hC0GQ7HwTV8DBbNkWw0O0w.text: Although quite expensive, the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is a must see to anyone visiting Las Vegas on vacation. Just make sure to request a window seat and you will have some of the best views of the strip around! Accompanied by a lovely Parisian ambiance and phenomenal food. The foie gras appetizers are to die for and I had the best lamb chops of my life there as well! My boyfriend got the chocolate tasting dessert, which was superb as well! The service was great, as to be expected at an authentic French restaurant. They were definitely a bit over the top but not too in your face. I've heard it's amazing for lunch as well. My table directly overlooked the Bellagio fountains so we got to watch many, many shows! They were also very respectful of our schedule since we had theater that we needed to make it to.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table!!

BcP77DqYEsVbmcrnXqzSKQ.text: What a wonderful experience!!! My bf and I came for dinner to celebrate my birthday early. Mon Ami Gabi is my favorite restaurant in Vegas but I might have to change my mind! The Eiffel Tower was incredible. We didn't have a reservation but had no problem getting a table. It was so nice to find a place that actually sticks to it's dress code. I hate being the only patrons dressed appropriately in an upscale restaurant. We were seated close to the window so we could see the fountains. It's actually pretty brilliant the way the dining room is laid out so everyone can get some sort of view.  Anyway, we started with the sea scallops which were divine! Cooked to perfection, melted in your mouth- but you are only paying for 2 so be aware.  Our server made great recommendations. My bf had the halibut and could not stop raving about the flavor! I had the red snapper and it was brilliant! I wanted to order more! Unfortunately the portions are a bit small for my taste but that was to be expected. And now comes the best part of the meal....They have like 5 or 6 types of souffle! We opted for the pistachio souffle and I kid you not, IT WAS THE BEST THING I HAVE EVER PUT IN MY MOUTH!  Yes, this place is pricey but worth every penny! The service was great, the food was wonderful and the view unmatched. I recommend going around sunset and watch the strip come to life!

EKWUE7Ih0a1NU5QQXhkIzQ.text: Let me tell you how to use this restaurant.  I haven't had their food but in order to take advantage of the view, just come up around 9:30pm for their famous chocolate souffle ($15) and a view of the bellagio fountain and the strip that you will never forget.    I can't imagine a better dessert...it was so warm, fluffy, light yet hitting all your sweet spots...gosh, one of the best desserts I've ever had in my lifetime.  I personally thing this was the best $15 I spent at Vegas.  Usually, Vegas wins....this time, I finally won....=)

5nJSztWk4m8rxf4FjWyC0A.text: Drinks at the bar were awesome. Classy environment. Friendly staff. And you can't beat the views.

KhNHIyQ8h0FBjp8AZUv-Pg.text: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday.  It was definitely romantic!!  Service was friendly as well but for some reason, I could tell the waiter was a bit annoyed with us.   My boyfriend and I were as nice as possible to him despite the negative vibe we were getting.  By the end of our meal, I think he felt guilty and his mood changed drastically.    It was just the 2 of us so our view was right in front of the Bellagio fountain show.  We got to watch at least 4 water shows.  I absolutely loved it!!  Our meals were mediocre - nothing to rave about although it was good but hands down to the souffle!!  We had the chocolate one and my goodness... we certainly devoured it.    Definitely recommended... I'm only giving 4 stars out of 5 because of the food and slightly because of the service from our waiter.  I'm a fan because of the dessert and the view!

15EmgG68WT1qRyrRu3i4UA.text: Surprisingly good burgers here.  I'd be weary of the mushroom flan, it looks and tastes a little like bacon grease.

uuNCLQoJxOeJkYiWguAL2w.text: My husband and I dined here for our anniversary. It was amazing! The food, the view, and the service were outstanding! We even got a free appetizer and dessert since it was a special occasion. I had the short ribs and my husband had the beef wellington, both melted in your mouth. Definitely expensive, but worth it!

6gPm8RQ7tmt-lPc3YW5M5Q.text: I only visited the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for some after dinner cocktails.  They make a Godiva chocolate martini that my mom and wife loved.  They have a handful of other house cocktails that are pretty good as well.  Not surprisingly the real value here is in the view.  The restaurant look straight across the street to the fountains of Bellagio which we enjoyed three or four times during our stay.  The menu is (surprise) traditional french and I am interested to come back for dinner and will update this review when that happens.  Fair warning, collared shirt or jacket required for guys.

otStzrV8hD-RQsTmAd9Xig.text: Went here for brunch on a Saturday at 11am. It was amazing. Seated immediately - at a table overlooking the Fountains of Bellagio.  Service - Excellent. I spilt a cup of coffee, they cleaned it up right away without any fuss Food - Very good. I had the chorizo eggs benedict.  Price - Between J and myself, the total bill was $56 (including tip) Additional notes - They give you complementary delicious french bread, baked goods and desert (snack)  Highly recommended

FqKmtB_jZPYDM9Bzx4PZEQ.text: My husband (fiance at the time) had our last meal as 'single' people here during our wedding week in Vegas (11/08)... and this was a simply amazing treat! We got a view over looking the strip and got to watch the Belagio water show a few times.   The staff was the best I have every experienced   Our food.... wow. I tried their 5 course meal that also had wine pairing and could not believe food was meant to taste like that!   My husband and I decided for our 5 year anniversary we will visit again :)

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brule

lEhg7vzaTZxed5hT-a2qwA.text: Some people are just so nonsensical. Usually I find it difficult to give 5 stars to a business that keeps their prices out of reach for middleclassmen like myself but it would seem almost criminal to do so in this case. The service was so superb and outstanding I felt like I left w a new group of friends that I will visit every 3-4 yrs from here out. The view of the strip and the fountain show is unparalleled and the food is better. You like Foie Gras??? How about 4 different options?!! Souffle? Taste the rainbow, they have six different flavors!

mc7X38lOzx6aMXxkt4lMQw.text: Didn't eat a full meal here, just some apps and drinks.  The menu looked great but we were not in the mood for the full menu...just starting off the night appetizers.  This place for sure set a great mood to start the night!  Awesome View!  Great lounge feel and the apps were good, drinks are strong and excellent!  Service is great too!

Ot5JQgf7HQ_r7aUE_7ve_w.text: Wow, so let me start by saying that I was invited here by a friend of mine's parents. They are typically high rollers and like to spend a lot when they are in Vegas. I try to translate expensive things with good quality, but unfortunately that was not the case here. Our party had 7 people total...   Good news first: ~Beautiful view of the Bellagio water show ~the Souffles ($10) are yummy (chocolate and grand marnier) ~escargot appetizer (~$13) - decent size and good ~foie gras appetizer (~$14)- foie gras was ok, but the fig chutney was delicious ~stuffed rabbit entree ($45) - my friends 12 year old ordered it and said it tasted like chicken (to him, delicious!)  Bad news (here is the list of food ordered and the qualitative comments): ~grilled asparagus ($9) - DISGUSTING. mushy, STEAMED not grilled, and covered with a HARD BOILED EGG CRUMBLE (WTF?!?!?) ~potato fritters ($9) - pretty cool concept. they came out looking like mozzarella sticks, but no cheese inside, just mashed potato stuff. first bite was delicious then I quickly realized how ridiculously salty they were, and ate 2 out of a 9 or 10 piece order ~surf n turf ($50) - the new york strip was the size of a filet mignon without the girth, and the piece of fish was cooked OK but also smaller than a small box of chicken nuggets from McDonalds ~halibut ($40) - tiny portion but tasted ok  I forgot the other dishes, but to top off the shitty food, our reservation was for 7:30pm and we didnt leave until after 11. almost 4 hours for 3 courses (appetizers, entrees, desserts)? I think that is a bit ridiculous. I have paid much less for much better food. if you have reservations, have some in-n-out first (that is where we ended up afterwards, LOL no joke)  btw - the bill at the end was $700 - 7 drinks (5 alcohol and 2 non), 2 appetizers, 6 entrees, 2 sides, 3 desserts.

8rDQz4HjpOaWVhSPpW63Pw.text: "That's it?"   These words started - and ended - the night.  The first time it was said because I had a dumb moment. Stupid me thought the restaurant would be at the very top of the tower. I realized that wasn't True when the elevator ride up to the restaurant was all of 5 seconds. Kinda took the magic of Paris away.  What I was also hoping was that the food would be better. If it's any consolation, the escargot was great. It was my first time eating this dish, and I really enjoyed the textures that came through. Well done. The "warm" lobster salad came out COLD and it was also quite bland. It also was difficult to eat. Do NOT order it. The rest of our food was overcooked and overseasoned. My seabass was dry, and my boyfriend's ahi tuna was practically cooked all the way through. He wasn't too happy with this and even offered his two cents for my Yelp review (which he never usually does). Salvation came at the end of the meal in the form of creme brulee. At least the French really know their desserts. In spite of all this, the service was very attentive and superb. They deserved their tip that night.  My advice is that if the view of the strip and Bellagio fountain show really matter all that much to you, then go ahead and have dinner here. But if you really want the main event to be your food, take your money elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizers and view

GLw0IH6oWf96rrB-mVOE3w.text: Came here with five other people. We all enjoyed but were not blown away with the restaurant, so I gave it four stars.  Firstly, the view is beautiful. Maybe come here on one of your first nights in Las Vegas, especially if you are not staying in or near the Bellagio/Paris (we stayed in the Paris hotel). If you are always around the fountains, they do get old after awhile. But then again, it's a different, more grand vantage point to enjoy them from.  We didn't take advantage but if you have an early 5:00 pm dinner, they will seat you at a window immediately. This is probably because Las Vegas diners come out pretty late for dinner and dining rooms are pretty empty until 7 p.m. hits.  The service is not particularly friendly, but I'm never really impressed by overly enthusiastic waiters anyway, so that was fine by me. One exception was the server who came around with bread. He was so enthusiastic about his bread. Lol. Great guy.   My husband and I both had the filet mignon with truffle sauce. It arrived...warmish, not hot. We had to remind the server we also had the truffle sauce, which came in a separate sauce boat. It arrived after the reminder. And we also didn't get proper steak knifes, which took away from the experience a little bit.   The other people at the table liked their dishes, the bread, etc. My father in law ordered the veal medallions but a big hunk of lamb chop was placed in front of him. He alerted the server to the error but the server tried to pass off the lamb chop as "better" and acted surprised when my FIl still insisted on the veal medallions. That was odd. He later apologized for the mistake but it was still an odd way to handle the situation.  We ordered dessert souffles (caramel for hubby and I, strawberry for the other two couples) and it was a truly exceptional souffle which made up for the other mistakes at the meal. I would highly recommend!  The mistakes not withstanding, the restaurant is great for a romantic dinner. It could use a little more polish considering the pricing, but the ambiance makes up for all of that.

Q9xsclIwFfv_4zbMoQkfwA.text: I can only comment on the drinks in the bar.  First, collared shirts are required for men.  We knew it was a fancier spot, but it's also Vegas, where just about anything goes, so we didn't think it was a big deal when my bf showed up with a nicer, non-collared shirt on.  We did find out they have loaner sport coats, how wonderful.  Even more wonderful was the fact that there were men at the bar with short sleeved Hawaiian shirts and fanny packs on, shorts & sandals...but they did all have collars, so there's that.  I think our waitress was either a burnout or a special child of God, because I've never had anyone so spacey get a couple of drinks for me.  She didn't know what bleu cheese olives were and when my bf asked for the "same" drink as me, she thought he said Sam?!? Not sure how that connects.  It became laughable at the end when we gave her a credit card to pay the outrageous tab ($60 for two martinis & two glasses of red wine) and she asked if we wanted change.  Good grief.

nOvI6rNsAVEeFVn58uVe2w.text: Wow. This place. All I have to say is this place is not overrated. I went here with my boyfriend for my birthday and it was awesome. The view and the table setting was so romantic. The food was awesome. I wish I could have tried everything on the menu. If you are full you still HAVE TO get their souffle. You have to try their souffle even though you are full to your stomach.

GZXVhN5E8rnLB9eBkFblVQ.text: I went to Eiffel Tower after graduation and the experience was great. All the food is amazing and top quality. My only regret is not getting all the caviar I wanted. The staff is also very nice and friendly. When they learned that I had just come from graduation they gave me a dessert for free and they wrote a little French message on the plate in chocolate! It said "Happy Birthday," but it's the thought that matters.

rhnpLX7nsWcW96r9E6PZFg.text: Wow. This place is so fancy! We had reservations from the night before, and it was such a grand and very romantic experience. Still a little woozy from the dayclub open bar, but it did make the food even more enjoyable.   We ordered the raw meat, filet mignon, and salmon entree and each bite was flavorful, decadent, and heavenly! We had amazing seating right outside of Bellagio and watched the water shows while we waited for our dinner. Our waiter was very attentive to us, and our service was excellent, overall.   Eating at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is definitely something to experience although a pricey one.

MNC5DKefg99miwPsOsD2Lg.text: My boyfriend and I visited the Eiffel Tower Restaurant on Wednesday, June 24, 2017 for dinner.  We were celebrating our two year anniversary, and upon entering the restaurant, we were treated like royalty.  Everyone at the restaurant was very well-mannered and knowledgeable about the menu and the wine list.  The waiters were very pleasant, and we were both under the impression that everyone enjoyed working there.  We were seated by the window for an incredible view of the Bellagio fountains during sunset.  For food, we enjoyed the asparagus soup, the chicken, the Alaskan cod, and a chocolate hazelnut cake.  Our meals were very impressive and absolutely delectable.  The presentation was amazing, and we really appreciated and enjoyed the complimentary Happy Anniversary dessert that was brought to us.  We would definitely return, and I just wanted to reach out and say how commendable of a job our waiter Tony R. did to make us feel welcome.  Everything came out in a timely manner, and our dinner was perfect.  It was our favorite memory on our first trip to Las Vegas together, so I'd like to say a big thank you to the Eiffel Tower staff for making it a magical one!

r4ZJgKF5N7gpRmWpQviU_g.text: I've dined here 3 times with family and friends, but the most memorable day I would never forget was on my birthday when my husband (who was my bf that time) surprised me with 12 dozens of roses and cake. Rose petals were spread on our table (sooooo romantic) and we had an amazing view facing Bellagio fountain. We enjoyed the food and the exceptional and outstanding service we've received! Kudos for my hubby for setting this up! :)  We had an amazing experience! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surprise cake! (I have such an amazing man :) )
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rose petals and 12 dozens of roses surprise

eXxzsy71By5WvTRa89ebIQ.text: I made reservations and requested for window seats facing the Bellagio fountains. I knew that we weren't going to be guaranteed those seats, but it was worth a shot. THEY CAME THROUGH WITH THE REQUEST!!! That won my heart right away.   Our waiter was a tall, older gentleman, looked like he'd been there for years, knew the menus inside and out. ....and a bit on the snooty side at first. He warmed up to us after a bit, which I'm glad he did. He suggested a great wine for us (can't remember which one... this was from our April 2015 trip).  I ordered the Prime Aged New York Strip cooked medium well (now, don't get on me for not getting it rare. I'm not a rare typa gal!) and it was cooked to perfection! Tender, still juicy, and scrumptious! My other half got the Broiled 22 oz. Bone-in Ribeye, Roasted Bone Marrow cooked medium rare. That was my first time tasting bone marrow... ehh. Not really my cup of tea, but it wasn't bad, I'll give you that. We got an order of mac-n-cheese to share. Mmmm! Perfect amount of cheese, a bit too filling, but then again, we DID order a good amount of delicious food.   We shared with our waiter that we were celebrating our anniversary. To our surprise, he brought out two chocolate mousse for our anni. He said, "In France, it is tradition to eat this with your significant other on your anniversary." How sweet! On top of that, he talked us into trying one of their succulent souffles. I ordered creme brulee because my boyfriend can't resist creme brulee! Alll were soooo sooo BOMB! At the very end, he brought out chocolates.   Ahh! Perfect fine dining experience! Great view of the fountains, awesome food, unpredictable server! All the other wait staff were friendly and attentive as well.   FIVE STARS! Def worth what you're paying for!

We got a table overlooking the Bellagio Fountain and the view was just breathtaking. The whole experience was  up to par with my expectations. Excellent good, outstanding service, great dessert and beautiful view make us wanna come back again.

4i8ZoZ-21CtPrwI9dI4vGA.text: We stumbled across this place for lunch by accident on our way to the pool and decided to take a gamble. We were quickly escorted to an elevator with great views. The elevator opens to the kitchen and we were quickly seated at a table facing the Bellagio fountains. Within 10 min of being seated the fountains started going and it was mesmerizing from this viewpoint. That alone made the meal worth it :) we ordered a few cocktails to start and I got the chicken salad. Service was impeccable and excellent. They even end the meal with complimentary small desserts to which we graciously accepted. Who would say no to this?? The complimentary bread was also delicious. I can definitely see how this turns into a much more upscale and potentially pretentious dining establishment in the evenings but it was perfect for a casual lunch. I was wearing a casual dress with a Jean jacket and definitely didn't feel judged negatively.

IvX5PLW_Jcs15Bb7cy3Igg.text: I got there with my girlfriend a week ago for my birthday celebration. Walked in and ordered 2 cocktails while being seated. Cocktail server was really attentive and recommended me what we would like to drink. After short minute, we were seated. Server introduced himself;forgot his name. And we asked for 2 cups of water, lemon on my girlfriend's. It wasnt really a busy day, but it looks like he forgot what we have requested, and we had to remind of him on our lemon. It took a while to get our orders too, we were sitting there for roughly 15 minutes without doing anything since we decided what we were going to eat. Okay, since it is my celebration day, I do not want to ruin it anyways. We ordered Newyork Strip Medium rare, Lobster as our main, Foie Gra with steak tartar as our appetizer. Food was cooked perfect and we really enjoyed eating food.  What i was frustrated was when we asked for the check and while server was taking care of the plate, he dropped some food on my girlfriend's dress. What's interesting was, even though it was his fault on dropping food on my girlfriend's dress, all he said is a one word, sorry. The way he said was too dry and I am not quite sure if he really meant it sincerely, but all he did was to say sorry and kept doing what he was doing. I am not going to lie, overall expression, it was good from start. It was just one server that I felt missing as upscale restaurant. Our check was around $300. I am not sure if I am going to come back, but if I do when one of my company is willing to pay, I will make sure I do not get the same server I previously got.

A5FbLnDZtheGwGRTGSXgWg.text: We had a great experience at Eiffel Tower tonight! Great atmosphere, incredible view, and the food was near perfect.   My only nitpick is that my steak was underseasoned. Still had very good flavor, but was just missing a little something.   The service was excellent. Our server had great knowledge of the menu and gave good recommendations.

nJDDo5fhK-ji6TFZey92Hg.text: As a proud American I always recognize how the French have been our allies - however I haven't had much personal experience with French food.  Where can I even begin - first if I could give it a 7 I would! This was the finest meal, on all counts we had while in vegas on "food crawl-2016 (c)" seriously.  We started with the house champagne- very lovely.  That was followed immediately by a demitasse filled with a puree of savory onion and cream - they described it as a savory cream, very custard like for cleaning the palette.  From there we moved onto the cheese plate consisting of French cheeses, spiced Feuilletine, honeycomb and candied walnuts.  Next we moved to the Classic Escargot laBourguignne, garlic and parsley- so delicious and yes a puff pastry too.  From there we decently moved to the cold Foie Gras Torchon duck with fig compote and brioche.  Whew - after that we enjoyed some bits of candied fruits and chocolates.(think Turkish delight)  They honored us with a parfait of chocolate mousse- one of the lightest and most satisfying deserts I have ever enjoyed.  We enjoyed their special roast (coffee) - it reminded me of coffee I enjoyed in Chili.   The service now that's a whole other review - they were professional, prompt but in no way pushy. They maintained our water glasses and then would vanish. If the meal was not the most amazing ever the service pushed it it up to 7 stars.  Did I mention it was extremely affordable?  We strongly recommend the Effiel Tower and we give it Five out of five forks"

3OPsAJO7MHPw63pb5u75_A.text: Did you forget to eat at the Eiffel Tower last time you were in Paris? We'll get your redemption in Vegas this is one hell of a view of the strip! Your looking at the fountains at the Bellagio every ten or fifteen minutes and the view of the strip looking south is probably the best strip view I've seen.  We came here after seeing the Jersey Boy's and had the baked herb crepes, la pave de salmon, beef tenderloin and a delicious chocolate dessert!  Your not in Paris but Vegas is the next best thing!

ndDMJWW_awTu-MH2K7c6eQ.text: Me and my girlfriend booked this restaurant months before our vacation but they still messed up our reservation from April 2nd to 3rd. But anyway, they were able to change it on that day. The view was ok, we saw the musical fountain in front of Bellagio. But the food was nightmare. Smoked salmon was not really seasoned, it was just like a salted fish. Filet mignon was cooked like a piece of wood, and the cod was cooked with some weird curry sauce, which was way over salted. At last, the farewell dessert was terrible, over-sweetened and very oily. Defiantly not recommended, the food was overpriced for the awful taste. In-and-out burger might be a better choice. Sorry the steak was really bad, we didn't take photo of it.

The waiter was extremely in the hurry running from table to table so he didn't have time for question after he went over the menu. We felt rushing. The main dish came solely with  item and zero size item. Their lamb, halibut (very little), filet mignon, ribeye was good. Their salmon (small and thin) was dried and over cooked.  Their dick breast was also dried.  10 main dishes, 4 sides, 4 appetizers, 1L5 wine bottle. $1115. Btw, the chef picture (Caucasian in his late 50's?) on the menu was not the chef who was in the kitchen (Asian in late 20's or early 30's). Bate?

180Co6_iX2pNqUzRuga8Lg.text: Summary: It's all about showmanship here - not quality.  (The view is lovely but really, that is all you're paying for.)    So perhaps my expectations of Las Vegas have been unreasonable... Perhaps I should expect that everything is simply a shell of good with a rotting egg inside? Okay, that is a bit harsh for this installment but truly, that is what I feel for the most part.   - Nothing at this location is organic but the pricing would mislead you to believe that they actually care about the quality of their products.  *ha*  - The staff is a bit haphazard as far as how they attend to your table. (I needed to ask three times for a cup of coffee... finally got an old brew that nearly tasted rancid. *joy*)   - I'm quite certain that the staff in all the Las Vegas restaurants are determined to say their fish is 'the freshest' when one can clearly taste it is not. (I cook and I'm from California... this fish does not make the grade and yet you still ask for the outlandish price. *tisk tisk* )  - The view is nice and though the old venue is kept up, it still just feels old.   Do not be bamboozled, come to terms with the fact that you are simply paying for the view and decently *presented* food and you're good.

PG8Ms3NkDWtTue6-dMJUFA.text: We were a large group and they handled us well.  We shared the steak tartar and escargot and the group was pleased.   Beware of the high prices .  A typical drink will be around 20 dollars and even the Chicken entree was 40 dollars.   We also had the dover sole and the lamb chops which were all delicious.  The desert soufflets were really good as well and the ambience is quite nice.  Similar to Jules Verne in Paris Eiffel Tower.  Be prepared to spend at least 150 per head .

gthv8_A1uBJB849vYuDwQA.text: Had lunch here March 2016 and it was pretty good. The waiter was attentive and gave us a great view seat.   Food was good too. Just remember there is a dress code here.

u0wHOj3kTZMVuD-maUeWKg.text: Best Steak I've ever had. Server was excellent and in house sommelier picked out one of the best wines I've ever had. Terrific view of Vegas and the mountains makes this the best dining experience in Vegas.

DSLx8oJpOsi4oom-RBtn5Q.text: Visiting the Paris hotel Eiffel Tower should be a must thing to do when visiting Vegas. You get to see a spectacular view of the strip, as well as the Bellagio water show from a view you can't beat, just incredible. There is no bar at the very top of the tower, but you are allowed to bring your drink with you and enjoy the view for as long as you want. FYI, there are no bathrooms at the top, but the elevator runs every 10 min.  Try it at night when all the light are on.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best view of Vegas

M73esPKQISjbOzQOg5X4Xg.text: Mediocre at best. I expected much more from this restaurant based on the reviews. I was sorely disappointed, especially when the check came. To begin, the filet was overdone: we had to send it back. A restaurant of this caliber should be able to get a filet mignon cooked medium with no difficulty. Alas, that was not the case. Secondly, the individual beef wellington was also over-cooked and relatively flavorless. I did not send it back, however, because it takes 25-30 minutes to cook (perhaps that time should be reduced to 22-27 minutes!). The ($12) side of mushrooms was over-salted and could not be eaten on it's own.  "Salt" is not a flavor! Apparently, the management is counting on the view to justify the cost; sadly, it was not worth the $350 tab ($100 for a decent bottle of wine). This was for a party of two and no dessert. I will not be back.

VRM-KOBjS-mHHxjY1sd6bA.text: Let me start by saying the bread and butter are amazing.  We had the lobster soup and the foie gras were the best I have ever had.  The soup was like cream candy and the foie gras was like a dream wrapped in a dream.  The filet was so tinder you did not even need a knife, simply perfect.  My girlfriend said Wellington was the eat thing she has ever had in her life.  Simply amazing and the view of the Bellagio fountains are really worth it.  We did it for New Years and you can each all the fireworks go off all along the strip.  It cost a lot but it is really memorable.

GEdZ6mTA7IOTCOCvCdwr0Q.text: We made the same day reservation to this restaurant this week.  During the call to reserve our table, I mentioned that we would be coming back from Cirque De Soleil show, and requested a recommended seating time (taking traffic and transport on weekday evening into account).  Eventually, we settled for 9:15pm and we arrived on time. Our waiter was so awesome.  Though he wasn't the one answering the call, he remembered that we just came out of the show, immediately whisked us to a window table and our drinks (Eiffel Affair cocktails) materialized within minutes!  The rest of the evening went very smoothly.  We took his recommendations and the dishes were spectacular.  We had the king crab appetizers.  My dinner companion had a rack of lamb, and I had the beef Wellington. For dessert, we had the Pistachio and Grand Marnier souffle.  Each dish was a celebration.  They're delish!!!! And the view was spectacular.  If you are in Vegas, and you don't think that you'd take the journey to the actual Eiffel Tower anytime soon, I'd think that this is a second prize experience.  Enjoyable food+friendly, knowledgeable and speedy service+terrific views=Unforgettable experience.  There was a proposal happening next to us and it ended with a "Yes".  The restaurant manager came out to congratulate the happy couple, and check on the other patrons.  We heard him said that they have not experienced a "No" throughout the history of the restaurant.  So if you are planning, give them a chance to help out.

LjMctSosrEQY3MYcgytDcQ.text: This restaurant is so overpriced. what makes it worth it is the view I guess. we didn't have a reservation so we kind of got stuck in the corner which in my opinion was probably the best view of the strip. Waitress was very nice. hostess and bartender were nice. The manager on the other hand was ridiculous.  My problem came when I forgot my credit card call the next day they said yes they had it I went that afternoon somebody had ripped the card in half. The card was brand new. basically they said oh well we can't do nothing about it have a nice day.

BgIE5nPjKBw4OBK4KomEbQ.text: Amazing view and delicious food. Fast and professional service. Can't say anything bad about our experience.

RviXZb42Qe0q_LSeVU0g-w.text: Such a weird experience. From the moment we checked into the host stand I knew it wasn't going to be a good night. Our reservation was for 3 and view of fountain. We got the last booth with no view at all. Tried to order waters while  waiting on our table and the bartender was a complete jerk and said I can't serve you with a child here. I'm like it's waters buddy.... anyways sat down took 10 min to get our menu. Then decided to eat and request lots of bread bc no one ever came around to take our order. Food wasn't anything special. The only thing is the view that this restaurant has. Go somewhere else. Isn't worth the aggravation and awful service

YogHqTvbw7w-VGRJJrHrjg.text: My wife and I ate here for our 15th wedding anniversary and it was amazing.  I made the reservation on Open table and made a note that it was was our anniversary.  The whole evening everyone we interacted with made a point of telling mentioning and congratulating us on our anniversary.  It was a small thing, but it made a big difference.  I requested a table near the window and we sat over the strip facing the Bellagio fountain, which was a great view.  The food was very good and we left very content and full.  Our glasses were never left empty (which is a pet peeve of mine) and the service was consistent but not bothering.  I would highly recommend this for guys to keep in your back pocket as a dinner location for special events or for making up some good karma.

YkgWcPlwB8J3Nr9RWgkB-A.text: Let me start by saying I came straight here from the airport after my flight from NY and I was in east coast time. Having dinner at 2am (NY time) seemed a little off but hey who comes to Vegas to sleep and who am I to say no to a romantic dinner even if it's an off time.    The minute I walked in I was wowed and super happy that someone thought I was special enough to bring me here.  This restaurant screams romance and we got lucky enough to get a table right in front of the Belagio water display.  The food, wine and service was amazing but nothing beats the view and the great company.   I'm so glad I sucked up and stayed up enough to have this experience.

wvBKjLM0tMP_PUwL7VbYKg.text: I didn't go inside the tower but I must admit after seeing the real Eiffel Tower, this is a spot on replica aside from the size difference of course. I was so fascinated by all of the larger sculptures and statues in Vegas!

bawvXOQVePlG4ff7ehqatw.text: Waiters and hosts are not friendly or patient WHATSOEVER. Read my story.  Walking in: you see a magnificent kitchen with focused culinary artists paying attention to every detail of the food.  Then, you wait for the host to tell you there's no window seats available though the restaurant just opened. You are puzzled and confused. You wait 30 minutes for the table and the host skips you because you're dad is the only one of your party there but you left for the bathroom. (A rule I've never heard before) You're forced to awkwardly ask for a window seat again. Finally, while making friendly chit chat with the  hostess, you get what you want..  You take selfies for da memoriez but you have waiters and waitresses giving you major stink eye.  Soon, the server comes to offer a great arrangement of breads with butter and a palette cleanser.  Your waiter comes up to you right after and expects you to have a decision. You don't and you are rushed to order. The waiter is very annoyed and walks away. So you feel unwelcomed....  The waiter comes a second time. We all order something different. He leaves. As he comes back around, you want to change your order to salmon instead of chicken. He tells you, "No, I already ordered chicken in the kitchen." You say oh okay never mind :). And the waiter dashes off in a hasty fashion. You don't get it, that something easily changable. Honestly, you would go to the kitchen and change it yourself if you could.  You receive your food with stunning presentation, it was quite the instagram meal to go with the view. You were enjoying every bite but your dad didn't like his chicken. He told our, so far, degenerate waiter that he wasn't expecting shards of bones and grissle in the chicken. Waiter said, "Well it's not supposed to be boneless" your dad says,"I know but I wasn't expecting shards of bone and grissle I was expecting a breast" and the waiter says,"Oh okay." And dashes off once again. I thought he would at least apologize. The restaurant is VERY dimly lit so reading the menu for someone with bad eye sight is HARD. Especially when half is in french and some ingredients are things you've never even heard of. We watch him suffer through his meal.  From that rude encounter, you knew this waiter already did not like your family because they didn't order quick enough and he really just wants us to go away. You don't think they've had any strange requests or rude remarks. They're just a bunch of awkward, quiet folk over here.  This waiter decides to have happy chit chats with all the other customers around you and runs past your table every single time, which is kind of distracting. Not like you wanted to ask anything more from him anyway.   It's a great place to take pictures with family. They would get up by the window on occasion to take pictures with the Bellagio fountain. Meanwhile, that waiter would sit in the dark corner and GLARES at you having a good time. AND HE WOULD TALK ABOUT YOU WITH OTHER WAITERS. It's getting really ridiculous now. Clearly he doesn't want a tip. AND your family stayed there shorter than both tables beside them and your family were quiet people. NO DISTURBANCE. They definitely rubbed this waiter the wrong way but not for him to turn all middle schooler on us, damn!  You decide to be nice to him. When he collected our plates and uneasily offered dessert. You smiled at him and acted very pleased. And he actually asked where were you guys from and you said the Bay Area. And he said Aw California. And he dropped the menus and walked away.... Okay.  The waiter comes by right when we finished and collects the plates and drops the bill on the table. As so expected, very unwelcoming.  Basically, y'all paid for the spot. and like many others your party stayed there for a little while longer. Soak in the breathtaking sight: the fountains, the lights, the dimmly lit room!  Began to leave and the waiter is glaring at you again, pointing you out to his waiter buddies. It takes a while to put on my coat and scarf and he intends to just keep staring at my family and I. I hope this time he was staring at us because he noticed no tip on the table...  The management clearly cannot stand the type that aren't fancy and high class. My waiter deeply disliked us for no real reason other than maybe we embodied some aspects of bad customers before. But I believe he deserved the no tip left on the badly cleaned table. Leaving on a positive note, the restaurant has an excellent taste for any savory or sweet dishes. All foods are creamy and I absolutely love that! The view is everything! But I wish the waiters and hosts put more care into their craft like that cooks.

RKSTtM2KYiwPzZTLP1yyVg.text: I once read, " Don't be so quick to judge, you never know when you might just find yourself walking in that person's shoes." Well, in my experience of dining at Eiffel Tower Restaurant, that quote might just very well ends with "you never know when you might just find yourself sitting at their best table, and enjoy it, too!!"  While planning our Anniversary/Christmas Trip to Vegas, BF asked that I must plan a meal here because he had such a phenomenal experience in the past. I begrudgingly agreed because I thought there are so many new and exciting restaurants on the strip that we can try. So, me, being the shortsighted idiot, made a reservation for lunch instead of dinner.   After we checked in with the host and hopped onto the exclusive elevator that somehow managed to transport us from the tackiness around Paris Hotel to a realm of sheer elegance. Sure enough, knowing it was an anniversary celebration trip for us, the thoughtful folks from Eiffel Tower Restaurant seated us at their famous corner table (yes, Table 56!!) With the breathtaking view, the etiquettes from our attentive maitre d', server, and busboy, I suddenly realized that my BF's stubbornness wasn't that much of a burden after all.   Our server and bus boy promptly presented and served us the menu and freshly made baguette. Our server thoroughly explained every item on the menu to us, and we opted for:  - Creamy French Onion Soup (unlike any other French onion soup, this wasn't as cheesy nor greasy but rather light. Please don't get me wrong; the flavors and the creaminess weren't compromised in any way.) - Cold Foie Gras Torchon (rich and dense foie gras wrapped with duck prosciutto, along with fig, and then smeared on top of the brioche. I particularly enjoyed how the foie gras was presented in a similar texture as butter and the way it melts upon ingestion.) - Lamb Burger (As a big fan of lamb, I naturally ordered it medium rare. The spices immersed the lamb heavenly, served with chips, and a side of harissa aioli.)  - Aged Parmesan Crusted Chicken (crispy and juicy, it reminded me of the chicken schnitzel that I had from "Johannes" at Palms Springs.)  Plus...  - Apple strudel (I usually don't like to mix fruit with dessert, so it's my BF who ordered this. However, I fairly enjoyed my few bites of pate feuilletee dipped in the caramel sauce.)  Other than the strudel, they also sent us a complimentary chocolate souffle for our anniversary, which was a very lovely gesture. Now that I'm thinking back, my biggest regret during my entire trip was that not only I didn't get to taste their evening tasting menu, but I also didn't get a chance to try their famous Grand Marnier Souffle (since it's only served during dinner.) Mind you, prior to my lunch at Eiffel Tower, BF and I had just our previous dinner at "Le Cirque," and quite frankly that dinner was not even close to this lunch at Eiffel Tower Restaurant. I applaud the classiness of their attentive and gracious staffs. My highest compliments to the chefs and the entire Eiffel Tower Restaurant Team, for this exceptionally exquisite meal and making us feel special the entire time. I cannot wait to go back!!

B0QaHf5RQp8lYT-LF6EheA.text: There are many many great restaurants in Vegas  but I love this one the best because of the breathtaking view, delicious food and great service! Highly recommend.

T5eYy6p66PsouJ4BXaLiDQ.text: Where to start with this restaurant? Well I'll start with the view!! I loved it. I mean I could have had brunch anywhere else, but definitely not with this view. It's a gorgeous view of the Strip. This was a great combination of good food with a great view, p.s. and great company. What else can I ask for? Lol I made a last minute reservation for Saturday brunch the day before and requested a seat by a window, and though not guaranteed, we did get our table right next to the window. Keep in mind this is right across from the Bellagio fountains so you get to enjoy that as well!   For our meal I had the New York Strip Steak, was delicious! I want to say my boo had the French Bucatini pasta, but I'm not sure that's the name, lol it was also great, I'm not the biggest fan of mushrooms, regardless I loved it!!    If you're debating whether or not to try this restaurant, don't think about it too much the answer is YES make a reservation! Definitely worth trying!!

4WwZS72mUzFFg4ngcGGy-A.text: Wonderful treatment for our wedding anniversary! Excellent table with a view of Belliagio water show and John and Reuben's brunch service was wonderful. Food was extraordinary- lobster Benedict and hubby had the burger!

eXq9W99KBZxy8a4r9hJWyQ.text: OMG the souffle I'd to die for, must order at the beginning as it will take at least 30 minutes to prepared. The Sweetness is perfect and not so sweet at all.  I would recommend one of the fish dishes and the freaking duck breast is off the charts.   Ask for Windows seating!!  Enjoy the views because it is awesome

lAbTRk-M8UjO1qY976fiTA.text: Made a reservation for my boyfriends birthday. If you're going to splurge on a restaurant, this is the place to do it. We got a window seat with a view of the Bellagio fountains and the whole setting was so beautiful and romantic. The food and the service were both great and well worth the money. I would come back in a heartbeat!

XL2q-_te-P3kxSRfZiPqmw.text: Excellent dining experience! It is IN the upper floor of the Eiffel Tower and has a beautiful view of the Bellagio Fountains across the street. Dinner was delicious. Server was attentive, helpful, funny but very professional. Provided great recommendations. Order the souffle for dessert it is worth it!

G4lXjkyCGmc8BBsKT6WOkQ.text: The beef Wellington was exceptional. The view is amazing and the atmosphere is top notch. Great romantic spot. It's definitely pricey but worth it.

YYgkeauvR1sB43EfOmxTzA.text: Went here with another couple for our 20th wedding anniversary.  Everything was wonderful!  As per our request, we were seated at a window table overlooking the fountains of Bellagio.  The service was perfect and we never felt rushed.  The meal was one of the best I've ever had.  My gluten intolerant friend was thrilled when the server brought her gluten free bread. She ordered seconds because it was so good. It was the perfect location to celebrate our special day.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée was perfectly prepared.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. John Dory plate - delicious!

-7EpZwDuGgZ9KHSA58qbPw.text: WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE!  I dined here for brunch for the first time and it was a True standout experience and one of the best memories I'll keep with me after this weekend.   FOOD: I am not a huge fan of French Cuisine but this was good.  Great quality food and easy for anyone to eat if they aren't familiar with French food.    SERVICE:  FANTASTIC. Our server was very respectful and the server assistant was very attentive and respectful to give us our space when we wanted it.  I think she read my lips one time when I said I needed more coffee because before I could turn my head to get someone's attention she came with the coffee and said  "I'm here!" I was so impressed!  From the host stand, to the servers, and back to the host stand, I had the best customer service in Vegas at The Eiffel Tower Restaurant.  AMBIANCE: It was the perfect balance of comfort and class.  I loved the windows and the decor.   VIEW: INCREDIBLE. I was able to get a panoramic view of the Bellagio water show but also an unobstructed view of the strip.  With the decor and the views that it offers, it is a new MUST-DO destination on EVERY Vegas trip in the future.    I will be coming to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant every time I visit now and am now open to staying at the hotel.  I haven't had dinner there but I definitely will next time!  I'm a raving fan!

vzRBsDh7X0rqSmkDgI1Rhw.text: Me: Party of two Hostess: What's your name? Me: I didn't make a reservation. Hostess: We'll get you a table ASAP. Me: How long do I have to wait? Hostess: ASAP.  Can you guess where this is heading? My girlfriend and I waited for 30 minutes and I asked the hostess again how long we have to wait. After going into a whole discussion, now she tells me that all tables are booked and we are there to wait indefinitely to fill in the gap when someone cancels his reservation. She says this is the definition of ASAP and I was too dumb to understand what it meant.

0hTvgeYRGT7mmv7UXj52Aw.text: Went here with my boyfriend a few nights ago for our anniversary and my first thought was, "This place is so fancy!" They even have a dress code and views in this place were incredible! We had a reservation but was asked if we wanted to wait a few minutes for a window table, of course we said yes and headed to the bar. The nice bartender made us a couple of amazing (expensive) drinks and then our table was ready.   Okay even though this place is super expensive I truly believe the view we had totally made up for it. Our table was right in front of the Bellagio water show! Super romantic and perfect for the occasion.   The food was pretty good, had the pork belly appetizer and we both got the veal medallions. It was tasty but I was still kinda hungry after....  its fine dining so I expected high prices for small portions. The staff (hostesses, bartender, server, busser) were all wonderful.   Overall this is a very good place to impress your date or for a special occasion but if you just want some really good french food on the strip I would say to go try Bouchon in Venetian.

wWTZg8jYc49pH9Y2C4EoBA.text: This is a great place in vegas to have a romantic dinner, right across the Bellagio fountains. The service was great. I have been here a few times and the food was always delicious, steak cooked just like we wanted it. Very decent prices for the quality of the food and the set up.

oZ5qBpzsPHia0suzvfKTLw.text: I'm never disappointed when I come here. My family and I always squeeze in a visit every time we go to Vegas. The service is always excellent.   FOOD My favorite is the rack of lamb. It is superb. It is seasoned perfectly and it melts in your mouth. I always struggle with going with the usual lamb or choosing another equally great dish.  You can never go wrong with the surf and turf. You get to enjoy the best of both worlds by eating steak and lobster in one meal.  The seafood platter is our usual choice for an appetizer. I like it because there's no smell of seafood and their variety of sauces are perfect.  MUST try the souffle. I tried their chocolate, caramel, and strawberry flavors. I love it because it's always picture perfect, has the right amount of fluff, and is not too sweet.

S9dV72yErnTYE6n_a7oSbw.text: We treated ourselves to a meal at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant on our second night in Vegas. Arriving early for our reservation, we were seated at the bar, even though there were plenty of open tables. I don't have an issue with that, except that we had to pay for our drinks separately from the rest of the meal.  The cocktail I had was amazing - something to do with strawberries and maple syrup and black pepper. It was perfectly balanced, taste wise, and super-strong.   The blue cheese souffle starter was wonderful. Firmer than I usually expect from a souffle (I was disappointed that it didn't collapse) it came with a tasty salad and fantastic balsamic dressing. I could have licked the plate.  Unfortunately the steak with Bearnaise sauce was a little dry and chewy - not what I expect for $56 - and so large that I was unable to finish it. Hubby had the venison chops, which he finished with relish.   Thanks to the huge portions, I  skipped dessert altogether.  The view is spectacular, but at $350 for a meal for 2, it's definitely best saved for a very special occasion.

u2pWNizrGui2BvJWkFkTrA.text: Unbelievable! So happy we splurged for this meal. The view is incredible. Our table was by the window with a view of the Bellagio fountains and The Strip. The felit was amazing. My boyfriend likes his rare, I like mine medium, both were cooked to perfection. Service was very attentive and professional. Our server suggested the chocolate souffle for desert and it was well worth it! Best Dinner Experience in Las Vegas!

cR4tS-1F1Eudx65ci6HmAA.text: Had reservations for four on Jan 1st. We were so looking forward to celebrating my husbands birthday. The atmosphere and view were the best things about the restaurant. Our French waiter was very pushy and difficult to understand. We ordered four entrees, four sides, and two souffle desserts. As well as drinks.  All of which were bland and just ok. My filet and my friends lamb both had to be returned to the kitchen. My plate and filet weren't even luke warm. It's such a shame, it was supposed to be a fabulous experience, so disappointing. Next time, we will make reservations at the Bellagio for a better dining experience... oh!! Btw, HUGOS CELLAR at the Four Queens Hotel downtown is less than half the price with amazing service and food. They've been serving for 40 years!! You won't be disappointed, I promise!

eMDHEMbov-lzSVDZRIVOKA.text: Some friends wanted to take me out to a nice dinner in LV and asked me for suggestions, having been at Eiffel Tower a few times in the past, I recommended it.  Atmosphere is nice and service is very good.   Views of the strip and the Bellagio fountains are also very nice.  This restaurant is on the pricey side, even for Las Vegas, so be prepared to spend.  Now, the food.   The menu is a meat lover's delight with only one veg option available, and steaks start at about $75 and $56 for a filet.   I ordered the filet in the red wine reduction and have to say it was very good, albeit a little over-done.  The salad as my start was great and fresh, as was the bread and even the butter.  They usually comp a small chef's sampling and our group was treated to a smaller shot of a cauliflower foam - also outstanding.   The wine list is expansive and expensive, mark ups seem higher than most other LV premium restaurants.   I liked the food and would go 5* here if the prices were more down to earth.

rDemuxhlOKsWJtRUiIaUvw.text: I loved having lunch at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant! There is a great view of the strip and especially the Bellagio fountains! You get there by the elevator in the casino, and walk past the kitchen to the restaurant. The food is soooo good! I ordered the baked crepes and my boyfriend had the lamb burger. Both were delicious! They served us some mushroom flan as well, which was surprisingly good, and I don't even like mushrooms.  The restaurant is pricey, but it is really nice! The service was friendly and took our picture for us. There weren't many people there for lunch when we got there, so we didn't have to make reservations or wait at all,  but we got there right about when they opened for lunch. I'm sure it's a lot more crowded during dinner. If you are looking for a more upscale restaurant or maybe a place for a date, or to get dressed up, this place is awesome.

5nyWN8ZOagW6-GndQ6yVsQ.text: What a great view this restaurant has! I was there for a Valentines day dinner,pretty pricey, I remember it was around $400 for two ppl , but how cared about money with such a great atmosphere? Love the place , love the service,not the best food i had though. If you are looking for a romantic type of place , you are in the right spot! I will post a picture here!

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry soufle
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dinner view

j4S_dNZ2VxmpKo5RJUpBRQ.text: I had my birthday dinner here last Sunday, May 25, 2014 with my partner.  We consider ourselves "foodies" and we had an exceptional dining experience at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.    The meal itself was outstanding and my highest complements to the chef.  We started with escargot and a kale salad that literally made our taste buds jump out of our mouths.  I had the Beef Wellington.  At the first bite, I swear I saw the sky open up and trumpets sound.  Absolutely the best meal I have ever had.  The puff pastry surrounding the filet was delicate and the mignon was well seasoned and perfectly cooked.  My partner had rabbit and it too was truly a gastronomic gift from God.    Our server was terrific and suggested the pistachio souffle to end our dining experience and I am so glad she did.  It was delicious.     We sat by the window, just one table from the corner and had an excellent view of the strip and the Bellagio light/water show.  The meal, paired with some excellent wine, was one that I will not forget.   I can't wait to go back.  My only constructive criticism would be to tell the staff, except the initial server, to stop coming to the table so often.  I love to enjoy good food AND good conversation and I like to take my time with a good meal.  We were disrupted, too many times for my taste, by wait staff asking if they could clear our plates.  I don't enjoy it when plates are taken from the table before everyone is finished.  Just my own pet peeve and it did not mar the evenings culinary experience.  WHAT A MEAL!!

c8D1SRdpqiGSN6WA6jRhsA.text: Yes! Came here for my Birthday during our trip to Vegas this year. My girlfriend made reservations in advance, made sure I got the best seat in the house complimented by red roses which she bought from the restaurant (very nice touch). We were seated at a half-moon table overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The service was top notch. I enjoyed my salmon a lot. My girlfriend liked her steak although it wasn't her absolute favorite. The green beans were average. What blew me away was the desert. Because it was my birthday they brought me complimentary mouse, which was delicious. We had also ordered a white chocolate banana elysee, which came out to be a work of culinary art. Amazing thin circles of white chocolate layered with fresh bananas and a torched sugar arc. Just amazing. Highly recommend this experience and can not wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Chocolate Banana Elysee. Must have.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My delicious complimentary birthday dessert.

z8dUjoh3OYzpAIgSJklMgQ.text: Made reservations for sunset and were seated along the window overlooking the fountains. Perfection!  We had the tasting menu with a pairing and thought it was very good. Great wines, too. Service is impeccable. Highly recommend for a special occasion.  * dress code didn't seem to be enforced too much. Quite the variety.

-vhBvxbfoh9dJLWjrdIOFg.text: I brought my girlfriend here for our last night in Vegas and it exceeded both of our expectations. We got seated at a window facing the Bellagio fountains, the wait staff was attentive, the food excellent and the Soufle was out of this world.  I had thought this was a typical Vegas gimmick restaurant and had ignored it until I read the reviews from Yelp and decided to try it. I am glad I did. I have found a new favorite place to eat when I have to go to Vegas. Thanks to the Yelpers who contributed!

H5damczY05fvtDEo_24J9Q.text: Amazing food and wine with a great view!  We have stayed at Paris before and have dined at this restaurant before but I just have to comment on it. The place has a great wine list with a sommelier that is very good recommendations.   We had the seafood appetizer and it is worth the money. Yes it is a bit pricey, but this is not McDonalds. My husband got a filet with a truffle sauce that was out of this world. We are planning to go back just to get this entree. My food was amazing as well, and I feel that you just can't go wrong here.   We recommend it for a very special romantic dinner.

yNBCcqWf25zOD54X0A5q5A.text: Amazing ambience.  The view was amazing! Service impeccable.  Food was lacking for the the price.  The signature chicken entree was lacking flavor and something just was not right with the oil it was cooked in. The trout entree on the other hand was very good.

7fq63B8oxaOoiIVoEzyXEw.text: View of Bellagio evening light show! Oh romance across the air...  touch of elegance sitting below the tower, staff was excellent. An hour and a half well-spent, indeed.  Foie Gras & filet mignon...my favorite pairing accompanied by belvedere and grapefruit delight...Life at its best...  our server moved us to the window seat the moment it became available...attention to detail, i love it.

CwYjH7QRdcSE2m1ngfllcA.text: Old review from a number of years ago which needed moved here due to this being the proper business.  I stopped by here with my fiance and some of her co-workers on my most recent trip to Vegas. We didn't have reservations whenever we made our way over here but that didn't prove to be a problem as we were seated within a reasonable amount of time. The table that we sat at ended up having a good view of the casino although I would have much preferred the strip. I ended up ordering the roasted farm raised chicken which was moist, juicy and good. It came with a side of green beans that had a lemon butter sauce on it which was amazing.  The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future. The food was good and I was surprised that the prices were a lot more reasonable than I had expected.

xiaSfW6-bJwIrZpUADzbjA.text: Me and my Husband came here for our wedding dinner. We had made reservations for 5pm. We called at 4:20 to ask if we can sit by the window so we could have a good view of the fountains and they said they can't guarantee window seating but we could come right now. We rushed up there and had a great view of the fountains.  The waiter was from France which was cool and the staff were very attentive.  Our food was delicious we ordered scallop appetizer (2 scallops and leeks) Beef wellinton Lobster Florentine They gave us a little chocolate pudding dessert which was very good.   Lastly our bill was $250 we will probably only come back for very special occasions,  like our 10 year wedding anniversary or if we become super rich.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedding dinner! Lobster Florentine. mmm

PcAzRMRQiSGVPmn4TmqmtQ.text: Tried the Restaurant Week menu for lunch and my partner got the Moroccan Lamb Burger (which was delicious and perfectly seasoned).  It was not busy when we went at 1pm but the Bellagio fountain doesn't start either around that time in the weekday. So if you come for the evening, prepare to be mesmerized by the view!  It was $30 with three course.   First course was an Alaskan King Crab, beautifully presented.  Second course was a Flat Iron Steak that was cooked perfectly.  Last course was Pistachio and Chocolate Creme Brulee.   I'm glad I got to try this restaurant finally! Probably won't be back for the food but I actually would come back for the cocktails!

hkwvidZpYO8TxcW03DX3bg.text: Beautiful view of Las Vegas! Great service and nicely presented dish.  Very good food.  Would be great to bring your significant other for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Window view of Bellagio

KX4QcJOEaR1mBt8tTM0Mwg.text: Didn't give it 5 stars only because I didn't have a full meal there and just got drinks and dessert at the bar.   First of all, I expected this to be a cheesy Vegas tourist trap, which I was totally into doing on Thanksgiving day -- but when I arrived for lunch, the hostess informed me that they weren't opening until 2 p.m. dinner service. She recommended another spot for me to eat in the hotel but I told her, "Well, I wasn't really there for the food, more for the experience." So, she offered to bring me upstairs to have a look.  How gorgeous is this place! Incredible view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. Beautifully designed and elegant -- really feels like you're "inside" the Eiffel Tower. The hostess took the time to show me the Thanksgiving menu and even checked to make sure they'd be serving their famous souffles later. I promised to come back at least for a drink.  When I had a less-than-stellar Thanksgiving dinner elsewhere, I found myself returning to the Eiffel Tower and took a seat at the bar. The seasonal special souffle, pumpkin, was TO DIE FOR. The souffles take 45 minutes because they're freshly prepared, so if you know you want one, best to get that order in ASAP.  While I waited for it, I sipped on a 13-year rye recommended by my bartender (who let me have a little sip to be sure I'd like it) and took in the atmosphere. I was dining solo but at least two bartenders made sure I was taken care of and happy, and I never felt alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At night

JFHowKq5YgN_3y68Z7jmqA.text: An amazingly great experience, even for Las Vegas - everything one expects from a 5* spot in a town like this! Service was excellent, the Filet Mignon so outstanding with the perfect accoutrements - this is a place we'll visit regularly now!

beP3lR6I5quJXj-nukY4_w.text: Beautiful. Pricey, but beautiful.  We came in here for a drink to check it out Saturday night. There was plenty of seating at the bar. We grabbed a seat, and took in the sights. With the entire strip illuminated, there really isn't a bad seat in the house.   We did not try any of the food, but we did indulge in a specialty cocktail. Quite delicious made with fresh juices and poured into an elegant champagne flute. The bartender was a man with great experience and a polite, friendly demeanor.   I wish we would have eaten but I know we will be back. I can't wait to taste what their menu has to offer.

lQGrOhdC6m91cRkmIO2Svw.text: Excellent food and service.  The prices take into account the view so make sure to ask for a window seat.  Food portions are small so make sure you eat your fill of bread.   For appetizers we tried the seared foie gras and the escargot (cooked two ways).  The escargot was forgettable in comparison to the foie gras which was heaven.  For our entrees we had the trout and rack of lamb. The lamb was the clear winner.  We asked for medium but it come out medium rare.  I'm not complaining as I think next time we'll just order it medium rare.   Both the creme brulee and passion fruit merengue desserts looked like stunning pieces of art.  That being said I probably wouldn't order either again. Both were solid but for the price tag they tasted only ok.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Foie gras appetizer

fAQH8o_4pWvu1VqImoctBg.text: Excellent ambiance with a hard to beat view in vegas. Wait staff is friendly and fast and most. Importantly the food is done well. Salad was fresh and crisp. Hubby had the filet and it was moist and juicy.   If you're looking for a great ambiance and nice view in vegas, without breaking the bank too much, this is the place to go.

kVjfSUaOF3kQUTZjCNX16A.text: We were lucky enough to have the best corner window table last night. The view was gorgeous. We ordered foie gras, braised pork (appetizers), duck breast, and ribeye (main entrees) which were all delicious. It was totally worth every penny we paid. Highly recommend! The place now becomes my 3rd favorite fine dining restaurant in Vegas, after Joel Robuchon and Guy Savoy.

CcLo6QCPXqCtFIkko-9vvQ.text: This is our go to spot in Vegas! Matt and Rich at the bar are excellent at what they do and they have Kronenbourg 1664!

TdFUoolTof0WF6ej7KfkRw.text: Wonderful experience.  We are here on our honeymoon. Lyle greeted us after someone had taken our jackets. It's cold in January. Our server Will was very attentive and knowledgeable. We shared crab salad app. And had butternut squash soup. Magnificent. Beef wellington and Venison for main were superb. Chef recommended glass of wine for Venison was delicious.  Do not miss the souffle.  Views of fountains at Bellagio.   Worth every penny,  expect to pay $100-$200 per person.

6EP_PHe3KQW1ENO-CjZxVQ.text: I'm really glad that we did this while we were in town and that they had reservations on open door.   We had a window seat with a decent view of the arc de triomphe. They even offered a shall to help keep warm.   My friend and I both started with a salad. I had the market greens. The presentation was perfect and I ate every last bit of it off my plate. Next was the queen filet. I ordered it medium well, which I know most places hate. It definitely wasn't medium well, just normal medium, but it was still good. Although I would have expected a nicer place like this to be able to handle it. I also had the mashed potatoes which were very good. Wish I had tried the asparagus to branch out though.   We finished with the lemon and blueberry souffle. I was honestly unimpressed. Maybe I would have liked it more if we'd gotten chocolate or Nutella.   All in all a great experience even if it was slightly pricey.

JbInFEjWSMWsk2hWyZ-ZOw.text: Great view from the top of the tower. Oddly enough, I think my favorite part of this was our trip with the elevator operator!  She was very friendly and funny, and made it a very enjoyable experience. I wish I had caught her name but did not. The view was good, my only complaint is the bars on the windows. I enjoyed the high roller more so and the view on the high roller more but we were at a different vantage point in Paris. Everything's pricey in Vegas, and this is no exception. Will likely skip this next time but enjoyed the experience!

OJbg6VUs0g9BNwlRmQdxCQ.text: I had the extreme pleasure of being taken here for my birthday dinner by my beautiful girlfriend. Wow, what a treat. I rarely give out 5 star reviews but this place totally deserves it. There really wasn't anything that wasn't perfect, from the service to the food. Top notch all around.   We made a request to be seated at the windows overlooking the strip and the Bellagio fountains and our request was granted. Such an awesome view. The restaurant itself is gorgeous too. Low lit, classy, and very tastefully decorated. It feels like you're in an old school, classic, French saloon or something.   Our server Michael (and it's weird calling him that because it felt more like he was a friend who had been here many times and knew what was good) was great. He knew literally everything about the menu and had perfect recommendations. He was prompt, friendly, and accommodating, especially for someone like me who was trying escargot and octopus for the first time!  Speaking of that, the escargot was great and the seared octopus was even better. I was surprised how mild the flavor of the escargot was. It comes served with something similar to a hush puppy filled with a creamy pea sauce. The octopus was meaty and well seasoned. It sort of had a lobster'esque quality to it, but not 'seafoody' tasting at all. I'd definitely order it again.   For my entree I had the TWELVE (massive) ounce filet with some creamy mashed potatoes and asparagus on the side. The filet had a beautiful crust on it and was a perfect warm pink in the center. One of the best filets I've ever had. I had trouble finishing it with how massive it was. And I loved the mashed potatoes and asparagus. I've never seen asparagus served with small egg bits, what a nice touch!  For dessert we split the chocolate souffle. Again, it was great. Substantial bready center filled with rich, bitter chocolatey goodness. You can't go wrong.   Can't wait to come back next time we're in Vegas.   Here's my overall ratings: Atmosphere- 4.5/5 Quality/value- 4.5/5 Service- 5/5 Food- 5/5 Drinks- 4/5

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I can&#39;t remember what this drink is called, but it had raspberries and blackberries in it. Tasty.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautifully cooked 12 ounce filet
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free eggplant appetizer

ONwfDR3x6lZhAG5a-WDwzg.text: With over 1600 reviews, what else is there to say that hasn't already been said?  Key points: -yes, amazing view. If you are dining as a couple, the tables with prime viewings overlooking the Bellagio fountains is set up so both of you can look out towards The Strip. -romantic ambiance. But still a great place for bachelorette parties or just a nice girls night out. -You get to the restaurant through elevator access and that would be located in the middle of the casino floor. We valet our cars and it was a pretty short walk. Just a bit longer if you self-park in the garage.  I really enjoyed the food. Started off with the Market Greens salad with avocado, sunflower seeds in a walnut vinaigrette. For my entree I ordered the Alaskan Wild Cod, comes with quinoa pilaf, zucchini in a beurre blanc sauce. Hands down, I would order both items again. Delicious! Typical high end restaurant Strip prices. My salad was $18.00 and my entree was $46.00.  Reservations are highly recommended. Doesn't matter what day, time, or occasion.

EtmjN7WEccGSgXUpgmiWfg.text: Starting off, the view was tremendous. It's right on the strip so you eat and you have beautiful sight to see.   The food was delicious. The avocado salad. With the filet mignonette was so good.   The waitress was really nice and did the most to make sure we had a good experience.   The design was great. It was my first time in a french restaurant so I was really impressed.

dmd1tLBcZx_cHkvHTJ1Jag.text: We love this place. It is elegant with exceptional customer service. The food is so incredibly delicious. The views are breathtaking, the Bellagio waterfalls, the lights, just everything you can hope for. We have been here several times over the years for various celebrations and family events. This last time we went for my in laws 38th wedding anniversary.  Every time we come, the General manager Sharon Boudreau goes above and beyond to accommodate us.  I would also like to thank our Captain Alix Briand for providing the most exceptional service ever, you were wonderful and we will always request you. And lastly I would like to thank Jules for always being so happy, and friendly and down to earth guy to talk to. You all made this dinner super memorable for our family. Keep up the good work and we will see you again on our next Vegas visit. Thank you all.

W-Vh6j3vDVNqg8Zq1QzulQ.text: Okay okay so I had no idea there was a restaurant up here at all! We were just walking around and I noticed there was an elevator and I was like it wouldn't hurt to check it out. Then as we went up, the view got better and better. It was overlooking the Fountains at Bellagio!   During this time, we had already ate but we made sure to make a reservation the next day to check it out! First things first, this is a very expensive restaurant so make sure you're ready. I got the Rossini Style Filet Mignon, Fois Gras, Truffle Sauce which at the time was $79. I also got Assorted Seasonal Wild Mushrooms which was $15. I don't know if Truffle and Truffle sauce is the same thing but it was my first time trying out Truffle. I'm pretty sure that the Filet Mignon that I got was the best that I've ever had. No joke, it melted in my mouth and in general that's the best steak type meal that I've had. However, the dessert took it to another level. I've been wanting to try out Souffle and understand whats the hype is all about. I ordered the Nutella and Pistachio Souffle which were both $16. WOW is the reaction that I had when I tried it. I believe it is my favorite dessert of all time. Once you take a bite and add in either the Nutella or Pistachio its like a game changer. I love the fluffiness and consistency of it.   I wholeheartedly recommend this place if you feeling fancy for the night! Even though my Filet Mignon was really really good, I recommend the dessert the most because I guess I'm such a sweet tooth kind of guy. Please come by if you are in the area!

i3zO3RL6tQyrXdmdBmQW2g.text: I originally scheduled a dinner here because it looked super romantic not to mention the so called view of the fountains.. after I got there I looked at the menu for dinner and being a vegetarian nothing really caught my eye. They had a vegetarian tasting menu but at 125 dollars I didn't want to take the risk. I switched my reservation to lunch and I'm happy I did. The food as much as it hurts to say wa a really BLAND. There was no flavor or texture it was just BLAH. Desert was not bad but there's so many better restaurants in VEGAS. It surprised me because I love the restaurant down stairs but this place did not hit the spot. With a lunch reservation at 2:30 it seemed like wait staff was rushing us out to make room for the dinner reservation FOOD AND CHECK CAME SO FAST, while we were eating entrees they asked us what we want for desert. Our view of the fountains weren't even that great honestly not worth the money we spent. Only one table all the way the corner has a nice view...  DO NOT GO JUST FOR THE VIEW TAKE YOU MONEY ELSEWHERE TRUST ME! Yes the elevator ride up there is cool and it's a nice experience but that's as far as it gets.

XWkVwDZtCrVVw0Hc9F94EQ.text: Been coming here to celebrate our anniversary for three years now...the food and service are exceptional!! However, the reason I'm giving it a 3 is because they've changed their dress code and now allow shorts, T-shirt's and flip flops!! Making it a less special restaurant! Now a super casual restaurant with a super expensive menu!

ihV1xujMKPvSIpwlX8NMFA.text: Ask questions! True French restaurant with great taste just be sure what you're eating, confusing menu if you can't read French well. I had the aged Parmesan crusted chicken and French onion soup... it was delicious. I only took a star off because the mimosa wasn't good lol. Service is excellent!

wHoMEsDqD234G7fwExXocA.text: My wife and I just celebrated our 25th anniversary at the Eiffel Tower in Las Vegas. The bartender, Ridge, was amazing and made us some of the best service we've ever had. Tried the daisy jalapeno drink!    The food was delicious and the service at the table by Maria was top notch. You can see from the photo the view is unparalleled.  Next time we are in Vegas we will definitely come back.
