pUm4uzlFhXqRjXwThlyrHw.text: The meal was truly flawless. We enjoyed the 5 course tasting menu with wine pairing. I'm only recently beginning to  appreciate wine, so it was a real treat to enjoy pairings that truly complemented each course. Pairing was well worth the additional fee.  Yes, the view is spectacular. The Bellagio fountains never get old and seeing them 9 times during the meal is a real treat.

QjseFsWXoTb7fKDi4mJfDg.text: Beautiful view but food not the best and overpriced. If you really care more about the view, then this is the place to be. Foodwise, there are so many other better restaurants you can try.

O1Pnrgq_F3aLtoIX6dDWSg.text: This is an ultra-swanky - if not necessarily "classy" - upscale restaurant at the heart of the Strip.  I mean, how can a restaurant located on the landing of a fake Eiffel Tower in an amusement park hotel on the Strip in Las Vegas truly ever be considered classy? It couldn't. Anyhow, my dad, stepsister, her friend and I came here for dad's birthday a few weeks ago because he had always wanted to try it. You ride up an elevator to the restaurant and anti-climactically emerge into what amounts to the kitchen.  The layout of the restaurant is in tiers with booths facing out to the windows and a spectacular panoramic view of the Bellagio and its fountains.  The service is quite attentive, however the head waiter was just a tad bit creepy in his mannerisms and tone.  Now, the food is where this restaurant loses two stars because, although obviously quality ingredients, it just wasn't what you'd expect when you're laying out this kind of cash.  Appetizers were fair: Cynthia is right, the carpaccio is excellent, however, being a fan of fast food, it struck me as glorified Arby's meat.  I dunno. The scallop appie only came with two (for 20 bucks). The surf n' turf consisted of a very good fillet, but topped only with a small amount of baked crab meat, not the lobster tail that one would typically expect.  The sauces were just fair.  My stepsister's friend had the whole lobster, the presentation of which was odd: it was upside down and laid open on the plate, with spinach leaves and mushrooms tucked under the meat. Weird. Everything is a la carte, so you lay out more shells for the side dishes.  The potatoes au gratin were quite good, but the sauteed mushrooms a bit flavorless and gummy.  So all in all, have dinner here if its a super special occasion and someone else (such as dad) is footing the bill.

gvLwPPvIPdhQf9yb_iId1Q.text: Service, atmosphere and food are all excellent.  Would return again.  Beef Wellington was superb.

XjssamoAOQ0_LUnfkEtfyg.text: My son and I dined at the Eiffel Tower last week. We arrived @ 1745 for a 1800 resv, made on line and were immediately seated. An early reservation allowed for a window table over looking the Bellagio water show.The sun was setting behind the Bellagio making it a perfect view for the water show. Our server ,John Figlietti, was a True professional. He was timely,observant,informative and personable. My son had the salmon, judging by his smile, left little doubt as to how satisfied he was. I had the NY strip which was a generous proportion and perfectly prepared, absolutely delicious. As the restaurant started to fill up @ 1900 we were ordering desert. We found the close proximity of the window tables to be a plus. It allowed for brief exchanges with our neighbors who were enjoying the views as well. The entire evening was a pleasure !

qicHEB75WFOr9d8LNHqE8Q.text: A beautiful restaurant that you would expect to have a better view of the Bellagio fountains than it actually does.  The service was excellent, and the food is great.  Had the Bone in Rib Eye steak, which was made perfectly.

7bM-kkMz4B9SuFvkuguHOw.text: Sent my sister and her husband there for his retirement.  The view was lovely but she had to send her caesar salad back because there was a large anchovy in her first bite.  Then her Pinot Salmon was fishy because it was over cooked.  Her husband's steak was under cook and had to be remade.  Once he got his food back it was perfect.  I am really sorry I choose this restaurant since it is something they will always remember.  To add insult to us they still charged me $55 for both the salad and salmon which my sister did not even eat.

w_58tXsz4rikgy1MGIprhQ.text: It's more like a 3.5 stars for me.  The bad: the place is extremely noisy and touristy. A giant number of people waiting to get seated on a non-weekend night. The deco is old and dingy. This is definitely not a "fine" Michellin-star dining experience.   The good: the view is quite good. You got a panorama view of the Bellagio fountains, though if you really want to see the fountain, Le Cirque and Picasso in Bellagio would have better views.   The unexpected: for such a touristy place, the food is actually quite decent. The bread is fresh and tasty; the drinks are well-made while not exceptional; my entree (cod) is tasty as well... typical good French cooking.  Overall I will not go back because it was so touristy. Le Cirque and Picasso are much better (also more expensive). I can see it being fun for some one who wanna go to a destination restaurant while having decent food.

sCrJs7avuxJ3SCbl19SDNQ.text: This place was WELL worth the hefty cash, and lived up to all it's praise.  My sweety and I came here to celebrate our 2 year anniversary, and decided to splurge on dinner.   We heard a lot of good things about the pre-fix menu, and decided to  go with that for our meals. It was so much fun, having all 7 courses come to us! They have you order dessert at the beginning, so we both decided to go with souffles. My man got banana, and I (who normally orders anything with chocolate) ordered the Pistachio souffle!  They start you off with these little cheese puff things (can't remember the name) but they are divine! They taste just like puffed up Cheez-its.  Our first course was the amuse bouche.. Next they brought by a warm lobster salad, which if it weren't so delicious, i would have BATHED in it. It was that good. I still dream about that salad. Our third course was  (i think..) a cream of celery soup, which was heavenly. At this point, the water show had begun at the Bellagio, and our table had a perfect front row view of it! It was wonderful, sipping our soup, watching the water show.  Our fourth course was red snapper over braised vegetables.. They actually give you a generous portion of red snapper, too! Perfectly cooked and soooo flavorful.  Fifth course was venison with huckleberries and braised chestnuts.. Which I was SO excited for, having never tried venison until then. It was melt-in-your-mouth phenomenal.   Our 6th course that arrived was wine poached pear slices wrapped around camambert(sp?) cheese, served with warm cinnamon raisin bread... ohhhh my god.   Our last and final course (my stomach was BUSTING at this point) were our souffles.. which was up there with some of the best dessert I'd ever had. Our server brought us some assorted candies with our check, which was such a special treat, although I couldn't eat one last bit!  The service was prompt, professional, and very attentive! Our server was so much fun, he reminded me of my grandpa!   This is the perfect place to take your lover on a special occasion, and WELL worth the money. I *highly* recommend doing the pre-fix, you get so much food for your money, and you will leave STUFFED, i promise you!!

jllbaJJECuYX-KdKGrlyag.text: oh my gosh...this has to be hands-down one of the best meals ive ever had.   as a finale to our trip, we decided to treat ourselves to a delicious, over-the-top meal at the eiffel tower. and i have to say, it was amazing, delicious and of course, worth it.    we arrived at 8, reservations highly recommended! we had to wait a bit to be seated, so we had a cocktail at the bar, which were phenomenal! we were seated in a corner table, along the windows looking at the paris balloon and the bellagio fountains. overwhelmed with what to order, we settled on a few things and shared sides. all of which were phenomenal. but im getting ahead of myself-   we were given an avocado and cream cold soup to start, which was delicious...then we were offered bread...we all opted for baguettes, which were the perfect combination of crispy and soft...2 of us ordered blue cheese souffles... which came pretty promptly. the souffles were heaven. it's literally in the top 10 pieces of food ive ever eaten. just omfg.   we got our main courses...my scallops were delicious and the girls oooed and ahhed over their dishes. our sides were phenomenal as well. the au gratin potatoes and the asparagus especially!   after our main courses, we were offered dessert...and who were we to turn it down?! we got the grand marnier souffle...SO amazing. also because we 'were good', we got an assortment of chocolate, nougat and caramel from our server! holy delicious. the caramel was my fave.   and i have to say something about our service. absolutely 5 star. every need we could have possibly had was anticipated- and our server was an absolute delight. he was especially pleased when he figured out one of my friends spoke french, so they had a brief conversation about where they both had lived. all in all i cannot say enough great things about our experience at the eiffel tower restaurant!

u7MyGWe3lNvziLRhDNflWQ.text: We had a wonderful anniversary dinner here.  You can not beat the ambiance of Vegas in the place.  So you have to go at least once.  Service is top notch, as it should be in a place like this.  The hubby is kind of a jokester and asks the waiter for "their 2nd cheapest bottle of wine."  But the waiter was cool, it's not so stuffy that you feel out of place.  Wine was wonderful, my glass was always refilled, which is amazing because I can down the vino pretty quickly.  I had the surf and turf which I highly recommend.  The hubby had duck, which he enjoyed.  All the sides that our party ordered were excellent.  Definitely can be shared.  All pricey but worth it, plus the view speaks for itself.

1GPHrjW4bLjulsIqCXNIvw.text: Had a private dining experience overlooking Bellagio Lake.  Fantastic well thought our meal.  The filet was great with our wine selection.  The chocolate dessert stole the show.

gWuvlCfdQTW4cUN0tUkiiA.text: I had an incredible time here because I was with good company and the service was good, but honestly, I can't remember much about the food.  I do remember the incredible view!  I want to go back and give this place another try.

jNM6wfmUBnw6sGABd-c0UQ.text: The first time was a 10 star - this time the whole place looked worn out - the service and the food has gone down!

Pqfp8rx3siVM8C21BDwwFQ.text: Loved this place. Been there twice and food and service were fantastic.

XnXSbOA5vYEiwMg-XGmd_Q.text: Let me paint a picture of our evening.  Call to make reservations at Andre's, the French restaurant at another hotel.  Get a standard phone message, stating to leave time, date, and number for a reservation. I do as I was told, left said info, got all dressed up, walked across the street ( no easy feat, as you need to walk 2 blocks to do so) only to find out that the restaurant was closed for reservations.   Bummer, Big Time !! I'm all dressed up, and no French Restaurant, We start walking the strip, me in a funk, when all of a sudden, the BF's light-bulb goes off. Let's do Paris Hotel -- they got to have a Frog Restaurant there.  We wanted to do the Eiffel Tower anyway -- so Yeah--- I'm there.  We don't actually go to the top of the Eiffel Tower ( they want an extra $25 bucks or something close for the 2 of us), but we get off the elevator just short of the top.   Beautiful. Wow. Superb View.  The strip in all it's glory is before us.  No reservations -- No problem, as long as we're willing to sit toward the back, as all the window ( great view) tables have been reserved. A table in the back...sure, we're just happy to get in.  We're given a booth along the wall, which is high up on a platform, so you still get the night skyline.  Our wait staff comes in a procession.  First the water guy, then the busser who turns glasses...then our waiter. He is funny, charming, from Eastern Europe, and has just enough polish to pull off a high ticket restaurant without any pompousness.  We like him from the get.  The BF is starving, so our waiter suggests the Steak.  Done  I love rabbit and order the rabbit Napoleon.  A nice Cab for me, a frog beer for the BF -- we're happy people again.  The food was outstanding, the service even better. Romance was in the air, for sure.   Tre' Bon

UqqQ2RJUEPR6JkwezwISfg.text: Order the filet and it was perfect. The view of Rhe strip and fountian is one of a kind. Please remember to wear pants and coller, this is not Wendy's! Worth the money, right under $200 for 2 people with wine.

teNVH3exteoSZNXGXobD4Q.text: I was here 2 weeks ago, and it was packed! The view was amazing and the staff was friendly. Food was good but the dessert was unforgettable! they make the best souffle I've ever had. It was a bit pricey but expected. Oh and the Seafood tower was really good too, and i usually don't like seafood served cold. Overall experience was great.

E1BIb1dSwwsBeIFkAAlApw.text: The drinks were great. Expensive, but worth the price. The view was great, but the food...eehhh...not so impressed. Expected more at those prices.

byDasm2cziFCrvaz2-gbYA.text: I went there recently with Mom and Dad....The server was mediocre in the start...then just got worse from there....My blue cheese souffle was cold, and the foie gras was okay....both a disappointment. The chocolate souffle came with no whip cream - a real shocker....Views to die for though!!

Htk5Z4KVYAWN1hxRW-vq7w.text: What an incredible dinner!! First off, you can't beat the gorgeous view this place has.  Also, the service was impeccable and the staff made the evening very memorable. Will for sure be coming back here!

Af_04qVdYX5vQoHGVuUzrw.text: Food was perfectly prepared! King and Queen Filets, Olive Oil Mashed Potatoes, potatoes Alexander, green beans and mushrooms. Server named Igor was phenomenal! I enjoyed celebrating my 3rd year anniversary there! Completely recommend it

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bellagio fountain view!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate and caramel  soufflés, very delicious!!! Beautiful view!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special dessert brought to us

ARTBSssyZmKPthGWLxNl2A.text: For the price what you pay this is over rated I think a waiter should not ask every 2 minutes if you are ready, the quality of food is not to the best. If you are looking for quality and very good service you better go to Paris, France.  The restaurant is very loud for a romantic dinner for two   I can not recommended this restaurant

rSH_dj73IxR6Y4716isLHQ.text: We came here to celebrate my best friend's birthday and were so excited to try this spot but left feeling utterly disappointed. The server, Jorge, made our group feel extremely uncomfortable. From the moment we sat down you could tell he was not happy about serving us. The restaurant was not that busy since it was a Thursday night and past the dinner rush so he had no excuse for being so hasty with us. A couple sat at the table next to us and we could hear him fawn and flatter them while being completely curt when he came to our table. The food was delicious and the view was wonderful but we just felt so unwelcome. The busser ended up making the best impression on us and was always there to clear our dishes and refill our drinks. We ended up asking for the check before we even finished our entrees because we wanted to get out of there so badly. We didn't want to order dessert, more drinks, or anything. We just wanted to leave because the experience was THAT bad. We tipped the standard 20% hoping that some of it would eventually reach the busser. Looking back, I wish we would have just handed all the tip to the busser and none to our server. I hope they learn to not profile their guests and give everyone great service and not discriminate on age and ethnicity.

yBbiiaolo-0bBPUVIU3UEA.text: I have been wanting to go here forever, and my fiance took me here for our 2nd anniversary recently.  While I'm glad we went for the experience, I doubt we will go here again...maybe in another 3-5 years.  This place is pricey, but it's warranted as the quality matches the price.  I had the rossini style filet mignon (I think that's what it was called) and it was crazy out of this world delicious. I salivate thinking about it even to this day. My fiance had the duck and he loved it. We had a glass of wine each and a pistachio souffle for dessert.  We had a table by the window and yes, it is a romantic restaurant, but I don't know what the hype is all about. It wasn't *that* spectacular.  Our server was nice but good grief, I did not care for the hard core sales vibe. He was pushing the upsell so hard it was a huge turnoff. I do not want to be pressured into eating specific things on a romantic evening out.  The other thing I didn't like is that you don't get to do the "Eiffel Tower Experience", you would have to go back downstairs and purchase tickets just like everybody else. You would think that spending hundreds of dollars on dinner would get you at least a discount, but sadly, they are too greedy for that.

ltxa4Ur5OoiWXzyTRFWy9g.text: . It was crazy busy tonight, with all the fireworks going on, this was easily a most sought after dinner spot. Luckily we made reservations and had an amazing spot in front of the Bellaggio. Anthony was our server and he was amazingly sweet. We both ordered the beef Wellington and it was the best we've ever had. Magical and special night that we will always remember. So romantic.

wUoRaxvtvzhiPdiPS1pFeQ.text: We had an enjoyable  dining experience  eating at the Effiel Tower Restaurant on our wedding anniversary. Our waitress Maria was terrific.  She was kind and sweet.  The food was excellent  from the beginning till the end . Compliments to the kitchen staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

tIo-cxMlAgJOUVouyo2-1A.text: This place is fantastic! Definitely make reservations ahead of time so you can request a table with a view as I did. I was not expecting much other than a nice view. Once the elevator doors opened I was amazed. Looked so much fancier than the Mastros in Las Vegas and I would be comparing the food to it so I was not expecting much.  I ordered the Fillet Minon, my wife the rack of lamb and we ordered some sides. Sadly, I almost knocked off a star for this but even then it would still be 5 stars, they did not have creamed corn on my visit!!! I could not believe it. I got past it an waited for the food to arrive. I decided not to get any sauce for my steak and I was hoping that I did not make a mistake. We were served housebread and a cup of eggplant mix which was very good. The food arrived and I cut my first piece of steak.......OMG I though! Sorry Mastros, this place tops your steak and it didi not need any sauce to do it. It was cooked to perfection and the taste was amazing. I then tried the sides and the also blew away all of the Mastros sides I've had before EXCEPT the cream of corn which this place did not have. Th desert was also delicious! I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9AkO-hfJkPbSfMhBTsUVWw.text: Excellent views from our table! If you are a party of 2 you will get to sit right next to the window facing the bellagio fountain. If it's a bigger party then u will not be able to sit right next to the window. Service is very nice! Reservation is almost a must for dinner. I subtracted one star because the food was good but not excellent. I was hoping for more gourmet food and most choices on the menu. I would come back and try brunch during the day again.

Y1qmiHl8La63zIJ4EjgBjg.text: This is one of those restaurant that you have options, you can have a nice regular dinner or make it a spectacular one (with deeper pockets).  I reserved a table and paid additional for corner area guaranteed table. Wonderful view, we had our dinner at 8pm reservation on a Saturday night and by that time, you get to watch the fountain show every fifteen minutes!   I ordered one of the tasting menu they offered. In fact, it's their proposal package! Comes with a bottle of champagne, a dozen of roses, personalized menu, photo in a frame...  Had an amazing time here!   The only mistake they made was they sat me at the wrong table, then asked me to go back to wait. But they were smart and gave us two free cocktails while we came back out to wait real quick.  Service was very good as well. The staff were very attentive with us throughout.   Food was good as we expected. Didn't expect any less from this restaurant.   If you google more about the restaurant, you will see a PDF file for special dinner or lunch menu and a proposal package.  Pricing range from $250-10,000 depending on what you are trying to do.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crime brûlée
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana dessert
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon!

wDQHFhkCQkF0KfWiGzEr9w.text: Very much looking forward to going to Vegas this weekend and this restaurant is the reason! I've been to Vegas dozens of times being so close by in Los Angeles and every time I've taken friends or family here they rave about it for weeks. Thinking of making a reservation for Friday night for my best friend's birthday and hope she has the same experience I've grown to know and love. Desserts are to die for!

XZDI6DoVwKtZ6WzEck79vg.text: The salmon dish we had was superb and the service was outstanding.  We also had an a above average server.   We will be back again.

vI20uF8WNbeddrWBmb9jMQ.text: The service here is second to none and the view was incredible! We failed to make reservations on a Wednesday night but only had to wait an hour at the bar before being seated. The lamb is AMAZING and the salmon was delicious!

VyeRv2vuwpOsfd14DqrmCg.text: I have always wanted to eat at this restaurant and finally had the chance to last weekend. It did not disappoint!! Everything lived up to my expectations..the view, the service, and most of all the Food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband and I enjoying our lovely dinner and view at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in Las Vegas

DWCLqOKDoPWyhVSE5vhnyA.text: First off I must say that the view was absoloutly amazing. They did a great job seating us with a view of the fountains as requested. Where they missed the mark was in regards to the service and the food. The waiter we had seemed preoccupied and wanted to rush us along, the assistant waiter lacked the basic professionalism one would expect from a $400 a table restaurant. He poured the bottled water from about a foot over our glasses which splashed both my wife and I every time he came around. He rolled his eyes at me when I asked him for a type of bread that he didn't have in the bread basket. The food was not the "Out of this world" experience we had previously read about. We had the Octopus appetizer (Great) the steak tartare appetizer (Great). My wife and I each had a filet, they were OK, but they didn't live up to the price in our opinions. The sides which were a la carte (Asparagus and Potatoes Au Gratin) were not hot when they made it to the table and were ridiculously small portions for $12 each. Overall, we would not recommend the Eiffel Tower Restaurant, especially with so many fantastic dining options in Vegas.

euevXHDdNVeWYs9bjho6Rw.text: Lobster starter was fantastic, 10/10, however I also ordered lobster for entree and sent it back as there was so much tarragon and parsley you could not taste the lobster. Partner ordered john dory which was over cooked. Souffle to finish was nice.  View was perfect, as was the service.

wTTjPbjfn77-XbTOmRETWQ.text: While the view was amazing the noise level was deafening.  We sat by the window and it was freezing.  The Halibut was overcooked and potatoes cold.  Service was good, but for the money, I'd slip this place and go somewhere your money will provide a better value

HmrwG3pNxIUhH72-s6XDfg.text: This is one of my favorite places in Las Vegas.  I'm from New Orleans and know good food and service when I experience it.   This place meets expectations for both.  This trip was my third time to this restaurant and I would recommend it.  Wth the service and excellence we had for dinner on this last trip, I'll be back again.   Also, they have a wonderful souffle!  Be sure not to miss it!

LCVdUw8dtB0KOad9mUiqtQ.text: You know what? I thought this place would be cheesy but it wasn't. It's expensive but worth it, especially for the view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. The tables are situated wrapped around the windows for optimal viewing.   Our server was sweet, efficient and informative. Of course I ordered Beef Wellington because I have watched too many Gordon Ramsay shows. I liked it. The souffles were also very good and interesting. I liked the Pistachio one best. In all with wine and souffles, the bill was well over $100 per person but it's great for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of two complimentary desserts!

-LMXmLUxwLIO-8wJGXaylA.text: My boyfriend and I celebrated our anniversary here and we had a great experience. Wes was extremely polite and helpful, always making sure we receive everything we need in a timely manner. At the end of our dinner, he surprised us with dessert! All the food was amazing, we really enjoyed it. And the view was so romantic, we saw the Bellagio fountain show twice.   Thank you Wes, the chef, and all the staff, for making our night even better!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie crêpe is a must! Strong lemon and herb taste, I loved it.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The complimentary dessert we received :) it was too beautiful to eat! And it tasted even better.

UORKNkJQ0mqx5dKHlsv9xw.text: The exquisite food is only match by the splendid view and ambient at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.   My wife and I both enjoyed a wonderful lunch date, while we admired the lovely view   Of the Bellagio's fountains.  Great place to eat and have a few drinks.   Tips: the Tomato brisk was very light and tasty. Don't be afraid to ask for a wine recommendation to go with your meal.   Great place, they made a customer for life. If you're looking to bring romance into your life or just reconnecting with that special love one, this is the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Apple desert...  Tip:it takes 25 minutes to cook, order a head of time.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chicken is amazing! Plus the mental drink adds a je ne sais pas to the meal...in short, try it!

09s9JXat5rywE0DxGtYA4g.text: The restaurants ambiance was really nice, the food was good but the prices are very high. I had the braised short ribs, the meat was really tender but I didn't care for the sauce and I thought the noodles were out of place. The most amazing thing was the brussel sprouts with bacon.

cI8silL8npkVpQrhx6pA4A.text: This place deserves 3 stars but they get that extra star for the setting and service.  Very romantic with nice view of the Bellagio water show.  The server moved us to a window seat before the entrees came so that we can have a better view...sweet!!  I had the lamb...must have the lamb at a French restaurant right?  Not bad...cooked rare and was very delicious.  Though I had better lamb and for the price they charge...??  My date had the filet mignon w/ foie gras...l tasted it and thought that it was good...that's all....though the foie gras complimented it very well.

rW51L8tqeslG78BzbdyD4g.text: If you can't make it to the real deal, then the next best experience is this restaurant. Nestled in the heart of the strip with an unparalleled view of the strip, this is THE most romantic dining experience you will have in Vegas. The elevator trip up builds the anticipation of dining in the tower. The atmosphere is elegant and warm. We had a view of the fountain show at the Bellagio. The food is amazing but bring your appetite because you're definitely going to want to wine and dine and indulge with dessert. The waiter prepared a special dessert for our celebration as a surprise and the chocolate mousse was exquisite. The ET offers a truly posh night out with a French twist.

hDI1xXoR6LTMud9rcuLSZw.text: Romantic, great food, amazing views and excellent service.  I have no complains, can't wait to go back again.   This place is known for proposals and we were lucky to witness one right next to us.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great view
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

arqwGXs5vhKqlSjekWjbQQ.text: Excellent view, food was very good. Service? Meh. Overall not a good bang for the buck.  I was running a bit late and joined my party about 20 minutes after they were already seated. A waiter with a faux french accent had taken their orders. We attempted to flag down Francois several times to no avail. I had to go to the bar myself to get a drink. 20 min later he came back with everyone else's food. He gave a faux apology and took my order, offering to rush my steak. I declined, not wanting to ruin a $50 entree. My New York steak came out pretty quickly. It was a good cut of meat, decently prepared, but nothing like Del Frisco's or the like.  I have no problem shelling out some coin for fine dining. However I expect service to come with the price tag.  If you want the view, take the tour and go have dinner at Van Gogh.

yA1T5Blwp15dZGV-___Lng.text: The BEST restaurant I have been to ...EVER!!! The service is excellent from the elevator ride, to the lady who sat us, to our server. Even the manager came out and made sure everything was going well. We ordered about 4 different sides and all were GREAT, specially the shrooms. The filet mignon with the red wine vinagrette marinade was beyond belief. It was as if 1,000 cherubs finished in my mouth!!!!  The place is dim, but has enough light to see your food and overlooking the Vegas strip is a damn near unbeatable backdrop. Also if you have a good seat you can clealy view the Bellagios water show. I'm pretty sure this restaurant has a sister location in Heaven!!! A MUST TRY next time ur in Vegas!!! BTW I brought my kids and didnt get a stink eye from the staff for doing so. (it does help that they are well trained in the art of fine dining manners.)

ZRqzombXvBoF1iDOOIwQAA.text: Went here for my girlfriend's birthday. I made reservations about a week ahead of time asking them for a fountain side seat. They told me they couldn't guarantee my seat and said I should come early.  I recommend parking with the valet service at Paris. Either you or your date will be wearing something nice and heels so you probably won't want to walk in those. The self parking lot is pretty darn far away (about a 7 minute walk) so skimping on the valet tip isn't worth it.   We got the following:   +pea soup (6.5/10) Very distinct taste. Came with some fish which was very delicious.  +foie gras (7/10) portion was very small but delicious. It was very flavorful but a bit on the salty side.  +blue cheese souffle (7/10) Delicious. The souffle was scrumptious.  +lamb chops (9/10) M girlfriend said this is the best lamp she's ever had.  +chocolate souffle (9/10) Very delicious and full of chocolate flavor. Our server poked holes into the souffle and then pour chocolate syrup inside.  +espresso  Our total came out to $132.42. A great deal for a good view, fine dining and a relaxing atmosphere.   I'd have to say the lamb was very delicious. My girlfriend said that it was the best lamb she's ever had. I thought it was pretty good myself. It was flavorful and not very gamy.  I read a few other reviews commenting that the lamb was a bit tough. My girlfriend and I like our meat rare so I asked the waiter to serve it as rare as they could get away with.   The blue cheese souffle was pretty good but not as good as the chocolate souffle. We ordered it early so we'd get it after our lamb chops.   The entire dinner was roughly 2 hours. I'd give yourself 2 hours if in case you're budgeting your time. We had a Cirque du Soliel to run to so we paced ourselves to leave in 1 hour and 45 minutes.   We sat at the very corner seat closest to the Bellagio fountains. We are from 700-900 and saw at least 5 fountain shows. I think this place has the best fountain shows. I'd definitely recommend this place for special occasions.

Nrt8hG2Wjo5I77JiGYphyQ.text: Very good service and very good views but when I was eating there roaches in the wall the employes new what we were looking at so they gave us free desert and appetizers but they didn't mention the roaches who knows if there was insects in my food

K4K4R0mjcB7tun65o5p9bw.text: High end restaurant with outstanding service.  We celebrated our anniversary there and were greeted by the manager.  As I was removing my jacket, he quickly assisted me on placing it on my chair.    Our waiter, Joshua was perfect!  He appeared at the right time to replenish our drinks, rolls and checked in periodically but not overbearing.  We had the Thanksgiving tasting which we enjoyed.  Turkey a little bland for my taste but the sides were excellent (red cabbage, au gratin potatoes).  The chef surprised us with a couple of "extras"...cold celery soup and multiple desserts.  All excellent.  A beautiful location with a great view of the Bellagio Fountains and the strip.  A great evening.

HFc-6QP06C0bs09839-f9w.text: Lets just say this place is lucky they have a view to use as a selling point.  The servers are non-attentive and extremely scripted versus being genuine, if they even speak English.  I would goto STK over this place all day long.  Get a room with a view and order room service, you will be happier and probably save a buck.

K5DS00TNit-0jGpv9TqGkw.text: Expensive...but worth it! Food is spot on...great view (Bellagio Water Show if you have a window seat), service is perfect.

Q4e-jeR3R9_Yf1u5of5vvA.text: I read plenty of reviews on here before finally deciding to book, I was also close to cancelling my reservation because of them but I'm glad I didn't. Leading up to the reservation they send you a text message asking you to confirm. When you do they will respond and ask you if you have any preferences, whether or not you'll be celebrating anything and would like to know if you want win/champagne or even a rose on your table which is nice. The view was great, we had a half circled table facing the water show at the Bellagio, The server (Rebecca) was awesome, really outgoing and over all made our dining experience even better since she was personable. The food was about the best french cuisine I've ever had, I ordered a New York steak, my wife got the filet mignon, Of course we got the veggies and potatoes etc but what really sealed the deal for us was the caramel souffle. They also have a photographer that will take a picture at your table or with a view of outside that charges $25 for the picture (price is tacked onto your bill) so you can expect to spend close to $300 or so with a few drinks, your meal and the picture not including the tip. Overall though you are paying for a really good meal and an experience which makes it all worthwhile.

wxVnM4etBn7J-ndK4HkyoQ.text: Good food, but you are paying for the view of the Bellagio.  Go at night and try to get a table near the windows to watch the Bellagio fountains.

RYjVHXjym3WAA5lkZQTSjQ.text: Best filet mignon ever. Everything about this restaurant was amazing: the ambiance, the service, the view, but most of all the delicious cuisine. It is not cheap, but you get what you pay for. This is the kind of place you propose to someone... So romantic, so perfect, so Paris!

1v1CCA_iR85FxMY9wLIl8w.text: I have to admit that this is a bit way over priced for the quality of food.  However, the view and atmosphere made this place a place to have dinner.  My wife and I went here for our anniversary.  Our seats were next to the window.  So, it was rather nice.  We oversaw the Bellagio fountains.  I wished they could open the windows so we could have the chance to listen to the music.  Oh well.  As for the environment, it is a very cozy and romantic place.  However, I would say that the negative is that you are within a foot or two from the next table.  There was very limited space to manuever.  As for the service, no better word than Excellent.  As for the food, we had the seafood sampler.  My wife and I ordered somewhat the same thing in Scottland, England and expected a similiar presentation.  But, the results was truly different.  It was 1/4 of the size in a oversized ice-cup.  Granted, the seafood was fresh, but we were expecting MORE... Oh well...  I ordered the T-bone steak and she had the duck.  Steak was ok and the duck was a bit over cooked.  We shared a chocolate cake together ~ too sweet....   In summmary, compared to the other high-end restaurants, this was a bit disappointing.  If it was not for the view of the Bellagio fountains, I would have rated it much lower.

QXZtA6uhmBIaFLE3tlBPrA.text: I don't have the Joel Robuchon dollaz quite yet but I still wanted bougie food to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. Most of Yelp's reviews are good, praising the food. Any bad reviews are attributed to bad service. I ate there on a Monday night (7/5) and the service was great! When we first got there, the table wasn't ready, so we waited in the bar which was dark but I felt sexy just sitting there. We got seated in front of the window, the Bellagio fountain show is great for filling awkward silence. Our waiter greeted us and he was very friendly, although he started out with an Irish accent and by the end of the meal it was Van Damme/George St. Pierre.   We ordered:  -Foie Gras with braised bing cherries -Sea bass with tomato quinoa (I've never had quinoa so delicious) -Beef wellington (good sized portion, we left with take home) -Crispy Pomme Dauphines (the serving size is a lot for 2 people) -chocolate souffle for dessert  We also ordered 3 cocktails and our bill came out to about $180. Considering it's Las Vegas and a bottle of water will cost you $2.50, our bill wasn't bad. The food was good, the view was great, service is friendly. The only thing was we didn't get a special birthday treat for the birthday boy so I'll knock off a star for that.  Don't forget to: -Dress up -Make reservation -Order a souffle in the beginning

1LRuTmDHjfgYtpnIejjnKA.text: Great views, great service, really lovely wine list, and the food was fantastic. I had an opportunity to eat at several well know high end restaurants at Aria and Cosmopolitan and I much preferred this restaurant.

DOyyVpGyiwxFmcnfdbx5QA.text: We went to this restaurant for our 10 year anniversary. It is a hype restaurant and it comes with everything you'd expect in an expensive, centrally located restaurant with a theme.  The view of the Bellagio fountains is very cool and definitely enhances your overall dining experience but it does come with a price tag. We had the seafood appetizer which was beautifully presented and very tasty. The main course was good but not the best I've had (I went for steak and my husband ordered pheasant), and then we had souffle for dessert. Plus, a bottle of wine to top the bill.  The souffle was good and the selection of flavors is overwhelming. It does take 40 minutes to make so I highly recommend ordering in advance - unless you are planning to spend 3 hours dining.  You can get a picture taken and printed out ($24) and you can get a rose for your date on your way back from the bathroom (at least, that's what my husband did).  It's romantic and very nice, with good service and a pleasant view.  But there's one thing it's not... and that is it is not the best restaurant in Vegas.

3intRtSebVicWXsHHq5U-g.text: One of the best view for dinner date. If you book seating after 8pm the Fountains of Bellagio show is on hyper drive (every 15 mins). The window seat are for party of two. Four or more you will get the 2nd row tables(much less impressive). The best dish was the deserts, both Banana Souffle and the Creme brulee was excellent. The main dishs was ok (cod, escargot, tartare & onion soup), not cook in a traditional french style, the chief modified all of them. Will go back again for the view. ;-)

xG2VpaosDiY_iV4Q-uoEkg.text: What an outstanding experience!  From the moment we entered the restaurant via the dedicated elevator to the moment we left we were fully attended. Our waiter was always there and never went MIA. The wine list was a bit intimidating, given the amazing high-end wines comprising their cellar, but we were able to tell the waiter our preferences and price point, and not only did he gladly made a recommendation, but he verified that choice with the sommelier and came back with a different option, which was outstanding.   I had the beef Wellington, and my wife had the filet mignon with berneaise sauce. Both were outstanding. We further finished the meal with souffles, mine pistachio and hers caramel. Again both terrific.   In addition to the great food and service, the view is spectacular. We had a window table overlooking the Bellagio fountains, which was an amazing addition to the already spectacular experience.

xT3YKZTdm1I-TFrWc6nvmQ.text: The spectacular view and French ambience at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant makes it one of our favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  Oh, yeah, and the food!  This melange (or mixture) is a sure-fire recipe for an enchanting experience. We reserved ahead for a late lunch and were shown immediately to a primo view table.  If you dine here often, the restaurant does keep track of your preferences, so do let them know what you like, or if it is a special occassion!  We had eaten here several times including our wedding dinner right after we got married (in Las Vegas, of course) and had a breathtaking view of the Bellagio fountains at night!  We were treated to a chocolate souffle with "Congratulations" written on the plate, and a toast of champagne!  The people around us joined in, and made it a party! This time, a quiet lunch was in order, and we enjoyed the Friday afternoon ambience.  I ordered a Sauvignon Blanc wine to start, and was up for brunch.  The lobster Eggs Benedict dish was a marvel.  Sweet, tender lobster, including the claw, slathered with pillowy freshly made Hollandaise sauce, all sprinkled with micro-greens.  This dish made me a convert to brunch food!  My honey got the Salmon Paillard, and enjoyed the tangy pepper and lemon combination.  We reveled in the view, and the atmosphere, feeling transported to a French time and place.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Paillard at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Eggs Benedict at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant

usESBjD0ZUxyxxRcXxCmMg.text: Absolutely exceptional. I got the one and a half pound Lobster. It was baked with cream spinach! It was enough for two people!  Customer service was amazing and the view was breathless. I would definitely want to go back and try a few other options.   I was truly impressed  with the ambiance, staff, food and view.

VJkKxD_XmLTU5yG0HrSOpA.text: This place is incredible! Top 10 on my restaurants list. This place is fancy, high end, find dining restaurant, and it's worth every penny. - The atmosphere and vibe of the place was very classy and elegant - The service was outstanding in every way possible - The food was the best. Fresh, tasty, great presentation  If you are ever in Las Vegas go to this restaurant. Either if it's for a romantic dinner or celebrating a birthday, this place will stay in your memories.  *If you are celebrating anything you can pay them extra to put roses on the table

Ygs4EjmM6nlf_sITR8PajQ.text: This is one of those bucket list restaurants you need to experience.  We went with a large dinner work party and I need to say the service was absolutely superb and the food was top-notch.   This is definitely a high-end experience!  There is a wide range of menu choices from vegetarian to seafood to meat and poultry.  Everyone at the table had something different and there were very satisfied smiles around!  Reservations are a must at dinner time and there is a dress code. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Olive Oil Poached Wild Alaskan Halibut, Fennel, English Peas, Quinoa
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eiffel Tower

Vnl4AvyzlaIw5HnPUDaRYA.text: Fun experience, was in town for my son's 21st birthday.  Staff tolerated my slight inebriation and even played along a bit.

MJhNdI7RAMsyZPvs4wEEJg.text: VIEWS VIEWS VIEWS. And VEAL. Wow... I'd never thought I'd ever be brave enough to try veal and not feel like a total POS whilst eating it. But I did and I enjoyed the shit out of it. So tender and juicy, the broccoli and mushrooms on the side were perfection. The bread they hand out is also very warm and fluffy (?), you get it... it's great. I had their chocolate souffle and the 20 minute wait was SO WORTH IT. It was truly heaven in my mouth.   The staff was so polite and courteous, service was efficient and they didn't push us out as soon as they saw were done with our food.   Yes the menu is pricey but you definitely get your money's worth, I'd definitely dine here again and again, the views from the "Eiffel tower" are great, looks over the Bellagio fountains and the rest of the strip, so it makes the dinning experience that much better.

FHlH1-G-EZtFPAKK6pGxZw.text: ***Review long overdue and Yelp friend Miss Michelle C.'s visit, reminded me;Thanks!***  Alas, I was having kittens while waiting in line for the elevator. Had not counted on the slew of patrons on route to the same destination; Eiffel Tower restaurant. Strangers all of us, we nodded politely waiting patiently without a brawl. Not wishing to be late for our reservations, we actually started our trek quite early and it paid off, somewhat.  Stepping out of the elevator, one can see the open kitchen through a large pane glass, everyone hard at work. Making our way to the Hostess, the stately bar on the left is grandiose. *heart eyes* Please see photo.  On to the Evening! Amazing experience worth every moments breathe. The beautiful setting, top view, and service lends itself to be a delight. My favorite view was the gorgeous bar that overwhelms you as you walk in; a True tremendous sight!  We were a party of 4 and celebrating Vegas. Therefore our excitement ran high. So Champagne wishes were first in line ;) Although we had reservations, no tables by the windows were available, boo hoo. Nevertheless we had a delightful meal through and through. The service is remarkable as we had several people looking after our table.   We opted for the pre-fix dinner and added wine pairing. From beginning to end, the food seemed to be never-ending and the wines generously poured. Please see Photo Although we had a starter dish, there was a preamble amuse-bouche of cool cream of celery...very tasty and wonderful start, Followed by the aforementioned trio of a starter dish. Please see Photo  *Foie Gras-was delightful and delicious sitting atop of chopped pear and drizzled with a luscious wine reduction. I was pleasantly surprised by the generous portion. *Seared Scallop-Although not a fan of scallops, this dish was pleasantly gratifying. Seared and seasoned perfectly.  *Venison-Bone in venison was tasty and not gamey. Accompanied by delectable wild mushrooms, I could have eaten 2...Oh wait! I did eat 2 as the Wifey passed it on to me ;)  Score! The evening came to a close but not before dessert. Unable to choose between the scrumptious Souffles available, all 4 flavors were ordered for the table! Pistachio, Chocolate, Grand Marnier, (my fav) and Classic. We were all quite stuffed and rolled out beautifully.   An enjoyable evening altogether. Why 4 stars then? Having arrived 10 minutes early for our reservation, we were not seated until 20 minutes past our rez. 30 minutes of watching. Don't blame them for the first 10 minutes of course, but it was obviously an overbooking issue. So we waited at the banquet bench available. We did enjoy and shall return. Don't forget to use the Yelp check-in offer!  Try Eiffel out for yourself and see what you think. Thank you for reading =)

CepAnZAX-tJw6gjRAp46cQ.text: My fiance and I came here back in May. Overall I would rate it a 4.0, our server was slightly annoying and made me feel rushed to order. After we finished our dessert, we had to wait a good half hour for the photographer to take our pictures (the pics didn't even turn out so well)... They had an amazing selection of wine! I would honestly come back just for it! I started with the lobster bisque soup which was creamy and savory. My main entree was the Filet Mignon I thought the texture was great and it was cooked to a perfect medium but I still think it was missing that rich taste of flavor I was looking for.  I would still return for the wine and atmosphere!

p1_uNchUXFB1j6cdLuLVHQ.text: My mom and I went yesterday for brunch to try the lobster Benedict and it was so amazing and surprisingly light. It was the perfect pick me up after a late night exploring the strip. What was even better than the view and the food though, was the service. We had a waiter that joked with us each time he passed by and really made my mom and I feel special, he made the lunch a whole experience and a great memory to take with us back to Chicago. He is so funny, he should be performing in a Vegas show. Thank you, John  The one with a beard  Great picture by the way

LanedhJLCrVpymnOkR9fxA.text: Everything was amazing. The view, the service, and the food. AMAZING. I had the filet mignon with truffle and honest to god, it's the best thing I've ever eaten. The service was phenomenal, efficient and attentive.

iQvANe8o5AsegADGlVvQYQ.text: Amazing. Got off elevator and a table with a superb view of fountains, mountains. WOW. My seafood salad just right, French bread to die for Service impeccable. My companions restaurant week lunch super duper. Soup, halibut and a dessert . Generous offering for Restaurant week SUPERB. A must go to in Vegas.

xeGMi5WayPrJpH3n4HUo3w.text: A great experience here at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant- we went for our anniversary. You check-in down in the hotel casino and take the elevator way up. It opens to the kitchen, which was beautiful and looked clean and classy. Walk to the right and around the bar area to the hostess. We went to the Champagne Brunch on a Saturday morning, and it was not very busy at all. We were lucky to get a window view at these cute two person table. It was quite romantic, and the view was breathtaking. We enjoyed the Creme Brulee French Toast / Alsace Apple Strudel / Iron Steak topped with fried egg and Yukon Potatoes / and Cremant d'Alsace Brut Mimosas - blackberry, and passion fruit mimosas. It was amazing champagne at $20 a drink. Pretty fancy French experience and truly glad we went through with our reservation- It was easy to make and change our reservation on open table. I highly recommend trying Eiffel Tower- their other menus looks great and yummy. Service was great and very professional.

ldny2OPkm-FHuJvX9420Aw.text: This restaurant holds a very special place in my heart.  This is where the hubby proposed.  We love the location as we were able to watch and enjoy the fountains at Bellagio.  The food is delicious and the service fantastic. It is very busy so be sure to get a reservation in advance.

MBc90ZORUUraFJooYOQYYA.text: Love the ambiance, great service, satisfied with my order of: 1. Caviar 2. Steak Foie Gras 3. Souffle

mcmCp5E9mDUvQdKvRGWxfw.text: Me and my husband made a lunch reservation for our anniversary. They gave us the window seat with a very lovely view. The food was great. Server and bust boy were very nice as well but not over crowded that some time you feels like they're watching you eat. We would definitely comeback

5-bXW380GoWYGWbj3oUX3Q.text: The restaurant has great view and great service. The food was good but I would not say excellent. I did not like the appetizer we ordered (lobster bisque) also the side of olive oil mashed potato we ordered with my steak. Weird taste, don't know what they add there. For that reason I took one star out of 5. Desert was good but I would say the view and the service were the plus. I would recommend the restaurant for sure.

1dxsG2ANfGfPLTkHX14gbw.text: Excellent food, service, and view. Make resv ahead of time, and don't be stingy, it won't be cheap! Had the steak tartare, insane.  Caesar salad was delish! King filet mignon with a red sauce (forgot name) but it was to die.  Asparagus and mashed potatoes, mmmm so good. Didn't have room for dessert so ordered the chocolate souffle, had one bite, wasn't really my thing but I guess it was good! Hahaha  All together, a fabulous experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from table for 2.

fLML5As11wdlmaELVjusEQ.text: Got a reservation and by chance sat on the side so we can watch the. Bellagio fountain show... dinner wasn't cheap but everything was tasty... I shared a ribeye, dozen oysters, couple sides and a chocolate souffles... everything was good, drinks service& view. Don't be surprised if someone gets proposed to while having dinner.   It's a steakhouse... so if you frequent those establishments then you know what you are stepping into. I saw a lovely filet mignon served up to my neighbor.  Happy eating!

zQrHdOYwlcLoTesTj4Rmfw.text: Ive written 199 reviews and ive been waiting for my most recent trip to vegas because i wanted this place to be my 200th review. Here it goes..  After a long weekend i made a reservation at this beautiful place for a girls only brunch. Upon arrival into the Paris casino look for the elevator and host stand in the center... thats the only way up. Keep your eyes open because the ride up is super cool.. u can see the inside of the tower. The doors open to... the kitchen?? Yea, it was weird. There wasnt anyone to tell me where to go nor a sign. I took it upon myself to just walk around and i found the host stand. I was warmly greeted and sat at a booth facing the Bellagio fountains. TIP: its easy to get this AWESOME view during brunch, but special requests must be made and im guessing extreme "greasing" needs to happen to get it for dinner. Definitly call ahead to get the view.  My group of 3 ordered mimosas, they have several kinds, all made with real champagne, not that sparkling wine crap. I opted for Peach and my friends had blackberry and watermelon. All made with puree, not syrup. They are delicious and go down easy, but keep in mind they are $20 each. Definitly get one, or 2, but maybe not 3 cause of the price lol  The food.. o the delicious choices. We started with the french cheese platter (duh). It was exactly what you would expect.  It was delicious but i will say, a little small. The bread (of course) was fresh and delicious. I opted to try their french onion soup because its very different from others. They add cream and puree it all together. I could eat that stuff everyday-so flavorful and aromatic.  We literally couldnt decide on entrees. I had the steak and eggs, my girls had the smoked salmon waffle and the stuffed french toast. We all wanted to try the BLT tower. We were in a tower and figured we should get it, so in addition to our own meals, we got the tower for the table. Hey.. its vegas! I dont even feel like i need to tell you...YUM. Seriously.. this place is legit. My steak was cooked perfectly. Its placed ontop of over easy eggs and thats ontop of a potato mushroom hash. I was told the smoked salmon was the best she had ever had.. and the noises that were coming out of my friend while she ate the french toast were almost inappropriate. The tower was cool. In the end it was just a delicious blt with avocado, but it was delicious.  Even tho it was brunch we, of course, had to get dessert. We had the famous creme brulee,  molten chocolate lava cake, strawberry ice cream souflee and they also gave us free chocolate mousse.  It was crazy. You could literally just go there for dessert.    The service was 5 star. They even cleaned crumbs off the table without missing a beat. Our waiter was knowledgeable and very personable.  The food is amazeballs. The view is spectacular.  Why are you still reading this... get over there and experience it for yourself.  Ps.. brunch was about $300 with tip for 3 people. But ya know.. its vegas. $$$$$ totally worth it.

2doAti1bwAYwG5z-hp4B_A.text: Let's get one thing straight...this place is EXPENSIVE but if you are out and willing to splurge or impress a date this is your go to place.I have eaten at plenty of places here in Vegas but this one made an impression.Best steak I have been had!!They had me at the wine menu!So many choices and they were all good that I tried.The ambiance is the best form the moment you take the elevator up you feel like you are not on the busy strip.Very romantic and low life with beautiful music.Really hope I get to dine here again

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My view

tx5q7GHopXL1QHXsBWC3Qg.text: Superbe! Go for lunch or dinner and get a table for two by the windows.  Everything is delicious.

8QNilI1CIJZYKdqzmW64iw.text: This is my worst restaurant experience. Unbelievable. They canceled our reservation without notifying us!! Now we are starving and we are having a hard time finding a decent restarurant because most of them are fully booked or closed. I would give 0 stars if I could. Totally ruined our trip. Horrible horrible service!

Mc3fREvV-bXlCtZBOw_sog.text: We set our expectation and didn't want to buy into the hype since we're in Vegas and there's a great restaurant to choose from but this was convenient for us so we thought we would give it a try.   A+ - Foie and Truffle Filet - boy did I indulged, flavor explosion! It is absolutely everything I want in a perfect bite. The fatty foie add a great umph to the steak.  Highly recommended  A- : Warm lobster salad - hardly a salad, just lumps of warm quality lobster meat  B+: Duck foie gras torchon - I realize I am a fan of seared foie instead of cold but nonetheless, still a flavorful dish  B: Salmon - nicely crusted on the top, provided good texture  B+: Wellington - this is what they were known for which was pretty good.  I enjoyed the flakey crust and the sauce that went with it  A: Milk fed veal - I feel bad everytime I eat this but oh so soft and tender, another highly recommended dish  A- Souffle - very moist   The view was lovely, you can watch the water show across the street if you request for a window table.  As "corny" as Paris may sound in Vegas, I had a lovely time :)

lIA2eXMxRebd0aCbGH5KKg.text: Had a wonderful evening celebrating moms bday!! George was a awesome server, very attentive and kind! Portions a bit small but what do you expect, It's French! Scallop appetizer was ok, and we both ordered fish. Overall, the ambiance, location, and view of the Bellagio fountains are spectuclar, and the food is good. One great item that's not to miss is the banana souffle! Cooked to perfection, fluffy and to DIE FOR!

ZxaEkL8tL96mkok6TKm4_g.text: An absolutely beautiful dining experience looking out over Las Vegas Blvd and the Bellagio fountains. If you plan on eating dinner here, you most definitely need a reservation. The service here was impeccable. We were seated no more than five minutes after checking in downstairs at the entrance to the elevators. Our waiter was very friendly and incredibly attentive, making sure that absolutely everything was to our liking. I had the venison medallions when I visited, which were amazing. The meat was very tender and perfectly paired with vegetables, pumpkin gnocchi, braised cabbage, and huckleberry jus. This is definitely a pricier dining experience, but worth every penny.

UiRuiY3JlYIAo38qiecH3g.text: Went here for my mom's birthday and the view was spectacular as you may imagine.  We were able to see the Bellagio water show more than a few times.  The service was impeccable and the sommelier helped choose a Chateauneuf-du-pape which we enjoyed.  To the food... just... yum!  Started with the steak tartare which is right up there with some of the best I've had.  Also had the king crab salad which was flavored / spiced well that it didn't just seem like an ordinary salad (which it shouldn't be for that price).    I believe the table orders were the salmon, the filet and the new york steak.  Most were cooked as requested though the New York was a little less cooked than my friend requested.  I had the beef wellington and it was delish!  Be careful not to put the sauce on top otherwise it will get soggy.    Finished the night with a complimentary dessert for my mom (she's diabetic so the rest of us enjoyed it)... and with a picture with the Paris balloon in the background.  All in all... a great meal/experience!

zgTeCHEenhwnyzL10Tw-nw.text: This was my second visit to the Eiffel Tower and I have to say that they have not failed to disappoint.   After a quick phone call the host was able to get us in on rather short notice. We arrived and checked in, grabbed a seat at the bar and enjoyed a cocktail while we waited for our table to be ready, we only waited just long enough to finish one cocktail, the timing was perfect.  It was a Saturday night around 7 so the restaurant was swamped , but that didn't slow down our experience one bit. The server was prompt, very prompt, she grabbed our drink order and off she went. When she returned we placed our food order, all the time joking and having a great time with us. We were unwinding from the hellish week of SEMA/AAPEX. The apps arrived quickly and were all delicious, everything was perfect up to this point. The entrees arrived shortly after we finished our appetizers, the server had planned this perfectly . Out entrees were prepared perfectly and everyone was thrilled with the food.  The Eiffel Towel is a little bit ore expensive then the typical strip restaurant , but I can assure you that it is worth every penny. I cannot wait to return to Vegas to do it all over again.

PfBtS6zCJe5osD8NehTBOA.text: We had Saturday brunch here with family and friends. We didn't want to deal with buffet lines, so we opted for Eiffel Tower. Good decision as we enjoyed the great view and ambiance. Food was good and the presentation was simple. Dessert was good as it wasn't too sweet. Server was attentive and friendly. Overall, great brunch place. Will definitely return for dinner.

-mHXvSLDth4BqJyOchPuHQ.text: 4 stars for atmosphere, views and the venue. My meal left much to be desired! I had the chorizo benedict and it was lacking on many levels. The flavor just wasn't there and the chorizo was chopped, which is weird. The potatoes it was served with were just OK. The eggs were nicely cooked and the sauce was pretty good. I think the food should warrant 3 stars considering the reputation, and mine was only 2 stars.   Our party of 3 had different opinions of the food. My sister said her club sandwich (with avocado!) was the best ever. I tasted it and it was good. We were there for lunch and entrees are around $20. They also served an amuse bouche of mushroom soup that was excellent as well as french bread. After our meal, our server asked how the food was and I told him my thoughts on the benedict. He said he agreed that it's not the best but can't tell people that. Alrighty then. Our view of the fountains was awesome. The bar is pretty big and is at the center of the restaurant.  Maybe skip the food and enjoy a martini while the fountains do their thing in the background.

jHuLtfqL0yRVasX9B1UYrw.text: My wife and I made reservations before we even flew into town. We had been told by friends that we had to get a 430 reservation and watch the fountains with dinner. We were very impressed with the entire experience. The service was absolutely fantastic our server Michael was great! The steaks were some of the best we've ever had.  The view was astonishing as we were there at sunset it changed from day to night and the view only improved. Do not forget dessert it was the perfect end to a perfect dinner. I highly recommend stopping while you're in town it is worth every penny!

XVOQtgL5gxafj1bm64HS-A.text: WOW - Fun!  I have been to both Eiffel Towers "Paris and Las Vegas"  Love them both!  The Restaurant in the Eiffel Tower / Vegas is Awesome!  What a great view at night of the strip and Las Vegas Casinos!  Just for that it was incredible!  Because of the view it made you want to stay there all night!   The food was really delicious and has something for everybody and came to our table in a timely manner and the staff was very aware of what we needed and when and very professional.  I recommend it as a great place to take a loved one, date, or your future husband or wife! :)  You also might go to the lookout deck on the top, but do at night!!  Incredible!  A must!!!!  Wine and Dine!  All The way!

RbITUz_mrT37bZ-Wtb6JnA.text: This place is awesome. My husband and I had a reservation for 8pm. They were very fast to attend us and sat us down in no time. Michael, our waiter was very helpful to understand the menu and pick a wines. Also he was very nice to us and we really liked his attention. We are very happy with this place

z3cTDaT-KsMNqyL0-_BJ6g.text: It wouldn't make sense to leave 1 or 2 stars - unless you are one lucky winner of a catastrophic incident here - but you really gotta earn the 4 or the 5.   Other reviews touch on the feeling of being pressured / "up-sold," and those feelings are not without merit. From the minute you make reservations ("Would you like to upgrade with long-stem roses, yada and/or yada?!"), you're reminded that you're [by choice] entering an upscale "fine" restaurant within an already over-priced money-pit known as Las Vegas. But hey, you're here cause you want to be here, right? It's not like you're not going in with your eyes open - at least, hopefully...  You're paying for the location, the view [especially if you can land a spot at the window right in front of the Bellagio fountains], the novelty of being in a half-scale Eiffel Tower in the middle of Las Vegas Blvd, and oh yeah, food & drink that isn't terrible. Over-priced? Of course! But again, eyes open & you'll appreciate the experience (unless you can't swing minimum $100 / person, then hey no worries, just go to one of the 9 billion other [maybe even better!] places just a stone's throw away)... definitely a "one and done" though, too many other places tempting my curiosity for future trips.   PS - one guy who did NOT make us feel pushed around was a waiter named Will (you'll feel like you have about 10 waiters minimum, lol) - nice guy who navigated the balance of what I assume is a high-pressure "sales" job vs. enabling the customer to still feel 'in control' - kudos!

SQ9ds1-5dBjDr8jf_DekCw.text: What a great evening we had, from the service to the food everything was unforgettable! We had reservations but showed up almost half hour early and they were able to seat us right away, and we got table by the window overlooking Bellagio fountains. They provide great service, you are treated as a royalty. Not only at the table but in the rest room too! Nice lady was helping with getting the door for you as well as paper towels for your hands. Our server was attentive too. Food was amazing! We had non traditional caesar salad, lobster bisque, Rossini style filet mignon with foie gras and  potatoe Anna. Everything was delicious, just melting in the mouth!

SagTDpFG-lwWuIg5OLvuxA.text: So off we go to Vegas to celebrate our 15 year wedding anniversary, wanted to have a nice dinner and was debating on where to go..in a city of celebrity chefs and their restaurants all competing for your $$$$ it came down to ambience and location for me.  This place did not disappoint, from Food to the view and the exceptional service everything was 5 stars.. from the moment we checked in at the elevator to go up..everyone knew it was our Anniversary.  The food is excellent also and the service was impeccable, water never went empty, was always checked on at the time! Again this place was awesome and I will def be back next time we are in town.. kudos to Eiffel Tower for standing up to the big boys on the block and holding your own!  See the pics of the food! And BTW the souffle is a must order however it takes time to prepare so make sure u order it before your meal starts.  Thanks for making a great one for us!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JjrWDFcNztMz-zRT80C1bg.text: Eiffel Tower is, by far, one of the best fine dining experiences in the US. I have to frequent a lot of different five star restaurants for my job (I know, tough life) and had accumulated a ton of Lettuce Entertain You points that I wasn't aware I had, so I figured my girlfriends and I would blow it all on a great meal during our girls weekend.   As others have stated, you just can't beat the ambiance. It's a beautiful setup filled with tables that aren't too close to one another, and servers that know the menu like the back of their hand. The hostess was super lovely when I asked to push our reservation 30 minutes later. Knowing it's an extremely busy restaurant with a long line of walk-ins, I was grateful for accommodation. Our server was fantastic, quick with the wit and knowledgeable on all menu items.   We started off with the seafood tower, and followed up with a rack of lamb + scallops + a filet. We also had a side of the wild mushrooms and asparagus. And too many drinks, of course (it's Vegas!)  The lamb was, without any exaggeration, the best meat I've had in years. Cooked perfectly (pictures to follow) and presented beautifully. The seafood tower did not skimp on the seafood like some restaurants do - the crab legs and lobster portions were enormous and the clams, etc were also generous. The filet was delicious and the sides couldn't have been better.  That's a dining experience I won't soon forget. We usually try to mix it up and try different restaurants/hotels for our annual trip, but I don't think any of us are willing to go elsewhere after this past Saturday.

NnEjGlpVESO0UqjVmHq1IQ.text: We have been to Eiffel Tower at least three times during our long weekend visit to Vegas. Each visit was exceptional. We love to sit at the bar, where the bartenders are always on their A game. By far our favorite meal was the salmon paillard. The vast wine and cocktail list didn't disappoint either. If in Vegas, it's a must see. The view, service and food are worth the trip to Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Romain with anchovy oil.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best selection of hard to find gin or vodka.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The wine list is excellent!

Sb9xu-TdfxO4u0QU3jAVkg.text: I had a wonderful dinner here at Eiffel Tower!  The views are wonderful and if you request it or get lucky, they will seat you on the side where the window is facing Bellagio and you have the best front row seats of their water show. This restaurant is beautiful whether you come for lunch or dinner.  The views are just stunning. Highly recommended during your trip to Vegas!  They started us off with a drink menu and then with 4 different kinds of breads.   We had a scallop appetizer which was delicious - it was very well seasoned and cooked as well as presented.   For my main dish I had ordered the lamp chops and I would highly recommend anyone else who loves tender and flavorful meat to give it a try. It was definitely worth it.  After the dinner, if you ask for a picture, the staff definitely knows the perfect spot to place you for the perfect picture! They will have you stand just where you can see the words "Paris" on the airballon behind you. :)

SYV4c6lKqI8f0lhn_Q7F0g.text: I've had far better food for a better price. I saw the "sommelier" ( wine guy) laughing at me to the waitress about me ordering the cheapest bottle of wine they had (which was $69.. average was around $300)... our waitress was adequate but dry and appeared to be a snob and gave short matter of fact answers to any questions we had... this was our wedding anniversary and time away from our babies for the first time.. I wish I would have had the experience others had! My lamb chops were tasty but very small for price... beef Wellington was just okay. View was amazing but will not be back.

_tLgzdWNKV40a6lia0JeSw.text: Came for brunch on a Sunday. Made a reservation on opentable, then you need to follow a link and provide credit card information as they will charge you if you don't follow through with your reservation ( which I totally understand why!!) Everything was amazing -the view of the bellagio fountains was breathtaking. For food we had the French onion soup & shrimp cocktail for appetizers & for main courses the steak & eggs , & blt avacado on bacon bread sandwich. Food was great & service was fast. Definitely recommend ! Having brunch here is a must for your Vegas trip!

z-gFozPRoyNTaCZ-Celc6Q.text: Mediocre food and service, very overrated and not worth the price when there are so many other better restaurants in Vegas. The steaks (ordered medium rare) were all close to well done, they forgot a friend's drink order, and worst of all, a souffle was ordered early in the night (since they take half an hour to cook) which was completely forgotten, so no souffle was had. The food overall is not bad but it's no where near as good as it should be for the price. My guess is the other reviewers haven't tried the better places in Vegas.  As an added bonus several of the people in my group had horrible upset stomachs after the meal, lots of Imodium was required.

A3LekKBXLjfX-Gpa_vkWCQ.text: One of the most beautiful places in Las Vegas I have ever seen, the food was good.. some things that I didn't like however...my husband made our reservation 2 weeks in advance he told the host it was my birthday and she told him she would let the server know..well she didn't because I didn't get any surprise that I saw in the reviews, the host who was there last night was kind of rude and had an attitude when we arrived I thought it was just me but even while we were sitting down people were commenting on it, I can understand being stressed out but this is our experience and your job..our server was amazing and so patient he recommended we try the rack of lamb but mine had a lot of fat on it, overall okay experience but beautiful view!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oq9QdVKci3YJNonrZS3K2Q.text: The food- fabulous steak and fabulous potato gratin. The creamed spinach with mushrooms, wonderful. The ambience- what ambience? God forbid I would come here for a romantic dinner. Way too loud, way too busy, way too crazy. The view- great, although the Bellagio fountains were off due to wind. If that is a deal breaker, check the weather forecast. 20 mph winds or greater, no fountains. Service- great. Our guy was very attentive. Value- this is what makes this a 3 star. The prices are way high. I've had ribeye steaks before in tins of places all over the US. I've been to dives and been to 5 stars. $89 ala carte for this cut of beef was too much. The petite filet was $60. Dry aged for 18 days still does not make that price stick.  So in a nutshell. Good food. Too loud and too expensive

bpJ6YLXYUJyhpcoyDJk2OA.text: Absolutely loved their service, atmosphere, dinner and drinks! Their prices are definitely worth the visits! I do want to mention that the day we went to dinner, which was a Saturday night, their air conditioner was somewhat high, so I asked the young lady that was taking care of us if they could turn down the air a little bit, and she came with a black chal to help me stay warm! I absolutely did not expect that, but that was super sweet and thoughtful! That deserves a 10-star rating! Loved it! Highly recommend!

XyiThmLu9lcwdXMpSlFgLQ.text: The service at this restaurant was amazing, the food was fabulous! Be prepared to leave your wallet there because it is pricey but you have to expect it with the breathtaking view and the food cooked to perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very romantic atmosphere..make sure to get a table with a view!

4R_9ZLuRt3iZM9Wn54V2cw.text: View, service, food was all incredible for today's lunch. This is a very formal yet intimate setting to have your meals. I loved the presentation from start to end. It's not fast food and expect to have your taste buds teased!

bKT5brsmREPc_MdQAId5ow.text: I had the Ocean Seafood Salad for lunch.  Great flavor, large portions of crab and lobster meat, along with shrimp.  I ordered this salad based on other positive reviews and I was not disappointed.  2 of my colleagues ordered the Ocean Seafood Salad, as well, and all enjoyed it.  Waiter and support staff were prompt and professional.

OVwGff-UIXsjj9ksFoLvLA.text: The food was wonderful; however, the wait staff was exceptional. The waiter made a delicious wine suggestion, based on our wine preference and I'm oh so glad we listened to him. Each employee we spoke to was very knowledgeable about the menu and their wine selection, which is very impressive to me. Our dessert was ordered ahead of time because the waiter informed us that it takes 20-25 minutes to prepare. There was an issue in the kitchen, which caused our dessert to be late. They did not charge us for the dessert AND they brought an additional dessert since we were celebrating a birthday. They also came by with a sample serving tray of desserts, and allowed us to try any of the treats we wanted. From the beginning of our adventure, when the waiter placed our napkins in our laps, until the end, when the staff brought our check in a timely manner, we were in awe. The concern with detail was noticed and appreciated. This dining experience was one for the books. The creamed spinach was amazing, as well as the lobster. It's a hefty price tag, but you get what you pay for and it's worth every penny.
