hE7wQm6DSDJbxb27mXH8kg.text: Ugly/disappointing Dessert Hazelnut & Chocolate Mousse with chocolate sauce and a very melted quenelle of vanilla ice cream. The souffle was great.  We where not given a table because we only wanted to order dessert so they canceled our reservation when we got there and told us we had to sit at the bar. Upon entering the kitchen a chef was leaning on the Expo counter. Other guests received dessert petit fours we did not. And to top off the night they did not write happy anniversary on the plate (I was hoping they would when I told them it was our anniversary when making the reservation, and saw happy birthday on a plate that went by the bar ). Overall the impression I received from Eiffel Tower Restaurant was that they did not have to care because they have a nice view.  *also this is airing on the picky side but after each song that plays there is hand clapping that plays on the speakers (I found it super tacky but maybe some people like it)

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ugly/disappointing Dessert Hazelnut &amp; Chocolate Mousse with chocolate sauce and a very melted quenelle of vanilla ice cream.

YP1DrmG2xw9nXupOlqKEaA.text: The Good  My husband and I had dinner here two days ago to celebrate our first anniversary.  He called to reserve an 8:00 dinner at which he was specifically asked whether he was celebrating a particular occasion; during which he stated, "Our anniversary".  At check-in, we were greeted with, "Happy Anniversary".  We arrived and were seated at a window table for two with a spectacular view of the Strip and Bellagio Fountains' water show.  While watching the water show, I ordered a Cosmopolitan, Spring Water, and Non-Traditional Caesar Salad with Anchovies, Capers, and Garlic.  We were also given a choice of three breads: Sourdough, French Baguette, or Whole Wheat.  We both selected the Sourdough and French Baguette, and were pleased.    For the entrees, he ordered the Char-Broiled Filet Mignon (prepared Medium Rare), Rossini Style, with Foie Gras and Truffle Sauce - it was absolutely delicious.  I originally ordered the Beef Wellington, but we were pressed for time (for our 9:30 Zumanity show at New York-New York) after our waiter indicated it could take in excess of 45 minutes to cook, so I subsequently ordered the Roasted Rack of Lamb (prepared Medium) with Tomato Tart and Tarragon Jus - it too was delicious.    After dinner, I finished the Cosmopolitan - it was one of the best Cosmos I have ever experienced.  The Bad  Our waiter attempted up-sell at every moment.  While deciding on our dinner selections, we asked him about an appetizer, he suggested the highest priced appetizer.  When we asked him about soup or salad, he suggested one of the highest priced items, and when we inquired about the entrees, he, of course, suggested the highest priced entree.  As we were celebrating our anniversary, our waiter never once mentioned it.  We never received an "Anniversary" dessert or anything close to it.  Although we were slightly pressed for time, our waiter did not even suggest a to-go dessert.    The Ugly  We received absolutely nothing for deciding to celebrate our anniversary at Eiffel Tower Restaurant.  We would have gladly paid more than our $200 bill to have received much better service.

Eb8VBQMUVcqUKspMwnMwAQ.text: I really enjoy reading peoples complaints about excellent restaurants. Most of them are unfounded rants without any knowledge of the art of cuisine. I often wonder if they ever even been to the restaurant. as for me I have been to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant on a few occasions with my significant other. Each occasion costing upwards 400$ and worth every penny.   Aside from the romantic setting and views of this restaurant you have perhaps some of the best service every experienced in a restaurant setting. Yes, of course it's pricy but you get what you pay for. From the minute you enter you are catered to, from jacket hanging to chair setting you are the boss at this restaurant. The treatment continues throughout the evening such that if you are on a date or with the one you love you are fully credited for the great experience.   Now, for the food, each course is an experience. From salads that leave you begging for more to prime cuts of steak that melt in your mouth. Desserts are the cu de gra.  For a wonderful and satisfying experience try this restaurant you won't be disappointed.   Suggestions: make reservations in advance, request a window table center and bring a date you are planning a serious relationship with (this is not a McDonalds date environment).

qU9KTzTIqvNO5PIlgbPQhQ.text: I called to make a reservation for an anniversary dinner for me and my fiance, after giving all my info, I requested a table with a view.. The host told me "we can't reserve a table for you, you can wait upon check-in for a table to open"  Why are we making a reservation then? She said just to guarantee a random table. IIF YOU HAVE A SPECIAL EVENING, THIS PLACE IS NOT. There are a lot of other places that were happy to reserves their best table for a special occasion.

O8T8R4iAJX6GtbgNfWYJjw.text: Overall a fantastic experience. We came in for lunch as we previewed the menu and wanted something that was no longer available, but we still managed a great experience. We were greeted by a french hostess and were escorted up the elevator, and then seated with a breathtaking view of the Strip and Bellagio fountains. They were not running, but still a great view none the less. Our server was also french and beyond kind and helpful. Talk about a True "Paris" experience!  The amuse bouche was a simple cauliflower cold soup (?) and was amazing! The wine menu was impressive and boasted wonderful French wines, or French-inspired. Go figure, in a classy place like this! They nailed it on the head for what they are trying to sell.  We had the Composition of French Cheeses as our appetizer. My favorite was the bleu cheese drizzled with honey comb. YUM! And this appetizer was perfectly paired with our wine choice. The name of the wine is elusive to me now, but it was a great french wine that I would love to have again.  I had the Ocean Seafood Salad. WOW! Delicious! Everything I ever hoped and dreamed! Words cannot explain the orgasm that happened among my taste buds. An amazing mouth orgy of ecstasy. I have been dreaming about this dish ever since. All of these tasty chunks of seafood nestled among greens, served with lemon (which I loved and squeezed all over everything) and a French Cocktail Sauce which I drizzled on top and seriously order this you will not be disappointed...  My wonderful other half (whose idea it was to take me here in the first place, well played my dear) ordered the Aged Parmesan Crusted Chicken. It was delightfully sizzling upon presentation and a generous portion. Although it was not the most amazing chicken he has ever tasted, it was very good. I would call this a high class pounded and fried chicken, and I would have to say this would be good on a hunk of bread with some mayo and lettuce. Sorry, just not the best ever.  Our dessert was Creme Brulee. Sadly, I was disappointed in this dessert as it is usually one of my favorites. I liked the same dessert in the downstairs buffet better. I would not order this again but I would try another tasty treat. After dessert we were offered some caramel and fruit things which were delightful.  I would absolutely (and can't wait to) return again. I would like to try for dinner as well. The overall experience was pretty authentic and even though not all of the food was top notch, I think they deserve 5 stars.

4rppwJJ15o7LcjxEARRcfA.text: Enjoyed our food, flavorful. We had Creamed spinach & Mushrooms, Rack of Lamb, Muscovy Duck Breast. We tried all the sauces, Great for meat dipping.   Great staff. Highly attentive and Courteous.   Great View. (Tip: Do not forget to request/reserve your spot facing towards bellagio fountain. Fantastaic View.)

xdsI5d76HSqNvEZ6EDUmyQ.text: There really couldn't have been a better 'moment of truth' than when the elevator opened up to an immaculate kitchen with the brigade prepping, firing, and plating all the decedent entrees. This set the tone for the dining experience.  Unfortunately I wasn't here to have dinner. I had just met up with my former casino professor turned good friend, and we were thirsty.   We sat at the bar in a way where we could overlook the LV Boulevard and the Bellagio fountains. As many of the other reviews state, the view is exceptional. A perfect date spot with that special someone. However, we were here to get lit. He started with some gin martini, I went for the manhattan on the rocks. At $20 a pop it doesn't come cheap, but if you were to imagine the perfect manhattan, this would surely be it. After a couple drinks each we were feeling all warm and fuzzy.  We ordered the French cheese board and crab salad to hold us over. The cheeses were phenomenal! I don't recall exactly what cheeses they were, but they covered a broad spectrum of cheeses. From bold and pungent, to creamy and luscious. The bartender also supplied us with plenty of extra crostinis to accompany our cheeses. We also had the crab salad. The crab was so sweet and wrapped in thinly sliced cucumbers, and surrounded by a small bed of greens. Definitely not filling at all, but a nice treat.  Overall a good experience. Pricey, but worth it. Bon appetit!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab salad at the Eiffel Tower restaurant
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French cheeses

qaBJEFcQAMQT2Lw9eu-5-w.text: One of our favorite spots to splurge when in Vegas. The views are stunning and the service and top notch quality food really make you feel like something special. Highly recommend making reservations ahead of time!

cFZV4VHq-ymCmroIS4VCDg.text: We dined here on our wedding night. We had a lovely table by the window. It was absolutely stunning.  The food was amazing. I loved everything about it.  From the Shirley Temple I ordered to the dessert  we devoured we were in awe the whole time.   I kept saying i can't believe this is happening.  They go above and beyond.  The staff were amazing. So nice and professional. They made it seem like we were the only ones there. I will always remember this place.    Highly recommend.

iNWqaGbNr-g1WaAhky4JnQ.text: The food was awesome the wait staff was excellent. The atmosphere is so romantic. This is the perfect place to take your wife who I am sure deserves a nite out that is romantic and elegant.

Eed41tACEMdJ6uo3acGnCw.text: If you are looking for the best view in Vegas this might be the way to go, very pricey but we'll worth it in my opinion, service was good, I had a small issue but they took care of me right away, so I edited my review, they really made it up to my expectations. I'll be back for sure

uwx_KKH2l9PRjkj7ZM1aiw.text: While none of the appetizers interested us, the beef Wellington was very tasty.  Chocolate souffle to finish was amazing.  View can't be beat either.

2ehiJRU-gKXsTVthfyfz5g.text: A little kitchy, but a very fun experience and the food was quite good. I loved the attendant in the ladies bathroom - I just wish I had known about her so I could bring $ to tip her.   We did not have dessert because we were late for our show (not the restaurants fault, our fault), next time I will be ordering a souffle - they looked amazing!

QC6rE6KZKBwP6v0EE62xCA.text: I'm having Vegas withdrawals right now..   I had my birthday dinner here on Saturday and OMG the dessert gave the cherry on the top. My husband made reservations ahead of time. We wanted to sit by the window but we had to wait for a hour. It was ok because I was having a good conversation with my husband, sis in-law, and friend.   We sat next to the window and wow amazing view. We got the seafood platter for appetizer and it was so good. I was getting full, but I remembered I had to save room for dessert. I had the salmon for my main dish and it was good and cooked to perfection. I had the some sauteed mushrooms to go with it and delicious. My husband had the painkiller drink and it was good. Our server was amazing and recommended the right things for us. I'm craving for the nutella souffle right now!

nfmSbk1dWeW6XdGa4mepfQ.text: We went for lunch which was a VERY good value.  For $60 (no wine or cocktails), we were able to try this high-end restaurant for a very affordable price.  We walked right up without any reservation around noon on a Friday, and we were escorted to a seat right on the window to see the fountains of Bellagio. After ordering, we were treated to an amuse bouche of a chilled tomato and cucumber soup.  It was so light and refreshing.   We both started with the French Onion soup.  Now, I have had A LOT of French Onion soup in Paris (some good and some bad), and I make a mean version myself.  This was by far the most unique version I have ever had.  It was creamy.  There was no heavy cover of cheese, and there was not an actual onion in sight. BUT, amazingly, they captured the flavor of French Onion Soup.  It was accompanied by a parmesan crisp.  I really, really enjoyed it. I had an endive and goat cheese salad which was light and refreshing.  My husband ordered the French BLT tower, and it was more food than he could finish.  Also, very good.  We skipped dessert since we were headed to the MGM pool for the afternoon. The service as polite, but  little bumpy.  Our waiter tripped over a wine bucket that made a terrible clash, but all in all, it was a very good experience for a bargain price in Vegas.

S_r9mX7OLG-WD74Q9wqsdQ.text: All I can say is wow!  I had the Beef Wellington and I can honestly say it is the best meal I have ever had. I am not generally a big steak or pastry fan, however apparently putting those two things together creates absolute magic! The view of The Bellagio fountain was amazing as well. If I could I would give this place a 6th star. The added bonus was I won $600 on a slot machine just before the meal, so it was for all intents and purposes a free meal. Win win!

QphbKWWQ2IE65pqkC56DlA.text: The experience was great! From the time you get off the elevator and enter the restaurant. Hostess and waiter were wonderful. Very accommodating and entertaining . Food was great! we ordered the marinated shrimp with avocado appetizer, lamb chops and Rib eye Steak. No complaints what so ever. View is also amazing. If you go at night make reservations for window seating. We did not make reservations but they were still able to accommodate a view looking at the Bellagio water show. Loved everything about it! Also be prepared to spend money $$$, well worth it!!

dD5H-0ecKnEHF2yG5B0LAA.text: Gosh, I really wanted to love the food here!  My cousin & brother have eaten at Eiffel Tower for years and have always spoke highly of it.  My husband and I went this past week for my birthday dinner.  He had the NY Strip & I had the Filet.  I think he enjoyed his steak, but mine was just ok.  Maybe I expected too much?  I realize I am paying for ambiance, but, I could have sat at the bar and had souffle and been happy.  I will probably go back just to try dessert, since I passed on it this trip. The view is amazing, and part of the price.  It is very romantic.  In fact, a fella proposed to his girlfriend at the table next to us.   All in all, I've had better steaks in Vegas, but, if you are looking for the experience, it's worth it once.

AfWWK5ew48VVcewHW19gTw.text: Always good food prepared well great service and the view is amazing. Every time we eat dinner there, we feel like we have our own dedicated sommelier.

PegVgP-v7mZvgemJVcsLTA.text: Tried to go back for our 6 year anniversary with a party of 18 and its: $125 MINIMUM PER PERSON 8.1 tax (completely understandable) 20% service charge (what) $500 deposit!!!!!!! (-_-) Are you kidding me. I enjoyed the experience last time. Will never go back again.

js3FQf_4uxPw_7bR0dHjjA.text: Sis & I wanted to have a nice holiday-time weekend in Vegas - to see all the decorations & more importantly to see BARRY MANILOW  This was his show's closing weekend so dinner at Eiffel Tower was the perfect place to have a nosh.  Believe people when they say to dress up!  I'm SO GLAD I didn't wear my jeans - which we do ALL the time in SF.  But not to fret, I still felt their disapproval at my fleece pullover so snooty-rep intact!  Sis was also put in her place when she asked for a glass of Pinot & didn't specify Noir.  Gee, I'm sorry but here in Wine Country, Pinot *always* implies Noir  But fake, facetious "french" snootiness aside, we enjoyed our meal  Starters included the Blue Cheese Souffle & let me just say this place knows how to make one mean souffle!  Light as air & just a hint of blue cheese flavor (could have been a bit more pungent but was still a fan)  Entrees were the one & only veggie dish they offered - the veggie crepe.  Sis loved it but I was completely turned off by the abundance of lemon  What did absolutely rock my world however was this Mushroom Spaetzle we got as a sidedish.  I could have had about 2 of these as a main course & been totally satiated.  Earthy, mushroomy, & tender pasta-like spaetzle.....absolutely delish!  Desserts included the Banana Souffle for Sis & Pumpkin Souffle for me.  We each thought ours was the best of the 2 & again, we're greeted w/ the lightest, airiest, souffle w/ just a hint of banana or pumpkin  Was hoping they'd be paired w/ something other than Creme Anglaise - like maybe a caramel pairing for the banana & a chocolate for the pumpkin but the anglaise was still tasty & didn't take away too much from our devouring  People all around us were celebrating 1 thing or another - a couple on one side of us was celebrating a birthday & then this other couple was celebrating their very first Mommy-Son date night; and this other couple sitting right beside us got engaged right there while we were having dinner.  So much love & excitement!     And this is all while overlooking the Bellagio Fountains.....would totally come back for the ambiance & maybe dessert!  Overall, food - 3 Stars; staff - 2 Stars; atmosphere - 5 Stars.....averaging = 3 Stars

i8aQETzZI5yctRvakiItJw.text: For the price the fish was under cooked and i had the worst food poisoning the night after my wedding night- which is the WORST! For the price i am paying at a fancy french restaurant i would think that they would know how to cook seafood.

MnZNB6yT9lWFl1vCZE1LdQ.text: My husband and I really enjoyed my birthday dinner here. Wonderful cocktails, delicious food and great view. I enjoyed the crab avocado salad and beef Wellington while my husband loved the duck breast. We will definitely be back.

5LmfsBbBGkby3MnOoRw3TQ.text: Super pricey, but totally worth it if you're dining on the business card :). I took some customers out to this restaurant and everyone loved it!  It was also cool to go to the top of the tower after dinner, too bad a 1,000 dollar dinner tab didn't get us a free ride

xlw5eAfvWIHeoobKwHKu_w.text: Duck is not very tender. The desert and appetizers are really good.especially the desert, probably one of the best I hv ever had. I don't recommend the window table coz it's only half a table...

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

V4tQefmm3THh5h10YKTKZw.text: Typical tourist trap in Vegas but nonetheless decided to try it for a good viewing spot for the July 3rd fireworks show at Caesars. Too bad we were seated all the way on the other side of the restaurant with no view . Service was so-so, waiters felt a little rushed due to how busy it was that night. Ordered the crab and avocado appetizer to share and that was delish!!! Don't typically like crab dishes but it came recommended by our waitress and was pretty happy with the choice. Hubby got the "queen" filet with green peppercorn sauce and I got the beef Wellington. Not wowed by my dish although the serving size was huge, but did enjoy the bite of filet I stole from my hubby's plate. Lastly, in order to have the souffle for dessert, you must order 25-30 min in advance, so we basically were forced to look at the dessert menu as soon as we placed our order for our meal which was weird. We got the Nutella souffle which was only okay. All in all, I don't see myself returning here since there are a ton of better places to eat in Vegas...

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington and filet mignon
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab and avocado app

cuT1QW3F9ZIV-R2nzwKDLA.text: Las Vegas has amazing restaurants!I did the tasting here and it was horrible. I recommend spending your money elsewhere. This place is a tourist trap disguised as "fine dining"

1notA-5XIo_iaNF4PGHI5Q.text: WORST RESTAURANT EXPERIENCE I'VE EVER HAD. My boyfriend and I came to celebrate our anniversary. Just as we were finishing our bread at our beautiful window table, we see a cockroach on the window. We immediately flag down our waiter, who fumbles around to find something to kill it but the cockroach runs off. Our waiter then pats me on the back and says, "Don't worry. It won't kill you." Then the restaurant lost power while I was in the bathroom. So when I tried to wash my soapy hands, I couldn't because the faucet sensors weren't working. I asked the bar staff for water to rinse the soap off and after waiting for 15 mins, I just used the water we were drinking. We couldn't order soda or dessert because there was no power. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

2S7VNFHrCxjlhnEaEpIV8A.text: My lovely yelper and friend had their tenth anniversary some years ago and thought it would be nice the day before NYE to eat here before year ends.  She made reservation months in advance so dinner was set for four.  It was a busy night as we enter into what looked to be a bar/entrance to the restaurant.  There, we were acknowledged and were said to wait until our table was ready.  We sat near the bar and to our non expectation, nobody came to take our orders.  One of my dear friend had to hop onto the bar and asked to be served with cocktails.    I got the pink velvet.  That was awesomely refreshing alochol drink that hit just the right spot.  The other flavors were gin and tonic and martini by the guys.  Low and behold, we were finally seated a not so great table but nonetheless, overlooking a post wedding dinner and a family celebration. Oh well.  Our waiter for the night was nice and pleasant. Got our menu as well as our order of the the fine wine that we all love Cab.  Cost us $155.  It was exquisite and worth every penny.  My table had the usual, foie gras and meat was the order of the night.  I went for the braised shortribs.  Very tender and delish. The lamb and the muscovy duck were good I was told by my eating companions that complimented very well with our wine.    To end the night, we four shared two souffles--chocolate and pistacchio.  I preferred the chocolate.  Overall, a great night of food with wonderful friends.  A romantic night out with a great couple. Nice ambience. Tab was steep but well worth it. Hey, we are in Vegas so we should eat like one--at least once in a while.

yvVDLVS_8NQ42c5t8Eq6Ig.text: This is one of the most romantic resteraunts I have ever been to in Las Vegas. The staff will always be smiling and proper and greet you with elegance. The ambiance and lighting are extremely romantic specially when eating a dessert. Can't wait to come see you guys in a few weeks!

IEhNUD5a6B4iLgfsT4c4aQ.text: In a word, disappointed.  I had the New York strip steak and my wife had the fillet.  Both were bland and not all that tender.  We both agreed that we've had better steaks at Texas Roadhouse.    The side items, asparagus and potatoes au gratin,  were very good.  They, along with the great view, helped save the meal.  I know this restaurant isn't a steak house but preparing a good steak should be universal, especially at these prices.

plxEH4qqoWtVqIqa-3AOVA.text: Wow.... what a fabulous lunch we had at this amazing restaurant.  The food, service and amazing view were to die for.  I had the Eggs Benedict with chorizo and my friend had a unique salmon potato dish. The waiter was so nice to our son, he even wants to go back.  If you ever want to feel special and desire delicious food, the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is the place!!   A must see if you come to Vegas.

t_ihBvE94wR47YSVyhgH0w.text: A favorite place for us in Vegas.  Every dish is amazing from the escargot to the lobster.   The beet salad is a treat for the taste buds.  Wine list is a bit out of control with the excessive markup.  Service is impeccable from the time you enter to the bathroom attendant.  Two people $300 so don't go on a tight budget.

Mjj-Hs90TxBahUmALXySog.text: Amazing food and service, easily the best restaurant I've ever been to, came here on my 2 year anniversary, don't regret it at all.

_lkzMyY3tQuxKDPH2MFzeQ.text: From 1 being horrible and 5 being awesome:  Food - 4 Service - 4 Price - 1 Scenery/View - 5  I only gave it a 2 because it was outrageously over priced.  The quality of food was good, but not something I would write home about.  You're paying for the ambience and view here, not for the food.

x4OAnM09WeSm5TtIapknzQ.text: Great view, great food and great drinks in a nice atmosphere. We tried many places in LV and even Robuchon wasn't as nice as here. Again the atmosphere was nice but still relaxed and the food was a delish. Also in Las Vegas the view was as good as it gets. I can only highly recommend this place.

WrV-DR9B5XFVbqjW9oe3yg.text: Best steaks I've ever had. Funny that I thought appetizer was such a bomb and later realized that Entree was bombER. I went there for a lunch and price is very very reasonable compare to the food's quality and taste. I am coming back for sure when I visit Vegas.

ZmuuDC12ws7keWWvniaitw.text: Such a beautiful restaurant. Our server Anthony was wonderful. Great recommendations on the menu. Loved the file and of course the view was amazing. The wife really liked walking off of the elevator into the kitchen, seeing where the magic happens.

iPjfkvV-gac7qHVGLypNeQ.text: I brought my husband to Las Vegas for his birthday, and decided to splurge on a dinner with a beautiful view. We were not disappointed. The Bellagio fountains danced every 15 minutes directly in front of our table at the window. Tom, our server, was top notch. The food was exceptional. The wait staff was attentive without being intrusive. We would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary birthday dessert
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table

oEI44LGzGnMxloZyS5dHdQ.text: I actually had a fantastic experience at Eiffel tower restaurant for lunch. We came with no reservations and had to wait about 10 minutes, but where we were seated had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains.   Quick tip on drinks - the nonalcoholic drinks are yummy but have a tad too much syrup in them. Ask for club soda to be mixed in to make it less overpowering.   We started with the creamy French Onion soup - I've never had french onion soup in this form (creamy) before but it was really yummy.   Next  we ordered the ocean seafood salad (lobster, shrimp, crab) to share. It came pre-tossed with really delicious dressing. All the ingredients were super fresh and it was a pretty large serving (do share with someone if this is not your main course).   Finally we ordered the Petite New York Strip steak with cabernet butter - yum! I usually like my meat cooked medium, but this could have been a little rarer. The flavors were great and the cabernet butter went perfectly with the steak.   Service was impeccable and the servers were all speedy and very helpful. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VZZ3xhcpqZb_gv-YMmSmIw.text: I had such a great experience here. Definitely worth the money for the meals because the food was DELICIOUS!! If you're wanting to take your wife on a romantic fancy date I highly recommend this restaurant, and once you get there ask them for a window seating the view is amazing!

xOdODQ-5aHON5inEHh17qQ.text: Great fountain views. Large menu or tasting menu with pairings option. Authentic French fare with a modern twist using quality ingredients, perfectly executed and artfully presented. Don't drink the tap water, it hasn't been filtered.

DM1jHKPOA6d_d1Oub1-YHQ.text: This was my first time going to The Eiffel Tower Restuarant and I've got to admit I was very impressed. The amazing view over looking their impression of Paris and the rest of Vegas was mesmerizing. The Staff was very attentive and accommodating. The food was mouth watering from the appetizers to the entrees to the amazing souffle dessert that came in many delicious flavors. I will definitely be coming back here again and I highly recommend everyone to make a reservation and check it out!

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster appetizer

6B92BALpS0zHYFY-QOzorg.text: The service is phenomenal, the half avocado with crab is amazing, definitely recommend it. A good drink to order is called autumn in Paris but use kettle one instead of grey goose vodka

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U5Xue5QuySYyb4aw7uTF1w.text: Had dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in March 2015. Food was fantastic and the staff were very friendly. We had a later reservation and had incredible views of the Bellagio fountains - which ran every 15 or 20 minutes. Prices are pretty expensive but the food and ambiance are high quality and it makes for the perfect romantic date night while vacationing in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the Bellagio fountains from our dinner table.

5NP7j0p2buU0zV8LQZIYeA.text: The service is impeccable.  The view is bacially the best.  The tables are too tight together, I felt like I was sitting at same table as people beside us, uncomfortable.

c-Bm39hApm3NpEmUZ3Nn9Q.text: Found by being escorted up one floor by elevator. The elevator door opens to a view of the busy kitchen. Interesting to see. Seemed clean and bright and well managed.   Fabulous views of the Bellagio fountain show if you dine after 3pm. Very romantic setting. Attentive and polite service.   I had a garden salad and the creamed French onion soup. The salad was beautifully presented in a cucumber wrap. Unfortunately it was drowned in olive oil and has no flavor. I didn't taste any but oil. The creamed French onion soup had potential but was over powered by salt. The cheesy crouton was salty enough for a less salt ladened soup. My boyfriend had the veggie crepe which was ok. Nothing creative tastebud-wise. The prices are high as is customary along the LV strip. Overall a three star place.

F8KK_4E05dAXLkfshIAE3g.text: If you get tired of enjoying the best of America walking around in Tapout shirts reeking of fireball then you just as well go to a french restaurant.  The view of the fountains is beautiful.  It never ever gets old. The food wasn't memorable in any way. Neither good nor bad and the view is worth the price of the food. It's not as cheesy as you would think.   *They will always be freedom fries to me!

UiQU20zu3Vw0PgR3KDCC-Q.text: Went here last August for my birthday. The view and service were 5 star all the way! The food was good, but not excellent but I had already known that going in.. We had the souffles and they were so good. Drinks were great too a great time!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KeNDK2aiP1rGK5grrSwRQA.text: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant, it was a thing of beauty when it was in it's prime. I believed it was a world-class restaurant; what emerged later into the night was by far the worst experience I ever had at a restaurant!  I've been coming here since 2007 and I've never had an issue until my recent venture. The scenery was almost worth the trip a few flights above the main strip. On the elevator ride, a person could easily experience vertigo if he or she intended to.  The reconfirmation phone call seemed like there was an issue with my reservation; when I called, the women that answered seemed immensely rude! WTH, why treat a customer like that? Our server was fairly courteous and our drinks were adequate. However, he seemed like he was rushing us since we did not order dessert...DESSERT!!! I also got sick after eating here; a first in Vegas for me!   Also, I don't want to get into the explicit details of my abysmal evening. However, I'm hoping the owner will contact me soon.   I don't believe I'll be returning and I can't recommend anyone venturing this place anymore. If you want to pay a lot of money for terrible food and service, then come here...

xqEa9Oa7GG9ZPW5dJ9ZQVQ.text: Came here for dinner with my wife for our first anniversary. I ordered the char-broiled Filet Mignon, Rossini Style. Regrettably I ordered it medium (old precaution from other restaurants), but it was still excellent. It was very tender and tasted excellent. My wife was also very pleased with what she had ordered.  Overall it was a very good meal and a wonderful romantic atmosphere.

Ewl4zS9D4wB3y9vK0kCFRQ.text: My husband and I just had dinner there on our honeymoon, and it was by far the best meal we had and we ate well.  The service is impeccable and the food even more exceptional.  We sat in a table overlooking the Bellagio Fountains and it was simply perfect and very romantic.  I can't wait to visit again!

ek8tvGBNUN5iqaZhkuePew.text: ery pricey but also very tasty.  This is a top notch French restaurant on the strip, not on the same level as Robuchon, but the level below.  I tried the tasting menu which is a 7 course marathon.  The courses began with some potato leak soup to cleanse the pallet and assortment of bread,  The courses consisted of rabbit, caviar and crab for course 1.  Next was the foie gras, followed by lobster, fish, venison, cheese, and souffle.  Not much hearty meat here as the dishes were specialized and curated for the size and menu.  The highlights were the foie gras which melted in the mouth and the fish which was as good as it gets.  Each sauce was very unique and added a flavor that really complimented each protein.  Many of the sauces were of Asian variety, which was a very unique French offering.  The souffle was superb as well and is not to miss.  Couple the meal with great wine and you got a winner.  To get a window seat you need to make a reservation so plan ahead.  Tables are only for 2 people near the window as an fyi.  Great meal, great atmosphere, great choice.

CY563Ik6T7z-TKTzDCcTyQ.text: My husband and I went there on July 4th, 2017.. We visit Vegas yearly but this was our first time at this restaurant.. We had made reservations months in advance so we could have a window seat to watch the Bellagio fountains.. We arrive early and they were able to seat us.  We had the perfect spot for watching the fountains..The service was excellent.. I ordered the beef Wellington, and my husband ordered the lamp chops.  We shared the potatoes au gratin.. Our food was beyond exceptional.. We both totally enjoyed our meal and the view..  This is bookmarked for a return visit in Nov..

__BqJyQ3Vu2JXK6Bx7wvpw.text: WOW! I recently went to Paris and going to this restaurant reminded me of the experience I had in France. The food is delicious, the service is excellent, and the view is spectacular! I sat at a window table overlooking the Bellagio fountains and the rest of the strip and it was absolutely gorgeous. The service could not be beat. The food was also excellent. I ordered the Chicken with aged Parmesan and it was phenomenal. The sides it came with were cooked in a traditional French style which I loved! The environment is very relaxed and tranquil which is a nice change from the hustle and bustle of the strip. This is an excellent place if you're looking for a fancy meal or a special event. The staff is very welcoming and attentive and make you feel like they're catering to you. You definitely get more than your money's worth.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SrDLjDT5toy69RQgxOSCow.text: I received a Lettuce Entertain You gift card and had been planning to use it here and I was surprised by how many people tried to talk me out of it and into dining at Mon Ami Gabi.  I stuck to my plan because a souffle from the Eiffel Tower Restaurant was on my bucket list and I had been waiting a LONG time to try this food!  We had a 7:30 reservation and arrived a little early.  They seated us at 7:30 and as we walked across the restaurant I was a little worried that we were going to the back, but no, we were seated in a great window table for two with a view of the Bellagio Fountains.  The view was awesome.  Good thing because we were there for some time!  This is somewhere you come for a long luxurious meal, if you are in a hurry, you might consider McDonalds.  Our server and busser were friendly and professional, with the busser a little more attentive than the server.  Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and helped me make my decisions.  I was torn between the baked herb crepes, the moroccan chicken and the arctic char and our server suggested the arctic char very highly.  I'm not a huge fan of cooked fish, but I decided to step outside of my comfort zone and I'm glad I did!  My arctic char was cooked rare, which I liked and was served ona bed of roasted beets and some pistachio crumbs.  The only thing that would have made it more delicious would have been if the pistachios were a little heavier.  I barely tasted them.  My husband had the roasted chicken with Moroccan spices and apricots with quinoa pilaf and I tasted that, too and it was DELICIOUS.  I would totally order that - the flavors are fresh and bursting with tangy-ness.    We were happy with the drink selections as they serve Stone beers and they had my favorite champagne, Nicolas Feuillatte Brut.  You can select what type of bread you want from a tray with a small selection of different types of breads carried by the busser.  I had a baguette and then another piece of softer white bread, and he brought big pats of butter.  For dessert, I finally got to have my Chef Joho souffle, but I wasn't prepared for so many choices!  I was tempted to go with pistachio, but I ended up selecting Grand Marnier for my souffle flavor and it was delicious.  The souffle itself was soft and pillowy and the sauce made it sweet and custardy on the inside.  It was heaven and even though I've checked this off my to do list, I have to go back for more.  It's that good.  I am now accepting gift cards if you would like to help a poor girl return to a fancy restaurant.  We actually did pretty good and our meal was only $130 + tip.  I could see how you could spend much, much more, but we left satisfied and happy.

gXcbH_6UCxC-bgOD65AmEw.text: The view was stunning from our window seat and the Bellagio fountains were stunning, but that was the highlight of the night, not the food. The main of filet mignon with foie gras was average. The steak was cooked perfectly but it was full of sinew and had no marbalisation. The steak I had at Wolfgang for $48 apposed to $79 here was far better. They did redeem themselves with solid desserts. I really felt the prices were really outrageous and did not justify the quality. Food 6/10 service 8/10 decor 7.5/10

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Venison $48+

JwH6HKSM4rUgjzE9MsRnBg.text: I was in Paris recently, and can surely say that I'm in love with that city. CITY OF LOVE..... So I decided to refresh my feelings and came to Eiffel Tower Restaurant for dinner.The atmosphere is very cozy and inviting.The view from the restaurant is outstanding. I could see the fountains of the Bellagio from my window. The sommelier gave me a good advice and I enjoyed excellent wine. The food was delicious. It was beautifully plated and served. Everything is expensive, but very much worth the price. The time spent here is priceless.  If you want to have a dinner to remember and enjoy your eating, this is the right place to go. UNFORGETTABLE!!!!!!

UQfLbX5ehHWbQQlJPSARnA.text: Great experience! Clean and open kitchen with fantastic chefs, excellent wait staff, unique and romantic (and I'm not one to use that word) atmosphere.   I'm a vegetarian and the options were limited, however what I did have was excellent! Mushroom quesadilla was so so good and filling!  My husband had a filet and said it was excellent! Cooked and seasoned perfectly.  I'll post a pic of the seating, we sat window side facing the Bellagio and it was so neat to see the fountains at night, from this perspective. They fountains go ever 20 minutes I believe and at one point we called our children who were placed on no volume and whispered to them what they were about to see. (Didn't want to disrupt anyone's dining experience) Our sons thought it was pretty cool!  The wait staff really takes part in making sure you have an excellent dining experience. It's a great place, great food and I almost didn't go because I thought the restaurant was in the very very top of the tower, it's not! So don't be afraid to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seated at our table. Half circle tables facing the window so you can sit side by side. Great seating for large groups too.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Chefs and spotless kitchen!

gYw5XP3PK5Uqt0wsAwWf2g.text: Most amazing night we've ever had! We came here for our anniversary/ his 21st birthday and it was spectacular!! The food was fantastic he was practically drooling over his plate. The view was unbelievable! Since he told them it was our anniversary, they set out a dozen beautiful red roses out on the table  everyone was so nice and helpful, everywhere you turned someone was there to assist you with anything your heart desires  truly amazing! I even got to bring the roses home with me to remember the amazing night! The hostess also came up and took a picture of us to remember the night

3ZAVPerAERvLFQWwr8rhCA.text: I woud have given 5 Star except for the Check in lady who was not pleasant and friendly. Perhaps she was having a bad day. At first she couldn't find my reservation as I gave her my last name (aren't you supposed to?) Showed her my reservation confirmation via email andshe replied "well, you should have give me your first name, it's under your first name." Obnoxious and cold. Lol!! She shoudn't be at the front counter checking people in. Anyway, got us a table overlooking the fountain at the Bellagio and that was pretty awesome. Food was good too.

iN0CNKJo30mjzBpFfKTwIA.text: The view and the service at this place were top notch, but it ends there....at the end of the day, I go to restaurants to eat. Maybe I'm spoiled by real steakhouse restaurants, but any place charging $64 for a single serve steak should know how to cook it. The first one came back medium well when ordered rare. The waiter tried to convince me the sunlight was somehow giving me vision problems. They promptly did get me another attempt. This time ice cold seared for maybe 10 seconds. They tried one more time and got the temp just about right, but it was still a pretty poor cut for a New York strip.  Mashed potatoes never tasted like bananas last I checked, but the other mushroom side we got was solid. So, go there for the mushrooms and the view and you'll love it.

d_0eeVo2OfJ5AuuzXFNzxA.text: What I loved most about this place is the table we were seated at. It was the corner table with a beautiful view of the strip and we were entertained by the Bellagio's water show while lunching.   I ordered something that was intriguing at the time but don't remember loving it as much. I ate it, but for me, it was the African spices that they put on the meat that I didn't like so much.   I was more in love with being at the top of the world than the food I ordered. What was more sweet was that we were having a kid-free weekend in Vegas, just my husband and I, rekindling like we were dating all over again. Sigh...

c9d_d6idpXgv9XVlrcG_JQ.text: Wonderful experience. Great staff.  Yummy food.  Amazing view.  Romantic.  Highly recommend this restaurant.

9seOhal5B4ZDp87yoWrOKA.text: We had steaks, halibut and salmon. Everything was very delicious. View was awesome. Service was great. Price wasn't  that bad either. Over all it was an experience to remember.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the restaurant.

R6Hs5IoKRMio4itDHr11EQ.text: Out of all the Meals that I had here in Vegas this was my Favorite, it was my first time eating in a French Restaurant. We were gonna dine at one of the most fanciest Places in all of Las Vegas, It was me, My dad, Mike and his wife Martha, Joe and his wife Deb (Joe treated everyone to dinner) and Paul and his wife Linda (a table of 8). Located on the 11th Floor of the Paris, we took the Elevator up and when we walked in we saw the Kitchen Staff hard at work preparing Dinner then we saw this big Extraordinary, Elegant Room and you get a nice view overlooking the Bellagio Fountains outside.  We sat down and while making our decisions for Appetizers were treated to a lovely Amuse-Bouche (French for Amusing the Mouth, to wake up your Palate, with a bite-sized appetizer) It was a shot glass filled with Celery Root Mousseline (Mousseline is a creamy soup-like sauce when you fold Whipped cream into Hollandaise) It was topped with some chopped Celery for some Texture (A nice way to start the meal and to wake up the Palate). For my Appetizer I got the New York State Foie Gras which was sitting on a Crispy Alsace Spice Cake with Quince Compote and Petite Mache (Foie Gras, which is what I call meaty butter, melts in your mouth, Quince a tart Fruit, similar to a pear in Appearance but has the Similar taste and texture to an Apple, Spice Cake was a nice crunchy little wafer spiced with cinnamon and Mache a leafy green that has a nutty flavor, it was Awesome).   My Dad got the Lobster Bisque with Lobster Flan, Celery and a Brioche Crouton (Rich, Smooth Creamy Soup with a Flan in the center made from Lobster Stock, you get some crunch from the Celery, and then you take a bite of that Crispy Brioche Crouton, its Spectacular). Everyone else at the Shared 2 Different Salads, The 1st one was a Tuscan Kale Salad, Door County Dried Cherries, Cherry Tomatoes, Quinoa Croutons, Toasted Pecans and finished with a Balsamic Vinaigrette (So much going on in that Salad, Crisp, Earthy Kale, Sweetness from the Cherries, Tartness from the Cherry Tomatoes, you get Crunch from both the Croutons and Pecans and you get Acidity from the Vinaigrette). The 2nd one was a Non-Traditional Caesar Salad with a Dressing made from Anchovies, Capers and Garlic (I honestly don't know what was Non-Traditional about that Salad and I thought the dressing was a tad bit too Salty for my Taste).  For our Drinks, while everyone else was mostly having Red Wine or Chardonnay, Me and Martha partook in one of their Signature Cocktails: The Eiffel Affair (Consisting of Blueberry Vodka, Creme de Cassis, Cointreau, Rose Nectar, some Champagne for that Fizzy and Bubbly Effect and topped off with some Fresh Berries).  For our Entrees: I had The Rabbit with Braised Carrots Confit and Mustard Jus (My first time eating Rabbit, so moist and tender like Chicken, Bite from the Carrots and Sweetness from the Mustard Jus, They use Dijon Mustard). My Dad and Paul had the Pan Seared Pork Chop with Spiced Braised Apples and with a Calvados Sauce (Juicy Pork, the Apples go so well with Pork and the Calvados Sauce was sweet Tasting, Calvados is an Apple Brandy), Mike got the Roasted Rack of Lamb with Tomato Tart and Tarragon Jus (The Bones were Beautifully Frenched ), Martha got the Red Snapper with Razor Clams, Fingerling Potatoes, Tomato Confit and finished with a Shellfish Bouillon (The Fish had a nice Crispy Skin), Deb and Linda had the Roasted Chicken with Apricot, Quinoa Pilaf and Moroccan Spices (I love Roasted Chicken, so flavorful). Joe got the Char Broiled Filet Mignon with a Truffle Sauce (his was the most Expensive).  Then we Ordered Dessert: I got the White Chocolate Banana Elysee (It was named after a Building in France, It was sliced Bananas and White Chocolate Disks stacked on top of each Other surrounded by a Moat of a Chocolate/Vanilla Sauce Mixture and at the top there be a little ball made of Caramelized Sugar, Normally I don't eat bananas but this was so damn Good, it was the most stunning Dessert I've ever eaten, it looked like a spaceship and boy did I take it to my Leader, My Stomach), Mike and Martha got the Chocolate Hazelnut a la Parisienne with Vanilla Ice Cream (It resembled a Bear Claw, Mike and Martha seemed to enjoy, but I thought it was bitter and after 2 Bites I couldn't take anymore), Joe and Deb got the Raspberry Napoleon with a Vanilla Blanc Manger and Red Fruit Sorbet (Stacked Beautifully) and Paul and Linda got the Classic Creme Brulee (A bit of a Cliche).   Everything was Amazing, but I had to delete the Pictures that I took here due to the Flash on my Camera not working so after calling the Restaurant a couple times (10) Linda (one of the Hostesses) and Sharon (one of the General Managers) were kind enough to help me out and to email me the Pictures. Also more thing my dad says you should adjust the lighting cuz it was very dim to him. I really had a nice time here, I'll be sure to come here again the next time I'm in Vegas !!!

Fj0y8atZCet74XV7jSX46Q.text: The dinner seating and view was fabulous. However, I think the menu is a little pricey.  * Sauteed Loup de Mer, Barigoule, Braised Artichoke, Basil Pistou $54 (4 of 5) Tasty sea bass without bones. This was a tasty piece of white fish and I really enjoyed the braised artichoke.   * Sauteed New York State Foie Gras, Slow Braised Pineapple, Alsace Spice Cake $28 (3.5 of 5) I really enjoyed the seared foie gras and braised pineapple, but I didn't think the spice cake complimenting the dish. I didn't think the texture of flavor complimented the dish.   Overall, This place is beautiful and spectacular views, but to be price conscience, I will just go back for drinks and dessert.

kzR6z1Gc-tb_YNlowDb0Og.text: Delicious food, excellent service, beautiful view = unforgettable Christmas dinner. When I made reservation, I asked a table by the window. At that time, the restaurant said they were not sure if I could get a table by the window, but they would try. Two hours after, they texted me that I would have a table by the window. 30 minutes before my reservation, they texted me to remind me the reservation. I like text messages from the restaurant.

Bl_drFUG6AgK9-KlndkV7w.text: I wish every restaurant in Miami was as good as this one! You have to go in through the casino of the hotel and you are led up to the restaurant through an elevator where you are greeted and check in. I made a reservation and requested a fountain view table for our anniversary dinner.   As we waited to be seated were had some drinks by the car which is rather small, but drinks are pretty good. Finally we sat down to our fountain view table. Best view in town!!!! The fountains play every 15 minutes at night time, it's the most beautiful thing ever! We ordered the filet mignon and it's the most delicious filet I've ever had! Everytime I order it here even in the best restaurant in Miami, it's doesn't come even CLOSE to the filet in this restaurant. Cooked to perfection!   The service was impeccable, our waitress was excellent! This restaurant is very "high end" so you get the service you're paying for! I plan to go back to Vegas at the end of the year and this will definitely be one of my stops for dinner!!!

ptYRRLXHDzGJNkmpFkakhg.text: For an expensive restaurant like This one , I'd expect more welcoming hostess, and staff.  We were greeted and taken to this 3 top table , which was a booth. We had requested a window table , when we made the reservation, but when I asked her to change our table to another one that was available , and it was also a 3 top, but by the window like we had requested , the hostess told us in a very mean attitude that we can't have it, and that, that table is promised to someone else through reservation. WE HAD ALSO ASKED FOR A WINDOW TABLE ON OUR RESERVATION!!! HELLO?!! Anyways, the view that we weren't able to enjoy as much was the only good thing about this restaurant. We got a really awful server, who was pushing us to order entrees per person. We ordered bunch of appetizers, and salads , and 1 entree to share. Since we are all tiny girls , we don't eat much, and we like to share everything. The server told us that it was on their menu , that we have to order an entree each. Which was a LIE!! There was no such thing on the menu! We checked afterwards! Then he was like fine I'll make an exception for you!  --- the lamb rack that we ordered was good.  The rest of the food was really mediocre. King crab appetizer wasn't good at all. We all hated it.  Salads were ok! Nothing special.  We ordered desserts with tea, and asked the server to bring them all together.  Our desserts arrived and 15 min later we got our teas! Like why do I even need tea after I'm done with my dessert ?!! Anyways , our server was really slow, and didn't care about anything but his pocket!  We spent over $300 for this bullshit!!!  He was gonna get enough tip off of us anyways, why push to get more stuff and leave a bad taste in mouthes! We were ordering so many drinks Already , food , dessert , and teas anyways! What a greedy server! The manager should really be careful who he is hiring! Because we are not coming back after this awful experience with the server and MEAN HOSTESS!

yhZjKS0ZpyycH8oDk2uD2A.text: Went here for a Bachlorette party dinner before a show. The atmosphere and view was nice, the food and service was something else. We were a party of 6 and our food took an hour to arrive. In the interim we just sat and waited...the waiter did not check in and we had to ask for our water to be refilled. The food was really overpriced. I don't mind paying for great food but $60 for bland Muscovy duck and $70 for really undercooked lamb was just disappointing.  We all thought it's typical Vegas prices but we went to the Foundation Room for dinner the next night and it was a complete pleasure.

LeRDoy15EZxFT7S_p76hAw.text: We had reservations here our first night in Vegas and it was great! The food (dessert too) was amazing! Our waiter was wonderful and we loved his French accent. The view from the restaurant was awesome. (Our reservation was in the evening so the city was lit up.. it was beautiful!)

-LdTors3XIiSSksjFp4pNw.text: Celebrated our 3yr Anniversary here on Halloween. The restaurant is beautiful. There's so much to offer.   Our server on the other hand, not so much. He was impatient & pushy. (Our servers name was Ron) He asked us if we wanted drinks & we asked to see the specialty drink menu. We asked for a few minutes to look at the menu & he came back to our table every 30 seconds to see if we had made any decisions. My husband and I both ordered cocktails without having a chance to look anything over. When they arrived, they were nothing either of us cared for. At $19 a drink, it's unfortunate we didn't get to enjoy them.   Any time we tired to take a video or picture of the view or Bellagio Fountains Show our server would interrupt. We asked to be seated at the window so we could enjoy the view & enjoy time together.   Ordering dinner we were treated with the similar impatience as the drink order. He gave us a lot of information and the dinner specials & no time to process the large menu. He also gave us the desert menu at the same time & said souffles need to be ordered with dinner. So we had two menus we needed to process, and again he came back every 30 seconds checking for orders. It was overwhelming.   The food was wonderful. I actually feel terrible giving the review two stars because the food was so great. I ordered the Sea Bass & my husband ordered the 22oz bone in Ribeye-which came with a huge bone on top with bone marrow. It was incredible & if you're a steak lover, we definitely recommend it.   Over all, we loved this place.  I wish our server was nicer, and more patient for new comers. We could have left with a much better experience.

9H4YyPT5lc2DYy0_19Dg8A.text: Don't come here with your family. No strollers allowed. More importantly, there is nowhere you can wait with your family. Children aren't allowed to wait the casino (even though the tickets and entrance are inside the casino). There is no seating at all while you wait. And the place is filled with smoke. I waited while my wife and older kids went up. I tried to wait for them with my baby and toddler in a stroller, and security literally kicked me out of the building.

_BDDOlThNlS23Q-eKOEBXw.text: We had lunch at this place. We ordered two types of chicken. Both were amazing. The drinks were excellent. The service was great and the view to the Bellagio water fountains was incredible.

GVjYgZZoy2cofboak67M5g.text: Although there was initially a mix up about our confirmed request for a window seat, Lyle and the two women at the front desk tried their hardest to move us to a better table, and we ended up in a great location. It was my daughter's birthday and our waiter and other staff were incredibly professional, courteous, and knowledgeable about the menu items. The food was great! Lyle came to greet us at the end of our meal and was the most welcoming and friendly manager we have met in a long time. They made our bday girl feel special and we will be sure to return again.

Our server, and her assistant were fast, nice, and kept are area very clean. My boyfriend ordered the bone-in tenderloin, which he loved! And, I ordered the queen filet mignon. zfqLoRQKSpemtgnrpEOyHQ.text: Located in the Paris hotel, it could be a bit challenging to find the restaurant as you'd have to find the right elevator to go up. But once you're there, you'd be amazed by the view! We had late lunch here and it wasn't crowded at all. Luckily, we had the window seat facing the Bellagio and were able to appreciate the fountain show of Bellagio every 30 mins. The food is also very well cooked and fresh - I opted the tasting menu that comes with appetizer (warm shrimp, well seasoned and crispy!), entree (flat iron steak, perfectly cooked, super juicy and tender), and a dessert( strawberry frozen souffle, very interesting texture, tasted almost like ice cream at first). Wine pairing for the meal complements the dishes very well! I also had a bite of my husband's lobster Benedict - good portion of lobster! In summary, a great place to have lunch or dinner with the view! The staff is also warm and attentive to our needs.

zuCwnMEuQFX_kRrZi61n0g.text: Everything you've heard is True. The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is seriously swanky. Looking for a romantic and upscale spot for our first wedding anniversary dinner, we made a same day reservation online (presumptuous, I know...but it was a Tuesday). We politely requested a window table overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Fingers crossed!  We arrived at 8:00 for our reservation and were promptly taken up the elevator and seated at....ta da! a window table overlooking the fountains! Score!  Guys-the service is the real star here. I swear we felt like we were the only table our server was waiting on. He was constantly there to fill our drinks, answer our questions, take our picture (cut me some slack-it was our anniversary!). It was like every time we turned around he was there. And not in an annoying way-just helpful.  The food was great. Not spectacular, but really good. We shared a "non-traditional" Caesar salad and it didn't disappoint. The bread and butter (oh my freaking hell that butter was heavenly) were so delicious that it was hard not to have too much and thereby ruin our entrees. For the main course I chose the beef Wellington and my sweetheart went with the chicken supreme. As much as I hate to say it (and it hurt my bank account as well), I'm quite certain that I make a better beef Wellington at home. The beef, while perfectly cooked (medium rare, is there any other way to cook beef?) and incredibly tender, was kind of tasteless. The snap pea accompaniment, however, was delectable. My husband enjoyed his chicken-it was seasoned wonderfully and although it seemed like a small portion, it filled him up well. We chose the potato gratin and creamed spinach for our shared side dishes. The potatoes were wonderful-cheesy and creamy and full of flavor. The creamed spinach was way off. It was unnecessarily greasy and lacked the creamy texture we were hoping for.  Pass on that for sure.  We splurged and ordered the Nutella banana souffle. It was delightful. Light yet rich and scrumptious. It's not to be missed. The restaurant was gracious enough to also provide us a complimentary dessert with a sweet Happy Anniversary message written on the plate in chocolate. It was thoughtful and appreciated.  The Eiffel Tower Restaurant might just be one of those once in a lifetime things. It's expensive. Like super pricey. And I get it-the service is impeccable. The food isn't the best I've ever had but it was certainly not something I'd turn my nose up at! The views are amazing-even if you're not fortunate enough to get a window seat, the entire place has floor to ceiling windows so you'll get a good view almost anywhere.  Go for a special occasion-you won't regret it. Just bring lots of money and a hearty appetite!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One year anniversary dinner. I love this guy!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our &#34;Happy Anniversary&#34; complimentary dessert. Very classy, Eiffel Tower! Thank you!

B9IKAUson_4hb60kvB7EMA.text: One of the best meals with the best views of the Strip. Kids meals are well done. We appreciate that there's a salmon option for children. Great escargot, half avocado with seafood terrific. Following the trend this year, there's avocado toast on the menu. All good. Service excellent.

M6L-gNl5NjtxI6M3ic5QtQ.text: We came here on a Saturday night to get a drink from the bar and it was so beautiful at night! The view is to die for and the service is beyond exceptional. I don't think I'll ever be back here to eat because it's pretty pricey (I'm sure worth it) but we will be back to come to the bar!

FcIiubp8g4_wUNi7hY0Ueg.text: Came for lunch with a view. Wanted a table by the window for 3 but unfortunately there were no tables left around the perimeter for viewing purposes so we were seated as close as they possibly could. Tables for more than 2 were SOL. Should've made a reservation.  It's romantic if you want it to be but upon closer observation, the interior looks a tad bit outdated. The waitstaff is very professional and courteous. We ordered the salmon, the flat iron steak and the eggs Benedict. Overall, the food was good. My salmon had a mustard seed crust - seemed to be a bit too overwhelming with the season but flavorful and there was a bone in the first bite I had. Others commented they enjoyed their meals.  Meal and service was good. Def make a reservation for best seating.

Kinda disappointed because me and my husband came all dress up because we heard and based on reviews there is a dress code and then got seated next to people who were wearing jammies and shorts and I was like WOW we could have just wear something comfortable in our shorts and flip flops. Them came the food which was really expensive but average when it comes to taste. The only thing that made it all worthwhile was the view. Nothing more Nothing Less

wwIN7pCoFpmMkvd-j4rlKw.text: My wife and I visit Vegas once every few years and I can say without a doubt that the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in Vegas is consistently getting BETTER and BETTER!! The ENTIRE staff are literally the Best of the Best in Customer Service.  Constantine was exceptional and without makes a regular couple feel like royalty. Mat Dozois and Edgar Quinones at the Bar execute the deadliest precision when creating the cocktails and their service is stellar.  We had the pleasure of being served by Capt Heather D who I must say is phenomenal at her craft. The food is something was so amazing that I feel like everything else I have eaten afterwards merely pales in comparison. Thank you Lyle for your team and the atmosphere you create.  This sensational staff truly wows the experience. Come for the views, eat the food and adore the service. I'd give it 10 stars if possible. Don't believe me? Go see for yourself.

CidednFcUHHz-4aHs62Qow.text: One of the best meals I've had, not just in Vegas, but anywhere!    The circular bar when you first walk in is great. Our reservation was at 8, but our table wasn't ready until 8:20, so it was nice to sit at the bar and have drinks. The view was amazing! Even from the bar you have a surrounding view looking at the strip.   The best part, by far, was the steak tartare appetizer. It was one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. Cooked and seasoned to perfection. I'm drooling just thinking about it.  For my entree, I had the seabass. Also cooked to perfection, and the encrusting was amazing.    The staff was excellent, the view was beautiful, and my overall experience was a 10/10. I will be going back for sure.

W7UAEv3KqRx460Wb9J8-7w.text: this is the best experience i've experienced in vegas !  it only is the view amazing but the food is actually good !! i ordered a rib eye ; medium, mashed & asparagus and a bottle of Sav of course ! the server was great and attentive with great recommendations. i would go back. food has good flavor and i love people who know wine . even tho restaurants have wine experts some still don't know what they are talking about. my service was well informed and informative

_CZeJc2eK9SBf9Z3t4y6Lg.text: The view and ambiance at the restaurant are spectacular. You could get a view right in front of the bellagio fountains! The food was delicious, I especially enjoyed the creme brulee! They also ask you if you're celebrating anything and will make you a nice complimentary dessert if you are. The service and food are spectacular, would love to visit again!

The cod with the curry was the best dish I have had in a long time. It is so good. Salmon was cooked to perfection as well. Amazing view from every angle, picture perfect inside too. Tonight was perfect.

xNDaNWAD9jX9hZFMijuXAQ.text: Was an amazing Valentine's Day Experience. It started with being greeted in the Casino, Then again as we exited the Elevator and escorted to check in for our Dinner. LuBycledYHQ7bROgbd9H1A.text: Very romantic and I highly recommend!  We went around 7 pm for sunset and to watch the fountains across the street. We asked for special window seating and was able to get it.  Staff was very professional and pleased to serve. Waitress was helpful with the menu options...Excellent night out!

vVOqQMi2CpWFy_useat4jg.text: This is not your cheap date destination.  This is one of the heavyweight contenders for very fine dining on the Las Vegas Strip and it more than holds it's own against the likes of L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon.  In fact, flavor-wise it exceeds L'Atelier (but Robuchon excels in presentation, exclusivity and service experience).  When you enter, you'll find the elevator entrance in the base of the tower in the casino.  Once your reservation is double checked (and you'll want to reserve months in advance if you can), you are ushered onto the elevator which lifts you up to the restaurant where the doors open to a busy kitchen and a host waiting to seat you.  Book your reservation early enough and you'll be treated to an amazing view of The Strip and the Bellagio fountain display in a romantically dark and lushly appointed restaurant.  A sommelier was there to help us as soon as we sat down.  With a bottle of Heidsieck Monopole we settled in to watch the view...but once the first plate from the tasting menu appeared the scenery and environment was merely a backdrop to the cooking artistry.    The plates were beautiful and absorb your attention on all levels;  sight, smell and taste.  The rich foie gras was perfectly accented with the pain perdu and rhubarb compote.  The halibut and veal dishes were amazing, perfectly cooked and accented with both vegetables and sauces.  The souffle was expertly executed.   The service from the sommelier and Ivan, our server, was attentive, non-intrusive and worthy of the caliber of restaurant this is.   Plan to drop $500 for two people if you want to really get down and enjoy the menu.  But you can get by with less by sitting at the bar and selecting and sharing a couple of menu items.  Worth it?  Yup.  Or perhaps I should say, "Le yups".

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal medallion with Cabernet jus
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut with chardonnay bouillon
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras, Pain Perdu, rhubarb compote

51E7IeoCDqXmMVbLRQDcwQ.text: Come here if you want to be spoiled with fine dining, service, and an overall lavish and gourmet experience. I came as a girl's night out the other night, and we were very impressed overall with the whole experience and the meal. The Supervisor Lyle went out of his way to make our evening 5 stars.     The night started with a complimentary chilled soup from the chef which was really nice an unexpected. My friends ordered the An Eiffel Affair and the Raspberry Mule cocktails and seemed to really enjoy them. I ordered the Casco Bay Sea Scallops, which came out with 2 medium cooked scallops. I prefer my scallops with more of a sear on them, but still a nice dish. We also ordered the Steak Tartare, which was really special and unique in both the flavorful tartare, and the bread-like chips.   The Rack of Lamb was so delicious, and was perfectly cooked medium rare. I also got the Rossini Style Filet Mignon with Foie Gras, and this was equally delicious. The Filet Mignon actually came with a quite generous portion which was a nice surprise since I was expecting a smaller cut of meat. The Foie Gras was very tasty, and this dish was great because it's like an appetizer and a main course in one. I would give both these dishes 5 stars.   Lastly, for dessert I got the chocolate souffle (which you have to order at the beginning of the meal). I was impressed with the 7+ different souffles they offered, but we decided to stick with the classic. It was exactly how a souffle should be- light at the top and gooey at the bottom. They ended the meal with complimentary chocolates.   Prepare to pay some $$$ for this meal, but it is so worth it if you want to have a special dinner. The entirety of the restaurant offers a beautiful view of the strip, so this is a great place to come if you are a tourist.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rossini Style Filet Mignon
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An Eiffel Affair
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Starter

k81eMgcxsoakkzPHFuBuTw.text: I ate here a few years ago on the fourth of July.   We were trying to find a great view of the firework displays without standing outside amongst the crowds. We somewhat succeeded.  I make a reservation in advance which is kind of a must (especially for a holiday) we got there early because I was trying hard for a window seat ( right in front of the fountains). We had to wait a little while so we sat at the bar and ordered some pricey drinks. The bartender was cool and had a great accent.    We were seated and the table was pretty good. It wasnt the exact view I hoped for but it could of been much worse. We weren't overly impressed with the pricey food which is always a bummer when your spending a lot of dough you want it to taste amazing. I tried escargot here for the first time and don't really think I need to try it again. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy some very higher class dishes but this one isn't for me. The flavor in our steaks was lacking as well as the buttery melt in your mouth texture.  I would come here strictly for the views.

hw9MUPovgapvMJfu8pmFgA.text: Best steak I ever had!  The ambiance is really nice. Loved being able to take pictures to capture the moment.

Jrj9y_tgTrgVgwefBa0TJg.text: Disappointing resteraunt. Maybe I'm not into French food. I went for lunch. I found the menu to not have many options

DBNS7h5jG3HV3lpj7gNZdg.text: Long situated as a focal point inside Paris Las Vegas Hotel & Casino it was finally on Saturday that the elevator was ascended to Eiffel Tower Restaurant, Chef Jean Joho's classic French Cuisine put on display several stories above The Strip in a space offering privileged views of Sin City and particularly of the Bellagio Fountains.   Open since 1999 and managed by Lettuce Entertain You, the same group behind Paris' Mon Ami Gabi plus Joho's Michelin starred Everest in Chicago, it is after ascending 110 feet into the 50-story Tower that doors open onto a showpiece kitchen, a staff of at least fifteen hard at work for Dinner beginning daily at 4:30pm plus Lunch on Weekdays and Brunch on Weekends.  No doubt a tourist hotspot, the elevated vantage and central location virtually guaranteeing traffic despite prices a bit higher than some might expect, it is after checking in at the hostess podium that guests are led to seats lining windows or on a higher ledge also offering a good view, though earlier arrival or reservations are recommended for prime real estate.  Featuring a full-bar plus an impressive cellar, the Wines mostly French and predictably subject to substantial mark-up, it is with Water poured that daytime guests are left to peruse items ranging light to rich, signatures designated by a small icon while five Brunch specials and a three-course tasting menu are also highlighted.  Well-priced considering the setting, service staff in suits and piano playing overhead adding class to crisp linens and dark red carpets, it was declining the $39 tasting that three courses were instead ordered along with Iced Tea, an amuse of Parsnip Cream a nice touch with contrasting Sage while housemade Baguette also showed well despite nearly-frozen Butter that initially proved impossible to spread.  Toqued by Executive Chefs Joung Sohn and Lucas Knox who have recently made small adjustments to the menu, a "luxury" French Toast topped in Foie Gras lost in the shuffle, it was nonetheless that dining was underway with one of two current Duck Liver preparations, the warm version selected over a cold Terrine and proving nicely seared atop buttery Brioche and stewed Apples complimented by Cabernet Jus.  Turning next to one of Chef Joho's classics, a $22 plate of what many might call "fried Chicken," suffice it to say that there is nothing simple about the thinly pounded Breast coated in Bread Crumbs and aged Cheese, the salinity nicely balanced by a sidecar of Brown Butter that also adds plenty of flavor to crispy Potatoes and snappy Green Beans.  Switching from Tea to Coffee going forward, both freshly brewed and refilled consistently, those seeking French Toast may want to dine somewhere else, a cost of $19 excessive even if the single piece were prepared perfectly - which it most certainly was not as the center was 1/6 filled with Custard thus leaving the rest dry and thirsty for Syrup.  Not wanting to exit disappointed, though the staff's failure to inform guests in advance of Apple Strudel that takes twenty minutes to prepare was also unfortunate, it was with an $8.50 Frozen "Souffle" that Brunch concluded, the layers of Strawberry and Grand Marnier Semifreddo juxtaposed to Fruit and Nuts while three tiny Mignardises including one made of Passion Fruit were a pleasant send-off.  ***1/2:  In a city where several Restaurants come with a view Eiffel Tower Restaurant fares particularly well thanks to the Bellagio Fountains, but taking into account premium pricing small details like rock-hard Butter and poorly executed French Toast are difficult to ignore no matter how good Jean Joho's Modern French Cuisine is otherwise.

_f3wlNmQWgor71FM0B_Z5w.text: My friends and I have been coming to Vegas for many years now and have tried many upscale fine dining restaurants, but this was the first time we'd tried French Food here.....and by the end of the meal, we were all in agreement that this was perhaps the best meal we have ever had in all our years of visiting Vegas. Ambiance was upscale, elegant, and classy, views of the strip were awesome, service was excellent....but most notable were the wonderfully delicious dishes we had ordered....and with a nice bottle of wine to go with it all. Yes, this place is not cheap, but you definitely get what you pay for.  Everything was so fresh, perfectly cooked, flavorful, and artfully presented. For our dinner, we didn't want to fill up too much before a show we were attending, so we ordered a Market Greens salad which came with Avocado, Sunflower Seeds, Sherry Walnut Vinaigrette. For Entrees, my friends ordered the Individual Eiffel Tower Beef Wellington and Rossini Style Filet Mignon with Foix Gras and Truffle Sauce. I went with the Boneless Chicken Breast with Fingerling Potatoes Jus de Poulet.  The market salad was so fresh, so beautifully presented......really enjoyed the Avocado and Sherry Walnut Vinaigrette. As for the mains, my friends were so impressed that the first comments from their mouths were  "mmmmm....So melt-in-your-mouth Good!" I was equally impressed by my chicken and particularly enjoyed the sauce that came with it.....yummy!   Service was excellent throughout as we were so well taken care of by our server David. Oh, and we were so glad he mentioned at the very beginning that if we wanted to order the Souffle dessert that we should do it by the time our food came out as it takes 30 minutes to make......we did exactly that and went ahead and ordered the Grand Marnier Souffle. Oh boy! I have tried truly outstanding souffles before, but this beats them all, hands down! Even my friends who are more of dessert people than I said this was the best they have ever eaten!  Overall a wonderful experience from start to finish. Our only regret is that we came a bit early when it was still light outside. If it were dark, the views of the city lights and Bellagio fountains would have just completed a perfect dining experience.....which was finished off with little desserts at the end of the meal....which I believe I heard them referred to as "Petit Fours" .....? Whatever they were called......very nice touch to end a wonderful meal!  As one would expect, the ET is not cheap.....even the wines run from just under a hundred to thousands!.....so be sure to reload your credit cards!

xoOniC5N4jzkJyyj_DlTNg.text: Lobster benedict. YESSSSSSS.   Classy. Maybe a little too formal. Definitely expensive.   New York Strip: perfectly cooked.   Complimentary desserts -- a very nice touch.   I would definitely come back.
