G7RKd_mIRFhp0srPhRuGiQ.text: Can you say boujie?!? Vegas local here.. this place is quite an experience. I went the day before Valentine's Day because well... Valentine's Day is obviously a national holiday for restaurants like this. It is a beautiful place. The ambiance is nothing short of romantic. The menu is pretty simple. You choose a meat of some sort & separately a side for an obvious separate price. The sides is a nice way to share with whoever is at your table.

aYL7Pvx3JMHuBWlxnKoxQg.text: Gorgeous restaurant with unbelievable views! My husband's steak was cooked perfectly.  My beef wellington was just okay.  For sides we got mushrooms and scalloped potatoes - YES!!!  The creme brulee  was some of the best I have had.  And trust their sommelier - he made incredible recommendations!

IQaBqHvTR5dbVws3MzHFfw.text: : What a splendid and entertaining experience! We had a business dinner tonight, and could not have asked for better. The atmosphere is elegant, and the view picturesque. My friends had the sea bass and I the NY strip with au gratin potatoes. We finished with creme brulee, which proved well presented and well prepared. The view is of the strip, with a healthy dose of Bellagio fountain for your repeated entertainment. Enjoy!

fKlNpFOP7yTCPvfh3fty1g.text: Great experience, good food, good service, and very nice view, the pork belly appetizer, the lamb chops and the salmon were all delicious, pricey but worth it, highly recommend the chocolate souffle

4AcoPUZuXT2NLyS95VLnNQ.text: Wonderful experience. Our bartender, Matt was awesome.  He helped make the experience fun and relaxed. If you ever go hear ask for Matt.

QSY7ooGnv3PdPkWAvqzGpQ.text: Enjoyed our dinner at this restaurant. A beautiful view of the dancing fountains at the Bellagio if you can get a window seat table. I ordered the filet mignon it was outstanding. Very good service. Highly recommend making reservations.

dcJ_uW8kIjduCjvn-oEVXA.text: Wow, they took us to our table and we couldn't believe it was the best spot in the place with a spectacular view of the Bellagio fountains, the Paris balloon and the whole strip! Happy birthday to me!!   Our server was fabulous! He had a great sense of humor, friendly and genuinely enjoyed his job. I love that, it makes the whole experience great! He wasn't pushy with menu items, made great suggestions, never rushed us, brought our food out perfectly without crowding the table and his timing was impeccable as he was there to snap our pictures during the fountain light show! I loved that!! We have the fountain as the background in our pix! Yippee!!!   Everything was awesome here, we'll definitely be back! I didn't get to go up the real Eiffel tower when I was in Paris but Vegas Eiffel tower will do just fine, minus the long flight! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too bad yelp limits video footage, here are some still shots of the spectacular view
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vPir6njuxeIKGCUOjXeqmQ.text: My expectations were cautiously high. There are many excellent restaurants in Vegas and just because one is pretty, or expensive, doesn't guarantee quality of experience. The Eiffel Tower however, absolutely blew me away. On a whim I decided to treat myself to brunch.   To my great surprise I was shown to the prefect table right in a window overlooking the Bellagio fountains. My server was warm yet efficient. His assistant was equally professional and turned out to be the son of the main guy.   After perusing the menu I settled on the lobster eggs Benedict. To start I had a small but delicious green salad. Oh, and the white peach mimosa was a great compliment to both. Everything was perfect. I mean seriously perfect. Even though I was stuffed, I couldn't help ordering the chocolate lava cake. Yum.   Can't wait to go back and try their dinner offerings!

CEN0QlT-I-BM4PA6Z0imng.text: Obviously this is fine dining so it was expensive, but my experience here with a large bachelorette group was amazing! 11 of us and our total came up to approx. $1,100. So prepare to spend $100 pp. I splurged more than anyone in the group cuz I'm a foodie (why not, it's not an everyday meal). I got the Eiffel Affair cocktail, coffee, smoked salmon, rack of roasted lamb, roasted spinach and mushroom. It was a very delicious meal, food was on point, and my lamb came out medium just as requested.  Ambiance was also great, staff are very friendly and courteous, walkways around tables are narrow and can get crowded, but no matter how busy they are, all the staff are trained to step aside and let you thru first. Bathroom had someone in there to hand you paper towels all day.  Also wanted to mention, we had a very booked night, staff worked diligently and got us our food, FAST. They were all very attentive and great to work with!

r4vx__rBKptbDuY7Hix-Ug.text: I highly don't recommend this place unless things change!  This place isn't as classy as I thought, came in here and everyone isn't dressed up it was very casual. We met a guy in the elevator leaving the restaurant that just got engaged to his girlfriend and was excited to bring his lady here but when say that no one was dressed up it made this place from {steak status to a ground beef status} like what is going on! the service was not good at all and the food was just okay.

3T_wc70HyyqriQPOHrMUnQ.text: Went for Saturday Brunch. You first walk in and you see the kitchen and their French chef jackets and you get giddy. Then you see the menu and it's about as typical American fare as it gets. Too bad. Great views and good ambiance. Get some French brunch up in here.

9sDbN9o6G4drD2a-OGUpRQ.text: Absolutely beautiful view especially when Bellagio fountains go on.... Service was very professional .  Food was average ..... Nothing special or spectacular .... Souffle was just ok ....

mgUJ6lFJujBovHthXshLSg.text: Little late on this review, we actually did Thanksgiving dinner here.  It was the best Thanksgiving dinner I've ever had (sorry mother!).  I went with a group and we all got the Thanksgiving dinner special.  I believe it included an app, main course and a desert.  I'm not much of a wine guy but we did get whatever pairing of red wine they recommended to go with the turkey, and it was very good.  The Turkey was awesome, cooked great, some light and dark meat, some awesome stuffing, great cranberry sauce/spread.    The thing that stood out most in my mind though was the desert.  Best pecan pie I've ever had.  Hands down.  I will have to see if they have pecan pie available next time I'm in Vegas, if they have it when you're there, I'd recommend it.  Came with a scoop of ice cream, cold ice cream with warm pecan pie, delicious.  The service was very good, atmosphere of the place, views, it was a good dining experience.  If I had to pick something I didn't like it was the lady at the podium on the ground level, when we made a reservation with her a few days before she made some condescending remarks about our dress at the time which I thought were uncalled for.  I'm not counting that as part of the dining experience though, so 5 stars from me!

aapgPdtFJNX0NBzekhR6MA.text: Were at this restaurant when they opened for brunch on Sunday (11am) and couldn't have been happier. Got a window seat and watched the fountains while eating some fabulous French toast and eggs benedict. Chef sent several "bites" to entice including cauliflower parfait (basically a cold soup), a pot de creme (ostensibly for the birthdays we were celebrating) and several our choice of two small dessert tastes (passionfruit jelly and salted caramel). Only complaint was the lemonade which was incredible sweet. Otherwise a stellar brunch with a view!

WYyqWBPtp8jvMuLknjRqxA.text: Great food and service, a must try at least once, the Souffle is a must. The view is great, request a window table. Be prepared to spend $200 plus before tip.

6djgh0Fq_9wfirKRabiT0w.text: Ok ill start this off with the only negative thing that you can say about this restaurant....THE PRICE. It's expensive but you should know that prior to coming.   Upon exiting the elevator you enter what looks like the kitchen area and it smells amazing. You can see chefs (or people dressed up as chefs) walking around preparing food and other items. The seating area gives you an excellent view of the Caesars Palace front water area and the Bellagio dancing fountains. That back drop makes for an amazing dinning experience.   We went with a larger group and they were very accommodating. Our serveur (waiter) was very nice to us and explained some of the stuff that was foreign without making us feel dumb. He provided us with a very nice champagne to help us toast a very special occasion. The desserts were over the top good and helped top off a great experience.

nbVLoJkoRSL_oWxuLuoZhA.text: Excellent food  Excellent service Spectacular view Alix was our server and she was awesome

8Mr8KcwV4Y6z5I72HRbjSw.text: Whoa, you need to take an elevator to reach this restaurant. Upon exiting at the top of the Eiffel Tower, you're greeted by a woman and can see the bustling kitchen.  I went to the bathroom as I waited for some of my party to arrive. Inside the bathroom, there's another lady who leads you to a stall. After you finish washing your hands, she gives you a pretty towel with the Eiffel Tower Restaurant Logo.  Anyways, we get seated and a waiter begins to recommend dishes for you. You can feel the professionalism of the atmosphere and everything is in tip-top shape.  We Ordered: 1. Duck Breast 2. Beef Wellington 3. Grilled Salmon 4. Rabbit with a light Mustard sauce 5. Beef Tenderloin 6. Escargot 7. Duck Liver 8. Chocolate Souffle 9. Strawberry Souffle  The appetizer that comes is a spinach soup I believe. Anyways, the presentation was amazing and they serve you bread. The outside view of the Bellagio fountains were amazing too.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach Soup Appetizer
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington

i4_oWFoYzL7Ar07p8NTcpQ.text: 3.75 stars.  Beautiful panoramic views of the strip from this glass walled upscale eatery located in the Paris.  Take the elevator up to the open kitchen then be seated in the multi-level dining room.  James was our expert server this evening, and he did a nice job tending to a table of eight.  Food was very good, but not unbelievable.  Vegas prices set the expectations bar high for most of us, and that bar simply wasn't achieved.  We were greeted by a nice little amuse bouche of cauliflower, a surprise that was both tasty and welcome.  A bread selection was offered and along with soft butter was a crusty treat.  I liked the rustic variety.  Appys:  The Maine Lobster Salad with Roasted Butternut Squash, Wilted Kale and Old Cider Vinaigrette was tasty enough, albeit a small portion for $24.  The Cold Smoked Salmon with Classic Condiments was very good at $19 and more substantial than the lobster.  Entrees:  James told us a story about the Duke of Wellington and Napolean that prompted an order of the Beef Wellington.  The preparation was classic, though without the liver pate.  Actually that is the way my fellow diner preferred it, and the dish came out perfectly prepared, medium rare and delicious.  Two others, including myself, ordered the short ribs which were underwhelming.  Four small bits of beef were accompanied by several baby carrots and three baby onions.  The brown sauce adorning the plate was a little too forward for my taste and quite a bit different from what we are used to eating in most establishments.  I want to say it was vinegar-ey, but I really am not sure what the unique flavor I tasted was.  I miss my Cafe 14 in Agoura Hills' short ribs!!!  Dessert included a caramel souffle which, too, was underwhelming.  Flavor was very light, even with the requisite caramel sauce.  If you go for the souffle I would recommend the chocolate variety.  We are used to paying Vegas prices, but although the Eiffel Tower had great vistas and good service, the value equation wasn't there at these high prices.  C'est la vie!

17a9VyixhKj9iJa_ec5SbQ.text: A wonderful meal in a beautiful environment with a spectacular view!  Scallop appetizer was perfectly prepared, my loup de mer entree was simply delicious, and my chocolate souffle was one of the best desserts of my lifetime!  A perfect 50th birthday celebration dinner!  Impeccable service too!

v4k8TYukLNR6g5TL1C_OHw.text: No need to say that is one of my favorite restaurants on the strip and the view is amazing. My review is based on the incredible experience and service from James on Monday afternoon. We went for lunch before returning to LA and decide to do a last celebration for my birthday and our anniversary. Everything was perfect from beginning to end and we were really happy with the delicious treat they gave us for the occasion. I love this place, the food is delicious and the service is impeccable! Every dollar you spend is totally worth it.

aPg5mhJaXiRBlPjBXGj8SQ.text: This is a beautiful restaurant with some of the best views of Las Vegas around. You can see the fountains of Bellagio, and almost anything you could want from this location.   One of my friends got married at the Paris and had the reception at this location. The staff were friendly, efficient and great at their jobs. The hors d'oeuvres were amazing. Sirlon burgers, puffed pastries with mushrooms, and salmon wraps with caviar to name a few. Everything went perfectly including the red velvet wedding cake with raspberry sauce. Wow!  If the air conditioning kept up with the crowd, I would give them 5 stars immediately. I realize during an afternoon in Vegas, with that many windows, it has to be hard to keep things cool.   I would definitely like to visit this location again for dinner.

VNs69qN7C2DNvWISEH3DcQ.text: Had an amazing table overlooking the Bellagio fountains perfection from service to the food to the view to the atmosphere. I'll definitely be coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

48oXEuLwN0eo0FjtxApaZg.text: A five star restaurant! Make sure 2 bring your jacket - there's a dress code. The service was absolutely great! The food was just more then amazing -- I got the lamb it was just melting in my mouth!!! I strongly recxommend this restaurant especially if u have some anniversary or bday. Make sure you reserve a table, they r busy on some Friday and Saturday nights and u wont get a window table with an awesome view of the Bellagio fountains. Its a great place to go relax, have some great food and feel special!

Q5AUpoolO7SERyMKAY3rZA.text: 3 stars for food and five stars for service, but I am going to round because they forgot the most important thing!  I had made reservations to celebrate my mom's birthday. When I had called, they had asked if we were there for a special occasion and I had mentioned that we were there for a birthday.However, once we got there, they made no mention of it. It wouldn't have been a big deal but everyone else on yelp had their birthday person recognized.   Why ask and then not follow through? Not cool. Not cool at all.   Service is outstanding! We started off with the amuse bouche, which consisted of a cauliflower mousse. Absolutely delicious. The servers kept coming back and forth to make sure we had enough bread and water. Kept cleaning our table over and over. They had this little bread crumb lifter that removed all the crumbs. That's high class! Their waitstaff is awesome and for that alone I would say go.   My mom got the recommended parmesean crusted  chicken while I got the lamb burger. She liked the chicken but it was a little to heavy for me. I got the lamb burger, but it was a little too strong for me, so I'd have to pass. We both ordered a non-alcoholic lime drink which was tasty and a great alternative to the alky.  We ended up getting our own dessert, the strawberry souffle with pistachios. Kind of reminded us of strawberry ice cream since they freeze it, but a nice option to the end of the meal.   Would I go again? I don't know. I usually go to Vegas for celebrations, either birthdays or graduations and such, so we usually go all out. But not remembering a birthday of a guest is a big no-no, especially at a place that has such a high level of service. Joel Robuchon definitely remembered. At least I took her to go see O.

gAq0_gHSMXFaiY2UmomNcQ.text: A grand entrance from the Paris Hotel casino, up a private elevator to the restaurant.  We stopped for a drink at the bar while they prepared a table for us by the window.  A window seat here is worth the wait, with views overlooking the Bellagio fountains that I really never get tired of watching.  Service from our waiter was professional, but not warm nor inviting.  Apps: Seared sea scallops were great. Forget what else was ordered. Entrees: Liked the Dover sole, loved the Beef Wellington, which was cooked perfectly and full of flavor. Dessert: Highly recommend trying a souffle...amazing.  A nice, romantic restaurant that I would recommend trying.

wY58Fc5YW_KDMCfNNPRpwQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants to eat in Vegas with a view of the world famous Bellagio fountains. Highly recommended to get reservations here as they ask for your name when you arrive at the kiosk by the elevator. In order to eat here, you have to go through the center of the Paris hotel casino in an elevator. At the top you arrive to the kitchen and see how well and clean your food is prepared. Very authentic french. Very cool.   Pros:  Well prepared food and attention to detail in their food presentation. They show how the French take pride in their food. I went with their 5-course menu and Ordered the filet mignon as I always do paired with wine. I personally prefer quality over quantity unlike Italian food and this place lived up to my expectations. Ever bite of every course was tasteful and prepared well with the right ingredients and pairings. Of course I had a glass of Cabernet to go with my entree. For desert I absolutely loved the Chocolate suffle - se parfait! It is prepared in advance when you first order as it takes time to freshly bake. My waiter even pours the chocolate filling for me when served so it is served right.   Impeccable Service that is second to none and set the bar so high for me. I have yet to go a restaurant with comparable service. You get your personalized waiter along who can offer to serve you the entire time speaking french. Again very cool! They actually pay attention to your needs and seem to know what you you need throughout your eating experience without being annoying. Between courses they clean any crumbs off the table. Wow! I feel like a king!   Cons: Not much. Pricey but you get what you pay for. A memorable experience every time.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best dining view!

Awh5P2x28DgAyuOsnhPemA.text: Made a reservation with this restaurant to celebrate my 50th birthday 3 months ago. One hour before the reservation (6:30), they called to tell me that, due to unforeseen circumstances, the restaurant was closed for the night. Huh? I asked if they would accommodate me somewhere else and they said no. We were staying across the street at Bellagio and noticed that the restaurant lighting was all on despite them being "closed." A little fishy to me!!!

eTQnlluXAteWa-5xCzBrmw.text: This review is for our lunch experience on a Sunday.  I can't speak to the dinner service, but if it's anything like lunch, then you're in for a treat.  To start, we didn't have reservations, but it was a Sunday and we decided to take our chances.  Thank god we did, because we were quickly seated at a table with a gorgeous view of the strip including the Bellagio fountains.    Then came Todd Smith.  Oh Todd, I would marry you if I could, but I don't think my husband would appreciate it.  On second thought, he probably wouldn't mind because Todd was amazing.  The right amount of service, charm, and all the right suggestions.  For starters was an amuse bouche of what I think was mushroom flan coupled with some cheese gougeres, better known as fancy french cheese puffs.  They were both delicious.  I was pretty close to asking for a few more puffs, but then out came our lunches.  I had their version of a caprese salad, served with heirloom tomatoes, fresh mozarella, and basil infused water.  I know, basil water? Initally, I thought it was a whole cup of dressing, but I was corrected, and he poured away. Delicious.  Refreshing and light with just the right amount of basil.  I'd order that again.  My hb had the lamb burger.  I was hesitant at first because while I love lamb, it can easily be ruined. This burger, oh this burger, was just so good.  It had a slight taste of curry, and a bit of a spice kick.  Cooked to a medium perfection, and served with a roasted red pepper relish.  I would definitely order that again.  We finished off brunch with the stuffed french toast.  When we ordered this, I thought I would be stuffed myself, but it was a perfect sized portion for the 2 of us.  It wasn't too sweet, which was a pleasant surprise, and was served with the thinnest piece of crispy bacon.  Perfect balance of salty and sweet.  Brunch prices were reasonable and considering we loved everything we had, I'd say it was well worth it.  That, and the service from Todd, the busser, and pretty much all the staff made this a perfect lunch.

FodfR4O_ihXyeA5OMaAWlQ.text: Valentine's dinner, overpriced terrible food, unprepared. Worst service worst food we have ever had in Vegas do yourself a favor and don't go!

4sbpJanJS9Go_lo1O2ZMFA.text: The experience from beginning to end was amazing as well as the service. The views you get of Las Vegas is breathtaking.  We started off with the steak tartare and a lobster salad. The steak tartare was amazing and the lobster salad was great too.  I had the filet with truffles, and my guests had the beef Wellington and the lamb chops everything was so tasty. But the best was dessert. You MUST opt to get a souffle for desert. Order it in the beginning because it takes a half hour to make.  We got the pistachio souffle and it was the best part of the dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_phb4XaQhR0K2KCENdWpwg.text: Romantic atmosphere and great food! The restaurant and view are undeniably gorgeous.   Our server was subpar, but the food was great. They provided free bread at the beginning of the meal and a cute desserts plate at the end. I had the slow roasted filet of salmon, creme brulee, and Nutella souffle. I highly recommend the salmon! So delicious!   Overall, I had a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. *Slow Roasted Filet of Salmon, Pinot Noir Sauce
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eiffel Tower Classic Crème Brulee

cMPobRGYKe1qS7w6cL7b4Q.text: I enjoyed the restaurant for my birthday dinner! The view is absolutely beautiful. I love that there are tables for 2 that face the strip. Since it was the weekend we saw the fountains go off every 15 minutes.  The sommelier was very friendly and helped us pick a nice French wine. I fell in love with that wine and hope to find it somewhere to buy for my own collection.  The food was good but not like omg I can't believe how good this is. I had the Caesar salad, scallops, Wellington, au gratin and Brussels sprouts. Everything was delicious.  The Wellington was prepared nicely, I feel like there were mushrooms or something in the pastry as well. All very good flavors. The scallops had a vegetable or something with it and that was really tasty. I enjoyed the different way of preparing a Caesar salad, he kept the romaine leaves in tact, it was nice and crunchy.   They were so nice, they brought me a birthday dessert and it was good.  I was going to order the obligatory souffle, but I just have a thing for creme brulee and theirs was delicious. It was not very thick like any other brulee I have had, but it was good. I kind of think I liked the free little birthday taster they gave me, some type of chocolate mousse thing.   Enjoyed my birthday dinner. View and ambiance is fabulous!   I guess you can come and just enjoy the bar and the ambiance if you don't want to eat here. I think I'd like to do that in the future, just get dressed up and enjoy the Vegas strip view.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SSRNh6YYUgse94Jm0i4zgA.text: Food was on the salty side, presentation was okay, Four stars for the atmosphere and the view of the Las Vegas strip when dining.

fxegAyAzQLCJsXOApK-heQ.text: Great view while eating up here. Had the aged meat which was delicious. No complaints. This restaurant and its employee do a great job. Great place for dinner.

xSrok1qIvOWAQ1ZZki-HPg.text: We made a dinner reservation here primarily for the view, and we were pleasantly surprised with how good the food  actually was. The waiter started off asking us if we wanted to order a Souffle for dessert as they took 30 minutes to prepare. Dinner and desert we're both excellent. You have to make sure you get the souffle.  The view was incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XG3tn461d1oiT-wzao4vSA.text: My fiance and I go to Las Vegas, on average, about 5-7 times a year. We go so often that there are very few places that we have not dined. The Eiffel Tower restaurant was one of them. It was an early evening at the Paris casino and we were gambling at one of the Buffalo gold machines, my fiance ended up doing well on the slot machine. Right before we started gambling we were talking about different places to eat. As soon as that happened,  we decided it was finally time to see what the Eiffel Tower had to offer. We were not dressed super fancy as we would have been knowing we were going here, but they were nice enough to offer my fiance a shirt to wear so that we could dine there. We had no reservation so we had to wait a little bit at the bar. The bartender was great and made a perfect Martini. It wasn't long until we were brought into the restaurant. We were seated facing the Bellagio fountain at a beautiful, small table in the back of the restaurant. They brought out a few different things before appetizer arrived. I believe we split a salad and the salmon. Everything was delicious, the service was great, the ambience was very romantic. This is a perfect place to bring your date. I'm so glad we finally got to have this experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad  so delish!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was brought out, we did not order it.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy salmon. My favorite.

2n45Yv1KageLXJG9HpgOhw.text: Came here twice in a row for the New Year's Eve Dinner. The ambience is great - you get to see the fireworks at midnight. The food is good, but for some reason, the temperature of the food is off - maybe because they are doing course meal and the restaurant was fully booked.  The service is good. But the live band playing was awful. The music they played was mostly 50's and 60's and it wasn't upbeat enough for the occasion.  The last sitting was $500 per person plus tax and gratuity excluding drinks. So, if you're Party can drink, be prepared, a cocktail is $30.

TQOKS8JSqC9uMfrp1q8abw.text: Super nice and cozy, went there with my husband, sat by the windows overlooking the Bellagio fountains, view was mezmerising. Food was super yummy and tasty. i highly recommend eating at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Chicken Breast
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KqtOoclmThpSUcEikbs_lQ.text: Some of the best views in Las Vegas and great service. It's wonderful to come off of the elevator and be hit with the intoxicating smells from the kitchen. My duck hash was a bit disappointing unfortunately, but my friends seemed to enjoy their meals!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck hash

sh9Al9zqFDUFblOOyxcBTQ.text: I came to this restaurant on a Sunday evening. We made reservations in advance but only were able to get a 430 seating which was fine as I made sure not to eat lunch that day. We were greeted and the hostess was very polite. The bread guy was awesome and the bread was just fantastic! Our waitress was lovely and made some great recommendations. We ordered the chocolate souffle at the end and it was delicious. My (now) fiancee actually proposed prior to dinner and it was a prefect spot to do this My only complaint here is that the restaurant did not even offer a dessert (shared) or drink on the house as a compliment to us just being engaged. Most restaurants offer some sort of compliments and we got a monotone "oh congratulations" from the server.  A bit disappointing since my fiancee held this monumental moment at their restaurant! If it wasnt for this, I wouldve given a 4 star review

qtIZ1Ibb0pAbUNMQGLKhBQ.text: Living in the San Gabriel Valley, I have ready access to a ton of delicious Asian food, so I decided to try more European and Western flavors on my weekend getaway in Las Vegas. I told my girlfriend I was in the mood for French cuisine, and she likes restaurants with nice ambiences, so we decided to pick a restaurant with both. Eiffel Tower is a restaurant that requires an elevator ride to get up to.  We were seated at a table that had a clear view of the city, including Bellagio Fountains as well as the lights at The Cosmopolitan. The light show helped set the mood for a very romantic dinner.  Drink wise, I got a virgin pina colada, and my girlfriend got some type of wine. We both loved our drinks. For me, I typically find pina coladas to be too icy and too sweet sometimes - not this time, this pina colada was mostly liquid and also not too sweet.  I was in a mood for beef wellington, which I hadn't had in a while. I ordered that, while my girlfriend got the NY Strip Steak. The restaurant also serves complimentary bread, which was filling but nothing particularly special.  The steaks were the highlight of the meal. I tried some of my girlfriend's strip steak, and it was by far the best steak I've ever had in my life. Granted, I don't eat steak that often, but I've had steak many times in Los Angeles and a handful of times in other places - this steak was very juicy, flavorful, and had a crispy texture on the outside. The beef wellington was also incredibly tasty. Both meats were medium rare, and both of them cut very easily. The wellington was just right, and the puff pastry was incredibly flavorful.  This is a very expensive restaurant, but then again, so are most restaurants in the Strip of Las Vegas. I highly recommend this place as a once in a few years romantic date for someone special.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Individual Eiffel Tower Beef Wellington , Sautéed Snap Peas

nwP8RkvtvuWErMgyrJkQRw.text: I have always wanted to go to France and after having brunch at the Eiffel Tower in Vegas I was ready to book a trip to the real thing! The ambiance is romantic, views of the Bellagio fountain are amazing, and the servers were friendly and knowledgeable. I was celebrating an anniversary so was lucky to get a table at the windows even though it was a busy weekend. Our waiter gave us a free dessert that I can only assume said "Congratulations!" in French. It was the sweetest gesture and made the experience more memorable. Excited to return and dress up to try the dinner menu!

ldLjuKdouQAxfGJQHBn5cw.text: We were there in 2014 and had such a great experience that it was a must for us to return.  We did, and for more than a meal.  I surprised my wife with a vow renewal and everyone at the restaurant was extremely helpful in playing along and keeping it a surprise.  The food was phenomenal, the service was top notch, and this restaurant will be a requirement for us to attend each time we are in town.

3uH0eRU0yLLVKVfIqbFcBg.text: This place sux, the staff are so rude! It's so pricey and not worth the aggravation.  We've been to Vegas several times and would never ever go back here. Stratosphere is much nicer and Binions Steakhouse. The staff is so much nicer. The food is amazing. Don't waste your time and money ...

yJ8XSvyL2UOv1d3Sctdteg.text: $29 for a 1 inch by 1.25 inch of New York steak  wings smaller piece of fois  Gras  a teaspoon of cherry jelly. WHAT A JOKE!

09VXYHOXIf0yQYwdwAmcfg.text: I was taken there on a romantic date! Food, ambience and the lights at the Bellagio hotel seemed like they were only lite up for us. I suggest to anyone going, ask for the window view. Side-note after dinner, take your partner on a helicopter ride. There will be smiles all around.

W7QL3EzC3Dydyy8F0KXVZw.text: I was here for brunch and everything about the experience was amazing from start to finish. After taking a glass elevator through the tower, you pop out facing the kitchen, which is pristine--a great sign. My boyfriend and I were sat at an adorable table for two facing the window. We both got a couple of their signature cocktails, which were amazing. For the entrees, I got the lobster eggs Benedict and my boyfriend got the Parmesan crusted juicy. The lobster Benedict was probably the best eggs Benedict I've ever had. I usually can't finish a whole restaurant portion, but there wasn't a crumb left on my plate afterwards. My boyfriend's chicken was super juicy and delicious as well. This is a great restaurant and I really recommend it if you're in Vegas.

Jc1mjv4Qp7gewbnqE0QXtg.text: It never even occurred to me to come to this restaurant since I imagined it would be a mess of tourists. However I was hungry in the afternoon at Paris and realized that the Eiffel Tower restaurant has a lunch service.  So I took the elevator upstairs and was seated in a perfect table at the window overlooking the Bellagio lake. I had a lobster salad and a glass of white wine, and thoroughly enjoyed taking in the view of the lake. Since it was lunch the service was more relaxed which was fine. I think I'd rather come here in the daytime anyway since the view is nice in daytime and the restaurant wasn't crowded.

4wJ-eDpznTWomOV1tQ4iTw.text: We hosted our extended cocktail reception here after our wedding ceremony and *almost* everything about my experience here was on point.  PROS: + Due to the size of our group, the left bank (it can hold approximately 80 seated and 100 standing) was reserved for us. We had 70 people and a mix of sit down and standing cocktail tables which was a great layout for us since there was enough room to move + We had a great view of the Bellagio fountains, the strip, and the bonus fireworks from Caesars across the street!  + We had a carving station and it was DELISH! There was even a line for it and everybody raved about it afterward + All of the servers were very accommodating and they always made sure we had drinks and/or food in our hands + All of the hors d'oeuvres that I selected were delicious and everybody enjoyed them + The price point is fair for an on-strip restaurant (a few other restaurants that I looked at were $$$$$$$) + Outside photography is allowed + Children are allowed here (a few places on the strip were 21+ only) + I was able to pre-select wine and champagne prior to the event + We were able to charge alcohol on consumption vs. open bar, since open bar would have counted for everybody (even those who don't drink) + I received prompt responses from the general manager, Scott Clark, and the director of events, Chloe Linder whenever I had an inquiry + An employee was able to hook up an HDMI cable to a laptop for my maid of honor's speech  CONS: - When we signed our contract, we were provided with event pricing for 2015 and had to pay the 2016 pricing which increased, but we weren't aware of new pricing until I asked for an updated menu 30 days prior to our event - We ran a little over our allotted 3 hour time slot and the server said "You have this room booked until 9:30pm and it's over that time now" which led me to asking to close out -- I feel like we should've received a 15 minute warning prior to 9:30pm because we were having so much fun and didn't realize the time - We were told that microphones weren't allowed for our best man/maid of honor speeches prior to the event due to the open space (so it wouldn't bother other diners), but during the event, one of the employees went to look for a microphone because she said it would be okay  Overall, I had a great experience hosting our cocktail reception here and would recommend the Eiffel Tower as a great restaurant on the strip for any special occasion!

-eu3X9uhcBKCRO_nI6WiPQ.text: I give it 4 stars for the view alone. Great atmosphere. I didn't find the food that amazing for the price, but of course I didn't try everything on the menu. Splurge for the view and make sure you specify you want a window seat in your reservation.

qFLWMNsAtIqZkAtebQmQSA.text: We went here for a birthday party.  The ambiance and view better than I had expected with the wonderful combination of just enough light to see inside and appreciate the view while being able to hear everyone in our party without raising our voices.   The wine list is extensive with a sommelier ready to help and suggest along the way. Food is fantastic.   We had duck, beef Wellington, chicken, with various sides and all of it was excellent.  I would go back, I am planning to go back in a few months.  This review gets 4/5 stars as the service was uneven.   Larger gaps timing of simple things like menu drinks and bread than should be expected in a restaurant of this caliber.  The food will bring me back, hopefully with an update to this review.

aq3gLAT_CKBP2LXlYEKgYw.text: This was an amazing experience. I went on my birthday. I was given a window seat where we got a view of the strip as well as a view of the water show. Our waiter was patient and was excellent at explaining what wines with well with different plates. He even let us taste the different wines before we decided. We were given different choices of bread. When the food came it was in small serving sizes. Prefect serving sizes because the food was so rich. I had the rack of lamb with potatoes! It's a MUST! I also got a special treat on my birthday as well! We also went ahead and ordered deserts (which we didn't need because we were full) it was the Carmel souffle! Also a MUST.   Con: It's an expensive experience but you get what you pay for.

Ut-kgb8qNFzr8EgQDepyNw.text: I wish I could give this place 5 stars but there was a hair in my food and I understand things like this happen but I'm holding off on the extra star for that reason. That issue was resolved accordingly and professionally. Besides that the view was great, the wine selection amazing and the food delicious! Even with that one issue I would visit again while in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DY92rixDOH6ofcsmfYl2Hg.text: great view of the bellagio fountain.  go to the bar and save yourself $$$.  the tables by the window are the best seats, so definitely request.  i did not notice a "collared" shirt for men on the website when reserving our table.  this "requirement" was and is beyond ridiculous.  they made my husband where a white waiter shirt that costs about .5 cents.  really?  no one was "dressed" for dinner; lots of jeans, polo shirts; no suits and ties.  lastly the food was underwhelming.  we started with the $19 Non-Traditional Caesar Salad, Warm Anchovies, Capers, and Garlic Vinaigrette.  it was just a caesar salad straight up.  we had the Rossini Style Filet Mignon, Foie Gras, Truffle Sauce $79; our steak was so "tough" we struggled to cut it with their steak knives.  our server made a point to tell us about the sharpness our knives.  our server was just Outback Steakhouse okay; not attentive, just rushed and busy.  we saw the people who served our food more than our waitress.  when we spend $500 at a restaurant, we expect a lot more than just okay.  i would recommend the view, but save your money.  have a drink at the bar, and enjoy the view.

z8x3yjxl6OcckZUZ240gpA.text: Reservations was super easy!! They texted me the day prior to our reservation and allowed me to set accommodations for our table, roses per seat and photographer for a photo. Delicious! Beautiful view! Great service!!! Well worth the money!  I got the roasted chicken with creamed spinach and mushrooms!!!! Let me just say that plate was cleaned!!! Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PuSqEaBfjoWCeYRudA3D6w.text: Had reservations for dinner with my bachelorette party Friday night. I really loved going up the elevator in the tower and the view from inside the restaurant.  I liked that they had a decent small selection of beers, decided  to try something new and shares an appetizer with my friend   We ordered the escargot. It has a good presentation and came out in a good amount of time. I really loved the little cakes that the escargot was served on.  I feel like the other servers could be a little more generous with the bread they serve with butter. I really liked the rustic bread. For my entree I has the duck with wild rice. It was perfectly seasoned and so tender  This is somewhere I would definitely recommend and visit again

s-Xne4ndRBOJrn86FhVg0A.text: Ordered beef wellington and THE KING!!!, both were amazing. We fell in love with the view while we were there. Prices are higher but its expected. Although, we got lost trying to find the restaurant but managed to come through with people's help. Lol

8KKcJfq8Ie1SE74HmFddvQ.text: A Nitty-Gritty Layman's Guide to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant  Reservations:  A must, particularly if you'd like to be seated during pique lunch or dinner hour.  If you're flexible, i.e. supper at 9:45, take a chance and walk in.  Attire:  Business casual. (We were somewhat dressier.)  I witnessed a couple being turned away because of their jeans and tee shirts.  Service:  Spot on.  Our server, Michael, was friendly and helpful.  We never wanted for a thing.  Wine:  If you're a connoisseur, I suspect you'll delight in the wine list.  If you're like me, a person who appreciates a California red, but doesn't want to spend an arm and a leg, your choices are limited.  You can order Shiraz at $12 a glass, or go for a bottle of Rodney Strong Merlot @ $59, which is what we did.  Over-priced, but less money than virtually everything else.  By the way, if you choose to bring your own wine, expect a ludicrous corkage fee of $75 per bottle.  Prix Fixe: The six course tasting menu is $125 per person.  Wine pairing is an additional $79 and if you'd like a souffle, tack on $8 more.  Two things to note: 1) if one person wants the prix fixe, everyone at the table must be in accord and order the same. 2) There is no flexibility in the  menu. Courses are as presented with no choice or substitutions. (Based on reviews of the venison, we decided to order a la carte.)  Our Meals Appetizers:   Of the appetizers, two were particularly good:  the casco bay sea scallops and my cold foie gras which was melt-in-your-mouth delicious.  I could have done without the accompanying fig compote or toast points.  (Make your selection from the bread basket instead.)  Salad: My husband and daughter ordered the market green salad, which appeared unremarkable.  Better choice may be what's called the  "non-traditional" Caesar salad with warm anchovies, capers and garlic vinaigrette.  Entrees:  Perhaps the best received dish was T's roasted rack of lamb and tomato tart.  He thought it impeccable.  My Muscovy duck breast was good, but not as tasty as duck I recently had in Atlanta. My daughter enjoyed her filet mignon, but again, there was nothing extraordinary about it.  You'll find that meats are high quality,  and cooked to perfection.  If you want it rare, you'll get it rare.  Dessert:  Curious about the "acclaimed" souffles, we ordered two.  (Note that the order must go in, early on.)  None of us were bowled over.  The chocolate souffle was ordinary, the caramel somewhat better.   Perhaps this is petty, but coffee at $7 per person seems excessive.....  In Summation: I vacillate between three and four stars.  We spent $500 for dinner that was indeed good, but hardly stand-out.  I'm happy for the experience ; the view of the fountains, as everyone points out, can't be beat.  Am I glad we came?  Sure!  Will we return?  Nope.

TZ8alNRffbp09-56id_UZw.text: The food here was excellent along with the service. We ate here for lunch and came back for dinner. The view was also a nice addition to a wonderful meal!

WYLaBY13z6l6GBoADoLoUQ.text: My wife and I went for lunch expecting the best and that is what we received. We were seated at a corner table by the window that overlooked the strip and Bellagio fountains, so the view was amazing! My wife started with the Creamy French Onion soup. If it wasn't a high end restaurant, she may have licked the bottom of the bowl, she loved it that much! We both ordered the New York Strip, hers medium rare and mine medium well. Both were cooked to perfection and were tender and juicy. The fingerling potatoes were great as well. A glass of wine for her and mixed cocktail for me made it a perfect lunch choice. Looking forward to possibly trying a night time dinner and checking out the ambiance and Bellagio fountains!

UWGR_IwRQhqHDbJ-LFZBQQ.text: This place has beautiful views of the strip. You take an elevator to get to the restaurant and you end up in the restaurant's kitchen, which was a nice touch. The kitchen is very clean and organized, it was nice to watch the chefs working in the kitchen for few minutes. The greeters are very welcoming and that make it extra special. Overall food was great, service was a little slow and not well organized. I opted for the wine and food lunch menu during restaurant week and, the wine was not served at the right time. You start the meal with a nice cucumber mint pallet cleanser, then I had a warm white and green asparagus salad. The asparagus was cooked and seasoned perfectly. Main course was a steak roulade and potato brick. The potato brick was made of she string potatoes and cooked very crispy which made it a nice texture to the soft melt in your mouth steak roulade. Steak was cooked perfectly in a traditional French style.  For dessert a strawberry fromage meringue, which was tasty, nothing out of the ordinary for this particular dessert. Overall a great experience and the only reason I didn't not give 5 starts is because of the service.

rCMomEz-PWWXxUzVOtCfWg.text: Bonjour, vous allez adorer la vue!  If your looking for romance or one of the best views on the strip, you can't go passed the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Located in one of the most obvious places in Las Vegas Paris Hotel & Casino.  Attire: Business casual would be the minimum I would recommend when dining here. When 90% of restaurants in Las Vegas are casual, Eiffel Tower has a higher than average standard.  Booking: As displayed in the yelp notes, there is two times Lunch & Dinner. You can either book online or by calling. Also don't forget you be required to place a credit card down with your booking.  So just a little run down of a few things.   A) try and grab a table facing the window, depending on the time of year the sun can get in the way till 6 or so but well worth it, the views here are amazing!  B) Service is fantastic, our wait staff were very knowledgable about the menu but also they gave insightful information about other things to do after our dinner either at Paris or other places in the strip.  C) Food here was great and my main dish of Roast Lamb was some of the best I've had in the states, however the appetizer of scallops were a little too fancy or dressed up which minimized the actual scallop.  I recommend Eiffel Tower, it is a little heavier on the wallet but the overall experience is something that is well worth the visit.  Overall: Service: 5-5 Food: 4-5 Drink: 4-5 (full bar) Coming back: Yes

tmcamzffAqbapKGi9uB60Q.text: We ain't impressed with the dinner tonight.  I made a reservation for window table and arrived early.  We got sat about 20minutes later.  We sat in the middle of the restaurant.  Being a fine dining restaurant, we should have been informed if the window table wouldn't be available or would it be a longer wait.  We advised them at the time of the reservation that, this is a birthday celebration.   Our service was great.  The food was okay.  We had few appetizers warm foie gras, steak tartar and sweet corn soup.  Then we went for foie gras and King filet mignon and Pork chop for dinner.  We saw a little bit of the Bellagio fountain view.  At this point we didn't care to try dessert anymore.  We just want to leave.  Medium Filet mignon was red.  My birthday girl didn't eat her medium cook filet.  Her complimentary dessert didn't have a candle.  How are you going to give a birthday girl desert without a candle... I guess no birthday wish to be made.   We can go somewhere else.  Overall if you want to see the epic view of Bellagio fountain.  I suggest to dine at Bellagio.  Lago has the best view of the fountain.  Very disappointed.  We frequently dine at the Top of the world which has a better view of the strip.  I can't recommend Eiffel Tower restaurant.  The stars are for overall service which was okay. The server was attentive. That's all I have to say.

f3lmXaNI8NUKOhExHN6DDw.text: Honestly I can't say enough positive things about the incredible dining experience we had here. I made a reservation on open table a couple weeks beforehand because I knew I wanted to come here with my mother while we were visiting Las Vegas. They do ask to hold a credit card to make the reservations which is a good thing to be aware of when making a res.   From the moment we went up the elevators from the Casino Floor everyone was extremely friendly and uber attentive. I have sat at the bar a couple times to have champagne and watch the fountains but this was the first time I have eaten there, we made a lunch reservation. They sat my mother and I at an incredible table overlooking the strip- with a view of the Bellagio Fountain Water Show.   Sebastian our waiter, and a True French transplant, was beyond words. He was attentive, friendly, professional and made us ladies feel like a million bucks. At one point he "noticed" I was cold and wrapped a pashmina around my shoulders in the restaurants matching crimson red color. I have been to some very upscale restaurants but I must say Sebastian was definitely one of the most incredible servers I have ever had. He lavished us with just the right amount of attention and even a special dessert!!   The food was delicious, by far our favorite meal we had while in Vegas. We started with cocktails- I had The Painkiller (delicious) and my mother had the Signature Eiffel Tower cocktail- also delightful. To start we shared the French cheese plate, which came with three different cheeses-really really amazing. And then both had the Salmon Paillard- which was fresh and amazing. We finished the meal off with the trio of sorbets which were great but paled in comparison to the delicious special pot de creme, Sebastian gave us as a thank you, holy moly it was heavenly.   Overall this place has the best, food, service and decor I have ever experienced on The Las Vegas Strip...clearly I could go on and on...can't wait to make it a staple. Thanks Eiffel Tower Restaurant!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pot De Creme

1Wnshtno7wkT-qvoNHf8ZQ.text: I made a reservation for dinner on 5th Nov 2016 at 7:45pm. When I arrived at the restaurant, I requested to have a window seat and the host told me that I would need to wait 30-45 mins for a window seat and we were promised a view to the Bellagio fountain. Me and my girlfriend came all the way from Hong Kong for the dinner therefore we agreed to wait. After a 45mins wait, we were sent to a table which was the second row and can barely see the fountain (can see the tip of the fountain, I guess). We were really upset and I went to talk to the host. The host attitude was the worst I experienced in my life. She said that we are not going to change your table under any circumstances. She said she never promised a view that can see the fountain and you were offered a window seat already.   I am extremely dissatisfied about my experience here I left the restaurant without eating anything. The manager did offer a table with a view after I was walking out the door (while the host won't agree to in the first place). Worst experience in my life. Unbelievable.

O3UTWGiaqStOThr0JkkeCA.text: We decided to give this place a try for my birthday and had high hopes but we're disappointed. We knew it was a pricey place but we're expecting a great French meal. The fish was way too salty for my taste and the portion sizes are tiny! I've had better French cuisine and walked away with a a much fuller wallet haha. Their souffle was amazing though and the service is decent. I wouldn't recommend getting a full course meal here but it's a good place to grab a drink to watch the Bellagio fountains. Make sure to get good seats tho! 2.5 stars

uTAvWvouW_ijcTPtkhT-UQ.text: Let me start by saying phenemoenal!!!! Service was amazing and on point with not a second of wanting or looking for waitress, food was amazing and very reasonably priced for what we were getting, and the view was incredible.  Unfortunately, I can't remember our waitresses name but she was always around with about being over bearing. Food came out with incredible quality and presentation as well as a timely manner between courses.   I was there as a surprise for my anniversary and it ended up making the entire trip and was by far my favorite part. I sincerely hope this will become a tradition to do on every visit to las Vegas.

PmOJLlNMOVSfCzDjqCxzIg.text: Delicious dinner with a fantastic view.  We went in for dinner before catching or flight back home and did have time to spare, therefore we had to skip appetizer and dessert in the interest of time.  Service was prompt and our server was friendly. When we mentioned we were catching a flight they seemed to step on it and got our food out pretty quickly, and handled the check with remarkable speed.  The overall the meal was very good. My only complaint would be the value proposition, which was an issue for me in many of the restaurants we visited. You pay a lot of money for good or ok food. Some of these places, like the Eiffel, have redeeming qualities that I'm sure are factored into the prices.  The setting is very romantic, red & white decor with mellow music and dim lighting.  NOTE: if there is a party going on at the club the music will reach the restaurant. Some may find that annoying.  We had a window table that offered a fantastic view of the strip. The half circle tables allow guests to sit close together while enjoying the view with no effort. If you're lucky, or if you plan it, you can get a table right across from the Bellagio and get to see the water show while enjoying your dinner. On any other table the view will still be great.  The corn soup was unimpressive. The lamb and the filet mignon were cocked perfectly, and were savory and tender. The side of potatoes au gratin wad good, the mushrooms but so much.  If you have the budget, and are looking for a romantic and impressive venue with good food, the Eiffel is a sure bet.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table view

5C3-wugRG25grdyebUZt4w.text: As a local, I am always looking for great dining on the Strip. We host plenty of guests and they are always asking where to go. For Great French food , this is the restaurant on the Strip you want for a French inspired meal with reasonable prices. For most the food here is pricey but this is Vegas and on the Strip, the prices are good for what you order and the ambiance.  The family and I had brunch here and it was excellent. Everything from the food, to the service and the great views of the Bellagio fountains were amazing. I especially liked the cold froie gras. If you are a froie gras fan, it's a must.  The service here was friendly. Our server even offered to take a picture of us. Don't be shy to be a tourist here and take pictures. How could you not with the great Strip views.  My family had a nice time here and that counts a lot when I score.  The whole experience was a win-win situation. It's sleek, intimate, amazing food and fabulous service. Did I mention the views?

UQFf2uMpdnywcdoiSfLkPQ.text: Pricy but exquisite food. I loved the lobster and all of the food I ordered. I especially enjoyed the baguette served at the beginning of the meal. The waiter was very helpful and kind. The bathroom was so nice and a woman handed me a towel and allowed me to try different perfumes available.

1ZeTXvRbapb8bfHL-a1tXQ.text: We're there for my husband birthday dinner, because my husband likes there, there's nice view just not the best view on the strip, the food just good not fantastic, we ordered the tasting menu but just the lobster, fish, Lam were delicious It is all a little overpriced but the service was good

DgpzAqR87rp5bIB9MqebKQ.text: Took my boyfriend here for his surprise 25th birthday during the last week of September and the service was impeccable. I made reservations for 5:30 PM so that we would be able to watch the sunset during our dinner. Upon arrival, the lady at the front desk checked us in and took us to our table, window seat and facing the strip where we could watch the Bellagio fountain water show.   Beef tartare: Delicious and melt in your mouth goodness. A must order. I ordered the filet mignon with the foie gras on top; buttery deliciousness. You know a steak is cooked well when you don't need any other toppings to go with it. My boyfriend ordered the"The King" Broiled Beef Tenderloin Filet Mignon with truffle sauce upon request. We also ordered a side of asparagus and mashed potatoes to share.  Shared a bottle of 2013 Sangiovese, perfect to compliment our steaks.   Dessert: Nutella souffle, need I say more. (30 minutes for preparation) It was the fluffiest, lightest, most decadent dessert I've ever tasted. I would come back just for that souffle.   Overall, it was a great dining experience. I will definitely be coming back to dine here again when I do come back to Vegas. Thank you for making my boyfriend's 25th a special one.

VdtYGpmRd1nL2gJtwolIUw.text: Wow! The Atmosphere &  food was fabulous! The staff was friendly, courteous and very attentive. We will definitely dine here again.  Thanks for the experience.
