l7kIdsN5okn_5hMKP5hiJA.text: Great atmosphere, the food was delicious and so were the cocktails. The service was excellent and I liked how all patrons get to view the kitchen saw we enter the restaurant.

1ZYJZdbSxG0cKkflj7238w.text: Absolutely delicious! Great atmosphere and the food was amazing. We shared the baked Alaskan crab for an appetizer. It was amazing! So perfect and beautifully cooked. I had the veal medallions with trumpet mushrooms and potatoes- to die for! So tender and flavorful. We shared souffles for dessert; chocolate, grand mariner and pistachio. All were terrific, but the grand mariner was my favorite. The Rose was also a perfect accompaniment.

Mg4hmzIv6q8SeSnE2LaC_g.text: Amazing Dining Experience! Wonderful views and service.  We had an awesome end booth overlooking Bellagio Water Show & the strip. I know this sounds a bit strange, but the highlight of the meal might have been the bread and butter... the butter was so creamy, silky and rich with just the right amount of salt.  I enjoyed foie gras for an appetizer, then had a fantastic petite filet cooked just how I like for dinner.  My side was the spinach au gratin... so tasty!  For dessert we shared the chocolate souffle... and they also brought out complimentary petite desserts pistachio cookie, salted chocolate caramel, homemade marshmallow.    I have to say, I made excellent choices because I personally didn't love the escargot (fishy to me but my sister loved) or the Caesar Salad (I prefer a creamy dressing to an oil based, but my friend loved it!)! Definitely too expensive for every night, but made our evening remarkable as this was the preview to an awesome Elton John concert!   A 4:30 pm reservation may sound too geriatric, but we had a leisurely dinner & were able to see both afternoon and evening views of the strip and the Bellagio water shows... and still make our 7:30p concert! What a special evening!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pvmGNNbDMQmP0FmJWG0e5Q.text: Two of the best meals we have ever ordered! The service was great, I loved the wine the waitress recommended. The New York Strip was the best I've ever had. We had a window seat overlooking the Bellagio Fountains. It was great. We then proceeded to go up to the top of the Tower after dinner! Little did I know my boyfriend was ready and waiting to propose! Best night of my life.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p_3oVyf2Zg0d_-0KuO2w8w.text: I lived in Las Vegas for 20 years. Rarely are in the strip. But this month we stayed at the Paris and absolutely loved the ambiance and flavor of this amazing dining experience. I had the Escargot and frais Grai (so) amazing food beautifully prepared. The fresh butter on the bread was phenomenal. Dan had the veal medalions which were cooked perfectly. We ordered the passion fruit souffle. Unbelievably delicious.   Cocktails were also delicious. I had the Autumn in Pais a spectacular peat martini. Dan loved the Long Island iced tea.   Our server Wes was friendly and attentive to a perfect balance.   We'll probably go back for a special occasion. It's amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal medalians
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect goose liver.

q6QXF0wtSH0u1ZxeNQUJaw.text: Rang in 2018 New Year here. The 5 course dinner exceeded all of our expectations. Simply put, the evening was incredible and certainly the best New Year's celebration. The view, ambience, food, and service was a solid 5 stars.

8Ea5erxpRhBKVlFHE32EKA.text: Review #180 - 2016  When I thought about which place to choose as my 500th review, it was pretty easy to narrow down the selection to my most recent trip to Vegas...  I was actually really tired from my flight so I didn't even have a chance to Yelp this place before I showed up for dinner.  My aunt & her son were the ones who decided on this spot so I showed up as a guest, along with my 16-year old niece who is visiting from Laos.  My experience at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant was exquisite from start to finish.  Although, my first impression as I walked toward the elevator to check in was, "OMG!  I'm so underdressed for this restaurant," which honestly rarely happens when I'm in Vegas.  Thank goodness the staffs didn't make me feel uncomfortable that I was in my tank top and super tight jeans...  The hostess walked us over to our table to meet up with our group of six & our waiter came by to ask us what we wanted to drink.  The bread guy came by and showed us a basket of 5 different breads, asking us which one we wanted.  I think I asked for the multi-grain one or something, but I remembered that it was pretty good with their butter.  I ordered the muscovy duck breast and the rack of lamb to share with my niece.  We both thought the rack of lamb was just superb!  It was cooked medium--still with some pink so it was nice and soft.  I've never been too crazy about lamb, but my niece is crazy about lamb and she savored every bite of her meal.  The duck breast was good, but nothing in comparison to the lamb.  My aunt had an order of the prime aged New York steak.  She gave me a slice to taste, and boy, was it delicious!  For dessert, we shared an order of the chocolate plate since we were all super full.  I had a bite of the chocolate souffle and the chocolate ice cream, both were divine.  I'd have to say that I wish I had an order of the chocolate souffle to myself, even though I was stuffed.  Would I come back again?  Most definitely, but the view was almost too beautiful not to have someone special to share it with...

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful view of the Bellagio Fountain...
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ApOTW53gpT6isn_NaeNd2g.text: Took my girlfriend to celebrate our 2 year anniversary. They gave us an amazing table the view was great! Right by the window where you can see the bellagio fountains. It was very romantic. Food was delicious! Definitely money well spent!

QAGOsgamYmCQnUH5wla3Jw.text: Aside from the spectacular views and amazing food, I want to thank them for their approach to being gluten free. When I informed the waitress she immediately brought me a new menu. Yup, they had an entire menu printed up with all gluten removed. Then, during bread service they brought me my own separate serving of gluten free bread fresh from the oven! Then, she discreetly asked if it was an intolerance or preference as it would take longer for the shared sides to be prepared safely.  Thank you so much to our server, Carmen, and the chefs and staff at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for making gluten free dining so easy and accommodating!

26KogEQ575JwasDHk8nWEQ.text: I just had my engagement party at Eiffel Tower restaurant few days ago, " amazing " is only word that describe my feeling now! Nice view, tasty food and very professional servers! Gary is one of them , who is very sweet and gorgeous. Last, I was very happy having desert decoration. Highly recommended.

_jrgUzM8i13NN0u13Zb-XQ.text: The good- impeccable service and amazing views!  Our server was a consummate professional- attentive, friendly, and accommodating.  We were seated in a half-moon booth in front of the windows, and were delighted with the view of the Vegas skyline and the Bellagio fountains.    I'm sorry to say, that's about the only great thing I can say.  As a long-time Vegas traveler, I can assure you the food is just mediocre.  The Beef Wellington came in at $68.00 ala carte, and was barely edible.  Although the color of the meat led me to believe it was the Medium-Rare I'd hoped for, it just didn't have that melt-in-your-mouth tenderness that you expect with a tenderloin.  My other dining companions opted for the chicken, and were also underwhelmed.  The Au Gratin potatoes weren't bad, just blah.  Even the mushrooms lacked that deep flavor that you come to expect from a high end steakhouse.    This place is just a tourist trap- the same money is better spent at Gordon Ramsay's Steak house, also located in Paris.

EkHnR6V8wM92WAi3cvmxZw.text: Visit James at Eiffel Tower for dinner during the weekend. He will make your dining experience fun! Their brunch French toast is tasty and the view is spectacular, especially at night.

FQKUci0Vl_UqMJUquJrS9A.text: One of the best restaurants in Vegas! With all the trendy chefs and new restaurant openings in Vegas, Eiffel might tend to be overlooked these days. This is surely not a place to be missed! We booked a table for lunch and got seated in the best table overlooking the Bellagio fountains. It is probably the most romantic restaurant in Vegas. The food and service was exceptional. While it is of course a great venue for special occasions, it is also fantastic to just come for lunch or dinner anytime!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PtE8rM5aHZndmMVL4JdGuA.text: Loved this place!!!  The food was GREAT, the taste, the portions for the price, and the way it was displayed.  I got The King Filet Mignon, Rossini Style Filet Mignon (a must try the sauce is mouth watering), and two orders of the Olive Oil Mashed Potatoes (our 3rd time here, they previously had some asparagus with almonds and my lord it was delicious. Sadly it was no longer in the menu) everything has always been so delicious.    We got a few drinks but i can't recall the names, now for the best desert I've ever had... drumroll....chocolate and caramel souffle  they are freshly made and coming out of the oven soft, warm, and soooooo delicious a MUST TRY.   We make reservations about a month in advance, not sure if its needed so ahead of time but it works for us.  Also, make sure to let them know you'll like a window view TRUST ME you will not regret it, the best view of the las vegas strip and dancing fountains.  Romantic and such beautiful views.

V8GsTUHCJz3D2tFSsI_ZeA.text: Horrible customer service. I've made a reservation for two on Valentine's Day over a week ago. Now they say my reservation is cancelled?!?  I call and the hostess is rude and i ask to speak to a manager regarding this. And she hangs up on me. Then i call back and the manager Jennifer refuses to help square this away. She gives me a different time then what i asked for. And then refuses to to help secure the reservation. I already ordered flowers from them. Hope I'm not charged!!! Hope to hear back from GM regarding the unprofessionalism and simply secure my reservation. It's more than Valentine's Day for us. And i work in restaurants on the strip, and their staff should be more professional. Not a good start. I want my reservation confirmed in writing if i am to go there at this point as i wouldn't want to be shunned away on that night

Y-oXmQXgJMYFNBK_bO4WJQ.text: Great food, Great views! Loved the trout. Things are pricey but between the food and ambiance it's a great experience. I also commend them for having the entrance through the kitchen. They keep things clean and well organized, sign for me that this is a well run operation. Service is on the slow side but coming here shouldn't be something you rush through, enjoy.

CRIKDUrjOrytdY0g3Q0IIQ.text: So the food is not entirely out of this world, but the experience was really cute and fun!  Great place for groups!  They don't usually reserve a specific table, but my friend called and spoke with the manager and arranged a table with the best view of the bellagio fountains and a large booth with additional chairs to accommodate 7 people comfortably.      Honestly, I'm not really sure what the heck we all ordered for our appetizers and sides, but I remember them all being very good.  I do remember my main entree being the new york steak with bone marrow.  it was really good, but i've had much better.   They have a cute engagement package, as one of my friend's proposed to my best friend here :) They offer a photographer, along with a cute miniature eiffel tower they bring out on a dessert table that you can put a ring inside :)  Needless to say, it was a special night for all of us that we will never forget.  If you are looking for a restaurant with a view with pretty good food, choose this place.  If you are looking for a trendy spot with pretty amazing food, choose elsewhere.

01g5bwVvqhDMiV1UMtmirQ.text: My wife and I spent our 10 year anniversary here. 10 years prior this is the location I chose to propose so it held great meaning to us to return 10 years later. I came by before they were open and the maitre d' and manager were more than accommodating to my requests for a very special evening. I was able to have confidence in the staff to handle my wife's surprise anniversary ring with confidence. The meal was executed expertly. The one thing that I can say that had a slightly negative impact on me was the fact that I said a personal all time high for the amount of money I spent on a single meal for just two people. Spend more money on this one meal then most people spend on food for several months. The reason it doesn't lower the star rating is because I did that to myself. I figured you only have one 10 year anniversary and might as well do it big.

LKJQ1XFV1yKwzD1pTIfAcA.text: My boyfriend made reservations here and I'm glad he did! This was the most romantic dinner I have ever had! We were seated by the window and were able to watch the Bellagio water show the entire night. Between meals, they gave us small, but very succulent food too. We also ordered dessert and it was a plateful of different types of chocolate! The bill was only $130 so it wasn't bad at all! Very reasonable price for a dinner for two.   They also offer professional pictures to buy when you first step in. They have a perfect background setting inside the restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bj4YNdQGokPg3zJ5AkqoxQ.text: This was our second time here and we loved it just as much as the first time. We wanted to celebrate our honeymoon that night and the manager Lyle was super helpful. We got a coveted window spot overlooking the fountains, our waiter Igor was very friendly and the food was great. In addition to that, compliments of the manager, we were served an appetizer and dessert to help celebrate our occasion. We had appetizers, entreees and dessert. Everything was what we expected and more. We will definitely keep returning everytime we are in Vegas.

Ov3YUELH7ORq13kQE974Lg.text: This place has a gorgeous view of Bellagio's water fountain, and the restaurant itself is quite swanky as well. Be prepared to order more than two dishes per person because the dishes are teensy.   My halibut was super dried out and overcooked. But the restaurant is gorgeous, has immaculate service & is a great place for a date or anniversary.

RlUoRYd-d5HVoCwz5b9eOg.text: We went here twice on a recent trip to Vegas. The first time was fantastic -- we were early for lunch, had a great view of the Bellagio fountains and the staff was attentive. We had excellent dishes. To my surprise and happiness, they had gluten free cheese poufs instead of a basket of bread. If I could have ordered an entire plate of those, I would!  On account of the nice time we had there at lunch, we popped up there for dessert late on Tuesday night after a fairly disappointing night. We thought that dessert, drinks and the fountain would perk us back up and make a nice end to our trip. Big mistake. We were dressed for where we had originally planned to go, which meant nice jeans and sweaters. I wear semi-religious clothing and that's OBVIOUS when you look at me. Despite the fact that we did not meet their dress code, we were ushered into the elevator (unaware of the dress code, mind you. We are not regulars and it is not posted.) My partner was instantly pulled aside by the hostess and asked what his jacket size was, etc.  I realize they are a nice restaurant and they want a particular reputation. Damn near ten at night on Tuesday, however, is maybe not the time to enforce it, especially as it was not posted, and the downstairs elevator staff did not warn us. I realize we are not swanky. We probably are not their desired clientele,  but given that we stated we just wanted drinks and dessert, they might have stuffed us in a corner and called it good enough? (For the record, we left -- a jacket over a sweater in a restaurant would have been misery.)  Bottom line, they need to post their dress code. And if they insist men wear jackets, then they need to put jackets over girls that are wearing inappropriate outfits too. Otherwise they come across as a badly-disguised meat-market. And maybe, on a weekday night, that's exactly what they are?  I'd still recommend this place for lunch, but I don't think I'll be back because of how badly they handled their own policy.

v9m2JRsqiQ7ok_hdwLKQ_w.text: Eleven guys in Vegas for a bachelor party/weekend.  We entrust one of them to pick a place for our one nice dinner there.  We figure he'd choose a nice steakhouse.  Instead he goes with French... Odd choice but since the bachelor was fine with it we all agreed.  To me, French restaurants present an atmosphere of romance and a classy dining experience.  Not a place where guys can get rowdy, stuff themselves, and down some beer.  We just had to be on our best behavior.  Despite my reservations, I had a wonderful dining experience.  Our menu was laid out in front of us.  I believe it was a pre-fixed menu or perhaps my friend chose the courses.    We started with White Almond Dusted Sea Scallops, Potato Galette, and Tarragon.  Scrumptious.  Up next, Romaine Lettuce and Poppy Seed Tuile.  ::chomp::chomp::  Done.  My buddy Andy sitting next to me doesn't eat veggies.  "Hand it over buddy!" Our main course - Surf and Turf - Beef Tenderloin w/ Lump Crab Crust.   Highly recommended.  We paired our meal with a 1.5 L bottle of Zinfandel.  Lastly, the Creme Brulee was just okay.  A bit too sweet even for a sweet tooth like myself.   Portions were bigger than what I expected for a French restaurant.  Service was excellent.  Our server was attentive and patient.  I hadn't even paid attention to the view.  I was too busy eating and jib jabbering.  HOWEVER, my friends and I nearly had a coronary when the bill arrived.  The breakdown came out to $170 per person...  OUCH.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brulee
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and Turf - Beef Tenderloin w/ Lump Crab Crust
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Almond Dusted Sea Scallops, Potato Galette, and Tarragon

qbJhIL9LCSFE-4S7BmyJ_g.text: Great service, amazing food, beautiful view...what more could you ask for? Well honestly, I'd ask to not be packed in like sardines and a somewhat less noisy environment considering the pricey-ness of restaurant.   I loved that there is a dress code in this restaurant. I loved the menu choices. I thought the service was outstanding. I loved the view from our window seats as we watched the fountain show at the Bellagio below and enjoyed the Vegas strip. The food was perfection. The chocolate souffle was absolutely to die for! With all of this perfection going on, I truly feel silly even mentioning the negatives, but for me, the experience really has to be impeccable to give that 5 star rating. We were packed in so tight that my husband and I almost had to look at each other sideways to enjoy each other's company. And because we are packed in like sardines, the noise level is far more than what it should be for a more upscale type of place.   That having been said, I can't wait to go back and see if perhaps I can give it a 5 star rating next time!

mTMASIWBFEhOLM138MeMZQ.text: Put this on your "bucket list".... must have Lamb Burger from Eiffel Tower restaurant @ Paris Hotel  This lamb burger is the F'ing Bomb. So much flavor. For $16 , you get lamb burger with fries. Add a "coke" plus tax tip is $25 for the Lamb Burger Experience... Well worth it.  There's a dress code. And you have to make your way through a casino. But the food is magnifique !  Very Professional and courteous staff. Spectacular view

PSQSNatuF4IISijyZR8BvQ.text: The food was wonderful, although overpriced and not the best I had the service and atmosphere make up for it. If you want to impress someone take them here. You have a wonderful view of the bellagio water show. We didn't have reservations, although it was on a Monday night at 10 pm they took us immediately to the best seat in the house. Id highly recommend.

D5DsTdwzYy50BZNCHjgoFQ.text: Very romantic!  If this place doesn't get you laid or at least to third base, I don't know what will!  The views of the Bellagio fountains are priceless!  Too bad you can't hear the songs that the water is dancing to! We came to celebrate our anniversary! He got brownie points, that's for sure!  Our friends have gotten engaged here!  So again, romantic place!   The food was absolutely excellent!  Pricey, but well worth it!  The drinks were amazing too!  It better be for about $20/drink!  I highly recommend the filet!  The bartender recommended it and now I must pass it along!  The waiter brought out both the red wine and hollandaise sauce!  I LOVE them both! So ask to get all the sauces if possible and decide for yourself!

GjEELtYNpxGCb-5f4TdHDA.text: The Eiffel Tower is where you should have your next special, romantic celebration while in Vegas.  I reserved a table for my wife and I to celebrate her big 30.  I initially reserved us a table at 9:45pm (it was late since we flew from Seattle that evening).  However, due to traffic and some delays, I called the Eiffel Tower to push back the time to 10:15pm and they graciously accommodated my request despite their busy night.  At first I wasn't sure how to get there, but the friendly valets at the Paris Las Vegas happily showed us the way.  You get there through a private elevator in the middle of the casino.  The ride up the glass elevator was a perfect start to the experience, which takes us to the kitchen where you can see the busy chefs working on the meals.  We were seated by the window with a great view of the iconic Bellagio Fountains, which made the experience very romantic, with its water show coming up every 15 minutes.  We had a couple of glasses of wine --- they have a great selection.  The bread was awesome too (good bread usually means everything else is good!).  I ordered the new york steak with bone marrow and cab reduction and thoroughly enjoyed it!  My wife ordered their "surf and turf" offering --- prime beef strip loin with butter poached lobster.  Amazing dish.  In a city filled excesses of buffets and the like, a nice sit down dinner with perfectly sized portions is like an oasis in the desert.  We had very good service, probably because we were served by the restaurant captain, Ron Gonzales.  His service, attention and graciousness scores five stars itself.  He took lots and lots of photos of us, even suggesting that we call him when the fountains start dancing to capture a perfect shot.  He was very quick and offered wonderful suggestions, such as the chocolate souffle which is a must try.  To top it all, Ron served my wife with a complimentary chocolate pudding with a big "happy birthday" written in chocolate.  The pudding was decadent!  Make sure you call the restaurant and advise them of what you want to do, like birthday celebrations (I hear they do proposals too).  They will work with you on your requests/demands.  Overall a great experience!  Will come back again definitely!

Hact6BAJc9QsLMoWeut3fw.text: Magnificent food. Worth every penny. Had lunch and everything was first class. Service was fantastic.

V6vVJ2R9pZGR8LC4YKchwQ.text: I loved pretty much everything about this place!! Once the elevator doors open into the restaurant you are greeted with a look into the kitchen and all the chefs in their crisp white jackets and chef hats scrambling around to get everything perfect. Instantly we felt like their number one guest because we were quickly seated at our table with not a minute of wait. There isn't a bad seat in the house, we were a party of 5 so we had a nice big table in the middle. Dinner couples of 2 get the best seats in the house right up to the window with a spectacular view. If you're lucky you'll even get to see the Bellagio water show!   We shared the Beef Carpaccio for an appetizer. DELICIOUS. We gobbled up two plates of that within minutes! They then surprised us with a complimentary little shot glass full of carrot soup which was to die for. The perfect amount to keep our taste buds entertained before the main course. I had the Steak with bernaise sauce, medium well cooked to perfection, and the sauce (which came on the side) was tasty too. I cleaned my plate! Make sure to do the a la cart options as well. Their potatoes au gratin is literally the best i've ever tried in my life. (Sorry mom)   Service was excellent. View was great. Food= amazing!!! I definitely want to go back next time i'm in Vegas and highly recommend it. Great for groups or a romantic dinner date!   I just wish they didn't charge an extra 15$ to go to the top of the tower, especially after we just spent a chunk of change on dinner. :(

Sx4AQsq8KinQYCRymYYwIg.text: You pay for the view. That said they are French so it is very rich and portions small. The service is fine but the cuts of beef are not. The price reflects a better cut like prime and not grizzle that is served for a NY. My replacement was filet again not soft or mouth watering though sauces are good.The lamb is butter, meaning good.  Soup okay thought the Caesar sale just not the finest, a real dressing has eggs but some lemon is recommended to bring the flavor up. Do not drink the house bubbles as this wine will be felt  the next day. Wine list is amazing but more tha double retail. The deserts are a masterpiece and some ideas to ad it a raspberry sauce not on the menu. Coffe is French and all visuals great. Eat light and be happy. Cost about $75-100 a person.

FWhtNLXramS7Z_6NQ94LmQ.text: Eiffel Tower Restaurant would be the epitome of fine dining.  I would recommend making reservations as it can be busy during weekends.  Also, do remember to dress up for this dining occasion.  I've been here twice, and literally every table in the restaurant has a view of Bellagio's water show.  At night, the strip lights really come alive, and you can take it all in while enjoying a bottle of Grgich Hills cabernet sauv.  This is a great place for a romantic dinner, or a friendly get together.  They definitely have enough waitstaff to accomodate both.  The bartender is friendly, so if you have to wait for a table don't hesistate to grab a cocltail.   I had the roasted lamb rack with a side of asparagus.  The lamb was cooked to a perfect medium rare, a deep purple in the center.  It was crusted in pepper and served with some grilled tomatoes.  The lamb had the consitency of cotten candy and melted in my mouth.  The asparagus was cooked perfectly in butter and topped with parmesan cheese bits.  The asparagus rivaled my entree in quality.  I also had the opportunity to try the filet mignon, as well as the veal medallions, and both met or exceeded my standards.  We finished with a choclate souffle, which I must wholeheartedly recommend.    The service exceeded my expectations.  My drinks never dipped below the halfway point.  There was perhaps one waiter for every person in our party.  Our waiter was friendly, funny, and knowledgeable on every item on the menu.  Overall, a great experience.  Although the dinner is very costly, I must recommend it if you love fine dining.    PROTIP:  You must order the souffle at the beginning of the meal because it takes a while for them to prepare it, so let your waiter know.

chjRnlIJJn5epebq5uA4gA.text: Amazing view and impeccable service. A wonderful place to celebrate or commemorate a special occasion. The Char Broiled Filet Mignon in red wine sauce with Classic Potato Gratin is our go to. The filet melts in your mouth for an mouthwatering experience. To finish it off we love their creme brulee, all this while enjoying an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains.

cYkSWFcHG0oAV8LA2WpQog.text: We ate here for a nice dinner when we were in Vegas. The food was ok... nice atmosphere but nothing special really. My duck was a little greasy. The drinks on the other hand are amazing! Now we just go up there for a drink. My favorite is the one with champagne and fresh fruit! Expensive thought! $22! But worth it.. just not having more then 1!

q3m1eWJp1xp1oi9LqRbqfA.text: This Eiffel Tower has everything you would want in a romantic dinner in Vegas! When you take the elevator up you are greeted upon exit just in view of the tone setting, fast paced kitchen. As the host immediately guides you in dinning room you receive an eyeful of the beautiful Bellagio waters! The view is amazing from anywhere in the house! Along with the view the food is just as satisfying! The tomato soup is a great start! Steaks are this restaurants know specialty but the Halibut with bacon is as delicious. With special packages available for all occasions, The Eiffel Tower restaurant is one of the most exciting and romantic ways to start a night out on the town in Vegas!

A_2qznI4lwUEB8mVc3hO7g.text: We had a table with the view of the Bellagio fountains. It doesn't get any better than this. The food was very good. The service splendid. But my goodness the VIEW! We made my reservation at 5pm right when the sun started to set and it was maaaagical.

FGyquP62cOSP_UbiR4D8hA.text: We had booked our reservations before 5pm. As indicated on the sign next to reservation counter. If we book before 5pm, we would get window seating. Instead we were placed next to entrance where the kitchen staff would enter in and out of. We still had somewhat of a view but only when the waiter had moved out of the way and when the other tables in front of us shifted their heads to the side. You would think that at a fine dining restaurant,  plate settings and napkins would already be there at table prior to our seating. We had a party of 3 and were missing 2 napkins. And they use fake battery operated candles.lame. For the amount of staffing they had,  service was slow. We didn't get any hello or welcome. No such acknowledgement. I don't know if it was because we were the only Asian clients there at the time or if we weren't dressed up enough to be treated as clients.  The scallops and escargot for appetizers was good.  Beef wellington was recommended and it was OK. The steak in it was cooked to perfection but the pastry puff on the outside was a bit too thick and slightly soggy. Our server didn't come back until the end to check up on us. By then, I just wanted to get out of there. My stomach was knotting up. My husband and best friend had stomach issues that whole night too. We had to end our night short due to whatever we had consumed there. What a waste of a night in Vegas.  The whole experience was no fine dining. Service wasn't great. Food was just OK until we got sick from it. Never coming back.

XahRI5zWRUzWqhvuUjtsnA.text: First, this is not a place for a quick good meal. This is an upscale restaurant that has a very nice upscale vib with great views of the the strip and the fountains at the Bellagio. I was amazed that even here, they allow the Vegas slob wear that is so prevalent in Las Vegas. We went here before a show and dressed accordingly for a nice upscale restaurant, and found that over half of the patrons were in slob wear. Certainly takes away from the experience. The service was impeccable, the food was very good, the view was great, the prices were extremely high, as is most of the nice restaurants in the Las Vegas area. For a dinner for two with two glasses of wine with tip was $250. There were several people using some type of dinner promotion here they were limited to a short menu and predetermined items, that was a lot cheaper, so this is one option to consider. We enjoyed our dinner as we were celebrating 40 years of marriage, but we would probably not go back due to the unrealistic pricing. This is by far the most expensive meal that we have ever had for the two of us.

4zTl5JV2-ZedM_5BxuHeUQ.text: There is a lot of reviews with many stars on this place but from someone who has eaten at some of the best restaurants ever i give this an ok.  You are basically paying for the view.  The food is something you can make at home if you know how to cook.  We went for Valentines and it was hell! We had made reservations for 9:30 and were not seated until like 10:30.  We had a few drinks while we waited at the bar, listening to the bar tender compare it was as romantic as a train station.  We had reserved window seats and were sat as far from the windows as possible.  The food was warm not hot.  There was no dress code??!! There was a mix of people from family with children to guys with street girls ( showing everything)  and a few decent people.

Wzcb5bk-CNDuEDPjTkwaYQ.text: let me add that this restaurant is good and the service is great and so is the food, but while we were sitting we had to scoot over for other people to sit near the window facing the bellagio, I think they have too many tables too close to each other watching the water fountains, and the prices are WAY too much I would rather go to Olives at the bellagio and get a fountain side seat for cheaper $$ and get WAY better food and WAY better views. check my review and picture I put on the review for " TODD ENGLISH'S OLIVES".

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THIS IS THE EIFFEL TOWER BURGER,
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THIS IS THE CHOPPED SALAD

D5pVJg_I8RzDWpsvo8wyfw.text: came here valentines! i don't recommend, unless u like pre-set menus, which alot of places do on a night like valentines, but every thing was great! from the service to the food. it was all good!!!!  food was really great. meats were perfectly cooked and all the flavors were on point. i love french food!  i recommend always having reservations here because it is a high-end restaurant. this place is pricy too so dont come here broke. the view is beautiful! u have views of the strip and of bellagio and other surrounding hotels.  when the menu is not preset they have exotic meats such as rabbit and such. havn't had them yet, but that is what i wanted on vday and was surprised with a preset menu. it was still a great experience.

QayPsOj3mUfNuS3GeazsjQ.text: the boyfriend brought me here for our one month anniversary...LOL yea he's a regular Casanova....(fyi i'm writing my review two years later..and i'm still with the same boyfriend if you're wondering...)   first off...it's a gorgeous restaurant...from what i remember we took and elevator up and waited 5 mins or so to be seated (we had reservations) my boyfriend had asked for a table by the window...so we sat looking out onto the strip and had the water as our show (from bellagio hotel) WARNING the tables facing the windows are small it's like half a table....when we arrive they had a bouquet of flowers on the table waiting for us (per the boyfriend request)   since it's been  a while i cant name our dishes...but i remember it being al carte (however u spell it) so on top the main meat dish ($35-50) you would order a side ($10-15) if i remember correctly i had the lamb while the boyfriend had the fillet Mignon....they were BOTH PERFECT the meal was perfect though it was expensive it was definitely well worth it! (i've been to other expensive restaurants and the food was mediocre (definitely not cool)  Service: was great...had a fairly young waiter but definitely attentive...he even conversated with the boyfriend for a bit and took as many pictures of us as we  liked =)  break down of the money  for half a dozen of roses in a vase (ran about $70)  food + drinks ($100)  total was around $200 ...it was once in a while kind of thing but to this day the boyfriend and i remember this date very well...it was a great experience definitely worth it

5L6deb2FcjnbOU2pkwaz8g.text: This is our second time visiting this restaurant, must make a reservation.  Its not cheap, but the quality of food and ambience are worth paying for.  A refreshing break from las vegas, we tried the 5 course meal which turned out to be very good except for the veal, I personally didnt like it but the rest of the meal was delicious.  The other four, or five things were delicious.  We were seated by the window, with a view of the bellagio fountain that added a nice touch.  The only low point of the meal was our server this time, he was dry and a little rushed.  didnt take any time explaining the menu, or even bothering to ask why we were there like others do.  It would have made our special ocassion even better.  The first time we went there, we had an older gentleman that was exceptional so I guess it depends who you get.  If service would have been better I would give it 5 stars.

JQ_2IZOh3ijSOVRyD7pi9A.text: Food was good but not necessarily what I consider over-the-top as their prices reflect. Definitely paying for the view which is pretty awesome. Biggest complaint we had is that there is a dress code for men and that doesn't seem to be advertised anywhere. Women can pretty much show everything but guys better have on long pants and socks or you'll be given a pair to put on. The socks were new. We all hoped the pants were laundered in between wears...

7ztubEzdfb_6_pafVdii8w.text: We happened to notice there was going to be Easter Brunch here, and we thought it sounded fun, and the menu looked good so we decided to go.  The view really is amazing.  I would completely recommend going here with parities of two, because you get an amazing view of the strip and the fountains at the Bellagio.  The service was phenomenal.  More than to be expected.    The food was pretty damn good too.  We ordered a bottle of champagne, and they started us with a little amuse bouche of Parmesan flan, which was quite tasty, and some cheese puffs. We both got appetizers, he got the Foie Gras, and I got the Blue Cheese Souffle Pudding.  The Foie Gras was probably better, but I'm a huge fan of blue cheese, and the flavors were subtle.  Here's where the meal gets fun.  His entree was the Omelet Souffle and mine was the Baked Crepes.  The waiter wanted to make sure we weren't in a hurry since the Omelet Souffle takes about twenty minutes to fire after our appetizers.  We were fine with that.  So after our appetizers were finished we waited and waited for our meal and nothing showed up.  Finally he decided to go the restroom and the manager shows up to tell us there was some sort of mistake and our order got lost.  That's fine, we can wait, we really had nothing else going on that day.  So they left to make sure it started and after the bf came back, I suggested he try to get some free drinks out of it while I ran to the restroom.    I came back and there were two glasses of champagne!  The waiter took it upon himself to give us a couple of more glasses.  Rock on!  When the food finally showed up, the manager told us the entire meal was being comped, so enjoy ourselves!  Rock on again!  After all that the meal was free, and very tasty.  We said we might go back sometime for dinner if we're back in Vegas.  I even picked up a copy of the cookbook because the food was good and I wanted to try some of the recipes!

FQVeGKJFbOr0aetJykxEJQ.text: AMAZING what a great time my wife and i had. The food was great the service over the top and the view was out of this world. Thank you again for such an awsome night,

JLByO_dCz1dNMRFA0nA2cQ.text: This is a nice restaurant if want to make an impression. Food is adequate, don't think really what you pay. I guess paying for the view and location. There are better options in the strip and downtown. Maybe less pretentious but a better experince overall. Be ready to spend big bucks. For example, went with wife and spent 250 tip included for salad,entree and souffle. No drinks except water. Tables are way too close. I could hear next table's conversation even if I tried not to. Unaceptable for a place this expensive.

Jvkp-fTIeATqvHolCAZfow.text: It was our anniversary and Valentine's Day so we wanted to have a memorable, romantic dinner.  We chose the Eiffel Tower Restaurant with the ads promoting the view of the Belagio fountains and the sunset.  We were greeted by 3 hostesses and were seated immediately.  I had requested a table by the window and expressed that a few times.  However, we were seated at a table not only away from the windows but, with huge steal beam to look at.  I told the hostess we did not want to sit there.  We were seated at a table without a steal beam.  Other than that, the evening was perfect!  There was a prix fix meal which was 3 courses, delicious each one and presented to perfection. The service was impeccable and flowed seamlessly. We both were studying the wine list obviously trying to decide which wine we wanted.  The Somalia apparently saw that and came to the table to help us out.  Very observant..we liked that!   The wine he suggested and brought to us was a perfect pairing with our meal.   I was able to see the fountains go off several times and people that did get to sit next to the windows had no problems with me standing behind them taking a few pictures.  We so enjoyed ourselves and certainly had a memorable and romantic dinner!  We  have now put the Eiffel Tower on the list of restaurants we must return to on future Vegas trips.    There was one other little issue:  my husband's chair had no padding in it anymore.  He was squirming in his seat and finally told me that his chair was like sitting on concrete.  I told him to say something but, he wouldn't.  We looked at the chairs next to us and figured out that they need to be replaced.  They were pretty much showing a lot of wear and tear.  For not the fact that we were seated in front of a steal beam when asked several times to have a table with a view and the worn out chair, I'd give this restaurant 5 stars!  : )

pddX3c7RNmiZBKwjqZHOOg.text: I heard this place was going to be one of the best places to have a romantic dinner in Vegas. After having dinner there, I do not want to go back again! The service was terrible! Maybe it was only us, but there were many things wrong. I have to blame most of my horrible experience on the waiter (who was the oldest man there!). He asked us in the beginning if we wanted their chocolate souffle, and told us that it would take about 30 min-1 hr to make, so he recommended us to order it in the beginning. So, we did. We waited a long time for our main entrees of salmon and filet mignon, but we didn't mind since my boyfriend and I were watching the Bellagio water show almost every 15 min there. I also ordered some scallops that were pretty good for an appetizer. At any rate, a couple behind us arrived 15 min after us, but were served before us. We found out later, as they stopped to eat their food, that they received the wrong order. It was ours, since I overheard them mentioning their sides. It just happened that they ordered the same main entrees as us. The waiter brought it back to the kitchen, and later brought it out (I know it was reheated in the kitchen) and gave it to us! I know this because my dish was overcooked and my side was on my plate! Horrible!   Not only did they get our main entrees wrong, but the dessert didn't come until an hour after our main entree was finished! The waiter kept telling us it would be coming out, and blamed that the oven was broken (when in reality....he FORGOT that we ORDERED IT!).   There was nothing really special about the dishes. I definitely would not go back there again, especially if that waiter is there! I know this restaurant has a long waiting list, but it was not worth the wait in the end.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from restaurant

L1zkgk_7s-S7fInZTEN0mQ.text: Excellent but accessible French food can be difficult to find.  The best places are often mired in complex and difficult to decipher menu description and/or ruined by stuffy service.  The more accessible places can easily dumb down the food resulting in bland food covered by thick, heavy sauces.   The Eiffel Tower restaurant strikes a remarkable and enjoyable balance by preparing many traditional french dishes, but explaining them in an enjoyably simple - but not dumbed down - manner and avoiding too many exotic ingredients that would turn off the average diner (escargot are not in every dish...).   As what may be an "above average" diner though, the menu, food, service, and atmosphere were all excellent.  It was a special occasion meal for us, being the anniversary of our engagement under the Eiffel Tower (the real one in Paris) while we were on our honeymoon.  My new bride was a little wary of going to an all-French restaurant, but found plenty to choose from.  All our food was excellent, from start to finish.  The sauces were rich and silky, but never heavy and smothering.     Service was excellent, with the entire staff from the elevator operators to the busboys providing elegant, dignified service.  As for atmosphere, it is a dark, classy restaurant with small white linen-covered tables. The view can be amazing - it is right across from the Bellagio hotel and resort and has a front row view of the fountain shows.   Not a cheap place for dinner, but highly recommended for a special occasion event.

0QhjwBUjM4Hus68Uco_c4g.text: So I just got back from LV and I neeeded to yelp every place I went to starting with the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.   We were late for our reservation, but still they were friendly and seated us right away. We took our time with the Wine List (which is a NOVEL!) and they were very helpful in trying to find the perfect wine for us.   The Service was EXCELLENT!!! Top notch!! Our waiter was so funny and totally went along with all of our jokes. I looooved this place.   Oh right, so I got the Beef Wellington, it was really delicious, but wayyy too herby. My friend got a Filet Mignon and she was in loooove with it. All the other girls I was with loooved their dishes as well. We all ordered different dishes and it was marvelous...  Duck 2 ways Filet Mignon Beef Wellington (me) and two fish dishes I can't remember right now....but it looked and smelled greatt!!!  At the end we got a souffle and although it wasn't what we were expecting (the quick deflation with the pouring of cream and chocolate) it was still yummmmy.   All in all, great experience and had a GREAT time! =)  Oh and we had a great view of lovely couples in love taking pictures and eating all romantically *insert sarcasm here* -____________-  We were a group of 5 bitter and angry girls...hahahaha  oh, the water show wasn't too bad, but it just isn't the same without the "Cause I'm proud to be an American, where at least I know I'm freeee" song.

rrAw1cW6EHxHZcLhTr6A9A.text: Just to let you know, most of the restaurants I've been to have a drive through, so fancy pants places really don't impress me. The hope is that the food is good, the service excellent, yadda yadda.  And in my book, this place is just okay -- especially considering the prices.  First off, we didn't really make reservations, so they sat us away from the windows facing that way cool Bellagio water show. The date asked about it, and the fancy-pants hostess make some comment that was like "oh, those seats are for reserved guests."   Okay, whatever, you lose a star for not seeing a couple that was willing to pay for the place.  Now I actually thought the walk past the kitchen was cool, because it was SPOTLESS. Not bad. You get back part of a star.  The service was pleasant, but I thought a bit over-frenchified like they were trying too hard to be French without them being French. If you have a French restaurant and you expect people to pay $90 a person, they better speak French. You lose another star, my friend.  The duck was a bit "tough", and figuring this was a fancy pants Paris restaurants, you would think that the duck would have been better. The venison was good. The date had a souffle. It was cool how they poured the sauces in, but the souffle wasn't "top notch."  Nice place? Sure, can't beat the view, it you get one of those tables.  Would I go back? No. This is one of those enforced fancy restaurants for the masses -- bring in the celebrity chef to create a menu, and serve high priced average food to people that don't better.

ZdfmYm48YbWUmQ4IggNw0Q.text: French food, wonderful chef's tasting menu.  Service was not obnoxious or intimidating like some can be.  We went for our honeymoon and were treated extraordinarily well. Though I get the feeling that was not out of the ordinary, seemed everyone got the royal treatment there :)  We loved it, and we are serious foodies. Reminded me of our tasting extravaganza at Tru in Chicago, only for 1/2 the price.  Make reservations and get there early to ensure the view you want..  We had a view of the Bellagio just at, and after sundown and the water show made a really beautiful backdrop to our wonderful meal.  Also, part of Lettuce Entertain You network, so rack up some additional points here. Glad the waiter mentioned ito us, we'll get a nice free meal out of those rewards!

EeqyTM6fjYCDss02EWT0ag.text: Food: Decent non-authentic French food. Nothing unique or memorable. Shrimp cocktail appetizer came with like 3 shrimps. Food alone, would merit a 2 star rating.   Drink: Wine and beer. No good beer choices. My girlfriend had a champagne and peach puree cocktail. That was best item of our meal. Nice subtle alcohol, fair balance of sweet and tangy, worth every penny.   Service: Average.   Ambiance: Windows, windows, windows. Mucho sunshine during lunch. Pretty sweet if you get a table by the window. Watch the fountains of Bellagio and a view of the strip.

aZGb3T3CZXti_nxT2QxeZQ.text: Had an anniversary dinner planned and made reservations 3 weeks in advance to get a window seat. I got a call the night before my reservation saying it was cancelled. The lady on the phone said the restaurant was closed. She didn't even offer an apology or any real alternative (She said I could come in for lunch or brunch). She acted like I was the one cancelling the reservation. Horrible customer service and will never go here. Obviously they are only looking to make money and do not care about their customers.

Y2KmSpEPEU8nn1qL-xR_AA.text: Food and ambience were fine,  price was what you would expect,  BUT our waiter was horrible making negative (in his brain probably smart!) primitive remarks to make us order more food or drinks. Real shame.

xyiT4KgXv7OUwRmu5QhqsA.text: An amazing restaurant! The king filet was delicious and cooked to perfection. The oil mashed potatoes were perfect for sharing. I enjoyed the creme brulee to finish off the dinner! Amazing place and cannot wait to return as soon as possible.

BDN2GdGLa8sa6MdiT8ciYQ.text: The think the ambiance of this place is amazing. I got sat right in front of one of the windows and had an amazing view of the strip. I went for lunch and ordered the parmesan crusted chicken with potatoes and veggies. It was just okay. The veggies were just steamed. The food came out REALLY fast, which was kind of suspicious. I do have to give it to them on the service though. It was impeccable. Also, dress up if you go otherwise you will feel out of place - even during the day.

w3_sihYSZgFdPqtmo60CeA.text: Wanted to try something new this trip... earlier in the day passed by and asked if we needed reservations. We were told no because it would be slow. When we came back for dinner there was a crowd of people going up in the elevator with us when we were there first and everyone bum rushed out trying to go in front of us but luckily we made it in front of everyone that was on our elevator. Once we were seated it took a long time to get drinks, order & bread they offer to everyone.   Only reason giving 4 stars is because the food was good! I recommend the salmon, filet mignon and gratin potatoes.

xL7ppuvpC8UNX5L16afgjw.text: The food was not good at all. And the service was not good at all. The only thing i enjoyed was the wine and the view. I would not recommend eating here.

VVyBbvQgG9pYLNpsklW5NA.text: I was actually quite taken with this restaurant - it has lovely views of the Vegas strip, right in front of the Bellagio fountains, and has tons of tables right up against the glass that made for a really romantic lunch.   My husband and I were actually somewhat frazzled when we arrived. We had come all the way to the strip via the monorail from our hotel and Hash House A Go Go was a mad house at The Linq. We searched several other places and were weary from the crowds when we happened upon the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. The host assured us that the wait was minimal and whisked us off to the elevator. When we got out of the elevator, another host escorted us to their waiting area and offered us a mini sample of their signature cocktail, the Can-Can which was exceptionally nice. We waited under ten minutes and were given a table with a perfect view of the Bellagio Fountains.   The brought a cold cauliflower soup as well as portions of crusty baguette that were excellent, to start.  We ordered coffee, an iced tea, the French BLT Tower, as well as the Paillard of Salmon. Both were very decent portions and eloquently plated. My salmon was very decent, although it did not have the fatty quality that I love about salmon. It appeared to be pounded very thin onto my oval plate, and a salad was precariously stacked to the ride side of it. To the left, was a lemon in cloth. The top had been brushed with a mustard glaze and spices - it was very good, albeit different than I'm used to.   We sat and watched the fountains for a while, and really enjoyed ourselves. The environment was in stark contrast to the hustle and bustle outside, and downstairs. After frantically looking for a restaurant for over an hour along the crazy strip, we were really glad to reclaim our sanity at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. We'd definitely come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilled Cauliflower Soup
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the Bellagio Fountains from our table - perfect!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paillard of Salmon

uIhRUjCgeTEDARG0siC92Q.text: Stunning views of the Vegas Strip including unparalleled seats for the Bellagio's fountains. After already enjoying dinner at another spot- Jenn and I decided to pop up to the Eiffel Tower for dessert. A couple quality glasses of Prosecco -- and we were ready for some Chocolate-- and CHOCOLATE we got.  The Eiffel Chocolate Plate isn't terribly expensive -- but OH MY!! it is all QUALITY.  Highly recommended  Yes- I will return to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for dinner reservations sometime

nKYNZm8t2SbBmAN1SwFlRA.text: We originally came just to have some dessert and coffee but after walking around in Vegas, we worked up and appetite (added to this exercise, the windy chill in the air). It's a decent excuse right?!  We asked the elevator operator if we can go up and check out the view. We walked into the kitchen (I want this kitchen) then entered the dining room. We asked the hostess if we could just get a seat for some dessert and coffee and we were led to this table that overlooked the Bellagio Fountain. After thinking it over we decided to get something to nosh on.  We ordered:  Artichoke crepe French onion soup Berry souffle Bora bora (non alcoholic drink for princess  Complimentary was the: Cauliflower chilled soup Chocolates and candy Bread (of course)  I have no words to describe the food and hope that you will decide after seeing pictures.  Did I mention the fountain show?!  The service here is absolutely top notch as well.

NWKiYNlt-ol9lPH0NUdj7A.text: I have reviewed them before but when you attain such excellence in dining you deserve another shoutout!!  Eating at this restaurant is an experience so do not go if you are in a rush because it deserves to be savored like a fine wine.  The service is second to none and everyone from the hostess to the waitstaff treats you like they are genuinely happy you are there.  Food is amazing I can't even begin to describe the deliciousness. Started with the blue cheese souffle and it is to die for. The duck and chicken are cooked to perfection.  Ended the evening with the pistachio souffle and it was so tender and perfectly cooked! Don't miss this experience it is worth every cent!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio Soufflé yummy!!

zaacj2Rj3qN_I3FLp62SdQ.text: Came here for lunch. And service is Amazing! Our server Ruben was great. At the end  of my meal, he brought out a tray of sweet goodies! Best part.......they were good & complementary!!

4mFx7z46VMH_0oJVElerIw.text: Beautiful view, beautiful and delicious food, attentive service. We weren't expecting to eat here, so we weren't as nicely dressed as we could have been, so they lent my husband a collared shirt. We had a good laugh about that, but it's wonderful that they have accommodations rather than turn people away.

_HGrf1VjMCYnMVte4Vg0Fg.text: Fabulous view, romantic atmosphere, and excellent cuisine, but what I really want to praise in this review is the attention my husband and I received, which can really make or break a dining experience.  Few restaurants know how to pace a meal, so that the diner can actually savor and digest each bite.  Thank you very much for an enjoyable dinner and lovely evening.  Our experience was refreshing and a True pleasure.

WHnrVmw9CpKiN37z_bThOA.text: Lunch was ok. Food was good, but service was seriously lacking.  Here's my breakdown: Food - 4 stars. Got the 3 course meal restaurant week promotion, only 1 choice. Salad was very good, but the greens were not very fresh, leaves starting to get sticky. Veal entree was excellent, although the veal was slightly overcooked. The strawberry desert was very good, just a bit melted when I got it.   Service - 2 stars. Drink not refilled at all! I had to ask 3 times to get some bread on my table. At the end of the meal, my neighbors got chocolates after their meal and I didn't. Made me feel like the unfavored stepchild.   View/ambiance - 5 stars. Floor to ceiling windows facing the strip towards the Bellagio, so you can enjoy the dancing fountains while you dine. It's very romantic. The decor is simple but well in line with restaurants in Paris.   They do have free wifi here; bathrooms are very clean; and the open kitchen is very cool to see. This place is definitely a great date spot to impress your lady.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s9VulmBc3l9tFJBViXnOwA.text: My husband took me here for our anniversary! Beautiful views and delicious food! Service was great!

xeGfhTcp098hHiRdfOoqFw.text: Great views (with window table), nice "presentation" (trying to be fine dining restaurant), vet good service (our waiter was really nice and attentive), food is far from being on the level it pretends to be.  My wife and my self enjoyed eve in general. We ordered one testing menu for both (yes they allow that). Wine (recommended by somalie) very good And atmosphere.  Sorry for 2 stars but it was far from the restaurant they pretend to be. We might be "spoiled" by NYC though.  So if you are looking for atmosphere, go If you are looking for fine dining , not sure

2p9Td4_T0w3kBEjh9PdiKw.text: Since we were engaged in Paris overlooking the Eiffel Tower it would only be fitting that we celebrate our wedding anniversary in the Eiffel Tower...and since we're not in Paris...this would offer everything we wanted...romance, incredible views, bubbly champagne, fabulous service and a French menu. yelp.com/biz_photos/eiff... Reservations were made easy on Open Table and we were seated without waiting despite our early arrival. I really enjoy the ride up the elevator and the friendly VIP greeting prior to getting in the elevator and while exiting into a busy buzzing kitchen with chefs running around in white aprons and hats. We arrived prior to sunset and we were seated against the window on a half moon table with views of the strip and the Bellagio Fountains. Our waitress was super friendly, warm and hospitable. Our drink orders were taken right away. We were offered some recommendations and a menu featuring specialty cocktails was a big help. I ordered a Lemon Drop Martini which was very good and my husband ordered the Eiffel Tower with infused berry's-which he ordered so I could try and it was a bit tart for me. The drink almost looks like you could pour it over a bowl of vanilla ice-cream, it was heavy syrupy consistency but it packed a punch. yelp.com/biz_photos/eiff... We opted for the tasting menu at $125 pp which takes you into about a three-hour experience. Wine pairings for an additional $79 pp was also an option. The highlights were the scallops-texture flavor mmm cooked to perfection. Foie Gras was very good but needed a bit more sweetness on the plate, the venison was my least favorite-although it was cooked very well the clove or anise spices were too intense which since it's already gamey it was overpowering despite its purpose to enhance. The starter was a wonderful little shot of cold onion soup-it was creamy and delicious. Dessert was a wonderful delicious chocolate souffle and a plate of sorbet's. yelp.com/biz_photos/eiff... We were debating where to have dinner. Since last year we were at the Bellagio and had a terrible experience I wasn't excited to go back to try one of their restaurants. The Wynn was also a contender but Eiffel Tower won us over simply due to nostalgia and the views. The last time we were here we had a party of four with us and had a bigger table which offered more elbow room. I wasn't a big fan of the smaller tables and some of the customers weren't dressed to impress which is always off-putting because the restaurant is plush red velvet and elegant. I think the price per person was a bit steep for the value. Overall the service was fabulous. I do plan on coming back maybe just next time for dessert at the lounge.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soufflé

pzrCFey2v4rVC-7gIZpylQ.text: Romantic and pricey restaurant.  Ask for a table for two by the window to get a great view of the Bellagio fountains.  I thought my waiter could've been a little friendlier when I asked questions about the menu, maybe he was emulating the notorious French hospitality.  Food was excellent, we got the creamy onion soup to share for our appetizer.  I got the filet mignon and my wife got the salmon.  The chocolate souffle was very good.

IYAdoplKJ35UF_O25E5N3w.text: As parents to a toddler, you can imagine our excitement to securing childcare and enjoying this trip! We are visiting Las Vegas and chose this restaurant as our "fancy restaurant" to visit on our babymoon.   Although arriving on time, we were seated 20 mins late, then 5-10 mins for the waiter' arrival. This made us feel rushed for the show we had later that evening.  We were seated at a beautiful 2 person table right in front of the fountains. But I later realized it was directly in front of their service bar 1 foot away and took away from the privacy/romantic ambiance to hear or feel service personnel opening/shutting drawers and chit-chatting.  Bread service was cold! Never been to a a fancy restaurant that served cold bread! Not even Cheesecake Factory does this! They have TONS of staff, surprised there is no bread monitor, it's your 1st impression of the food!  Filet & Duck were delicious. Brussels sprouts side dish was flavorless, pick something else.  Lastly, we were offered to review the dessert menu and would have ordinarily ordered something as it was a special occasion, but were in such a rush.   Lastly, I felt a bit down they did not do anything to recognize our special night. Not one chocolate, petite four (that was staring me in the face just inches behind me on the service table!), not a card, nothing. The waiter did acknowledge our special night verbally upon greeting us, so I know they were aware of it, but nothing happened. It would have been nice to leave with a sweet in my mouth after our dinner as I wanted to change the taste of the steak out.  So next time for you special occasion, if you're to pay $70 for a piece of steak, I think there are some more refined, less busy and more attentive options in this big fun city.

RfMlVW0yYD7GzV5mCYMtVQ.text: This visit was made exceptional by Anthony - who was my waiter the last time I was in almost a year before and he actually remembered me!  The view was outstanding, the food was impeccable and the service was outstanding.  I can't wait to go back...an all around wonderful experience!!!

EvzB3-2Ag630IfsuiBR_xw.text: Wonderful restaurant with an unparalleled view of the Bellagio fountains. The service, cuisine, view, and overall experience is top notch. When I arrived the attractive hostess greeted me with the traditional french greeting of "Voulez-vous coucher avec moi, ce soir." While it was a temping offer, I had to regretfully decline. The restaurant has an open kitchen and floorplan. The perimeter is lined with semi-circle tables for parties of 2. It seems like every seat had a great view. I tried the lamb burger, creamy french onion soup, chicken parm, and the apple burrito for dessert.   My ratings: Lamb Burger (9/10)  Creamy French Onion Soup (8/10) Chicken Parm (9/10) Apple Burrito (10/10)  The only place with a better Lamb Burger is Fergburger in Queenstown, New Zealand.
