Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar

DzRwN4ZUMbMDorNey_svag.text: I wanted to find a nice, romantic place for anniversary dinner with my wife and oh my goodness did I find the right one.  From beginning to end dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant was perfect.  It starts with the private elevator from the hotel floor up to the elevated restaurant part way up the replica Eiffel Tower at the Paris hotel.  The elevator doors open up to a great view of the working kitchen and a friendly hostess there to guide us over to check-in.  The view is the first thing you notice as the walls are all windows and overlook the strip and particularly the Bellagio lake / water show.  Particularly for couples, all of the two person tables are right up next to the windows with amazing views.  The layout and settings are all beautiful and classy French steakhouse style.  The service, from beginning to end, was great as well.  The big surprise, for me at least, was that the food was amazing too!  I expected good food amplified by the setting and view, but the food was good enough to stand alone and even justify the hefty prices (at least along the strip).  I had the NY steak, which was one of the best steaks I  have had in a long time including some of the best steakhouses here in Los Angeles, and my wife had the Turbotin (fish) which she raved about as well.  Side dishes, souffle dessert, and wine/drink selections were all great as well.  Bottom line, if you want to splurge and have a really great dinner in a beautiful setting, this is the best place on the strip to do it.

oAasO7Sc4xZvZRcNanpTgQ.text: To start we ordered cocktails and I really enjoyed their Blackberry Mule, my girlfriend got the pear martini which she also enjoyed, but I didn't care for. Their sommelier recommend a wonderful Cabernet from Sheffer, which we truly enjoyed. The steak tartare was amazing!!! One of the best I've ever had! I ordered the beef Wellington which was good, but not the best I've ever had, though I did enjoy it (I'm a Wellington snob, it's my favorite). I have to say the Wellington was cooked perfectly and came out as rare as possible. My girlfriend got the Filet Mignon Rossini style, with the fois gras, which was absolutely amazing and I wish I had ordered it! I highly recommend that dish. We finished the meal with the featured Nutella Suffle, which was cooked to perfection, subtle and delicious!!! Honestly, my compliments to the chefs!  We then capped the meal off with excellent espresso shots, not too bitter, just smooth and enjoyable. I highly recommend this restaurant to people who enjoy French food, it has a wonderful view and amazing atmosphere to boot!

5NVjFvUuggd5seFk_xM-Uw.text: View: Lovely... if you get seated at the window seats, she likes the view to see the Bellagio fountain a lot, especially the fountain plays different music every 15 mins  Service: Fine dining restaurant service with great details..... You can celebrate anything in this restaurant by just even calling them a day ahead.....   Food: We love the food.... maybe it is different experience compare with other yelpers...OR we just don't know what real French food tastes like.....but we like the food there...  A very good place/romantic place to do anything with your significant others.....like proposing.....which I did...... ~ :P

RUPn2f9vlQJSBaW9NrHecw.text: Beautiful view, very nice service ... there is a nice gluten free menu. They provice gluten free toast as well, its average but the food makes up for it.

HEZECY0L3M-oe182ymj-bg.text: Fun. Great for pre-dinner cocktails while staying on property. Little tight spaced at the bar. Intimate enough though. Bartenders weren't screaming personality but very professional. Awesome view. Certainly on the list to do dinner.

xv1dekcIYEoiJhqo6g1ZSg.text: This place is so amazing and worth every penny! My husband and I love this place so much that we had our wedding reception there and recently went back for our anniversary. This was one of the best meals we have had in a really long time. If it is your first time and you want to try something, I would highly recommend the beef wellington and the chocolate souffle for dessert. The service is impeccable and you can't beat the view! This restaurant is romantic and perfect for a special occasion! Bon appetite!

gLfcNIZaWMDa53MQP2NiAw.text: This was a very disappointing experience after I had wanted to visit here for many years. This visit was in July, 2015. My mom, son, and I visited for lunch around 1pm. It was moderately crowded but we got seated promptly. None of the staff smiled at us and they acted very stuck up. We were dressed up and they were still looking down their noses at us as if we were paupers off the street. How did they know whether or not we had thousands in our wallets ready to spend?!!! It took over 20 minutes just to get a server to take our drink order. He was too busy chatting up/schmoozing the large family seated by the window a few feet away from us to even acknowledge our presence. I don't remember his name but he had short blond hair, glasses, and was over 40. He had a very rude attitude and fake French accent. We should have left as this visit was going downhill fast, but we were hungry so ordered lunch anyway which took a long time to receive. My son and I got the onion soup gratinee which we thought would be French onion soup but ended up being a creamy soup very similar to lobster bisque. The food was very good (yet very pricey) but due to the sub-par treatment and service we received the food was not worth this visit. I was shocked at my experience because a few years ago a very friendly concierge gave us a tour of this place and some free, fresh bread from the oven. We had wanted to visit ever since. She would really be as surprised as we were at the crappy treatment we received years later upon our visit! What a disgrace to the Paris in general!

uAfwgYhjyNUsuPQfdgzurg.text: Good food, a bit overpriced but would be worth it if you made reservations for a seat with a view of the strip. We had some great dessert it was a meringue of some sort.

w8OqcnJ8AnOm9-ta5P7ZAw.text: My son and I were at the top of the Eiffel Tower doing the tourist-y Vegas thing when he asked the guard how to get to the "Other Level" that he saw from the ground (which is the restaurant).  Well, one thing led to another and before I knew it we were being given a tour of the kitchens and a seated at a table for two overlooking the Bellagio fountains!    It was lunch service so I had a roasted chicken and Camembert sandwich and my son (age 6) had a breaded chicken cutlet with green beans.  We also shared the Triple Chocolate Cake for dessert (YUM!!).  The food was amazing and the service was impeccable even though (like I mentioned) we didn't have a reservation and were in no way, shape, or form dressed for 5-star dining!    I would highly recommend this restaurant and will DEFINITELY go back again on our next trip to Vegas!!

CNSmvgr89xVSeq9jYFawqw.text: We celebrated our anniversary here and were seated in a private corner table that overlooked the Vegas strip and the Bellagio.  During our dinner we were able to watch the fountain show at the Bellagio.    The service is first rate and the food amazing.  If you like souffle it's a must order for dessert.  The atmosphere is beautiful with low lights, table lines and elegant dinnerware.  Everything we ordered was excellent.

ou1s8-AKFkD_F7GRMNlnQw.text: Everything was cooked as they should be, with some dishes being outstanding and others being ok.  The filet mignon was superb.  The salmon was about right - not outstanding, but salmon very rarely is.  Short-ribs were somewhere between good and great (lacked that extra oomph to blow my mind).  The chocolate mousse and ice cream dessert (cannot remember what it was actually called) was outstanding.  Side dishes varied from average (creamed spinach) to perfect (green beans almondine).  They also had a Cote de Nuits Pinot by the glass (+1), which I was very excited about. Fantastic wait staff too.  However, -1 because when we first went in, the host staff tried to put us in the very back of the restaurant looking out into an alley or something; I didn't bother to look long enough to figure it out, but quite frankly that back corner should not even be a part of the dining room in a restaurant of this caliber.  Normally this wouldn't be an issue worth writing about (I understand a restaurant being busy), except there were numerous empty tables in the main dining area.  I don't know why we were shown a clearly inferior table first and were only seated in the main area when we declined and prepared to leave. I chalked it up to miscommunication among the staff or something like that.  So, it was expensive ($100/pp for us) but I left pretty content.

nAvl1pp2AqoaeeDs9mLWEA.text: An absolute delight and an affordable treat if you want to indulge in fine dining without breaking the bank. I did a lot of research on French restaurants along the Strip and the price here to do pre-fixe dining is very reasonable considering the quality of food and level of service. Coming here is an experience. As soon as you enter the restaurant via the elevator ride up along the Eiffel Tower, you are transported to a world away from the loud hubbub of the casino floor and smoky smells of Sin City. Dress up in your finest and get ready for a night of elegance and affordable luxury.   As soon as you exit the elevator, there is someone there ready to take your coat and you are welcomed with an open view of the kitchen. It's glaringly bright, clean, and lively with the hustle and bustle of busy chefs running around. Then you step off to the side into the actual restaurant, which has a romantic ambiance with small tables, plush seating, and dim lighting. I made reservations for 5:30pm for 2, which gave us a nice table right in front of the windows for a clear view of the Bellagio fountains. It was spectacular. The tables allow for you to get close to your dining companion, which is perfect for a romantic date or just having an intimate conversation with a friend. We both opted to do the tasting menu for around $120ish per person.   The food was absolutely spectacular. The timing of the dishes was coordinated well so that we could enjoy the food, view, and conversation without feeling rushed. Everything we tasted was delicious and the presentation was beautiful and elegant. My favorites were the venison chop marinated in red wine, crayfish and shellfish soup, and lobster salad. All very memorable. For dessert, I had the classic chocolate souffle which was perfectly done. I also tried the apple dessert and the flavor combination was great. Their menu looks great. There's something to suit every palate.   If you're looking to try some delicious food in Vegas in an elegant restaurant with great views and personalized attention, I highly recommend coming to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Thanks for the food memories!

_AuYieTrhb34nPHOfyD8nw.text: So my husband and i wanted to try a different restaurant this time and the food was horrible in one word to describe it RAW! i ordered a steak that was so pink inside i was afraid i was going to get sick, my hubby ordered beef wellington which was even more pink in the inside than my steak, on top of this they charge you $10 extra for any side which even that was very plain. My side was green beans which were served on a horrible looking tray and my drink was terrible, my hubby and i left with a stomach ache. The only good thing about this place is the view if you sit by the window which we did, that was not worth the over $200. The very next day my hubby and i went to Hugos's restaurant located in the four queens casino on freemont st which is where we should have gone to begin with, what a difference we ate so good and for way less the price and what a service.  McDonalds is better than the eiffel tower restaurant

C1cTybk3RzYDHFYNiGa5NA.text: Wow!  Loved this restaurant. My friend and I made reservations at 5pm and had a window view.  We got the 5-course meal with dessert & two cocktails for around $300 and it was all worth it.  The whole experience is such a good time. Loved seeing the Bellagio waters, too!  Great service as well. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for special events!

-zMRit-6tsqNuP8I0UZqIA.text: Incredible experience. One of the best restaurants I've ever been to. Everyone can experience the "atmosphere" by watching a YouTube video of the view from the restaurant. As good as the ambiance is, the food is amazing. Best duck I've ever had, best potatoes I've ever had, best glass of wine I've ever had, best creme brulee I've ever had... Overall, one of my top five favorite restaurants in the country.

NGtO2ZYo_Z3tAlAuSc-7OQ.text: Took a special person that has not been to Vegas for over 15 years to celebrate his birthday. Wanting to give him a wonderful Vegas dining experience, i sought  assistance in getting a window table at Eiffel Tower with Jennifer, the manager that has been very responsive with yelp reviews. Jennifer gave me an option to book the reservation through opentable. Then, she can make a notation in my reservation to make sure that we get a beautiful table.  We arrived for our 7:45pm reservation right on the dot since we just barely made it to Vegas from our 4 hours drive. The hostess told us that they would have a nice window table for us if we choose to wait 15-20 min. We chose to do so and had two eiffel tower affairs at the bar while waiting. Keith, the bartender was wonderful and even discussed the ingredients in this wonderful drink which I will attempt at home.   Since we were having such a great time at the bar, we were not sure if we were sitting there for more than 15 min. Another hostess came to let us know that a window table was available. We were not rushed at all.. When we were ready, that nice hostess took us to our table with a beautiful view. Lee was helping us with our dinner for the night. He was not Valentino that a lot of reviewers had mentioned but he sure was so thorough with the menu and is an expert with all courses. Lee  had the assistance of another nice gentleman that kept our water glasses poured and tasty bread offered several times.   I already looked at the menus online but gave my companion a chance to look at the menu. I wanted to treat him to a tasting menu with wine pairing which he obliged. I won't go into details of what was on the tasting menu since it's available on the website.   Overall, the food was very good. Have I had better? Yes, but the experience, the service, and the ambience made it wonderful. I normally don't care too much for lamb but this one  was done nicely, juicy and without that gamy taste. For desert, we chose the pistachios soufflet which Lee recommended and a plate full of different kinds of ice creams. By this time, i was too full already so I've only tasted the soufflet and it was quite good, very fluffy and moist.   I should also mention that while waiting for our food to arrive, the photographer came and offered a photo with either the Paris sign or the view of the Bellagio fountain. We chose the fountain but i asked her if it would be possible to take it during the water show. As soon as the water show started, she came back and tried several times to make sure we have a nice background. Kudos to her professionalism.   Overall, we had a nice dinner. Our check came out to be $474.83. While the whole experience/ambience/service is worth it, i can't say the food alone is worth it if it was not the whole experience. Toward the end of the dinner, we saw a lady that went to a table next to us to talk to another couple. I assumed that was Jennifer since the other reviews mentioned that she does stop by. I was hoping that if she did, we will thank her in person for helping us getting a table with a gorgeous view. However, she did not stop by our table so we did not get that chance.   The whole time we were there, the restaurant was full and it was a week night. All the window tables were always occupied. My companion enjoyed his birthday treat and wanted to visit Vegas again soon.

mORiTZBR01g980k_dgfSmg.text: I celebrated my birthday dinner with my boyfriend this year at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and it was amazing. It was a late Friday night and we were starving. We headed in without a reservation and were seated in just a few minutes.   Yes.. it is a bit pricey, however you get what you pay for. I had the most amazing filet mignon ever! I do understand how the size of the filet is a bit small however, it's well worth it, as it's quality over quantity here. You do have a choice of sides which allows you to try even more of their delicious menu. I do not remember our waiter's name that night (May 11), but the service was impeccable from the moment we walked in. The view of the Bellagio fountains definitely adds to the ambiance of this restaurant. It was definitely money well spent.  My boyfriend and I enjoyed our experience so much, we returned to the restaurant on May 18th. Unfortunately, there was a wait for a table, but we were excited that we could sit at the bar and eat without a wait. Keith/Cory H. served us our food and drinks... and suggested the amazing Eiffel Tower Souffle. We were in heaven after getting both the pistachio and chocolate sauces to mix into our souffle. It is definitely a MUST for anyone visiting this restaurant.

-LDTvwppOYL_y4i_MahsHw.text: Service is excellent.  I had foie gras.  It was delicious.  The duck was perfectly done.  The lobster medallion appetizer was very good as was the roast chicken.  The warm Ceasar salad was unique.   All in all an A plus dinner and worth the cost.  Ask for Tom and Carlos to wait on you as they are a team.

zBM54p2pERPlvzbkauTivw.text: I wish I could give this place more stars, but instead I will just tell you how GREAT it was.  We were in Vegas celebrating a 40th birthday and I just couldn't decide where to go for dinner on Saturday night but it had to be special whatever it was.  I was searching around on Yelp and found the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.  I noticed quickly that the majority of the reviews were good...but then I noticed the Manager of the restaurant actually commenting on the reviews so that intrigued me a lot.  I contact Jennifer and she responded to me right away and was happy to help me make our dinner a special night for my best friend.   We showed up at 8pm and the place was bustling.  Great atmosphere...You have to take the elevator up into the Eiffel Tower itself and when you arrive you get to walk through the kitchen to get to the main dinning area -- the kitchen was awesome everyone dressed the way you expect a 5 star restaurant to look...it was bright and CLEAN....I was amazed they cooked in there it was so spotless!  Once you round the corner you get to the main dinning room and the bar is immediately to the left, but what really captures your eyes is the view....from everywhere in the place you see floor to ceiling windows and all the lights of Vegas...it was spectacular!!!  Jennifer greeted us and she was awesome.  Took us right to our table with a fantastic view of the Bellagio water fountains.  We were able to watch the water show the entire evening as we dined.  It was so awesome I can't even tell you.  The waiter was the best I had had in a restaurant in I can't even remember.  They were so attentive but not on top of you asking constantly if you needed anything...they were just there and ready to take care of whatever we needed without us thinking about it.  The food was the best.   Jennifer sent over a nice plate of appetizers that were all personalized for each person (meaning we each had our own sample plate)  they were so good I could have licked the plate!!!  We also had a small bowl of a cold cauliflower soup that left me wanting more....the cocktails were mixed well and had just the right amount of flavor to alcohol you would expect.  When the main courses arrived we were in food heaven.  Three of us had beef dishes and one friend had the sea bass...ALL OF THE DISHES were divine.  Lastly we ordered at the top of the meal a chocolate souffle that melted in  your mouths...since it was a special birthday they also sent over a lovely desert just for the birthday girl and some samples of their sorbet.  Again I can't tell you how good it was so you have to go try yourself.   This restaurant was the best experience I have ever had in a 5 star establishment -- they made us feel welcomed and I can't wait to go back.  All four of us have been telling all of our friends!!!  I just hope Jennifer and her staff can handle all the press because I am certain that she will be getting a lot of business and calls from our reviews!!!!

LpUK-u0KCSjYCwWHHrX4hQ.text: Went here with four other people on a Saturday night. First off, the service was terrible. The lady serving us seemed like she didn't even want to be there and was extremely rude when one of my friends asked about an item on the menu. The bread was served cold. For a little starter they served us cauliflower mousse. I can't even begin to explain how rancid this smelled. It tasted even worse. It tasted extremely metallic and as one of my friends described, it tasted "like an old sweat sock". I decided to order the chicken with vegetables and a parsnip puree and the green beans as an "accompaniment" (really pretentious way of saying a side). When the food came it was severely undercooked. Even though the plating was nice, the chicken was bright pink. The green beans were okay but had a really sour after taste. After we all finished eating and the $500 bill was paid off (we didn't order any drinks if you're wondering) we went back to our hotel. I started feeling really bad after eating here and so did two other people I went with. One of them starting throwing up and the other one got the runs while I was in bed with a bad stomachache. We ended up staying in the rest of the night, ordering Chinese delivery to the hotel room, and swearing off this place forever!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green beans
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken with vegetables and a parsnip purée

G9lq7IrUbaDloHZdctxyCg.text: Romantic and tasty.   This restaurant is really popular for a reason. The food is delectable, this service is over the top, and it has the best view of The Strip, the Fountains at the Bellagio. While enjoying a great meal, one can enjoy the Fountains right across the street.   Good: Great food with a spectacular view.  Bad: Better get a reservation!  Final: Go and take your special someone!

eABcIg7cYjPNQfsfZssL3Q.text: If you eat at Mcdonald's all the time and come here, you will be impressed.  If you have been to other fine dining restaurants in Vegas, you will be very disappointed in the food.    The restaurant looks amazing inside.  Very nice.  5 stars.  The service was also good. 4 stars.  The Food - 1 star because the souffle was really good.  Everything else was beyond terrible.  Cold, Flavorless, Bad.  I ordered the Beef Wellington and I would have enjoyed a Banquet Pot Pie more than what they served me.  My wife got the Surf & Turf....  steak was ice cold and very fatty.

cF52Wgb-cx6alC9AWzrQcw.text: The restaurant raises its sun blockers around 6PM/7PM to reveal a summer sun set against Nevada's Rocky Mountain. Construction is going on between the Bellagio and Monte Carlo, and so cranes are also in the picture.  The service is IMPECCABLE. Everything was on perfect cue. We did not have to verbalize additional requests. With subtle eye contact and body language, the waiter decanted additional wine and flawlessly poured the wine in the polished wine glasses. He removed the plates in a timely and quiet manner. The highlight was the complimentary dessert tray. My favorite was the grape jelly coated in sugar crystals.  Oh, the food? It was alright. The foie gras slice was a fairly generous amount. In its rarity, I had farm-raised sturgeon, which I thought could have been warmer than lukewarm.  What really ticked me off was the bathroom attendant who twisted my and my friends' arms for $5 gratuity for a mere three individually wrapped lifesaver breath mints. Turn off.

TcIMrqOXj2A7zvZ_i1UJCQ.text: I took my girlfriend here for lunch. I absolutely love it and is worth every penny. This restaurant is what I call fine dining. The bus boy was always standing on the side and helped orchestrate the delivery of our food and refills.  The server was nice and professional. The ambiance is fantastic as it is intimate ... until a family with kids were seated behind us but they weren't rowdy. :) The best part was seated right by the window with a perfect view of the Bellagio fountain.  The food was fabulous and well presented. This is what we ordered: - cheese bread with an orange pepper flan; it's used as a spread for the cheese bread; wonderful! We each had our own little tiny cup. - Cold Foie Gras Torchon, Duck Prosciutto, Fig Compote (foie gras was perfect and not salty and who would have thought the Fig compote complemented the foie gras perfectly. It was a rich slightly salty and sweet tangy taste) - Crab Toast a la Francais, Sauce Remoulade (excellent but very rich and crab tasted fresh none of your ... artificial crab) - Aged Parmesan Crusted Chicken, Potato Gratin, Vegetables (rich but flavorful - ordered a cocktail and a orange creme drink  Total: $87  They even gave my girlfriend a happy birthday chocolate mousse. I would definitely go back.

29O-3ghiIIqMhQo-R-kYGw.text: This place is AMAZING.  I go there all the time.  Service is always awesome and the food is out of this world. The souffle is a must have.  Everything melts in your mouth.  The meats are always tender.  Just be aware that when you buy your entree it does not come with sides.  You have to purchase them separately.  This restaurant is an expensive, nice restaurant but it is soooooo worth it!!!!!!  I even loved it more than restaurants in Paris.  The chef's really put their every effort into the food.  The vegetarian dish is not that great, that is the only dish that I didn't care for.  You have an amazing view of the water show at the Bellagio.  The ambiance is perfect.  It is a great place to propose to your girlfriend!!

xe9tCVMYK_0-051T_5GIdA.text: Very impressive restaurant! We went on a Wednesday night and didn't need a reservation. There were still a lot of vacant tables. The hostess was very nice and gave us a table near the corner of the restaurant with a wonderful view of the Bellagio water show that came on every 15 minutes. It was beauutiful!   The wait was only about 10 minutes for them to clear the table so we sat at the bar and ordered their house Cabernet. Not bad.  It was a very romantic and fun experience. The food was pretty good too! I can't remember exactly what we ordered. I remember the Fillet was pretty good. Their bread is good. And the dessert, the souffle was pretty amazing too!  It's great for a nice date night! There's a photographer to take a picture of you and you can buy the keepsake with your photo in it.

rzUAVrZVVl86s86ZGE3L7g.text: Came here for specifically for drinks.  More $$ than your average bar in Vegas, but well worth it; scenery is breathtaking!

hzfiFkG9lcC6jUnom9QiMA.text: Had 9:00 PM reservation...finally was seated at 10:30 PM. Food was mediocre at best. Dinner for 2... $500.00. Not worth the money. The view of the fountains was the only thing favorably memorable about this resturant.

KCp6-O9kOGE72gsfPcpNdA.text: I'm so glad I decided to come to Eiffel Tower on 4/1/12 for my boyfriends birthday! My boyfriend ordered the rack of lamb and I ordered the New york rib eye, OMG both dishes were cooked to perfection. My boyfriend got the dessert plate with Happy Birthday in chocolate on the edge, he loved it!! Jennifer the manager actually came over to our table to see how everything is going..the service was amazing.......Thanks Jennifer!! I can't thank you guys enough for making my boyfriends birthday memorable. This is something we will never forget. We will be back for sure whenver we decided to go back to Vegas!

n6JoFcsVDk9NEA0VdzZjkA.text: 1st Visit: I got invited to the Eiffel Tower Resturant at  the 11th floor of the Paris Hotel for a business function dinner.  The guests are whisked to the restaurant in a glass elevator that takes you to the electric activity of one of the city's top kitchens before being escorted to the dining room, where panoramic views and exquisite cuisine take center stage.  The glittering lights of the Las Vegas Strip appear even more dramatic in the dining room's intimate lighting, and guests are treated to spectacular views of the glorious Bellagio water fountain show across.  Metal framework from the Eiffel Tower dramatically breaks through the restaurant walls and creates a modernized art deco style. The course of the meal is defintely gonna satisfy you with the very, nice desert list.  Highly recommend an experience you'll remember! 2nd Visit: Order their Souffls!!! Regardless if the host tells you they take half hour to prepare for those Chocolate, Grand Marnier, Pistachio, Banana, Raspberry or Benedictine Souffls, order it! You'd love it!!! ^^

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kxEEENXDA1iF6yF8MWbiHA.text: Valentiine's Day dinner with reservations well in advance. Our reservations were for 7:30 and it was 8:25 when we were finally seated. The whole atmosphere was one of utter chaos. There was almost nowhere to stand. We were lucky enough to find a spot at the bar after a bit, where the bartenders were something to behold. Very skilled and able to keep up with such a hectic pace. The dinner itself was so-so. The foie gras was delicious, the salad was pretty, but nothing special as far as flavor or content. My husband said the lentil soup was good. We both had the tenderloin and found it to be tender and flavorful. The dessert, Chocolate Pear Napoleon, was a major disappointment. We also did not find the wines on the suggested pairings list to be particulary complementary. Overall I think a restaurant of this caliber should overbook to this extreme. They have to be well aware of their capacity and clearly tried, unsuccessfully, to exceed it. We paid an exorbitant price for a mediocre experience.

lxPcoKQphKhMhuaTCNeqbQ.text: Food: 3.5/5 Ambiance: 4/5 Services: 4/5 Prices: $$$$ (avg 100/person)  My partner and I were lure into taking the elevator to check out this place while waiting for our table at Mon Ami Gabi for lunch. We decided right away to make reservation for the night's early dinner, first due to the location being just opposite Ceaser's Palace so we can walk over to see Bette after dinner, second, its the view. We arrived 5.30pm for early dinner and its already 20% seated. We were given the window seat of course with the view of Bellagio's Fountain and the Strip.   Again, we went for the easy way - the 5 course Tasting Menu for $89/pax. According to the server, the course usually takes 2 hrs but we only got 1.5 hrs before the show, so, we asked to speed it up and we did... We started with a glass of champagne, then swiftly follow by these courses (as we requested):  Amuse bouche - cant remember what but its something very similar to the parfait from L'Atelier. It was OK  Soup - cream of lettuce, chicken quenelles and lettuce chiffonade. Sound really interesting but its really bland...  Baked halibut, braised veges, tomato confit, pistou bouillon - the simpler but better tasted dish with fresh veges and a good portion of flaky halibut  1pc of roasted rack of lamb - right texture, tender but lack of seasoning and flavor  Desserts - i went for the pistachio souffle as highly recommended by the server with additional $6. Well, its a huge portion and if you are still hungry from the previous courses, then check this out, otherwise, you can go for the creme brulee or other smaller lighter desserts. The cheese plate before the dessert cost additional $10 which we opted out. In addition, the server will come with selection of bonbons if you order coffee.   In conclusion, Eiffel is a place for you to enjoy a romantic evening or just to impress your significant other or even for a small party with friends/co-workers. The food are decent but not as refined and definitely has potential to improve. That being said, if you dont mind forgoing the romantic setting and the view, I suggest to go L'Atelier Joel Robuchon for better food and slightly cheaper 5 course Menu!

jTs21y4wZ_Eb4SsObDo7-w.text: Pretty pricey, but always a great place to visit in Vegas.  I went here twice (once w/ a bunch of friends, another time w/ my husband), and had great meals both times.  When I went here w/ my hubby it was especially nice since we got to sit in one of the best seats in the house, with a fantastic view of the bellagio fountains (I asked for it when I booked the place on opentable more than a month before, and I can't believe they actually gave it to me).  When I was last there, I had the seared foie gras appetizer, filet topped with foie gras (you can tell I was totally jonesing for foie gras that day), and the chocolate souffle for dessert.  Mmmm...yum.  I know there are probably a lot of fancier and better places in Vegas, but I still think this place deserves 4 stars for a wonderful meal, great service, and an unbeatable view.

mPLMK4CiiB9H2Pa5cPbWsw.text: Let me get things started that this restaurant is fairly expensive however, it is worth the dining experience.  You'll get a very nice view of the Bellagio Water show, a good portion of the Vegas strip. Do that while sipping your martini.   Call ahead for reservations and I suggest you dress up when going to the Tower. Most if not all people are dressed nicely. If you'll spend a little, why not go the whole nine yards and dress up, even just for this place. It is worth your 120$/ person.

0eILHCPIjuJQGAaq1WAvzg.text: Excellent food and service. The view of Bellagio fountains and City Center including the strip is amazing. The chicken was the best in town.

ACAbmBN6GJ8DfLyaQQ4Y8Q.text: Way overpriced! Service is OK, but their prices are killing all of the good experiences. The other night forked out $600 for a party of four (no alcohol). Unless you got $$$ to burn, go somewhere else.

cpeGCjbCT9E95RcLhgDLjQ.text: Fantastic time. Great service great foot great atmosphere!  It was my wife and I's 10 year anniv and when we made the reservation at the desk, JP was very accommodating. He actually called me on my cell when an earlier time opened up because we were seeing the "O" show that night.  Great guy!!! We overlooked the Bellagio dancing fountains, such a great sight!

x6dUelnGv8GgMyuP_MVwAw.text: Amazing view of the Vegas strip, I was able to get a reservation through OpenTable! The ambiance was obvious one of the top notch, and service was great!  I had the Wellington steak which was good but didn't really "wow" me, however my gf at the time order their only Vegetarian dish (Baked Herbed Crepe, Artichoke, Walnuts, Slow Roasted Tomato Coulis, Basil Pistou)... and that definitely WOW'd me!   Overall I think i would have ordered their filet instead of the Wellington but beside that everything was top notch!

iLY4uD6n1_qIT2WMWdogwQ.text: Our 24 th anniversery was some what a disappointment! I made reservations over month in advance for front table! For two I then canceled and made it for four I was told there were not tables that would accomendate four in front window Lie! Only to get there and see a nice front table for four. We were seated in a back table could hardly see the water falls in front! We also noticed we were never offered photo other at table or in front windows as others were! My father brought 2 bottles of his favorite winery in napa $75.00 for corkage fee! Per bottle! Not ever! My father bought 3 glasses of wine at near 20.00 per drop Ha! Our bill was near 500.00 for four. Save your money we won't be going back!

W0rGMPR0VGCokrdi24QD0Q.text: Less than 1 star  I and my hubby are very disappointed at their foods...  Salads are obviously NOT fresh. It's so small and saturated.   I ordered a fish, but it tastes awful!! I gave a piece of them to my hubby and he spitted out it before the first bite. He ordered a chicken, but he left 80% of them.  No vegetables AT ALL on the dishes.   I don't wanna go back even it's free. We've never been depressed before by any restaurants...

01lyMbOw9F1orm1hj-APZw.text: I have been to the Eiffel Tower a few different times and have had enjoyable experiences up until today. The waiter appeared very frantic, we had a table of 11, but thankfully his assistants were more than qualified to assist. The food came out warm and the ambiance with the Bellagio fountains was excellent. I ordered the French onion soup (gluten free version) and was told two times that the soup didn't contain wheat. After my first bite, I knew the soup had too thick of a consistency. When I asked the head waiter for the third time, he came out from the kitchen and said the soup wasn't gluten free. As someone who suffers from Celiac disease, I am VERY upset with this complete disregard for food intolerances, hence the one star rating. Very big deal for those who have severe symptoms.

PBUtpsw8DoFcQQofD5wPKg.text: We tried this restaurant for the first time on a Friday night.  If you make a reservation, make sure you ask for a window table.  The view of the bellagio fountain at night was phenomenal.  They are a bit strict with reservation.  We had some issues with our hotel check in and we had to call them to move our reservation time from 9:15 to 10 but they told us they would not be able to guarantee a window table.  We tried to rush over the restaurant and made it by 9:45. The manager was kind enough to accommodate us with a window table even though usually they can only hold a reservation for 15 minutes.    Though the service was good,  it wasn't at the caliber that I expected at an upscale French restaurant. Also,  I came to the Eiffel Tower restaurant expected similar quality as the Jules Verne in the real Eiffel Tower in Paris.  The food was good but wasn't special.    For dessert I recommend the souffle. It takes about 30 minutes to make so if you would like to order one,  let your waiter know when you order your entree so they have enough time to make it   For the drink, I went with our waiter recommendation and got "an Eiffel affair". It's a mixture of champagne and vodka with mixed real fruits strawberries,  raspberries and blueberries on the bottom.  It was pretty good.    Overall I think it was a good experience.  Nice restaurant, spectacular view, romantic French ambience and good food.  I'd come back again for the view, drinks and desserts  but probably not just for the food .

wEAMW0-Ep0hvSrjz7i7waA.text: Came here for my birthday and wow. The view was absolutely beautiful. (We sat facing the Bellagio and had the perfect view of the fountain). The food was cooked to perfection. I'm going through an oyster phase right now, where I have to try oysters at every restaurant. The oysters here exceeded expectations. Super fresh and to die for. The waiter was extremely attentive and polite. Would check up on us often. They also have a photographer available. We took pictures and got physical copies and she gave us digital copies straight to our iPhones. The salmon and mashed potato was good too. Everything was perfect. Would come again.

5bPE8Ynhh5_NWL_xOF1Psw.text: This is a must when in Vegas. Yes, the prices are high, but not only are you paying for the best food in Vegas, your paying for excellent service which is hard to find nowadays. The view looking into the Bellagio fountains from this restaurant it absolutely breathtaking. Just remember to make a reservation in advance to ask for one of their viewing tables. Nothing more romantic than a bottle of wine and a water show. The food is out of this world. Must try the bone marrow, filet, and French onion soup. To top off the night you HAVE to order the caramel souffle, it is to die for!!!

The meal was served and it was good but I guess I was expecting more but it was delicious, overall the experience was what I wanted

_F4nFFEYWUR7QrNbXtdj7A.text: I have to start my review by saying that I only visited for dessert. That being said, I was completely blown away by the superb service and the overall experience of this beautiful restaurant. I sat at the bar and ordered a cocktail called "An Eiffel Affair". It was a mixture of champagne and vodka, with fresh fruit soaking at the bottom. It was presented beautifully and tasted amazing. I was really cold at the bar, and the bartender heard me state this. He came over and covered me up with a Shaw. I thought that was super sweet, and added a touch of hospitality. For dessert, I ordered a chocolate souffle, which was out of this world. The souffles take extra time, but it is so worth the wait. It was served hot chocolate, drizzled in the middle and warm pudding on the inside.   The view alone was stunning and worth every penny spent at this restaurant. This was my absolute favorite experience and I would fly all the way to Vegas just to spend an hour at this elegant and beautiful restaurant.

SX4nY7VLLCEdZKYTc6bBTg.text: Amazing view! We had a group of six and they do not mess around with their reservations. Multiple calls the day of and required a credit card on file. The food was really good. I ordered the snapper and it was cooked perfectly. The sides we ordered were the wild mushrooms and the potatoes gratin. Both were good but the potatoes definitely won that one. Beautiful view of belliagio water show.

cLcG42fEw5adByrvMUMFzw.text: Eiffel Tower has been on my list of notable restaurants to visit for the sole reason that its pretty difficult to get to. Its tucked away on this odd level of the Eiffel Tower attraction and one cant help but wonder how is it to sit in there and admire the view while enjoying delicious French cuisine.    Well, i came and conquered...for lunch.   I exited the elevator and as the doors open I noticed I was in the kitchen and expo area. I cant imagine how many people experience complete confusion as the doors open. They should put a sign that simply states "proceed to your right for eiffel tower restaurant". I suppose its a gimmick to show guests the kitchen has nothing to hide, but it fails in execution as theres no one there to even greet you and the prep cooks are head down cooking.  I proceed over to the right and theres more confusion as the hostess stand is ALLLLL the way in the middle of the restaurant past the bar. You just keep walking until you see two computers. The host was seating someone and quickly arrived and showed me to my table.   You'll want to avoid the point overlooking the fountains as it is right in front of the service area and they can get loud with silverware,  ringing up checks and just general busy work; it was distracting. Aim for a table away from that corner, but along the window if you care for the view.   For a empty restaurant the service was quick and felt rushed. I received my amuse bouche s well as some French bread (no butter was in sight).  The bread wasnt warm and I've had better at my local grocer.  Two minutes later as I was staring out the window the onion soup arrived. He scooted my amouse buche out the way and stuck the soup in its place. I barely had time to taste it.   The creamy French Onion soup was great, but the portion should be offered as a cup or a bowl. The standard bowl was too much food and becomes too salty. The aged parmesan chicken entree was stellar for $22. The meuniere sauce wasn't needed nor did it add anything to the dish. Ive had meuniere sauce made with lemon and parsley but that was missing in their version.   The server didnt check on me to see if i needed anything while enjoying the entree or bother to ask anything about me or my time in Vegas. I dont even think he provided me a name. He was plesant, but only in the sense that customers are numbers and hes theres to provide food, drinks and deliver a check. Cant fault him if thats how he was trained- to not make a connection with the guest.   He asked if i wanted dessert right after dropping the menu keep in mind its only been 35 minutes since i sat down and i had to take a moment to breath. Service got slow after that point. No dessert and between getting the check and having it rung up it took 15 mins. Classic "fast at the beginning, slow at the end" service style. He did bring out comp. small sample sized desserts which was a nice touch, but seemed odd considering the fast pace of the meal. I suppose its in the handbook.   No manager stopped by the table which is always a nice touch for a restaurant of this caliber.  Would I return? Only for special occassions. If then. Service was rushed and not personalized. If you are sold on seeing the Bellagio fountains keep in mind they may not even be running as was the case during my visit.   Rivea, Top of the World, Lago, Spago and even Beer Park for casual diners are all comparable if not better options than this one.

DH-2CUKhDgsqlXkOVQ1-wg.text: A most fabulous restaurant and dining experience. From the wonderful staff in the Paris that walk you right over to the elevator when you look lost to a nice greeter at the elevator to the lovely staff throughout the restaurant to our server and table crew. Everyone made it a wonderful meal. And the food. Muah!! We chose the Chef's tasting menu to celebrate my birthday and we were not sorry. Worth every penny. Can't say enough about the food. A Devine and heavenly experience. Such flavors. Every way each course was prepared and the texture and flavor combinations. Absolute PERFECTION! Just when you thought something couldn't be topped, the next course arrived. Each course was better than the next. I actually ate one with my eyes closed to savor it more. I can't say enough about the Chef's choices. I wish I lived nearby to come here again and again.  We were seated at the second best window table (Best went to a delightful couple with a proposal. Can't begrudge them that table. Delightful to witness.) and the view was fantastic. Right in the middle of the bustling strip across from the Bellagio so you get to see the famous fountain show among other things. Everyone was super nice to the birthday girl. Chef sent out two extra courses. A tasty cauliflower soup to start and a terrific chocolate mousse to finish. See my pics to see the different courses and descriptions.   When in Vegas, make it a priority to experience the Eiffel Tower restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Speaking of which...dessert menu.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A perfect orange tea to have with dessert. Look at that view and the simple China. So peaceful.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Final entree of the Chef&#39;s tasting menu. A delicious veal with a blissful fingerling potato. Light as air, savored at the end. Eyes closed.

yE0Iw9CUa-3-9OBMGZR1dw.text: Came here for brunch with my bf with reservations to sit with the best view! We were able to sit next to the window where we were able to see the nice view of the strip. We ordered the escargot as an appetizer, and it was pretty good. Though the idea of eating snails might be intimidating to others, you can only really taste the garlic and parsley along with its chewy texture. For our mains, I ordered the boneless farm raised chicken with spinach crepe and the snow peas. The chicken was O.K but it was kinda dry. But I loved the spinach crepe! It was creamy and flavorful. My bf ordered the lobster Benedict and to him it was just a boujee Benedict, nothing too special about it other than the added lobster (they added a good amount). Highly recommend!

jXHFW9hrehwsnqkRP585Xg.text: 11.22.2018  We came here for two birthdays, and it's great! Service is great and he has a sense of humor! For food I ordered the steak tartare for appetizer, grass fed bison for the entree, and a raspberry souffle for dessert. For souffles, order ahead if you want to try it (they do mention it to you). The steak tartare is tasty since there's Parmesan and truffles on it, and the bison is cooked nicely so that the meat doesn't dry out. This is a great place to go to for occasions (birthdays and thanksgiving). P.S. note that they have thanksgiving specials too!

YiEKF34AWQlNlMei_6dnQg.text: Officially one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas!  I've always wanted to eat here and finally got my chance during a business trip.  It was lunch so reservations and dress code was a little more lax (after 430, plan to dress up!) but our meal was as fine dining as a lunch can get!  Started off with an amuse bouche - a celery mousseline which was a great way to kick things off!  Wanted to try the French Onion soup - and it was a creamy bisque instead of the standard brothy version - and OMG it was absolutely divine!  The best I've ever had and now I want all my French Onion soups bisque-style.  Just YUM.  Hubby got a plate of French cheeses with honeycomb, pears, herb crackers and pecans.  It was an absolutely beautiful plate!  A fantastic starter, perfect for sharing.  Entree was the California Veggie sandwich with roasted red pepper and I believe Brie cheese.  Had a nice cucumber crunch and excellent flavor all around.  Served with flash fried kale and chips.  Hubby chose the Ocean Seafood Salad - and he absolutely loved it.  Full of shrimp and lobster, with celery, tiny crouton crumbs, olives and a creamy French dressing - he couldn't get enough!  For dessert, we shared a sorbet trio.  Flavors we got were mango, raspberry and sour cream.  Strangely enough, sour cream was our favorite.  Such a unique flavor!  And a great ending to the meal.  I highly recommend this place, for lunch especially.  If you feel like dressing up, dinner, I'm sure, would be spectacular.  We will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas.

CVMZ1VXjGaSFwICdy6riJg.text: Get a table over looking the Bellagio fountain show. Lovely. We had a Romeo cocktail to start and it is something I've never seen before and it was great. A new take on an Old Fashioned / Manhattan. The entire meal was well done with great flavor and we enjoyed the view and the service. Very romantic place for a date.

AzopkdvHP5uHsV-yuI3NNw.text: I'm so in love & everything about this place is romantic!   It's a French restaurant with superb service & a view you won't want to leave; we were lucky enough to be seated at THE BEST corner table in there (my birthday dinner).  This ended up being a lovely 2.5 hour dinner.    I really enjoyed the ambiance here- I love a dark & sultry restaurant! I plan on going in the future to just hit the bar- it's that good.   The food is phenomenal- think high end everything.    They offer a palate cleanser snack before your meal, which is nice.   There's a bread guy who comes around with a nice selection of bread; which I appreciated versus leaving the whole basket on the table to stare at me- making we want to eat it all & not leave room for dinner.   Must-haves:   *Beef Wellington- comes with a red wine reduction sauce that makes my mouth water just thinking about it. I don't eat red meat often but when I do....Just order it!   *Souffle for dessert- I'm sure any kind is great but we had the grand marnier & it was delicious. Must order in advance!   *Eiffel Affair champagne cocktail  I went a few days after dinner for lunch & loved it all over- had a delicious seafood salad of some sort.   This place just goes above & beyond- I see many visits in my future!

YTqZz6oCO8L5NffoLO8lsg.text: Exquisite! One of the BEST upscaled restaurant I have been to in years! Everything about this place is amazing!! The food, the service, the BEST mojito I have tried!!! And I had many! Hands down this has to be the best literally. Beautiful restaurant for a date night or an anniversary dinner, I celebrated my birthday it was amazing!

S5YwZvq06Bc377xzba5Dfg.text: Great Service, Great tasting food. Was there last september with My Wife for her B-day she loved, Also amazing bellagio water show View

47lKX4yRpfXcrMV1amKY7g.text: Exquisite!  Everything was delicious, and the ribeye with bernaise was heaven!  I'll definitely be back, as the service and view made it all the more worthwhile and memorable.

7a8o5kZoobpm0VqiDzL9jQ.text: It was an elegant and wonderful place to take my wife. Food was amazingly, and the service only complimented it.

cMkMXrTdRyPu8HbkBY3BDQ.text: Tough place for me to rate. The ambiance and staff are excellent. It really is about as good a location as you can get to eat and watch vegas. All the hostesses and staff were also outstanding. But the food was overall just ok. We did like the appetizer (Alaskan king grab) and desserts, and the cocktails were very good! But our entrees were honestly yuck. I really wanted to love the restaurant for all the reasons stated above, but we ordered the new york strip and filet and they were just terrible. Granted, I am a steak connoisseur and my bar is pretty high (mastros beverly hills, cut, etc.), but our steaks did not look or taste anything like typical USDA prime cuts you expect from am expensive steakhouse. Ive had better steak at Outback. Of course, cooking steak is an art and even the best steakhouses can have a bad day, so maybe it was just a fluke? Anyway, I will probably still go back but I think more for a nightcap with desserts and cocktails.

QeIIenwQBSqEVxd66u3ziQ.text: I made a reservation and got sent up the elevator by a member of the staff. Once I got there the hostess looked at me, didn't say anything to me, but started chastising the staff member who let me up. I was then told that I needed a shirt (not a tank top) to dine there. There were multiple people wearing sports tees, but I got turned away because my shoulders were showing. It was 1:00 on a Wednesday and the place was barely a 1/5 full. How're you going to turn away a paying customer over that? Not impressed.

y54ByKd5D2tO4YSbyU69fg.text: Amazing!  So, I think that in a classy place like this, one should not take pictures of ones food.  Therefore, the below pictures are only of the view. The Eiffel Tower has been on my Las Vegas bucket list for a while.  In November, I decided to tell hubby exactly what I wanted for both my birthday and anniversary so that I could have exactly what I wanted.  I told him to make this restaurant happen for our anniversary.    We arrived at our appointed time.  However, it was about a 10 minute wait.  I think that was due to our request to have a window seat.  I had already talked myself into thinking that it won't matter.  There are no bad seats in the place.  However, shortly thereafter, we were walked to our table at the window.  We were facing more towards the Cosmo, then dead on to the fountains.  Still, the view was joyous.  Moving on to the food.  Whoohoo!    I started off with butternut squash soup.  It was a production.  They brought me a soup dish with only solid items on the bottom.  Then, woosh, a pitcher of soup was poured on top of it.  If I were less classy, I would have licked the bowl.  As it was, I was fighting to keep myself from wiping it with the freshmade french bread that had been brought shortly before receiving the soup.   Moving on the my main course, I have the rack of lamb.  A bite of the crust will make you cry a little.  It was so delicious.  As I got more full from the creamed spinach side and the potato al graten, I knew I could not finish my lamb.  I offered it to the hubby who was willing to sacrifice for me to not take home a doggie bag.    However, before I gave it to him, I ate off the crust on all sides....He was sad, but still took it.  While we had declined the souffle, however, our super stealthy waiter snuck a dessert menu on our table.  Well, he went to all the trouble, but I was super full, so I guess that I would just have to have a Normandy coffee.  With a yummy cocktail and an alcoholic coffee, I breezed out of the restaurant full and giddy.    Thanks for the amazing night!

taIaRiR6B2XCKnxSwFqC5w.text: This restaurant deserves 10 stars. Food is fantastic and delish. Classy ambient above the strip with wonderful views. We had been dining at this restaurant in numerous occasions and never been disappointed. Dining in the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is experience worth every penny.

xbJMvk8kVJRgE5HHqmFwRA.text: Drinks at the bar, rather than dinner this time around... Still a wonderful experience!  Our bartender, Mat Dozois, was top notch...  Great Mixologist!!  And he knows everything about Gins!!  The cocktail he made the hubby & I was magically delicious!!  Our bar  snacks were a nice little add on!  Def will be back!!!

Nl2Gtp_OhYkR3mJGXzApOg.text: There are so many wonderful things to say about the restaurant in the Eiffel tower at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. The service makes you feel like royalty. The menu is diverse with beef, chicken, veal, and vegan selections. The food is perfectly proportioned and tastes wonderful. The bartenders are well educated and quick to offer a suggestion if you ask. We had reservations but opted to wait an extra 45 minutes for a table near the glass so we could see the strip and the fountains at the Bellagio. The whole experience is very classy from the moment you walk up to the elevator and ascend to the restaurant. You exit the elevator to walk past the kitchen, seeing the chef and team at their best. This was a nice treat to see how clean the kitchen was and how well organized their system is. The bathroom assistants are very kind as well. Every corner has a special touch and you feel class and sophistication every moment.

J6h9nQHG5rVl36LRowR-MQ.text: Absolutely one of the best restaurants I've been to in LV. From the drinks, food, service, view, elevator up, to even the restroom/powder room, I literally applauded them! Everyone at this establishment was truly amazing. I cannot rave enough. Originally, fiance and I had reservations for 9:45 PM and requested window seating. At 4:30, I received a text for a reservation change for a 9:15 PM for an available window table. I happily accepted. We arrived at the restaurant 15 minutes early and made our way to the bar as we awaited for our table to be ready. Within 10-15 minutes we were seating at a window table over looking the Las Vegas Strips. We had amazing view of the Bellagio fountain. Our waiter was very kind, attentive, funny, & informative. Since it was out first time, we decided to go with menu options that specifically stated being featured in "The Eiffel Tower Restaurant Cookbook."   Roasted Rack of Lamb, Ratatouille Tian, Tarragon Jus - I ordered this plate medium rare, and it was cooked to perfection.   Individual Eiffel Tower Beef Wellington, Sauteed Snap Peas - We were warned that cook time was roughly 30 minutes, and I am so glad we did. It was definitely worth the wait. I can safely say it's generously portioned. My fiance was just about full halfway through.  Olive Oil Mashed Potatoes - Very creamy and complimented both our dishes.  Assorted Seasonal Wild Mushrooms - I could eat spoonfuls alone. If you love mushrooms, you love complimenting this item with your dishes.   Grand Marnier Souffle - Must be ordered ahead of time (upon seating) & it was gone in 60 seconds. Delicious! My mouth is watering just reminiscing of the short time we had.

rUJUWVoGn-ke6a3YneSGYA.text: Amazing! Service was top notch. Ambiance was romantic.  Food and wine was amazing. We had reservations and were seated immediately.  Would definitely eat here again!

3nljjlCdEvC7dfxI_-iX2Q.text: My husband, 15 year-old daughter, and myself had dinner with a most coveted view in the state! I am terrified of heights, but promised my family I would brave the 11th floor view. I had such a wonderful dining experience that the height and view enhanced the whole evening. Igor was so attentive with a wonderful sense of humor. Each course was beautifully presented such that it was almost too pretty to eat! Our daughter is a picky eater and she ate all of her Queen filet mignon and side vegetables. The wine sauce for her filet suggested to her by Igor was delicious. My crusted salmon was the best I have ever had. The sauces that accompany the entrees are divine. The souffles melt in your mouth and are so delicate. We will definitely be back! Thank you for such a wonderful and memorable dining experience!

bhN3MQV7DJ8CC2qt622T9g.text: I would say the only good thing here is the view of the bellagio fountain.  Don't make the same mistake as me and have dinner here.  Food was just ok and really expensive.  We should have just come for dessert and enjoyed the fountain show.  No need to have your meal here.

IghtQZAWgrF2xfGPwWcapA.text: I was very pleasantly surprised by the restaurants response to my review.  They emailed me, and also spoke to me on the phone.  They seemed to genuinely want to hear about my experience, and even followed up by sending me gift certificates for the next time we visit.  I really appreciate their professionalism.  Thank you.

WagTkc8qkfTE94jiyRzv9A.text: The most underrated restaurant on the Las Vegas strip. The Restaurant in the Eiffel Tower is excellent. The food was amazing from start to finish. The starters are good and tasteful. The atmosphere is very fancy. Feels like you're really in France. The service is good and the views of the Bellagio fountains is definitely a plus. I recommend the smoked salmon as a starter and for dinner the fish dishes are delicious. The sea bass and Alaskan cod are great choices and the potato gratin and Brussels sprouts as sides were exquisite.

--wch1EKIHhtKk8avI0iXA.text: Belated review.  Had business dinner last Wednesday.  Everyone enjoyed their food and we ordered a bottle of Darioush white wine.  Good foods, great views, and service was decent.  Most of us ordered fish and various sides or salads.  Although I had an odd comment.  One of my guest mentioned he liked the steak at Salt Grass better... really?!?

TngGrEDhSFQk7m0wZWhBWA.text: View was awesome for lunch. The signature drinks  were a bit expensive and served in very small glasses. Quality of the food was average, not what you'd expect for the price they are charging. Service was great and the waiter was very attentive.

6XhdQHx_rjMERcCIf5Os_w.text: Great views, good vibes, even better duck. Made friends with the bathroom attendant and the waitress. Unfortunately I didn't get to pay my respect to Chef Joho.

AZE6yRZmrb-utoj5JPC-BQ.text: The Eiffel Tower restaurant is definitely five stars!  This is the third time I've been there and it never fails to disappoint. It is pricey but well worth the money! we checked in for my daughter's 21st birthday and were treated like royalty. We had a waiter straight out of France, a sommelier who was the able to pair all of our wines for the evening and some of the greatest chefs! We decided to order the pre-set tasting because we didn't want to order just one item off the menu, we wanted to try it all!  There were 9 items brought to our table....My absolute favorite was the beef topped off with seared foie gras!!  It all just melted in my mouth. For dessert, we all had to try the Nutella souffle.  Wow!  is all I have to say! The whole dining experience was out of this world!  With all the amazing restaurants in Vegas to choose from, the Eiffel Tour Restaurant is at the top of my list! Merci Beaucoup!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loving our meal in the Eiffel Tower!!

euGlK3HjO-HXFuV9ukCSSQ.text: I had the sauteed foie gras, New York steak with bearnaise, asparagus, and chocolate souffle. Everything was excellent, including the service.

bpasEXejeiVDxqpMiU1afg.text: Had an amazing experience at this restaurant!! Had an awesome table overlooking the Strip! Our server, George, did an outstanding job.  We were served a delicious cream of zucchini soup with crushed rice crackers - yum!! We then had the Market Greens salad and the non-traditional Caesar salad - both were delicious!! The warm anchovies was such a delicious addition to the Caesar salad!  The New York strip steak was the best I have had - anywhere!! The filet and the halibut were delicious as well!! The creamed spinach with mushrooms and the classic potato gratin were some of the best we've had! We finished our evening with the pistachio and chocolate souffles - delicious!!! Lastly, petit fours were served and all were delicious!!

It's basically front row seats to one of the best attractions in Vegas!   All while enjoying a wonderful meal.  Highly recommended!

EkAEv0Zw2U77NgXKqgbhSg.text: Had a wonderful dinner! Appetizers of Salmon and veggies. Moist succulent chicken I've ever had, a wonderful glass of wine and then.... Chocolate Mousse.  If you can afford it try it once! You won't be disappointed!

sgJ9LaBSxDRF5nMvA86pKQ.text: Absolutely amazing! Made my night special and a night to remember! Stunning view and delicious food. Felt a little rushed and wish you could hear the music when seeing the Bellagio fountains. Service was impeccable!

BuN-tibaOy_82Py6ncwfhw.text: I took my wife for her birthday on a Tuesday night. We arrived early because we wanted to get a table with a view of the water fountain . We were greeted promptly and got a nice table .  We ordered some drinks and an appetizer to start our evening .  We ordered the Seared Scallops and it was delicious . For the main course we had the Red snapper and Abalone Mush. Both dishes were great and yummy . They even brought a nice dessert for my wife's birthday . The service was impeccable and personal . Nice place

N1o84ccCMIEl2uMMxY6pWw.text: For my birthday Aug. 27  we went to dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant located at the Paris hotel. Reservations are recommended and so easy, I did mine on their website. I recommend going to dinner around 7:00 because once the sun starts to go down the Vegas lights come to life and the Bellagio fountain show is amazing. Ever time we come to Vegas we always go out for a fancy dinner and this place is our number one choice. We get dressed up and enjoy ourselves. The view is jus so amazing and inside the restaurant is very romantic. From the moment you walk in they make you feel so special. I had the Bone-In-Pork chop, my husband had the Alaska wild black cod and we shared the creamed spinach with mushrooms and the classic potato gratin. The food was cooked perfect, it was so delicious. The apple martini was so smooth I had to have another one. Skip the salad and indulge in the most amazing dessert. I had the Grand Mariner Souffle, it was absolutely amazing and I highly recommend it.  We were there over 2 hours and they never rushed us. Most of all the atmosphere is extraordinary.  FYI  if you have a drink before going to the restaurant finish it because you can not take it up stairs.

QLV7OIdzTyC9kN8XP_u4eA.text: We were in town for a conference and came to the bar for drinks and had such a great time with the bartenders Corey and Kieth that we cancelled our dinner reservations the next night and came back for dinner. The food was amazing and the staff was exceptional.  I highly recommend this place.  The view is the best in Vegas and the food and drinks were well worth it. This was the highlight of our trip. We will be back for sure.

xxL0R0K4Ui8375jUPrr_Gg.text: So if you're gonna do the whole "Vegas experience," you may want to include the Eiffel Tower Restaurant as part of it.   My company held a dinner here in their private room. One pet peeve of the room is the huge column that divides the space, which can create awkward ducking or hitting your head. The private room does not have a great view of the Bellagio fountains, but does have a nice view overall.   There is a minimum you need to spend to reserve the room, not sure of the price, but price per person (sans vin) came to about $100 each, not including tax, tip and all those other extras that can get tacked on.   The prix fixe meal started with:  * Blue Cheese Souffle Pudding w/ Walnut, Pecan, Petite Salade - Interesting. Kind of like Boursin meets Jello. About the size of a small ramekin, it went well with a baguette. Great salad!   * Tuscan Kale Salad w/ Door County Dried Cherries, Quinoa Croutons, Toasted Pecans - Okay, so technically one could call this gluten free! And the kale salad was a nice counterbalance to provide all the antioxidants one needs when in Vegas. Why do we have to know the cherries are from Door County? I don't know. Where is Door County? Again, I don't know. Very fresh salad, the tang of the cherries provided just the right "bite."  * Sauteed Wild Salmon w/ Quinoa Summer Beans, Tomato, First Pressed Olive Oil - This is what I'm talkin' bout! Perfectly done, beautifully prepared salmon that melted in your mouth. Wild salmon can sometimes have a more "meatier" taste that farm-raised due to the lower fat content, but this was spectacular.  * Eiffel Tower Classic Creme Brulee - La piece de resistance! Very large serving for a creme brulee - could be easily shared, in my opinion. No one could finish theirs. Loved the caramel decor that graced the top.   All in all, it's a very romantic setting. Taking the elevator up makes you feel...special, for lack of a better word. Would I come again? Mais, oui!

5gzUslGQIFYs8M4DEt6oCA.text: Very very good but service seemed like it could be better. I was in town for 2 nights and had to dine at some of the many celebrity chef's restaurants that are in this town. Tonight I chose Chef Joho's Restaurant at the Eiffel Tower. I was surprised I made the reservations earlier that day and they actually had an opening. I requested a window table overlooking the Bellagio Fountains but when they took us to our table it was that. So I went up to the hosts stand and asked if it were possible to sit by the window. They said it would only be a few minutes and we got the perfect seats in the house it seemed like. For a starter we got the Napoleon of Alaska King Crab and Avocado which was phenomenal, very light and fresh flavors, perfect way to start. The main course I got the beef wellington with snap peas. Very good however I did have Gordon Ramsey's Beef wellington a week before and I have to say that was better but it was still very good. The snap peas made a lovely side. Service though! Seemed like our server was very rushed so we had to ask him quickly for what we needed while we had him before he ran off. At this type of cuisine service should be very friendly and inviting. One time I started to ask him something but it was already too late, he was gone in a flash. But other than that it was an excellent experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Appetizer

U32P9wcc0Qqv0ajI-3PE3Q.text: We had the best 1 year anniversary dinner! They seated us at the very corner of the tower overlooking the fountains. It felt like we had out own private restaurant because we weren't able to see anyone.  The food was amazing! You think french and you think small portions. This was not the case. We were stuffed when we left. They kept bringing us more chocolate through out the meal to try. We ordered 2 desserts thinking they would be small. Nope! And they brought us a complimentary dessert.   I would go back for dinner, but I'm afraid it could never live up to the first amazing meal. I would have to go back at lunch just for the views.

c7KqTbaTip92Fnd0Kidsdw.text: I can't even begin to describe how wonderful my experience was at this restaurant. I've been to Paris, and I've been to the top of Eiffel Tower, and although it is not the same spiritual experience I felt in France, it was still wonderful. My bf told me he got the recommendation from a guy he was sharing a poker table with as they were discussing french food. The guy told him he has taken his wife here every year for their anniversary. And let's just say after eating here, I really had to go back and re-evaluate all the 5-star places I've reviewed. I would never take back a star or anything but every venue after this has a standard to meet. lol.  VENUE:  The restaurant is at the top of Paris Hotel and Casino, with amazing ceiling-to-floor windows that allow you to have a view overlooking the strip. We were taken up via elevator and once you first enter you pass the kitchen - all white tile, very French-looking kitchen. A bit tacky I thought at first, but on my way out, I realized how clever they were in doing that (it was probably unintentional but whatever), because as soon as you enter the dining area you are floored. The atmosphere is romantic and intimate. Perfect place in Vegas date night/dinner so make sure you take someone on whom, you find worth spending the money. Go during the evening - after 8 PM when the Bellagio does its fountain shows every 15 minutes you'll enjoy the view. Overall we spend ~$250. Worth every penny...that the bf spent.   FOOD/DRINK: DRINKS: I started off my evening with the house Bordeaux. Now, I'm not a sommelier and I don't think myself a vino or anything, but I thought this red was delicious. The server told me it would be dry, but I didn't find that to be the case at all. When I think of dry I think of Merlots but this was fantastic. The bf got their (the name escapes me) drink with the raspberries, blackberries, and blueberries in it. It was delicious and is served with a spoon so you don't have to worry trying to tilt the glass upward at the end to get the fruit.  APPETIZERS: Roasted Foie Gras, Marinated Grapes, Julienne Crepes: Oh my goodness. For such a tiny portion, it sure packed a punch. It was PHENOMENAL. The pate melted in my mouth and also went well with the bread that served.  Rack of Lamb, served Medium: Oh lawd. Delicious. Tender, juicy meat that literally fell off the bone once you put your fork in it.  Beef Wellington, served Medium Rare: Let me tell you, I've had some pretty darn good beef wellington in my life and this was scrumptious. The beef was also tender and juicy and the pate surrounding it was a great seletion.  DESSERT:  Strawberry Souffle. I can't even. It wasn't super sugary sweet which I loved. The flavors of the strawberry really came out, and eventhough I was STUFFED by the time dessert came out, I didn't feel guilty eating the souffle at all. The texture was marshmellowy but didn't feel heavy at all. It was amazing.  SERVICE: We were orginially sat at a table to the side of the restaurant but wanted a better view of the Bellagio (who wouldn't?) and asked to be moved. The hostess was accomodatnig and understanding and were re-sat in a matter of 5 minutes. Not bad for a 7PM, Saturday night reservation. We sprung for the photo - and although I feel bad for the other yelpers that got blurry ones, ours came out really well. And being a photo whore, the photogapher let me review what she had taken and took a few to make sure I was satisfied. Our server was funny and helpful and courteous. He made sure to ask us about dessert before our entrees came out - which was mindful since we had a 9:30PM show to catch. We took our time and paid with minutes to spare as we walked to the Monte Carlo afterwards.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge table! Excellent view!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9d6VnQ2a9eSUf8SgktQT0w.text: Came here for birthday celebratory dinner. This would be my second time being here. The service was amazing specially that I didn't have reservations. We got nice seating that overlooked the Bellagio fountains. The waiter was great and always took care of the drinks and always asked to see how everything was. We had escargots to start, they were ok, I mean they were escargots. We had a steak and rack of lamb. It was delicious. We had effeil affair drinks and they had blue berries and raspberries. So delicious. For dessert we had the chocolate souffle and it was amazing. You can never go wrong with this place. Also the entrance is through the kitchen which is really cool.
