1KYe-cjEMyML5zYX5Y05QA.text: Went last night as a birthday celebration.  I ordered the tasting menu. It was divine! 6 - 7 small courses,  each paired with its own wine and dessert included. This is the way to go if its your first time there, you get a taste of most their dishes.  Pricey but as a celebratory treat it is worth it.  The Hostess/server was super friendly and helpful.  Initially was seated on a table with limited view and as soon as a better table opened she moved us and brought a Rose arrangement as a gift.  Awesome experience and will definitely go back. (when i have saved a few $$$ for it)

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Milestone

dqeY6ql6wQCzQfBvEMguNg.text: Wife and I eat out a lot both on and off the strip and knowing the strip prices are generally higher. This place does indeed offer a spectacular view and I found service to be very good, although tables are too tight together for the prices they charge.  Wine prices are rather ridiculously high. .I paid $110 for half bottle of average CA cab. I eat escargot all over the world and this was one of  the worst ....visually it looked good but far too much "fufu" around the tiny snails, very little garlic taste and served warm. ... My error in not turning it back immediately.  My venison was cooked correctly and tastes very good, my wife's filet was more medium than MR,  which she had asked for.  Sides were excellent in taste but way overpriced for the small portion Souffle was excellent.

O79Hu9s773AQpxxvX0W4qA.text: This restaurant was absolutely wonderful. From the minute we entered the service was exceptional. We were immediately taken care of, and checked on quite frequently (without it being overbearing). We got the last window table and I'm really glad we did (try to request this in advance, if possible...it's well worth it) because the view is lovely and you can see the Bellagio fountain show all throughout dinner. The food portions were more than enough, especially if you get some of their accompaniments (we got the potato gratin & creamed spinach and mushrooms). Believe it or not, we didn't even have room for dessert! Everything was delicious, perfectly cooked (although the duck may have been slightlyyyy over-cooked but still great), even the bread & butter was tasty!  I would definitely go back for a special occasion, and would highly recommend.

qAQYqRR7pA8dwXGgHXs1aQ.text: While the view is spectacular, the food above average, and the service decent, I was shocked to see that the restaurant received a C rating just that week; we noticed the posted sign upon leaving the restaurant, making me leery of everything we had just eaten. No restaurant that charges those prices should ever be in danger of receiving a C. A B rating is unacceptable, let alone a C; I worked at two restaurants, and even As get away with enough. My first review was removed because I posted a brief review letting others know about the rating. I wish someone would have mentioned it in a Yelp review and saved us the trip and the money. Also, we asked for a table near the window and a ten o'clock reservation. We were told that a 9:30 pm reservation would guarantee a table by the window. When we arrivied, there were at least 15 (all but ours and another couple) window tables available from the time we got there until the time we left. I'm not sure if this is to discourage late dining.

ApaYcNcy3862uKJYmAFyAA.text: Awesome pre valentines dinner. We arrived right at 4:30 took a few minutes for them to finish setting up and seat us.Maria was our server she was very knowledgeable of the menu. The food was phenomenal. We would've preferred a better seat to see the Bellagio water show. I don't know if paying 50 dollars just to reserve that particular seat was worth it. Our view was blocked a little.The meal was pricey which was  to be expected but the food was amazing so for us it was a nice treat. I recommend the Lamb and Beef Wellington. The lamb just melts in your mouth.We shared the potato gratin and spinach and mushroom as our sides.  Which were also amazing. We will definitely return.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb

JA4KuQhVvviXDwze76j0rQ.text: I am usually not a fan of gourmet resturuants (as it usually entails getting charged exhorbitant prices, for very little food, for dishes where the chef's primary objective is to be unique, rather than tasting good). But I enjoyed my dinner at the Eiffel Tower....the food was excellent (although, I did order one of the most basic "non-gourmet like" items on the menu....filet mignon with a side of wild mushrooms). The atmosphere is beautiful, and upscale, with great views. The service was also excellent. Overall, It is a great place to take a date and enjoy the romantic ambience while dinning on fine food.

nqP9umSeM389vDhDu-i9xQ.text: Most romantic orgasmic cullinary experience in Las Vegas. Sit next to the windows overlooking the dance of the majestic  Bellagio fountains. Order the prefix menu with the cheese plate enhancement and wine pairing. Amazing views, amazing food,  enjoy the good life.

HR5o6bOnvrd8LFDb_w2MuA.text: Went here for my birthday as a gift from my wife. This isn't cheap (don't know how much she paid but unless she got 95% off deal it was expensive), how do I know? Easy 1: it's Las Vegas and nothing is cheap here, 2:Its a hotel restaurant which overlooks the fountains of Bellagio  and the stripe. 3: Refer back to #1. It is well worth the splurge to go here and have a magnificent meal served by exceptionally attentive staff wit a superb view. Sometimes its a good idea (as hard as it is for an old tightwad like me to do) to put away that mental calculator where you're thinking that's $xx plus $xx I think I'm gonna be sick and just relax and enjoy. Great food, magnificent staff and service (the bar even had good single malt scotch) with a great view. All done sitting next to a person you love. Priceless.

YqcGyUUKsgSVRu7n5nIb0g.text: Service A+ View A+ Food A  I was very impressed with the Eiffel Tower Restaurant experience we enjoyed last night. From the moment you enter the elevator to the middle of the faux Eiffel Tower you are treated like princes and princesses.  The staff is very friendly and helpful and our waitress was fantastic. She was very knowledgeable about the menu, honest in her recommendations and did her best to meet some of our more food restrictive diners. Our table had an excellent view of the Bellagio Fountains which made every 15 minutes a treat.  We started with a fennel parfait compliments of the chef.  For an appetizer we shared a seafood treasure chest of lobster, crab leg, oysters, shrimp and a seafood salad.  For an appetizer, a single order of the seafood appetizer will be enough for two to share.  For dinner I enjoyed the beef wellington, light and flaky with an earthy mushroom flavor and beautifully cooked so it cut like butter and melted in your mouth.  We also tried the Rabbit which was surprisingly tasty, flaky but moist. The crab salad was also well presented.  The restaurant was able to accomodate the special requests for a picky eater in our company who has several allergies.  When they couldn't, they were quick to inform her of the reason and other options.  I have to say I was very disappointed in the kids menu.  Although reasonably priced and with crayons and a kids coloring menu, the options were pasta with butter or marinara, grilled cheese and chicken.  I mean this is a beautiful, top food restaurant and you can't get more creative on your kids menu?  So many restaurants sell the kids tastes short but I would have gladly paid an extra couple of dollars for her to be able to add shrimp or chicken to her pasta, or have a fish option.  Other than the kids menu, it was a fantastic dining experience. NOTE: This is one of those places where you pay more for the location and view so the prices will be high.  It is also one of those places where it is worth the price.  NOTE 2: Although I was there with my family, this would be a very romantic date spot.

bSTRydQsUBD6MVGyd7-DcA.text: we eat here every time we go to Vegas - twice a year - first class all the way. Service awesome and food is tremendous - of course the view is as good as it gets

Ad1wz9eOZswgUH6iSAjQpQ.text: Absolutely my favorite dining experience in Las Vegas!!!  The food was amazing, and the view at corner table #56 has to be the best in Vegas--it centrally overlooks the Bellagio fountains and all the casinos in both directions along the Strip. Reuben was our waiter and his service was top notch!  Cesar assisted and was wonderful as well. Do not miss out on this experience!!!

skAd-DfI7cq_aM5wOga2cQ.text: We had dinner there, just last night, and lunch there a year ago. The lunch was so lovely that we looked forward to having dinner.  We reserved a 4:30 table so that we could see the Bellagio fountains.  It was a beautiful setting with a crisp white tablecloth.  Unfortunately the meal was disappointing. The butternut squash soup was served luke warm.  My husband said that his New York steak had a good flavor but was tough.  My rack of lamb was also luke warm.

1G9KxyEIYfxhS-PQ3sEjpw.text: Our experience was wonderful!  Nicolas was our server and he was very helpful with selecting the perfect wine!  The food was great and the view was excellent.  We will definitely be back!

TV6PEzaoPzjh8G6bmqXgNA.text: Great food and service this is what you expect when coming to Vegas . Lamb was perfect goose liver prepared two ways is so flavorful and a must is the souffle for desert

om9TDmN1C4Kc7BlHkimKhg.text: I was celebrating my 30yr anniversary and had an 8:15pm Reservation got there @ 7:15pm hoping to get a early table. Hostess said there were very busy but would try to seat us soon as possible. We had drink in the bar area while we waited, waited and waited!!8pm  I ask hostess how much longer? she was not sure. 8:30pm arrives still no table!!! we left very disappointed!

yZUziSDrIJuegNsnPsnC3A.text: You come here for the view. The food and service are good and on par with other fine dining places in town but --you come here for the view--. Sure there are better places in town but --you come here for the view--.

vWSTkODD_q7iZn33bHMo2g.text: I figure I have to do a tasting menu sometime in my life, so why not here?  First word of caution: They require a collared shirt for entry. They did bring me a jacket to wear for the meal though, since all I had were T-Shirts with me.  The tasting menu was an experience. It was a very formal service, and they were prompt in all of the removal of dishes and service.  You do need to tell them at the start of the meal if you are going to have the souffle, it takes extra time to prepare.  The courses were all good, except for one - the venison. The Huckleberry Jus combined with the other flavors made a really bad clash of tastes in my mouth. The meat was very good and tender, but it was overpowered by the other flavors on the plate.  All in all, a great sampling of other dishes, and superb service.

1U8NZPTCPVS2dlKV2XMMWg.text: If I were only rating the view, I would give this restaurant five stars OF COURSE.  You couldn't ask for a better quintessentially Vegas Strip view.  However, for the price, I would've expected better food and better service.  I showed up AN HOUR before my reservation in an attempt to "call dibs" on the very best table for two (the website tells you there are no guarantees but best to call ahead, have them notate it on the reservation, and ask the maitre d' when you arrive - I did all three in addition to getting there an hour early) nevertheless, we got a table about midway down and while it was still a nice view, I think my efforts should've earned us a better spot with a more central view of the Bellagio fountains. (I'm a little spastic, sure, but I wanted it to be perfect to celebrate a friend's birthday).  Moving on... at a restaurant like this, you shouldn't have to ask for a dark dinner napkin.  They should see you're wearing black and automatically switch out the white for black.  They should also hand the napkin to you (or lay it in your lap, which is always weird for me) when they're greeting you and running down a list of wines or cocktails or other such initial "need to knows" for the evening.  None of that happened.  I had to ask for a dark napkin after the bread guy put bread on top of the white napkin I had not yet moved.  Our server was friendly and made good cocktail recommendations, but the whole experience felt rushed and overly casual (which I would've expected at a Cheesecake Factory but not at a $$$$ restaurant).  She didn't describe any specials or provide any food recommendations.  My friend ordered the chicken - it was tough and a little dry.  I ordered the salmon, which was a little undercooked (medium raaaare).  The haricot vert were SUPER SALTY.  We couldn't eat them. They put what looked like French's fried onions on top, which reminded me of the green bean casserole at Gramma Betsy's house for Thanksgiving.  They did bring a small chocolate mousse with "happy birthday" written on the plate in chocolate. That was a nice touch.  But overall, the dining experience was very underwhelming. I think that's one of those places you can go one time, just for a drink and the view, and then never go back.

7ZisF2B3LddKGsn1VBuuYA.text: I went here with a party of 13 for a graduation celebration. First, they got the name wrong on the reservation they had it under someone else's name. Second, they wanted to "accommodate" us so they gave us the last reservation for brunch at 3:00 p.m.. Well with all the things happening down at the Paris and on the strip four of our guest were late. At 3:45 the hostess came and told us we had to order immediately or we could not eat, keep in mind that we had order appetizers and drinks. When she did that I felt disrespected because if you gave us the last reservation for brunch then you know what is going on in the hotel and people would be delayed. Then our four guest arrived within five minutes and our waiter took our order. I ordered the Eiffel Tower Burger and it was good the only bad thing about it was it was greasy. I will go back but I think they do better with smaller parties versus 13 people.   I would have given 4 or 5 stars but if you give a party of 13 the last reservation do not nicely force them to leave by offering the dessert menu when people are still eating. We spent over $400.00 and I think they could have worked with us better knowing the type of money we were spending.

zug0xh8Q7EfkrPxAQ88_SA.text: My husband and I treated ourselves to a special date night here, and we were extremely impressed.    Service: 5 stars The service was excellent from the moment we checked in. The hostesses, server, and wait staff were all extremely friendly and courteous!    View/Ambiance: 5 stars The view is amazing.  We even got a seat right next to the window directly in front of the Bellagio and a view of the Strip.  You can't beat that!  It's a very romantic place. In fact, one couple beside us got engaged right while we were dining and the one on the other side had just gotten engaged earlier that day!  Food:  4 1/2 stars  The food was good, too.  The starter was the fennel mousseline, which was surprisingly interesting and good as we'd both never had a mousseline before.  We both started with the Market Greens salad, which was very good. The dressing was really amazing!  My husband opted for the halibut upon the recommendation of the server.  He enjoyed it so much that I didn't get to taste it.  I went with the filet mignon, which I requested to be cooked medium, although we both thought it was slightly overdone (more like medium-well with only a slight hint of pink in the center).  We also ordered the Asparagus with Brown Butter.  I found this to be only okay.  We each finished with the pistachio souffle, which was perfectly light, fluffy and enjoyable.      Overall, our experience was great. This is an excellent spot for a special occasion or a romantic night out in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from our window seat for two!

lzZtUBWCP0F38GtN59K4DA.text: We stopped in for a drink while wondering around the strip.  Its probably a lot better to eat here then to come sit at the bar.  The tables are situated by the windows to give an amazing view, but the view from the bar isn't as good.  The service was really good.  The drinks were good but expensive.  I would come back in the evening for dinner as good view of the fountains could definitely make it worth it.

eFyNnQvdpLtAfZOTAux67A.text: Great service!  Best beef wellington I've ever had,  Gordons doesn't even come close. Food was amazing! The Eiffel view is a bonus. A must eat experience.  One you'll never forget.

1s6fqQrb2DQkKrK-2AJnfg.text: Located in the Paris hotel in their Eiffel Tower, this place is absolutely amazing. Great view across of the Bellagio Hotel and the strip. We started off with the Seafood Tower. I had the fish of the day while my colleague had lamb and customer had the salmon. All was done to perfection. Finished off with the souflee which was perfect and very satisfying. Probably one of the best features of the Paris Hotel.

Li7YC5oGAtZPaKm5LkFCCg.text: Had a great lunch here with some girlfriends.  While the prices are somewhat inflated, the food and the service was excellent.  Of, course, you can't beat the view either!  Overall, it was an experience that was definitely worth the cost.  I would return for special occasions.

5YnxJx8OSzmTAewyYQS7Kg.text: My hubby took me here for my birthday celebration and its was worth the prize! View was great and the food was terrific along with the service!

jWvgQV8M8fq7-ibOvPaQXQ.text: everything was five stars! the jalapeno something drink was amazing. $19 so it was sort of pricey, but worth it.

LBrg9HsMzR9wctlvhThDOQ.text: Best steak of my life! I'm not kidding! This place is fantastic- I don't even know where to begin. I didn't think the greens beans would be one of the most memorable parts of my dish. I think it caught me off guard how amazing green beans could taste. The steak is out of this world- it cuts like butter. And there isn't a better way to end your meal than with sticky toffee pudding!

hbC2YPsSzj-BWoLOc4IdHA.text: I have been here quite a few times but today was BS! (Below standards) normally they have phenomenal service but our waiter seemed distraught and it took a good 25 minutes just to place our order. The food was ok not as good as it used to be and the bread was as hard as a rock and when we asked for some fresh ones they refused saying that there only allowed 2 per person.Also every time we asked our waiter for something it took forever we would have to remind him multiple times before he actually brought it! All in all this place isn't worth the price.

xqku6V0huF-mYGtht4ROIQ.text: The staff is obnoxious, snotty and rude. We arrived 50 minutes before our reservation time just so we could get a good table. They ended up seating is right by the waiting area, next to the elevators. There was so much traffic walking past our table that we couldn't eat in peace. The overall noise level was also unbearable. I felt like I was sitting at hometown buffet, this was definitely not a high class restaurant experience. The food was overpriced for the relatively small portions and we did get two dishes that were cooked incorrectly, one of them being undercooked fish. Our waiter had a bad attitude and was very sarcastic in the way he spoke to us. I will definitely not come back here again. If I wanted to eat at a loud, crowded place I'd drive down to Denny's or iHop.

oQ_vFhnQbXMwZEdamvLAaw.text: Not one bit of snootiness at this french restaurant. Everyone was very friendly!  Our group had 5:30 p.m. reservations and we were running late, but they were very accommodating and didn't mind at all. (10 girls sharing 2 bathrooms = running late!)  We were greeted by a spunky french guy when the elevator doors opened. We requested that he take a group picture of us and he was happy to do so with 3 different cameras. Our waiter was very nice.  Ambience was nice and the view was awesome.  Everyone enjoyed her food. I got the Char Broiled Filet Mignon with Bearnaise sauce, which I recommend. Other things that the girls tried that they loved and would recommend:  *Baked Alaskan Halibut, Braised Vegetables, Tomato Confit, Pistou Bouillon *Filet of Sea Bass, Fingerlings, Double Smoked Bacon, Crispy Potato, Petit Mache *Semi-Boneless Roasted Chicken, Green Beans, Crispy Potatoes *Sauteed Pork Chop, Mushroom, Cracked Corn, Celery * Great side order: Gratinee Creamed Spinach and Mushroom  5 stars for service, friendliness, quality of food!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gN6GARS_BRr5UX2D3WAH0w.text: We got recommendations for this place from my parents and so, for our anniversary, we booked here. We were told though that it was first come, first served, in terms of having the ideal seats by the windows that overlook the fountains of the Bellagio and The Strip. We went for lunch though, so it wasn't too busy. We were seated by the window and were promptly served some sort of puffed rolls, with cheese and herbs infused. They were delicious!  We ordered the onion soup to start and I ordered parmesan chicken and my husband ordered a lamb burger. Our food came and was delicious. The soup was probably my favorite part. We were feeling very full by the end and so declined dessert, but were still given some jellies and chocolate truffle and then were served a small chocolate mousse, on a decorated plate that said Happy Anniversary, which was a total surprise (they had asked when I booked if it was a special occasion, but had said nothing while we were there). Overall the service was great, the food delicious and the view wonderful. It was a great experience!

TMnxWcOANlJnPbsvW-w8dQ.text: My friends from Oman were in town and asked me about the Eiffel Tower, so I checked on Yelp of course. The 3 of us went for dinner on 3/12/12 and it was wonderful. OMG it was really really awesome! The sommelier quickly came to recommend a nice red, which was spot on, we had 2 bottles. The selection of breads was delivered with a big smile. Jennifer, the manager, came to welcome us and I mentioned her good job at replying to Yelpers' reviews. We were just so excited to be at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant that night!  Valentino, our waiter, was patient, as we were unsure what to order. He made some suggestions and we quickly decided. I was sure to mention that I'm allergic to shellfish, and it was noted immediately. While our meals were prepared we received some kind of cold soup in a tiny glass, I enjoyed it more than my friends. Then we each received a trio of tiny appetizers, which was unexpected and delicious. For appetizer we ordered:  Cold Foie Gras - rich, smooth and velvety. Pepper Marinated Raw Beef - Beef carpaccio to perfection. Trilogy of Imported Osetra Caviar - with different little toasts/pancakes to serve it on, simply delicious, something I had never had. For main course we ordered: Muscovy Duck Breast - my friend ate it before I could try it, so it must have been great! It certainly looked good! Boneless Organic Rabbit - super tender pieces of breast, the rabbit sausage was a bit salty but sausage generally is, still easy to eat though. Rack of Lamb - a refined combination of flavors and juicy tender lamb. We accompanied these dishes with the Potato Gratin and Creamed Spinach and Mushroom which were great sides to our main meals. We felt too full to do dessert, but somehow a tray of sorbets made it to our table, and it was certainly refreshing! One of my friends had an after dinner liqueur I can't remember which, but it completed his meal. I hope my friends took good care of our servers, cuz I didn't get a chance to look at the bill. It was one of the best meals I've had in a long time. I sure hope I get a chance to come back as there are so many things on the menu I would love to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Imported Osetra Caviar
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. appetizer was delicious
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of Lamb

wIo0UfSFtflWhYr_V4fbuw.text: The service was good but the food wasnt. The beef wellington was beyond bland, and the halibut wasnt any special either. The warm foie gras and the salad was the only 2 good dishes. For dessert, we got the chocolate platter which was super disappointing since it was recommend to us by the waitress. The Lava cake was dry and overcooked, the chocolate ice cream was nothing special and the mousse was quite sweet

I4aZvdyidV4P77fI7TQ-1Q.text: Wow!! This place was absolutely amazing! So we took the elevator up with a gorgeous view of the strip. We requested a table for two facing the Bellagio. We got to enjoy the water light show throughout our dinner. It was spectacular! We checked in for our reservation early, soft music in the air, we walked in & it smelled incredible! Since we were early they showed us to our table early and we got started. We were sat by Angel, she was very nice. (I have to mention that all of the hosts were dressed beautifully & all of them were very nice!) Maria, our server, shotly came over & got us started with drinks, explained the menu to us & got the show on the road! The start by brining you soup that cleanses your pallet. Then we started with the seafood platter & they brought over the best fresh bread! My husband ordered the salmon and I ordered the Queen filet mignon we didn't decide to get any sides because we had already ordered so much food. (Keep in mind all of the menu items come ala carte.) Our dinner got to our table and we were both blown away! It was amazing! Cooked to perfection & seasoned perfectly. The flavored were incredible! We get through dinner & I ordered the creme brulee . First Maria came out & wished me a happy birthday & brought a beautiful plate from the chef that said happy birthday along with my creme brulee. They were both so delicious! Lastly Maria brought us over an array of fresh made candies & seriously they were the best candies I've ever had in my life! It was such a beautiful dinner. I couldn't have asked for a better birthday dinner! THANK YOU MARIA! You really made my birthday dinner so special!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood platter!

k-ZxHMok8di39F9IaliWrQ.text: I really like this place! My parents and I came here for lunch to check it out and since it was a bit cheaper than dinner.  The staff are super friendly and so willing to help out.  When we rode the elevator up, we were greeted by the kitchen! Haha, how cool, well I think it's cool, okay?   We got there early so we wandered around a bit.  The view was pretty awesome! I loved being able to see Bellagio and Ceasar's Palace on such a beautiful sunny day.  We were seated and our waiter John came to help us out and all.  He was really nice, made some small talk in between bringing our menus, drinks and food to us.  I really liked that.  I would definitely have a waiter who is more social than one who just brings us food.  And we found out we had some stuff in common too!   Anyways...on to the food: I ordered an open faced smoked salmon sandwich. My mom got crab french toast while my dad got an open faced flat iron steak sandwich.  Ah and a lobster bisque and a cucumber lemonade.  Unfortunately, my favorite part of the meal was the amuse bouches.  It was a shitake mushroom custard (? er something similar to one) Gosh it was SO GOOD.  Creamy, light and a lovely earthy deep mushroom flavor.  Then these cheese rolls, I believe there was parmesan inside.  It was crispy on the outside, soft, chewy cheesy on the inside.  There were two kinds, one topped with fresh black pepper and the other with fennel seeds. Yumm!  Sorry this review is getting long, I wonder if anyone reads reviews this long. I enjoyed my entree.  Smoked salmon had a nice flavor and the crispy brioche on the bottom was nice.  And the flavors worked well, The lobster bisque was frothy, light, had almost a seawater and lobster taste to it. I really liked it! The cucumber lemonade was very refreshing.  My mom's crab french toast was alright.  I liked the crab meat inside, but maybe a bit too much egg on the outside.  And my dad's steak was nice, a good medium and had a great flavor.  Phew my fingers are tired, hope you're eyes aren't too tired.  I do recommend checking this place out for lunch if you don't want to spend as much on dinner.

oB5B3raeYbV-tNwxCuRaBA.text: My boyfriend surprised me by taking me to this restaurant for our one year anniversary. We had such a great experience from the view to the food to the service that we decided to go back again for our 2nd anniversary. The food was so decadent and melted in our mouths! We loved it so much that we decided to try them out for lunch one day & it was equally as pleasing! We recommend going for dinner, though, because the city lights add an extra amount of romance!

uGt3cybZa_M02mRoQQvY3w.text: I would come back just for the view!!! Food was good, but I was hoping for the food to match the view. We came for Sunday brunch and the food was good, but nothing spectacular. Service was excellent. I would come back just for the view!

HHbH0EfvRSylplLp3JORZQ.text: First things first, this place is pricey! So if you are looking to only spend $40 on two people, stop right now! You're in the wrong town for that, this is Las Vegas.  This place is amazing! You definitely have to make reservations, but it's worth it! The food is heavenly! I went here with my girlfriend (her first real time in vegas, so I had to make sure her first dinner here was memorable!) and we both loved the food! I had the Beef Wellington with mashed potatoes, and she had the Salmon with mashed potatoes. Both dishes were perfect! The souffles were absolutely amazing and are highly recommended! Most of all, the service and atmosphere is extraordinary! You get to see the Bellagio water fountain from your seat, and the service is amazing! It's like they are always there to fill your drink. Hell, they clean your table with a knife! Who the hell does that? Well, these guys do and you definitely feel super human when you eat here! By the way, in case you're wondering how much a typical meal for two would be here...i'd say on average it'd be $150. In my opinion, worth every penny!

WEaiHa9gZjJyjAHanhzA5w.text: Alright, many of the reviews here are from the ladies but it's time to get a guys perspective ain't that right fellas?  To my brothers, first things first work overtime, deal drugs, win the lotto, do what you have to do to get a lot of paper son cause you'll be needing it if you want to impress your date. 2 dinners, one side, dessert and a drink will cost yo ass a bill if not more. No joke!   The food is great though. Since we took the leap of coming to this boojee ass restaurant I decided to splurge and get myself a $50 steak. What does a $50 steak taste like? Fucking delicious, atleast that's what I keep telling myself for ordering a $50 steak that came with no sides. But really though it was great even though I only have cheaper restaurant steaks to compare it to. The French waiter was cool at first, he was attentive but then he seemed to care more for a couple of girls and ignored our asses for the rest of the night. That is until it was time to pick up the check and get his tip then he was circling our table like a vulture.  All and all, I try to say "fuck it" every once in a while and go all out. Chances are I could get a ticket for making an illegal u-turn or some dumb shit and waste my money on that instead. Now atleast I can say I had a $50 steak and it was de-fucking-licious.  P.S. Dress up if you don't want to get dirty looks from the staff and invest in a souffle (sue-flay), ladies love souffles.

rI0piz0Aiy_V8GjfNvElqA.text: Hubby and I came here on a whim for lunch while I was taking a break from a conference I was attending and were completely blown away by the beautiful atmosphere, food and customer.   We were seated right next to the window so we had a beautiful scenic view of the strip. I ordered the chicken Parmesan with vegetables and potato scallops. It was cooked very well. Hubby ordered lamb burger which was cooked well but not crazy about it. One of the best parts of the menu was the dessert! Creme brulee was absolutely amazing! We were also given complimentary passion fruit candy and chocolate truffles.   Our waiter made sure we taken care of and the buss boy also made sure our water glasses were filled.

2FI8Aqez-VQpWVl0O59MEA.text: Good food & great view. My husband and I went to the Eiffel Tower to celebrate our anniversary. Although we enjoyed the food, he had the beef Wellington, & I had the short ribs, I honestly thought it could have been better for what it cost.  The short ribs were a little dry.  The best thing about the meals: dessert. I had the chocolate souffle, & my husband had the pistachio. They were both great. Yummy!  It's worth going for the experience, but I wouldn't go back again.

egyHNCpf_YG0V5lNCrF1Ig.text: Insane. Was celebrating our engagement with my Fiance. Chef made us a special Chef Choice dinner including five appetizers, three entrees and a special desert decorated with our names in chocolate ganache.  Food was superlative from beginning to end. View of the Bellagio water show from our window table was spectacular. A lovely place to celebrate a special event.

ADX1RcFlhUDCrZws5dpYuw.text: This is by far one of the best experiences I've ever had in a restaurant. We made a reservation for dinner on a Friday night,  got a window seat with the most amazing view. The service was incredible and the food was even better. If you are going to Las Vegas you have to eat here!

p-sc3zu7mNUYpraUuTfLCA.text: Pretty good French restaurant. We could see the fountain across the street while we were having dinner here. The food was delicate, and I had a chance to have rabbit dish. The rabbit meat was properly stewed and the sweetness of the scallions help avoid the fishy taste of the rabbit meat. This dish definitely worths trying. The appetizer I had was warm foie gras. The foie gras was so good that I wish I have a chance to try the cold foie gras during next visiting. The service was pretty well, but it would be great if they standardize the utensil service. During my visit, the fork and the knife did not get changed for each different dish.

LRvtqBVgYtHxduqG3l3j8Q.text: Duck was amazing! The entire night was magical and beautiful and a great place for a fancy dinner. The only problems we had was with the steak which was very raw, but the server was quick to put the steak back on the grill. Server was great, awesome vibe at the restaurant, and delicious mocktails were made!  I would advise to get a reservation ahead of time due to their popularity and the amount of people going there every night.

VJJcN1iY20RCPaax6W7KgQ.text: After looking forward to this dining experience for several weeks it's safe to say it did not disappoint! Mat, the bartender who served us delicious cocktails, also delivered great recommendations. As recommended by Mat, we ordered the bison steak (LOVED) and the beef wellington. Coupled with sides to share and a bottle of champagne, it was a fantastic dinner. Great food, great drinks, great service, and a great view!

WpvKKlZMFxUSz-tkIiWf8A.text: Decor: Had dinner there during sunset. The view is magnificent! We got seated at a table by the window overlooking the Bellagio's fountains. So amazing!!!  Food : we choose just a simple salad to start with.  Appreciated the way the bread was presented, wrapped in a napkin on a plate, set up like a bed.  Then we had the Tournedos Rossini that consists of a thick piece of beef topped with a scalloped slice of Foie Gras. Very tasty and delicious. It came with a supposedly creamy spinach dish that end up floating in melted butter. Probably 1000 calories per bite, too bad but really too greasy, we couldn't eat it.   For desert we had the souffle with salted caramel syrup on the side. The texture of the souffle was perfect and very well cooked but to our taste a little too sweet.   So for my this restaurant is a little over priced for the quality of the food but the view is definitely breathtaking!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overlooking the Bellagio&#39;s fountains
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner at the Eiffel Tower
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread in bed lol

lJMavwZ9ndezbhQJsoSblg.text: Service is impeccable. I'm pleased to see they've added some vegetarian options but both times I've called ahead (bc we had reservations w a large party) and asked if they'd be able to accommodate a vegan. They did not hesitate and each time assured me they'd speak to the chef. The chef prepared special dishes just for me! Sorbet was a painter's palette of sorbet. I was not hungry and I have no idea how much it all cost bc I didn't pay but something tells me it was WAY too much for faro and mushrooms lol. The views are amazing.  Oh and the cocktails are awesome. Try them all! (if you're not paying) I definitely wouldn't make it a point to come here if you'er vegan but if you'er in a group and not paying, I'd come.

c5tZ94nRJDXpO4cgXCD4yQ.text: Absolutely romantic spot to have dinner.  The view from up top is gorgeous. Customer service wonderful,  food that melts in your mouth it's that good.  Highly recommend for a date night.

yyf6hCUX28Jra7nZOkg0hA.text: Absolutely beautiful setting! We only visited the bar, but the cocktail we had was spectacular! Pricey, but it's Vegas, so it's expected. The type of setting where you'd want to get engaged!!

6KGPuubr0JiP8a_fiP2aBQ.text: The ambience and food were excellence.  The staff is very attentive and were excellence with my family and our little celebration

mNdRu07bufio5OG8H7-UCA.text: My husband and I have been to many wonderful restaurants, and decided to celebrate our one year anniversary at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in hopes to continue our extravagant dining experiences in Las Vegas. Prior to our arrival we received a text outlining a strict list of apparel guidelines and what to wear. Upon our arrival we shared a ride to the 11th floor with a couple wearing jeans and t-shirts, while we were dressed up. This was originally shocking and upsetting.   Our seats, near the window was wonderful! As we sat down though, my husband was greeted with the lady at a table next to us charging her iPhone. Literally plugged in by my husbands feet. The down side to our table was we were near the waiters stand and heard personal conversations among them all night. Our service from the beginning was lacking. I was not impressed with the atmosphere.  We thought perhaps all the ups and downs maybe it's worth it for the food, wrong. The prices are so "high class," for a "low class" experience and terrible customer service. I ordered a New York steak. Not the best I've ever had, okay size but not filling. Our sides potatos au gratin and mushrooms were good, but not out of this world for their high price tag. Lastly my husband ordered a rack of lamb for $59. The plate came out with a mere three lamb legs. I can get way more and better tasting at other restaurants in Vegas for the same price and better atmosphere. Disappointed doesn't even cover our experience. We came here excited to share our first anniversary and discuss our last year, but we're faced with a lacking experience. We're upset we didn't go to a restaurant we know we love that our dressy appearance would have been more welcomed and appreciated.  Overall, I would not recommend this experience to any of my friends and family. I was disappointed none-the-less. The best part of dinner was my company, my husband.

x4LmniK7aE33NhEdD2ZRLQ.text: I had been looking forward to dining here for quite some time; however, I am pretty disappointed in our overall experience. Even after making reservations ahead of time, we still had to wait a while for our table. Considering that we came on a busy Saturday night, the initial wait was not the issue. I was initially disappointed in the fact that we were given a table that was somewhat tucked away without a direct view of the fountains. Our waitress was not very friendly and took quite a long time to bring our drinks. In fact, our drinks didn't come until our appetizers had arrived. We ordered the non-traditional Caesar salad and the asparagus soup. Although we were more than happy with the amazing flavor of the salad, the soup was lukewarm. I had been looking forward to ordering the Wellington but was underwhelmed with the dish. The sauce that accompanied the entree seemed to lack flavor. The creamed spinach and mushroom side dish was absolutely delicious! Another plus side was how much we enjoyed the cocktails once they arrived. I am giving 3 stars instead of 2 due to the salad, side dish, and tasty cocktails. We've dined with many many restaurants on the strip but I am sad to say that this restaurant did not live up to my expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Individual Eiffel Tower Beef Wellington , Sautéed Snap Peas
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Non - Traditional Caesar Salad , Warm Anchovies , Capers and Garlic Vinaigrette. Absolutely delicious! I highly recommend this dish!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamy Asparagus Soup, Petite Crab Cake... Lukewarm

I-fln5NeMBml1DI3BcDUjA.text: My elderly mother and I had a very nice lunch at the Eiffel Tower Resto in Las Vegas. We had very nice window table with a beautiful view of The Strip, great service and very good food.  Helpful tip: It is much easier to get a window table for Lunch. The only downside is that the Lunch Menu is smaller (but less expensive) than the Dinner Menu and the Bellagio Fountains do not start until the late afternoon. Enjoy!

8ep4nQG4JysAUuKZz5udIw.text: Now this place earns five stars no problem service,food and view everything about it is awesome i have to say one of the best I've dine at. Perfect for a special occasion a little pricey but is worth every penny of it.

qa7cOPt1ht9cz3GTwQYlXA.text: This place has a great view if you are only dining with one other person. I went with my family and we didn't have a nice view at all and we were told only couples can sit by the window. Food was just ok for the price and is not comparable to some of the other fine dining options. The viewing deck is sold separately, so for a large group you are getting an overpriced meal with nothing else included. Services was good though, which is why I gave it 3 stars instead of 2.

rrG-EgWWvw8AhhgcJKmiPw.text: This restaurant has a great view on Strep and romantic atmosphere. Food nothing special but too expensive I wouldn't spend again so much money amount of food

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rabbit

zDOtAUl_Du4R3MEuE25ACw.text: Went here for my spouses bday. It was a surprise and had a group of 6 to attend. I had changed the reservation many times . Each time it was not a problem. The service , food and cocktails were awesome. I have no problem  getting what I paid for and I did.  We have been here before and it did not disappoint then and now .. the ambiance is romantic , dressy and the view of the Bellagio Fountains is great.

a4oHz8vsXnoMp4ek4x0WbA.text: Our first anniversary and The Eiffel Tower Restaurant did not disappoint.  We were promptly seated at a two person table in which you are facing the window.  Our view was fantastic.  Our waiter treated us extremely well.  We ordered a nice bottle of wine, "Trebach".  It was exquisite.  We never lacked water or even bread.  They kept attending to us.  My wife ordered the "Queen" Filet Mingon and I had the Rack of Lamb all accompanied by the Olive Oil Mashed Potatoes.  The best cuts of meat by far.  It was all fantastic.  The filet was crusted wonderfully and the lamb was tender and juicy.  Oh my!!!  For dessert, Grand Marnier Soufle'. Another "OH MY".  To die for.  Once it was all done they brought out to us a small dessert plate celebrating our 1st anniversary.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kmzlLQ-B_8qb6D29yUC0Gw.text: First off.. The view is priceless. The food, well that's a different story. When we made our reservations on the first floor in the Paris casino, they did not tell us that we are not allowed to share a plate. The bottom of their menu states each person has to order their own plate. Drinks are way to expensive and mind you these are just basic alcohol / wine drinks, nothing extraordinary.  I ordered the semi chicken ( came with 2 inch asparagus)..no sides.  $35 chicken was tasteless and hard to chew. I believe the view is there to distract you from how simple and flavorless  the food taste. My husband ordered the king steak $70! No sides just steak. On a good note, the staff was super friendly and highly attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow! Bill for just two people. Way way too expensive and REMEMBER they don&#39;t allow sharing 1 plate! It&#39;s stated on the menu.

00RebN0-dxIIHR8d9CI9Ug.text: Amazing view. The food was eh.... so so I've had better French food elsewhere. The lobster app was good. And souffle was to die for. Anything in between was overrated and over priced.

ll0j3iVAxTplEIxUm5SuHQ.text: Great atmosphere! Beautiful view! Great service even in the bathroom. We always stop by every time we're in Vegas. It's the perfect place for special occasions.

Y7_86QJsUogAUp3ZLpMqDA.text: We went for our 5 years wedding anniversary they were busy we had cocktail ls at the bar and were glad we did , food were delicious had it with a bottle of wine and the view were just stunning. Great steak, Crab salad were nice, Desert to compleate the wonderful meal the server were nice. Not a bad price.

ajXixiMpi8uZsSDqYDGuQg.text: The restaurant is great, I loved the food, the view and the quality how my husband and I were treated. If you are looking for a great and romantic experience, that's the place.

aYrPWzP6WmxHb8YLhAsspA.text: Had another spectacular meal today at the Tower for lunch. Started with my go-to appetizer: the escargot that's served with puff pastry in a garlic butter sauce. Outstanding! I also ordered two La Reve l'Orange mocktails (think of a melted orange creamsicle). For my entree, I had the Salmon Paillard, and for dessert, their molten chocolate tart. The service is unbeatable here. All staff members are eager to spend time with each guest, answer any questions, and get to know each personally. And as someone who tries to visit the Tower once a month, that goes a very long way with me. The prices are right on par with this caliber of cuisine, and the views of the Strip and the Bellagio Fountain Shows from the Tower isn't something to miss!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An incredible chocolate tart/cake from the lunch menu.

-mII-_oHCTlOWFoDcTRUsQ.text: Had an excellent meal here. Booked the 4:30pm reservation to be seated by the windows for sunset and fountain show. My only disappointment was no intesting non alcoholic options. When a fancy restaurant thinks of us non drinkers it makes me really happy. Everything else was super on point. Perfect baguette. My venison was executed perfectly and was incredible. Souffle for dessert amazing. It was a fantastic experience and would highly recommend!

KA2QoTdQeO28ZW3FzoyA3g.text: Very pricey but worth the money. The view is great. Ordered filet mignon with bone marrow and lobster, came out to be around 200 bucks but the food was perfect. This is the only place I think the meat was cooked to perfection. Definitely recommend. The only thing was they sat me at the corner so getting the waiter's attention was really hard

8s-ZBTr6I3iRBGou9eDkQA.text: My girlfriend is from Paris, and while I've had Foie Gras, I never understood the fascination with it until I had the Foie Gras here.  The food, service, and drinks are excellent.  We also got a great view of the Bellagio water show.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Autumn in Paris
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Eiffel Affair

6hzm8G6lFAHNiFi71v_qOg.text: Went here from my Birthday.  Spectacular View. I've eaten in many French Restaurants in Chicago and Paris France.   The food here was not good at all.  Maybe we made the mistake of doing the tasting menu.  First course was one scallop.  That was ok.  Did smell a little fishy which it shouldn't.   Second was foie gras which was tasty. Next came sea bass.  So salty and no other real flavor. Did not like it at all. Last was veal medallions.  Pure salt.  Like someone dumped a whole bunch of salt on it. First time in my life I sent food back.  You could not eat it.  They brought another and same thing.  For a $145 tasting menu it was not worth it at all.  Do not think I'd ever eat here again.  Too many other fabulous restaurants in Vegas.

qWmtiBusu0ILveBJTPH_Tg.text: We recently ate here for lunch during a recent stay in Las Vegas. The view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains were worth the trip alone but imagine my surprise when the food was beyond exceptional.   We had the aged Parmesan Chicken with roasted potatoes and French cut green beans. The meal was exquisite! They brought us some sweet treats, recommended a fabulous wine, I'm still thinking about that meal. The service was impeccable. The server Ruben treated us as royalty.   I've eaten at the real Eiffel Tower restaurant in Paris and this one may have even surpassed that as far as flavor and service. What a treat :)

LMPQrZ43na9eCUZ_Zpxwww.text: Would give this gem 6 stars if I could! Service was impeccable, great view of the strip, wine list was on point, filet was amazing, and the made to order pistachio souffles was so delicious!

nfnz6QLe8ZJo8OtOueRqQQ.text: I recently visited Las Vegas from Chicago and decided to spend Valentine dinner here with my wife and I must say this has to be the best experience thus far! The view of the Bellagio water show and the strip was spectacular...Our waiter was very attentive and courteous  and guided us to the Romeo and Juliette drinks. Our dinner was very appealing to the eye up to par with what we expected, and the ambiance was perfect for the occasion. We will defiantly never forget that experience and will return soon

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not even the Signature Room in Chicago can compare to this!

YuVOzNQ0mjsZ23DW5FjJ2g.text: If you get a window seat, you are in for a treat. Excellent service, each dish comes beautifully presented. However, each of our two entrees were too salty. We ate about a third, bagged it to go, and later dumped it.  Extremely disappointed for the $$$ price.  Will not go there again.

Oz6Gcyd3zNIY-FzrRYq_jA.text: This place was great change of scenery and food that you should expect  from a Vegas high end restaurant. With so many steak house options in Vegas, why not opt for delicious French food with a great view.  Pros:  Service: my waitress was very professional and had a great attitude. She kept checking up on my table to make sure I had everything I needed and that I was satisfied with my food.   Food: starting from the foie gras to the desserts, all the items were decadent.   Plating: the presentation was beautiful and lived up the standards  View: even though I made reservations ahead of time, I was disappointed that I did not get the window seats as I requested in advance. I wasn't too disappointed since every seat in the restaurant still gives you a beautiful view of the Bellagio Hotel and the Bellagio fountains especially if you're dining at night.

iFsJTxeerS4cNULfL-vB8g.text: Simply fantastic. The ambience is so relaxed and inviting.  Panoramic views of the Bellagio fountains.    Impeccable service and quality. The bread to the The dessert .    I ordered the lamb. Wow the chef can cook. It was art and heaven combined.  Perfectly cooked. And FLAVOR.... off the charts.   This is definitely a return visit restaurant. Enjoyed every moment.

s79l_YOskLCIUjbt6s-K0A.text: I had been wanting to go here for years. I'm so glad I finally had the opportunity to come here. This was the best meal I had ever had! The service was amazing and the view for Las Vegas was very nice. As for the food, everything we ordered was amazing. We ordered , butternut squash soup, New York foie gras, baked lobster , king filet mingon with creamed spinach and mushrooms and potato gratin. This was our first time trying foie gras and it was unbelievably excellent! It is a bit pricey but worth every penny for the amazing experience and I cannot wait to come back!

zfqCpGvfycdoF-ZgfP1dTg.text: What a fantastically romantic and amazing experience! It's honestly been a dream of mine for years to eat at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant when in Vegas but I've never been able to attend, but wow was the wait worth it!  I made a reservation about a week or two in advance for lunch at 11:30am on a Tuesday to celebrate my anniversary with my partner and the few people who helped me over the phone were super nice and respectful. I asked for a window table since I was celebrating a special occasion and the receptionist was able to secure me the best table in the house! The coveted corner table!  The views were absurdly gorgeous! The rose I requested from them was placed on the table and was beautiful. The food was amazing, we had a little cup of leek soup courtesy of the chef which was great, their French Onion Soup was to die for! And at $8 for an appetizer it's such a good find! We ordered the French Buccatini pasta which was one of the best pastas I've ever eaten as well as Chicken Parmesan with potatoes and green vegetables which was equally as delicious. Finally, we were surprised with a Happy Anniversary Chocolate Mousse executed with an amazing presentation!  All in all, a phenomenal experience that was the highlight of my trip and made my anniversary super special to me and my partner. Amazing service, beautiful restaurant and perfect food, and $20 average for a lunch plate is not bad at all! I'll definitely be returning next time I'm in Vegas, and hopefully turn coming here into a new tradition!

aE3GWXXgHXOV6Z-qbXhITQ.text: Date Night was amazing! Their service was exceptional! My husband and I enjoyed their seafood dinners and their dirty martinis are amazing! My husband had aged bourbon and he enjoyed it too. The environment was breathtaking as we sat in a private table for two overlooking the Bellagio fountains! What a great night!! Definitely a perfect place for a romantic dinner!

cTFKBrSbWkyWPRWjmmSyig.text: Had reservation at 7:45pm today, On our special occasion.   very unprofessional/uneducated front desk employees wasted our time more than 30, they couldn't read the instructions on reservation info. Screwed up our following plans with long wait time.   We waited for the food to serve more than 1hour. OMG it's not a great place to celebrate. Makes you irritated

LqPP-5baLfoVJz1oxr4X8Q.text: Amazing food. I had filet mignon and asparagus with a glass of wine and it was thee best meal we ever had. Service and view couldn't be beat.

2G0KJnv2-ybZoBnEsojn_A.text: OMG! Chris was our waiter and he was so knowledgeable and very helpful! Service was wonderful... Food was amazing!

LQ34BMJN666zDSMT13bRtg.text: This place is a bit fancy and not our usual kind of venue but I wanted something special to celebrate my wife's birthday (was a week previous) on our Vegas weekend splurge. Ambiance and service is what you'd expect for the most part - excellent.  Amazingly we got seated at a window table but we suspect that was maybe a "faux pas" on their part as we had not paid for that - a hostess came over to question our reservation name 5 mins after we sat down. Very obsequious waiter (hand clasping etc) came over and did his stuff, then sommelier steered us to a great choice of wine based on what we wanted, food paring and our budget (wine list starts at $65, goes up to infinity, and he talked us into a lower priced wine than we originally were going to order so respect that). We ordered our food and all was good.  Fantastic smoked salmon starter which we shared (red flag for waiter maybe), then main courses came out.  One reason I took my wife here is because she wanted to try Beef Wellington (she's a Gordon Ramsey fan). That came out "well done"  and no pink in the middle at all (still very tasty and not dried out but not as any online recipe suggests).  My lamb cutlets were meant to be "medium" but were verging on bloody/raw.  Not very impressive! The service from the waiter had gone downhill rapidly and it was hard not to assume he had figured out we were not "big spenders" so he would be better off focusing his attention on other higher spending tables.  Hardly saw him after that and the dessert menu was just plopped on the table without any comment as I was looking out of the window while my wife was in the restroom. The overall experience left a sour note and was frankly disappointing.  Sure, a $250 meal for 2 plus a $50 tip is peanuts from the waiter's perspective in an establishment like this but to be so blatantly dismissive was rude and really tarnished the experience I was hoping to give my wife.  Will not be going back.

gv-2w2DFtDgC9DUIT5h4oQ.text: Everything was really good, but the star of the show is the Gran Marnier Souffle.

MrAMc8INItepSgRR-D_Taw.text: Amazing view- especially if you call ahead and tell them that you want the window seat. We got the set menu which was delicious. I preferred the steak over the fish, but still overall yummy.  We had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains which was the best part of the whole meal.

6jMTgG9BZeqdfZTHmTAqpw.text: This review is overdue, but sadly, I was less than impressed with my experience here...and it was my birthday dinner! During a trip to Vegas, we decided to enjoy a nice dinner out at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and actually planned ahead so we made a reservation before we got into town. We called the restaurant, requested a nice window seat and told them it was my birthday. Knowing this is a very expensive restaurant, we expected to have the same experience we've had at other expensive restaurants (in Vegas among other cities). We expected to be greeted nicely and for our reservation to be treated with some dignity. When we showed up for our restaurant, we immediately realized that this restaurant is more of a spectacle than the other fine dining options in the area. They let anyone up into the restaurant so it's very congested by the bar, loud and anything but "special." We gave our name for our reservation and the hostess lead us to our table. As I mentioned, we had made our reservations several weeks in advance and asked for a window table.   They gave us a "window" table but that ended up being right next to a huge poll on the opposite side of the restaurant that didn't overlook the Bellagio fountains but instead the run down Bally's pool that was under construction. It was also the smallest table in the entire restaurant. Our lovely romantic dinner on my birthday was turning into a disaster very fast. We decided to ask the hostess if there was any other table available and they said possibly. So we went to the bar to have a drink and waited for another table. About 20 minutes later they took us to another table. This time, it did have a view of the fountain but it was also right in front of the server's station so we constantly had servers on our laps during the meal. After the cluster of getting a table, I barely remember the food and while we still had a good time because we were together, we won't be visiting the Eiffel Tower Restaurant again for a fine dining experience in Vegas. There are so many other places with just as good of a view, better ambiance and much, much better service!

E8QYxaKMLM9lDOjxZt4Q5Q.text: Absolutely one of my favorite French cuisine place to go! Not only is the food amazing but the service is impeccable and excellent.  The view is also a plus and breath taking.  This is definitely a place that's worth going again.

PbSXv7bcfMlPu0kr3HGzdA.text: I came here for lunch yesterday. It was my first time eating here, and I could say this was the best fine dining experience I ever had as of today.  The restaurant: The view of the strips, especially the Bellagio fountain, from this restaurant was beautiful. The decor was elegant.  The food:  I ordered Aged-Parmesan Crusted Chicken, Triple Chocolate cake and Mudslide (Mudslide was not on the menu, by the way). They gave free mushroom flan and Parmesan cheese puffs as starters. All of them were very rich in taste. Very delicious. The flan, cheese puffs, chicken and string beans were well-seasoned. The cake was smooth and delicious. The Mudslide was great as well.  The service: The waiter, who took my order, was attentive, nice and polite.  He knew the menu well. He's such a professional waiter.  The restroom: Very clean. Elegant decor as well.  The kitchen: Wow, it looked really clean. No wonder they are not afraid to show their kitchen to the customers. The kitchen is located right at the entrance (in front of the elevator), and it's an open kitchen, so people can see the kitchen and the hard-working chefs when they enter and leave the restaurant.  I will come back to eat here again when I visit Vegas next time.

dA_N0DhQDELRiGRPqGptyg.text: Fine dining, rich and decadent food, gorgeous view... At its best!  $40 champagne flutes, buttery potatoes, perfect filet mignon.  The best seat at the house in the corner of the restaurant, Bellagio fountain, the busy strip full of lights, feeling you're on top of the world.  As the elevator doors open, you have a view of the open faced kitchen, walk into the dim restaurant with a big bar to grab drinks while you wait.   The whole experience was fantastic. Definitely a nice place for special occasions.

kymIqVKmhYpu6q0P3F-jVA.text: Gents....be careful when you decide to take a girl out without making plans.  My date made zero plans and said he would take me to dinner wherever I wanted to go...so guess what? I wanted to go to the super fancy Eiffel Tower Restaurant.  Make reservations ahead of time....we got in on a Friday night because of the connections I have.  :)  Anyways, Grilled Lamb with huckleberry's and chestnuts? Yes please!!!!  Chocolate desserts and Chocolate souffles???? HELL YEAH! To die for!!! Dont forget to refinance your house before coming here...you will need the cash.  Oh and ever since this incident, my guy has had a plan for every date we go on. ;-)

Urlv1ZI3udfj1bFPSUhSHQ.text: The whole package is a four.  The views, service and ambience is a 5 and the food is a 3.  We had a magical view overlooking the Bellagio fountains with the pretty--if Disneyesque--architecture of the Italian style buildings around the Bellagio lake.  In fact, even the restaurant itself felt like a Disneyworld restaurant.  I'm not sure this would be my restaurant of choice (given the expense) if I were taking my wife.  I would take her to an equally expensive but more gastronomic choice in Vegas.  But, given that I had my 13 year old daughter, the choice couldn't have been better.  The food is pretty good but you can tell this isn't a chef of supreme talent.  My daughter's halibut was excellent.  My veal was a little tough and a tad over-cooked.  In other words, the food is perfectly fine but don't expect Eric Ripert from Le Bernardin or Thomas Keller from the French Laundry.  I wouldn't even put the food in a category of Mortons or Ruth Chris.  It's a half a step below these.  But, the view, the fun of riding the elevator and the overall experience made this a wonderful evening with my daughter who has raved about the restaurant.  Here's what to expect for price (assuming appetizer, main and dessert) per person:  $75 food $50 wine $10 tax $25 tip  $150/per person

mi5PiFgMARnZHWSckVPbFg.text: Some of the best food and service  I have had in a long time our server  was really attentive  and was on top of everything  the food runners  did everything  to the t and we didn't wait or want for anything they made sure we where well  taken care of and in closing  my complements to the kitchen  staff and the front of the  house state for the best service  ever will be going back for dinner  soon

mHPQSVeZ6AjGTYfdgDPeWA.text: Don't be fooled by the look of this place. We had better food and service at random local diner along the way of our drive from Texas.   The food was bad, especially the lamb burger that I ordered for lunch . The meat was too salty. The taste of lamb was non-existent. I would prefer to spend $16 for a fast-food McDonald's burger than eating that lamb burger again.  My wife ordered a BLT burger with salad on the side. Now why would you name it "burger" without any meat? The meatiest thing I could see was the "prepackaged" bacon which barely have any taste except, again, salt. And the salad... there were still dirt or spoiled leaves left. Totally unappealing. My wife lost her appetite after a single bite. We sat there waited and waited for over half an hour (not touching the food) for the waiter to show up (yeah right about good service) and guess who showed up!? The buzzer! Yup. And his job was just to clean up and fill up drinks. We then pointed at the spoiled salad and asked for the server. Yet no server came. Come to think of it, no one came to ask how we were doing with our meal the whole time we were eating there.   So, after the buzzer cleaned up the table, guess what, they dared to bring out the bill... without even asking if we wanted desert. Wow, my wife and I sat there in disbelief for a while. THEN the waiter appeared with 4 pieces of candies. Complimentary? Was that our desert? We would prefer a simple apology (which we never receive).  Terrible place to eat. Period. Just come for the view.  Pro tip: You can get the "better" view if you pay for the Eiffel Tower elevator ride, and a better meal if you bring along a to-go McDonald, and it definitely costs less than wasting time eating in this "restaurant."

g-cI1U_DyE-ctWBlwVrgzA.text: The only reason why I'm giving three stars is because of the desert the entree where not all that and overpriced...the desert was beautiful and delicious

jQbjItA2p_K8a_OL6ox0Mg.text: Please DON'T GO HERE,,, prices are way too high for mediocre food & probably the worst customer service ever!!! They will ruin your night , spend your money somewhere where they will appreciate you!  I never have time to write reviews but I had to warn others about this horrible place :/  I've been too many restaurants in my day ,, and I never seen staff that could care less about their customers ,,, since they are a busy restaurant they don't care if you don't like the service because they can just replace you with someone else who will take your table reservation ,,,I believe a lot of people were lured to this restaurant because their "view" but  truth is their view is not great at all , their service is insulting , the food is mediocre , and the atmosphere is nothing special. Fine dinning is priceless but when the place is actually worth it .Spent over $200 at this restaurant , and I have never been so ripped off in my life.  Seriously , spend your money at a more famous restaurant in Vegas ,, now I realize that if celebrities don't frequent a restaurant , it's obvious because the restaurant sucks ! Just how this one did :(

9paW7rIQO0tt1IcW6fLFtQ.text: Awesome food, view and service. Great special occasion meal and dining experience. Make reservations and tip the maitre d' upon arrival for a nice table with a great view.

zyN0NGnC25EExwelQjv3uA.text: Everyone familiar with Las Vegas most likely thinks of the Eiffel Tower Restaurant as a perfect location for a romantic evening or a beautiful place to have a special experience overlooking the Bellagio Fountains.  I completely agree with this, but I'd like to offer up another reason to visit this fabulous restaurant.  Recently, I had four business associates visit Las Vegas for a convention at Mandalay Bay. It was my job to entertain them during the hours they were free from meetings.  Immediately when they arrived, I scooped them up and brought them to ETR.  They were completely blown away.  We sampled delicious cocktails (The Daisy and Autumn in Paris) and amuse trios in the lounge overlooking the fountains.  Michelle was our server and she was fantastic.  Two managers, Laurent and Ehsan, stopped by to welcome us.  It was a phenomenal experience, and my guests loved it so much that they came back to the restaurant for both lunch and dinner later in the week.  They also went back to the convention telling their fellow associates how wonderful it is.  So - while it's perfect for romance,  also know that in any type of business related situation, when you're looking for a place to wow and impress, be sure to visit the Eiffel Tower Restaurant!

ey_R2m5H1c1ZZdXG0x7n2g.text: This was the best meal that I can remember! I brought my love here on a date while here in Vegas. I made the reservation well in advance a must for any of the nicer restaurants out here, and the only way to get a coveted window seat! I chose to have roses waiting for her at the table, which can be added to the dinner bill, and they were nicely arranged in a glass vase and sitting among a classy place setting. We had a beautiful view of the strip, the Bellagio fountain in particular. After we were served bread and a delightful fresh soup (chilled tomato with watermelon- I was terrified; but it was terrific!) She ordered the Beef Wellington with snap peas, I had the free range chicken with artichokes two ways, and we shared some potatoes gratin. For desert we had the pistachio souffle. All of the food was perfectly prepared and gorgeously plated. The service was fantastic. The restaurant was beautiful and the view was stunning. I had an amazing time. The only caveat would be that it is pricey, but judging from my experience worth every penny!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lft: free range roast chicken over artichokes two ways. Cntr: potatoes gratin. Rt: Beef Wellington with snap peas. All flawless.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fI8k89-b8vhBCMp2OZF5Yw.text: Amazing Views, but pricey and hardly any Veggie options  If you are vegan, don't even go here. They have like one mushroom dish which is vegan. If you eat eggs , there are a few more options. The view is amazing. It came to 52$ with tip for 2 people for just an entree and one non alcoholic cocktail.

0Skcil8gUsNOWMgq_QzMFg.text: This place is overpriced for a view that you can get from your hotel room. Save your money for the real Eiffel Tower. You MUST order a meal even after you are blown away by the astronomical prices. The restaurant does not cater to dietary restrictions. The waiter asked us if we had questions than had a snide remark answer. I would save your money for other Vegas eats. Want to have wine? Dish out 300 for the same selection at Costco.

345oxp5oD44vu6lJfAQaxQ.text: Never again!  Except maybe for a cocktail.  While the views are fantastic, the service and the kitchen does not measure up to high-end Las Vegas standards.  The menu is truly pedestrian with no imagination whatsoever.  Prices are targeted for lame high-rollers and we pity the poor punters that take their significant others there for a once-in-a-lifetime celebratory occasions.  My wife & I joined her clients in from out of town with another couple for a birthday dinner.  We opted for wine-by-the-glass, but the list was MBA/CPA optimized for maximum gouging.   The menu was strangely limited, although each category - beef, fish and non-beef - about 6 selections each, was hardly stimulating.  New York Strip, rib eye, rabbit, halibut.  Yawn.  Started off with a vichyssoise that tasted like it came from a can.  The taste of the French bread was terrible!  Local Vietnamese sandwich shops offer fresh French bread with better texture & taste.  Then we waited - for an hour before the mains were served.  The average entre price is $50.  Salads are $12.  With so many fabulous restaurants in greater Las Vegas, we're loath to return.  All the view in the world didn't make the dinner experience any better.  Semi-retired food snob.  He doth protest too much.

PT8adgcflulhBQ62LE6nJg.text: Finally got to experience the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and was sorely dissatisfied... The food was mediocre at best and our bill was almost $900.  We were a party of 4 and we all had the tasting menu so we could try a variety of dishes.  Not worth the money...it's a tourist trap.

ooQ98Ku9tSJWSJVoq6bpoQ.text: Keith, our bartender, was wonderful! He was knowledgeable about dessert and cocktail pairings and made the best raspberry lemon drop! As frequent visitors to Vegas, I can't believe my husband and I haven't come here before! Two delicious cocktails, the best chocolate dessert and a fabulous view for about $40! If you're debating... just do it! We didn't have to make a reservation to sit at the bar. Thanks, Keith, for the excellent service!

d9YAsXpwDkamDrlFAVN7XA.text: The Eiffel Tower was AMAZING but pricey. Well worth it -if you have an unlimited budget.  We sat with a fabulous view of the Bellaggio fountains.  The night view is lovely -you can see the whole Strip.   Only reason I gave this place 4 Stars is because the corkage fee is outrageous-$75!!! Unless you have a very special bottle to open, the corkage is prohibitive.  The wine list is expensive too.   But the food -EXCELLENT! We had the lobster salad, beet salad, the wild Atlantic Cod & John Dorsey.  All were fantastic with beautiful presentation.   In the French tradition the meal ended with a sampling of delicious, varied bite sized deserts.  Delicious!!   I've eaten at the Jules Verne in the "real" Eiffel Tower & now here. Both meals were memorable.    Go if you can.

-D06Wo5xOC5JRhIXmeEs0w.text: Had lunch here a few weeks ago as an anniversary gift for my parents. It was our first experience here, and what an experience it was!  I made reservations which I quickly realized wasn't necessary when we got there, the place was mostly empty on a Thursday. Unless you are a VIP, lol, only 2-person tables are up against the windows. For larger parties you have to sit more towards the middle of the restaurant. The view isn't bad though, just not as good. But what a view, we even stayed long enough to see the Fountains at Bellagio show.   Our server was extremely friendly and helpful to us. We began lunch with the Cheese Fondue with Poached Egg. This was so delicious!! We regularly have fondue, but have never tried it with an egg. Note: The bread that comes with the fondue was oily/buttery so if you don't want that make sure to ask.   They give you a small cup of soup to start off the meal. I can't recall what it was but it was definitely tasty. They also served us various breads as we awaited our entree. The one I remember most had tons of peppercorns on it, so obviously a little spicy, not my favorite.  I was treating a few others besides my parents and at a place like this sometimes you let your wallet choose your entree. So sadly I went with the Burger. The Burger was fine but not the best on the menu. They will look at you weird if you ask for traditional/american mustard too. What can I say, I don't like that french dijon stuff. My mom was raving about the Sea Food Salad she got!! She told me to make sure and recommend this in my review, lol.   We had a few mimosas to go along with our meal. Not the best I've had, and definitely on the strong side. I think its great OJ that makes a great mimosa not pouring heavily on the champagne, but you won't catch me complaining to much there.  We decided to skip dessert, but as a gesture they brought my parents out a small dessert plate with candies and chocolates on the side for the rest of us. They looked very happy to eat it!  Overall a great experience along with quite possibly the best view of the strip from any restaurant around. Food and service is top notch.  They aren't affiliated with the rewards card used by The Paris Hotel, so sadly you can't collect any rewards points here :(:(:(

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger from lunch menu

VQC5CFZvFos1y8idk-O3jw.text: Excellent!!! The Eifel Tower was a great restaurant to celebrate my Mom's 73rd Bday. We ordered the assorted cheese, to start. My mom ordered the ocean salad, my dad ordered the filet of beef, and I ordered the salmon. We ended our delicious meals, with a complimentary chocolate mousse and a creme brulee. The Bellagio view was truly amazing. The service was impeccable, and most of all, the food was exceptional. We will definitely be back, no special occasion needed!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chocolate mousse
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood ocean salad, fresh.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet of Beef, Delicious

dLaKtp1ekZ81cD4akDiB-g.text: I proposed to my GF (now fiance) in Vegas and choose the Eiffel Tower restaurant as the place.  I did the "proposal package" dinner and it turned out great.  The planning and such leading up to the night was very smooth and organized thanks to their event staff.  The actual night itself went just as smoothly.  We sat in the special corner window table overlooking the fountains.  It was beautifully decorated and setup upon arrival.  The meal was delicious and then the ring was brought out on the banana desert on a covered platter. Our waiter and the rest of the staff couldn't have been better.  I was blown away by how well everything was handled. (I had enough on my mind already!) While a bit pricey, this was a once in a lifetime event and was worth it to me.  I recommend the proposal dinner package to anyone looking for a way to pop the question.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Proposal dinner package.. in the corner window table overlooking the fountains..

v8cZym4ICGXfd6-DyOA2lw.text: I've visited Vegas multiple times and this is BY FAR the best nice dinner place in Vegas! It's quite an experience, from the decor, delicious food and drinks. They make great cocktails. And the desserts are excellent and fancy! We waited the extra time to get a table with the view of the Bellagio fountain and were happy to do so! Loved this view WAY more than what was at the Stratosphere (even though that is still an ok choice too) Our table was a bit small but up against the glass with the best view, we were very happy!
