nTd_4hJBFgMtYpUNqA_GfA.text: Our family had a reservation here for Christmas dinner, and it was definitely a Christmas dinner to remember! The Eiffel Tower Restaurant provides a beautiful panoramic view of the Las Vegas Strip, which is the perfect backdrop to this lovely restaurant. We were promptly seated upon arrival and quickly greeted by our waitress. The level of service here surpasses that of any other restaurant we dined at during our stay. We chose the appetizers of steak tartar and the Caesar salad, the salad was absolutely wonderful, although I am not a steak tartar fan-the member of our party who ordered it said it was absolutely fantastic. Entrees that we chose were the filet mignon, New York strip, and the beef Wellington with the sides of potatoes anna and the olive oil mashed potatoes. The consensus favorite of the table were the New York strip and the beef Wellington, although all food was delicious. At the suggestion of our waitress, we ordered the chocolate souffle---best dessert we had on our trip. Overall a wonderful night spent at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.

SsE1CRIVkyjc0SAwXwjmOg.text: Amazing food/staff/location! Perfect romantic dinner for two, specially if you sit near a window overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Server was attentive/helpful & hostess wished a happy birthday which I thought was nice. Food was delicious & the creme brulee was the perfect dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best view ever!

ha4-tXoKYasSwu2psPUFtQ.text: Beautiful restaurant and good food. I called the restaurant 3 times making sure we have a good table as it was my husbands birthday. We got there on time but had to wait 30 mins for our table.   The hostesses acted like we were a bother. Finally get our table and it was a horrible one. I went to the hostess and asked her if I could get a better table as it was my husbands birthday and it was requested so many times to begin with. I was told, with an attitude, that this was the only table available and that if we wanted a better one we would have to wait an additional 30 -40 mins. The service from the wait staff was amazing but the whole experience was marred because of this.   I have been to better restaurants and I understand when everything goes haywire but, I would think that since this was a special occasion they would afford it the respect that it deserved. Suffice it to say this was a very disappointing experience!

S1vOPP8uiYxEjD0xGeWlSg.text: Add to the awesome great review..   Parked over at the bally/paris self parking. Greeted by a host on the bottom floor that then opened the elevator for us.  Upon exiting also greeted by another host that lead us to host in charge of our tables. Sat for 5 mins.  Got Called to seat in our table.  Arrangement was set as I asked (Flowers)  Waiter was very prompt and took our drinks.. Gave us a menu to look into.  Ordered our app/main entree.  Appetizers came pretty quick.. I was very amazed... Server was very very very prompt..  Ordered Dry Aged Steak medium/rare was so bomb!!!  Got offered to get dessert souffle and let me tell you.. it wasn't small but worth getting it..   Overall experience was awesome.. I give them a 5*..  If you want to bring a love one here its worth every penny..  Get the whole package..  Enjoy the show..

ipXd8WB7vxn4l47nSa9F7A.text: You can't beat the view at this restaurant, and it is a very romantic setting in Vegas.  I always enjoy the tasting menu, which is typically $125 per person and the whole table must order it.  It makes for a very relaxing enjoyable evening.  It's a nice place to take a special client or business associate.  Must have the souffle'!  Also, be advised this is part of the "Lettuce Entertain You" restaurant group, so if you have their rewards card, be sure to use it.

YkLtIxSPhygjILdcupARvQ.text: My hubby and I came here to celebrate our wedding anniversary. It was an incredible experience! Sitting by the window facing the fountains is a must! I had the duck and my husband had the Beef Wellington and we both shared each.  Both were perfectly cooked to perfection. And yes, the pistachio souffle is incredible and probably one of THE best desserts I have ever had! I highly recommended this restaurant as it is both incredible food, service, and atmosphere. I am equally into my atmosphere as I am my food when dining at these types of locations and this was everything I imagined it to be. It was an incredible experience that I will never forget. It is pricey so expect to open your wallet but I promise it will be worth every bite!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d0GdjiGgBmR9OFGEwy-J_w.text: First off the Wait and support staff were excellent. Great service and very attentive but that's the only plus. My reservation and confirmation I informed them this was for an Anniversary and Birthday. Also the couple with us this was there first trip to Vegas so we wanted a window table so they could see the town. Our table was a booth that looked at the window but you could not see anything worth while except the Bellagio sign. The food was mediocre and prices relevant to high end Vegas places. Portions were somewhat small and some of the dishes good and others just ok.  Come desert I expected something for the occasions I mentioned but nothing as our waiter knew nothing of my requests. My major issue is that there were more "suits" in the floor moving around and not once did anyone stop by the table to check on us. A top flight Resteraunt usually has Manger intervention on the floor to insure guest satisfaction. Not here yet many passed our table through the night. All in all my last visit here as I get better treatment and attention at many other places in town.

8KimOw-Ha9Xa1uVTAm_-AQ.text: Came here for lunch with my husband and had an amazing experience! The lunch menu had many options at a decent price range! We had great seats right at the window overlooking the Bellagio fountain! What a beautiful view!! We had a bottle of Rose, which was good! Our food was good- I took one star away because it wasn't mind blowing, but it was very tasty!!  I had a pasta dish, and my husband had the Parmesan crusted chicken. We had an interesting creme brulee for dessert. Creme brulee is my absolute favorite dessert and this was an interesting twist in flavor and presentation. As for the service- it was amazing!!!  Everyone was super friendly and accommodating! Our server came by to check often, but not in an annoying way! He rocked it! Thanks Jeff S. for a great experience! You made it all the better!

mUkJXk1XTe6hfTFCLJtEQg.text: Yesterday, I took my wife out to dinner and celebrated our anniversary. The foods, services, and view were amazing. Overall, we had a wonderful time! Yes, I would recommend this restaurant.

f4HayMX1ZYiEJr_TmbpQjg.text: Great food. Great service. They're very accommodating to food allergies. I come here whenever I go to Vegas.

X4K9s0Rlo2KXf_aXNYcTEg.text: It is a good place for date. Get a window seat and enjoy Bellagio fountain water show. It is pretty.   Service was good and server is knowledgable to explain the food. She checked the ingredients carefully to make sure I am safe. But I was expecting that they can accommodate my allergy more seriously because when I called to make a reservation, they told me that they are able to accommodate the allergy. However, I cannot eat anything on the tasting menu, and 2/3 of their regular menu. According to that, the experience at Chicago Everest is way better than here.  We ordered king crab leg as our appetizer, cheese plate, salmon, and snapper filet. I am satisfied with the food we ordered. Just feel a bit disappointed that the initial order of duck breast and steak and most of the food are not ok for me. Those were pre-made already. For the reputation of the chef, I expected more, that's why I only gave this place 4 star.

4BKIbQxm4766yd26DrKc5Q.text: I absolutely adore this restaurant. It is my Vegas tradition - I come here every trip!   It may seem like a cheesy idea at first, but it quickly wins you over. Every person I have brought with me falls in love with the restaurant too.   The view is incredible - the best in Vegas. I love watching the Bellagio fountains and seeing the rest of the strip.   And the menu is divine. I try a new entree every time (go with items that have an Eiffel tower icon by them...you cannot go wrong with those!) but stick with a bottle of champagne and cheese plate for an appetizer. Their mixed drinks are tasty but come with sticker shock - $17 for a tiny cocktail is a bit too ridiculous for me. Ask for a bottle of wine instead!  Their desserts are also a must. My favorite is the creme brulee but each one can hold its own!  If you have time, go up to the top of the tower after your meal. The view is spectacular!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-k4LK2_rodnVOx7IAAr9jg.text: Such a romantic experience!! Went with my husband after we got married and felt really special. Food was delicious and service was outstanding. Our window faced view outside looking onto the strip. It cost A LOT of money but it's a great experience.

dfVShjy4par9-x5L9xMyqw.text: The view is a 4. The food is 3. Service is 3. My friend ordered the New York steak-medium. Because it was a bit dark he didn't realize it was raw by the time he got to the middle of the steak. We told the waiter and his responses was, " why didn't you say something earlier?" Not a response I would expect and definitely didn't appreciate. Escargot appetizer was not at all traditional French. Highly disappointed. Escargot at Mom Ami gabi downstairs is still the best in town. Company and the view was the the only good thing about this experience.

xLy5fnAtJsQdwyhW0kFVsQ.text: So many reviews here I'll keep mine short and simple. The food was quite good but not worth what the final bill.  I have had much better for that kind of cash. This place is VERY expensive IMO. I have never had a $20 chocolate martini before...unfortunately we had 4 total.  So drinks &  dinner w\ no appetizer, no salad and no dessert total was over $220. That may be no big deal to you high rollers but I was pretty shocked.  Again, decent food and  one of the best views on the strip but you definitely pay for it! 3 stars for food quality, less that stellar waiter service, always empty water glass  and price shock. 5 star view for Vegas strip and the fountain show.  Bottom line, once you are in they have you.  You are paying mostly for the view.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JUKNc5v-x6CeE2eX0Re83Q.text: Exceptional food and great service!  Be sure to ask for Roman.  He will make your evening spectacular!

WaItm-YubtvgwRGSfzraUQ.text: Lacking menu and overpriced options. Meat was somewhat burned and did not taste fresh.  The view is good, but nothing too spectacular.  Service is okay, but a bit crass.

QfCDfhUln94BEHArlCKaYg.text: We had come to Vegas for a health and wellness conference, and my parents invited my husband and I to celebrate my mom's birthday at the Eiffel Tower. Phenomenal is the only word I can use to describe it! From the gorgeous views of the Bellagio fountains to the food to our excellent server DAVID, everything was memorable and fantastic! If you want a special experience for your palate and trip to Vegas, you have to come here!

YCxRJpnUhajRbR0fLMoXtQ.text: Wow, this restaurant did not live up to my expectations at all. I was really disappointed with the food for the price. On the last night of a recent Vegas trip with just ladies, we wanted to go out with a classy bang. Earlier in the year I visited the Ramsey Steakhouse which is also located in the Paris hotel/casino. That was my first pick but since we couldn't get a table there, Eiffel was our backup plan. We had a reservation for 4 and arrived about 20 minutes early. They accommodated us right away which was great. The view of the strip is a beautiful backdrop to the restaurant. Our server was excellent. He was very professional and explained everything in detail. I ordered the surf and turf ($74). It was a prime cut steak with lobster. I was extremely extremely disappointed with my meal. It was a layered meal which consisted of a block of a bland potato dish, topped with the steak, topped with a lobster cake then topped with 2 tiny pieces of lobster and garnish yelp.com/user_local_phot.... Not at all what I had in mind. I couldn't help but compare this to Gordon Ramsay's. Eiffel Tower restaurant doesn't come close to Ramsay's. In lieu of a salad, I opted for the tomato, mozzarella and basil app. ($18) yelp.com/user_local_phot.... That was delish! It is heirloom tomatoes, avocado, with fresh mozzarella cheese dressed with a basil oil. I ate this with assorted bread they give. Speaking of bread, you get it only after you put in your order. There is a man who walks around with a platter of assorted bread table-to-table. Can't they just leave a bread basket, don't want that man to judge me on my bread consumption, ha ha? The steak was good but nothing mind blowing. Sides were ok. My friends ordered the halibut and only ate about half since she didn't really like the flavor. I'm glad I can say I've tried this place but probably wouldn't ever come back nor recommend to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green beans
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Caesar salad
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes au gratin

yo-pBygPq-yKwvsVde6UEg.text: Perhaps this should be a 4.5 for seating us right next to a table facing the fountains of the Bellagio.   Our waiter was excellent ( I hate it when we receive great service and I forget the name ) The food was very good, but equivalent to (not surpass) other steak houses. The steaks were prepared just to our liking though. The Pear Martini was excellent, but at a staggering $20. I don't recall ever paying 20 bucks for a drink regardless of where but it was a unique drink, so worth the cost.   Seeing that it was a B-day celebration, our waiter brought over a dark choc dessert in a shot glass. It was rich, bittersweet and very satisfying for its small size. One of the best I've ever had. Nice touch!   It was a very nice experience, especially watching the beauriful fountains while we enjoyed our meal. The prices were a bit high ($20 drinks) but it's justified once you get a glimpse of the Bellagio fountain.  Well worth the experience.

DSLDcSLrDLFb9VYGIGaLng.text: We have eaten at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant before and had found it to be ..just ok.  Last week we booked it for my birthday.  The views are simply amazing and our booth overlooked the Bellagio fountains.   But even better was our meal and the service.  Nicholas Johnson-Tatum (he gave me is business card) was our captain and waiter.  I highly suggest asking for him, as it was impeccable service.   Will definitely go back

Z1mpQykGMuRlLSyZubriLQ.text: Absolutely the best meal and experience on the strip even for vegetarians.  I highly recommend the beef wellington - it was the best dish I've had in years!

dlgrU8P4aBvxiL46yr6SCw.text: Really enjoyed this as my 10 year anniversary dinner spot. After being seated in a *not so great* section of the restaurant they were more than accommodating to move us to a "fountain view" spot (which made my husband's anniversary surprise that much better!). Pricey....expect to pay for the location and the view but the food was YUM! Started with a few different types of bread and a bottle of wine. We ordered two main dishes we were both interested in. Main dishes we ordered were the stuffed lobster tails (I ordered but my husband commandeered it after I took his meal!) and I had the lamb chops (OMG the best!!!!). The side orders were nothing to write home about and the husband and I were not up for desert so we opted out of the souffle. Best place for a wonderful and romantic evening night out (although we did see families and friends eating there as well).

yv0T5THLBdPmIjNHSbzUWA.text: The food here was very good, I wouldn't say it knocked my socks off, but very good.  The service was excellent, very attentive staff kept our drinks filled and frequently checked in on us.  As others have noted, you're paying for the views of Vegas strip mostly.  I think the experience is worth the price.  But don't order drinks. $20 for a cocktail is away over the top, when you could put that $20 in slot machine downstairs and get free drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rabbit

ljzToxZGvVykKM8MawYxJA.text: While waiting for out dinner reservations elsewhere we decided to head up here for a drink.  Great choice, the view amazing the service nice and the bartender was attentive and cute.    Again the view is amazing!  Next time I will have to try the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view

bleedddSm6GXtHIEctRpjw.text: Beautiful restaurant. Delicious food.  Service was average. Where we sat... horrible!   With that being said... We sat next to the kitchen, where the waiters were rushing in and out of there. Every time a waiter would pass by, either my purse would fall to the floor, my jacket would flip over, or my hair would fly all over. It felt like they were running past by us.  Next time, I know where not to sit.

AxbbImey8Q1wbjPNNgukmA.text: One of the best dining experiences I've ever had. My wife and I were in Vegas to celebrate our 10-year anniversary. I wanted a memorable dining experience and settled on the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for our celebratory dinner on 1-30-16.  When I made reservations, I asked if we could get a table by the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains. As some other reviewers have mentioned, I too was told that the only way to guarantee a window table was to buy an all-inclusive package.  This is my only nit-pick with the Eiffel Tower Restaurant....the price of the package is insane. Even if it is "all-inclusive," there's just no way that two people will eat/drink enough to justify the price you commit to in order to guarantee a window seat. To put it in perspective, my wife and I ended up getting a 6-course chef's tasting menu, we each had 3 premium wines/drinks, we got a commemorative photo, I had roses delivered to the table, and we got 2 Express tickets to the top of the tower after dinner. Even with all of that, it still didn't add up to the price needed to "guarantee" a window.  The good news.....we ended up getting a nice window table anyway. I declined the guarantee price but simply asked if they could do their best. And they came through.  When you take the elevator up, you exit right into the kitchen, which I thought was a cool touch. It's like you immediately enter a different world, where you get to see world-class chefs at work.  The view from the restaurant is amazing. As mentioned, our table was right up against the window looking directly over the fountains.  At the server's suggestion, we opted for the 6-course tasting menu. It was great because we got a taste of everything. The highlights were a warm lobster salad, wild snapper, and venison. The only thing I wished we hadn't done was the cheese tray. It was an optional add-on and, in fairness, our server warned us that it's not popular. I ordered it anyway, and I shouldn't have because it just wasn't our thing.  The service was top notch. Literally the best service I've ever had in a restaurant. Very attentive without being intrusive. I wish I could remember our server's name to give him a shout out because he did a fantastic job.  Don't go here if you're on a budget. If you want a memorable, romantic experience in Vegas, though, this is your place.

plB98Ra3OmUZcOWWJv1OGA.text: It's really too bad that this experience was so disappointing.  Our group of four had dinner here before we headed out to a show.  Two people in our party ordered steaks, medium rare.  Well, they both came out not only well done, but burnt.  It's appalling that the chef thought it was okay to send out steaks that looked like this, and also shocking that the waiter looked at these steaks and didn't seem to care. You'd think he'd say to himself "hmmm, these look really well done and my customers ordered medium rare."  But no... my friends sawed through the steaks and sent them back, but by that time we were running late for our show.  So, canceled our order and left hungry.  They did give us a nice discount on our appetizer and wine, but how hard is it to cook a steak?  How hard is it to observe that you overcooked a steak when you're a chef at a high end restaurant?  The steaks should never have been presented to us.

2zK0KaBRV5_nPlTsOnZH6Q.text: We had an excellent dinner experience on a weeknight. We choose to sit at a bar that looked out towards the strip so we were able to view the Bellagio fountains. Our appetizer, salad, entree, and dessert were wonderful.  I would expect a restaurant with this great of a view to be lacking in the food department. Well, I would be completely wrong. This was one of the best meals I've had in Vegas. I recommend it to anyone looking for a romantic dinner with upscale dining.

iez2jyo16My-fgw_Gd00-Q.text: Everything you'd expect from fine dining. This was by far the best dinner we had in Vegas.  We booked a table well in advance and the manager seated us himself at a romantic table for 2 overlooking the Bellagio Fountains.  It was the most romantic spot in the entire city.  The service was truly professional.  They kept the wine flowing and anticipated every need we could have.  The food was incredible.  I got the duck and my husband got whitefish, neither disappointed. We were worried this place would be all hype because of the location, but it deserves every good review.  Worth eating here at least once.

52pXU1ctwbFN_Kd7aNzONw.text: We had a great time at the Eiffel Tower. To me, the service of a restaurant is just as important as the food, and in this case, Eiffel Tower exceeded my expectations for both. Let me start by saying we were lucky to have a booth facing the Bellagio Music fountain! And we purposely made the reservation for around sunset, the view was breath taking! The food was also amazing! I had the Cod and it was made to perfection! My friends ordered the salmon and the chicken, they were all so juicy and tender! The cod was made with curry sauce which was very interesting! The portion is also perfect to allow us some room for dessert! I personally thought the creme brulee was soooo good! And it just looks amazing with the fan looking thing on top as decoration! And the souffle on the other hand was just okay, we didn't finish it. Highly recommend if you are looking for a highly relaxing and romantic dinner!

t9on0CS5J_veTPwsZr-t1A.text: The location was well appointed with a great view of the Strip below.   The cold foie gras torchon was recommended over the sauteed New York State foie gras which would have been our initial choice, and we were not disappointed. The fig compote was a perfect complement to the foie gras.   The wine list is heavily tilted towards wines that run from the cost of a decent dinner to the list price of a used Honda Accord. It is not an inexpensive place. We did a drink each and a glass of wine.   The bone-in rib eye was magnificent as was the recommended green peppercorn sauce. My wife enjoyed her steak and my daughter loved her chicken dish.   For me, wife, and daughter, it was about $500+. I would think that this could have been pulled off in Chicago with a more egalitarian wine list and the same quality for $300-$350 (maybe), even with a bottle of wine, so don't come looking for a moderate price point.   Good service, great view, great food, but a bit expensive for what it is. If the cost works for you, give it a try.

JzQmPrx2yJnHw3OUpSxTGw.text: Taking into account the service, quality of food, price, and the unparalleled views, I highly recommending coming to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for a special dinner date.   I brought my bf here for his bday weekend and our first meal off the plane at 10pm was at The Eiffel Tower restaurant. While everybody raves about their views, I think they are seriously underrated for their food. Every single dish that we ordered was amazing. Our waiter was ridiculously attentive without being in your face. The entire restaurant gets gorgeous fountain views at the perfect height. If you make a reservation for 2, they tend to seat you at the window at these cute couple tables where you both sit face next to each other and enjoy the strip view.   We ordered about 6/7 dishes, including a lobster corn chowder with crab flan (huge chunks of juicy lobster scattered throughout a creamy corn chowder, embellished with a chunk of crab flan), foie gras and warm pear appetizer, the beef wellington (huge portions and unlike anything I've had before, good flavor), an amazing veal entree, and 1 dessert + 1 complimentary dessert for his birthday. Everything was stellar... I didn't have EXTREMELY high expectations so me and my taste buds were ever so thrilled all night. Best part was, our two-person birthday dinner with drinks came to $270 total including tax and a generous tip. Very reasonable in my opinion... Keep in mind we ordered enough food for 3-4 normal people. :)   A special night!   It would be really hard for one to have a bad night here. Even if it's just for a drink or dessert, or a snack, it's worth the experience.

mUB6cD9tUycrzH9GqX7XfA.text: The first time here was when my family and I moved to Vegas, so it's been awhile and thought we should try this place again, so we decided to come here for New Year's Day dinner. I have a big family, which is great because it means there are more dishes I could try! I feel that this is a great restaurant for people who are visiting Vegas, because the restaurant offers a great view of the strip, as well as, the Bellagio fountain show. But if you are looking for an omg, mouth watery dishes then it's best to try other restaurants from renowned chef around the city. I am very pleased that the seafood platter was cook perfectly.  My duck was a bit bland to me. My brothers got steak (ribeye & filet mignon) and it was ok. My dinning experience was not as great coming from a high-end restaurant. Our server seemed very quick and efficient, which is good for attending to all the customers and getting everyone served. But I like it more when they take their time with you and agreeing with what you order. I felt that she was pushy to get my dad to get a side dish even though it was obvious that he didn't want any. Then when my mom was next to order and she asked my dad if he got any side dishes, the waitress gave an attitude, "I already asked him, but he didn't want any." When we were undecided on whether we should get one or two seafood platter, she announced over the entire table to get everyone's attention to hurriedly decide what we want.  Lastly, we opt to skip the dessert and just asked for the check and she gave a disapproving look. The restaurant was bit pricey for the food and service, but I guess you're paying for the spectacular view.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22oz ribeye and bone marrow. Soooo good
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood platter
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck

N-9lw9QA1p24eolR5cVIWg.text: My boyfriend and I came here on a whim and decided to make a reservation the day of on a Sunday and got right in! We loved the elegance and ambience of the whole restaurant. We started off with the smoked salmon which was to die for. I had a New York steak and he had the 1 1/2lb lobster which were both absolutely amazing. My steak was cooked perfectly. We had a seat overlooking the strip and the Bellagio light show. The service was amazing. One of the best places to eat in Las Vegas.

AEA91hl9J9BXSimToG-jrQ.text: My husband and I celebrated our 1st wedding anniversary in Vegas last month and decided to have dinner here for the actual night of our anniversary.  When he made the reservation, he requested for a table by the window with the view of the Bellagio fountains. He was told that they can't guarantee that and we'll just have to basically try our luck when we get there. We were so happy to find out that they have reserved a table for us by the corner (closest to the Paris balloon) with the view of the fountains! :) It was nice being in the corner, we had a little bit pf privacy. The setting was so romantic, especially with the view of the sun setting and the Bellagio fountains dancing.  We sat down and started going through the food menu and the wine list. It was so hard picking out the wine since they had a massive list. My husband and I ended up getting 2 different ones. A glass of rose wine for me and a half bottle of red wine for him (can't remember exactly what the varieties were). For our starters, I got the corn soup and my husband got the smoked salmon. We got the muscovy duck and the aged new york steak for our main course. Then we got two souffles to mix and share, as per our server's suggestion. We had the grand marnier and chocolate-- they were to die for! Everything we had turned out to be very, very good!  Also our server, Joshua (I hope I got his name right), was wonderful! Even after devouring our desserts, he even offered us some petit fours. Wish I could take all of their salted caramels! lol They were so good... best I ever had so far.  We were very satisfied with everything and left the restaurant with very happy tummies! We'll definitely go back again in the future! :)

roNle6QNvxAhLko5fDcYFg.text: Ever since I was a little girl and my family would travel to Vegas for my dad's work, I wanted to go up the Eiffel Tower at the Paris hotel. Well, I finally got to do that during a work trip of my own AND I got to eat at the restaurant. That was definitely one of the highlights of my trip because the food was exquisite (almost said "amazing" but I wanted to try a classier word to match with this classy place ;) )!  I made reservations through Open Table and was advised on their strict dress code. Luckily I brought a dress, otherwise my jeans or shorts wouldn't have cut it. So FYI, be prepared for that. As soon as we stepped foot in the elevator to take us up, I was already impressed by the service. Our waiter was so attentive and seated us by the windows so we could get a good view of the Bellagio water show. He also made sure to get our food out quickly because we had to be out of there to make it to a show.   I started with a glass of Riesling and the Blue Cheese Souffle Pudding with Petite Salad. It had a little Eiffel Tower picture on it, which meant it was a favorite...and not only can I see why, but I'm still thinking about how delicious that dish was! The souffle was perfect, not too stiff and not too soft (sorry, that's the best I can do to describe it!). The flavor was not too intense even though blue cheese usually is, so that made it even better!  For my entree, I had Olive Oil Poached Halibut and Herbed Couscous with Tomato Basil. Fish is usually not something I order, but I wanted something light and this was highly recommended. WOWWW. That's all I can say. Try it. You'll love it. Both the fish and the couscous were seasoned just right and I felt like every bite just melted in my mouth.   The portions weren't huge...I mean, it's a fancy restaurant so I was expecting tiny! But they were just right. I would have tried a dessert, but we had to go. I'll do that next time I go back!

_P1L9wNcolVY-qWa5UTHIA.text: Wow, this is a GREAT restaurant.  We went again last night.  This place is a splurge, nearly $700 for three of us.  I can say, its worth it though.  I do not spend money on food unless it is amazing and this place has it down.  Cocktails are beautiful.  View is stunning.  The restaurant is clean and well kept.   Servers are very attentive.  I had the crispy char main, three different cocktails (bees knees was excellent), lobster and the salmon apps, couple glasses of wine, the mushroom and creamed spinach sides, and a caeser salad, and literally 47 pieces of bread.  Yep, go big or go home!  Everything was delicious.  I will also give kudos to this restaurant for having a responsive manager who replied to an email requesting the recipe for a cocktail.  You cannot do better on the strip.

iWz3I2US_fJAc90-RQlKzw.text: I'm giving this a rating based on what my expectations are!   Haven't had the pleasure of visiting "Eiffel Tower" restaurant....YET.....but after reading all of the yelp reviews as well as other online recommendations, my hubby and I are excited to visit it next month to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary!  Unfortunately, we've already got dinner reservations already confirmed elsewhere, BUT will be going there for after dinner cocktails and delicious desserts in the bar/lounge area! Can't wait to post pictures and a fabulous review....of our anniversary evening out at the "Eiffel Tower"! :)

70pdKxS34DPW-sOgJKCX5g.text: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is a place to come for the amazing atmosphere of eating in the Eiffel Tower overlooking the Las Vegas Strip and not necessarily the food. Me and my three friends made reservations for a Monday night at around 6pm on 2/11/13. When we got up there, you have to take the elevator up to the restaurant, then walk through their kitchen area, which is really neat to see. They gave us a side view of the Bellagio fountains and the rest of the strip (which is an amazing view). It is a very classy place, and they serve you multiple choice of bread which are all excellent. It's a pricy place, but no pricer than your going to get anywhere else on the strip. I got the FIlet Mignon with Bearnaise sauce, which was very good, just not great. Also got the Caesar salad, however, the dressing tasted 100% oil, and not like caesar at all, which was probably my least favorite thing here. Also got a Apple strudel dessert which was very flavorful with cinnamon sugar and nice flaky crust.   PROS *Atmosphere - #1 reason to come here. Might be the nicest place to dine in the heart of the strip. At night it's beautiful because not only do you get a great view of the Bellagio fountains, but the strip in general.   *Service - I really enjoyed how it felt like we didn't have a waiter, but we had a host. Everyone was really nice and very accommodating. The waitress always came over and refilled our water glasses and they constantly asked us if we wanted more of that fresh bread.   CONS *Food - Food is still really good, just nothing amazing to the point I was blown away. I personally think Ruth's Chris or Morton's food is better than here.  *Price - Not outrageous for Las Vegas, but still a pricy place. For a Caesar Salad, Filet Mignon, and a dessert cost me in the neighborhood of $100.

npzYr-wQ1ALaWrcdZ-FH7w.text: Fantastic. Excellent service and great view  Had the lamb burger - best I have ever had.  The half avocado was ok  Great for a romantic lunch or dinner

lYr1AAqooF_bcjwgVpCr8A.text: We stopped here for lunch, to try the food and also view the spaces they have available for a wedding reception.  Reading reviews on different sites, my expectations were pretty high coming into this lunch. We had an amuse bouche of Asparagus Flan.  Absolutely spectacular, a little bite of asparagus-y perfection. My now hubby got the steak sandwich (which was also excellent, I wished I would have ordered the same) I got the crab french toast which was where the meal took a turn for the worst. The bread was stuffed with a very heavy mixture of crab and mayonnaise. The bread was very heavy, greasy and in conjunction with the crab mixture it just wasn't at all what I expected or very palate pleasing.   We ordered dessert which was the apple strudel. It wasn't a BAD dessert but it wasn't what you would expect from a french restaurant with this kind of stellar reputation. Our server was excellent but the experience itself was inconsistent. The distance between the highs and the lows were too great for me to give the review I expected to give.

7XPA9sU1KV-MKldubkNBCg.text: The food was really good. It was so delicious and the cocktails as well. I recommend the pain killer drink. The view of the bellagio fountain was amazing. The only thing the service was soooooo slow. That's the only reason I didn't give it five stars I was even debating on giving three that's how slow it was but cause the food was really good it deserves four.

mhQ3c9y0PTHkdsYwxadvNg.text: My husband and I had a wonderful experience at this restaurant. Michael our server was exceptional and the food was amazing. The manager even came over to see how things went. Very friendly, great service, amazing food and an outstanding view. We can't wait to experience it again. I was so happy to  that the restaurant was not part of the hotel ownership because the service at the hotel was horrible. I just hope that the restaurant is not perceived in a negative way because of their affiliation.

F9evWcprpLy0KD6XK9XA3g.text: It's no secret that this place is good. I wouldn't expect anything less.   From the moment your brought up in the elevator to the moment you head back to the hustle and bustle of the casino, you definitely are living an experience.   Low lighting and a view that can't be beat, fine linens, and wait staff who attend to your every need, the Eiffel Tower is first class all the way.   I selected their smoked salmon to start and I have never had a better piece of fish. Smooth, thinly sliced, and melt in your mouth buttery taste accompanied the onion, capers, and creme fraiche (not sure of my French spelling here) with several slices of perfectly toasted bread. I could have eaten a second plate and called it a meal. The capers were surprisingly delicious - not the over salted from a jar variety.   Most of us selected their filet mignon, with several different toppings to choose from. I couldn't resist and chose the decadent Bernaise sauce. The steak itself was cooked to perfection and the interior was almost as buttery smooth as the sauce itself. There were a ton of sides passed around our table, but the winners were the potatoes gratin (perfect in their simplicity) and the mushroom spatzle (yes they eat German food in parts of France).   Desserts probably deserve their own review, but to put it simply; save room and order a bunch to taste and share. The chocolate plate will leave any chocoholic in heaven.   Pricey, but worth every penny.

6iFMC6M-BPB95bha8rv0rw.text: Had company in town and a gift certificate I had won, so we went for Sunday lunch.  FABULOUS!!  Besides the awesome view, our service was wonderful, and the food....oh the food... it was DELICIOUS!!  We're still talking about the parmesan flan!!  We would love to cleanse our palate with that every day!  At first, we were skeptical, but one taste and we were hooked.  Our server, Todd S., was very friendly and efficient.  He made sure we had everything we needed was able to describe the menu items with great detail - helping us throughout the meal.  We tried the Seafood Salad, Crab and Avacado, Parmesan Chicken, and the soup.  The only minimal complaint was that the lettuce was cut too small.  Otherwise, everyone was happy with their choice.    Would definitely visit again!  Can't wait to share with more of our guests

tUcJ0lmBwNZACx9OzSWlOQ.text: Very overpriced for the quality. A bottle of wine that I can buy at the store for $30 was $225!!! The pork chop was over priced and very salty.  We got a table way in the back so we barely had a view. For 4 people our bill was $450. I wouldn't mind if i loved the food but it was a b-

uY5uJvVSmdtwTa1BXA6Isg.text: Spend over $600 four people and you guys add service can't believe that. May be my party look cheap for them. I gave $160 in tips which I never thought tips were already added. Only good things were server told that the tips is already added. I was surprised when this kind of vip restaurant add tips for party of four. By the way that bill was only for appetizer and drinks. We had great dinner at chef Ramsey restaurant spend another $500 for food and drinks and tips was not added left the server with $200 tips.

DRGh_sycW3XJzSNzjFL18g.text: Amazing dining experience right on the strip.  Panoramic views with perfect viewing of the Bellagio fountains.  Excellent service.  Dim lighting and dark colors make this a romantic spot for dinner.  Excellent for large groups as we had 14.  I would certainly take my other half for their sunset dinner.  I would certainly call ahead for reservations.

S76DCk9QH4btkPdBcaZdOg.text: I attended a networking event here where primarily cocktails and appetizers were offered. I think most of them were made special for us, because I don't really see anything specific to what I tasted on the menu. But I imagine they were alterations of things that they do actually serve.  The view from our section of the restaurant was gorgeous. They're serious about their service level. Someone puts you in an elevator and another person escorts you off of it and to your section. No one can come or go unless permitted by the elevator monitors. There were at least 4 individuals constantly circling the room, offering bites, checking for drink orders, and clearing away used dishes.   My cocktail wasn't great. It was a flavorless Cosmo. But my co-worker got the Berry Champagne. It was pretty delicious, like a Sangria but sparkling.   Now, the appetizers. OMG DELICIOUS. So, so, so delicious. I definitely made a meal out of them. The goat cheese filled dates, mini lamb burgers, and parmesan bread balls (none of these are probably the correct names) were my favorite. My guess is that the actual menu items are even better. Next time I'm in Vegas, I might have to reserve a table and have a real meal.

wLjCN2zDCl_-jPaBShgANw.text: Went here night with my husband to celebrate our Anniversary. Last year for our honeymoon we went to Le Jules Verne, the original restaurant at the Eiffel Tower in France. Last night I was a far better experience, from a restaurant experience perspective. I requested a window table with a view, and was absolutely elated with our table! It was breathtaking! We overlooked the strip and had an amazing view of the Bellagio water show. The food was the best we've ever had! The best steak and lobster EVER! The Sommelier, Joe was great and helped us select the BEST champagne we have had...and we've been to Champagne, France! I highly recommend dinner here for any occasion! Thank you for helping us have such a memorable first anniversary!

3wp7Xn4DKHvs8GLwtPrEbg.text: Pros:  -Food was good, not mind blowing, but still delicious. I recommend the lamb, the salmon, and creme brulee. The lamb was cooked to perfection, really juicy. The salmon was delicious (I wish the portion were larger ^_^). The creme brulee finished off the meal with a sweet kick. -Gorgeous panoramic views of the strip (beautiful fountain view), request a window table if any are available -Friendly, professional service  Cons:-One of the busiest restaurants on the strip, restaurant feels very crowded -food and drinks are a bit over priced (but then again it is a restaurant on the strip) -portions are small, but it is intended to be a multi course dinner -can be a bit loud -the booths still have a beautiful view of the strip, but the coveted tables are right on the window -the woman checking us in was a bit stuck up, I had to greet her first =(  Overall, it was a good experience. But as far as I am concerned, this was a one time deal.

SkbVUZDv6oEUD3-oO8Ofcw.text: My husband and I came here for the first time two years ago to celebrate our tenth anniversary. I made a reservation for early dinner (5:30pm) because I want to have a table facing the Bellagio fountain. I was not disappointed. We were given the corner table by the window, the very best seat in the entire restaurant!  The food was great from start to finish. I had the fois gras for appetizer and loved every bite of it. The lamb chop for my main entree was cooked exactly the way I wanted. All that great food was finished with the delicious chocolate souffle, on a plate with "Happy Anniversary" writen in chocolate sauce.  The service is absolutely perfect. Our waiter was very attentive without being overly so. The entire dinner lasted 3 hours and was perfectly paced. The view is definitely one of the best in Vegas, we saw the fountain at sunset, and at night with lights on; I only wish that I could hear the music when the fountain came to life every 20 minutes.  I have recommended this place to many of my friends, and came back here again earlier this year during a girls weekend. We got a great seats overlooking the fountain, and the food and service were just as memorable as the first time!   I will definitely come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chocolate souffle is a must at the end of the wonderful meal.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of lamb is delicious.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fois Gras was among the best I ever had.

ZcpU3ErCG7-ecJyRtpZjlQ.text: I don't know how I haven't done this review sooner. I came a couple years back for my bachelorette party and decided on Eiffel Tower Restaurant as my fancy dinner choice. Everything was wonderful, right down to the entrance (up and elevator) to the stunning view of the strip and Bellagio fountains, and the service. The whole group raved about their food, and we definitely enjoyed the atmosphere. I highly recommend this place!

H2PuhoQf3w7F2KxP5V9vaQ.text: Pros: Husband's duck was tasty. Salad greens were fresh. View was amazing. The desserts were heavenly. The guy with the bread and the attendant in the bathroom were both friendly.   Cons: Bartender and waiter were rude when we didn't order enough food/drinks. They gave us some attitude about it. The waiter then tried to sell us some kind of restaurant membership, which was tacky. My filet mignon was just ok. It wasn't bad, but I've had much better for less dollars.   We enjoyed the view and the desserts, but the attitude of the bartender and waiter was enough to make us not want to come back. There are plenty of fine dining establishments in Vegas. I have no reason to go back to one that is going to give me attitude because I only spent $190 on dinner/drinks.   This was our only experience with rude people in Vegas. Even the other fine dining places were very nice to us even though we don't order the most expensive stuff on the menu.

MXGa1zVGsFAn8AoJ9Pc3VA.text: So I'm a 36-year-old bachelor and I've been to Vegas I don't know maybe A few dozen times. With that being said I have never been to the top of the replica Eiffel Tower. Needless to say it is worth every penny. I highly recommend finding the Groupon purchase for two people and going up to the top during the Bellagio fountain showtimes.

dkC8wyscWOY-AlGZPfAsLA.text: What a meal! Enjoyed a delicious meal with a friend that was visiting from LA. This restaurant never lets you down with the ambiance, food, drinks, and service. This is one of my favorite restaurants on the strip. I barely had any room for dessert, well that's a lie who doesn't indulge in every single spoonful of a delicious creme brulee Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U4icWlzH3ypyjj7alHGysw.text: If you are planning to use the great view for a romantic date and great ambiance, this place will do. The dining room is large and beautiful. Expect to wait 45 minutes so you can sit at the bar and pony up for 20$ cocktails, from practically mute bartenders.   Make a reservation way in advance for strip view tables. Walk ins have no shot. Apparently the tables next to the strip view are booked in advance or you have to know someone.   We finally were seated in a corner and given a very solemn gentleman for a server who must've had a bad night, he was very pretentious and unhelpful with helping us navigate their menu. We went late so both of our first choices were not available. I had the lamb and it was nice and juicy, but not special in any way. The deal breaker was both our sides were plain ol' average. Where was all the elegance?   The pacing was horrid, like we weren't fine dining but at TGI Friday's at happy hour.  I'd never recommend, unless this is a date where you just cared about the views and not the food or the service. The place was gorgeous, but the staff and cooks lack the panache you are paying for!

LDvWbcqPbfnLPgU12bmk4g.text: An amazing experience with great ambiance! I would recommend making a reservation and request to be seated with a view of the Bellagio fountains. We ordered the rack of lamb, NY steak with bearnaise sauce, olive oil mashed potatoes, and wild mushrooms. By far, the best lamb I've ever had and both were perfectly seasoned and cooked.  We also ordered a caramel souffle for dessert. The souffle must be ordered in advance, as it takes about 30 minutes to cook but, it was delicious! Cant wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of lamb, NY steak, béarnaise sauce, olive oil mashed potatoes, and wild mushrooms
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY steak
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of lamb. Best I&#39;ve ever had!

EhN3JBPx-4AvfT7uXKIMSA.text: So, I was pretty disappointed. It is my first time in Vegas and I've heard what amazing food there is. I ordered the Halibut, the presentation was beautiful but the fish was not. It was very very dry and the outside was overlooked. I eat fish 2-3 times a week and this was just ruined. I ate it of course but this should've been done perfectly. The kale that came with it was just a few little pieces, this was also a bit disappointing.   Other than the food the service was wonderful and the view you cannot beat. Maybe go for dessert and wine?

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful Halibut but cooked poorly :(

Q43FG6avJOHzMpMLxyXsiQ.text: During my short stay in vegas I was taken here. Knowing nothing about vegas I found it entertaining from even standing outside the building.  Total paris themed it puts you right in the mood to a nice dinner overlooking the strip.   Nice selection of drinks, and extremely polite staff.  Was seated right next to the window with an extremely wonderful view that I will never forget.  For my main I ordered the lamb.  I love my lamb super rare and they cooked it perfectly.   Even though I associate this restaurant with touristy things to do while in Vegas it is surly a place that Ill never forget and I def. reccomend it to anyone that is in vegas for a special time if your willing to splurge a little from your earnings at the casino .

CwzygcG3p-Zhr6FP76BBLg.text: Sunday Brunch with a great view - Flat Iron Steak and Eggs, Aged Parmesan Crusted Chicken, and French Onion Soup. Excellent food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NLd9EIqhNwzxTvaQEtT0uA.text: Nice place, gents need to where a collared Shirt... lol a bit pretentious... but the drinks are good and the service is slow... welcome to Vegas

kA-byChuVc38Ad1A_qezpQ.text: Service was on point from beginning to end. We went up the elevator and was greeted by a pleasant woman followed by a young man asking if he could take my coat for me. Why yes I would! We get to our table by the window with a spectacular view of the strip and bellagio. We must have seen the water show 3 times while we were there! I got a apple side car to drink (it was super strong) and the salmon apppetizer. I ordered their seabass and creme bruelee as a dessert to finish. My boyfriend had even arranged for there to be roses at the table, which they kindly bagged for me so I could take them home. Before we asked for the bill, our waiter offered to take a photo for us. He actually got a pretty good shot. Overall it was a really romantic and memorable experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bellagio show from our table!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cBl7wiO3BB3P2lqxtqq0jQ.text: Went here for dinner one night while in Vegas for vacation. I didn't know my boyfriend was going to propose to me here, and I must say everything was amazing. They accommodated us with the best seat in the house, the service was wonderful and the food was absolutely delicious. I would highly recommend this place to couples looking for a romantic dinner on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our view
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our names on the menu 3

a3F7w1StIWD7JrQybkd14g.text: I really had high hopes for this place. We requested to have fountain view seatings and even waited 45 min to do so and sat all the way at the corner with the view of the Paris balloon (even though we had reservations). I felt pushed by the waiter to order more drinks, an appetizer, and a dessert. I had the queen filet mignon and it was very dry, unfortunately. I'm from Texas and I know what real steak is supposed to taste like. The asparagus and potatoes were also okay. Small portions. The waiter did not come to our table once to ask us how the food went. He literally dropped off the food, told us to enjoy, then gave us the dessert menu. It's a cool once in a lifetime thing but I will not come back.

Pg9vj17eBXInY14jH6Ktqw.text: This place is expensive, but don't expect to get the portion size that you pay for! My sister and I came for appetizers and were extremely disappointed!  We have ordered the "lobster salad" which was $30 bucks, and all they served us was a small scoop of lobster over like 1 teaspoonful of corn! I leave 3 stars for the greatness of the food, but it's NOT worth the cost! Food was good, but I literally just wasted $30 bucks! For a salad, we were picturing some lettuce, croutons, lobster and all of that for the price, but all we got was this:

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is what they call &#34;lobster salad&#34;! lol

gc86VBEGbbMqJMzJKrpOWA.text: Great view and staff was very accommodating. Food was not as good as I expected for the price

4NrVmC5OF4V-YEME7V__bw.text: Warning: If you do not have some "Benjamins" in your wallet skip this place and go to the nearest buffet   We were walking around in a 106 degree weather hubby was wearing his shorts and golf shirt  (collared shirt so they allowed his top) Eiffel loaned him some pants to dine here.   So off we go try this resto.with postcard-perfect view of Vegas.  When our name was called we were invited to the bar which I think a highway robbery, cocktail menu is in the top $.  but hubby was in the mood and ordered a single malt whiskey 18, I don't drink so was given water. We snagged a nice seat in the middle 3rd level area and had a great view of the Bellagio fountain show. To add to the ambiance, a French accented server took our order.   I wanted to order the pork chop but was warned that it is salty *thanks I hate salty food,  so I opted for the rack of lamb 59  (comes in 3 pcs 20 per piece of meat chops WHOA !). For my taste, the tomato and lamb was not a good pairing. I tasted rack of lamb at my local bistro,  w some pear chutney and that was unforgettable. I requested a side of mint jelly to compliment the lamb. That was delish w the jelly. Also ordered a bottle of sparkling water Badoit.   Hubby had the 22 oz ribeye w a bone marrow 89 ordered side of potato gratin 10 and mushroom 15. He was in cow heaven! Paired w cabernet sauvignon. French accented guy recommended to throw in the Seafood platter to the order 69 per person (one order to share). Are you kidding me? it would be gluttony. We sort of agreed at first, then requested to please take it off the seafood platter from the order. I regretted ordering the sides too. With the price of the proteins, all sides MUST come as gratis. But oh well this is Eiffel Tower of LV,  We did not have room for dessert so we said no to the litany of dessert list, but the French accented guy was kind enough to give one small shot of complimentary small chocolate mousse to share.  Overall view is nice, service is attentive yet a bit pushy in the ordering process, The more they throw in the table, the bigger the tip.The guy who offers bread is very friendly,   The bill came to $200+. Will I come back? Maybe not, it was a bit stressful dining here. I truly miss my neck of the woods fine dining.

u6HVlwhoHh4mJWyJ1VeXSQ.text: Fantastic service, dish, and service with beautiful view of the Bellagio's fountain. Pricy but appropriate. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Eij3Y9hkij2NNssyX3t4DA.text: Went here for a birthday dinner by far one of the best filet mignon dishes I ever had. The service was great and staff was very accommodating  and we scored a nice view of the strip. To end the night we had a delicious pistachio souffle that had happy birthday in chocolate drizzle it was divine
