uS5QDdyxnQBBWRqfcu0osA.text: Great view- sat right on the window. Cocktails at the bar before being seated were very well made and bartenders efficient.   Had the beef Wellington, tar tar, creme  brule, salad, and scallops. All good- the Wellington left a little to be desired- but was overall good experience.   Great place to take visitors on town or just spoil yourself for a night out.

ki61zc9G9PPep_TYG4MZzw.text: I made reservations 2 weeks in advance. The day of, we were having complications and I believe I changed my reservation about 3 times.. Thank you for that. It was my first time dining at the Eiffel Tower. I requested a table with a view. I spoke to the host and asked if she received my special requests.. She stated, "you have the best table in the restaurant." Honestly, I did not believe her. I felt that hosts were suppose to say that about every table.. She was not lying! We had the best table in the restaurant - a corner view of the Bellagio fountains.   Our server, Roman, was very professional in assisting and suggesting us items on the menu. I chose the roasted lamb and paired it with a nice glass of red. The lamb was utterly delicious! My girlfriend ordered the truffled chicken. Who knew chicken could taste that good?!  Thank you for accommodating us, and treating us with an unforgettable dining experience. I hope to dine-in again in the near future.  If you're looking for a restaurant to take your significant other, I definitely recommend the Eiffel Tower. You are in for a memorable night!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Lamb

8hutjAc0zwaLe2tOjuvhNg.text: I've been to this restaurant many times, and each time was an amazing experience. Great views, and great food. The Last time I went was for New Years Eve on December 31st 2017. They were offering a special prix fixe menu for $250 a person. I was so excited to try it out. They had an amazing lobster appetizer, which was presented beautifully. The disappointment came when they brought out my entree, the filet mignon. It tasted very soapy. I thought it was just me, so I had my boyfriend try it, and he also said, it tasted soapy. My boyfriend ordered the sea bass for his entree, and thankfully it didn't have that soapy flavor, but it was pretty much flavorless. On our way out, the hostess asked us how everything was. I told her about the filet mignon being soapy. She said, "why didn't you tell anyone?". I thought to myself, "aren't you someone?". She apologized, and showed us to the elevator exit. I don't think I can return to this restaurant, my latest experience did not come close to my expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster appetizer, the only good part of my meal.

I2Nj8i5YvAkrISKR_1YjKQ.text: We enjoyed the variety of food and flavors from the food tasting menu. The best thing offered here though is the creme brulee .

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2e8b72GBHT0AO9fZ6mDWBg.text: Food and Service was awesome.  My family took me for a surprise birthday dinner and they did everything right.  Couldn't see the fountains but have a nice view.

eBc-0osuS2NzRnzXg7txrg.text: Came for brunch! This place was absolutely beautiful! This place was a great place to enjoy a beautiful brunch while in Vegas. My companion has remarkable taste in restaurants and always picks the cream of the crop. The scene was breathtaking. We sat by the window and had a great view overlooking the waterfall at the Bellagio.  We started out with shrimp cocktail for an appetizer. The shrimp were fresh and succulent. It definitely seemed as if the shrimp were caught fresh that day. The food was served with some french bread. Having recently been to France, I found the bread to be quite authentic. For my meal I had the french toast with a side of bacon.  The french toast had a delectable apple swirl atop of the french toast.  My friend had the eggs Benedict. As a lover of eggs Benedict he seemed to be pleased.   This place is definitely a place that we would come visit again when return to Vegas. While they say what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas, it doesn't apply to great food.... for that must be shared.

RKUPZWR11MTly0lsgY3t9g.text: Fantastic view of fountains. Spectacular seafood medley and cheesecake dessert was superb. Little noisy with lots of people. That being said the waitstaff was very diligent.  Worthwhile dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Room with a view
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jpVSkohxMRb4xl2P9WrsaQ.text: We went for lunch on Christmas Day. Let me start off by saying I thought that lunch would include a ride to the top but I suppose i was wrong. This is getting off topic because to be honest with you if our food was good i really would not have cared. Out of 7 people in our party 3 ordered off of the price fix menu. One ordered a children's meal, one went with a pasta dish and 2 went with the warm fish entree. Out of all of us, only the 2 with the warm fish entree got through the day unscathed, I have already written to the management and I was told a few days ago that they would forward my concerns to the appropriate department. Working in the food industry (food safety to be more specific). I really think that 5 people getting sick is more than a mere coincidence. Anyhow as you can tell I feel it was extremely overpriced and over rated. After that the only place I would it at was In N Out Burger down the street and I have to admit i was not disappointed.

10WmTmkX4V--c_tGuptK1A.text: The view here is beautiful which is what attracted us to visit. The prices are super high. The food is good but for the price I have definitely had better. I'm glad we tried it but it's most likely a one time thingv uunless we goito see the view at night, we went for brunch originally.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The escargot was buttery and very yummy. The view was very pretty.

NiA5YdmEWZSGhaGPIc474A.text: Took the wife to the restaurant in the Eiffel Tower for a birthday dinner! We are both vegetarians and didn't quite check the menu before deciding to go there. But when we got there, they had 1 vegetarian option. Vegetarian crepe. We ordered the same thing... crepe was ok. Over priced in the restaurant for what it's worth.   However! The view was absolutely amazing! We sat next to the window and were able to watch the Bellagio fountains multiple times throughout our dinner!  Place is pricy, but the view was worth it. I would recommend this place for special occasions.

tf7AkDLQwurEHRmF99FbAw.text: No 4 or 5 stars because it was my birthday and we told them multiple times but....nothing happened. The 1st course was ok, the veal (2nd course) was amazing, the dessert was meeh. Though I must say, the wine pairing was excellent. The view was also great.

FVzDvUnqZDzGSAFFnL9mmg.text: An elegant and classy spot. Brought my sister to this spot for her birthday! Coming from LA and use to the Beverly Hills and LA restaurant spots this is a must top for a special occasion dinner! We reserved in advance and asked for a window seat and got the best seat in the house overlooking the Bellagio water show! Ordered the Roasted herb chicken and was delicious! Can be a bit spendy so be prepared but worth it for an occasion! Service was quick, our waitress was attentive and always checking on us and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NvMetxI8A7ULv62Mea7W5w.text: We eat here every time we come to Vegas. The food is great! The view is very nice also. I recommend the foie grace, filet minion, beef wellington, the salmon was also amazing! I think my favorite thing here is the side orders! The only thing I do not like here is the souffle, it always very dry.

pv-qlM3ii3tR4wqY-i6CdA.text: Good drinks and good food. I had the chicken supreme. It was perfect. The chocolate mousse that they gave me for my birthday was really good. The views are amazing. We made a 7:15PM reservation so we could enjoy the sun setting, and we could see the Bellagio fountain show at 8:00PM. It was worth it.

NbR9D_4bbj7_MgpcalS5Kg.text: I will never forget this day here.  Service - terrible Food - terrible View - impeccable   My date and I ordered Rossini Style Filet Mignon, Foie Gras, Truffle Sauce ($79), Hand Harvested Sea Scallops ($24), Paillard of Salmon with Salad ($24), Classic Creme Brulee ($12), and a couple of virgin drinks ($$).   Never will I forget the taste of those raw scallops, the INSANELY sweet taste of virgin drinks, and our bitter waiter. The bill came to the triple digits, but I wouldn't even pay $20 for all of our food. I am so disappointed over this restaurant - especially because of its prices for unappealing food yet great publicity.   But because this event was merely 2 years ago, my boyfriend and I now laugh about how awful the place was. I sure hope this place has improved since.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. great view

qbsIHmSzWXVZwhubvxSntQ.text: This is probably one of the most beautiful places ever. My boyfriend took me here recently for my birthday, the place is indeed pricey. But the way things are, the ambiance, the beautiful dishes, its all worth it. This is probably one of my most favorite places in all of vegas at this point.

KHycJ6bCl0MKdbvNDgD_0g.text: This was one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. The food was Incredible and the staff was so kind, attentive and knowledgeable. Our waiter, specifically, was Igor and as this was our first time being here, he was so patient and thorough in describing the different cuisine, was very attentive, but unobtrusively so, and also added a bit of humor which made him professional, yet personable. They gave us a complimentary dessert (amazzinnnnggg) for my boyfriends birthday and the ambiance and view were also spectacular. The chefs creations were wonderful and I have nothing but positive things to say about this place! I would definitely come back here.

4qzgXKWJFfs_LTSIBox9oA.text: Nice view and good enough food. Came here for lunch and got the seafood salad. They put a good amount of shrimp, lobster, and crab on it. I didn't care for the way they shredded the lettuce under the seafood, but that's a minor detail.

jgJ43E8-UwcHHiN2XEXegg.text: C'est terrible.  2 glasses of the wine tasting had lipstick stains.   Cheese course on tasting menu was not offered.  Service was catty and 3-star not 5.   Manager had a terrible attitude.  Veal medallion was overcooked to medium in order to crowd-please the tourist economy.  Foie Gras was excellent but that was it!  Oh and even though the tasting menu had snapper, the waiter brought salmon without even a forewarning. Two entirely different fish with entirely different flavor profiles. They brought halibut once I complained but still, not The same at all.   Don't go there. Go to Michael Mina's, Joel Robouchon, or Le Cirque if you want a good tasting menu. Leave this behind!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9fP8SPQcHCeBAbabTRSOXA.text: Amazing place for romantic dates and proposals. The view of the Bellagio fountains from the top is breathtaking.

T5TTe1QJzGLDPQlP0Z_Byw.text: Really not into writing a book but we'll never go back to this place. Travel to Vegas three or four times a year, this was the place to go for a great steak and good view. Actually proposed to my wife here, was very special.   One slow Vegas night after a show stopped by for a bottle of champagne and a light dinner for four. We were seated then asked to move to another table when two people within our party of four were going to split a steak rather than order their own. Our waitress had a fit and asked the manager to move us. We felt totally blindsided, paid for the bottle of champagne and left. It's apparent where their management and staffs values lie.  They lost customers for life.

UbaiCVwf_uSqhOPFTzXljg.text: This review is only for desserts and drinks at the bar.  I've never been compelled to visit because I would rather visit the real Eiffel Tower in Paris. But since there are no future plans for France at this point, and the reviews seem positive, why not?  Getting into the Paris hotel is not terrible because you can come from Las Vegas Blvd or via the back road from Harmon. Walking into Paris to the Eiffel tower is relatively easy if you know which way you are walking. Once you find yourself at the elevator entrance to the restaurant, it's a straight shot to the dining room. I think it's cool that their kitchen is the first thing you see when you get off the elevator.   It was 830p on a Saturday, and the bar was busy. Still lots of people waiting for their tables.  We finally found a couple seats at the bar and ordered what we came for.  The souffles: chocolate and banana. SO good separately but much better together.  Since it's their specialty, they have it perfected.   I would definitely come back, and would like to try dinner. If I come to the bar again, I'll remember to come after 9 so I don't need to stalk for seats at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate, and banana souffle, and drinks!

ZSwSWrjG9aZktzF7OjaDrw.text: The view is unbeatable and the service is almost perfect, e.g. you can see the water show from above.  The food is better than the food in the venues downstairs in the Paris, but like them it is only good, not unforgettable.  Though the prices are not extremely high for the starters or entrees, other items are extremely overpriced (for the view I suppose).  Iced tea was $7.50

MnFfqIa_jr1PY0wbRqYAvQ.text: Wonderful ambiance, fantastic service and delicious food. We were a group of 30 and everyone was very happy and left very satisfied.

bP65qA1bpF3NflplZKdCWQ.text: I hate to be the one of unpopular opinion here, but my overall experience here wasn't that great.   Drinks were decent, amuse bouche of asparagus mousse was pretty good, and the souffles were fabulous as described.  However, neither of our entrees were good. My husband got the vegetarian crepes (the only vegetarian item on the menu) and found them pleasing at first, but overpowering after a few bites. I tasted it, too - it's like whoever created it didn't actually try to sit down and eat a whole one.  For me, the lobster was so tough and stringy that I had a difficult time cutting it with a knife. No delicious dessert can make up for that sort of problem.   Oh, I forgot, we ordered sides as well. The potato croquettes were pretty good as long as they were piping hot. Once the temperature went more toward warm, you could taste the grease, which to me is not ideal.  I'm happy to pay a premium for a great meal/service/ambience, but I expected much better from this place, especially in Vegas where competition is stiff.

EKt3PtP-6oR0wDzJgVfRQw.text: Food was decent/a-okay. A little bit over priced IMO. Then again, this happens way too often with all the "fine dining" restaurants I've been to around the world.  Portions were big enough to be very filling.  Ambiance wasn't quite I imagined it to be. I thought it would be more quiet and romantic. Instead, it was very loud and crowded. I felt like as if I was at Chilis or TGIF. I would prefer my pricier restaurants to feel classier.  Note: Even though I made reservations, I still had to wait in line for 45 minutes. Apparently there were 6 other groups/couples with reservations who 'checked in' before me. Not sure how that works.  Also, there is a dress code.  Minus 2 stars for the price, loud atmosphere and wait time.

6S_vQnJ1AMV9AursaUE3iQ.text: Incredible service and incredible food.  We had a reservation and would not have been seated without it.  The Eiffel tower is popular and well worth it.  To get there, we entered into the Paris Casino and took an elevator to the 11th level.  We were welcomed by the kitchen to the restaurant, which I thought was the wrong floor, but it was the right one.  We walked around to the other side and found a breath taking view with full windows of the lights and the Vegas strip below.  I really enjoyed the interior architecture of the Eiffel tower steel framing as part of the decor.  The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is very pricey.  As for my first meal and visit to Las Vegas, this was tops.  I was very impressed with the service.  Not a single person was under dressed and I'm sure I would have felt either uncomfortable in jeans or asked to leave.  We order a bottle of wine and were taken care of extremely well.  Our waiter was wonderful explaining the menu and the wine list with precision.  Our meals were exquisite.  We ordered the Veal, Fillet Mignon and potatoes.  Our meals were done perfectly and we finished with a fluffy and mouth watering Chocolate Souffle.  Oooohhhh...makes my mouth water just writing about it.  I highly recommend a reservation on the Bellagio fountain side, window table as we did.  Might be the best meal, including view, I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal

TrpCf7wJx9ZZWy1tTTaFJw.text: Sorry, but this place is just a rip-off. I went for brunch. The view was beautiful. we made a reservation for three asking for a window table. There was one there and we had to demand it, as the hostess tried to put us in a tiny booth with no view, because the table "wasn't cleared yet"  DUH! clean it -how hard is it to say" we are preparing the table for you it will take a minute". I had 1/2 an avocado with crab salad and a small cup of coffee. With tax, $35. It was Not worth it. My friend ordered "onion soup" What came out was a small bowl of some creamy stuff-no cheeses, no bread, no onion soup au gratinee. And no pre-warning from the waiter. The worst onion soup I have seen for $12. I tried to order artichoke crepes and got something that did not taste like artichokes. but skimpy spinach with a lousy tomato sauce. It was nice of them to take it off my bill since it was terrible and definitely not French. The kitchen was in the forefront of the restaurant for all to see. Frankly, they should hide, considering the mediocre food we received in small portions. I am a native of San Francisco. I've paid steep prices of food, but usually in SF you get what you pay for. Not here.

fMpODvhQ85UT7NWvyRNN3Q.text: I know this is TMI and gross but it needs to be said. I ate here at about 7:30pm and have been up running to the bathroom every 5 minutes since 5 this morning. I was feeling fine before I ate here. I didn't eat anywhere before this. Now I can't let a bathroom out of my sight. Added to, after dinner, the server took away a half-finished cocktail I wasn't even done drinking yet when I made a quick run to the bathroom that night. For $20 a cocktail I would've at least liked to have finished it! I would've actually given this place 4 stars if it hadn't been for the HORRIBLE upset stomach I'm experiencing at this very moment. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was nice but now I don't think I'll be coming back. I feel so sick right now doubled over with stomach cramps and vomiting it's not even funny.

bZ4UOtgmDWoF_-EzasmvUQ.text: My wife and I celebrated my birthday here and I noted in my reservations that we would like to be seated by the window to enjoy the water show from the Bellagio across the street and they accommodated us perfectly!  The view was amazing and the service was quick!  Actually too quick, lol. The food was delicious, drinks were ok and the desert was ok as well. Great romantic spot for all occasions.

oN1KKy9n7I-XsiXDcq9hZQ.text: Ok I guess I'm on the outs here, but I really wasn't impressed. Sure it looked nice inside and the bathrooms even had a sit down area for u to sit and do makeup. The main thing is the food and service-not the best. First they say we can't take you-not cool, Then someone else goes oh wait we can. Then they take us up elevator-cool. We ask to sit near the fountains overview-didn't happen and they weren't busy at all. I've had 100% better French Onion Soup at a non-French regular old diner joint than here. The French onion soup was creamy like a broc cheese/onion soup and no cheese/bread/or real onion just a thick puree. Secondly, service took forever and after 30 min of waiting for our meals when they weren't even busy at like 2:00pm they told us they were out of steak. So my fiance's mom had to pick something else when she thought we would be getting our meal by then. The blt was good but for the price no way! Only difference was they put avocado on their blt-big whoop and you can get blt's anywhere. I was expecting more exotic French foods. Not overpriced American food and crappy French version of French soup.

QOCjvwn5ulgf5xHDsLucjQ.text: My husband and I came here for dinner tonight for our last night in Vegas. Our service and experience was over the top incredible! Our server was great with us and very nice. Our food was amazing (I'd recommend definitely getting the souffle for dessert). We had a minuscule mishap when I found a piece of plastic in my scallop potatoes but it was taken care of immediately. In fact we never even brought it up again because we didn't see it as a big deal but they comp'd us for the potatoes anyways. Seriously, everything was great. However, I forgot my phone at the restaurant and didn't notice until we were already back at our hotel. We called the restaurant and they snagged it for us and let us know they would hold it at their hostess stand. We dressed out of our nice clothes that we went to dinner in and out into casual clothes that we were going to gamble in. We headed back to Paris hotel and mentioned to the restaurant that we were only back to grab our phone. They allowed us up the elevator and back into the restaurant. As we are walking towards the hostess stand we were stopped by the greeter who asks us what we are doing. We tell her that we are only here to grab my phone because we had eaten there earlier and forgotten it. Her only reply to us is that we can't eat here because we are not dressed appropriately and will need to leave. We again mention that we just need my phone. She says ok and we get to the hostess stand. No problem there, we grab my phone and are walking back out. Literally 5 seconds. As we are waiting for the elevator to go back downstairs the chefs behind us start snickering and making mocking comments about how we can't eat here because there's a dress code. "Uh you know there's a dress code, you can't eat here" then more chefs laugh along at the mocking comments. We ignore them, half embarrassed because we were only here to pick up a phone and half disappointed because we had such high regards for this restaurant but now are being disrespected. We called the manager and he apologized up and down however we are still leaving the restaurant with a bad taste in our mouths with zero desire to return. Which really is upsetting because after our dinner we were already making plans to come back to Vegas and make the Eiffel Tower a must when we return. Now we would rather eat anywhere else.

u1pDFw643V1OJYhPQh3McA.text: The food was very good but not at the level of a 5-star restaurant.  But for a nice night out, very worthy.  The braised short ribs were wonderful.  The service is excellent.  All personel are wonderful.  We requested a widow seat with our reservation for two and got one.  The pricing is not out-of-bounds for this level of restaurant.  However,  be prepared for spending over $200 for two people with wine, salad, entree, no sides and desert.  They have a large and impressive wine list but the pricing is way out-of-bounds at 4 to 10 times retail.  I've been there 4 times now and find the quality to be consistent.  It is a great place for an event dinner (anniversary, birthday, etc.) but not if you are just going for the food.

BNH0F4P_TfKNh5WEHV8eUg.text: The best gastronomic experience ever! We tried the tasting menu offered by the chef, and we were amazed by each plate! The server Nick was excellent, we absolutely loved the experience!

wYW-Ow_pQbjS3-2n1GxMpg.text: Nice view of the Bellagio fountain show. Great ambience. Awesome service.  Wasn't too impressed with the food though. It was decent but too pricey for what it is. I must admit though that the creme brulee was delish!  I will not be coming back again. There are so many other restaurants in Vegas that offer better food than this place.

Hj-Wv9tt658E71JBVP-XHg.text: Beautiful decor with metal structure of the tower throughout the dining area.  Elevator to the restaurant has you walk past the kitchen to the upstairs host stand.  I have eaten here twice now, once for dinner many years ago and this time for lunch.  Both times the price is obviously steap but for the ambiance, atmosphere, food quality and service provided it is definitely worth every penny!  Would definitely recommend as a place to dine and overlook the Bellagio fountains!

XlOrcqgPFVkqeHFEOarT_w.text: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant was phenomenal! My boyfriend and I had the most UH-MAZING dinner, dessert and view! We were seated at a corner table overlooking the Paris Balloon and the strip.  Reservations were at 8:30pm. It was so romantic! I strongly recommending asking for a window seat and/or a corner table.   We started with a riesling from the alsace region. It was delicious.  We received a complimentary appetizer, an asparagus puree. Bread choices were multi-grain, french baguette, or wheat. Water is either sparkling or flat.   Main Entrees: * He had the filet mignon. Absolutely delectable! I had the rack of lamb. Melted in my mouth like butter.   Desserts: THE SOUFFLES ARE TO DIE FOR!  *He had the Pistachio Souffle. As I quote my boyfriend, "Honey, I can now go to the top of the Eiffel Tower and jump because it just doesn't get any better than this. Sorry, babe but this pistachio souffle is just better than sex!" And people, let me tell you ... it is True! I totally agree with him and we have great sex! It was heavenly.   * I had the Grand Marnier Souffle.  That was absolutely delicious too ... but it was all about the Pistachio Souffle!  * We also received a complimentary dark chocolate mousse. Wow! Just yummy!  Overall - it was an awesome experience! Yuri, our waiter, was attentive and friendly.  Lyle, the manager was accommodating and pleasant.  I have high standards. It goes beyond Patina in Los Angeles. Maestro's is still a favorite but the Eiffel Tower was just that phenomenal!

BCY1kzqQHyyQCjaoQvDsAQ.text: Wonderful introduction to see the bustling kitchen as you exit the elevator. Reservations are a must for this restaurant and we had one. We were seating promptly and just as the sun was going down and all of the lights on the strip came up! The waitstaff was excellent and the sommelier very knowledgeable and helpful. Service was excellent and the food very good, but not memorable. The food was good enough to make us come back next time, but mostly for the ambiance and view.

aa9Uw4q-_efGch01FklC1Q.text: (Jan/ 2006)  A birthday dinner on top of the world?-- beyond words.   The restaurant was gorgeous and no matter where you are seated, you get an amazing view of the strip and the Bellagio hotel. Sit by the window, like we did, and you'll catch the Bellagio's water show while you dine.  Our dinner was superb! The Char Broiled Filet Mignon accompanied with mashed potatoes-- mouth- watering good! For dessert, can you believe they make souffles 6 different ways? We've never had banana souffles so we went for it. Definitely one of the most delicious and memorable dessert we've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. banana souffles
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mashed potatoes

TqzDMH0Z8kse_--0T_qvIg.text: Ambiance: 5 stars Service: 4 stars Food: 1 star  The place has great ambiance: dark but not too dark.  It's just dark enough to make everybody look better.  The decor is great;  glass floor-to-ceiling all around.  I got a window fountain view table even though I was by myself.   There are very few "bad" tables.  Unfortunately, as with every place where the claim to fame is the location or the view, the food falls down.  Hard.  It's as if the chefs are blind robots trained at the Culinary Institute of America: everything appears to be well prepared and nicely presented, but they all taste as if nobody in the kitchen has taste buds.  They're uniformly bland.  (Well, at least, they're *uniformly* bland and not some bland some too salty!)  The bread was not too bad.  The fish was cooked to the proper doneness, but was... bland.  It came with a corn salsa where the corn kernels had bits of cob on them, as if cut off the cob by an amateur home cook.  To cap it all off, the dessert came garnished with a sprig of mint that is wilted, with one leaf half blackened (hence my "blind" robot observation).  The quality is definitely not worth the $100+ per person for the tasting menu.  For that price, you can get amazing food at countless other Vegas eateries: Sage, Joel Robuchon & Joel Robuchon Atelier, Scarpetta, etc.

sU20e5EONKu5N0CfneI_MA.text: We been to the Eiffel Tower many times. The view and the ambience is amazing. There were four of us and I had the halibut which was overcooked not very flavorful. The New York was delicious.   We had better service and food on our previous visits. Not sure why because it was a Monday night and not that crowded.

3ckUWQt87KQGLYStsgifNA.text: Our waiter was great, the food was excellent! It was a very quiet, comfortable, romantic spot with a great view! My wife and I came here for lunch and the prices were excellent!

CoHlfHqJIzD564zEQNtbmA.text: Tourist trap. Very poor food. Many people around us had the forethought to just order a drink see the view and leave.

pGavBW9RYZdB-JSnQqmoYw.text: Awesome experience!   Thanks for the special birthday experience!  Great service, great views, great food!  We had the fixed brunch menu and there wasn't a bad bite.  Thank you!  Beau B.

--Q-TTIIDA-bcRfY2vKzRg.text: I'm not a French cuisine connoisseur, but what I tasted here was delicious.  And it may seem like a lot of money, but it beats losing that money to the casinos.  My husband got the Char Broiled Filet Mignon, which was the best cut of meat we've ever eaten.  I got the Muscovy Duck Breast, Camargue Rice, Pistachio, Sauce Foie Gras.  I've never had duck before, but it was a nice meat. It was a bit chewy, but it had good flavor.  Get one of their souffles!  It takes 30 minutes to cook, but it's well worth the wait.  I also recommend the Non-Traditional Caesar Salad as a salad option.  They gave a complementary birthday dessert, as well as little petit fours to close the meal (such a lovely touch).  I also ordered a Pineapple Rum drink that was tasty but not worth $20, in my opinion.    The view is beautiful, as is the atmosphere.  Highly recommend if you're looking for a romantic evening.

OiSu2fOHCIswjm_gJz1b8g.text: Likes: Light frothy cappuccino, three types of bread available to choose from, delicious chocolate and pistachio souffles that were light and fluffy on the outside with a warm filling that just oozes out when you cut into it, variety of petit fours, photography option, incredibly beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains and their water show (I stopped the conversation every 15 minutes just to watch the show =)), AMAZING friendly service - everyone that came by was extremely nice which is extremely hard to come by in a lot of restaurants, great ambiance, VERY romantic, definitely a must-go place!  Dislikes: Chocolate souffle was definitely better than the pistachio souffle.  I had food coma after eating so much deliciousness.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate souffle
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great view

W2DhDDfX7sye9D6_2103fw.text: The view while eating is the best. The food is not bad also. You're paying a lot for the view. What was strange the last time we came was that we were waiting for the complimentary french bread and butter that we love, and saw other people getting, but we had to ask for it when our meal arrived. I would recommend the burgers.  I enjoyed the shrimp appetizers and the dessert ice cream souffle from the brunch menu.  The steak and eggs was just okay, it was a flat iron steak and sliced. I have tried the salmon omelette and that is good.  The prefixed brunch menu is $39.99 per person.

XNN304m6ez-WAdoraF-H4w.text: Very special treat for my husband and I.  Both being in the restaurant business ourselves and celebrating a combination of my birthday and our 5 year anniversary this restaurant had come highly recommended by fellow foodie friends.  We made reservations on Open Table but arrived early hoping to perhaps be seated earlier or have a cocktail - as we were looking at the drink list the hostess informed us that a table was indeed open for us and YES a view table as we had requested!  We had the tasting menu with the wine pairings (after enjoying a Singapore Sling)  Carmen our server was spot on, professional, polite, knowledgeable but not intrusive.  Jose our backwaiter kept our waters filled and our bread plates going and we had so much fun bantering with him - I told him Jose was not a very "French" name so I would call him "Pierre"  we had fun all night asking Pierre for this or that - If we could afford to go back we would in a heartbeat - and the view!  What a view!  The only drawback is my husband would have loved to sub the veal for the duck on the tasting menu but I guess the kitchen is not open to doing such requests - oh well

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our S/A or back waiter Jose or as I liked to call him &#34;Pierre&#34;

UgN0Nn3y_yZKMp8i3ss7nw.text: Very good food and exceptional service. Our window seat had a awsome view of the  strip. Pricey but worth the experience. I suggest the after 8pm reservation so that you can experience the vegas strip in all its glory.

58dkOHOpAEk9wtGb2fr6JA.text: A restaurant with great food, great service and a view of Bellagio's fountain show (or other parts of the Strip). Definitely a nice place to have dinner with somebody special. You will not be disappointed.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée

htOtcZfwqDKYBAlfYoyzkA.text: Your paying for a great view of the bellagio fountains. You really get pampered here and the food is excellent. So your total experience here is going to cost u here. Apps, drinks, main entree and desserts ran 250 for the two of us.

iXdHV4mLk563fPHDYHMF2g.text: Bonjour!  Welcome to my review! Me and the hubs got a chance at a date night thanks to grandpa watching my little monster. I carefully selected this place. As someone who lived in Europe for 2 years and have visited Paris twice I would say the Eiffel tower is much bigger. haha! But in all reality it really is a super cool replica!  Even our waiter was French (maybe he was faking it, after all have you hear Rick's voice from the Walking Dead?? CRAZY!) The steak was amazing (and I'm a Texan y'all!) and the potatoe croquettes were to die for! The creme de la crop was the Creme brulee. I am still dreaming about it...(sorry honey)  The drink was awesome, don't get me wrong (pink something??) but $19?!! I coulda gotten one of those yard stick margaritas for that (which I did after, to show my classiness)   Did I mention you can see the Belagio fountains perfectly?? It's pretty amazing. We will definitely go back here. Next time I will 86 the drink and save the $ for gambling (or a second creme brulee, who knows??) Oui Oui!!

l30Oj80bkq8Mbo7ythWHkA.text: Don't waste your money here. And you'll waste a LOT of it if you do. The only reason they get 3 stars is because of the impeccable service. That's all they have. The food was terrible!!!  We paid $140 per person for 9 family members (do the math and then add 20% gratuity plus tax ) to celebrate our daughters birthday...which also happens to be Valentine's Day. I get it, the whole idea of a pre-set menu, it's all about feeding the masses, quantity over quality. But for that price you expect quality! The filet was tough and needed a hack saw to cut into it. I chose the sea bass. What a joke! I've had sea bass many times. It's thick and meaty. This was the thinnest puny piece of fish I've ever had that claimed to be "sea bass". Simply put, I'd expect this type of cheap cuts of meat & subpar side dishes at a buffet for $29. Not $140.  The wait staff however,was 5 stars!! They were polite, attentive, and overall just very professional. I couldn't find a negative if I tried. So if you don't mind dropping a ton of money on the "experience" go for it. If you actually enjoy good food, skip this place altogether.

MoI009sqKrMHFn3yM-MFKA.text: I didn't like the food. But view is breathtaking! Perfect place for first time visitors. Ask for a table next the window!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soufflé. It was ok. The best dish in this restaurant.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view

bX_uwXqGHlRbIc-TxfJVmw.text: I booked the 5pm dinner so my newly wed husband and I could get a window seat and watch the fountains. The only upsetting moment I had, was realizing the day was too windy and the fountains would not go off. We put that behind us as we ordered our cocktails. Let me tell you the Eiffel Affair is to die for! Fresh fruit in the bottom of my glass just soaked up the liquor. Yum! I ordered the scallops...delightful. The highlife was ordering the veal medallions. So glad I ordered that, they were so moist. My husband ordered the aged NY steak mid rare. Looked superb. I also ordered a customized cake (very lovely) months ago and I chose to get the picture. Very glad, everything went well and was a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My view of the fountains. This was the third table to the right of the corner table that is shown in their advertisements.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The customized cake we decided to have as our &#34;wedding cake.&#34; You are able to choose the cake type and filling. Sixty dollars.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The photo we chose to purchase.

SCDW8onXnvJFWX4beJsL9Q.text: A night to savor with good company, especially of the romantic kind. Overlooks the Strip and the recurring water show below, which partially explains why the Eiffel Tower may push past the price envelope, at times. Or maybe this is just Vegas, done in style. Regardless, when you're here, enjoy yourself and celebrate all things good.  One reason to come here was the Chef had created Brasserie Jo, in Chicago, one of my favorite places ever.  Do ask for a window seat when you approach the Hostess stand. Repair at the swanky and luxurious bar as they make your table ready. Take in the room now, because soon you'll be looking out onto the beautiful vista -- as well as at your beautiful dining companion. And when food begins to arrive, you will want to gaze deeply into the works of art that wait demurely on your plates.    *Maine Lobster Salad, Watermelon Tartar, Water Chestnuts, Pistachio Vinaigrette is a delightful starter. Fresh, light and substantial all at once.  * Warm Caesar a la Francaise, Capers, Garlic was not entirely satisfying. Though the Romaine confidently snapped and crunched beautifully, the *warm* part was absent. True, we had the dressing on the side. But the atypical Caesar dressing came room temp at best. My dining companion spotted our salad waiting on a table or stand nearby for several minutes before it got delivered by a backwaiter/busboy. Halfway into the salad we informed our server about the temperature problem. He apologized but made no efforts to remedy the situation there and then, nor later at the time of the bill.   While debating which entrees to try, I thought our server gilded the lily saying how rare it is to see dishes like Dover Sole and the Beef Wellington on a menu. I saw them both offered at Mon Ami Gabi.  *Sea Bass, Shaved Asparagus, Quinoa Gallette, Champagne Brown Butter Broth was appreciated by my dining companion -- though I felt it to be far too lemony, and fairly mundane. Adequate, but not thrilling.  *Boneless Organic Rabbit, Braised Carrots Confits, Mustard Jus, however, I thought was Outstanding! The description relies on the verbal, though, and here our server got it just right. While half the dish is simply (and perfectly), the second part was a a more complex sausage made from the loin mixed with some vegetables -- so flavorful. Highly recommended. The carrots (haha) were delicious too.   *Chocolate Souffle was a perfect ending. While someone here on Yelp grumbled it was small -- I think it was just right. I love a great Chocolate Souffle and when it's not great, I tell the restaurant there and then. This was great.  We muddled a bit over wine choices, and our server wasn't a great help. Maybe because they were busy, but we fairly soon enough got a nice visit from the Sommelier who steered us to a lovely White Bordeaux. We began the night with some fun cocktails off the Drink List. And we ended with excellent coffee and a latte.  We loved the bread selection and the re-appearance of the gent who delivered them. A different guy, alas, dropped my salad utensils on me as they slipped off the plate. Also, when we sat down and were asked about the water, still or sparkling -- it would have been appropriate to mention bottled or not. Not the end of the world, but a teensy bit presumptuous. The not-so-warm Caesar, the bobbling busboy contributed to this being a four not five star review. Still, it was a fabulous dinner.

QnDPNT7I-Ih9kA6r7PnL1w.text: Came for dessert and sat at the bar. You enter the restaurant via elevator and walk past the immaculate kitchen to a dining area that features magnificent views of the Bellagio fountains. We had the pleasure of being served by Ridge the bartender, who was fantastic. We only ate dessert but the souffle and apple strudel were awesome and our port/liquor pairings were perfectly on-point (thanks Ridge!) This place has the whole package - service, food, and atmosphere. I'll return next time I'm in town.

ptCA4HTe_V2Xn9aMhGKImg.text: Our kids spotted this restaurant and thought it was cool because we would be in the Eiffel Tower. While definitely expensive the food was great (and they offered a kids menu too). I had the salmon and it had nice flavor. . My husband had the filet and felt it wasn't as great as he has had in other restaurants (especially for the price!). My son had the chicken off the main menu and it was delicious. For dessert we had the Caramel Souffle which was to die for!  The service was outstanding and although we did not have a window seat the view was spectacular!  It was a definite great place to go once for the experience or for a special occasion. Special note: men must wear long pants!!

qtil13WeqHz9WtwCcO8CFg.text: Visited the Eiffel Tower restaurant over the weekend for our 1st year anniversary. Very romantic restaurant overlooking the strip. Our view was the fountain at Bellagio.  Food is delicious and customer service is beyond outstanding!

rfX-9SM_P_RRuj9VHWze2Q.text: Everything was worth the price. From the food down to the service. We called the restaurant a day before on a Tuesday to reserve a window table to the Bellagio fountains for 6:30pm on a Wednesday night. As soon as we arrived they walked us over to the most perfect seat in the house, right in front of the fountains. We were able to see the fountains go off a total of three times while we were there. We had the waiter check in on us about every 10 minutes, and they were constantly refilling our water. I got the "king" filet mignon and the meat just melted in my mouth. It was perfectly seasoned and cooked just right (medium-well). I made sure to savor every bite. The mashed potatoes were also to die for. I got both the wheat and the French bread but the wheat was easier to chew. We ordered the caramel souffle right when we ordered the appetizer and as soon as we were done with our dinner, they brought it fresh from the oven. It felt like we were tasting a little piece of heaven. It was so warm and soft, it was just amazing. Overall, my boyfriend and I had a very romantic dinner with such a beautiful view. The bill came out to about $200 with an appetizer, a glass of wine, dinner for two and a dessert. We're not ones to eat fancy dinners very often, but if you ask me, it was totally worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Night view. Beautiful.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful view. Make sure to request a window seat to the fountains when you make your reservation and call to confirm.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel soufflé was the best thing I&#39;ve ever had. Make sure to order it as soon as you order your appetizer bc it takes 30 mins.

7K6wwzq1ueOCCZqgyZX5Mg.text: I rated it 5 stars not just because of this restaurant's prancing-fountains-view but for its food quality. Such good cuisine is as rare as a Citroen or a Peugeot on American street.

RExycguEhZPHAtB1CwutEg.text: I definitely recommend this Steakhouse the food is really good always good service fresh hot excellent food excellent staff

pcLIbI470Hcxh81R2Oz1hw.text: This restaurant has a great view and ambiance. However, the food is not worth the price. My food came out cold, and my husbands was not very flavorful. You're pretty much paying for the view. I am happy to be able to say I've ate there before, it was an experience I'll never forget; but if you're looking for amazing food for the same price, try the Gordon Ramsey Steakhouse downstairs.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel souffle.

1XaDvU4jiDKDqcx6Kq7Grw.text: What a wonderful place to celebrate my 40th birthday. I made a reservation to sit in the window to watch the water show below, and it was spectacular. The food was probably the best meal I've ever had! The filet mignon was cooked to perfection. I loved the bread basket that had a lovely selection of baked items to choose from. Great service and romantic setting. Will go again!

Ut12q7Bi2Q5ZvVS-Sstw-Q.text: Wonderful Mother's Day Brunch food was delicious!! Service was great!! The View of the Bellagio fountain was beautiful!! Only thing was food could of been a little bit hotter but place was very busy due to Mother's Day.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HPnCl63zjsAwRzS0qHU02g.text: What kind of restaurant refuses to cater to vegetarians or people who can not eat bacon?  I ordered a salad that did not say on the menu description that it was apparently sauteed in bacon fat and topped with bacon. I was quite disappointed and ended up switching salads with my friend who ordered the kale salad.   From the beginning I was unimpressed. The tables were extremely close together and hard to get up and go to the restroom (due to the narrow walkway and narrow space between tables), the starter was a complementary cold cream corn soup in a shot glass.. i think its self explainatory as to why it was unimpressive, the scallops we ordered was a total of two scallops  (one whole and one cut in half to look like 3) which I would have preferred to be cooked a bit more to be a bit carmelized on the bottom.  Also, There is a photographer that comes around and asks to take a picture and will later tell you they can add it to your bill for 20 something dollars.. It would be nice but the photo we received was blurry. Being yelpers, we don't complain we just write about it later.. haha.  However, The dessert made my experience so much better. I ordered the banana tower with white chocolate and it was exquisite.   Overall, the food isn't anything to write home about, the view isn't as great as I thought it would be, its not great for the claustrophobic, but you must try the dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold instant cream soup with pieces of bread crumbs complements of the chef..
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brought out my salad with bacon and it wasn&#39;t labeled on the menu and wouldn&#39;t cater to vegetarians..

SGS3y-HgWqWgcXOLU5rqDw.text: ATMOSPHERE: The restaurant knows what their selling point is: the view of the strip. It is absolutely incredible. Perfect view of the Bellagio fountains, Cosmo hotel, and the big Paris balloon. I had the pleasure of viewing the scene during the daytime and during then night...the view totally transforms before your eyes when the sun sets. Took plenty of pictures.  The tables are quite close together, they want to pack the place up. NOT good for groups, tables are mostly meant for 2-3 people. Noise level wise, it was louder than I expected, lots of glass clanking and I could hear the kitchen and bar.  FOOD: The food was quite delicious. I will say it's not the BEST I have ever tasted but it was still delicious all around. (Pictures posted up in pics).  Pre-appetizer: they give you a little avacado mousseline in a shot glass type. Tasty. And I always appreciate complimentary dishes. The bread guy was really funny. He will come around with a giant bread plate and give you 5 choices of bread.   Appetizer: got the scallops with ox tail and the quail. Both quite delicious. Quail was better. Scallops were good but I found it interesting that it was in a dark meat sauce (since I associate scallops with lighter sauces).  Entrees: Got the 7 oz. filet minion and the short ribs. Filet was better probably because the cut of the meat was just better. Though the flavoring was still better than the short ribs. I found the ribs slightly on the dry side. They give you 5 large pieces so definitely worth it. The butter noodles and the veggies that came with it were just OK.  Side dish: the potato croquettes were really just potato shaped like finger-length sticks and fried. It was very meh, pretty bland.  Dessert: SOUFFLES. Hands down. Got the chocolate and the pistachio. Pistachio was MUCH MORE delicious. Even the waiter said everyone in the kitchen prefers the Pistachio. GET IT. The chocolate one was not that chocolatey...  Overall the experience was very unique and nice. The view is not to be replicated anywhere else. Food was good, but as you know, very expensive. You really pay for the view and the experience.   Oh they'll come take a picture of you and you can buy it for $24. Wasn't worth it for me considering I took plenty of pics on my own. =)

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. filet minion
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spare ribs

Z-e8904K4bL_1hqtSeJW3A.text: Came here for my bday and did the vegetarian tasting menu. Beautiful view and ambience. Love that they OFFER vegetarian tasting menus, table behind us was also inquiring, vegetarians are foodies too! Service was on point.  With tasting menus timing and dish descriptions are imperative,  both were there. Not the 5th star because the food didnt have me begging for more. Im a stickler for table maintenance and the busser did a great job. Restaurants of this caliber stand out because of attention to detail. Only detail missed were un polished plates. Didnt ruin my meal or anything, but finger prints and marks were glowing under the lighting of our table.  If you've never been its worth checking out!

omKHEX00XzHn2xPrpQUqhg.text: Wao. Exceptional customer service. All compliment to the wait stuff and probably the management team as well, who train the staff. We wanted to take a look to the Bellagio's fountain from the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. So, we went upstairs and seat on the bar area facing to the fountain. Our waiter came and we politely and  by making some funny comments we let   him know  we are not gonna be his most valued guests tonight. My wife is pregnant so she is good with a water, and I am okay with a glass of wine, plus we have a reservation in an other place so we  just like to kill the time and share one appetizer. In this industry if someone like us telling you up front you not gonna make any money on them, most people won't give a f., but least they will give you the feeling of not giving a f. In our case this not what  happened. He maintained his professional attitude in the whole time we were there, and handled us like his money bags. I have to compliment them and a positive review is the minimum what I can give to this place. To make employees to be  happy and professional, under in that kind of circumstance, it takes an exceptional management and crew. Many restaurants should learn from them. Good job.

e8upI1KpgcEt99HHT7O4qg.text: Fabulous fancy lunch!!  We really enjoyed our lunch here on our last trip to Vegas. We had the kale salad, cheese platter, hamburger, and shrimp cocktail. Everything was to die for.   Service was excellent... views were awesome... really nothing bad to say about this place.  We will be back.

8Da7wo5Uwc7DhReCdJAARQ.text: Love the restaurant. Went to both the one in France & here. Vegas of course is more up to date. But both gave me the feeling of romance. Love. Service us above and beyond !!! One of my favorite !

8zy4PnnmTn8ATvSAFCwq9w.text: Overall it was OK, but our birthday boy didn't like any of his dishes.

r_SHgh3tDBAjEUynSaRO1w.text: So we came here on April 16th for my wife's birthday  and we asked our waiter what he recommended  the chicken I then asked what it came with and he never mentioned onions which I'm extremely allergic too.  So we order drinks and we waited for dinner to be served. It was very hard to get his attention because he was so rude to begin with. So the food came out and looked great I started to eat and started getting hot flashes so my wife starts to move the chicken and there's tons of onions so I had to stop eating  and asked  the waiter why didn't he mention there was onions and he was just rude about it and said well I didn't have to mention that because I should know there's onions in all french food even after I had told him we had never ate at a french restaurant. But besides the mishap and the rude waiter the view was beautiful and my wife enjoyed her food and that's all that mattered..   The funny thing is that besides the mishap my believes if you don't leave good tips you get bad luck at restaurants so we tipped him $60 and LoL when we were leaving we saw him looking how much we left him and I was going to the bathroom to put water on my face and when I came out he was talking to my wife saying how much he was concerned with my health and much he enjoyed us. I was like really?? ?? Just because we tipped you??? I'm glad I wasn't there when he said that ...  So "Jorge" the waiter profile someone that comes to your restaurant because don't think we didn't see the two ladies next us that you were kissing the butt the whole night and they ran up a $400 tab and left you $5 bucks. We seen what they left you..  But if you want a beautiful view eating dinner with your spouse or that special somebody then go here and enjoy. If you get Jorge tell him we said hi lol

PiPGkU-GQt4YocyzXX7AqQ.text: We had a nice table for two by the window on the Bally's side.  There is no bad window seat although the best views are those that are directly across from Belagio.  The lunch menu has not changed much since our last visit.  The Ocean Seafood Salad has been our favorite and it did not disappoint.  The Aged Parmesan Crusted Chicken was not up to Eiffel Tower's usual standard.  It came out completely soggy and greasy.  We sent it back to the kitchen and the reincarnated version was an improvement but no match for the one we had on a prior visit.  Service was good and our waiter made up for the food fiasco.

MmedFCXFGhNLu7fQNgVb2Q.text: Amazing food, excellent service and a perfect view of the Bellagio fountains - except for the perfect companion, they do provide u with everything u need for the perfect date night....!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6TMIVuYBg6FzUbTuvgM8eg.text: My boyfriend and I ate here in the evening and had the best view of the Bellagio water show for starters. The food was absolutely amazing! I ordered the queen filet mignon with bee aide sauce and he ordered the Rossini Style Filet Mignon, Foie Gras, Truffle Sauce. Both were cooked to perfection and was the most tender filet mignon we e ever had. We also got a grand mariner souffle which was also the best we've ever had. Our bill was 258$ including tip but not including the 50$ we spent on 2 drinks here. Worth every penny I loved it!

Aoai2dtSo7I1f41s0_P-AA.text: While visiting Paris I noticed that the Eiffel tower restaurant offered some very tempting food and desserts. After getting my group together we realised a couple of us did not fit the dress code. No problem they have pants and jacket available. So after a quick change we were having cocktail by a table near the window. From time to time you can see the water and lights show across the street at Bellagio. The service here is superb. I ordered the beef wellington. It took about half an hour which we knew but it was well worth the wait. It was absolutely delicious. For dessert I ordered the Grand Marnier Souffle. This too took some time but it was incredible. Next time I'm in Vegas I will be dining here again.

P4R45ns6uUDln74wPEg-yA.text: This is the five star restaurant that I will  base all my ratings from now on. I will not be giving out many 5 star ratings because there can be very few equals to this experience. Make reservations in advance and ask to be sat at the windows facing the Bellagio. This restaurant is about 6 floor up from street level so that you will have an amazing view of the fountains as they show every 20 minutes. The food and service exceeds the view. You feel well taken care of from the minute you check in for the private elevator, through the reception desk and to your seat. The food had us moaning much like Meg Ryan in "When Harry met Sally". Kale salad, Lobster Bisque, Filet Mignon, NY Strip steak. Pre dinner complimentary cold cream of celery soup and post dinner complimentary petite fours. Served impeccably by an attentive but not intrusive staff.  Men must wear a jacket  and collared shirt if you don't have one they will loan you one. Be prepared to drop $250 minimum and more likely $300 plus for 2 people. It is worth it..

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paris, Vegas.

etaWIpvHIjohTebfcr7MmA.text: An amazing place for a romantic night out in Vegas, a proposal, and just fun night with friends.   Love the view at sunset and the great view of the Bellagio Water show.   Food is amazing!! Drinks from the bar are good as well. Menu is pricey but the food is great and you are paying for the view as well.   You don't need to wear a suit, but a nice pair of khakis or black dress pants and a collared shirt would be very appropriate.   Make sure to pay for the photo they will take of you and your date and/or party. They come out amazing!

BFB9cms3fs663WI8uCD9NA.text: This place is very romantic!   * lobster salad: everything about this salad was good! refreshing and tasty!   * lamb burger: I don't eat lamb but this burger was good! the fries were delish!!   * service: GREAT!   I would like to say that the restaurant wants you to feel as though you are in Paris but it is anything BUT that. I have been to Paris and believe me, the service is nothing like the service here! It's the exact opposite! The service and attention to detail in on point at the eiffel tower restaurant! The staff is great! i loved every minute here!   i will defenatly be back!

fDxfrrRs148xcrRl5Yc2JQ.text: The service here is A1. The waiters are very attentive and work for their money. You feel like a million bucks here alone. Then the food was just fantastic. I had the Parmesan crusted chicken and would recommend. The cheese appetizer was certainly one for learning but delicious. Waiter recommended a $100 bottle and got confused, he understood we wanted a cup and not a bottle, but charged us for both. It ended up expensive. You get what you pay for.

OioiK6tyePeduYq_ArxHXA.text: Normally I'm not that into French food. The price is crazy and the food is just ok. I feel like people say they love French food because it's the sophisticated thing to say. This place was different. We had a price fixed menu that was fantastic. There were 4 courses with an Amuse(whatever that is) to start. All courses were wonderful. It was expensive but you can't beat the food and the location. The service was spot on. We forgot to bring our printed tickets to a show and the server gave us the email address of the manager who printed them for us so we didn't have to go all the way back to our hotel. That's above and beyond in my book. I definitely recommend this place.

vg4Gkq9iBWETbj-KjAbGEg.text: My better half and I wanted the nice date night on the strip. After meandering around we decided to check out The Eiffel Tower for our possible dinner. One glance at the menu and those $70-$80 plates quickly caught our eyes. The hostess recommended we go ahead and check out the view at least and get a drink. We arrived to the top and were immediately greeted. We deferred to the bar which did have a some tables overlooking the Bellagio fountains. I believe four chairs in total. She had a couple glasses of wine, and I had the Eiffel Avenue (sweet and tasty).  Signature cocktails were $19. We had the apple strudel with a scoop of ice cream which was ample for two. We did see the fountains a few times and were able to get them in some selfies. Great experience.

TAV5VVICl6siutXqT_85dQ.text: Food was expensive as expected but excellent. We really enjoyed our meal. Our only complaint is that the female host was not very friendly & she didn't make us feel welcome.

YHf9MeOpC6GAwgFml3A9lQ.text: Simply perfect. We've had TWO outstanding meals in a row here. First of all, we're locals. You've got to drive a hard bargain to get us near the strip. Eiffel Tower Restaurant does just that. Probably one of the most tourist dense restaurants in the city and equally one of the most well known. Not the average place you'd find a local. However, for this place, we make the trip.   The food is perfect. The service is perfect. We've now been served by Anthony and Alix. Both marvelous. Great personalities and very good at their craft.   We spent dinner Thanksgiving here. We strayed away from our typical prime rib dinner to do something different in 2017 and it was worth the risk. This is now our go-to spot for Thanksgiving dinner or any other special occasion.

t2U8cOol0IG8ciMUFYezug.text: One of the worst experiences of my life from a restaurant of supposed class. Really ruined what should have been a great Valentine's Day dinner. You have to guarantee your reservation with a credit card and for Vday actually pay a ridiculous  $195 per person up front. I now know why. Fixed menu that was terrible. They must have given the regular chef off. Maybe always bad since this was my first (and last) time there.  Started with a ride up in the elevator with an escort that had the personality of a log. Then a long wait even with a reservation only seating policy. I verified a window table via phone after credit card payment and was confirmed until we show up and waited. Then denied and told with no apology that it isn't guaranteed. Tried to move on with the night. Drinks came in a timely manner but food courses were spaced out much too far. I guess they were busy burning them and then letting them sit out. Honestly, even having the best company in the world couldn't save this overpriced slop. Much better French dining all around and definitely don't rely on this place for a romantic evening. To be fair, I'm sure it's the best view, but the next night we went to the Cabo Wabo bar & grill with a second story view of the Bellagio fountains and strip and the Mexican inspired food, atmosphere, and vibe was so much better for a tenth of the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

soUt1c_bqP-KQQTSXV366w.text: There was no way I was leaving Vegas without visiting the Eiffel Tower!! It was amazing!! The whole experience was incredible. Specially if you get to see the fountain show at the Bellagio. I highly recommend stopping by at night! Prices change I believe it's cheaper during the day and once the sun goes down it the prices go higher. Even though we went at night it was still pretty affordable. You need to visit the Eiffel Tower!

Gq87rVxejQ-58B_arYq8Jg.text: This restaurant was on my bucket list for a while and my sweetheart took us for our anniversary. Ask for a table with a view, it's worth it- time your reservation for sunset  and it'll be absolutely beautiful.  The atmosphere was lovely. From start to finish. The service impeccable, which for a restaurant like this- an expectation that was met.  We had scallops for appetizer, yum. I had steak and he had salmon, double yum. And the dessert we had was just ok but still tasty.  We had our photo taken there too to remember such a great day.  Definitely a restaurant and memory that you'll always remember.

We shared grand Mariner Soufflee.great view and friendly staff  Food: crepes- good flavor, wasn't too impressed Soufflee- yes- order it!  Service: really funny and friendly staff  Overall: pretty pricy but for a nice meal it's great. Make reservation to sit near window for view

uqC6n2AzRqutVdOEtuBY8A.text: All the Way Up....Yes the view from up there was spectacular.Did not have lunch nor dinner there but bought some tickets to just go up there to get that incredible view .Very Happy I did it was a thrilling experience.I do recommend it if and only you're not afraid of heights.

e39DXWV4ZGD9LOWI_hMeFA.text: Can't say enough good things about this restaurant! The customer service is top notch, and they really do make sure all your needs are met. When we were making the reservation we happened to mention that it was our ten year wedding anniversary and that we'd frequented their restaurant on our honeymoon. They gave us the best table in the house with a direct view of the bellagio fountains, and a complimentary dessert!  Ps- order the beef Wellington- you won't be disappointed!!

31U41f6JVs-6VGK_UKiNkg.text: Great view. If you order the seafood platter just know its not cracked so be very careful. Otherwise it had a great ambience. Price is what would be expected. This place would have gotten a 4 if I were a tourist , but since I live here and would come back, I took one star away.

KX5sJfxHWqZdoc3wX73f7Q.text: Pros: -Amazing Food -Filet Mignon and mashed potatoes were amazing -Excellent view of the Bellagio Fountains -Long wait? Have a drink at the bar! The stewardess will come DIRECTLY to you when your table is ready.  Cons: -Price - (Cheapest meals are $40 and $20 a drink) -Wait Time - (Waited 30 minutes WITH reservation) -Not for Children (There are no Chicken Nuggets here)  Straight to the point: this restaurant is amazing! None of the food was bad and everything ranged from amazing to "can I legally marry this?". The location is also amazing with a view of the bellagio fountains! The Ambiance was a nice and very adult! Overall: 10/10 experience and WILL be back for more!  Recommendations: Filet Mignon Mashed Potatoes

Se5uI_DWfa7eEXZGUWg-pA.text: Had dinner there for the second time when I was in town this week. Had the lobster bisque, beef Wellington and a chocolate souffle. All of it was delicious. Our table had a view of the fountains at the Bellagio. We'd definitely come back.

4PdltpV-mKEbf6P5Bg3TBg.text: Two words: pumpkin souffle.   My boyfriend and i went here for his birthday and we were not disappointed in the least! We don't often partake in fine dining, and when we do (usually for special occasions) we want it to be well worth our time. Eiffel Tower exceeded all expectations, and then some! If you eat here, you should absolutely request Heather as your server. She provided possibly the best service I've ever had, and she made us feel right at home from the very beginning.   Now the food: we started with the foie Gras and duck prosciutto, which was nothing short of heavenly. My entree was the salmon, and it was seared to perfection, but my boyfriend had the duck, and after his first bite, I genuinely thought he would start crying! The view of the Vegas Strip was beyond incredible, and we had a perfect view of the Bellagio Fountains. We will definitely come back to Heather any time we're in Vegas!

mDkT3nyKkjCxkd2BIDYi2w.text: This occasion was during our Annual visit to Vegas and we were celebrating my birthday with our daughter and husband from California. This visit to the restaurant unfortunately was marred by being seated at a table for 4 in a dark corner by one of the decorative posts. We had booked well in advance, confirmed our visit by credit card and even responded to the email guaranteeing a window seat if we agreed to come 1/2 hour earlier which we could not due to our show before we went for dinner. Apart from that everything was great as usual with the service, sommelier's recommendation and the quality of food. We also were well-dressed as usual befitting the standard of the restaurant. Hopefully next time this will not happen again as it has not in the past. Perhaps some oversight on your greeting and seating staff would be in order as we did not want to complain with our family there on this special occasion.

IxRbBW-8WAiWbXFZRlgMxQ.text: Big thanks to Lyle for setting us up with a premium table overlooking the fountain show. Maria was exceptional and extremely knowledgeable.  The food was excellent. Foie gras and duck prosciutto with fog compote was delicious. Oysters were perfect. The scallop appetizer was probably my favorite.  Just know when you come here, you can expect the best of the best. Thank you for an amazing evening.

9qGZagQs1ix_VGbAS0SDuw.text: Definitely one of the highlight meals from our latest visit to Las Vegas.  Highly recommended!    Tips: 1.  Make a reservation on their site.   2.  Go for weekend brunch.  We reserved for Sunday brunch on September 2nd, over Labor Day Weekend.   We were very pleasantly surprised to be seated at with a great window view of the strip (Bellagio/Caesar's side).  The restaurant was not overly crowded.  When we came in (11:30am) all couples were seated with window views, which is terrific considering the restaurant recommends a 4:30pm(!) Dinner reservation for a window table.   Definitely go for weekend brunch!  I had the Lobster benedict, wife had the Maine Lobster salad --  both were was very, very good.  Service was excellent.   Attentive and helpful with recommendations; but not 'hovering' or rushing you to finish at all.   A lovely dining experience that we will certainly return to repeat.  The views during brunch from the Eiffel Tower restaurant complement a truly great meal.

_EWpFPGkzRUMYeREeuFxsw.text: Went for brunch great food, great drinks, and great service all with a view!! We would go back no questions asked!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qmZSbMi7C1fUr3Hq89KnTg.text: Our hopes were high going into this experience, so maybe that was our downfall. Our friends had tried the tasting menu here a couple of years back, and still talk about it to this day as one of the best they have ever had. So, when we all decided to take the trip to Vegas they immediately made a reservation for the four of us.  The elevator ride up is pretty fun, although I was extremely turned off by the elevator doors on the restaurant level, which are covered in so much dust it almost looks like it was intentional. It's likely no one else would notice this, as you have maybe 5 seconds of a view before the doors open/close, but that put me off.   We were seated right away for our 8pm reservation, and our server was lovely. She made great drink recommendations, and I was very pleased with the Daisy, which she proclaimed was her favorite drink. Pleasantly sweet, with just the right amount of spicy. The service was great overall (who doesn't love being offered bread every time your bread plate is empty?).  The thing that really didn't work for us was what we had come for: the tasting menu. We were told it was a bit different for the weekend we were there (the Friday before New Year's Eve), and that we were lucky because we had the opportunity to try all of the entree dishes from the New Year's Eve menu, while diners on New Year's Eve would only have the opportunity to select one. This sounded good in theory, but what we were left with was an overly rich, salty barrage of dishes with no progression, and no balance. For the price tag of $145 per person before drinks ($20 per cocktail, $8 for an Arnold Palmer, $6 for a Ginger Ale, plus an additional $8 per souffle, if you go that route), the meal really should have worked better.  Because we were given the opportunity to make substitutions, and I was feeling the cold foie gras over the sauteed foie gras that was listed on the tasting menu, we made that swap. Unfortunately, we probably would have swapped out half of the dishes had we had the foresight.  * Les Amuses Bouches - all VERY tasty.  * Crispy Maine Lobster Roulade, Avocado, Endive - this was delicious, but they skimped on the claw meat on my friend's plate. We asked if it was intended to be that way, and they assured us it wasn't and replaced his plate.  * Cold Foie Gras Torchon, Duck Prosciutto, Fig Compote (vs. Sauteed New York Foie Gras, Persimmon, Walnut Financier, Walnut Crumble) - really, really good, and so happy we made the swap. Tasted even better alone than with the toast points they provide, but good either way.  * Sea Bass, Sunchoke Emulsion, Roasted Chanterelle Mushrooms, Pinot Noir Reduction - was not into this at all. The fish was cooked well, but everything was salty and heavy, and reminded me of all the things I don't enjoy about certain French dishes. My friend also found three large bones in her filet.  * Filet Mignon, Braised Short Ribs, Romanesco, Thumbelina Carrots, Cabernet Jus, Puff Pastry Tuile - again, very heavy, to the point where we were questioning why the short ribs were there (and then questioning ourselves for ever questioning the presence of short ribs). Did not work as a tasting menu dish, though probably would work as an entree. I only ate a couple of bites, and still felt uncomfortably full at this point.  * Composition of French Cheeses, Candied Pecans - "They can't mess up a cheese plate," we said. How wrong we were. All of the cheeses were extremely potent, and nothing worked together. There was frisee on the plate for some reason. The pear moutard was weird and unpleasant when paired with the stinky cheeses, and the candied pecans were dry and unwelcome. I, an avid cheese lover, couldn't even finish half of my plate.  * Choice of Eiffel Tower Desserts - while the desserts were good, I was so uncomfortable from the heaviness of the meal that I could barely take a bite of each one. We ordered the Chocolate Plate, the Champagne (everyone's favorite), and Pistachio (second favorite) and Grand Marnier souffles.  * Petit Fours - nothing exciting, not extremely welcome at the end of this meal either.  We also ordered the Galette of Potato Anna as a side, but that was not memorable.  While my boyfriend and I were not nearly as disappointed as our friends, I can say this felt like a waste of money. We didn't expect anything to come of the mistake with the lobster, the bones, or the fact that one of the staff spilled water all over my boyfriend, but it would have been a nice touch to see something reflected on the bill. No such luck.  We were unable to file a complaint with anyone there, as they said they would only entertain Yelp reviews, so here I am. They also could not validate our parking, as they operate independently of the casino, so it felt like one disappointment after another.   I would probably give the Eiffel Tower another chance, but it would take a lot to impress me at this point.

zRINhFDU-1p_DbImpZDsWA.text: Amazing brunch and super friendly staff. I got the avocado toast with poached eggs and it was amazing. Atmosphere and view is worth the price as well!

mnmAIoOqttTLF3P76fwqug.text: While I did find an overall improvement from my last visit for dinner, there's still something missing and that something is a bit more creativity and risk taking in the kitchen.  The John Dory was good but the hen of the woods mushrooms were the only different presentation to what was essentially a piece of well cooked, average fish.  The course that had me from first sight was the venison medallions.  Perfectly done, rare, with turnip, caramelized onion compote, and huckleberry sauce.  Great flavors and a perfect dish.     The cheese course was very sparse.  Three small pieces with the star the bleu cheese.  I could have stolen the wheel from the kitchen if I could have gotten away with it.  The mignardises tray had one new item that I could tell.  The rest have been around for years.  Service was excellent!! Isabelle was personable, knowledgable, and a delight to talk to.  What I'm looking from Chef Joho is to take a chance.  Do something outside this very safe tasting menu and give me something to walk away with a big wow in my head.
