mwkRJ8Qj_zKye9N6p1iDjw.text: First of all, I liked the service! Their staff was so nice and friendly. Our waiter was so funny, I liked his sense of humor!!!  He really maid our evning!!! Unfortunatly, I don't remmeber his name :(  The main cours was ok! But the dessert "Crea- brulee" was amasing!  I feel that this is good place for family dinner!  And also the view is beutiful!

DGjbalOH0qBk8n3ivoXgPA.text: After viewing those unbelievably talented Chefs on The Iron Chef shows, I had a craving for the best French food while staying at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas.  I walked around for half an hour, and was totally frustrated (and hungry at 10PM after a long flight) that I could not find a real French restaurant by walking around the Paris casino lobby.  Finally, the concierge walked me to the Eiffel Tower, "that's where you find real French food."  Oui!  An older middle-aged lady, very well-dressed and hmmm.... well-proportioned ...  took me to the elevator behind her.  In a few seconds through layers of steel super structures, I arrived at the restaurant.    Scene 1:  First Impression.  Elevator opens to the kitchen with displays of dishes, stainless steel wares, and busboys. If my synapses were not all firing tonight, I would have thought I'd entered the restaurant through the kitchen from the alley.  1 out of 5 stars.     Scene 2:  Chit Chat.  The greeter took me to the Hostess kiosk where I had to wait for the boy/girl chit chatting before they would address me.  1/5.  Scene 3:  They asked for my reservation name.  The restaurant was half full (empty?) so I said I did not have one.  She said "Let me find a table for you."  Within minutes, they found a table for me -- on the inside wall where the view was to another table.  Wait, what's wrong with any of the tables overlooking the Bellagio water fountain dancing thing?  They were all sitting empty.... vacant... unoccupied..  "Well, Sir, we are trying to shut down that portion of the restaurant this time of the night, but let me check."  As if he was a Secret Service agent, he touched his ear and talk into his wrist and then asked me to return to the lobby while they set up my new table!  Now we talking.  3 out of 5.   Scene 4:  The Tea.  "Shall we start you with some wine perhaps?"  "No, thank you.  I will have green tea please."  "Am sorry, we have no green tea.  But we have black and peach tea.  Very nice."  Am easy to please, so I agreed to the peach tea.  What came out?  Ice tea!  Am easy to please, so I kept the ice tea, unsweetened out of a very nice bottle.  "Can I also get a cup of hot tea, please."  "Am sorry Sir, we don't have hot tea."  Really? The French don't drink tea?  How do you all get sober after being drunk from all that wine?  What am I going to wash down my fine dining with?  I can't really ask for a Coke Zero.  If the French don't drink hot tea, am certain they won't drink Coke Zero.  She gave an uncomfortable smile as I gave her an awkward frown on the tea thing.  "Perhaps you would like coffee instead."  I told her I'm mormon.  That stopped further suggestions.  I was thinking of Dave (mormon friend) when I said that.  I was satisfied that my response immediately wiped away her smile.  1/5.  Scene 5:  The Appetizer.  The fun begins here.  Food tastes great at a great restaurant.  Food would probably taste heavenly if you are hungry, at the "finest French restaurant in Vegas," in the  Paris hotel perched high in the Eiffel tower.  I escargot.  "But I want you to know, it only comes with 5 escargots."  What on my forehead said I wanted a pound of escargots sauteed and served on a hot dog bun?  I smiled and politely said that was a great portion.  A few minutes later... "Am sorry Sir.  The chef said we are out of escargot for tonight."  But it's a French restaurant!  It's like McD is out of french fries.  Fine.  What else ya got?  After some prodding to try cold smoked salmon, I settled on "giant scallops on a bed of ox tail."  After a weekend of pho at home, I am up to my eye browse with ox tails, but the scallops was appealing because it was light.  I want to be French tonight.  Light portions.  Great presentation.  Explosive tastes.  The scallop (one) wasn't giant. but it was good.  The oxtail was horrendous, however.  You know the levels of saltiness.  At the bottom it is bland, then a hint of salt, then "to taste", then salty, then really salty, then bitter.  Mine was bitter.  2 out of 5.    Scene 6:  The Bread.  Before the appetizer came out, the bread man came along.  It was a nice silver tray with different breads laid out in rows to categorize the different breads.  He took 2 spoons and created a make-shift tong to handle the bread. French-like.  I chose the sesame seed bread.  Then he said "you get to choose two."  Oh my gosh!  For a $100 meal I get to choose 2.  What if I wanted 3?  1 star.    Scene 7:  Duck.  Perfectly cooked.  Red.  Moist.  Skin wasn't crunchy as I preferred.  They served the duck on a bed of what tasted like salty and smooshy fruit cake.  Did not complement well at all.  I had to cut the muscle and skin from the breast.  The reduction encircling the duck was again salty. 2/5.  Scene 8:  Desert.  The banana souffle was the highlight.  I had to order it first so the chef can start it right away.  Fluffy, light, airy.  Exactly how it should be.  5/5.  Not worth it.  View was nice, though.

hZJlNXKt5obXxtdrXpZfEA.text: Love! We always visit when we're in Vegas. High end food and one of the greatest ambiances in the strip. Just bring your wallet because this is a meal to break the bank, but it is Vegas and if you didn't come to spend money then your not in right place ;)

G7sTh3g0g08O17ojmFKhog.text: I've always wanted to eat here all the times I've gone to the Vegas strip and was pleasantly surprised when I was taken there for my birthday!  It was summer and extremely hot (109+ degrees) but slightly more formal attire was recommended.  We were in formal attire but later noticed that some were in business-casual attire.  There were still many in formal attire as well.  The restaurant is located in the Paris Hotel/Casino.  There's an elevator that takes you from the casino lobby to the restaurant located in its "Eiffel Tower."  We made dinner reservations and we got there a bit early so we went to the bar for a cocktail.  I'm not big on alcoholic beverages so I ordered the "Sparkling Passion."  I don't remember but it was a sparkling wine with orange juice and some kind of fruit puree.  It was very good!  This was a few years ago so all I remember about the food was the complimentary cheese bread being probably one of our favorite dishes haha.  Our table had an amazing panoramic view of the Bellagio fountains.  It was really beautiful.  This is a great place to have a romantic dinner.  Apparently, my significant other ordered a surprise delivery but it never got to the restaurant.  The manager at the time was apologetic and tried to make things right for us so we appreciated the good customer service.

E43_-1tV6W8ajAi7BKRfyg.text: Going to keep this brief.  Went here for brunch on a Sunday with a number of friends.  Got the lamb burger and it was pretty solid.  My wife got the BLTA sandwich, which was ok.  The prices were a bit high, the views are nice, the service is good but a little stuffy.  Its got a high class vibe due to the French servers, but there weren't many people in there for Sunday brunch, so it had kind of an awkward feel too.  I imagine dinner in a full dining room with the Bellagio fountain light show going in the background would be best.

yHqHgZo0K8IWDIEE7P_YQw.text: Come for the view, maybe leave without food! At least this was my last experience with the Eiffel Tower restaurant.   I have been in to eat 3 times now. The first 2 times were wonderful; 4 stars. This last time however was an abysmal 1 star.  First of all, the view of the Bellagio and their stunning fountain is fantastic. Romantic, breathtaking and all other adjectives found in thesaurus. The staff is 5 stars all the way; from the helpful hostesses to the swift bread guy that is at your table though out your entire meal making sure you have a new, fresh piece of bread from the 5 different varieties in the basket.  Amazing! Kudos to him. The wait staff is all uniformly good as well - although at one point I finished my glass of wine and instead of refilling it from the bottle at the table, my waitress snatched it away leaving me wine free. I had to flag someone down to get me a fresh glass! And this is in Vegas! Humph, not impressed.   Now, on to the food: My very first time in I ordered the seafood tower - go big or go home, right? It was crazy expense and worth every penny. It was fresh, tasty, totally over the top with how gigantic it was and resulted in a story to be told for years. My second time in was for a family meal. We went traditional with fish or steak entrees; the decadent bacon brussel sprouts on the side as well as potatoes. This meal had nothing negative to comment on.  Overpriced but when you factor in the view, worth it for sure. Now my most recent visit: I decided to really see what the menu was like away from the tried and True entrees. So, I started with Lobster Bouillon soup with lobster flan, Celery and toasted brioche. The soup was creamy, very rich and the brioche was perfect to dip in.  The flan however was like an orange, wiggly, tasteless blob... Like, crazy tasteless. Next I had the worst, over vinegary, kale salad ever. And I love balsamic vinegar, I even drizzle it on ice cream! This salad was horrible, oh, and had 3 tiny cherries.... Thanks, wouldn't want to over cherry, you might take away from the all the vinegar.     Finally, I was so excited to have the Foie Gras Torchon with duck prosciutto and fig compote. The Foie was slimy on top and congealed so it was hard to break through, I had to use a knife to cut it!  Also didn't have that amazing buttery, melt in your mouth quality; it actually didn't taste much at all. I have never seen or tasted Foie like this - I know Canada is lucky that we have free-range farms and ability to produce amazing, sinfully delicious tasting Foie. This was just disappointing and sad. Hands down the worst Foie I have ever had.  Oh, and the duck prosciutto was as hard as glass. It actually cut my gum open when I tried to chew it.   I would have had dessert but my mouth was bleeding from the duck glass.   Le repas etait horrible!

9ZS-CaCtgMnEVP2D5kQZdA.text: We dined here for a family event. My parents and I throughly enjoy the food that the server recommend. Michael our French server . The entrees and souffle were outstanding. We will surely come here again.

wy68VckotowYHNOj1ZgA-Q.text: I recommend this place to everyone!! We ate here when i was preggo 2.5 years ago and i still talk about the experience!! Get anything souflee including  appetizers!!

wjO03M-kdYNy83GOnOqzyg.text: Gorgeous view of the Bellagio, the surrounding desert mountains and the strip.  Time your reservation to catch the Bellagio fountain show and ask for a table by the window!  The night time view is beautiful as well.  We visited for a late lunch and had a lovely table by the window.  Our service was excellent.  The menue is over priced in the way most strip restaurants are, but worth the experience.  Variety of choices on the menu to try.  Wines by the glass if you like.  Wonderful lunch experience. Will definitely be back!

upDMtZrDja37wG0d0UUVUQ.text: We came here for lunch and a view of the strip.  There's not much of a weekday lunch crowd and getting a nice table with a view of the strip, Bellagio, and Caesars' Palace was easy.  I had a nice $16 burger that was cooked medium rare as requested.  Wife had baked vegetable crepes for $17.  Food was ok, but you're really paying for the view.   They also served complimentary bread puffs and a nice pistachio pudding.   Having recently gone to the Hancock's 95th floor Signature Room, I thought we might be going to the top of the Eiffel Tower, but this place is like at the 5th floor elevation.  Makes sense - they wouldn't have a whole lot of tables at the top of that skinny tower!

wpflRgl-wSv6cOI_UYjGWA.text: We celebrated an anniversary dinner here, and had a table with a perfect fountain view. The bread is to die for and consistent with authentic French bread straight from the oven, and the beef Wellington was so tender I cut it with a fork! The putter pastry was flakey and light with the right balance of crunch on the crust and soft fluffy pastry near the meat center. I am picky on steaks and do not like when they are over cooked, and this was spot on perfect as far as how it was cooked. My only reason for not rating this a five is the wait even with reservations- when there were empty tables comparable to ours. It seemed odd that several couples and groups were left to wait even though there was clearly seating available.

pTzHrxM3tJy48MUpuxAQNw.text: Terrible management staff, horrible food many other places you can get a better steak like at the homestead at Caesars, $75 corkage fee outrageous! Save your money go elsewhere. I would not recommend to anyone

0yhTclmqTi1mhh_6VNAvjA.text: Surprise dinner here for my bday. Bf kept saying the food might not be great bc a lot of reviews only talk about the nice ambiance. We had dinner at the palm in caesar's the night before and it was disappointing. The Eiffel tower made up for that.   The restaurant is romantic and nice with an awesome view of the strip and the bellagio water show. I had the lamb chops with foie gras $48. The bf had the duck breast $39. The side we chose was the potatoes croquette $10. The lamb chops was really good and tender but u only get 2. I guess I didn't pay attention to the dish description bc the foie gras is what makes it so expensive. I didn't know and tried it and then figured out what it was. So that was the only disappointment. Rather would've had extra lamb instead. Haha. The bf's duck breast was really yummy too. Nice and tender and moist. The potato croquettes were ok. I'd choose another side next time. For dessert we had the chocolate souffle $15. When they bring it out the server makes a hole and drizzles in melted chocolate which makes it extra rich. I would have preferred to do that myself. The parts not drenched in melted chocolate was less sweet and tasted very light. I would ask them to not pour it in if you prefer it not be so sweet.   In addition for my bday we got a small chocolate parfait with happy birthday on it which was very nice. And then they also bring out petit desserts to choose 1 to try. The service here is amazing. The atmosphere is awesome. There's also a photographer to take your pic with the Paris sign in the background. It's $24 for a 5x7 and they also email you the pic to have as a digital copy and add to your phone pics. Overall really like this place for a romantic dinner. It's super fancy but guys only need to wear a collared shirt. The hostesses wear long black gowns. And servers wear tuxedo like outfits bowtie and all.

3_9KKE9OqFfmHtFny5GgGQ.text: Great view of the Bellagio Fountains!! Very romantic setting. For the price you pay, the food wasn't worth it though. I will tell you that the Eiffel Tower Experience drink was the best drink I've ever had. Make a reservation no matter what time you want to go... just to be sure you don't have to wait. And ask for a window seat.

L3X3D83mWVGVemGVsuuNJg.text: Find a better location in Las Vegas to have a wonderful dining experience.   I have been to The Eiffel Tower Restaurant before and I knew that if I wanted to take my my family somewhere special to celebrate, this was the place to go.  The service and the staff is top notch and they will do anything to make you feel welcomed from the bartender to the the waiter to the wine connoisseur, they were all intensive to our needs.  I dropped my fork and by the time I picked it up, there was a new fork waiting for me.  But of course, we must discuss the menu.  after a little bit of champagne the hostess led us to a wonderful table overlooking the Belaggio Fountains.   We began with Les Amuses Bouches which led to the appetizer, Warm Foie Gras, Black Pepper Pears, Sauternes, Smoked Bacon. Delicious, wished there was more. Bread was great too.  we had the:  1) Roasted Farm Raised Chicken, Verjus, Fines Herbs - not a big fan 2)Venison Chop, Oatmeal Cake, Chanterelle Mushrooms, Huckleberry Reduction - Delicious. Loved how the venison was prepared. 3)Braised Short Ribs, Buttered Egg Noodles, Roasted Vegetables - To die fo 4) Aged New York Steak, Bone Marrow, Cabernet Reduction - a great cut and made to perfection  with Brussels Sprouts, Chestnuts, Bacon - a nice accompaniment.   For desert:   we each had our own souffle's. you didn't expect to share? Get the chocolate and Pistachio. We really liked the Petit Fours too.  Definitely come here on your next visit to Vegas.

9Kaxf7YPOrFRYBitGq6-9A.text: Absolutely one of my favorite French cuisine in Las Vegas. The atmosphere & view of the strip is stunning! The food is great & the staff were wonderful. We ordered the escargot & scallops for an appetizer. Main entrees was lamb chops & duck breast accompanied by gratin & asparagus. For desserts we had the pistachio & chocolate Souffle oh my oh my words can't describe how delicious & soft it was... It melted right in your mouth & it was just amazing . I would definitely come back here again!.

0ehTbFF8M1RCargtNcvquw.text: Great experience from the start. The staff were helpful and very friendly, Alix.B is the best. She made sure we had a exceptional first experience. I would highly recommend this place to everyone I know. The view was a plus, loved every moment.

D3CTww1v3KXw3sAyoQlNAA.text: There was a lot of hype around dining at this Vegas strip restaurant.  Our reservation was for a late dinner at 10:30.  We were seated at a window seat facing the strip and found the view to be cool, but very cramped and I'm a small gal.  Not much elbow room between each table.  The wait staff made us feel very rushed and seemed put out when we asked for a 2nd piece of bread.  The filet I ordered didn't have much flavor and was just marginal compared to other restaurants in Vegas.  All in all the experience was ok, just not outstanding in my opinion.

fmSNDRuz8meebf1HzwapTg.text: The environment is great: great view, beautiful restaurant, good tasting food. The char broiled fillet would have been a 10 if it wasn't so burnt on the outside. They could have left it sitting in some of it's juices for 56 dollars.  For the amount I paid for the fillet, chicken, and side of potatoes ($128 including tip), I expected better service from my waiter. His description of the fillet when I asked about how it comes, "It's literally a piece of meat on a plate", didn't sound very appetizing. When he asked if I wanted a side of potatoes, he never even told me how they would come. (They ended up being potatoes au gratin) Again, the fillet was burnt on the outside which didn't make me too happy.  For that kind of money, I want excellent service.

k8E3C7jzLDYURwTSSXY0GQ.text: My family and I celebrated our son's birthday on March 8th.  My wife ordered a birthday cake from a local bakery that was delivered to the restaurant for the occasion.  The restaurant approved the delivery and she was told there would be a $15 cutting fee.  At the conclusion of the meal i was provided the bill which indeed included a $15 cutting fee...at $15 per person so $75 to cut 5 pieces of cake.  Outrageous.  When I questioned the charge I was told by David, the manager, the cutting fee was explained to my wife when she made the reservation (first lie) and then was explained a second time when we checked in (second lie).  His solution was he would remind his staff to explain the cutting fee is per person.  Not what I would have expected after two two lies and a $500 meal.

4zYeqXq746ZzllooncdpBw.text: My second time dining here and it was just as good as I remember.  My most recent trip we had brunch and it was great. Had a tasty cocktail at the bar while we waited to be seated.  We had 2 different foie gras dishes both excellent. But my favorite was the brulee stuffed French toast....wow so so good. And of course our server was friendly and attentive.    But I'd really like to mention our first trip there that was for dinner years ago.  It was me and my wife's first trip to Vegas together. I decided on Eiffel because I thought it would be romantic.....and it is by far one of the most romantic restaurants in Las Vegas with a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains across the street.  Food and service was outstanding.  I still remember the duck (two ways) dish I had....  haven't had a better duck dish to this day.    Our experience there was so amazing that it started our culinary romance with Las Vegas. It inspired us to venture out and try a new restaurant every time we returned. So thank you chefs and staff at the Eiffel Tower!     Their are so many great restaurants in this town and I think the big celebrity chef ones get the most attention.  But do yourself a favor and check out the Eiffel Tower for brunch, lunch or dinner!    We promise not to wait so long to return!

OdekhKaXuP3Q-Y_EHlISQw.text: Beautiful place to have dinner but wait time can take 1-1.5 hours especially if you want a window view.   They gave us a delicious yellow beet soup appetizer that was phenomenal!   The star of the show: Filet Mignon with foie gras, wild mushroom, and the amazing dessert Nutella and Pistachio souffle.   We also ordered the warm lobster appetizer, Alaskan wild cod with cauliflower cous cous, slow roasted Atlantic salmon and baked herb crepe. These were okay and I probably wouldn't order it again.   It's pricey but I would definitely come back!

nGBqghLlmMlNSTFaUz7R5A.text: We made reservations for my birthday here and it went so smooth. I highly recommend making reservations ahead of time if you plan on coming here. The restaurant has its own entrance to the tower. Now I have to admit, you probably so much more for the view itself here. We were sat at the "back end" of the restaurant but I thought the views were just as great here. We started off with the auld fashioned. The french take on old fashioned. My wife ordered a paris affair. Really satisfying drink. We ordered the King steal filet, medium; came out more well done, so I was like ok about it. We tried the rack of lamb, bomb! Ordered a side of the mashed potatoes, so creamy. Our server was amazing, I forgot to get his name. Nice long beard.   Amazing drinks, 5 star service all around. The food itself was just as good, our server was great. It's really pricey but like I said you pay for the views and experience. Recommend it if you want a view to die for and great service. I will return at a future date.

7CZA7tp-WNhi8ovtHbtCeg.text: Amazing dinner! We did the tasting menu and was worth every penny in our opinion. Amazing views and delicious food! Will def come back again!

PmY99i02qjde2PjVz3Fr4w.text: Bonjour Paris without the flight. This is by far the most elegant, upscale dining experience in Las Vegas. I came here in mid April on a work event trip and I am super fortunate to experience this treat. You are truly paying for the memory, from the moment you ride the private elevator up the tower, when the door opens and you arrive into the kitchen, are greeted right away and escorted to the gracious hostess who has been expecting your arrival. Most of the tables against the windows are reserved for couples facing the views of the Bellagio water fountains, the strip, and the sunset skies. If it is a special event, birthday, proposal, or anniversary they have the very popular reserved corner window table for an extra fee and special menu with personal photographer package. The larger tables and group table seating are still spectacular with beautiful views.   The service is magnificent. Our bread server, Ruben was awesome and Heather our server was marvelous. Never did we have to flag them down for something however at the same time left us alone and the timing was spot on. They also have a floating photographer lady who offers to take photos of your party then simply adds it to your bill and the photos are uploaded to your phone right away.   The menu was not extensive and was right to the point. They gave us complimentary avocado soup, a choice of 4 breads with butter (you can have more than one), and were offered water. I began with a glass Pinot Grigio Terlato which was perfection. For starters, I chose the Non-Traditional Caesar Salad with warm anchovies, capers with a Garlic Vinaigrette which surprisingly was larger than I expected. I also tried the Slow Braised Smoked Pork Belly that was divine. When we first arrived, a lady was leaving and said we needed to try their escargot, "its to die for", so I ordered the escargot, however, it was an off menu item for dinner and the kitchen agreed to make it for us. It blew my expectations away-this was probably the best escargot I have ever had. It is very rich and full of flavor in a savory sauce, not to be missed. For the main entree, this is a place where you have to order everything separately, it does not come on one plate. I was in the mood for The Queen Broiled Beef Tenderloin Filet Mignon (cooked medium) accompanied by the Brown Butter Roasted Asparagus and the Olive Oil Mashed Potatoes. The flavors are heavenly and everything was plated so alluring. The other appetizers and entrees looked amazing as well.   Save room for dessert they say, it will be amazing they say, try the souffle they say. The Souffle au Grand Marnier was the winner for me. Every spoon full was exquisite. Finally, finished with a glass of Port. This was definitely the icing on the cake.   The lady's room was lovely, with a powder room, extra seating to touch up your makeup, relax, and there was a sweet restroom attendant with all the goodies in case you forgot something. As you leave, there is a glass case with items you can purchase that say Eiffel Tower on them. Overall, I had a wonderful experience here. It's nice to know you do not have to just come to dinner, you can also dine here for a casual lunch, or just sit at their beautiful bar area, anytime you chose, you will not be disappointed.

hPfRLbaPwCUuYYgxGH0LGA.text: Came in for my bday dinner. It was a Sunday Evening no reservation & we took a seat at the bar while enjoying the panoramic view of the world from Paris. (Oops i meant the Vegas strip)   Our server was humorous & attentive. What more could we ask for? Started off w/ Brut & were served French & multigrain bread. Both great.   We all ordered the Queen (petite) Filet as it was a late dinner. I had mine medium rare and paired it with the Lemon butter. It was a tad over cooked but didn't feel like sending it back especially being my bday our itinerary was full. It was still enjoyable.  Sides:  Brussel Sprouts: crispy  Asparagus: good  Classic Gratin Potatoes: tasty crisp and smooth v delicious & rich.  Mashed potatoes: I didn't particularly enjoy

Et-08tRIYm8MjzB6IrNoMA.text: One of our finest dining experiences ever.  You know when you order a simple dish like chicken and the skin tastes like it was cooked by Chef Joho, your in for a treat!  We make a reservation 2 weeks before my wife's birthday. We also did a walk up the day before to check on our reservation and to make sure we had a window seat. They told us all reservations made for 430 is guaranteed a window seat. We expected a small crowd at 430 and low and behold, it's a packed house already!!   We were the 3rd/4th couple seated and we got a prime seat overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  My wife got their signature Eiffel Affair Tower drink and I had a couple of their margaritas. The bartender makes some mean drinks.   My wife saw the lobster in some previous yelp reviews and just had to have it.  Baked 1 1/2 Pound Maine Lobster, Herb Crust, Spinach Florentine It's 79 dollars and worth every penny. She said hands down the best lobster she's had in Vegas. The presentation was awesome. She didnt want to eat it, just take photos of it :)  I heard the chicken was really good and tried they. I normally go for the steak but Opted for the chicken this time out.  Half Roasted Free Range Chicken Two Ways, Wild Rice, Root Vegetables The skin, I know we are talking about the skin here but it was to die for. Not sure how they cook it but it was perfect. The only complaint is that it was slightly salty. The rest of the chicken was perfect!  For the sides we got the Gratinee Creamed Spinach and Mushroom Classic Potato Gratin  Both were delicious and a wonderful compliment to our dinners.   For Dessert we had the White Chocolate Banana Elysee and wow this thing is a work of art! Not only did it look good but it tasted good as well!  We also go the photo combo which cost $40.00 this included digital prints and a photo in an album. It was very nice. They charge it to your bill.  Our wonderful experience cost just over $300.00. I highly recomend it. My total reward points paid for the entire meal!

My husband got the aged New York  steak with classic potato gratin he enjoyed every bite of it. Overall, it was an amazing experienced.

r_POQuPxu_oowvkm1wvdNw.text: Amazing... not sure what else I could possibly say to describe this restaurant. The atmosphere and view...Amazing. The waiter Gary...Amazing. The food OMG THE FOOD! Amazing. 14 of us. 9 of us had Beef Wellington with Snap peas and potato gratin. 3 people had filet mignon, 2 salmon and one bone in ribeye. The beef Wellington was delicious and the snap peas were crazy good. Everything about this place was spot on. Attendants in the rest room, you exit elevator into the kitchen. Pretty cool. 082CMWYMutjOe8oJr0c64g.text: To get to the restaurant you take an elevator that is located towards the front of the casino floor. It opens up into a beautiful kitchen that you walk buy on the way to the beautiful dining area with spectacular views of the city.   We went for lunch and were not disappointed. They started us with a little taste of a cold parsnip puree soup topped with fried sage. Deciduous! Two of us had the BLT Tower & the other dish ordered was a burger with blue cheese. The BLT was excellent. It was made with bacon bread! It was basically 2 sandwiches cut in half & stacked on top of each other. I'd split it with someone the next time. The burger was huge too & equally delicious. To finish off the meal they brought out little tastes of candy to try. Perfect ending!

w-0Qtp-LsqF112oN0PqF2Q.text: I was expecting this place to be very touristy, so I'm shocked to come away feeling it is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. In fact, I enjoyed it more that Jules Verne in the real Eiffel Tower!  The room is beautiful, and the view of the Strip and the Bellagio fountain can't be beat. The atmosphere is sophisticated without being stuck up.   The lunch menu offers a nice assortment of French-inspired cuisine focusing on the lighter side. I loved the torchon appetizer and my Ocean Seafood Salad (btw, what other kind of seafood is there?)  The frozen souffle was an interesting dessert. Try ordering a glass of Amaro and pouring into the ice cream at the bottom--delicious!  The wine list is decent, and the prices normal for the Strip.  This is one of the few Vegas restaurants I think is worth a return visit, because it is about more than just the novelty of the experience.

Y0nyaa78BsFnkG6h3EWctA.text: Was I surprised? You bet.  I don't like to have too high expectations when it comes to places that already have good Yelp reviews because I have experienced not so great food that does not reflect the stars.  I LOVED THIS RESTAURANT.   If you follow me you know that I have been to many places in Las Vegas and Eiffel Tower instantly shoot up to the top of my list of high end dining places.   The orders:   1) Seared Scallops $26 - Two chunky sweet scallops. They were good with a great sear on them. They came quickly and were just a tad warm. The onions were not great, too chewy and mostly cold, so I only ate the scallops.   2) Muscovy Duck Breast $49 - DIOS MIO. This dish probably changed duck for me forever. I think only half the time I order duck it is good. Eiffel made this dish the gold standard in duck. The breast was juicy, tender and medium rare. The skin was crispy with just the right amount of fat in between. Each bite went amazing with the blood orange sauce. Everyone at the table thought the same. A MUST ORDER.  3) Individual Eiffel Tower Beef Wellington $68 - HANDS DOWN the most incredible and most perfect Wellington ever. Gordon Ramsay's does not hold a candle to this one (I tried the one at Hell's Kitchen and GR Steak). Beyond tender, beyond flavorful beef medallion with simply the most skilled made puff pastry ever seen. Non mushy, crispy and delicious. Ridiculous.   4) Baked 1 1/2 pound Maine Lobster $79 - Really good lobster, a bit too much spinach florentine but good lobster. IN a few words, Treat yo sef.   5) Classic Potato Gratin - Yes. The way it should be. Well seasoned (usually the come too salty but not this one). In a cast iron skilled, hot and creamy with potatoes that hold their shape. Perfect.   6) We also ordered in advance 2 SOUFFLES! Chocolate and pistachio. Of the two, the chocolate was the tastiest one. Both incredibly delicate, perfect for sharing. They will not make you feel heavy or otherwise. A must order as well.   Service was very good. The only thing I did not like was the bread service where they bring a big basket of bread and they ask you which one you want. Obviously, I want them all! So I had to ask the wait staff for the bread man to come by again. The breads were fresh but not hot. That would be my only complaint.   Will definitely recommend this over most of the other fancy restaurants for a special occasion. Highly recommended to make reservations (will need a credit card to hold it, and they charge $50 per person who doesn't show up which is a bit ridiculous)

gpNxmEmUNYcF1LpEDx7t6w.text: Eiffel Tower restaurant is always such a gem!  My parents took me here when I was young and I decided to visit again with my husband. I made a reservation for 4:30pm online as that will guarantee us a window seat. We got seated in front of the Bellagio fountains and it was a beautiful sight!  Food and service was impeccable.  We got their tasting menu and loved the foie gras.  If you feel like splurging, tasting caviar here gives you an elaborate experience as it comes with gold spoons and all the fancy little toppings and bread.  We loved our dinner and it was a great night to remember.  Highly recommend to anyone that wants a romantic dinner date!

KTiIh5VEYl3I2zoHxRN-6Q.text: We had a pretty amazing dinner here for Thanksgiving. At first they seated us way at the back of the restaurant, with no view of the strip, but we asked for a different table and got moved to a prime spot, very close to the windows overlooking the strip! With a 4:30pm reservation, we also got a beautiful view of the sunset behind the strip.   FYI most of the tables right AT the windows are two tops. There are a couple of four tops, but you can't 'reserve' those (we tried. Plus we had a stroller, so we knew that would be hard). It's hard to get a photo right at the window with a view of the strip, so if you see any that are empty, take advantage of the chance to snap a few pictures!  I also love that right when you get off the elevator, you get a full view of the kitchen (no window or anything!). It is spotless and everyone works together like a well-oiled machine.   RESERVATIONS: Made about a week in advance, in person. My mom was walking through the Paris Casino and randomly was asked if she'd like a tour of the Eiffel Tower Restaurant (normally you need to pay if you're not dining there). She was so impressed that she made our Thanksgiving reservation there after the tour!  THE SERVICE: Fantastic. Our server (Konstant, I believe, based on our receipt) was incredibly professional and at the same time warm and friendly. He chatted with us but didn't linger, and was very patient with us and gave great recommendations.   THE COST: My main reason for not giving this restaurant 5 stars - it is very expensive! Dinner for four, plus a $140 bottle of wine, came to $600 total including tax/tip.   MUST-HAVES: Sauteed Foie Gras (appetizer), Rack of Lamb, Souffle (many flavors available - I liked my pistachio!).   THE FOOD:  AMUSE BOUCHE * Pureed Turnip with bacon and caramelized turnip - 3.5 stars Interesting, a nice way to start the meal!  COCKTAILS * Pomegranate Cocktail - 2 stars Our server recommended this when I asked for something light and refreshing. I found this to be too strong and not very complex in flavor. I sent this back, which was absolutely no issue.  APPETIZERS * Sauteed Foie Gras ($29) - 5 stars I've never had sauteed foie (only the torchon/terrine style), and apparently this is the more traditional way of serving it. I took one bite and it was like heaven in my mouth! It seemed to just melt away into a fantastic plethora of flavors. It is a bit much, quite intense and heavy, so if you don't love foie, this may not be for you!  MEATS/FOWL * Roasted Rack of Lamb ($64) - 5 stars Delicious, perfectly seasoned, light pink in the middle, tender meat, slightly charred in just the right places. Just super pricey!  * Muscovy Duck Breast ($49) - 4 stars Very good, and the blood orange sauce was great with this! Duck was a little tougher than I would have preferred.  DESSERT * Souffle ($16) - 4.5 stars Wonderful - heavenly soft, spongy cake. Fantastic with the sauce poured in. We tried pistachio and pumpkin, I liked the pistachio slightly more!   * Cappuccino - 3 stars Lots of good foam, but the coffee was just ok underneath.   THANKSGIVING MENU ($79pp) * First Course: Butternut Squash Soup - 3.5 stars My mom loved this, but I thought it was just fine. A little light on flavor, but a nice thick texture.  * Main Course: Turkey - 2.5 stars They did a nice job incorporating all the Thanksgiving classics into one plate, but it just wasn't up to par for such an otherwise fantastic restaurant. The turkey, potato, brussel sprouts, cranberry all were homemade-level quality.  * Dessert Course: Pecan Pie - 3.5 stars Good, a classic!

fVk7NeEX0chnD9WeunQoZw.text: After dining at the real Eiffel Tower in Paris, we decided to go here for thanksgiving this year. We had been one other time a few years ago so it was long overdue that we dine here again.   The elevator to the restaurant is in the middle of the Paris and it's lit up in red so it's not hard to find. The elevator opens right up to the kitchen of the restaurant where you're greeted and brought to the front to check in. We arrived about 25 minutes before our reservation time but were still able to get seated immediately. I requested a window but we didn't get one. The place was pretty full and it was thanksgiving so it's understandable.   The view overlooks the Bellagio Fountains and is so pleasant. Our waitress was so welcoming and helpful. We were able to choose from the regular menu or the special thanksgiving menu. They also have a children's menu which I wish I had known beforehand. Then my daughter wouldn't have enjoyed Jack In the Box prior to our meal. Instead of the children's menu, she happily filled up on baguettes and a Shirley temple.   We order from the special thanksgiving menu and chose the butternut squash soup with duck confit. It was so tasty and filling! Next, our main meal came out. Dark and light meat turkey with gratin potatoes, brussel sprouts, braised cabbage, chestnut stuffing and cranberry compote. Every bit of it was amazing but my favorite thing was the stuffing. It was so perfect and not mushy. It actually had chunks of veggies in it, yummy! Lastly, we finished with dessert and both chose the pumpkin Souffle with southern comfort creme anglaise. It was the perfect end to an amazing thanksgiving. The best part was I didn't have to cook or do dishes.   I really like Eiffel Tower Restaurant and it's very good no matter what meal you get. Best view for sure and attentive staff.

RBv9_mBOtNoW-rZ82l8c8w.text: One of the things that everyone has to do when coming to Vegas is go on a romantic dinner. The main attraction to this restaurant is the view, and there is a table for two all along the window, so you will get an awesome view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip. There are bigger tables throughout the restaurant, and still has the view of the strip. This is located at the Paris Hotel, across from the Bellagio. The entrance for the restaurant is in the casino lobby, towards the front of the entrance. There will be a hostess on the casino floor where she will direct you to the elevator that will lead you to the restaurant.   We got a table against the window with a great view of the strip. The service was great, and the complimentary bread is amazing. After you order your food, they will serve you fresh bread. They do give one slice at a time, so stack up when they do come by! The French bread was so fresh, and I was already trying to think on how I can take it on the airline back with me.   Rossini Style Filet Mignon, Foie Gras, Truffle Sauce: It was a decent sized filet mignon, with a good slice of foie gras. I have been waiting for this dish since they have banned Foie Gras in Los Angeles. I loved the filet mignon, and the foie gras does go great with it. The entire dish was cooked to perfection and the salty fat from the foie gras with the thick meaty filet. The one thing I was amazed on was the steak because the plate wasn't covered in the juices or blood while I was eating.   Broiled 22oz Bone in Rib eye, Roasted Bone Marrow: The rib eye was a great size for those who are super hungry. It was seared with the bone marrow on top. The Bone Marrow reminded me of the restaurant in LA that I never tried but everyone is raving about. I did learn that I do not like bone narrow at all. The rib eye was one of the best I ever had.   Mashed Potato: We both ordered this as our side. It was light, and was amazingly smooth. I never had such a smooth creamy mash potato before. The one thing I do recommend is the sides are big enough to share for two. So order something else so you can share.   Classic souffle: I could not decide which flavor I wanted, so I had our waiter decide. Plus, I never had souffle before so I figure I would let someone who had it before decide. If you want the souffle, then they recommend that you order as your ordering your food since it does take about 30 minutes. They have variety of flavors from classic, pistachio, chocolate, and grand mariner.   There are two things I have learned from my experience with this restaurant. One is that the main dishes seem to have the fatty to the meat ratio. From my steak with the foie gras, and the rib eye with the bone marrow. The second thing is the price. We did not order any wine, alcohol, or appetizers, and still paid about 300. This is a pricey place, but it is an experience you need to try at least once and the quality is undenialble. It is well known for being a romantic place for a reason. Also, if you pay a fee, which is about 60 I believe, they will give you a dozen roses. So there are tons of packages you can add on to the experience of romance. Also, make sure you make reservations in advance because it does fill up quickly.

n6wVgxsldnp27nMauyI02w.text: For New Year's Eve we choose this restaurant to celebrate the 2019.  We did our reservation months ahead because we wanted to see the firework show and the experience of this place.  The service is beyond amazing, every single person that works there is very attentive and friendly.  When the food came we were expecting something beyond.  We didn't expected the food came in very small portions (bite size) and even the flavor was really really good I wasn't just impressed.  My favorite time was the Mediterranean Loup and my less favorite was the Foie Grass.  The environment is romantic but also you can go with friends and family.  I liked that our waitress explained every single meal we had just to make sure we were going to enjoy it.  Paying almost 500 dlls for this dinner don't think we will do it again because despite the view we didn't get to see the fireworks.

Nk3NULQK9sP7UJiQx1eBnA.text: Made reservations for 8:30pm. Arrived early so was asked to enjoy the bar while they got our table ready. We brought our little one with us as we were celebrating something special. Had my timer on to see how long we would wait as it was packed & yet we had reservations.   8:30 hits - we get called. VERY impressed. We were greeted by David right away on our table as we sat. Again, impressive.   Food :  Appetizer - i could skip this. They offered bread so could save you some $$$  Main course -  Rib eye w the bone marrow - cooked perfectly as requested. Husband loved it.  Lamb - cooked the way i liked it. 4 pcs so just decent size. Kids meal salmon - can i just say i LOVED the fact that they have kids meal? Yes we want an upscale dinner but no we wont leave our child home and i LOVE that they do accommodate children.  Chocolate souffle - MUST HAVE. As u all know must oder ahead of time as it takes a while.  Strawberry souffle - my husband wasn't fond of them. Said too sweet (and he has a sweet tooth) will slop next time Complimentary : Ice cream for our little one Anniversary dessert - husband loved it didn't even share. Think it was chocolate mouse   Highly recommend this place. Will def be back. Perfect service from start to end.

aUkqcv3oQxc9FQxXnKR9Rw.text: I came to the restaurant as part of a Century 21 convention and awards ceremony for the first time recently.  I was amazed at the level of service particularly from a gentleman named Rodney Lennon.  He took the extra time to provide a True level of care and service and I look forward to returning with friends and family in the future.

j08Emn_0ec4Ers3M-yFb1g.text: Best Experience of Las Vegas...  The view! Bellagio's Fountain = breathtaking...  The food... Amazingly good, worth the price tag. Apps- cold spaghettini salad with shrimp - 5 stars Entree- ribeye rare... perfect fat marbling, juicy and melt like butter. Side- balsamic glazed wild mushrooms Side- roasted garlic potatoes puree - best mashed potatoes EVER  Service was great as expected...  Elevator Up! Enjoy the view of the Vegas Strip...

EhtY6G0L1EZL9zw6qeFrfw.text: I've been here three times now and still get excited every time.  Twice with just me and my fiance, at night, when it's nice and romantic (prices are higher of course and you have a full waiting staff which can be overdone) and once at lunch with my parents and fiance (much more relaxed during the day.  The food is delicious.  I've had two chicken dishes for dinner and one blt for lunch.  Food and experience is definitely worth the splurge.

vOvsvRXiHTSkXv_UZxfBqA.text: I love Paris, I also love the Eiffel Tower- so when I was in Vegas for the first time and the Family I was with needed an idea for dinner- I suggested reservations at The Eiffel Tower Restaurant.   While a bit pricey, it is definitely worth it. The view we had was AMAZING (Belliagio light show allll night), the food was good, and ambiance *magical*.  I feel it was perfect for the group we had, and probably also for couples, I wouldn't come here with a bunch of Girlfriends though.

MXJX3Pmm7wZomSV_w95m6Q.text: This was our first time here. We decided on lunch and oh-la-la, we didn't go wrong!! Our waiter, Todd Smith, was just OVER THE TOP! SO, SO attentive and friendly. His suggestions on choices were right on - creamy onion soup, lamb burger & parmesan crusted chicken. Oh, and let's not for get the small little rolls they serve you before all the food comes - really, really good but those can fill ya up pretty quick, so be careful. And the huge creme brulee was delish...  Hope to go back again someday - thanks Todd! (Thanks to your back-up help/service too - everyone was just SO pleasant)

idA3zjJJlmMz72piQ2vQKQ.text: Surprised my husband with dinner here for his birthday.  Fabulous view of the Las Vegas strip.  We lucked out and caught the only Bellagio fountain show of the evening - due to high winds.    The only thing that bugged me was that in this classy restaurant, there are still those people who don't even try to dress up a little.  Ripped jeans and a tank top?  Come on.  Don't mind me - that's just a pet peeve of mine.  Dinner was excellent.  Any time there's escargot on the menu, you know it will end up in front of me.  YUM!  Dinner consisted of steak for both of us.  Filet Mignon for me, bone in rib eye for him.  Both were cooked to perfection and topped with potato gratin and sauteed mushrooms.  We were stuffed, but no birthday is complete without dessert.  Somehow we managed to down a Grand Marnier souffle and the apple strudel before rolling ourselves to the casino.

rh8VeWudKBTlCAoTq2N66w.text: i have not enjoyed spending so much money on food since i was actually in Paris. The views were beautiful and the food was divine. It really would have been a romantic setting, but I went with my best friend, so we had lots of fun creating dialog for the surrounding tables. We ate at 8:00pm and were starving! Our waiter was a really hilarious gay guy who was totally a queen. At first he was really calm and reserved but when we started cracking jokes with him, he let loose!  It's haute cuisine, so do not expect big portions. You eat there for the experience and the flavor. Our server told us that the Blue Cheese Souffle was a good started and wow, he was right. Its a tiny little thing, perfect for sharing and it was gooey and soooo good with the little salad that was served with it. It was gone in just a few bites.  We both ordered Filet Mignon, but since they serve it two different ways, we each ordered one version and sampled both. I got the red wine sauce and she got the lemon butter. I really can't tell you which is better. They were both wonderful. They both made me close my eyes and shutter. I ordered Asparagus and Gratin Potatoes also and my friend tried the Pommes Dauphines which are fried balls of potato puff. very interesting.   Even though we had absolutely phenomenal food, we were hungry about an hour later and ended up driving through Sonic on our way to the Palm's.

Y2-d6Q11NFJ-Qcrficplsg.text: I must say that my experience was quite disappointing.  When I made the reservation I was told that the dress code was "smart casual." I wore a cocktail dress and my hubby a suit.  When we arrived we noticed other patrons in jeans, t-shirts and flip flops.  I was hoping for a more romantic, intimate evening, however, that was not the atmosphere at all.  The tables are to close together, and the service wasn't all that great.  The food was not bad, not out of this world either.  I will not be returning.

Qtomyw0tiRgyk6osy1fIxw.text: Restaurant has a great view of the strip and would surely go there for the views but not the food.  If you want good French food seek elsewhere but don't miss out on the views here and the souffle

qzVAtbmM3M5Oz0ZiqcKERA.text: We celebrated my husband's birthday on Friday night and the staff went out of their way to seat us at a table with an amazing view of the fountains.  The food, drinks, & service were excellent.  What a great choice!  Truly a memorable night.  We will be back again to celebrate.

YCy6a5TW6_wXbVjvmzQaaQ.text: We had a fantastic tasting menu dinner experience with matching wine.  One of the more costly meals in my lifetime but worth the price paid.  At the end of the second course, we felt the dinner was moving along too quickly.  I asked the waiter to slow down the pace, and he obliged so we could spend plenty of time taking in the Bellagio fountains at sunset, watching the casinos light up as we stared transfixed at the beauty of Las Vegas and the beauty of each other, quietly holding hands under the table, engaging in fun conversation about us, each other, life, and so many things.    Sometimes a dining experience is positive because the food is excellent (as was the case with the Lamb - wow), but what I strongly recall as I compose this review  a week later is how the meal facilitated a romantic interlude.  It also facilitated a marriage proposal at the table next to us.  I recommend this place even more so for those who are in love or want to fall in love.

MMlUn-N_MU-6R9b50-Kq7Q.text: Now *this* is more like it. Ultra spendy? You bet. But TOTALLY worth it.   I loved everything about this place, and was so, so, so glad we decided to splurge here on our last night in Vegas. With no Res, we came up the elevator, gave our names and only had to wait about 15 minutes at the bar before we had a seat. The bartender was hilarious & sweet, and the hostess carried our wine over and seated us in a large, plush booth.   The view = incredible. This place is mid-way up the faux Eiffel Tower, facing the Bellagio - so we got to see the water show more than a few times while we ate.   The food = even more incredible. We started off with the Blue Cheese Souffle Pudding, Walnut Pecan Petite Salad. Holy god, that was good. For entrees, we had the Aged New York Steak, Braised Celery Heart, Bone Marrow, Cabernet Reduction and the Filet of Sea Bass, Fingerlings, Double Smoked Bacon, Crispy Potato, Petit Mache. Plus, we shared the Potato Gratin. It was all AMAZING. And they aren't messin' around with the portions. Everything was as filling as it was delicious.   To finish off, the special Eiffel Tower Souffles in Chocolate and Raspberry. They take 30 minutes to make, so we had the foresight to order them before our meal and they were just perfect. The waiter does this fancypants thing where he pours the cream and chocolate into them at your table and they get all big & fluffy. mmm. MMMM.   The topper: our *very* French waiter was great! Constantly checked up on us, made funny jokes, and didn't even blink when I spilled water all over the table. In fact, he moved us to another!   All in all - just the best. I would for sure splurge to go here again. It was romantic and beautiful and I left completely satisfied.

fC4UvH2HpP6HRo6ZaVAsGQ.text: Ambiance = 5/5 Food 3/5  My group and I got seats right next to the window that oversaw the Bellagio Hotel. Amazing view! The servers all wore 3-piece suits which was very classy.  The food was pricey and not very good. I think of it as us paying for the view. I shared a steak and lobster, which were both...just okay. The only thing that is really worth mentioning is their chocolate souffle - it was the best souffle I've had to this day.   I would go back for the view and the dessert. :)

xubAOAjJL4dDlDQB-YEVWQ.text: My husband and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary with our kids and therefore decided to give this place a try given the high ratings. I must say I was really disappointed. I gave 2 stars just for the views and for the amazingly delicious souffle, which by the way cost $15 each. I was not impressed by the phone manner of the person taking the reservation or the front hostesses. For a restaurant of this caliber, I would expect more courteous attitude. What I don't get is that I called 45 minutes before my dinner reservation time to see if I can move it up 1/2 hour. What I get in response is that they cannot change my reservation but I am welcome to arrive earlier to see if they would sit me. What kind of response is that? You either tell me that no tables were available or change my time. Upscale restaurants would not let their patrons wait if they have a reservation. We ended up arriving 10 minutes earlier, and even though I see a lot of empty tables, the hostess asked us to step aside and said we were early and that they would sit us at exactly 7pm. I was a bit turned off already. I was even more disappointed when even after both reservation taker and the waiter asked if we were celebrating any special occasion and we told them about our anniversary, nothing happened. Most restaurants would do something special with our desserts, but not this one. As for the food, the steak was ok but not worth $59. The lamb chops was good, but the Dover Sole was disappointing. It was pretty hard as I couldn't eat it without cutting it with a knife. At $69, I would expect better. I had it switched to salmon. It was better, but nothing to write home about. The strangest thing is the kids menu. I specifically asked and was told at reservation that there is a kids menu. When we sat down, there was none. I asked the waiter and at first he said that the kind of upscale restaurant that they are they don't really recommend the kids menu. I pressed further and he said the portion is too small for older kids, just for little ones under 5. My kids are 9 and 5. He cannot honestly expect me to order an adult entree for my 5-year-old! I ended up ordering pasta for my little one and the portion was just fine! With the kind of money we spent on this dinner, I could've easily gone to other restaurants in the area that offer better food and service. I just don't get the high ratings from other Yelpers.

IwcBCBOWpN4UXfgDbLS0NQ.text: We went here for our Honeymoon, it was our one fancy meal to celebrate!  We made reservations on OpenTable and when we got there, we told them we had just got married. They gave us the best seat in the whole restaurant--a table that overlooked the Bellagio Fountains. The ambiance and food are absolutely perfect. The waiters were also very knowledgeable without being too pushy. It was the priciest dinner we've ever had in our entire lives, but it was worth every penny.

ooFRxW-OopKqBesh-niiPw.text: Spectacular view of Vegas Strip, Food and Service 5 Star!

QCsYvniey495UQgROOUCrw.text: My wife and I went here for our anniversary in December and we were very pleased with the food and service. I made a reservation early and had asked for a table with a view and they fulfilled that request. They even brought out a little appetizer/dessert because they knew it was a special occasion.  I ordered roast chicken, my wife ordered the duck. My chicken was great, and according to my wife she thought her duck was great also. It is a little pricey but considering the cost of other restaurants like this i believe its comparable. Our bill was less than 100 for two entrees, two desserts and drinks.  The view is why you go here, it was great the Bellagio water show was going on at the time it made for a very fun experience overlooking the strip.

0j5Lfe5h4oInqhQAw0kAaA.text: I always have trepidations whenever I eat at a restaurant whose main attraction is that its inside a major attraction at altitude.  It seems that half the value of the meal is on the view (in this case, the Bellagio water show), and it's at the expense of the service or the food.  I was delightfully not disappointed on either count by the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.  Highlight of the evening was our indulgence in a delightful chocolate souflee (order at the beginning of the meal, 30 minutes to prepare).  The wine list is probably too large for your average tourist to comprehend, but our waiter was patient as a trained dog in helping my godmother choose a wine from the list in the dim light.  Their bar also knows how to make a fantastic sidecar with bourbon.  Got me hopped enough to play a spin of roulette (Won $10 on black).  Service was a bit slow in mid-meal, but I give our server high marks in geniality.

ABEYvZfYEk_zjCwbjDPzHA.text: Simply delicious.    I've been to quite a few steakhouse restaurants and this was by far beyond my expectations.    Ambiance:  I would recommend making your reservations between 6-8pm...that way you can enjoy the sunset and the water show with the proper lighting.  We snagged a seat around 7pm right next to the window and were able to enjoy both.  Our waiter, a portly man with a great sense of humor and a "FURANCH" accent, was very pleasant and helped set the mood for a night of french cuisine.  Grub:  The steak was "melt in your mouth" delicious.  If you go with the filet mignon- medium rare, there is no going wrong.  MMm...we still talk about that steak to this day.  The appetizers left a little more to be desired...we ordered the duck patte.  This was probably not the best choice considering the price.  It was...an acquired taste... one that probably should not have cost so much to be acquired.    Service:  At the end of the night, we were offered dessert and found ourselves too full to order.  However, the waiter returned anyways with a plate of delicious sugar cookies on the house!  That alone deserves a full star.  =)  Price:  Our bill came out to about $195 that night including tip but well worth it in my opinion.  I think on the next shot, we might pass on the appetizers and shoot for the filet mignon only.    All in all:   simply delicious!!!

nvkrWsqrJElOyGF_e4kgfw.text: Had a wonderful evening meal here. Our waiter (Tom) checked in just often enough to be attentive without being disruptive. He made some suggestions that we accepted and we were quite pleased. Mrs Foodie had the lamb and it was prepared to her request (although she detected a hint of gaminess - but not throughout the entire portion.) I enjoyed the Beef Wellington - flaky crust and tender, flavorful beef. Sides of asparagus and potatoes au gratin were tasty as well.  Dessert was very tasty.  Coupled with a view of the fountains, this was definitely an enjoyable dining experience. While not something we'd do on a repetitive basis, we have no qualms assigning 5 stars.

OZq12dzYiLTf9CJ6u9Qekg.text: The food was delicious....well worth the money....I ordered the beef Wellington and it was to die for!!!! The service was friendly and on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Souffle.....chocolate....super fluffy and light and delicious
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington...sooooooo amazing

VGgXyeci8vM92NGeImIKNg.text: It was the one expensive dinner for my husband and me while in Las Vegas. We were late for our reservation because of traffic. I called to let them know and they still held our window table view of the fountain show. We both had the venison and it was delicious (although a small portion.) The service was exceptional. I would go again.

_x3bXS6lY28gq2BtF8_0Ew.text: This restaurant had good food, but excellent service and view. My husband and I came here for our wedding anniversary and we're not disappointed. :) We made a 4:30pm reservation, so we could be guaranteed a window seat, which was a beautiful view. My husband order a duck dish, I ordered steak, and we shared potatoes gratin and chocolate souffle.  All the food was delicious, especially the souffle, but I am a dessert person so that would be my favorite part. The service was the best service we have ever had!  I would highly recommend eating here.

h7AhkRFtCPd9tt9CQ873Ow.text: As local Las Vegans, we have come to expect a lot from our better restaurants in the Valley. For my wife's 50th Birthday dinner I chose Eiffel Tower and requested a window table-overlooking the Bellagio lagoon- at sunset. When we arrived (early) we we seated exactly where we wanted, enjoyed perfect service and two exceptionally prepared meals. The wine service as very good (as was the list.) We were never rushed and the courses came out in a timely manner. After dinner, our prearranged tickets to the observation deck were included in our bill and provided a wonderful exclamation mark to the evening. I would highly recommend this restaurant for any special occasion or meal for those who want a truly remarkable experience.

UZlMl9lbOB4KKTCWDqjfoA.text: Nice view if you have a window seat, generic food, overpriced. There are way better and more innovative restaurants in Vegas. Not coming back.

Ob2inVuXTxrv9xhZQGEG9w.text: What a magical place is the Eiffel Tower restaurant. Ate here during a work event and loved everything about it. This place has lots of charm. The staff is extremely attentive and accommodating. The food was delicious. Overall everyone in our group had an amazing experience. Highly recommend this place for a romantic dinner or if your looking for a traditional Las Vegas experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great views outside the Paris
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open kitchen
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tried all three desserts. Chocolate lava cake was my favorite.

JorE7qGnVYsZcJZWK0fm3w.text: My boyfriend made a reservation 2 weeks in advanced & requested a window seat.  We had a really hard time finding parking. We Spent atleast 15 minutes looking for a spot. So I called the restaurant & let them know we would be a little late. We got there around 20 minutes late of our said reservation. So we pretty much figured we would not be getting a window seat.   Once we entered the restaurant, we were taken to our table. A corner table next to the Bellagio Fountains. Probably the best seat in the house & much more intimate.   Service was great. They explained everything on their menu, and always made sure we were taken care of.  I had the baked lobster, my bf the chicken, & a pistachio souffle. AMAAAAZING!   What a great place to celebrate a birthday or anniversary.

LA9_Bsq6mndcrNJPtSlSXg.text: Every time we have dined at the Eiffel Tower restaurant, it has been a totally enjoyable experience. The food is always to die for and the wait staff treats you like royalty.

pEaBlJtDpDa3Y7lK6wCflw.text: Excellent from start to finish. We were seated at 7:15 and had a window seat  She started with a crab appetizer that was excellent. I had the house salad.  For entrees we could not pass up the filet mignon with foie gras.  Unbelievably delicate, medium rare, absolutely fabulous.  Our waiter was excellent, I think his name was Tom.  Perfect in every way

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qlcggn0Ryjj_Fe8S4O4X4g.text: Amazing place to eat if you really want to impressed someone you must bring them here it's about romantic and cute it's at gets, staff is super nice and you can dressed up or not amazing experience I came here for my birthday with my daughters so cute.

tlV3owUwg78izenDylaZCQ.text: What an amazing experience right dab middle in the heart of the Las Vegas strip!  This has been on our bucket list for the past several years and we finally made the splurge for our anniversary.  Overlooking all of the bright lights of the Las Vegas strip, you get to enjoy some real fine dining that the Paris has to offer.  We had two of our dear friends join us for dinner who also happen to be very good business colleagues.  Visiting us all the way from Pittsburgh we wanted to show them a great time.  This place did not disappoint.  From the minute we sat down, we were greeted with a really nice and comfortable red velvet booth overlooking the strip.  We ordered drinks, which were very excellent by the way; the Pink Velvet and Can Can.  Definitely a sweet and sour type of alcoholic drink made to perfection.  My only gripe was that the drink was served in a champagne glass instead of a larger cocktail type glass.  Still a good drink to definitely start the buzz for the night.  Our entrees consisted of the Free Range Chicken and the Imperial Beef Wellington.  Both excellent meals and I did not leave the plate empty at all.  I told the server I was concerned with the beef wellingtons having some pink, but it did not.  Was served medium well and certainly did not disappoint.  It also came with a red blood looking sauce (I forgot the name), but it really enhanced all of the savory flavors.  I will definitely be coming back here to try the multi-course meal; apparently all parties in the group must order it.  Great excuse to come back.  Excellent place for cozy, quiet and romantic evenings.  Be prepared to spend $125-$150 per person, but well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special Anniversary Dessert
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Imperial Beef Wellington
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free Range Chicken

X9rr-3WaWo2YYzt6aJknTQ.text: What a beautiful experience. Had a window view and watched the Bellagio water show down below and across the way.  Our server was very informative and knowledgeable of the menu.  I love love love their escargot! I can totally just order a plate full of that and be good!  Ok doing the whole French food experience I also had the caviar. Everything I expected. Wasn't quite my liking but it was edible. Glad to say I tried it. Their foie gras was incredible! The veal ravolini entree was exquisite! My bf had steak. It was cooked to his liking and enjoyed it.  My martinis were perfect!  I will definitely return and try some other items!

Colji1dBPAjTwsLCcKwo8g.text: This place was so much fun to eat at! Beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains at night- which does its fountain show every 15 minutes. Most of the seats are geared to give a good view- so already a hit with the ambiance, right off the bat. We walked in on a Thursday night without a reservation, and even though they were busy, we got seated within 5 minutes. The food was also really amazing. It's French (go figure), and upscale. Service was great too (I ordered a drink and didn't like it, they replaced it with a good wine instead) and very attentive.  We got the scallop appetizer, while admittedly it was small, it was delicious and perfectly seasoned and seared. We each got an entree- and neither disappointed.  Next time I visit Vegas, I'll be sure to come here again!

awxvPXA4mN_RMjDJVOpDBQ.text: Came here about a month ago and All I can say is this dining experience was the best I've had in my entire life. The food was absolutely delicious and tasted like what angels must be eating in heaven. the atmosphere and our window view of the fountain was gorgeous and romantic. our waiter was extremely nice, knowledgeable and helpful, he provided the best service. we did the menu tasting paired with wine tasting. it was pricey but worth every single penny. I recommend everyone try this restaurant and I can't wait for the opportunity to come back. I give 10 stars if I could.
