vYc5i_0Ip30vD2BM_spy-g.text: Delicious food and excellent service. Although I am dissapointed that the sides offered (such as veggies or steak sauce) are charged extra, it was overall a lovely experience and definitely a romantic setting for a nice, quiet dinner. Will return again!

Y1A-yO1NkrfoqQ7AXgnMUw.text: Great for a birthday dinner or romantic dinner. We went for my mother's birthday and w just loved it. The fish was incredible and the mash potatoes are great as well. The desserts are just to die for. And the view is just incredible and gorgeous of the strip.

D5B3WgBRjRSes1HDIdU32Q.text: Me and my boyfriend had a wonderful time at the restaurant.  It should receive the 5 stars but our waitress was the one caused the missing star.    The evening was very nice, great drinks, views and food and we sat the table we requested.  Had good communications with the reservation staff.  Enjly the food and the water show.  Our waitress did come to our table to check on the service but the way she spoke to us was very unplesant.  She couldn't understand the request and kept talking down to us.  I asked for the refill of my diet coke, and waited for over 10 minutes to asked her again to see where is my drink.  I got the reponse as the following:"Did you just order your drink?  Then you need to wait a little.".  When I ecplaned to her that I ordered the drink 40 minutes ago and requested to get the refill about 10 minutes ago.  She couldn't understand and told me that I can't rush the order.  Also when she asked us if we need any thing for the first course, I answered"every thing is fine".  With a very disrespectful tone she said:" I was asking if you need any thing."  We decided not to let her service effect to our dinner because rest of the staff were really nice to us.  We walked away with the smile on our face.  The waitress just didn't add the great image to the restaurnat, I hope the manager can be awared.  A good restaurant is not just about the food and view, with out the respectful service, a perfect dinning experenice can be destroied.  I hope in the near future, I can put the missing star back.

hyDFN0F22NSUMG02LkB8wg.text: Visited on Bastille Day.  Surprisingly no observance of Bastille Day at the Eiffel Tower restaurant in Las Vegas.  Its a special day for my hometown French restaurants.  Special menus, celebration, etc.  On to the experience.  Excellent service for Las Vegas. Prompt, Professional, Courteous.  Missing the warmth of the relationship you have with your home town French restaurant but otherwise very good service.  The food experience was quite good.  Frankly (see what I did there ;-) ) outstanding for Las Vegas strip standards.   The Beef Wellington was a nice change from my usual filet with truffle sauce.  My wife loved the porkchop.  The Soufflee desert was magnifique.  Pricey wine list.    Decent Calvados selection.

-61XAV-VvFbXwY3acHanKw.text: Roman was an exceptional server with enthusiasm, expertise and passion for our dining experience. The view was outstanding and the cuisine was divine. We highly recommend and can't wait for our next special occasion! Special thanks to Lyle, the GM, for the personal welcome.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pink Velvet with Belvedere Vodka, Watermelon &amp; Edelflower liquor &amp; Pineapple juice.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut and Salmon were fantastic! Great cocktail list and an extensive, thoughtful wine list.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view, the ambiance and the cuisine are exceptional!

nTtp9Mrtr67m248jHzoM8g.text: Great service and great food. Pricey but definitely worth it especially If you are celebrating a special occasion BUT not as pricey as I was expecting it to be :D *huge smile*. My husband and I celebrated our first wedding anniversary here and they hooked us up with a free dessert :D. Btw the meal portions are filling especially if your pre gaming with appetizers. Lol. Great place we'll be back soon ;).. husband just doesn't know yet. Hah.

LeP2IXear-oJzUu9a5IwHw.text: This place was amazing! The food was very good and top shelf. The aged New York Steak will melt in your mouth. The view of the Bellagio watershow was great. I highly recommend this place. Just know everything is al a cart and you pay for what you get. You can preview the menu on-line.   The ride up to the top is a must also.

39CfAtcVglPc7I1j4vJorQ.text: pricey but great for a nice celebration dinner.  Service is top notch.  food is wonderful.  monkfish (poor man's lobster) was so good.  love this place and the views you get of the strip, bellagio fountains, and if you go towards the back you can see the paris hotel pool.

3Y_1oXosnXeFy4Am1gzWqA.text: I went to this restaurant with my boyfriend and I loved it.  We were lucky enough to get a seat right in front of the Bellagio. The view was so beautiful. I ordered a classic hamburger and it was the best burger I've ever tasted. It was seasoned to perfection. I ate every last bit because it was so juicy and tasty. I will definitely be back!

5oWxYtVAwFiBZnw2oDkVcA.text: 1. restaurant  the staff ...very nice. 2. the downstairs staff very nice, but not very useful. 3. food was made quickly 4. food was great! 5. the view was awesome..we could see the fountains and the sunset. 6. great for anniversary 7. very expensive!  results: wife loved it.

v148VhZJsQ3lbhAwjUbQNQ.text: why go any where else? Food is the best on the strip, best executed,wine list rocks with interesting choices, and the view is well, the best in Vegas

2guV1tFJ_rF3XMfZ_yK6cw.text: Watching the fountains of the Bellaigo while eating dinner in the Eiffel Tower Restaurant again! This has to be the "Best" view in all of Vegas!  "Priceless"!

9HYnopMiLGWYClZjdj_t-Q.text: Great view. The best creamy French onion soup I have ever had. Love the staff. Love the menu. Try the lamb burger it is to die for.

palLkJXWsJa_VYVe7P_LfQ.text: Food was very good, not exceptional, but very good.  The service was exceptional.  You definitely want a table with the view of the bellagio fountains, and while I was just there with my husband, there were lots of groups which seemed to be having fun. This place is quite expensive so just be aware. My husband and I are in our 20s but came to Vegas prepared to spend money! We spent close to $350 though (with a bottle of wine) and unless you are really holding back, I don't think a couple could get out of there for much less. It's Vegas so everything is relative.  Worth doing once for sure :)

SWCLYANLMiXiPhW0mzicVQ.text: Food and service was outstanding.  Had the escargot appetizer and filet mingnon for dinner, drinks were great too.  I would recommend this restaurant.

RxTMiQOhl6azQhYYXxkj3w.text: One of the best meals I've had in Vegas.  The food was great, service was good, and the view was AMAZING.  Great place to bring a date.

GeWmSxA-VH8LOsX2vdHiwg.text: Okay, the ambience is a little dated, but...  Food:  Original & spectacular. Really!  Service:  Attentive, personal & insightful. Really!  View:  Wowzers. Really!  A really, really, really fine Las Vegas experience.

iOVxQYr61wW7OJhkEpegpA.text: A Beautiful Evening. I took my parents while we were visiting Vegas. They love cheesy tourist stuff and I wanted to treat them to a nice meal. Well, it wasn't as cheesy as I expected. As soon as we stepped into the dining room, I felt like we were floating above The Strip. The dining room is dark so the lights of Vegas looked amazing all around us. The service was top notch and the food was fabulous. It's probably the best view in Vegas. The best tables are in the front of the dining room right next to the windows facing the Bellagio fountain, but we didn't get those tables because most of those tables are for 2 ppl and we had 3. Larger 4 ppl tables are behind those. So if you want the best view, it's probably best to go as a couple. However, even from our table at the side of the restaurant, we were able to enjoy the Bellagio fountain shows and also get a great view down the strip. I could see Aria, NYNY, Excalibur, and Luxor from where I was sitting! We all had the $89 pre-fiix Tasting Menu and it was worth it. Every course was melt in your mouth yum. (6 courses including dessert) Here's the Tasting Menu: eiffeltowerrestaurant.co... It's really the best deal since you get a bit of lobster, halibut, and lamb. I'm not a huge lamb fan, but their lamb was great! The tasting menu had smaller portions, but I was stuffed by the end of the meal. We also dished out an additional $6 each to get the Souffle instead of the regular dessert. Again, totally worth it. We each got a different flavor and sampled each others: Pistachio, Grand Marnier, and Chocolate.. All were beautifully sweet and fluffy but with their own personalities. Definitely don't miss out on the Souffle. The bar looked like a good alternative if you don't want to spend the $$ on dinner. But once you see the view, you might want to send the whole evening there.

kAhgk2yRxA_Ce7rgqzHIwA.text: Amazing view, excellent service, spectacular food. 5-star service all the way. We arrived a few minutes early and were whisked up an elevator to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. We were promptly greeted and taken to our table for two -- literally looking out at the Bellagio fountains. It was the best view on the strip!!   Our meal started with sparkling water and an amuse bouche of a tiny parmesan cheese puff pastry. A perfect little bite indeed!! I ordered the warm lobster, braised leeks and celery appetizer. The sauce was rich and delicious, the lobster was delicate but boldly flavorful. It was perfectly seasoned. My wife ordered the blue cheese souffle pudding with a walnut pecan salad. She loved it. Loved it like she wanted to lick the plate clean loved it. Loved it like I had get a little pushy to try a bite loved it.   For an entree I ordered the duck prepared two ways--a sliced breast served medium-rare and a leg confit with wild rice and a rich sauce. Every bite was tender and juicy. My wife ordered the slow roasted filet of salmon with a pinot noir sauce. She said it was the best salmon she had ever tasted. We opted for a side of the pommes dauphines which were essentially mashed potato filled tater tots. Awesome. Every bit of our meal was amazing. We sipped on their signature cocktail the Eiffel Affair and ordered souffles for dessert. I went with the chocolate souffle and my wife had the grand marnier souffle. Both were delicious. Each came with a sauce (mine had a chocolate and a creme anglaise sauce). Probably the best dessert I've ever had. Thank you Eiffel Tower for making my belated honeymoon dinner worth it.

yHR5Z5E3NoXzo2wGYttLZw.text: The Eiffel Tower restaurant has a beautiful view.  Try to get a table near the window facing the Bellagio.  The service was amazing as well as the food.  Looking forward to dining here again!

juve4sjIhm3uoysXaVv-AA.text: What a tremendous experience.   The food was incredible but the service was better.   From the way the manager greets to the simple touches from the servers.    The view was spectacular and made the experience unforgettable.     The bone marrow reduction NY Strip and the Wellington were both delicious.   The Souffle was not as good as advertised but still very good.    Eiffel Affair and the wonderful Napa wine selection both made the experience wonderful.

eWyAFAnZgMke4lvBHDHD7A.text: The view was great and the food was just ok. Me, my husband and 2 other friends were graving for souffle on a Sunday afternoon, so we were thinking we should find a restaurant somewhere in the Paris hotel that had it. We walked by the entrance of the The Eiffel Tower Restaurant and a guy asked us to check out their brunch menu. So we especially asked him if they have dessert souffle and pasta in brunch, then he said "yeah, yeah, yeah, of course." We were all excited to have a good brunch.  We ordered Eiffel Tower classic hamburger, Light omelette souffle topped w/ asparagus and brie, also some french toasts. When my friend was trying to order pasta, our server was so rude by answering "Pasta and spaghetti are Italian while this is a French restaurant." Then we were thinking why the hack they have hamburger, isn't it Germany cuisine? And then my friend asked him, if we could order dessert souffle, he said they don't have time to prepare for the lunch period. But that's what we've told and that's the main purpose of us decided to come into this restaurant. What can we do? We were disappointed, but we still had to stay.   Appetizer: instead of having regular bread, they served us an amuse bouche of some kind of parfait, it was delicious.   Hamburger: it tasted alright but very juicy  Omelette souffle: texture was just like an overcooked steam egg  French toasts: it tasted ok  The price is reasonable, the whole meal costs around $60. I will recommend to go for dinner but not brunch.

_lBe0uvECBgIxjrLJLdxdg.text: By far this was the best meal we had in all of Vegas.  The place is located on the 11th floor of the Eifel tower in the Paris hotel/Casino.  The view was spectacular and the restaurant is glamorous.  We had the best service.  We ordered the pairing, where we get different wines for each course.  But since we had a 4 hour drive, we opted for no wine.  The food was wonderful.   My appetizer was Warmed seasoned shrimp over a light sauce.  My boyfriend had the spinach and mushroom strudel.  He said it just melted in his mouth.  My shrimp was delicious.  His main course was a smoked salmon over egg omelet with crunchy potato strings and capers.     I had the marinated steak over potatoes with poached egg.  OMG  the flavors were fantastic.  We thought heaven had come to earth.   Our dessert was a souffle with grand marniere   along with a topping of strawberry ice cream with diced pistachios and fresh strawberries.  It all was great.  Please visit this wonderful place.

DIVrpHYJSi1KmR53k2awlg.text: I took my girlfriend here to celebrate her birthday. It was a Wednesday night, but I made reservations in advance just in case. When I made the reservation online, I advised them of the occasion and asked for a fountain view.   Upon arriving, the experience and the view were fantastic from beginning to end. This place is fine dining at its finest. The service was amazing. The host who greeted us once the elevator doors opened was a nice touch. The waiter was fantastic, very attentive, very friendly. He remembered to bring out a birthday dessert without me having to remind him. The support staff came by several times to check on us, offer us bread, etc., and never let our water glasses get less than half full. I appreciated the supervisor, Lyle, coming by to check on us, and his thank you email after the fact was a nice touch.   I had the New York Steak, my girlfriend had the chicken, both were delicious. The pistachio souffle was to die for.   It was pricey, to be sure, but you get what you pay for. I wanted it to be a special experience for my girlfriend and the Eiffel Tower Restaurant did not disappoint.

xnmWOLxJmrIV2oJD9xWRIA.text: Table was wobbly the whole dinner.  Souffle was served with no side plates.  They expected me and my whole party to bump spoons when sharing the souffle for dessert.  Waited 10-15 minutes for the side plates to be brought out.  By that time the souffle was cold.  Currently waiting another 20 minutes for another souffle to be cooked.  Not happy with the service or condition of the dinning area.

Bq1uYfzvYjViMYuwQs9O8g.text: OMG AMAZING!!!  My friend Sarah and I came here to celebrate her birthday on Christmas Eve.  Sarah had made the reservations a few weeks prior for I believe around 5:30ish, well since the sun had been going down earlier here in Las Vegas, the restaurant contacted us and asked if we would like to move our reservation up to 4:30 that way we can enjoy the sunset while we were enjoying dinner.  SERIOUSLY?! WOW!!!  I felt that was one of the best things a restaurant could even consider, I have never had anyone worry that we might miss the sunset, we were extremely happy and took the 4:30 reservation.  The wine was excellent, the appetizers were amazing, the salmon was delicious, the service was the best I had ever experienced on the strip!    Even the fellow patrons were a delight, minus the woman sitting next to me yelling at her child because she herself did not know how to operate a digital camera and was trying to take a photo of the sunsetting but was too daft as to turn the flash off, she then complained that the rather clean window was disgustingly dirty and that is why she could not get a good pic, um, no it is because you have your flash on and are trying to take a photo in front of a window LOL But I am not faulting anyone for her stupidity.   The only issue I have is they have a rather "strict" dress code, which i am fine, I just decided to wear my tux as we were going out afterwards and it is always nice to dress up, we were both informed that it is "Business Attire" fine, spectacular, and as we are leaving we share an elevator with people carrying To - Go containers while dressed in kind of filthy blue jeans and long sleeved t-shrits.  Why put on your website and inform us over the phone that it is "Business Attire" only if you are allowing people to eat there in jeans?   Over all it was an amazing experience, i would definitely recommend eating while the sun is setting as well!!

uXlcshHqrV6EDQDdo2gFEw.text: We had the Filet of Trout ($22) and the New York Strip ($32) and both were very tasty! The service was great and a view to match. I suggest dining during lunch (11:00AM-3:30PM) for a lesser price point! I'll be back again!!!!

Pf8BN3ZkqiSV4hvXcc-1Vw.text: This review is long overdue.  I came here with my wife little more than two years ago, a day after we got engaged.  This was our second stop after I proposed to her at The Edison in LA.  We had the pre-fixe dinner menu which was about $90/person and included amuse bouche, appetizer, entree, and a dessert.  I can't remember everything we ate here but both of us still remember the venison chop with huckleberry reduction sauce and ginger mojito.  Those were some of the best things we ever ate/drank.  The venison was super tender and huckleberry reduction was excellent.  Ginger mojito was the best mojito we ever had.  We both loved the ginger foam at the top.    The service was very professional but somewhat stiff, almost corporate.  Place looks upscale and romantic.  Most of the couples were seated by the window where you can get a nice view of the Bellagio water show.  You definitely need to dress up to dine here.  The decor can be a hit or miss depending on lighting and time of day.  During night it looks quite spectacular, but during the day, it may look like a typical gaudy Vegas decor.

XzNGHLpiaS4V6dMiF9raJQ.text: Great view, great services. I loved my food.. My only complain about this place is that I ordered a bottle of wine, and my server misunderstood me and brought me a glass.. I quickly corrected him and told him it was a bottle he kindly apologized and brought me the bottle. Except when the bill came BOTH were charged... I'm not one to complain so I just payed. But it upset me.. Other than that!! GREAT place to visit in Vegas. Great viewing area of the water show! Great for a nice date :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My delicious New York strip
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese appetizer
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ve08LMEPY1QsA4GrcBw_Ng.text: My mom surprised me in Vegas for my 30th birthday and took me here for a FABULOUS birthday dinner. I didn't even know this place existed! You take an elevator up and the views are fabulous. It was very impressive!  The food is just melt-in-your-mouth amazing, the service is top notch without being stuffy, and they really went above and beyond to make it a very special night. We were continually brought bread, waters refilled, and even given a great tasting cauliflower soup (sounds a little weird but tasted awesome), compliments of the chef. The food was delicious and the service was exceptional. The waitress was so on top of her game, it was probably the best service we ever had. She was great, yet wasn't stuffy -- she was very personable and made us feel comfortable. When my mom made the reservations, she asked them to include roses on the table. They had a dozen of the most beautiful red roses ever -- they are seriously perfect and still thriving! I got to take them home in the vase, and the waitress provided a great gift bag to make carrying them out easier. The are full and open, still looking and smelling as beautiful today as they did this past weekend at the restaurant! She also brought out a birthday dessert, in addition to the delicious souffle that my mom loved. My mom also asked them to bring out a jewelry gift she had gotten me, with dessert -- they brought it out on a platter and had written Happy Birthday on the plate. They didn't skimp on anything here -- everything was fabulous! It was the greatest dining experience and they helped my mom make my birthday truly special and unforgettable!

07ZfnTtKC4dTEFl2tarSPw.text: My husband and I came here for a nice dinner out on our vacation. We were looking for something nice with a view. The view is great in the restaurant especially if you are seated on the side of the Bellagio next to the windows...we were not at all impressed with the food. We both agreed to never revisit this place unless there was an option to only order drinks. The food is very much overpriced for what you get. I ordered a glass of wine (that definitely costed more than double what the bottle would've), my husband ordered a "French lemonade" non-alcoholic, we had a middle of the range appetizer,  I ordered Filet mignon and my husband ordered beef wellington....our bill at the end of the night was $285!!!!!!!!@@@$$&#% totally not worth it! I would look for something different if you're looking for someplace nice to eat! There are plenty of other views out there!

hMD5D6ExWBVYCcfBcJ9XlA.text: Such a fantastic view & super romantic. Great for a special occasion. Get the souffle!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon &amp; Steak w/ potato gratin!

Jtlfg7Rvrm8yMno6ItgPTQ.text: Random info: Tasting Menu is $125, Wine paring optional, additional $79. Average individual entree ranges between $50~$80. The elevator to the restaurant is located in the middle of the Paris casino.   Ambiance: Excellent. In terms of view of the Bellagio fountain this is probably the best place to dine! (Be sure to ask for a good table if you come here for the view ;).)   Food: Good. The first time I came here with my girlfriend we had lamp chop and a steak. I thought those dishes were quite average. The second time I came here with my clients, and we had the chief's tasting menu which I thought it was definitely one of the better tasting menu I had come across. The Foie Gras, which is duck liver was amazing!   Parking: Good. Free parking if you don't mind the walking. On the other hand valet is only $3~5 bucks depends on how much you want to tip. I always valet when I'm in Vegas it is so freaking convenient!   Service: Excellent. First of all there are people greet you right at the elevator, and will escort you to the restaurant. If you are having the tasting menu, your utensils will be swapped out for clean ones after every course. And oh, beware they have restroom attendants, be sure to bring some cash for tips. Water is always filled on time, sometimes the VP/manager will walk around and personally make sure everything is ok.   Conclusion: Hands down one of the best view in Vegas! Good food. Over the top service. A good place to impress a date/client. Dinner for two, expect the bill to be $200 if you order off the menu. $280 ~ $450 if you are getting the tasting menu.

6cvAo-RBZbS7lBtnIr62vw.text: What an awesome experience! From the elevator ride up, to the friendly service, and the great food. I had the New York streak cooked to perfection (Medium Well), and my GF had the roasted chicken which was also yummy, great thing about a relationship is sharing food. The sides were also good! It was a lil pricy, but worth the experience! They even offer to take your pic with a great background, and frame a 5x7 for $25. Glad my GF not only suggested it, but picked up the tab! I'm a lucky guy...

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view....

3Go6VkwF3OEmmmAvK1qXDQ.text: When my boyfriend asked me if I liked French, I immediately assumed we'd be dining at Bouchon. But then he mentioned a spectacular view and I remembered the actual Eiffel Tower in Paris has a restaurant in the middle of it.   It's quite a walk (especially in stilettos!) from the parking lot past the buffet and through the Paris casino to the elevator which will take you up to the restaurant.    We arrived uncharacteristically late (8:30 for our 8:15 reservation). Because we specifically wanted a window seat (which I HIGHLY recommend), we ended up waiting over an hour. Around 9:45, the hostess let us know that 7 tables had signed their checks and they were just waiting for them to leave.   First up, the gazpacho amuse bouche was flavorful and refreshing. Oddly, someone walks around with bread (which I suppose is a good thing if you don't want to fill up on it). I preferred the baguette to the multi-grain. We also ordered two glasses of cabernet based on our waiter, Tom's, suggestion.   We started with a summer salad with shaved vegetables and corn soup. I felt the salad was overdressed and yes, there were literally paper thin slices of vegetables. They brought over my soup bowl and poured the liquid contents into the bowl tableside. Fancy. It was supposed to have manila clams but I couldn't really taste it although I am always happy to be served bacon.   For entrees, the boyfriend ordered steak and bone marrow while I had the rack of lamb, cooked medium. Both were succulent and perfectly cooked and definitely worth the wait. The staff apologized for the long wait. Since the kitchen was slammed, our entrees didn't come out until nearly 10:30.   We ended the meal with a Grand Marnier souffle (they have 6 kinds), which you have to order at the beginning of the meal. Afterwards, they brought out petite fours. Yum.   Although the soup and salad were forgettable, the entrees were amazing and perfectly cooked. What was most impressive was the view. We were seated by the window where it directly faces the Bellagio water show. Easily the best seat in the house. Saw quite a few brides (2-3) at this super romantic venue. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The circular bar with the Paris sign behind it.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak, potatoes au gratin, rack of lamb, and wine. Mmm.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from the window seat.

wEw3omLbjnanjNQgio_snA.text: The food was ok, the service was ok, the casino was ok, the view was great! We didn't have to wait long as we made reservations. My husband ordered flowers for the table before we arrived, the roses were beautiful! There are a variety of personalities that dine here, my husband and I enjoyed that a lot. It looks over the fountains of the Bellagio, so that's another great perk to eating here. It is pricy but I feel like you're paying for the experience, not the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband at the Eiffel Tower before dinner
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Eiffel Tower
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The roses my husband ordered for our table.

hZCn9TU-fBO9RHeGrWQlLw.text: You did it again! My wife and I had an amazing time here on our honeymoon.  The staff were very attentive and friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed every item that was delivered to our table. I'm a scotch man, but I branched out and tried one of their cocktails. It was so good that I ordered the second one before the first one was even finished.   We were offered a complimentary amuse bouche and at the end of our meal, a sorbet variety. Our favorite was the sour cream sorbet.  This is by far the most romantic restaurant in Las Vegas. This place is worth the trip alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A complimentary variety of sorbets. The white one on the left was our favorite (sour cream)

Bk_fnNVGPo0IxGvY9vAT2Q.text: This place was EXTREMELY overrated. The "window view" we got was less than ideal, and we could barely even see half of the fountain show. The best part of the food was the crab appetizer, but other than that it was sub-par and WAY overpriced. The cheapest cocktail on the menu was a Not Your Father's Root Beer which I payed $10 or $11 for. The main course was chicken, which I would NOT recommend to anyone. The waitress was nice enough. Overall I was very disappointed and would never go here again.

va4TRVWFEWo9eGn9AR8LnA.text: Well I finally get to post one of those "Best dinner ever reviews". This was the best dinner we have ever had. It was also the best service we've ever had. The view was amazing. Even though I feel like I will be posting the same awesome review everybody else posts, I will do it anyway. We started out with the salmon appetizer and it was incredible! My wife had the filet with asparagus. I had the beef wellington and asparagus along with the potatoes. We shared a souffle to wrap things up. I will simply post some photos and say it was the best dinner ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M5qHvthaTlnD2PL42J5Avg.text: A small group of us had brunch here on a recent trip at the suggestion of a friend. The day we visited was my birthday, which we informed the hostess of when we made reservations the day before. The entire staff, throughout the reservation process the day before through the meal the following morning, was very courteous.   We were seated in a rounded booth that faced the Bellagio, which was ideal for me as I find the building to be beautiful and of course there are the fountains. From our seats, it was easier to see the fountains when they were shooting higher - the views from the small tables that line the windows look to be amazing. I was a little disappointed that halfway through the meal, shades were drawn halfway over the windows and thus limited our view.  We had anticipated the prix fixe menu ($39/pp), before realizing there was also regular menu options. I opted for the french toast, which was listed in the menu as having a vanilla cream, bananas, and pecans. Upon its arrival, there was bacon (actually, pancetta as I was informed) resting on it. I informed our server that I am a vegetarian, and had my only unpleasant moment during this experience -- while he took the dish back to have it corrected, I was not given an apology of any kind but merely told "that's the pancetta". This item was not listed in the description on the menu, so I did not know when ordering to request that it not be included.  The food itself was good, after being corrected. I also opted to have the warm apple dessert, which we were told needed to be ordered in advance due to preparation time. This came out a little more crisp than I would have normally preferred, but overall it was a good dessert. In addition to this, I was given a small chocolate dessert for my birthday. As a chocolate lover, I found this to be very good and especially enjoyed the chocolate slice that topped it.  Overall, I really enjoyed this restaurant and would return on a future trip so long as the menu still contains items I find appetizing. I would be more careful when ordering to ensure that the option does not contain any kind of meat, however.   As a final thought, they sell a few items including cookbooks and chocolate bars. As I raved about the chocolate slice on my dessert, my brother purchased a chocolate bar for me. I wish I could say that this was the same chocolate, but will admit that the purchased bar is very good as well -- it is a dark chocolate bar with sea salt. As someone who doesn't care much for salt, I find the combination in this bar to pair very well.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the table
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the table
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious birthday dessert

OcJdWolmIvj9ekb9mkikYQ.text: The spectacular view of the Bellagio fountains is the real selling point here ... honestly, I found the food good but not great and pretty overpriced.  Service, however, is excellent, and the general atmosphere is of a "special" event.  I've been here before for Sunday brunch ... and if you time that right, you can see the fountains when they're running during the day on the weekends.  I really enjoyed that meal (about a year ago, I guess) and the prices weren't too outrageous.  They don't offer the souffle for dessert during the day, however, and since I REALLY wanted to try it based on the many rave reviews, we decided to come for dinner.  When booking, I saw that if you book a 5:00 or 5:15 table, you are guaranteed a window table overlooking the fountains.  We had a show to get to anyway, so that sounded good to me.  However, our window table was off to one side, so the view of the fountains wasn't that great ... and one of us was pretty much pointed away from them entirely with no view at all to speak of.  Appetizers -- corn chowder with lobster custard ($18) was way too sweet.  Had to add lots of salt to make it palatable.  Far better was the Roquefort souffle ($16), a small dome of light and fluffy blue cheese and eggs paired with a small green salad.    Entrees -- crispy-skinned arctic char with smoked beets ($46) was on the small side, but the fish filets were moist and tasty ... the plate also featured a foam emulsion that was surprisingly bland considering it was made with horseradish.  The beef wellington ($68 -- ouch) was a filet atop a layer of mushrooms and pate, all individually wrapped up in puff pastry.  A small pitcher of rich red wine reduction came alongside, as well as a pile of limp snow peas that looked like they'd been scooped out of a buffet chafing dish and plopped on the plate.  The meat was a shade overcooked, but still very tasty, especially with that sauce.  However, I could easily reproduce this meal at home for $10 with no advanced chef skills required. I find that annoying.  I don't mind paying high prices when magic is being done in the kitchen, magic I could never work myself.  This was not one of those meals.  And so, time for the souffle (not sure of the price ... $18?).  We chose pistachio to share, and it was okay, but not over-the-moon fantastic.  It tasted very strongly of amaretto instead of pistachio.  If I had it to do over again, I'd go with the chocolate instead.  End of the night, with drinks, tax, and tip, we spent about $235.  Meh.  I wouldn't do it again.  I MIGHT, however, return for daytime brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. restaurant anniversary celebration cocktail
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arctic char with smoked  beets
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington

RE7JnzmCpY1jdIAE1KYW2g.text: Great view, great service and great food!  We came here for my dad's birthday and fortunately for me I packed an evening dress and heels. Not so good for my dad lol. He forgot to bring a jacket and apparently this restaurant likes to keep that "high class" feel going. They even lent him a jacket to wear for the entire dinner. I find that somewhat funny but at least they didn't turn him away right?  Looking at the menu, it took me back when I was at the Space Needle for dinner. Everything sounded so amazing yet so pricey! I can admit it, I can be fairly cheap sometimes BUT I do however think amazing foods come at a fair price.  With that said.. I order the roasted rabbit, no appetizer or salad. They served us asparagus soup  and bread to begin with so I didn't want to stuff my face too much. Gotta save room for dessert! Having rabbit is new to me and as much as I wanted lamb I also like to try new things even more so. The meat was so delicate, much more so than lamb but just as delicious. With the sauce and vegetables served along the rabbit, everything fell into place. My mouth certainly was having a taste bud orgasm.  For dessert, I ordered the pistachio souffle which our server had informed us about in the beginning since it takes about 45 minutes to prepare. Souffle? Yum. Pistachio? YES PLEASE! So how was it you ask? Blissful. I was literally in heaven. Subtle sweet gooeyness and fluffiness... Oh, and it was humongous! I probably could have devoured it all by myself but I was nice enough to share since there was definitely more than enough.  Exceptional service of course. Our server was very friendly and informative. The ambiance is very intimate with an outstanding view of the water fountains at The Bellagio. It was a nice experience and worth it but man was I happy to take off my heels after wards! The strip is not friendly to feet in heels at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VV325W6y8os6k5HI2C0CcA.text: Great upscale restaurant in Paris Hotel on Las Vegas strip Went for lunch  Table for twos face windows and Bellagio fountains  Great service wonderful food excellent value  This is a special place if you want to celebrate a big event or just want a great meal Will try dinner next time  Highly recommended

KNgeVRcFaeFXCVBjguzXmw.text: "go all the way to the tower...find out the secrets behind"  while it's no secret that this isn't the real Eiffel Tower, the secret is this: reasonably priced food and a surprisingly relaxed atmosphere. not things you normally expect of the French, or their Vegas colony, but nice to see.  the spicy lamb burger is hefty, juicy, and packed with flavor. get it. do not pass go. proceed directly to the lamb burger. it does not disappoint. FOR GREAT JUSTICE.  service was friendly and fast.  the view out on the Strip is tough to beat, especially when you see the Bellagio fountains going off. worth it.

vnStgR1acz0OoFCAy-oQwA.text: Lunch, table in the window! Get the 1/2 avocado with crab salad as an appetizer. It's lite and flavorful. The shrimp cocktail rivals my favorite (Epic Roasthouse, San Francisco,) and the chicken dishes are always executed perfectly. The hostess and staff are professional and accommodating. So, so good every time.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Right on the corner
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kinda like a chicken parm w/out all the stuff. Real good :-)
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail

KBI9dL7DpzK6Jn-LTFUDhQ.text: Amazing. Loved the view and ate every bite of what I ordered! Had the Market Greens Salad and regret not taking a picture. So fresh and AVOCADOS. Had the "Queen" Filet and Classic Potato Gratin for the main course and my steak was like buttah. Potatoes were creamy and all kinds of awesome. I got to choose from a few different breads and selected the French baguette because duh, Eiffel Tower. Skipped lunch for this meal and I'm so glad! Creme Brulee for dessert and another picture worthy course. Perfection. My waiter seemed confused by some of my awesome jokes, but otherwise, no complaints!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. See, I wasn&#39;t lying.

kIfW-MWrBGb_LN2GK7H_EQ.text: My husband and I dined here for our anniversary and they made sure it was a memorable experience.   We were seated with a view of the Bellagio fountains in an area that felt private.  We couldn't decide what to get, so we opted for the tasting menu and was not disappointed.  There were a couple of things on there that I really didn't want to try, so our waitress was very quick to switch them out for other dishes.  It was expensive, but totally worth it.  If you are looking for excellent French cuisine and an experience like no other, I highly recommend giving this place a try.

5OwqWMn5urDTnS3VxG9hZQ.text: THREE STARS, FOR A GREAT BAR  NEGATIVE TWO, FOR DINNER SERVICE THAT BLEW  Hubby and I made reservations for our dinner here a day early. We drooled over the menu and called his parents for suggestions on what to eat.  The following day was spent walking around Vegas, drinking, and eating! We unfortunately planned very poorly and had booked two other things this day: a late lunch and bar show at Kahunaville (prepaid on Groupon) and a naughty (X)Burlesque show to end the night . A 7:30 dinner was stuck right in between the two with not much room on either side.   We arrived on time and were told to wait at the bar where we ordered a drink from Keith. We actually each ordered a bottle of Hell's Keep ($22.70) and he suggested we share the beer because the bottle was a little bigger than normal and we didn't have a long wait. Perfect - and yummy!  With sadness we looked over our menus and realized we'd have to get something smaller than we planned since we'd eaten not long before and had to hustle a little for the 10 pm show (we were told to be there no later than 9).  We wanted to be upfront with our server and told him we would be ordering apps and dessert instead of complete entrees. Since we were at a window seat he said that we would probably have to move to another table near the bar. I understood, since seating is the nicest so they want to give it to the people spending the most, but the WAY he said it was not pleasant. Even though we were allowed to stay in the seats, his attitude the entire meal left a bad taste.   What we ordered: Warm caesar salad ($16.00) Blue cheese souffle ($16.00) Creme Brulee ($12.00)  We both agreed the salad was the best of the three. The dressing was fantastic. The souffle wasn't bad either but we found a much better creme brulee another night at Centercut in Flamingo.  Honestly, we really enjoyed the view and the water show from Bellagio, but when I'm spending $50 on an appetizer and dessert I'd like some class from the staff. We should have just moved to the bar area as soon as he first said it.

rPcCg4_kIz9caHpqkz_IaA.text: What a great experience.   The food is wonderful along with the views of the bellagio fountains.   I went with a group of people and were impressed in the staffs knowledge of food and wine.  This is a good romantic night out on the town.  The thing i like about this resturaunt compared to other high end ones on the Vegas strip is that you don't have resort people walking by in sandals and tank tops since your off the ground.  Will come back again for dinner

TvzZtFt3Ff8AJjB8lAPsIA.text: Went here for our 6 year anniversary and my birthday! We don't usually spend a lot of money on food so we were not sure what to expect. I read mixed reviews so we were hoping for the best. Overall I really enjoyed the experience. We were sat at a table by the window. It was a Sunday night around 7:30 and was somewhat busy. Atmosphere is louder than I expected. I had 3 pieces of bread because I was worried the portions would be small. We ordered the scallops for appetizer. They were the best scallops I've ever had. I was trying to discretely get all the sauce from the plate! We ordered the pork chop and rabbit with two potato dishes on the side. One was mashed and I can't remember the other. Portions were bigger than I thought and I was pleasantly surprised. Waiter was nice and explained the menu and didn't make me feel dumb for asking what certain dishes are. We had a great experience which lasted about 2 hours. I think they intentionally take their time so you can enjoy the view. We had a souffle which was alright. Overall the food was really good and the view was great. If you have the money it's worth a try!

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop appetizer

7SprIqMyqWnZYAx8O0gmGg.text: The view from the top is amazing. Only thing is it's small at the top. So it gets a bit crowded at time, but you can still see a great view. They got viewing scopes at the top which is nice too. You can see the Bellagio fountains from another view up there which is worth waiting for. There is not really a time limit to be up there. You just go and view.  So if you have time wait to see that and take some photos. He bridge walkway yo the elevator is nice before you go up. It's a nice photo op area. They also have a wall of locks that they collect in that area.

XRq6V0HG1pJ3JPoL7YHNMg.text: We couldn't have asked for a better "experience". The reason I say "experience" is because you cant JUST come here for the food (which is outstanding). Our server was experienced and knew the ins and outs of each dish. Not only was he able to answer all our questions, but he seemed truly excited about what was on our plate. The bread, amuse, and dessert were a nice touch, and the VIEW was second to none. I can only imagine what the view is like from the REAL eiffel tower and I would predict that this is better ONLY because of the Bellagio fountains.   The only thing I wished they would do is pipe the music from the fountain show into the restaurant. (Because it's the music WITH the fountains that make it so exquisite.)

Xb3amSaF_HYdBmGcpi0ATw.text: "Spring" Restaurant Week 2013 finally gave me the opportunity to check out le faux Tour Eiffel. In my OpenTable reservation, I mentioned RW and the fact that I would like a seat overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  Silly me. The fountains don't start up until 3pm. We did get our window seat, at least. Though I didn't check out the other side, I'm happy our table was along the window angled toward Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, and the Paris balloon. The view was so enjoyable, we didn't miss the fountains at all.  I suppose I should talk about the food. In a word, it was outstanding. They started us out with the amuse-bouche of the day. It was some sort of sunchoke mousse and it certainly amused my bouche. But the star of the meal for me was the beet salad. Easily the best beet salad I've ever had, the RW menu description reads, "Spring Greens, Smoked Candy Striped, Red And Golden Beets, Fromage Blanc." Delicieux!  Not wanting to turn this into a novel, the main course ("Sauteed Veal Medallion, Green Pea Mousseline, Wild Forest Mushrooms") and dessert ("Mixed Berry Pudding, Strawberry, Blueberry, Raspberry, Framboise, Creme Fraiche") were also fantastic. Wait a second. Framboise means raspberry. Redundant!  The wonderful setting and the fabulous food would be diminished if the service wasn't also impeccable. Our waiter knew we were there for RW and he was very knowledgeable about our meal. I chose to do the $16 wine pairing and I enjoyed his tidbit about Willamette Valley being the same latitude as the best pinot regions in France. Sure made that glass of vin taste just that much better. It was also a nice finishing touch as he brought out a selection of chocolates and candy. My choice of passion fruit jelly was delectable.  Having been to la vraie Tour Eiffel, I've been skeptical about visiting the Vegas version. But this restaurant, with its romantic window tables, has made me a believer. I look forward to returning for dinner with the Bellagio fountains in full force.

vKsjfQcmI87IknyOnMt3-g.text: So I know it seems silly to give this place three stars after a delicious meal but I'm pretty disappointed. I was primarily looking forward to a fabulous view but what I saw instead were the iron support beams littering the restaurant.   What a truly lackluster experience.  The only tables with a great view were the ones directly in front of the windows.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Was pretty good but I expected better

7d38PFuOaQtbOPiWb7FuEQ.text: For the amount you spend on food, you would think they could manage good service. I have nothing negative to say about the food, it was all delicious, and I tried many different things. The duck was great. The salmon and halibut were amazing, the lamb and filet all had great flavor. Now. How did I try all this? We had a work dinner here, and spent a lot of money. The problem? We had to ask 4 times and slip the bus boy some money on the side to get bread. After an hour of being there having drinks and discussing wines and dinner. 4 times. To get bread. After wine glasses were sitting empty for 15 minutes, we were pouring our own wine, when the server comes up appalled that we would do so. Uh, we won't. If you do your job.    If you are spending as much as that place costs. You should get real service.  Extra star for the delicious food.

yJ-esme234yxtW1L_CbnBg.text: First off this has nothing to do with the quality of the food, this has to do with the management and customer service. I have been there 2 times in the past year, once for my anniversary, and the second time for my mother in laws 50th bday. I reserved a table for some late night desert. Their souffle is to die for. When we arrived for our 9pm reservation the hostess asked me if we were there for a special occasion, I told her we were here to have desert and it was my mother in laws 50th bday. So I stated my intentions from the beginning.

3gTBXc4CbN2AdPWTpz8yYQ.text: What a treat! This has to be one of if not my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! You honestly can't go wrong with any dish and be ready for flavor profiles that will blow you away. There food is rich in taste and culture with taking it back to the originals with great dishes like the Beef Wellington and Chocolate Souffle. I can't get enough of this restaurant and be sure to ask the sommelier about  paring a great bottle of wine with dinner, had the Vice Versa this last time and it was mind blowing.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pistachio Soufflé is absolutely incredible as is the chocolate and caramel as well. We had all three!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Please do yourself a favor and get the Beef Wellington, there&#39;s no way to disappoint with this!

9x-HpRn4UCxCcTDkzlcXNQ.text: Love it !!! great customer service. We did have a reservation at 730 took them about 20 min but we did say we didn't my mind waiting extra time for a table with a view of the Bellagio fountains.  Food was great. To drink I had the Eiffel affair which I think tasted like a sangria and the pain killer which was my fave.  Food was good. And desert was good too we got pistachio souffle, since it was our anniversary they also sent us a cute little dessert.  Definitely wear nice clothes if you go and call ahead for reservations.  It is a bit pricey to give you an idea my husband and I spent a little less than 300 dlls so b prepared.

997q2p0Ik69yY8brkq9WrA.text: I brought a large group of 28 customers to this restaurant.  We ordered $80 bottles of wine for each table.  The severs did a bait a switch and brought $350 bottles of wine instead and kept bringing them without approval .  They refused to make it right and I was stuck with a $5k bill.  Be aware ...  Food was just ok , but the scam on the wine was outrageous!!  When I challenged the amount on my American Express , again this restaurant refused to make good on their mistake. Not only that,  they tried to up sell one table ( we were split into three tables ) to a $1200 bottle of wine.  I have emails swearing all this was True from my customers and still they didn't care ...  Terrible experience .

P05vbv3hVAsjneNdsDIF-g.text: Fine dining in the Paris Hotel and Casino at the Eifel Tower overlooking the Bellagio Fountains, what could possibly be better?  First off, you're going to pay to play here; though the prices are *reasonable* for this level of dining in Vegas (it's not Michelin rated or anything), it's still not easy on the budget.  The service and the venue are absolutely 5 stars.  The food was phenomenal as well, but nothing miraculous.  I am going to complain about the wine prices.  The glasses and bottles here are WAY overpriced, even for a place like this; with a corkage fee to match.    If you're a regular Vegas goer, then this needs to be on your list.  It's up there with the Picasso or Michael Mina (my two favorites).

S4F2kx9q6CZKuk_nnzpt1A.text: Oh my gosh. This place was good. BUT EXPENSIVE.   I've never paid $18.00 for a 4 ounce cocktail. Golly. It was good but not enough. Service was good although our server could have tried to smile a little more. The bread was endless and being a sucker for bread, I probably ate more than I should have. We both had a salad which was actually a pretty decent size for the price. There was only one vegetarian entree on the menu (the crepe) and it was excellent.   We had to go see a show and sadly didn't have time to wait for the souffle. We had the chocolate cake which definitely hit the spot.   Our bill was just over $200 for a cocktail, a glass of wine, two salads, two entrees and one shared dessert. Absolutely worth the splurge. We didn't get to enjoy the view as we sat inside but it was for sure one of my favorite dining experiences in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian crepe. Amazing

3yvlfLPfn7P6FFf3Ehdd9w.text: French Restaurant or Dinner Theatre? I have been coming to Eiffel tower restaurant on and off ever since they open. And I can see the changes and it is not all good.  If you go right at opening , around 5pm you can score a table around the window facing the Bellagio fountain, those are mostly table for two. These tables use to be regular rectangular table with the two seat facing each other, as formal dinning should be. After all, you are dining with the other person, so facing each other will be more romantic and better for conversation. Now the table is a semicircle table butting up against the window with the two diner both facing the window. As a result, more tables against the window can be place, ( the space for the two seat are now eliminated). The bad or the good, is now you can ignore each other while dining and just pay attention to the fountain belonging to Bellagio.  Now the service related to this seating. Now the server or the table cleaner have to put his or her arm right between you to do their duty. Again it can be good or bad. Bad when you are having a romantic time and all of a sudden an arm appear between you two at eye level totally disrupting the conversation or moment.  Server at top restaurant will observe you and wait for a breaking moment before they interrupt with their duty, not here. They are the boss not you.  If your want a leisure French dinner, like having a drink and appetizer before deciding on the rest of your dinner,-- like we used to do in this Eiffel Tower restaurant. Forget it. They want you out of there as soon as possible, like a dinner theatre.  They want you to order the entire dinner at once, -- that is what the chef wants -- according to the server. What about what we the paying customer wants?  So you like to be dazzled by the fountain at Bellagio and not so much on the food and enjoyment, this is the place for you.   This place used to be the pinnacle of enjoyment in Las Vegas, you got the feeling that once you are in, you will be taken care of to the best of their ability, like visiting someone house.   No more, it is just grap your money and run. It almost feel like the owner wants to get as money as possible at the shortest time possible before calling going away.

rFlxkKL0ZnVxIn6HOaAx2g.text: My friend and I dined here on a girls trip to Vegas. The food was amazing and great service too. I'd read a few reviews saying the service or food had missed the mark but we went on a busy Saturday night and still had a window seat to view the Bellagio water show. They only take window seat reservations at the 430 seating but we lucked out. We ordered the Escargot which was delicious, the Butternut Squash soup with Duck and a Beet Salad. The flavor of the soup with the Duck in it was incredible.  For our  main course we ordered the Beef Wellington that was worth the price and seasoned and cooked to perfection.  The pistachio souffle for dessert was huge and went down easily even though we were stuffed. I'd love to return here someday.

JQSQZuXYY6FRTPb40NLlYA.text: This review is just for the service, view, and dessert.  Decided last minute to get dessert/drinks here so we could enjoy a nice view of the Bellagio water show without having to pay a lot for dinner. This place does not disappoint! Guys must wear a collared shirt and pants, but they provide that for you if you don't have any. You check in at the bottom and by the time you get off the elevator to the restaurant, someone is waiting there with clothes for you to change into. We sat in the bar area where it's first come, first serve seating. There are 4 seats in this area that have amazing views of the Bellagio water show. There weren't a lot of people at the bar on a Tuesday night, so we got this prime seating pretty easily. If you want a panoramic view and don't mind a pricey dinner, make a reservation in the corner window spots. We got the chocolate souffle, which took about 25 minutes to make, but was delicious and worth the wait! I expected the high prices, but I was a little shocked when my coffee turned up on the bill as $7 and wasn't anything special or even that great. That was my one complaint but everything else, including the service, was fantastic!

UxXW2fWCk6SprY-_pA9yrw.text: REVIEW JUST FOR COCKTAILS:  I was in Vegas with my wife and another couple we know in November 2012, and we decided to grab cocktails at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant bar in the late afternoon.  While the cocktails were pricey, the view rocked as did the drinks.  The French Martini ($16)  was outstanding as was the Vesper ($18)and New Wave ($18).  Our server, Molly, did a great job.    I can't attest ot the food, but for a cocktail and a chill session, this place is great!

K7N-5vOwOU3k7jQ-fm56sw.text: Amazing experience! The food was so good and the staff was so polite and amazing. The view is beautiful and overlooks the strip! Would recommend this to anyone! From the time we walked in to the time we paid for our meal we felt welcomed and taken care of! AMAZING!!

r5R8zP2YrKx7O33EdecMRw.text: Simple fabulous lobster Benedict and flat iron steak for brunch celebrating our 15th anniversary. Had our first meals husband and wife here and the food is still well worth it!! And views just and to the ambiance!

eloUXbLlJao1Vepx66f8hw.text: We went to dinner here last week with some friends while in the area. The view is beautiful! The staff are very friendly (be sure to wear a collared shirt guys! My husband was given one ). The menu had a unique set up, I had the roasted chicken. It is definitely fancy and smaller portions. The price was pretty expensive but so is everything else in Vegas. As a couple expect to spend about $200. The wine list is also enormous and they are helpful in pin pointing the selection! Great ambiance as well!

PvOJkxXp38-l2tkB8X6Oug.text: My wife and I celebrated our 1st anniversary here and had an absolutely wonderful experience.  Cant wait to come back.

f9FWGL3BpG8PHAw79pf64g.text: Food was absolutely amazing! The service couldn't be better. I had the lamb chops and chocolate souffle for dessert. Only downside is the cost of food which is very expensive. The view of bellagio fountains makes for a great experience.

73osHK75PuPCB9cxzlwUxw.text: It's a beautiful experience to dine at The Eiffel Tower restaurant. We reserved a Window table for 2 and the experience of dining facing the Bellagio and the timely fountains was absolutely fantastic. One of the best places for a Romantic dinner date. It felt royal sipping wine watching the Bellagio fountains on a Sunday night. Service was prompt and good. There was a 20min waiting time though we had a reservation. People usually spend 60-90 minutes easily at this restaurant.  The restaurant has unique view of the Strip, Bellagio Fountains from a height and view of the public on the Las Vegas blvd. The window tables are smaller in space and closer to others so you over hear peoples's conversations, but they have a spectacular view which gets you lost in you own world. The official photographs are just about OK for a $25 price. We ordered Salmon Entree and it was good but less in quantity. The wild mushroom and Chicken entree were great.  water/sparkling water are overpriced- blame the spectacular view.

YuIrJnAaV5eSg-20D3OE9Q.text: My fiance and I often go on culinary adventures and have so all over the United States and in other countries. San Francisco, Tahoe, LA, Denver,  Belize, Mexico, the list goes on. Street food, fine dining, we love to eat and will try it all. I don't believe I'm a food snob, but I certainly feel that my pallet recognizes a good meal and quality ingredients when I have them.   We had heard this restaurant would be fantastic...that while expensive, the ambiance, dishes, and drinks would be worth the cost. $360 later for two people, I was both underwhelmed and disappointed. Save yourself the cash and dine elsewhere off the strip. We had a $50 Dim sun meal the very next day that blew this one out of the water. (Yum Cha, btw)  Our experience at the Paris Eiffel Tower was as follows:  Cocktails:  wine w/ tar tar  wine w/ ceasar salad  wine w/ pork entree and new york with peppercorn sauce, creamed spinach and potatoes a gratin  Dessert  With reservations we were promptly seated and had a very nice spot, but we were about 12" from couples next to us on either side.  We started with a sazerac and a bulleit old fashioned. I had expected a decent crushed and brandied cherry, and whole muddled sugar cubes, but my $22 drink arrived with a cheap, formaldehyde-filled neon, red cherry and tasted just okay.   We like to move through the menu, perusing and choosing as we go...but were told we had to order all at once. "That's how it works here" reported our waitress. Fine, okay, can do.   I had barely finished 2 sips of my cocktail before our wine, tar tar and bread arrived. I immediately had to ask the waitress to slow down, please. The request was met with a curt response and our wine and tartar sat untouched in the 6pm sunlight for easily 10 minutes before we were ready for it... A dish meant to be served cold as was the pinot (cool, not room temp). This seemed like a rookie screw up on her part. Can't help but feel service should be impeccable in comparison to cost of food. Also, wine pours were closer to 4-5oz. Not a standard 6 oz pour. At $22/glass, you'd think you'd get a full pour for a Russian River Pinot. Not exactly a rare vintage or anything. Despite timing and temperature of food, the tartar with the truffle oil was easily my favorite part of our entire meal. It was quite tastey.  After the tartar, we moved on to the ceasar. It was okay. Not much in the way of anchovie chunks as I had hoped for. No fresh parmesan offered, not warm though advertised that way on the menu.  My last portion of the meal was a pan seared, $64, a la carte, new york. Had requested med-rare. It came medium. Peppercorn sauce on the side was flavorless and overly peppery. Usually these sauces tend to be creamy and made with cognac. This was just a cream based sauce with green peppercorn. Again, just okay. The au gratin was also suprisingly flavorless, so was the creamed spinach. I honestly found my fiance's pork tenderloin dish to be much more palatable with interesting textures and flavors. Though small in size, I would have gladly traded places with him. The pork was decent but the portion of meat was only approximately 5 oz at most.  Lastly, we finished the meal with desert. Two days ago and I can't honestly tell you what it was, I don't remember. That memorable.   Stopped to use restroom on the way out. Powder room attendant was distracted and chatting away on her phone. So much for that.   Overall, I was perturbed at the experience. Thank goodness for my positive and lively dinner date. Time spent with him makes any dinner more enjoyable. Our wallet wouldn't have agreed and at that price, I would have expected a more memorable and positive experience.   TLDR: Eat elsewhere, have enjoyed WAY better meals at other steak houses for much less. You aren't paying for the food, you're paying for the ambiance. If you'd like a great view, this is it, however dishes, food, and service are sub par. Just, Meh.

ZGNgFxzmyKzKpj4Rh0malQ.text: We stayed at the Paris hotel and this restaurant was a must ...  the view was amazing service impeccable and the food was great.  This is the place to go have dinner when you're feeling lucky in Vegas.

pcwIGSsoNTgwOiKbQ2iVYw.text: Stopped here for drinks and superb views of the water fountains, certainly a lovely spot for special occasions and such, enjoy your time high away form it all and watching the crowds swarming below.

0H8-hLBIFuwX9ki_2cnJcw.text: Background story... several years ago, my husband and I went to Paris, France. We had reservation for dinner on the Eiffel Tower. A day before our reservation, Paris was hit by terrorist attacks. We never got to visit the real Eiffel Tower.  Fast forward, it's my birthday and he takes me to Las Vegas and books a reservation for my birthday dinner at the Paris Eiffel Tower. It's not the real one but it definitely feels like it and the views are awesome. Now to the food... I had the seafood tower and he had the New York steak with potatoes.  The food was delicious and prepared perfectly. The ambiance is great for date night or special occasion.  Service was top notch!!! I would recommend to our friends and family. See you next time!

AhIj7PoV9OF-x6exg-n--Q.text: We came here few years ago, level of service was so much better. I regret coming here again. made reservation, showed up 10 min early, they made us seat 7 wait 20 min after our reservation time, but I saw lot of empty tables, I don't like that part where restaurant make you wait..  & wait & wait. what's the point..Food was mostly good, aside my steak, was really chewy & not cooked. (if you're charging me $85  for steak it better be top shelf)   On the plus side the view is really cool, but I'm not paying $$$$ for that experience again.

TnjdXrmtZJmdWUiHDXErmg.text: All around lovely and elegant.   The Eiffel Tower restaurant is a wonderful place to come for a beautiful and fancy dinner, but my favorite time to come is actually for lunch. It is casual during the lunch hour so you don't need to dress up, Their mid day menu is lighter yet still has fancy options as well; I recommend the stacked BLT which is a site to behold, and the burger. The bread and butter is incredible, and the mini dessert favors they bring at the end of your meal are exquisite. You cannot beat the views, and if you are lucky enough to be there when the Bellgio fountains are performing it is pretty special. This is an excellent place for a romance or a fun family memory, make sure to get your picture taken at the top!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fnu-E_5crjRGbOFGS3HpNw.text: The food is delicious, the tour BLT was fantastic especially if you like avocado. The reason for the 3 stars was not for the view, which is breathtaking, but mainly because of the cost. A glass of wine was somewhat pricey. Overall, the food is delicious, the view amazing, and one of the coolest bathroom that I've seen in the strip with its couch!

rqLGsUE48Mu7yzSLK_pcag.text: I love trying new places in my home town! A friend has her birthday here otherwise I probably wouldn't of tried it to be honest. Plan on spending $200 a person. My husband and I both had the beef Wellington. It was very good but I've had better steak in Vegas. The escargot wasn't the best I've had but the steak tartare was fantastic. Now the best thing of the night had to be the pistachio souffle! Too good to even get a picture. I'd come back just for wine and desert next time. Great views of the Bellagio's water show. Great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c-2SMKPqj9r7ifA6eY_qdQ.text: Very disappointed. We made a reservation for 9:30pm. But when we arrived they said they closed. We didn't receive any notice for this. After they told us this, we barely can find a good place to eat. Ruin our day totally. :(

_66tNXKBP6P6s4Ns-aYG6A.text: Great experience having lunch here today. Easy to get a window table (since it was Monday); service was very prompt and friendly; food was great. Keep in mind the Bellagio fountains don't usually begin until 3 pm on weekdays.   Food:  - Creamy French Onion Soup: has the consistency of potato leek soup, but tastes just like the traditional French Onion. Was a little salty, and was very rich. Felt pretty full after it.   - Filet of Trout: really phenomenal. The fish was cooked perfectly and came apart easily. The skin was the perfect amount of crispiness, and I was impressed that this texture was maintained even though the skin side faced down on the plate. Came with delicious wild rice that complimented the flavor of the fish.   - Creme brulee: really creamy, not too sweet; great presentation as it came with a beautiful crepe fan.   Atmosphere: Upscale vibe without being stuffy; has the Eiffel Tower detailing. Great view of the Bellagio and the Strip. Bar in the center of the restaurant.   Service: Really friendly and attentive. Good details like great bread at the beginning and a choice of bonbon before you leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crème brûlée

RaL0b6rDJtbGu7aWXQ07DQ.text: Hubby and I celebrated our wedding anniversary here in October.  We had our daughter with us.  We were seated in a short amount of time (5-10 minutes) after we checked in for our dinner reservation.  The staff and food were excellent.   I would recommend getting the souffle for dessert.

_XpUJRXxoXHeEQkJc2KutQ.text: To celebrate Randy's birthday, I booked a reservation here for 11:30 brunch on opentable 90 days ago.  Service is impeccable, setting is elegant and the view breath taking.   We dressed up for the occasion, full suit with vest and tie and i wore a gold and white white dress.  We arrived and everyone else was more casual .   The server was friendly and lovely.  We ordered seafood salad and lobster Benedict. They constantly refill water and make the experience memorable.  Randy loved the view as we had the perfect table.   At the end they gave him a chocolate mousse for his birthday.   Complimentary chocolate and candies are given. Perfect beginning and ending  Thank you Ruben for being fantastic  Stunning views, beautiful blue sky, perfect company and lovely food make this a memorable birthday experience

P1ELVjAZ_92FAFpyatRo5g.text: What can I say about this place that will do it justice!? They were beyond amazing! I took my girlfriend there as my pre-proposal lunch because she loves everything Parisian.  And even though the proposal didn't happen until we were at the top of the Eiffel Tower, the lead up to it from the restaurant was absolutely above and beyond.  First, I only mentioned that was going to propose to her sometime that day and they went ahead and put us at the most impressive table in the restaurant. (Corner table, facing the fountains) And the staff was just so accommodating and they were all very hands on. Everyone from the host at the bottom to the maitre'd who made us feel extremely welcome up until the end.   Our server was Arianna D. She was informative, very professional, warm and patient with us. She made sure all the aspects of our meal was perfect.  My napkins was even folded for me when I went to the bathroom. That's good training and its the small details that differentiates restaurants and separates them above the rest. Our server assistant was Paul and he was extremely attentive and checked on us regularly.  He made sure not a single crumb was left on the table between courses.  Our maitre'd for the day was Carmella and she was very warm and informative up until the very end. She even let us know and talked to us about the cook book that was left at the front of the restaurant.  My lady had the Eggs Benedict and I had the NY strip and they were both cooked to perfection. So so so so so good!  And lastly when I called to get the names of everyone involved it was Diana on the phone who was so polite and professional with her assistance in finding out the information for me.  We are definitely going to make this location a tradition for us. And whatever you folks are doing at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is clearly working! Keep up the fantastic, stellar, performance! Bravo! And even though I did not actually propose to her in the restaurant, it will forever tied to the perfect moment either one of us and our family members will ever forget. We cannot wait to go back!

fcZEeIWwGk0Pe0NUnAAT-w.text: Definitely make reservations.  Some people say you have to make reservations months in advance, but I managed to get reservations for 7pm on a Thursday in August by doing it online the night before.  Be warned, they do require a credit card for a deposit, and they will charge you $100 if you do not show up.    This place is very popular, and it's popular for a reason.  The atmosphere is awesome, amazing views, and absolutely SUPERB service.  Yes, it is expensive, but they really deliver on the WOW factor.  It's very classy.  If you can score it, you should try and get a reservation near the windows overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  I've seen them from street level several times, but seeing them from above is really cool, and makes for an extra special evening.  The waiters know everything about all of their wines, beers, and each and every menu item.  They can describe each menu item, how it is prepared, and even offer suggestions.  The entrees do not include any sides, so they are ordered a la carte ($12) but they are a decent size, so order two of them and share.  Vegetable and Quinoa Wellington, Tomato and Heirloom Basil Coulis - it was ok, but I should have opted for a meat option at a place like this, instead of vegetarian option. You gotta live a little, right?  The Broiled 16 oz Ribeye with Roasted Bone Marrow is also an excellent choice.  One of the most flavorful, well marbled (but not full of fat and gristle) ribeyes I have ever tasted in my life.  It was a perfect cut of meat, and cooked perfectly, as requested.  Our sides were the  Brown Butter Roasted Asparagus, Parsley, Egg, and the Classic Potato Gratin.  The potato gratin was the best of the two sides - I recommend it.  If you order it and don't think it's the best you have ever had, I will happily refund your money. ;-)  Final note - it seems that the management reads the Yelp reviews on a regular basis, so I want to give a shout out to our server, Will S.  The food was awesome and I had no complaints, but without his superb service, patience, and knowledge of every menu item, this review might not have received five stars.  I really hope you relay this message to Will.  The service is definitely five stars at this place.

FfFyIHhG18LDi98UndTomw.text: I am updating my review. After I sent a review after our bad experience from back in February, the manager, Sharon, contacted me and invited us to come back and she also provided us with a gift certificate to make up for it. We agreed and are very happy that we got to go back.   We got to eat our favorite meals that we always get, the staff were great and we even got to have a table by the window overlooking the fountains. At the end of our meal, Sharon came over and spoke to us. We thanked her for the opportunity and we are still very pleased with the restaurant.

Dy5FzIoLOKiThRaOH33Bzw.text: Came in last week for my husband's birthday dinner.   I had requested a particular table and I'm so appreciative that they were able to accommodate us.  There's just something about being treated well and having great customer service on top of that amazing view and that impressive menu.  Our server Anthony was very welcoming,  helpful,  attentive and professional.   Every time he came by, he had a warm smile and was incredibly pleasant.     We decided to order drinks that we haven't had before.  So we ordered Paris Paloma and Eiffel Affair.   They were both good.   Paris Paloma came with berries in the drink and a spoon on the side to eat the fruit.  It was pretty much a Sangria.   A great Sangria that is!    After couple of nibbles, we were ready for more drinks.  I got my typical Pink Velvet (my absolute favorite here!) and my husband got a bottle of Stella.   Market Greens was a delicious salad that we shared.  I loved the presentation and plating.    My Rossini Filet Mignon was tender, delicious and cooked perfectly for my taste.  Definitely something I will order again!  My husband loved his Vegetables Wellington.   He completely cleared his plate.  That's impressive as he rarely does that.  We ordered Potato Gratin to share and it was delicious as always!  Once again,  we were too full to order dessert.   But Anthony brought over a chocolate mouse birthday plate for my husband and a little tastings plate of delicious little sweet bites.  If you've never been to this restaurant,  do yourself a favor and plan it into your next Vegas trip.  Make sure to make reservations ahead as it does fill up.    It's one of those experiences where you dress up and have great service which makes you feel great.  It's definitely a must do when in Vegas.

X8PPUXhLD32VDajoLDeWIQ.text: The Eiffel tower makes a perfect date night or just a great night out! I loved my broiled lobster with some creamed spinach on the bottom & then baked with some herb breadcrumbs! Yummy!   We also got a side of the potatoes au gratin that were awesome and green beans that were nice and crispy and served with a foam. And, we loved the views of the gorgeous Bellagio fountains!   We wanted Moscato wine but there wasn't any but our wonderful waiter, John, recommended a different wine that was equally as good. Speaking of which, John was an excellent waiter and he made the whole dining experience even better. We also loved that they gave us little pieces of chocolate, they were delicious and it was a nice little treat!
