q9ZwuZ_sqi4GLnV_7i0AEg.text: My boyfriend made reservations here and they required a $100 deposit fee. If you cancel, say goodbye to $100! Arrived at the restaurant at 8:30 PM on a Thursday and got seated right away! (YAY) My boyfriend and I were lucky because we got seated near the window, overlooking the Bellagio fountains. FYI, being seated near the window is first come first serve. :P   Food: We've received a complimentary cucumber appetizer (not sure what the name was) which was a refreshing way to start our meals. We had ordered the gratinee creamed spinach, mushroom and lobster bisque which were both great appetizers and full of flavor.   Entrees, I order the individual Eiffel tower beef wellington, sauteed snap peas and it was top notch. The crust on the outside of the steak was heaven and the steak on the inside was juicy and well flavored. (Drools!) As for the boyfriend, he ordered the baked 1 1/2 pound Maine lobster, herb crust, spinach Florentine which was the prettiest and biggest lobster I have ever seen. Not only was it pleasant to look at but it was chewy and tasty as well.   As for dessert, we received a complimentary chocolate dessert and on the plate, they wrote happy anniversary. That was such a lovely surprise. Our server also recommended other desserts and when he mentioned souffle and pistachio, I knew I had to get it! (Please note that it takes approximately 20 minutes to make). Hands down the best souffle I had ever tasted. So light, delicate, and tastes like you're eating a cloud!!   Ambiance: Walked into a room with dimmed light setting perfect for romantic dates. What made it more special were the lit lights on the strip and the famous Bellagio fountains across the street. The size of the restaurant was decent. Loved the red interior, made the restaurant look classy and edgy.  Service: Our server was nice and informative. The only complaint I had is the lack of communication we had when we wanted our food to go. We only ate half our meals hoping to take the rest to go, but when we asked for our check and our leftovers he told us he had tossed our food away. :( Be sure to let your server know if you would like your food to go. This is why I had to dock a star.

cmZn2f5UyJ9Op01R-roi5w.text: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is AMAZING!!!  I have been several times and it's always a great experience!!!  I recently went through a terrible divorce and 7/29 was my wedding anniversary.  I live in the San Francisco Bay Area and I decided to come to Las Vegas to privately acknowledge my anniversary. I came to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant because I knew I would have an amazing experience and I knew that the great experience would help numb the pain I feel.   I love sitting at the bar and conversing with other patrons while watching the beautiful Bellagio fountains. The bartenders are absolutely fantastic and their service is absolutely top notch and flawless. Ridge, in particular, was absolutely amazing! I forget the other gentleman's name from 7/29 but I think his name is Matt (so sorry I can't remember)? He was excellent as well and on 7/30 Cory was working with Ridge at the bar and he was excellent as well. Actually, on 7/30 I lost a contact lens. Luckily I found it and Cory was very kind in lending me his eye drops ... lol  Ridge was present both nights and again, he was fantastic! I absolutely loved our conversations and his attention to detail. Because he was simply being himself,  and without knowing it, Ridge helped put me in a better place.   I am very appreciative and grateful for their hospitality and kindness. I'll be back in town 11/29/19 - 12/2/19 and The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is at the top of my list to visit! I'm definitely a customer for life!

qW-y0jDnYhVfZRbPN2Zq6Q.text: Been here twice now and I can honestly say the staff, food and ambiance is truly outstanding here. Had a reservation for 9:30pm. Checked in around 9:15 and immediately were seated. Our view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains were breathtaking.   Maria, (I think that was her name), greeted us and gave us the drink and wine menus. Her assistant, didn't get his name, served us water as we were looking over the menu.   We ordered the Queen Filet Mignon, Brown Butter asparagus and olive oil mashed potatoes. The filet was perfectly cooked medium rare. So tender and mouth watering. The asparagus was tender and al dente and the olive oil mashed potatoes matched perfectly with the meal.   We ended the meal with Pistachio and Grand Mariner souffles. (Order the souffles when you order your food because it takes 30 minutes to make). The souffle were so light and tasted so good. Totally recommend this to finish off your meal.  We paid $239 before tip, so it's not a cheap, but this place is totally worth the price!

-OHILltG9e6BfNEEO-aDGQ.text: First things first, this review is not about the food because unfortunately we didn't have the opportunity try it.   My bf had booked reservations online on Jan 15 for 10pm for May 28th to celebrate our anniversary. He had made them this late because we had tickets to go Celine Dion, and we wanted to be sure we made it. Online it states that you can make a reservation up to 1130pm. On May 18th my bf got a text from the restaurant asking if we would like to move the reservations earlier to 930, to have a table seat. My bf had stated that we were going to see Celine Dion and wanted to make sure we would make it on time before he confirmed. The person who texted him (not sure if it was a manager, owner, event planner), ensured him that it was a 90 minute show and we would make it on time. So he confirmed seeing as the text was confident.   On Tues, while we were watching Celine Dion, we looked down at the time realizing it was 915 and didn't want to miss our reservation. So we left the show early, and later found out that this show does not end until 945 ( so we missed 30 minutes of it). We didn't get out of the hotel until about 930 as my bf was on the phone with this restuarant to inform them we would be about 10 minutes late. After holding for 10 minutes, someone picks up the phone and informs my bf that they weren't seating anymore people after 930. He had reminded them that our original reservation was at 10, and that we would've made it on time to that.  They continued to tell him they weren't seating anyone else and moved our reservation over to another restaurant.   I'm very unhappy with how this situation was handled, seeing as we would've made it to our original reservation. If your plan was to close early, maybe send an email stating that rather then just moving up our reservation time informing us we would've made it. Because of that text, we not only missed eating here but also missed the last half of our show.

z5CHmdTpxXrAVGZ9ABzbfQ.text: Update:  Because I come to Vegas quite often (dual residency lol- I just like to gamble and party) I stopped by here.  Thanks to Lyle for inviting me back. This time around was a much better experience.  Chris was our server and he was so much more pleasant than the server I had previously.  5 Stars for Chris! (I hope that was his name)   Food:  *Slow Braised Smoked Pork Belly Lyonnaise Style *Baked 1 1/2 Pound Maine Lobster, Herb Crust, Spinach Florentine *The King- Broiled Beef Tenderloin Filet Mignon *Chocolate Souffle  Washed down with a couple of glasses of the Paso Robles Cabernet. (Idk name)  The beef was cooked to perfection and very tender. The pork belly is always a hit and the lobster was out of this world. All these different flavors bursting in my mouth that I loved each bite.   Lastly, we were given the option to have a complimentary photo but I kindly declined. (Minus 1 Star due to the mishap of my previous visit)   Definitely will return again and would highly recommend this beautiful restaurant.

jiTY_lzt0BasqelwQvPEWg.text: We came here for brunch and wow, it did not disappoint!  Service was amazing and the view was spectacular. We sat in the corner table over looking the Bellagio fountains.  Highly recommend requesting this table as it's the best view.  The food was very thoughtful and well made.    Warm foie gras with Apple compote was rich and decadent and was complemented well by the sweet tart apples   Avocado and seafood salad.  Such a simple dish but my gosh it is flavorful.  The seafood was light sweet and tender.  Wow!  Must get  Lobster Benedict was the star!  Wow.  Cooked to perfection and perfectly balanced with the creamy hollandaise sauce.    Steak and eggs.  Steak cooked perfectly and super tender.  Melted in my mouth.    Apple strudel was delicious and very big portion. Served with creamy cinnamon ice cream.     Trio of sorbets.  The raspberry and mango were fresh tart and creamy!!!  It was paired with sour cream gelato.  Yes. Sour cream and it tasted like it sounds.  It is interesting but paired well with the sweeter fruit sorbets   We will definitely be back!

glr6RxEhYQzeSYujt6DpEg.text: The restaurant is extremely expensive for my budget so I have never dinned there.   I have been to the observation deck several times and highly recommend it. There is no better place to watch the Bellagio Fountain performance than from up here. The best part it's the is no time limit so you can be up there until your ready to head down. The first time I went, I was at the top for over 30 minutes and see the fountain show twice.   If you are thinking of going to this attraction check Groupon first. They often have a deal for tickets. The only feedback I have is the amount of people they allow up at once. They oversell and it can be very crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eiffel Tower

RqsTVUGDCIL_XprMzryVyQ.text: What an impressive dining experience. I have to be honest, I had my doubts about this place being that I've dined at the actual Eiffel Tower in Paris. My assumption was it would be highly overrated; but it actually turned it to be a memorable night. When entering the tower through the elevator and arrive at the restaurant floor you are faced toward the large opened kitchen layout with many chefs hard at work. Then you walk over to the hostess stand and then sit at the beautiful bar directly next to the hostess and indulge in a cocktail while you await seating. You can't help but notice all of the other patrons dressed to impress and the smooth jazz music playing in the background. The dim lighting sets the mood for all of the couples eagerly waiting to be seated.  My reservation was set at 8:30 pm with a window view of the Bellagio fountain so when it began we would have a minor show while we ate. The view was immaculate, the service was top notch, and the mood of the restaurant was well appreciated.  As we placed our order for dinner with our server we were asked if we would like to put in an order for the souffle for dessert right then because it takes a half hour to prepare. I absolutely love souffles so of course I said yes. There were a couple of different options like Grand Marnier, strawberry, and one other I cannot remember at this moment. I asked for the Grand Marnier souffle. They also provided complimentary bread and butter and for the appetizer we asked for the crab legs. These crab legs were like nothing I've ever tasted. We almost asked for a second crab leg but I thought it may be too much food. We ordered the Bison entree and the rack of lamb entree. I loved my lamb and the bison was well prepared as well. I was randomly asked if I'd like a blanket because it was cold in the restaurant which I agreed to but was surprised it was such an adorable red silky shawl like blanket. I thought that was cute. Finally, the souffle presented itself and I swallowed the souffle like it was about to run away from me. It was gone in a minute and that's not an exaggeration. Loved it all!

SY2ZBNuTygG02ILo1c6B3w.text: So we stopped here before dinner for some drinks. The service was phenomenal! The bartender that took our order was named Ridge. He was extremely attentive and chatted with us for a bit. I love experiences like this! The view is also incredible! If you want a nice place for drinks, I highly recommend the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.

-2nysY7N7jLGo4HjuVwn9w.text: I loved my experience at this place!  Booked the restaurant through open table. I was happy that I could change my arriving time 3 times lol- in Vegas is difficult to count time. When I booked the table, I asked for the table next to the window, and by surprise, we got one of the best views- the fountains of Bellagio. Our waiter, don't remember name, was polite, friendly and highly professional. All food was well prepared and tasteful. I had fish that had smooth taste and my boyfriend had duck that he enjoyed.  The most I liked it was my appetizer- foie grass, and dessert- mix of sorbets. But of course, the view was top notch! Highly suggesting! Actually, try to come later around 8 pm and you will have less people.

ETxCSKJN8PQ877iWSSeutA.text: Incredible! The view, the service, and food were all 5 stars! If I could give more I would!  We went and had great window seats and had a perfect view of the Bellagio Fountain show.   I had the Pino Noir Salmon and the gratin and both were phenomenal. The sauce and breadcrumbs made the salmon so worth the price. The gratin was the best I have ever had!  My husband has "The Queen" and brown butter asparagus and both were delicious! It may look like a small cut but it's so thick and was very filling.  Our server was the best and brought us a cute little dessert and truffles for our anniversary.  If you're looking for a nice dinner and don't mind spending a good amount, this is the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert with a view!

9IDgS8eZpQQEup6EI-ltGw.text: Las Vegas is one of my favorite cities in the world, go ahead and judge me. There's nowhere else you can visit New York City, Venice, and Paris in one afternoon, or travel back in time to ancient Rome or Alexandria or medieval England. Sure, it's all fake, including the Eiffel Tower in which this restaurant sits. But you say potato, and I say po-tah-to. This is one of those cases in which I urge you to embrace the cheese and spring for a lovely dinner in this beautiful restaurant. Make sure to arrive early enough to snag one of the window seats so that you can watch the beautiful water show at the Bellagio just across the street as you dine on some of the finest food on the strip.  I've made a point of having a dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant on each of my most recent trips to Vegas, and give it my highest rating. Everything is on point - the location and the views, the insanely attentive and polite waitstaff, and the FOOD. Bread service is complimentary and boasts several varieties and you wait on delectable seafood, steak, and fowl. I've enjoyed The Queen, a scrumptious steak, as well as an outstanding red snapper there. My mother pronounced their roast chicken the best she'd ever had in her life, and y'all, she isn't an easy woman to please.   Most exciting of all are their souffles, which change with the season. Last fall we enjoyed pumpkin, and this summer it was strawberry rhubarb. Both times, it was absolutely divine. Looking forward to my next trip already!

PPHfUY28-P5GLKCbdKaXUg.text: There was a total of 9 people for our party. We were sat at exactly 7:30pm for our reservation. Our server was amazing and was accommodating. I have been here 2x now and the food I can honestly say is sub par (this is minus their amazing souffle). It is just not memorable and not worth the $$$.  Service: prompt and friendly. Our serve made our finding experience great. The dining room is quite tight and did not have any space for people to walk through.   Views: the view is amazing, you get the Bellagio fountains  and view of Paris hotel.   Food: our party ordered the rib eye, bone marrow, filet mignon (king and queen) bison and beef Wellington. All the side dishes you order separately. The rib eye was not flavorful and somewhat tough, that's being nice. Rib eye was just not aged. So disappointing. The side dishes were prepared perfectly, mushroom medley, creamed spinach, mashed potatoes and asparagus. The bison was prepared perfectly and was delicious. The filets were mediocre, and lacked flavor. All the entrees were not memorable and was missing flavor. For the price you pay, the food was forgettable.  Desserts: if you come here, you must get one of their souffles!!! This was the most amazing part of dinner. So soft and so amazing!! We also ordered their white chocolate and banana dessert, so good.   Conclusion: we loved the views, the service and the dessert. If we were to come back, we would sit in the bar and order their souffle. Wouldn't dine for dinner again.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PPUxzBShbcMMSyXWWXJLsw.text: Finally made it back here and totally worth it, one of the few restaurants that serve my favorite Foie gras as a lunch option so had to get both hot and cold versions. Everything was delicious and that stuffed French was one of the best we've had in a long time. The molten lava cake was perfect and you couldn't beat the view. This restaurant is a must in Vegas.

Y9_B91fUmJ2cjzEja5ehyA.text: There are many really great restaurants to choose from in Vegas so when you repeat a restaurant, you know it must be good! This was our second time dining at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and we were not disappointed. We split the steak tartare for an appetizer. For dinner I had the individual beef Wellington and my husband had the prime aged New York Steak. Both were excellent, though in hindsight I wished I had ordered the salmon (which I had on our last visit) since we also had a red meat appetizer. I wasn't thinking about that when I ordered and was satisfied with my meal, but a little variety on the protein would have been nice, too. We split the spinach side dish and for dessert we had a complimentary chocolate dessert for my birthday and ordered the hazelnut cake which was divine! We also split a bottle of Pinot Noir recommended by our waiter. Very delicious!   I made reservations online and requested a view of the fountains and they were able to satisfy that request. All in all another amazing experience!
