Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ggw7mllZzqyJl3kTaug_cw.text: A great spot for a romantic treat.  The views of the strip are spectacular if you can get seated along the windows, which we were.  Service was impeccable and very friendly - none of the stuffiness that fancy French places sometimes seem to think adds to the experience.  We were treated to a delicious little creamy corn soup amuse-bouche - ooh lala!  The wine was very good and a nice selection of by-the-glass choices.  We both had the petite filet, and both were excellent.  And we ordered the souffle, which was mouth-watering and timed perfectly to the end of the meal.  The only hiccup was a rather difficult-to-deal-with ceasar salad that we split.  The dressing was okay, but quite oily, and since the romaine was served in the "traditional" un-chopped style, it ended up just being a pain.  But overall we were really pleased with the meal and felt it was worth the (very large) bill.

jCGB1gB1JVP9bfwcvnYhJg.text: Absolutely the Worst! Where should I begin, how about being sick with intestinal disorder tithe entire next day! Or maybe ordering the Venison Medium and having it come out blood red and cold.  Or making reservations three weeks in advance and getting seated facing away from the "Strip" overlooking the parking deck in a converted  room  designed for storage but used for dinning.  I was told that they had 700 reservations for the night. My wife had the Lamb, with a side of undercooked Cold tomato ratatouille. We think this is what got us sick. If you want to have a $100 per person dinner, have terrible underprepared food and be put in perhaps the worst seat in a restaurant that promotes it's view and be sick the next day then call the Eiffel Tower Restaurant, they will be happy to accomadate.

ggTuIQD341M12b4wQ0ixbg.text: I LOVE this place. My husband and I visit every month or so for an amazing evening on the strip. The foie gras is seared perfect and always a generous portion is served. Opt for the tasting menu with wine pairing. Also this is the BEST souffle I've ever had - share a chocolate and pistachio with your date for the perfect end to a perfect meal! Yum!

bqjfyuRoVo1SZIkOo0lNYA.text: Absolutely over overpriced. Food is OK  to decent. CaN'T BE a chef in the kitchen just a lot of cooks is what my taste buds tell me. Quality of meats fish etc is top so you are safe with a steak. However, there is no special touch added to these dishes. Place is not set up to give individual attention before being seated. They have a system that requires a queue check in. Not exactly first class The elevator leaves you in the kitchen. Young women at reception are full of themselves and not very welcoming. I sent back a soup that was supposed to be lobster based. Medium sized bowl was $18; soup was light not tasty and had never been near a lobster. Wine prices are ridiculous, even for LV. A lowly Broully goes for $70+. That's about a 500% markup. The $75 corkage charge guarantees you will pay mucho if you must have wine. This place reminds me fondly of The Jules Verne restaurant in the real Eiffel Tour in Paris. It now has 2 Michelin Stars allowing it to charge high prices. However, the food and service are impeccable at about twice the price of the LV Eiffel. The view of the Seine and Chaillot Palace are stunning. You can see the Bellagio fountains for free at street level or even stay at Bellagio for less than your tab at this Eiffel. Oh: Lest I forget. The service has always been professional here. Why am I not surprised that Michelin has stopped rating Las Vegas restaurants. Walking through the now tacky Paris Hotel is not a great appetizer either.

CwcjkO81pKOI9NrU7yCBEw.text: The caviar was a little bit sloppy but the 500$ champagne made up for it. The cheesecake was amazing though

m_tro_6H2S1AGLTL4Qiytw.text: Two of my favorite reviewers, Blair B. & Elizabeth L., checked in with 5-star reviews of this joint, so against my natural impulse to RUN...RUN FARRRR AWAY from this place considering its cheese-tacular setting and it's in the Paris, which is just a gotawful hotel, (with albeit a really good Double Deck Blackjack pit) I decided to give it the ol' college try. Hmmm. Niiiiiiice. How do I put this? The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is like that girl you knew in college that you'd see across the auditorium in PoliSci 103 that didn't really look 'all that' from afar so you didn't pay much attention to her. That is, until your pal tells you that she was at the kegger the other night that you missed to study for your Stats final and it turns out she's kinda cool but deliberately hides her face in class, wears a Chargers jersey on the weekends, and can down 5 shots of Patron faster than that chick Marion from 'Raiders'. So you check her out just for yuks and you discover that she's actually immensely cool, really smart - heck, she's acing the class - on top of being about a solid '9' & you realize you've been a total dick for pre-judging her and wasting your time not getting to know her better. But by then your sophomore year's over and she transfers to another UC, changes her digits, and you never see her again. Ever! DAMMMMMMMMIT!!! Hmrph.. uh, where was I? THE FOOD? THE VIEW? Oh yeah. Food's good. And the view's pretty awesome, what with the fountains and strip and all. Your girl will definitely dig it. This is classic French cuisine and eating here made me feel like I was cheating on Andre Rochat. We're eating French here, so you should know that the dishes will be small, right? And you should go with classic French dishes, right? Duck 2 Ways, Rack of Lamb, or Venison. Fois Gras & Escargot. And so here we go: Duck 2 Ways: 5/5 Rack of Lamb: 5/5 Venison: 4/5 Fois Gras: 5/5 Escargot: 4/5 ("When in France..." you eat French food, right? So who the heck goes to a French restaurant & says, "I'll have the seabass"? Cripes - would you like a bowl of Miso soup with that?) THE ATMOSPHERE? This is for the most part, a really elegant, classy restaurant with prompt and formal service. I did notice an interesting theme however - that service quality appeared proportional to one's dress, so consider yourself forewarned. I came in a sportcoat, dress shirt & slacks. ....Did you ever wonder why Andre Rochat, famous for his Las Vegas French cuisine, never built an "Andre's" or an "Alize" in the only French themed hotel in Vegas? Well, it might have something to do with the LOUD, CLASSLESS JACKASSES & THEIR OFFSPRING THAT PERMEATE THE PARIS HOTEL. If there's one item that does not belong in any fine dining establishment, it's a HIGH CHAIR. ...I'm sorry, but I really can't ignore this point. The food is quite good but the environment while I was dining, was downright teeth-grating at times. I can see why they are enforcing a dress code. Too bad it's not enough. CONCLUSION: Focus on the food. Dodge the tourists, go on the off season, and get to know this beauty of a restaurant. Lest she disappear, a victim of the Vegas economy and you never get your chance. 4-stars. ------------------ INSIDER'S HINT: LAST MINUTE RESERVATIONS The place is the only joint that fills up with reservations at Paris. If you get in late, and you can't get a reservation by calling into the direct line, go to opentable.com and try getting a reservation there. Eiffel Tower is available on OpenTable which often can get you reservations when none are otherwise available because the restaurant has to "keep a few seats open" for the service.

krzzvLjJpFUgp3iZqge2rg.text: Even the view couldn't save this restaurant.  Cramped seating and spotty service.  They did provide the best beef carpaccio ever to touch my lips.  Bring me down to lower ground-something like Picasso at Bellagio!

DgNsEhRZiK5EzeY4WFaAxQ.text: This Was one of, if not THE, best dining experiences I've had.   Our table was at the window facing the Bellagio, which could see the fountains going off 4-5 times during our dinner. It was an amazing view. The service was also well above average. Our waiter was great.   As for the food, we got a complimentary flan+braised duck appetizer which was interestingly good. I ordered the roasted pear salad and my wide got the creamy lentil soup. Both were very very good. For our main course we got braised short ribs and beef Wellington. Also some potatoes gratin and their asperigus dish. Each of these were AMAZING. The asparigus was so crisp and fresh, and the potatoes were so creamy and good. The beef dishes were cooked perfectly. We also had some really good wine and champagne.    At the end, we got a complementary shot glass sized chocolate moose and cream dessert. We also ordered an apple strudel and cinnamon ice cream dessert which was really good.   I have to say, this place was amazing. I'd go back in a heartbeat....though it also might have been one of the most expensive meals i've has too. It was worth it though.

LwzAz2v9hP972mDvf5RNOg.text: Service was extremely slow. Food was bland. Other than the view, I wouldn't recommend this place. You can much better steaks for half the price elsewhere.

rEwoIK8th64gcgB6cnYltw.text: 1.Best Romantic Restaurant in Vegas with Great View of the Bellagio Fountain (make sure to call for a reservation instead of booking through open table to get a table by the window). Perfect fo Anniversarries, birthdays any special occassion,  It makes the ocassion very memorable. But i'll make up any excuse to my fiancee just to go back there again.. lols   2.AWESOME SERVICE. Our server paid very much attention to us. Even got a Complimentary Chocolate Dessert from them, the chef put it on a plate and wrote HAppy Anniversarry on the edges of the plate. It was so beautiful. It made us feel so special..  We don't drink and unfortunately they don't serve any unalcoholic drink but we told him we wanted something just for a toast and surely after a few minutes he came back with a couple of flutes, though I dont recall what it was called his effort to get us something they dont serve is outstanding.  Service is FAST too., unlike other fine dining restaurants which takes 30 minutes to get your food done.  3.REASONABLE Price for a fine dining restaurant with a great view. We paid the same thing at Sutro's in SF and Sutro's food wasnt even as good.  4.EXCELLENT FOOD! make sure you try their FOI GRAS with grilled grapes... yummy.., it melts in your mouth.  5.The only thing is that tables are kind of close to one another so you actually hear the conversations from the other tables., But we got one of the best tables right infront of the Bellagio Fountain so were Happy nonetheless..  Would Definitely be back there Again next visit!!! :)

Za1kU-PWN71UuHR99Fj0hg.text: It was such a perfect night! My husband has been wanting to go here ever since we moved here so I set up reservations the night before he shipped off for deployment. And he LOVED it. He got the duck breast, which actually good. I stuck with a traditional filet, just to be safe. Well my filet came with foie gras on top, I'm not a fan of duck liver but again, he LOVED it. The souffle was amazing as well, we got the mandarin orange. If it didn't take 45 minutes to cook I would have ordered a second!

jVxvLwqxpLJHVEu_wm6t2A.text: Romantic?  A resounding YES!  Tables for two around the perimeter, all with beautiful views. The service was impeccable, our waiter very knowledgeable and friendly, but not so friendly as to be annoying.  The dinner itself was delicious, dessert was amazing and the ambiance was exactly what we had hoped for.  Worth every penny. I've said it before, yet I feel it bears repeating - leave your children at home, this is a place for adults.  Nothing spoils a beautiful romantic dinner like children too small to behave or appreciate fine dining. Guys, you should suit up for this restaurant.   A lovely place to dress up for, enjoy the food, gaze at the fountains across the way, hold hands across the table and sip a martini.  Everything I expected and more!

OquJtSZpu_RRhe5y8Dqh3Q.text: Ah the Eiffel Tower...restaurant.   You make your way up the elevator and are immediately greeted by someone who takes your coat and leads you to your table, or in our case, since we were a bit early, to the bar.  The bar is nice, great view of the city, top shelf.  Once our table was ready, they came for us, transferred our bar tab and took our drinks and us to our cozy table for two, overlooking the fountains.  It's a beautiful view. The fountains go off.  Impressive.  Ordering al la carte is not cheap.  We opted for the tasting menu ($93.00 pp) WITH their optional wine pairing ($69.00 pp)...This is a great DEAL people.  An appetizer and entree would have been almost as much and we had 5 decent courses of beautifully prepared foods, beautifully presented.  Now that said, the wines were decent but not what anyone would call fabulous; although I found their pairing of the seafood bisque with a Oloroso Sherry, right on!  Have you ever seen the show "Hello Dolly"?  Remember the waiter scene, waiters doing the waiter dance with trays held over their heads?  While service was prompt and well timed, there was also a frantic feeling of the waiter dance...and those trays, held over their heads, were happening over our heads and close to our back.  A little disconcerting.  But nothing was dropped or dripped on us so that was a good thing.  And remember those fountains at the Bellagio?  Well, those suckers go off every 15 minutes...so after the first few times...it's like sitting in front of a clock.  "Has it been 15 minutes already?"  With a large group, or even maybe a new man (or woman) in your life, that may not be noticed so much, but after 23 years of talking, sometimes you just look at the view, over and over.  The food was good, a well thought out menu, nicely, although unevenly presented.  My plate came looking one way, his a bit different.  If you are serving two plates of the same thing side by side, they should look exact replicas of each other...at least at this level of service and presentation.  Denny's...not so much.  LindySez:  It's a nice date night.  Great food, great view, if you have something to talk about after the 6th time the fountains go off or, as in our case, talking about the fountains going off...and great service (see if we had been paying attention to the view, we probably wouldn't have even noticed "Hello Dolly" was being played out behind us.

fYkKLjZhxcBbUQsMAnwrAQ.text: Very overpriced. Food was luke warm and bland. It tasted premade. Not sure what all the hype is. I would never go back. Save your money...and to top it off my 6 year old grandson threw up all over the entry way as we left...some suit  came out and questioned the boy about where else and what else he ate that day...hey genius he got some bad food from your joint! Not even the offer of a cup of ice cream. Terrible!

VAQwzaG2WMDThr0GUNU28g.text: My wife and I had dinner there to celebrate our 29th wedding anniversary. This has to be the best restaurant in Vegas. From the ladies escort at the elevator, the host, the bartender, and of coarse our fabulous waiter Stephon wait on you hand and foot. The restaurants decor and view of the strip is something to always remember. The drinks were great, the food delicious and the desserts were out of this world. "A MUST GO IF IN VEGAS AND I WILL RETURN".

g8o4LgpgIU0pvn3uI-Yjaw.text: Real date night has proven itself worthy.  So this is what a celebration for a new job feels like?  Dinner at one of the most uppity up places in Las Vegas?  WOW.  I have never been blown away by a dinner like this one before.   First, the restaurant alone sits itself in the sky, practically.  You are greeted downstairs by the hostess and then personally escorted in their triangular elevator to then be greeted again by the maitre de.  Immediately you notice the breathtaking view of the Las Vegas Strip and what is right in front of your eyes is the beautiful Bellagio.  As we were walking in, the water show at the Bellagio had started and I was completely mesmerized.  No matter where you sit in this restaurant, you are guaranteed a spectacular view.    Keep in mind, reservations are a MUST at this restaurant.  Dressing up is a MUST.  And if you decide to book last minute (like we did) then you have to give them a reason why you are celebrating.    We were seated right in front of the restaurant, right in front of the Bellagio and the water show.  We were given the most excellent service by our waiter who delicately explained every plate that came out to "stimulate our palettes".  We ordered the "Le Menu" special which consisted of 6 courses and 1 choice of dessert.  I won't even go into how delicious the food was especially the dessert (get the souffle! get the souffle!) because if I did I'd be writing a novel for a review.  Just trust me on this one, it is FINE DINING at its' FINEST.  And when you're there you must ask your waiter for the sweetest Pinot Grigio wine they have.  (But be prepared to pay $90 for a bottle) Then again, you get what you pay for so for the wine connoisseur, this is your place as they have over 500 selections of wine.   Be forewarned though,  this is not a place to go to if you're on a budget.  All in all we spent a good $400 for what I can call "one of the most romantic and best dinners of my life".  Was it worth it?  Well , when you just won $1600 in roulette the night before I'd say hell yah.  All kidding aside though, even though the dinner was worth as much as a Gucci bag, it was an experience that will never be forgotten.  So yes, it was worth it.

HWuvu0GNdbyQqRHyyAJxAg.text: Go there every year when I am in Vegas for our annual sales meeting.  This is one of the best views of the Vegas strip you will find.  Disappointed they took fries off the menu, they were my favorite side dish over the years.  Have always had a great view in the past, but this time we got stuck at the worst table in the restaurant overlooking the pool at Paris.  I should have questioned the hostess and asked to wait for another one.  While our service was very friendly and we did order appetizers and dessert, it took a long time for our waiter to get our wine going and we did not get the check until 10:30 (we had a 7:30 reservation).  I still love this place, but was a little disappointed compared to previous visits.  I will be going back next year.

4gprZ6JiWKNV8anz0qhJ0A.text: The most romantic setting/view coupled with the greatest food.  HIGHLY recommend the chocolate souffle.   Guys-  Make sure you bring a worthy date....it'll woo her and make the price worth it.  Girls-  Get ready to be wooed

6rI1XHXKnI_jCTWWww4ljQ.text: Came here for dinner on my first night in Vegas - what a treat!  We were seated right by the window and could watch the Bellagio fountain show throughout our meal.  It was a really cool view and the food/drinks were amazing.  I had the braised short ribs - yum!  Bread was served while waiting via a guy walking around with a huge tray of a variety of breads.  The drinks were to die for.  The pear vodka drink was so good that I tried to replicate it when I got back home.  Service was impecable - they didn't rush you.  We stayed at our table for an after dinner drink which was very enjoyable.  Awesome place...

jPmGEK5yqqw6kyInl7wkUg.text: This place is pretty amazing.  I have had my last two birthday dinners here.  I got the tasting menu both times and was very pleased.  The food is super high quality.  All the two top tables are facing the windows overlooking the strip and balcony.  They have a great selection of breads, although the lunch time cheese filled rolls are amazing.  It is pretty pricey but worth it for special evenings out.

orGFQ4B7kdzp1e2t7IrYvg.text: Second visit here; first was earlier this year.  Very disappointed this time.  Outstanding location, and view of fountains is of course a great plus.  Last time, it was special for view, ambiance, food, and service, but now I think we will not be back.  Almost all tables have a view; that is still nice.  I think this place has now taken on much more of a "tourist trap" feel.  Waiter was patronizing, overly pushy toward up-selling everything, and seemed to want us to hurry to turn over the table.  We wanted a single app (smoked salmon) for four of us, and he told us it would be small...we had had before, and knew it was enough.  He told us we had to order entire meal at once, rather than taking our time with drinks and appetizer.  He tried to steer each of us to a more expensive plate, insisted we must order sides, and even questioned our wine choices.  My wife's chicken dish was awful, all dry dark meat, poorly-seasoned, and poorly-presented.  Understanding this was not a "signature" dish, we still expected quality, but when we commented, the waiter wanted to argue the point; poor form.  Frankly, for the almost $400 we paid, this experience was dismal.  Go for a drink at bar, skip the dinner.

g3tbgjhIQEyksDpBglOHlw.text: ive been here a while ago but one thing that i remember from eating here is that ive had the best duck EVER.  the view of course is gorgeous, views the center of the las vegas strip, and its set in a very elegant fine dine feel.  but let me tell you about the duck i had here.  i ordered the duck made 2 ways, which was rotisserie and the other pan seared and sliced thinly.  Ive never had duck this delicious before that now, i want to try duck made from everywhere.  The pan seared one is my favorite its very soft and juicy, it also comes in a dark wine sauce that is great! everything comes a la carte so don't forget to order some sides to compliment your entree. French food seriously has the best sauces.  so if you decide to come eat here, please please order the duck :)

sdP-u0caYsTfxyRN3oDmCg.text: Consistency is the mark of excellence.  At least that's what I think and this place - more than 6 months later did it again.  The food, atmosphere, staff and drinks were amazing.  I love to eat here.  This will be a regular stop on my future journeys to LV.  I was once jaded about a concept restaurant simulating Paris but not anymore.  You have many choices in LV - I have eaten at most of them, but this one consistently serves top quality food.  Great job.  If I had to be picky, I suspect the cappuccino is machine made.  I asked for a wet cappuccino and the waiter looked at me like I had two heads.  When it came it looked like a vending machine cappuccino in a really nice cup.  BUT that's me being picky.  I am a coffee maniac.

j13zoaV27e_Ow7Q3LWlIow.text: I went to The Eiffel Tower again recently.  Everything is still up to their usual standard.  Great service, great views, wonderful atmosphere, and the food was superb.  Maybe my all time favorite restaurant.

6nhollw16-o3BYq0oXFeuw.text: Food fancy and you can see them cooking. The view entirely depends on where they seat you, however. If you come here just for drinks, you won't see the fountains very well. Also, the drinks are hella expensive and not too special. A mixed drink runs you $16-22 - same for glasses of wine. I had the Bubbles and Sparks, and it was terrible. If you get fruit juice, it's only $5-7 per glass, but it's mostly ice.  The waitstaff is super friendly and the atmosphere is chi-chi, but come here to eat, not to lounge.

DtdX4CRvHLEubNCZmsgQ_Q.text: The food here never ceases to amaze me.  My fav is the steak medallions with crab meat.  YUM.   All the food is very tasty and very original.  I love coming here when I go to Vegas.  =)    If you're a martini lover....they have the best sour apple martini's.

7yqGJ8tFutns4zMPM9AIjQ.text: Ambiance, yes...Innovative menu, yes...a souffle...yes! What more can you ask for? The pricing was a bit high, but the wine selection was perfect and the food put a terrific twist on some of my absolute favorites. I cannot even explain how great it is to be confused as to which dish to order these days. Monk Fish, Rib Eye with Escargot Sauce (amazing!), and all of the classics... If you want to experience fine dining in Vegas, you have to go here. Yes you are at the Paris, yes you are in an Eiffel Tower Replica (the real one does not have dining like this) and yes you are on the strip...who knew that they could have such high standards and deliver this well? I do now!

zQDsIWpV6T5-Ti3i78oDaQ.text: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant was suggested to me by a good friend who has good taste in food. Well he was right. The food was some of the best I ever had and I'm always looking for the best quality tasting food. I also believe in " you get what you pay for" and this restaurant is no different. If you are willing to spend a good chunk of change then you'll receive excellent food. The only reason why I did not give five stars is that I didn't feel that romantic ambiance that I was excepting.

Xnc9_cK2o8iQh4cd2wkBKw.text: Good French food.  Good view of the Bellagio fountain. Food is not cheap, but it's worth it.  Great service with a team of usually 2 servers for each table.

889KbZabUM80ItgIEDViyA.text: Okay let me start by saying this place is beautiful, romantic place to take a special person for a any occasions. My hubby and I had a beautiful romantic dinner for our anniversary window seat looking at the bellagio fountain. Breath taking people, Jennifer the manager came over an introduce herself to us since she and my hubby exchanged emails regarding the reservation plans. The girls were all delightful, loved the restaurant. Now as much as I loved the service and the ambience's of this place the food was not good to me hubby love ribs an ordered the short rib which was not tasty at all, and I ordered the duck which was ok. Which I could of said better about the food, but I would return for the ambience's and view so worth it people just order steak I guess:-)

G0hz5YYquxVdxFERpjrS4g.text: After posting my review I was contacted and reimbursed for the dinner portion of our visit. This was an acceptable resolution.

WuUPBjs91WXUdp6pM7X_0A.text: Couldn't ask for a more romantic setting than this.  Perfect place for a special dinner.  Great food, great service.  I can't understand why some people were shocked and upset about the price.  What do you expect when you go to a place like this?? It's in the (vegas) Eiffel Tower for cryin out loud!!   :)

Lx1fRilgwjgJx5uswX3tqw.text: I am a huge fan of foie gras and they have it both warm and cold . I must admit both were fantastic . I had the fish and it was great delicate and delightful . My friend had the steak and said it was very good . I also recommend the oysters

2HRWcFH2l2K56NU8R9lAOw.text: nice ambience romantic place to come with your hunny

7VHIrPh0IboSnVjK9TTGkw.text: I went for lunch, Foods are not that very good, but view saves it~;)

MD-7DW5m7m2jQQA7fcte8g.text: top notch in every way.  food, service,  view, pricing.

wh0Qxcq98mJzZ8aNPEufFQ.text: Awesome View. Great Service. Food I wouldnt think Id like, but loved. Awesome souffle too. Definitely romantic ;)

uYSW723L6J5LXQXHJt6vTw.text: I'm rating this dining experience in my top-10 all time.  Extremely romantic setting, courteous and attentive staff, and everything tasted decadent.  Just the view of the Bellagio fountains was enough to make this memorable for me.  The Souffle is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iyIY02Xv4t6b549I3n4yQw.text: Tasty food, great views (the Bellagio fountains and my wife), good service and reasonable prices. No wait, just walked in for lunch. Felt like a hidden gem.

BH0bseS4cVhQM41NB2ogCQ.text: This restaurant is up in the Eifel Tower at Paris Casino which offers one of the best views of the heart of the Las Vegas strip. It over looks the famous Bellagio water show. If you're taking a date request one of the tables against the window so you have front row seats to the water show while you eat. The food very good, I had the filet mignon. Wine selection is excellent.

BdGNIquPqEcLVoM2yKzGlA.text: Phenomenal meal, everything was flavorful, delicate and cooked to perfection. Perhaps the best wine list in Vegas and certainly one of the most romantic destinations in America. The waitstaff was helpful and attentive, careful and humorous. Ask ahead for a window seat for two with a great view!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view at night
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert with raspberry sorbet!

4Tx-b8Hree5GB1nVYVsDxw.text: Delicious Filet Mignon.  Wonderful service.  Great food.  Breathtaking views right from your table.   Splurge a little you wont be disappointed.

OOdOcgp0XAFKSgFaj-opdg.text: In a town where every block has a hand full of award winning fine dinning restaurants, which one should you try? The unique feature of this restaurant is location and the very romantic atmosphere. Hence I chose this place to celebrate my gf's birthday here with the extra red roses and pedals on our table for her (a special service that they offer). Both our food and wine were amazing and relatively generous portion for a fine dinning restaurant. Our server, Captain Ron paired our dishes perfectly with a surprise wine. Highly recommended. I posted photos of our dishes on my blog at: alpachinoreview.com/2011...

jXWytfzcC4DUIwS9KHJWIw.text: Yes, it is expensive. You are fine dining while perched eleven floors up overlooking the heart of Strip (including every lady's favorite: the Bellagio fountains). Get over it. I was a bit perturbed that you can only secure a widow table via a reservation that is at 5:30 or earlier, but luckily we got one nonetheless. And what a table! As far as a date night, you would be hard pressed to find a better table. The service was very attentive and personable, but I had a major hang-up here. Unless something is jumping out at me, I often rely on the server's opinion and suggestions. It always irks me when the server finds the most expensive option (or close to it) to recommend, and that is what happened here at every step. I realize that it just may be the case that the most expensive everything is the best, but I find it rather unlikely and have been to many 'o joints were this is not the case. The scallop appetizer was outstanding, as were the lamb chops. I did not care for either of the sides (mushroom spaetzle & potatoes gratin), but everything else was great. After reading on how many people harped on the price, I was pleasantly surprised with my visit here and would consider it again for a special night out.

LthgVcG8vmVHmv2ixysoig.text: I somehow managed to sneak in here without a reservation and was very pleased. Though not as tasty as le cirque over at belagio its still quite amazing.   As you come up the elevator there is a small waiting lounge where we had to wait for a table. It was comfortable and they have some great beers. As we walked to our table we could see out the window. Out the window! Crazy view!  The room is very open and bright like almost like an outdoor cafe. There was ALWAYS a member of the wait staff at our table with something for us.   They have a wide variety of breads they came around with. For starters I had both the foie gras and a salmon plate. Both where fantastic. For the entrees I was able to try the filet mignon and their duck. Both of course...fantastic! Their entree sauces are so tasty and look so pretty.  Compare to the rest of the vegas casino restaurants I have been to this ones atmosphere was so much more casual and friendly. It made the whole experience really fun.

frlDdymE3u1-53_7BHE9Rw.text: The Eiffel Tower is a perfect marriage of ambiance, good service, and great food.  The dining room is a wonderful treat with a classy dark wood motif and an amazing panoramic view of the city.  Having been to this restaurant a few times -- twice on a busy weekend, once on a quiet weekday -- I can tell you I never had poor service here.  The hosts always seem cordial.  The wait staff is always highly attentive and unaffected even during a packed house.  Food-wise, my favorite appetizer is their foie-gras, which is paradoxically delicate and rich.  The entrees I have tried were the filet mignon and the lamb -- both perfectly cooked and seasoned.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

LRejrrX8mrc9gBuL8QRbUA.text: All I can say is this is the best place I have been to and I do go out to eat a lot. I was here with my husband and 2 kids. The desserts were amazing. The menu is awsome. the cleanliness is super and the service is well trained to please:) Would come back again if I am in town.

RJCnOuuKos0jNyRt_3rxzg.text: The best dining experience my wife and I have ever had! Many other fancy restaurants the food is supposed to be good just because its "fancy". The food here was absolutely amazing! Elevator guy was very pleasant, waiter was fantastic, sommelier was ready to answer any questions. Spectacular views of the fountains at Bellagio. Highly Recommended!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9BwMztNqeDdXSS9vged9Gg.text: Mmm Foie Gra over steak over slightly fried potatoes?  Cheesy Bread? Pistachio Souffle?  And a view of the dancing waters of Bellagio? Okay I suppose I really asked these questions with no real answer.  But the answer should be: Spectacularly romantic.  I went with a dear friend of mine and we had a blast with this sorta creepy but attentive waiter.  It made us miss our significant others dearly, but then made us forget about them when delicious food arrived.  They really thought out the entry as you take the elevator up and walk through the kitchen before arriving at the dining area.  It was great to be able to have a quick glance of the ingeniousness of the people creating our meals.

hwTIvy_21gf9EZatAwLWbg.text: I went here for drinks with my family right after I graduated from college. The view at night is spectacular!! I didn't eat dinner here, (yet) but I will update when I do, however the service was great and the ambiance was wonderful, it really made me want to go for dinner, when normally I would avoid it thinking it was a tourist trap.  More to come!!

bSF00MvTNDbHxGyslNRLjg.text: I remember we came here for July 4.  Anyway, like every reputable restaurant in Vegas, it's expensive as shit, go figure. And like all the rest, the portions are tiny, so get ready to drop half a bill on a meal the size of your fist and if you want wine, go in on it family style.  I ordered the filet and we got a bottle of wine. My friend and I ended up drinking 80% of it and the rest went around the table.  The wine, eh, I don't know anything about wine. It was the cheapest one and it tasted like wine to me, so all good there. I would say the tiny filet was disappointing but I pretty much knew what I was in for, so no big deal there.  The atmosphere was great, as you'd expect. Very nice view. There are some parts of the eiffel support that sort of awkwardly run through the restaurant but we didn't have any issues with them.  So why did I give this place a 4? Sounds like a 3, right? It does so far, to me anyways.  Well, before they give you the meals, they serve the bread. And here, the bread came in the form of these little cheese bread balls.  Hooooly shit, these things were incredible. I'm pretty sure I could subsist entirely on these things. It was like nirvana in my mouth. I'm pretty sure these will be an integral part of my last meal someday, and they're so soft that if I'm 120 and I've lost all my teeth by that time I should still be able to eat them. Rolled in the experienced hands of Chef Boyardee and cooked to a golden brown in what could only be St. Elmo's fire, these cheese balls were the highlight of my eating experience.  Call them and see if you can get the cheese balls to go first. If not, this place is worth eating at once at least.

bRpVrg_s8Ay3hvZsLnm5rA.text: This may be the best room in Vegas.  The food is pretty good too.  I had the John Dory with roasted veg. and veal jus.  It was very good. Service is awesome as is everything else about this place.  Bring a bankroll though.  They're not afraid to charge a price.

L8S7sxQid_v7BHYfybfjaw.text: We've eaten here three times: twice for dinner and most recently for Easter brunch. Each time we dine here, they set the bar higher and higher for themselves as well as for any other restaurant. The customer service is impeccable, the food is out of this world delicious, and the view can't be beat! An added perk is that Lyle, one of the supervisors who is in charge of the Facebook page, takes extra special care of customers who let him know they'll be visiting the restaurant. Even on a crazy busy holiday, he got us a phenomenal table and took time to personally greet us. WOW. That's all I can say. He made us feel so special, as if we were the most important customers of his day. Each meal we've had here has been memorable and we expect to make many more memories here in the future. Life (and dining) are great at the Eiffel Tower in the L.V. Paris! :)

g5tp0Hobb-SUu7JhxTtjgw.text: We were told by several people this is the best place to eat in Vegas.  We were sat at a window seat overlooking the Bellagio's famous fountain.  That was the best part of our meal, sad to say.  The view was stunning, but the food left us disappointed.  For the price, we expected everything to be excellent.  My drink was the second best part of the meal.  I had the Eiffel Tower (something-or-another.)  It was like a light champagne version of sangria with mixed berries.  My husband had the Beef Wellington, and it was just ok.  I had the filet mignon, and it was tough, dry, and overcooked.  I asked for it medium, so I was really disappointed with it and didn't even finish it.  For a $69 steak, that is not good.  I've had better at Longhorn Steakhouse.  Maybe we ordered the wrong items, but everything should be good at a place like this.

FB2SOQZAaHk9tA7CNO5gVg.text: My husband and I went to Vegas for his 30th birthday and decided to treat ourselves to a fancy dinner. What better place for that than the Eiffel Tower? We made a reservation around sunset thinking it would be extra romantic. We got there on time (5:15pm) and were seated shortly thereafter. Our server was nice but not super friendly but the hostess was very rude and, for a lack of better words, snobby. We were given a window seat which we were happy with but the tables are small and extremely close together so your elbows bump with your neighbor when using utensils which is silly considering that we are both fairly small people. We both ordered a steak; I the New York and my husband the filet, both $59 a piece. I ordered mine medium which arrived VERY well done and my husband ordered his medium-rare which came out medium-well. Only one side of each steak was seasoned and both contained far too much fat for the cuts. The entrees do not include any sides so we shared an order of potatoes Gratin which had no flavor and the consistency if mayonnaise. There was zero opportunity to express our disappointment with our meal since our waiter seemed to disappear after the food was delivered to the table. All in all, the meal wasn't terrible but it was far from what I would have expected from one of the nicest restaurants in the area.

O1165nnUeAEIYZrFxgwLeQ.text: I've been to 3 star Michelins and I was very impressed with the Tower.  Like Rick said, it is basically a restaurant in a theme park; but, the food, ambience and service negate all of that. The blue cheese souffle was not as strong as I hoped it would be; but, still good.  I had the lobster thermidor and it seemed that by ordering that I made the waiter very happy.  We were pressed for time to get to a show so we had to skip desert; but, I imagine it would have been delish. When I tried going here about 3 years ago I was wearing all black tennis shoes (Louis Vuitton mind you) and I was told that "gentlemen are not allowed inside the restaurnt while wearing sneakers."

YncX2nEhww48Yqqols8jtw.text: I did NOT enjoy myself here at all.   Not every seat in the house has a good view. Service was spotty at best.   they ask for your CC number to make reservations and will charge u if you dont show up....   after being seated in our seats with no view i wanted to leave but feared being charged.  I dropped over 230.00 for dinner for 3 and felt ROBBED   small portions!!! to say the least. food was a 6-10 bartenders were not friendly and rather talk among them selfs than serv.  If i were to do it again i would just go there for Drinks look around and Leave don't give this place your money.

rN01h3m4Cz9thCanebblwQ.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas...and anywhere for that matter. We made reservations the day before and asked to be by the glass to see the Bellagio water show. We were given the best seats in the house - right in the center on the glass. I was a bit cold during dinner so the waiter came out with a shawl for me. YES! this restaurant has everything to accomodate their guests.  My friend and I started off with the Romaine Lettuce, Poppy Seed Tuile salad. I ordered the Sauteed Medallions of Veal, Braised Vegetables, Wild Morel Mushrooms and she had the Char Broiled Filet Mignon. I can't recall the exact name of the dessert we ordered but it was an entire plate of mini chocolate desserts - lots of variety and absolute heaven. I can still taste it! Everything from the view, the staff, the atmosphere was absolutely perfect. Money very well spent.

PsGS_FUJf8mQRAXDCMr_JQ.text: Great dining experience.  The food is good, but the service is excellent!

PCe395RcGDr5lZQYut7Gow.text: I ate here with a group of people and thought the food was great. Just alittle to classy for people looking to have a good time. Meals and drinks were very expensive. For me and my wife this would not be our first choice of an expensive place to eat while is Las Vegas

bfVncdYPz8SRonjjp6RW2w.text: My wife and I used to make the Eiffel Tower Restaurant an annual event but we had not been back for a couple of years. I'm glad we decided to go back.  As in the past, the atmosphere is vibrant and polished. I always wear a jacket but there are some without. Business casual is fine. You should expect to spend 2 - 3 hours for dinner here but the server will ask you if you have a show or event to attend later in the evening to help you get out in time. Do make a point to arrive early and have a drink at their bar. The view from bar (and the entire restaurant) is awesome.   Only negative- I was told that we could only get a table at the window facing the Bellagio fountains if we were seated as 2. We were 4 so we settled for a table on the second tier but saw some of the Bellagio show. I was distressed, however, to see some tables for 3 and 4 set up in that first tier to see the Bellagio show as they dinned. I guess I didn't speak to the right person when I made my reservation.  My smoked salmon starter was outstanding. As in our past visits, my wife and I had the filet mignon. And as in the past it is the best filet I have ever had. Instead of going to one of the many steak houses on the strip, save your steak night for Eiffel Tower and order the filet. You will not be disappointed.   Yes, of course, we had to order their famous souffles. We ordered the chocolate with chocolate sauce and, as a twist, chocolate with banana sauce. You cannot order incorrectly whatever flavor you order. Don't worry about the flavor-just order it! Everyone also get a a small tray of sweets to end the meal.  Their wine list is extensive and the sommelier will help you if you are not used to ordering French wines. The service was attentive and knowledgeable.  It is pricey, but worth it. Save this place for you big night out and you will remember it for a long time.  I only go back to restaurants if they earn it. Eiffel Tower Restaurant earns it year after year.

mla2q5kgpJj7zkvRG4ia2g.text: Had such a great time here with my boyfriend. I love how we got a window seat and how the table and seating makes you face the window but slightly angled so you are facing the person you are with.  The food here is absolutely amazing. Even the bread that they give you, and you get to choose what kind of bread you want. We ordered the Black Pepper Marinated Raw Beef and that was amazing, the texture of the beef and the flavor was delicious and it came with toast.   For entree my boyfriend had the Duck Breast and Duck Leg Confit, and I had the Filet Mignon with Bearnaise sauce. It was one of the best Filet Mignon I ever had, and I really enjoyed the Bearnaise sauce... I pretty much drowned my filet mignon in it....  If you want to get a side, you should definitely try the Classic Potato Gratin. It was soooo delicious, covered in cheese and the potato was soft. It tasted soooo good.  For our dessert we had the Chocolate Souffle, which the server told us that it takes 30 minutes to make so we had to order it when we ordered everything else. The souffle was really good, it was really chocolatey but was not ridiculously sweet. Even my boyfriend who doesn't really like eating chocolate liked it.   This place was really romantic and we had a great view of the Bellagio Fountain. It was just amazing. And they have a photographer that takes your picture and puts it in this pretty frame for $24. Had an amazing night here. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Souffle
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Filet Mignon and Béarnaise sauce.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boyfriend&#39;s Duck Breast and Duck Confit. And our side Potato Gratin.

naTLpUpo5aY0CjkrvjjwvA.text: OK so I have just had to rewrite this review because I remembered a detail about the service.  They do not have chocolate milk on the menu for my little girl.  This is no big deal, and can be easily swapped out for water.    However, our waiter took it upon himself to have someone from the kitchen melt milk chocolate and stir it into a glass of milk.  It was the first time, I have seen someone go to such lengths to appease a four year old.  So for this act of excellent service, this place has moved from three to four stars.  The food was good.  My wife got beef wellington, sorry but it didn't hold a candle to Gordon Ramsay's.  I got a well seasoned, nicely accomplanied piece of fish and my daughter took down an indulgent glass of freahly made chocolate delight to accompany her pasta.  The view from this place in spectacular but we weren't seated anywhere near a window, and felt it would be rude to go trapsing through someone else's meal to get a nice look out the window.  The view is apparently so nice, that they have employed a theme park style photographer to snap your pic and send you home with a $30 keepsake.  The fact that the place is accessed through an elevator was just incovenient, the fact that it opened up into a fast paced kitchen was offputting.  If you happen to be at the Paris you have three choices for food in my opinion and in order they are:  Ramsay Mon Ami Eiffel

frqn5PDYcotohlWBWoz3tA.text: As residents, we have hesitated to visit this restaurant thinking it would be too foo-foo with small portions of food.  We've tried the best in Vegas and as you know, there are unlimited choices.  We finally bit the bullet and gave it a try and we are sure glad that we did.  The food was spectacular, presentation was even better and the service was superb!  Oh, and of course, the view is to die for.  We went for lunch expecting to have just nibbles but as our plates came out, they just got better and better.  It is surely worth a visit and worth the money.  We will definitely be back, next time for a romantic dinner :)

ldvHe2MwDmzGeTq6cVUeFA.text: Overall a great experience at this restaurant. The wait staff is very attentive and friendly. The view, should you have a window seat (we didn't), is amazing and overlooks the Bellagio fountains. Minus 1 star because I felt the restaurant was quite loud and because 2 of the dishes we had tasted slightly under-seasoned. The cold potato soup they serve as a starter is absolutely amazing, and the filet mignon put the other entrees to shame. We had a pistachio souffle for dessert, which was good but tasted a little bitter.  I really enjoyed my meal here and would come back again, although next time I will make sure we have a window seat!

Ss5iDKMtgfWRCB6ZyJHSQw.text: Awesome venue ! Amazing view of the Strip and especially of The Bellagio Fountains. The service was excellent. Knowledgable and attentive. The food was delicious . I had the flattened herb crusted salmon. Good portion size. My husband had the Mediterranean Lamb Burger with fresh kettle chips, again taste was excellent and very moist. My daughter had kids pasta and sauce. A little pricy but well worth it. We will definitely visit again.

6Z6FcAyTlJLQ5BXfz53G4A.text: Absolutely amazing view.  The place is gorgeous and the food was delicious.  Waiters were extremely polite, and they bring you complimentary tasting samples for free--bruschetta and truffles!  Had the grand marnier souffle--heaven.  Prices were high (around $45 for a typical entree that doesn't include any sides), but it was definitely expected for a place like this.

GH-XEQBqkrmvSTU843B2qg.text: Called today to make a reservation because I am going to Vegas for a getaway since my grandma died and my parents are getting a divorce after 27 years. For the past 2 years I have been having anxiety and othe problems such as depression and insomnia due to everything and it only got worse this past 2 months. So my kind enough boss paid for my get away to just relax with my boyfriend and get away from it all.   I called to ask if they take emotional support animals because I've needed my dogs for my case. I have a written documentation from my doctor and everything stating that I need them because they are what ive always known and the only thing "stable" in my crazy life right mow. I spoke to the manager and he said yes we take service animals. I told him my dogs are not classified as service animal because under the law service animals help the blind, can call for help if there is a heart attack etc. But I do need my dogs with me 24/7. Here in Los Angeles they go everywhere with me even the bathroom when I'm in my own home. So I explained to him that they are emotional support. He said that's fine and had a girl make my reservations.   Well I decided to celebrate my dogs birthday since her birthday is on 11-11 and the dinner was the day before so I explained that I was going to order something for them to eat such as an unseasoned beef patty or something instead of their usual kibbles.   I get a call back immediately saying now I can't have dinner there because I was celebrating my dogs birthday and that i wanted a cake. I was like what I never once said cake and then he said well we don't allow dogs to eat at the table. And I said they are not eating on the table that's disgusting and unsanitary. Then I said they can eat on the floor. And he said not the floor either. So then I said ok well they need dinner but that's fine they won't eat. And he goes on cutting me off saying no I'm canceling ur reservation ur not allowed to come here with your dogs, we only allow seeing eye dogs.   So I'm fine with not eating there but then I asked him can u please tell me why I'm not allowed anymore when I first called and explained to u I'm not blind or handicapped and u were the one that said everything was fine. And he says well when I saw on the reservation that you were having your dogs birthday and u wanted a cake and them to eat, that is not our restaurants policy, I again I told him, no I never requested any cake and I said ey will bot be eating. And then he goes on saying well we only want service dogs. So which one is it? My dogs eating or your only allowed service dog, and he kept cutting me off and yelling at me saying I'm done speaking with u, etc. Definitely the worst service and discrimination against people with a mental illness and discrimination against dogs being fed,

WlDegwNyxo3-QNkZ4JVxmA.text: Wanted to try this restaurant at lunch time with the hubby while in Vegas. When you arrive in the Paris Hotel you take a special elevator --inside the hotel--to the restaurant. There was a nice lady and gentlemen by the elevator door that retrieved the restaurant elevator for us. When we made it to the top we were greeted at the hostess stand and immediately seated. Our waiter came by very nonchalantly and handed us the short lunch menu. I asked could we sit in the middle of the restaurant but for some reason they had to fill all of the seats around the edges. What????! The restaurant wasn't even full and it was lunch time. After reviewing the menu, the hubby and I decided that we didn't want anything to eat (nothing looked appealing) but we would stay and have a glass of wine. When I informed the waiter he said we could not sit at the table to just have a drink and we had to go to the bar and he proceeded to retrieve our menus. I had enough of this wanna be restaurant by then and the hubby and I left. I was not impressed.

xviFkWc-iv33NhTHCn10tw.text: The ONLY good thing about this place: the incredibly gorgeous 180 view you have of the Strip. We were able to watch the Bellagio fountain show from our table. Food & service was measly. For one, the menu is not very French. French toast was on the menu. That turned me off. Really? French toast is NOT French. And the drinks? My friend paid $18 for a supposed drink that was the hot seller. It was a strange fizzy pink liquid with raspberries floating in it. Did not taste good. Gross.  Our server was very quick to leave us. Don't get me wrong, he definitely had a host's personality when he spoke with us... for like 5 seconds! He would dart in and out, just before we finally would form a question in our minds about the food on the menu.  I had the Aged Parmesan Chicken with what looked like canned vegetables & a miserable pile of dry-tasting potatoes gratin. Blah. The only reason the chicken was tasty was because there was AGED parmesan. And it looked like a giant flat pancake on my plate. I paid $24 for something I could make myself.  I hear there's an Eiffel Tower Las Vegas tour. Go on that instead so you can at least check out the view. The food is not worth it.

r9RhBWqR9_Fj2SUlf2qC7Q.text: Great view of the Bellagio fountains, but the food could use a little work especially for the price.  I had the lamb, rare.  It  tasted okay (not amazing but certainly not bad), but didn't really seem worth the expensive price, especially compared to other restaurants in the area.  It seems like you are paying mostly for the view and the "experience".

tJP-KsCKe6UObcQGWoRyqQ.text: This was the perfect restaurant for our big night out. The wife and I had an amazing time here. I am from Las Vegas but never get use to how breath taking the lights can be. The view of the Bellagio fountains here are amazing. The food from appetizers to main course were spectacular.  The carmel souffle was spot on. It would also like to say that our waiter was very knowledgable of the cuisine and always there for us. It was worth the money for such an important night.

RA-7cdKrpy1cRkLKiEwB7Q.text: I took my girl friend to this restaurant for dinner.  I actually ate there, have a receipt to prove it.   Service was very good, all the staff was friendly.  We ordered, menu looked great, all the foods I would expect from a French restaurant.    When the dishes came we found them to be very very very small in portion.  Price was not small however.  The dishes were not French, they are some kind of wierd fusion.  As we tried to enjoy our dinner we found the quality of food and preparation to be minimal.   Eiffel also markets itself as having high dress standards, this is laughable.  Seems to be more a marketing gimmick.   My conclusion, for 1/4 of the price (that's a $125 discount for two) you can get more, and better, elsewhere.

OzjL3v42VC8KP0zbhMF4nA.text: I don't know where to start! My girlfriend and I were in Vegas attending the Electric Daisy Carnival which coincided with our 2 year anniversary. Immediately we started looking for the finest restaurants Las Vegas Boulevard had to offer. We tossed around ideas, and drew up a list. The Eiffel Tower restaurant had  fantastic price point that didn't degrade service or quality. Of course we dressed up for the occasion, however I did note that some patrons where wearing beach shorts and t-shirts. Not really the kind of ambiance I'd like when spending around $400 including tip. But alas I dined like royalty and enjoyed my stay. I started off with the Heirloom Tomato, California Burrata, Balsamic Aspic, Basil, Extra Virgin Olive Oil salad. It was beyond words and more than just a salad. The flavors that my palate were introduced to were unbelievable. My lovely girlfriend went with the Warm Maine Lobster, White Wine Braised Baby Leeks, Mustard Vinaigrette  that was sublime. Tender, succulent and bursting with flavor. A Light size portion that is more about taste and saving room for the next course. For my entree I went with the Char Broiled Filet Mignon, Rossini Style, Foie Gras, Truffle Sauce. One of the best meals I've ever had the privilege to enjoy. Definitely worth the $79 it was priced at. Ill include a picture of this wonderful bit of paradise. I was hesitant to try foie gras but my curiosity was rewarded with an delicacy  that is no longer available in Los Angeles. It was cooked to perfection and looked as immaculate as it was delectable. My girlfriend had the Prime Aged Bone-In Ribeye, Caramelized Onions and added the black truffle sauce that complimented it exquisitely. A magnificent slab of meat suitable for a king or queen in this case. Bought some cocktails that seemed overpriced but the craftsmanship put into concocting them is well worth the steep price. The servers go out the way to make you feel comfortable, and for the time that you are there like you were as important as the president. Never did I feel hovered over or stared at as if I didn't belong. My visit was a little less than a year ago and to this day 4/23/2014 I am still raving about it. We are going back to EDC Las Vegas this year and are struggling to find another restaurant to match the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. And the killer view of the fountains and strip is more romantic than can be described. Definitely a meal that will stand out for a long time. Adieu!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What a nice touch!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My girlfriend&#39;s entree.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their filet mignon topped with foie gras

I-dmph9XKQaOA37VLn0ZHQ.text: We didn't eat here. We waited a sec for a table in the rapidly emptying restaurant at 10:00 and they stuck us in a corner. Why pay for a view that you won't see? We left and went down to Mon Ami Gabi instead.

fi8Xgf9PGIlg64k2-J490A.text: If you take your out-of-town visitors to one place, take them here! I took every visitor stopping through town here and they all said it was one of the most memorable experiences. The restaurant is absolutely amazing! Gorgeous view of the strip and consistently good french food. Reservations are definitely recommended and you must reserve with your credit card information.  It you don't feel like dropping a lot of $$$ but would still like to experience this gem, just go to the bar area. The views are almost as good as the dining room and you can order small bites and drinks while you watch the Bellagio fountains show. Definitely try the souffles! The pistachio is my favorite!

ZYA32V2DaPRKNfckmzbEWA.text: The worst value for your money. Pushy waiter insisting on bottled water, cold bread and very high prices. The food was mediocre at best, nicely presented.  Nice view of the Bellagio fountains, we would never recommend this place to our friends.

rZFJ6lGQNNgO7W-ZawVaZQ.text: We celebrated my birthday last night at the Eiffel Tower Las Vegas Restaurant. I loved everything about it. The service, food and view was spectacular.  I would highly recommend you make reservations in advance and request a view.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This drink is titled &#34;The Eiffel Affair and contains fresh raspberries, blueberries and strawberries macerated in Vodka.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you like Sangria, then you will definitely enjoy this refreshing cocktail titled &#34;The Eiffel Affair.

_ri9wWaW9ziacAtdr3-nbA.text: Very good food, gorgeous view and excellent service. An elevator drops you right off in front of the kitchen.  Every seat in the restaurant has an amazing view of the strip. The bread was fresh. I ate the salmon and asparagus. The French Riesling  was really good as well.

suP5YBDkpilaBEpV2r2cQQ.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful, offering to show my dinner guest the way to the men's room.  The view is breathtaking and wherever you are in the restaurant you can get a glimpse of the awesome fountain show at Bellagio.  The food is pretty mediocre all the way.  Pricey, my dish was $44 for black cod baked in a bag.  My dinner guest had short ribs, pretty small portions for $52.  For these prices, they can do much better with the quality of food in terms of presentation and the taste.  But then again, you are paying for location and view.  I thought it would be super touristy but it wasn't at all that bad.  Probably be more like 2 1/2 stars as opposed to 2.  Would probably not go back there again but was worth the experience for the view.

aOghuT9R7U5hEYedH8I3-g.text: Freaking AMAZING!!! It's so romantic. They us window seats so we were able to view the Bellagio water fountain. The food was amazing. We started with scallops,  beef target, and escargot. Way too much food! I was stuffed! The next time, I'll just do the scallops because they were cooked perfectly. My main entree was the filet with foie gras on top. It was melt in your mouth delicious! I couldn't finish it but I definitely packed it to go. The staff is really nice and friendly. I can't wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RC6QoELm1RURnLlqfpCY5A.text: Great dining experience.  Met up with a couple hadn't seen in awhile.  Was truly impressed with the ambience.  The views are amazing.  The staff was attentive and the food was done to perfection.  Wife had vege crepes and I had chicken.  Many sides and dessert.  Only drawback was souffle lacked kick.  Good but not as light and airy as others.  But highly recommend to anyone in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uTrYdrrCwTd0gnrNFL85XQ.text: A beautiful experience!  First! You get to take a private elevator up to the restaurant. That's pretty fun, just by itself. When entering the views are breathtaking!   We were sat with a great spot to enjoy the fountain show! Best view! However, it's a small half circle table and just behind us was the service bar, so it wasn't very inviting. It felt quite cramped.   The gentleman who served our bread and water was a lovely man- always a smile! And I loved how he paused when offering my selection of bread to make sure I didn't want to try the other offerings... I did!!! Being polite, I initially asked for one, but because of his nice smile and kind disposition he knew I wanted to try all 3!! They were yummy.  However, Eiffel Tower, with these prices, cold bread and ice cold butter is just not acceptable! Not enticing at all. (I still ate all of the bread :)  We ordered the scallops for an appetizer. They did not disappoint!!! Absolutely delicious!!! Yum and yum!   For dinner we had the filet. We ordered it medium rare. However, because it's such a large cut, the edges were completely well done. For $70- I can't say I was very happy. Still not happy. I've had many filet mignon, so I might advise one to not try it here, unless you like your meat well cooked. Perhaps a butterfly cut might help if your heart is set on it, though.   For dessert we had the chocolate souffle. It was not mind blowing. But it was yummy. They have 8 flavors to choose from!!! So don't get chocolate- branch out and try something fun! Passion fruit would have been fun!   And maybe I'm New School- but I feel like the lady in the restroom who wants a tip for handing you a towel is tacky. I'm not a fan. Who takes their purse to the go to the restroom? And then I feel guilty for washing my hands!!! Those days went out with Breakfast at Tiffany's.  For 3 items and a glass of house wine- the total was $140!!   I'd definitely return to sit at the lovely bar and enjoy the beautiful ambiance and views! Have a drink, maybe the scallops? But the price you pay for the food, just doesn't match the Wow factor - like when I saw the bill!!!

I7axxQPCtefC716zV6gv4w.text: Cute little date spot :)   Best part of our meal besides the view was the seafood tower and souffle.   Not the best restaurant in Vegas but if you g to Vegas a lot you must eat here at least once :) it's fun and fancy.

-WL7bbsED8CnbYh_UNXlvA.text: As a Vegas local, we all usually have pretty high expectations for restaurants but our visit here really superseded all our expectations in every way. The service was ahhhhhmazing and the food even better! From the view to the great appetizers and fabulous dessert, it was really one of the best dinner in experiences we've had on the strip!

JNQRgSMJKlG9G1Rly8AxwQ.text: Beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains from a nice height. Some of the tables are shaped to enhance the view from the tower which was nice. We both ordered the Parmesan crusted chicken for lunch and we really liked it. Flavorful and tender. Our only criticism for this hot-spot was the smaller selection from the menu to choose from. Great and quick responding service.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan crusted chicken

JFJ7Ajeb69jruXBApuPJXA.text: Omg this might be my death row meal!  It started with a cold fennel soup amuse that I could have left and felt happy but that was not the end.  The lobster salad was next.  Perfection a mix of lobster, potato and mushroom.  Then the ribeye with bone marrow.  The marrow was to die for.  Creamy, salty, fatty bliss.  The steak aged and intense in flavor.  The mushroom side dish upped the decadence of the meal.  Finally the best souffle of my life.  A pistachio dream.  Excellent service and amazing view.

Dp2GogwuyoyMm7MyNRnpJQ.text: I've been coming to Las Vegas ever since I was young, and this was my first time dining at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. It was an experience I'll never forget!  Made reservations for 8:00 on a Thursday night and was pleasantly surprised to be seated near the window, it was a very romantic spot for my boyfriend and I. The server (Igor, I believe) was funny and attentive. He was on top of things and having him as our waiter was a nice addition to a fantastic evening.   For an appetizer, we ordered the steak taretare, which was amazing. I've had my fair share of taretare, but this one really took the cake. For dinner, I ordered the beef wellington and my boyfriend ordered the veal medallions, both of which were out of this world.   Overall, the food, the view, and the service were all spectacular. I highly recommend this place if you want lasting memories!

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best Shirley Temples around! The view didn&#39;t hurt, either.

cukmJTzddiDvBfmiCmRACQ.text: Very classy. Enjoyed our dinner with a terrific view over looking the strip. Even though we has a little wait to be seated.During that time we had a few drinks at the bar. I don't recall what I had but the bartender recommend a pear infused martini? But whatever it was, it was delicious! Be prepare to open your checkbook. Beside the food, the view & the hospitality is what you are paying for. All in all it was worth it.

QInmvYJ6OhHMMR89xsfBog.text: Absolutely LOVED this restaurant! Yes, it is pricey but I had no idea a garden salad could taste that good. Escargot was delicious. Even the country white bread and butter astounded my taste buds. I had the duck which was delicious but was still my least favorite part of the meal.  Restaurant does have a dress code so dress appropriately. That being said, boyfriend and I had no idea so they provided him a white collared shirt without any problems and I was not treated with any ounce of disrespect in my t-shirt and jeans.  We had a lovely view of the Bellagio fountain show!  Highly highly recommended!

g4ShmrX3M84wJ4nMkqXdcQ.text: Amazing experience. Beautiful strip view of Bellagio Fountains...Highly recommend the caviar, duck--and ofcorse champagne!  Once in a lifetime

OtL-AJ20zPWC_mja94phNQ.text: The chicken and dessert was good, steak was dry.  Wine lovers don't bother bringing your own bottle for a special occasion as they have an exorbitant corkage fee - a sure sign of a mediocre wine list.

J2s1afyXoBzKD2epjbKXQQ.text: My BAE and I had one of the best meals at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant located in the Paris Hotel. We had made reservations weeks in advance.  A very romantic place where we had a window view of the Las Vegas Strip. From the hostess that guided us up the elevator to our waiter--the staff was so helpful and accommodating.  We started off with our regular Hennessy and two seafood platters. The platters included, lobster, crab, oysters and clams. The meat easily came out of the shells. I don't think I have ever had crab meat come out that easy. Very good start to our meal.  The filet mignon was cooked a perfect medium rare and accompanied by a side of (classic) potato gratin.   We finished our dinner with a pumpkin souffle and espressos. A very romantic and enjoyable time. Great food, date and view--what else can you ask for?

eajIffHVPY6ln8nxdN0Yeg.text: The Amuse bouche was a smoked salmon pate mouse that I will never forget, nothing here disappoints, the view, the spectacular, perfectly executed menu, the service... all above and beyond!  This is a very special occasion place!

plg0pDeYVHbqVBwZZsVAiA.text: We had the most delicious dinner and a wonderful view. You have to get the souffle for dessert. All around a great evening!

A5kz0ComVSNfsMNE4dc2mw.text: So delicious and the view is amazing!! Great food and great service. Love being able to see the Bellagio water show from our table.

pbpRLZHBzTfZOE4vkA53Cw.text: We were looking for somewhere to brunch on Sunday. A concierge told us this place had a brunch special of $30.99 for the meal and $12.99 to add unlimited mimosas. This place looks like the Eiffel Tower and the elevator to get in is inside the hotel. There is one elevator to take you up there. As the door opens, you see the kitchen and the chefs cooking. Once we got into the restaurant I knew that the brunch special had to be a mistake. The servers were in professional attire and the tables had linen tablecloths and a boatload of cups and silverware for one person aka fancy. My thoughts were confirmed by the bartender laughing at us when we told him what we came for. At that point my friends and I were tired of looking for a place so we sat at a table. The views were incredible! The food and drinks were extremely expensive. I settled on the brunch special that included three courses for $40. The presentation was amazing for the appetizer and entree but didn't taste that great. The shrimp appetizer really was delicious and brought a whopping two pieces of shrimp. The entree was steak with an interesting wine sauce. It was ok. I guess I should have expected small portion sizes for this kind of place but I was blown away at paying almost $70 for a subpar meal and ONE drink. A MIMOSA WAS $18! yes I know Vegas is expensive but damn! The dessert was gross. I love dessert and it didn't do it for me. It was some sort of frozen fluffy yogurt. I don't know how to describe it. I probably would not go back to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and egg entree. Eh
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XMZCxfT9MEnQuLCsDKP0dg.text: My wife and I LOVED this place. It was our first time ever going to a restaurant of this caliber. We're more of a budget friendly kind of people and we decided that we deserved one REALLY good dinner and cost wouldn't be an issue. It was the most expensive dinner we've ever had. We wanted to find something that was the whole package and at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant that's exactly what we got. The ambiance was perfect. It was soooo intimate , romantic, and personal, you almost forget that there's a bunch more people there. There is noise but it's not noisy. You barely notice any other sounds other than the conversation you're having and the sound of your knife and fork on the plate. Having a window table overlooking the fountain just ads a really nice touch to the whole experience. The filet mignons were to die for. They had an amazing crust with just the right amount of salt and pepper for seasoning and the meat just melted in your mouth. There was no effort cutting or chewing. We had some drinks too, the Pink Velvet and the Pain Killer. Pretty pricey but soooo good. Some of the best cocktails we've ever had. Amazing flavor and mega strong!  The staff are beyond great. So friendly and professional. They're the best. Chris G was our waiter and by far one of the best I've ever had. Answered every question we had, made great recommendations, had a nice laugh with him, and helped make our experience there that much better. When I called to make the reservation I spoke with Miles and right off the bat he made me excited to go have dinner there. He was able to get me a nice table at a great time and made it seem real personal just booking my reservation. Everything was just phenomenal there. Best restaurant experience my wife and I have ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wmAdcjOCLkFcgzOCfSTsXg.text: Amazing experience here. This was my second time dining at this restaurant. Food options are great and drinks are creative and tasty. The view is amazing especially at night. Would definitely recommend. 4 stars!

7P_ro3PiHKJ1mvg29WFGPw.text: For an anniversary celebration we showed up at the Eiffel Tower without a reservation, on a moment's whim. In short order the hostess placed us at a table overlooking the Bellagio dancing fountains; the romantic view for which my honeybunny was hoping!  After much discussion with Igor -- our server extraordinaire, who completely made our evening -- we decided upon the Chef's tasting menu. Each course was worthwhile, with exceedingly high marks for the venison: succulent, tender, perfectly-cooked, gently seasoned to bring out the best taste notes. The celeriac puree upon which it was seated was the perfect counterpoint.  Unlike most tasting menus, this one has large portions, and both of us were very sated before the dessert course. We enjoyed both the chocolate taster plate and the banana tower and would do both again :-)  This was a great two-and-a-half hours, Igor took care of us from start to finish, and a return to the Eiffel Tower restaurant is at the top of our list.

JJZUZ0k3zcY5270kh7xKVQ.text: Made reservations for husband's birthday. We got there and was seated, but in a corner, not the cozy tables that everyone else sat in. Food was mediocre. I ordered chicken breast and husband got rack of lamb. He had to send it bk 2x because it look as if they had just done autopsy on the rack. Wine was $19 and i wasn't able to wet my throat .

sXZr3gYf4GtqJVOf8Yt0bw.text: This was our Honeymoon dinner and surpassed all of our expectations.  Got the table with a view I had hoped for but couldn't reserve in advance.  Thank you receptionist.   Roman our table captain was absolutely stupendous.  Service from him down to the table runners was flawless.  The cuisine was imaginative and the desserts generous.  Perhaps it was the occasion, or the fact we were dressed in suit and gown.  Whatever it was, we got treated like royalty from beginning to end.  Nothing beats Old World style formal dining.  Too bad that not all the diners around us could appreciate the experience and tone down their raucous behavior.

tbhd4rXt9XgmazU-CQs6NA.text: Absolutely stunning views all around and the drinks are unique and delicious. We have been here multiple times for special occasions, but my biggest complaint is that for 6 years you have offered the same vegetarian option. I really wish there were more options for vegetarians/vegans than just one thing that never changes. A lot of restaurants have multiple items or they rotate them. Please help us out and we will visit more.

jq61lmZ7IxMzNbnKl6B1mw.text: Friendly staff, great cocktails and the best view in town- overlooking the Bellagio fountain show. Be aware men must wear a collared shirt and wear closed shoes. The restaurant would provide you a shirt if you came with a T-shirt, but it's uncomfortable and looks bad.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.

06rzM86_ztT3-ACrakCWnw.text: We can here for New Years Day brunch! I got an event notification on facebook about crepes at Eiffel Tower Restaurant for New Years Day Brunch! That sounded really good! Well there actually was no crepes, only a kids menu crepe. So that was kind of a bummer but then we where still hungry and excited to try something out. Important note- we don't eat pork... this actually narrowed the menu down quite a bit. I am not eating meat at all so really my choices where pasta or waffles and my husband ended up getting a burger when he really wanted something more breakfast like. Everything was good, customer service was pretty good too but the menu was really small and included a lot of pork or dairy and meat mixed. I got the waffles which where good but really rich and I could only eat a few bites before I got a sugar overload. We both left feeling tired from eating sugary or heavy foods. The view was amazing though!

2t1kTcW0yuG6D4W9vG9gMA.text: Visited here for dinner with my wife while on vacay in Las Vegas. Food is just ok - not much of a "Wow" factor. Don't get me wrong; the food was NOT terrible. I would try another French Restaurant next time we are in Vegas.   Wanted a table by the window so they suggested we reserve for an early time. Time suggested was 4:30pm which is a bit early for us but confirmed anyway. Scenery was nice and service was superb. Just a little disappointed with the food.   We had the Caesar Salad which to me was the best dish. They make their own dressing which was very flavorful since it had garlic, olive oil, anchovies, and other miscellaneous ingredients. We also ordered the rack of lamb and the filet topped with foie gras. Just ok.   If you like the scenery and a nice view of the Bellagio fountains and just ok French cuisine then give this place a try.
