0WCZe-HTuoc3jeA6Bb4iWw.text: My boyfriend and I were lucky to get a table by the window, I put in my reservation about a month in advance. The view of the Bellagio fountains were just breathtaking, this place is definitely the definition of fine dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aLJVjQGlXpHq_hjxf3_OrQ.text: I'm not one to really downplay a really amazing meal but I want to explain  why I felt my experience was just okay.  I'll give the good and the bad to provide a fair review and why I would not return unfortunately.  My group and I dressed up quite nice for this place and headed over on time,  as in we were 10 minutes early just in case.  They suggested this as well.   I called ahead like I had read others do to make a request to get a window seat and the service I got on the phone had been fine. The woman made it sound like it would be easily accommodated and I believed her considering I called a whole week ahead.  She told me when I arrived speak to the front to confirm and so I did. I was greeted with a very monotone blank reply of "unfortunately that is usually kept for 2 people so if you'd like to sit we'll call you when you're ready". A little peek into the future all I saw were groups of four... But the reply I got was what I did not approve. No considerate explanation she just brushed it off and said sit down in a rude tone. And no eye contact? That's always a sure sign you're getting great service....  The window seat wasn't the biggest deal but we got a far seat with an overly excited group of women banging their table, laughing excessively loud and using flash photography throughout their meal. Or how about the table in front of us that was glued to their phones and since I was on an elevated platform all I saw in front of me was women editing selfies and checking how many people viewed their snapchat. The reviews who say it was classy make me think they had a better experience than I.  This place is more what you'd call "Vegas classy" because had I been in SF these types of parties would have been asked to calm down and remove their devices from the tables.   I give it 3 stars for the entire experience. For goodness sakes, they called me the wrong name when bringing us to the table. Not even an attempt to ask how to say my name, just a really butchered wrong name.  And most of you know the ability to say one's name makes the entire experience more personal. Then we were lead to our table that was placed for 3 instead of four so they made us go back to the lounge once again and wait another 10 minutes. That's not a fine dining experience to me unfortunately.  You've had my reservation for weeks and we get there early make us wait in a tightly packed waiting area and then get it wrong? Maybe in a casual restaurant that'd be fine, but if you tout about being the best you damn well better live up to it. A butchered name and an additional wait because they screwed up? Not living up to the expectation.   For those above reasons I gave it a 3 because it was genuinely just a-ok.   Now the food and service we got was good. Rebecca our server was wonderful and knew her information, which I highly respected as some of my friends didn't know certain parts of their meals.   The filet mignon and the rack of lamb were great, although I will say this. One of my party's steaks was a very easily rare when he had asked for medium rare. I truly believe you can tell how great a place is by the ability to cook the steaks perfectly and he had an extremely rare steak. Not a medium rare, a bloody-raw-middle rare looking steak. That wasn't okay.   We ordered a souffle which was wonderful and came out on time since we had ordered ahead. It had risen nicely and the texture was soft while the flavor was light with a nice touch of the Nutella flavor.  That was probably the nicest part of the meal.   It wasn't the worst experience and I'm no fine dining expertise, but I have certainly had my fair share of classy restaurants in LA, SF, NYC, and DC and this just didn't seem to be on par. Part of it is some of the clientele you get. They bloody tell you business casual with jacket preferred after 4 but I see a man in a opened plaid button down with jeans on?   You have a mixture of fine diners and people who look like they're going to clubs. And then you get people who are overly obnoxious at their tables without respect for others because it's Las Vegas and not some real nice restaurant in some upscale neighborhood of a metropolitan city. My friend accidentally bumped into a woman and she was so offended she had to turn around and make a nasty comment? Such a classy experience! Not to exclude the fact that he apologized profusely and was trying to make room for someone else to walk?   A mixture of good and bad service, coupled with decent food and a bad seating placement make me go with a 3 star experience. I didn't leave this establishment thinking "wow that was the most amazing meal I've had" I left thinking it was okay. I paid four hundred dollars for a incorrectly cooked steak, a wrong use of my name, obnoxious clients around us and the errors made initially and with that I probably will not return to this establishment and will look elsewhere for a better fine dining restaurant.

bT7dJNVIJQW8oZTXBQktVA.text: Great restaurant, food serving size is a little smaller than you can probably get elsewhere but was good. Experience was great as our server was on point with suggestion, very knowledgeable, and made sure we had what we needed timely.

fVbp57iC8atUrhVrCfTzwg.text: Well you definitely get what you pay for at the Eiffel Tower Steak House. My wife and I made the advertised 4:30 reservation to get a window seat for the amazing view of the Bellagio Fountains. I had the 22 oz Bone Morrow Ribeye and I requested a blue cheese crust which was not on the menu but after our server spoke to the chef they were able to accommodate the request. This was the best steak I've ever had, the bone Morrow was as amazing as everyone says, paired with a nice glass of wine and the amazing views this is an all time favorite of ours. Highly recommended for anyone looking for an amazing overall dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TLOAHSDVZckeQriAOA3LJw.text: Hello! My husband took me for my bday to this restaurant for dinner, I am leaving 5 stars because the service is excellent, the food is amazing super delicious, the view is also wonderful right in-front of the Bellagio fountains. The only downside I would say is that it is very pricey.. though again the food is worth it. Totally will recommend this if you are trying to take that someone to have an amazing time.

-oTBa8KoCUwF83HoA_Hokw.text: Had the tasting menu with wine pairing, and while the atmosphere was amazing and the service exceptional, the food was good but not fantastic.  The meal was over priced for the food served.  Don't get me wrong, some of the courses were delicious (foie gra, main lobster, souffle)

8IVC4HwRjO5nRo0WWOVigg.text: Came here for dinner for my friends bday  Environment: located inside the Paris hotel, the restaurant has a very classy feel with a spectacular view of the Bellagio water fountain. The restaurant is dimly lit, they play jazz music, most people are dressed up as resort wear with collared shirts and long pants for men is required. They also have a person in the restroom that hands you towels when you are done washing your hands.  Service: my waiter was awesome, as well as the wine lady who constantly made sure my glass was filled. I felt a little bad for my waiter as he was squished in the corner table. My biggest distaste in this section was the fact that I had requested seating with a nice view of the fountain, but they still put me in a tight corner although there was some availability closer. Everyone in my section seemed a little bothered probably with the same issue. My waiter really made things better though and even gave us a complimentary birthday dessert which is super appreciated and topped off my friends birthday night.   Dinner and drinks: they have a wide variety of wine selection, mostly above the price of 70 minimum. There cocktail list was a little limited with the basic drinks like old fashion and manhattan, nothing too special.  The food on the other hand was amazing. First, their bread selection was subpar. It made me crave Mon Ami Gabi's fresh baguette right down stairs. But we ordered the escargot, the steak and lamb. The escargot came fried and sauteed. It was drowned in a delicious olive oil sauce that taste amazing with their bread. The ny steak was cooked perfectly which is medium rare for me. The crust was salty and nicely crispy, which a warm tender inside. It wasn't very large, so I left craving for me. It really tasted like butter and melts in your mouth, so good! The lamb with the ratatouille was also super delicious perfectly cooked medium rare. It also tasted buttery, but had that gamey taste. The side dish olive oil mashed potato was also good but nothing remarkable.  Overall, this place is very romantic and good for special occasions. The food and drinks are pretty over priced, but nothing I didn't expect from eating on the strip. You should probably arrive early if you want better seating. But, I really enjoyed the atmosphere, the view (even from the corner) and the amazing food. Hats off to the chefs and waiters!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. complimentary bruh day dessert, thank you! Delicious!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good food and a good view, great for special occasions
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Olive oil mashed potatoes, pretty good

ijZ_BLHdJHhZjfr4N1ExJA.text: Excellent service and quality of food. View of city, was beyond of expectations. Wine, appetizers, main course, sides and dessert (chocolate souffle) were beyond my expectations. Highly recommended.

P7I3pqyIDJKcq8LpvY7X_w.text: Wow. This restaurant is spectacular! We are not normally the types to splurge on an expensive dinner, but this was worth it.  We made a reservation late in the day the day of our anniversary. They were unable to give us a table by the window (make a reservation by 4:30pm to get one!) but we still got a table with a view of the Bellagio fountains.  We ordered cocktails at the bar, which were delicious. The entrees were delicious. I got a beef Wellington and my husband got a king filet minon. Both were spectacular. Then for dessert we tried one of their signature souffles in the pistachio flavor. Perfectly light and delicious!  They have a person who will take a photo of you for $25. They were super willing to work with me to get the perfect anniversary photo.  I definitely recommend this place for special events.

E6nYlUQZ-J7c7P1ynxbZhQ.text: My wife took me here for our date night last Saturday. This restaurant was phenomenal. My wife booked us a Window Seat overlooking the Bellagio Water Show.... that view was remarkable and romantic. Ha. Our entrees were delicious. I even ordered the creamy spinach twice. We ended up spending about $200.00 easy here. It was well worth the experience. We advise everyone to experience Eiffel Tower at least once.

i10jIY3cbRJ_bh0tJSWWIg.text: Not cheap, but the view and service were great.   If you have party of 2, def try to be the window seat. We had 4, but still able have a fairly good view.   Lamb, steak, pork chop were all delicious. The bread at the beginning were so good that we ate a little too much of that, so was so full half way through the entrees.   But even with all that food. We were able to even finish the souffles! Pistachio one was better, than the caramel one we had.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snapper fillet
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb

4ElUOWb2f_2Vg9Z4yFi_rg.text: Yum! Delicious food and breathtaking views.  Food is excellent, starting from the bread all the way to entrees.  One tiny note is maybe a bit salty sometimes - which I think is the typical of "Americanization" :p  Service was excellent.

t9ucadAWpgIf5SsbYmozwQ.text: I came here with my fiance for his birthday. The reservation requires a credit card and they charge you $50 if you don't show. I actually think that's a great way to hold people accountable for their reservations. Anyways, although we were not able to get a window table we still had a great view of the strip and Bellagio fountains.   Our waitress was kind and attentive. The food was amazing. I had the salmon and he had the cod. The sides are technically individual but it was enough for us to split. We had the creamed spinach and mushrooms and mashed potatoes which were good.   I would recommend this place for a romantic dinner.

khMqszI53vBXV46lTyqOBg.text: We showed up here and were told that there is a 45 minutes wait. So we patiently waited at the lounge area. After 45 minutes, people who came after us were seated (maybe they had reservations?), on checking with them they mentioned waiting for the"fireworks" to get over.   After about 75 minutes of waiting I spoke with the manager, who was unapologetic and we left. Good place to waste your time and as for the view, it was nothing compared to our room at Wynn.

x8piM3mU8b8SA8laQZb5Kw.text: We booked the Salon Prive at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant to host our wedding reception for 25 persons.  It was wonderful  The manager of the restaurant was very good at quickly giving me pricing and options, then when we made our selections he handled all the details perfectly.  I had given him some decorations and party favors to put out and when we arrived after the ceremony the room was beautiful and perfect.  The staff was so attentive and professional and the food was amazing.  Everyone had menus to order from and all the food arrived at the same time,  hot and delicious    We had some people party heartily, and the staff was great there also  P.S., miscellaneous sanitation bucket is $50.  ooops  and they were so nice about it.!!!!!!

lUZgujl33WYVM5YW16ERRg.text: The restaurant is in a prime location in the center of the strip. Fabulous views. The service was outstanding. I am disappointed the dress code in not followed or enforced. There was a gentleman standing in proximity to our table on his cell phone loudly discussing business for 20 minutes. Overall the experience was underwhelming. As I said the service was great, however the food was not good. The escargot was serviced cold and unattractive. The soup with scallops was very bland--no seasoning. The beef Wellington fell apart and was almost well done instead of medium rare. It was terrible. The chocolate souffle was nice. Overall I do not recommend this place to eat. If you want an elegant and refined dinner try Picasso at the Bellagio.

FgMykqElsLNTc1VNDzfXPw.text: This was our third time dining at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant, and the food was wonderful as always.  The view is spectacular, especially if you have a window seat as we have all three times. Our waiter was very nice and quite helpful with menu suggestions.  The evening would have been wonderful once again except that as the server was clearing our dinner plates he unfortunately spilled what was left of my wife's glass of wine on her dress.  He was very nice helping clean things up and explained to our waiter what had happened, but did nothing more than fill her glass with what was left in the bottle. When you pay $400 for a dinner, you would expect at least a replacement pour or a complimentary dessert, but we were offered nothing.

SME6AyMymYsNv9VQ3bfceg.text: I've been here for brunch as well as for dinner and had 2 wonderful experiences.  Except for the fact that they made me wear one of their over-sized blazers.  My nice, long sleeve, tapered, crew shirt lacked a collar.  I just think it's ridiculous that the guy in the Under Armor coaches shirt, flimsy collar and protruding belly included, could lounge about in this nice restaurant blazer free.  A little discretion from the hostess' when it comes to doling out the scarlet jacket would be nice.    Now, back to the wonderful experiences.  First, call ahead and reserve a table at the windows with a fountain view.  It's the best view on the strip and a perfect place for a romantic dinner.  This is a must.  Choosing a entree was difficult.  They have an excellent Chef, and their menu is fantastic, but at the end of it, I had been craving a steak all day, and ordered the filet.  It was the best steak I ever had!  And I eat a lot of red meat.  For desert?  Creme brulee; a perfect way to end the meal.  I'll be back!

pIKu8u2Uqi7B7pNnxFGlSw.text: The view is good.  The food is alright.  For the price you pay for fine dining, atmosphere and service, you have better choice in Vegas.  The only good thing is the souffle

bG2HOYV57ByMRoqNrRvfrA.text: My wife and I decided to treat our selfs after winning at the tables. I have to say this was no treat. This place is morbidly overpriced, The food is average at best. Service was pretentious at times and comical at other time. There are restaurants that I have been to that were expansive, how ever those have warrented the price tag. This place was a joke. The only reason I am giving an extra star is because we both had a good lough. I just remembered it was not a lough it was a lough upside down. I am reading all these great reviews of this glorified haute cuisine wanna be, and I am puzzled. Sooooo many places in Vegas that truly serve fantastic food with great service. This one is not it.

QwVdZ4DF8YOfa3MiqA0ZEw.text: View is AMAZING!  We did not have a reservation and they said the wait was going to be 30 minutes, but it was only about 10.  The lobster appetizer and the scallop appetizer my table had was very delicious.  I had the crusted salmon with a side of green beans and it was very good.  The salmon was cooked perfectly and crusted very well.  The green beans had a lemon foam on top that was a neat touch.  They also bring out complimentary desserts (5 small desserts) that were very good.  Make sure and get a view of the Bellagio fountain, they will go off many times during dinner and it is a fantastic view.

YKOcpBYj7uI84u6o3DcyCg.text: Don't miss this one.  The setting is so similar to the real one down to the smallish quarters and open kitchen.  The service is impeccable.  I ordered coffee with dessert and had taken out a small amount of the sugar packet to taste.  It wasn't enough but when I went to add more, the packet had already been cleared from the table top without my realizing.   The mushroom soup was fabulous.  You cannot ruin fois gras and its nice to see it on the menu.  The lamb chops were as tender and tasty as any I've ever had,  while the Wellington wasn't the best I've had it was so nice to see there.  Souffle for dessert, a view of the Bellagio fountains.  An amazing evening without fault.

oi2pPJtYQWWOhKeLsb1EVw.text: Part of me feels like fine dining should be transcendent and have this major WOW factor. By nature I want to hate places like this... in a hotel, overpriced, etc.. but I can't fault them on anything, really. They have a large varied menu of solid French food. Rabbit? check. Duck? check. Foie Gras? check. Also a huge array of fish. If you're looking for a run of the mill "nice" dinner that won't disappoint and would appeal to anyone, this is your place. Awesome view, awesome ambience, and although pricey, the food is solid. Not 'omg this is the best food I've ever tasted', just solid and predictable and good. Sometimes you don't want noveau California cuisine.. you just want something reliable and tasty.  I had the seared foie gras, and I got the ahi tuna I had last time again. Both incredible. Dessert was a pistachio souffle. They get points for originality on that one.. plus the flavor was awesome.   After eating at some of the more edgy places in town recently (Cut, Strip Steak, Shibuya, Little Buddha, etc) and being disappointed.. this place is 2/2 on fabulous experiences.

Nxdx6fnVF7sPUEzDTU_2eg.text: I loved this place!  First of all, I made reservations about a week in advance and I mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary so they gave us wonderful seats.  We got to sit right in front of the windows with an excellent view of the Bellagio water shows.    The food was excellent.  My fiance ordered their romaine salad and their NY steak... I had their escargot and salmon.  Everything was soooooo good.  And best of all: their chocolate souffle.  OMG.  So freaking wonderful.  Their cocktails: orgasmic.  I loved it!  Best of all, we got to meet Mike Tyson who happened to be eating there as well.  No worries guys, I left with both of my ears in tact ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. heavenly chocolate souffle!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. views of the Bellagio behind us

4SMgOrxEG90NtksQxXVCfA.text: I was extremely disappointed in the Eiffel Tower Restaurant! This used to be one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas for the first-class experience and food that it offered. Sadly they seem to have lost their way. The service was so bad it actually set a negative tone for the rest of the evening! It seems to me that the restaurant's number one goal is to maximize the cost of the meal, rather than provide a positive experience for the guest. They require each guest to purchase an entree (no sharing, no ordering salads or appetizers only).   After getting the manager's approval to share a 9 oz. steak that cost $69 a la carte, our server's attitude turned cold. The timing of the food was terrible. I had taken about two bites from my appetizer when my steak was placed in front of me. My friend, who ordered two appetizers instead of one entree, received both at once. His scallops were cold. (I see that other reviewers mention undercooked scallops, so this is not an isolated or new issue.) Another friend ordered the "warm lobster" dish, and it was also cold! We had informed our server that one guest would be arriving late, and she brought his salmon out and delivered it to an empty seat to sit and get cold. Our side dish never came out, and the server said she didn't know we ordered it. We ordered the souffle at the beginning of the meal since we were told that it took a while to prepare, and waited at least 30 minutes after all of the plates were cleared for it to come out. With all of these issues, it was the server's cold demeanor that made us the most uncomfortable.  It is such a shame that the management is allowing the service to slide here, and are ruining what was once a truly wonderful experience. I hope they take reviews like this into account, and make adjustments to their poor attitudes about service!

I3WgEPmX7Jl9ZpwxAK6RXw.text: Just don't.  The food was good - not great.  We bought a package, dinner and show.  Dinner was prepaid.  There was some glitch on their part so far as payment for the dinner part of the package was concerned.  The manager took off with our credit card and show tickets -- no explanation whatsoever -- for over a half an hour.  We were held hostage and could not leave.  We repeatedly asked about the credit card.  Apparently (according to the bizarre explanation we got) the manager had to go wait in the box office line to get the dinner vouchers.  It was very stressful.  The waitstaff literally hid. We barely made the show.  Just don't.

c6m6mitJlFeRIOnbWs7E8w.text: Great french food and the somelier will give you perfect advice for the best pairing within your budget and tastes.

hsdfeQLYzwWmv72dM7jIcg.text: First time in Vegas, and the husband took me here the first night we were there.   We sat near the window with a full view of the fountain display outside the Bellagio. Right when we got there we were pleasantly greeted, our coats were taken and hung up for us and we were shown to the table. The atmosphere was AMAZING. We ordered some wine (our server gave us spot on suggestions) and appetizers (Red Wine Marinated Quail) before the main course. Hubby ordered Slow Roasted Filet of Atlantic Salmon and I had the Muscovy Duck Breast. Can I just say that I absolutely despise salmon, but was so tempted to switch and steal the mister's salmon? What stopped me was that I was IN LOVE with the duck! I woke up the next day dreaming of going back, ahhh so good.   We had Classic Potato Gratin as a side and Creme Brulee as the dessert and my oh my, by this point I was in Frenchfoodecstasyland. Some of the best freaking food I've had in my LIFE, hands down.   Also the portions were perfect and though they take a long time bringing out the food between courses it was perfect for relaxing and conversing while watching the Bellagio fountain display. Veeerrry romantic :)  The staff was also very nice, especially one girl in particular who came over and took our picture with the fountains in the back and even complimented my dress. She was the cutest little pregnant person I've ever seen, ha! *creeper* We bought the picture afterwards, it's a nice keepsake :)  Word to the wise, go a bit earlier though. Our reservation was for 8:15 so we weren't done until close to 10:30p...and by around 10:00 all the obnoxious drunks had started getting annoying; men and women alike, but one loudmouth man in particular kept shouting and hooting across the restaurant. It was incredibly disturbing and put a damper on the end of dinner because in such a quiet place it can be pretty startling. I was actually surprised that they didn't kick them out because of the type of place it is. I wish they had.  Anyway. Can't waaaait to go back!

CVDQgePmSvou1LpPndo1pA.text: Just came back from dinner there tonight.  First of all, it was very expensive and I think that although it was a gorgeous setting, the restaurant's atmosphere just did not come together.  Honestly, it was kind of tacky.  There are sooo many wonderful restaurants in Las Vegas, with great atmosphere.  This place is not one of them.  And I hated the Christmas music.  Really??  Ugh.....  I will say the food was very good, but very overpriced.  Wish I had gone to the restaurant right below it.......

7W1lCu3dtQ4dhX2KvMlTQA.text: Food is ok, the view is amazing. You pay a high price for the view because there are much better restaurants as far as food goes.  Atmosphere is ok, waiters are not very friendly. The souffle was great!

sId8O9bpa7Z4B3S8cF12IQ.text: I had one of the best meals of my life here!  The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is a treat!  AS others have said there is a worry that this restaurant would be all about flash with no substance.  It does have flash but it also has plenty of substance to offer.  While this is not perfect it is very, very good.  The service was impeccable from start to finish with the waiter and sommelier working very hard to get us exactly the meal we were looking for.  The restaurant is designed so the spectacular view is forefront and everything else compliments that.  It is slightly noisy but not overly loud.  This place has a happy energetic hum to it.    Many couples were seated directly facing the view away from the noise so I would still recommend this place for a top notch romantic atmosphere.  We were here from out of town to celebrate an event and made the lucky choice of dining here.  We came in just as the sun was setting and watched the strip transform around us, it was breathtaking.  But this place is about more than just a sensational view.  The restaurant opened with a free amuse bouches one which paired three flavors a salmon mousse, asparagus with a lemon foam and a bit of pastry and a wonderful lobster preparation, we argued over which was the best.  We started with caviar, a blue cheese souffle pudding with salad, the fricasse of escargot, sweetbreads and fennel and finally the foie gras with pears.  The caviar was served beautifully on square platforms with indentations for the caviar, creme fraiche and chives.  It was served with a metal spoon rather than a mother of pearl but that was the only flaw.  The caviar was wonderful tasting and all the various accompaniments flawless (there were both buckwheat and plain blini AND toast points).  The foie gras was seared perfectly and came to the table at just the right temperature.  The accompanying pears in a sauternes sauce did not seem quite right as it needed more sweetness to contrast with the foie gras.  The fricasse was not as remarkable as I hope but it was a nicely balanced dish with a great contrast of textures and flavors, it seemed on the mild side for such an ambitious combination of elements but still very nicely done.  The blue cheese souffle pudding was incredible.  It was a sturdy souffle which did not fall when cut into but such a wonderful, flavor and it worked so well with the dressing on the greens.  Just wonderful, absolutely the high point of our starters.  I had the Beef Wellington which was perfectly tender and seasoned perfectly.  Done just on the rare side of medium, it was heavenly.   Our table generally loved the potato croquettes but I was somewhat underwhelmed by them.  They seemed too simple and by the time I was passed them too cool and limp.  Finally the desserts, there were many ordered and consumed at our table.  I remember the Pistachio souffle as being dreamlike in its perfection of flavor and form, the other souffles were magnificent in their execution as well but the pistachio flavor just was so intriguing and well done.  The Napoleon was lovely and just as delicate as one could wish and there was a wonderful chocolate plate that I was too full to touch but looked perfect.  Despite the magnificence of the meal, I have a few concerns about this place.  It is on the pricey side for what you get.  I almost took off a star for the very few missteps during the meal, however the overall experience was so wonderful and the great times I have had stopping by for a drink and an appetizer on past trips to Las Vegas are also terrific, I have to give this my highest rating.

yaUHeeks1sbHQ-aNuqLhlg.text: This was my second visit and as always the ambiance here is upscale and romantic.  A good vantage point of Vegas and if you're in the right spot you get a marvelous view of the Bellagio fountains.  However, unless only 2 people are dining, the vantage point is mediocre for the fountains.  Dinner was delicious.  We only ordered entrees as we had to run to a show.  Beef Wellington:  Takes approximately 30 minutes but was worth it.  Very delicious at medium rare but make sure to ask for the sauce on the side as it can be a bit overwhelming.    Roasted Chicken was delish.  It's a large portion and the veggies were cooked just right.  Salmon and the duck were also very good.  Sides:   Classic Au Gratin was dry.  Creamed corn was not good.  It was like a creamy polenta and I hate polenta.  Blah!! Creamed spinach and mushrooms were a hit for the entire table!!  The downer for this restaurant is the service.  Most of the wait staff looks confused and or rushed.  A large table next to us definitely wanted to have a good time and celebrate however, the waiter was clueless.  Our waitress was not friendly and was very curt and short with us.  A real shame for such a beautiful restaurant with good food.  I have to say that I truly enjoyed the food here however, based upon the experience with the waitstaff, the Eiffel Tower Restaurant will not be at the top of my list for a nice dinner out.  There are too many other options in Vegas that have great food and great service.

1euMacNoD_vXvPn5JhPEXg.text: Perfect place to end a short, crazy weekend. Our last day in Vegas we chose to eat here, it was a major change of scenery because we're so used to eating at crowded, noisy places. But no, not here. You get a beautiful view of the Bellagio and it's fountains, it's quiet, and oh so relaxing. The service was great, nothing they could of changed.  They started us out with parmesean balls, and a mushroom flan before our meal and it was a great starter.  I ordered their eggs benedict, omg so yummy. I think it was also topped with some spice, the bread it sat on was perfect and crisp! They serve really good iced tea by the bottle called Republic Darjeeling Tea. I read it's the "champagne" of teas. I want to go back!  Ahh I love French dining...

sXVMuf_LG5adZPJKyimt0Q.text: My husband and I decided on this restaurant to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary. Eiffel Tower Restaurant was going to kick off a spectacular night of good food, strong drinks, and luck at the poker tables...and it did just that; with style!~  Upon entering the establishment, I was startled by the kitchen being right in front of me as I exited the elevator. This was interesting but it is very crowded and hurried when you exit the elevator so you dont really have time to take it in.   The restaurant itself is much smaller than I imagined but in a good way. It is very romantic... We were seated promptly as we had a reservation. Our waitress was simply a joy and I truly enjoyed her presence throughout the evening.   A server comes around and you get to choose your own bread; that was a nice touch and the server was very very friendly and attentive. I like the server nearly as much as I enjoyed the waitress.   They bring out a complimentary amuse- I believe it was a calliflower soup?- It was served cold but it was absolutely delish! At that moment, I had full confidence that this dinner was going to be amazing! Did not disappoint~  My husband had the lamb for his entree and I had the halibut. I cannot speak about the lamb as I do not eat meat but my husband said it was cooked to perfections; which I guess is difficult to do with lamb.   The halibut was to die  for but what I enjoyed more about that entree was the bulgar wheat. The restaurant called it couscous but I am quite certain it was bulgar wheat made into a splendid tabouli! I attempt to make tabouli all the time and it is quite difficult to make really well so I was very impressed! As a side dish we had the mushroom spaetzel?- To this day we still cannot figure out if we were eating mushrooms made to look like noddles or actual noddles that were mushroom flavored. It was truly bizarre but I loved it for being different (and super tasty)   For dessert we have espresso and the Grand Marnier Souffle~   I dont think I have ever had Souffle before and it stole my heart! I probably would have choosen a different flavor next time as I do not think the Grand Marnier added much to it but it was cooked to perfection!   My husband had a great idea that when the Bellagio water show comes on, the music in the restaurant should be timed to play the same music that is going on at the water show. I must say the water show does not leave as strong of an impression without the music to go along with it.    Pricey dinner at nearly $200 for 2 people but in my opinion it was worth every cent!

u8QYt0ggO12pywnJujSKkA.text: We have just recently celebrated our Anniversary here for the 2nd time. This place is nothing short of Perfection. We have dined in so many places previous to finding this absolute GEM. I couldn't possibly cover all the superlatives this Restaurant deserves! We enjoyed a reasonably priced bottle of Wine. I had the Bone Marrow Steak & hubby had the Filet. A wonderful Lobster Salad & potato side dish and great Bread/Rolls selection. Next: The View of the Fountains and piano playing softly in the backround in a dimly lit room all comes together with the attentive service of the staff. Sommelier is spot on with wine suggestions. Next time I'd also like to try one of their specialty cocktails. Anything to stay longer and take in the whole experience! Ask for a table at the window for an exceptional view of the strip and fountains. Lyle was so helpful and our server Michael was terrific ! Some mini appetizers, a palette of asst. sorbets and a chocolate mousse were sent over compliments of ET! Wonderful ! Treat yourself to this experience of a lifetime. You only live once. And I cannot wait until next year. We could not even consider another place that could top ET for a wonderful meal/experience all the way around. A big Thank You to everyone there for our special memories !!! Check out their Facebook Fan Page for more info! Trip Advisor loves them too!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our Wine was wonderful.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taken by their professional photographer. Well worth $24.00 &amp; copy gets uploaded to your computer should you want more copies.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorbets also complimentary. Sour Cream was my fav then chocolate.

UIybRFRmTWX3LBaj6WQIcA.text: This is where my boyfriend spoiled me to a tasting menu dinner for my 30th birthday last night. Amazing ambience, attentive, sweet & knowledgable waitress, decadent amazing food, wines perfectly paired and one of my favorite parts-a window seat overlooking one of my favorite Vegas sights, the beautiful Bellagio fountains. I was spellbound & delighted by the entire experience. Extremely romantic & special. A couple even got engaged in the adjacent corner, it was that kind of perfect venue for it :) Neither of us will ever forget this meal and experience.

67AQgHFFgLh17VzTuKgIrA.text: Very good and expensive, go for the view, especially during the fountain show. Wine list was great, steaks and sides were great. Expected.

RsYX1Kr-Caru-k9qTsjAeg.text: Went there to celebrate our engagement. Food was amazing. I got the Muscovy duck breast. Was very delicious, I took the servers suggestion and got it done medium rare, would have liked it a little less pink, but they know best so I went with it. Fiance got veal medallions which were great. We shared two types of potatoes which were both great. We also got the chocolate souffle which was amazing as well. Servers were attentive and pleasant. We had a table with a prime view of bellagio fountains.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal medallions
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck breast

aciULQboLUdi4sxBoTOueQ.text: Called to make a reservation, was put on hold for 5 mins then the woman who picked up asked me what time I was looking for, was rude and spoke over me when I was asking for a reservation for a certain time then told me to hold again. That pretty much ruined my experience.

pnICufvuOqlHEvYvcJwxNw.text: Driving in to Vegas, I e-mailed Sharon to make a last minute special request at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.  Sharon was extremely helpful and took care of our reservation. When we arrived to fulfill one of our family traditions in Vegas, we were warmly greeted by the check in desk and they knew exactly who we were and what we were celebrating.  Gary our Maitre D was wonderful and took such good care of us, checking in on a regular basis to see if we were enjoying our evening. The Souffles! All 3 of them were spectacular! Thank you Sharon B. and Gary for making our first night in vegas wonderful and starting our vacation off so well!

X1ms9b_YVRd-kV3XsVWQEw.text: The trouble with writing a review for The Eiffel Tower restaurant at the Paris hotel and Casino is, making the choice about what is best about the offering.  The view of the Las Vegas strip and Bellagio water show?  The food?  The service?    The view has to be the standard of measure.  Sitting eleven stories up, the view is spectacular.  The food is first rate. For me, the service was the best part.  Our Wait Captain was named Joshua, and he made it all come together.

XeZjiMcAHbcuWxEedtdx0w.text: Great food Great view Great service (thanks Joshua!!) Yes it'd pricey but it's French food and experience is well worth it

Qs9yWIHFf5baB9k6KP4K7A.text: Came here for dinner and had rack of lamb chops, hands down the best lamb chops I've ever had (medium cooked). The chocolate souffle was also very good. My husband had the duck and it was so so.  It's quite pricey, but a real treat for a special occasion, not to mention the spectacular view of the Belagio water dance.

XRPLI_8Qyszne1r8_BMvKA.text: Bread was seen reused from other tables,appetizer was cold and small(pork belly) but most likely the best part of the dinner.    Me and my wife had a Caesar salad which was sour and unsatisfying .   Last but not least ,I had the aged new york steak which was a sea of inedible tendons and my wife had a filet mignon which tasted good until the last bites had a bad irony blood flavor.   Ambiance was good ,view was great, but don't go for the food if you can.

IVbjk8dt0iSDfMMqpADyKg.text: This was one of the best dinning experiences in my life. We took out a party of 10 and the service was just knock out. The room is really beautiful, especailly at night!. I first must add that I live in San Francisco and we have many great restaurantsthat I can compare it to. That being said I found the Eiffel tower to be better than Gary Danko, Masa's, postrio etc.  Their foie gras tourchon was amazing with a fig puree. Their take of Surf and turf: an 8oz fillet with an amazing crab crake was the best( the steak with so delicate and tender and flavorful). The potatoe gratin side was delicate, subtle, and bursting with flavor. The wine list is a knock out....from chateau margauxs to california pinots and everything in between...probably 500 different wines.  For dessert we had the souffles.....bannana , caramel, and chocolate...very good.  This restaurant is very expensive but I felt, as did the other 9 dinners, it was worth every penny. I highly recommend!!!

ic5vjG0_u_MppGQlhbGUkg.text: My friend and I spent well over $200 on lunch here including the very good wine. Yes you too can spend $200 on lunch if you should feel the desire. The service is near unmatched and superb, however the some of the food is not quite worth the price. This is another example of hype in vegas, but I will say that over all it is a wonderful place to go if you have the money to spend. the wine list is probably top five in Vegas so it's really more of a reason to stop by. I must admit that I personally took great pride and got far too much joy out of crumbling bread onto the table while no one was looking, just to see the buss boy attendee come running with his tiny crumb cleaning tool. I seriously did that like three times, (he he he).   CHAD

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. another viewpoint
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. out front

RqId6CNi6zM2xiCAKRhBmw.text: This is our 4th experience dining at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant, while the view is breath taking the "wow" factor wasn't there this time.  Can it be that we're used to seeing the view or it may be the new way they configured the tables.  Now small half round tables butted against the windows and so close to other couples that it doesn't feel as intimate.  My husband and I came (again) to celebrate our anniversary.  My husband ordered a couple of cocktails and I ordered 2 glasses of Pinot Noir.  We shared the kale salad that was a little over powered by a sweet yet tart dressing, tart cherries, walnuts and quinoa croutons that were a little soggy. Was a little disappointed that they didn't split the salad for us but served it along with 2 small plates so we divided it ourselves.  The NY steak and filet mignon was cooked to perfection and was delicious.  We shared the potato Anna - a crispy sliced buttery potato that was a tad too salty and green beans almondine that was very fresh and tasty.  For dessert we ordered the famous chocolate souffle which was delicate and rich along with a cappuccino and an Irish coffee.  Our server, David then brought a small chocolate mousse on a plate with "happy anniversary" piped in chocolate around the rim... Very delicious!  We were then presented with and got to choose from an assortment of complementary petit fours.  So stuffed at this point but couldn't resist :) David was the greatest, very friendly and made us feel comfortable, giving us the space to have a romantic dinner while making sure we were attended to.  At the end he chatted with us, thanking us for choosing to revisit.  Overall a very memorable evening.  If you haven't dined here yet, it is a must at least one time!

7zlQ6iOBSJvG5rvOqpAUKw.text: View - 5 stars.  Service-4 stars.  Food-3.5 to 4 stars (I am waffling on that one).  Went there for my bday.  Shared the warm shrimp salad appetizer (yummy marinated veggies) and blue cheese souffle appetizer (nice and light) .  Then had lobster thermidor--prepared with spinach and mushrooms in a sauce.  The downside was the grand marnier souffle which was feh.  The chocolate my friend had was a little better but still not what I dreamed it would be.  They also gave me a comp dessert for my bday, some chocolate thing in a glass that was pretty good and came on a plate decorated with chocolate that said Bonne Fete.  It was a nice dinner, but I expected even better. So many places in Vegas, don't know if I would go back.

uCfC3R4SxXbuJJlNkcAmSQ.text: What an amazing view.  The wait staff here is outstanding.  The only reason there is not 5 stars here is I had to literally send back my steak 2x because it was over cooked.   The waiter was visibly mortified and took care of us, however, by the time my meal arrived the other was cold.  I highly recommend this restaurant if you have the chance to visit and hopefully the kitchen gets it right one the first go.  You will need a healthy budget, however it's worth it for a romantic dinner.

r2wbcYkahQZzlj7huBU6KA.text: Insanely overpriced for the size and quality of food.  For example a heirloom tomato salad is $18 and is half the size of places that charge $8 - 12.  Lobster and steak are almost $70 and you get half the size other places serve for less cost.  Quality was only average at best.  I recommend Alize at the Palms for a far superior view, service, atmosphere and value! Wayne Gorsek

fcpv70wHBCazhPcW2Gt8sQ.text: OK my family ate here Christmas night 2011.  Gorgeous restaurant! Spectacular view!  Wonderful service!  Everything I ate was really good.  My only complaint were the hostesses.  All of them were sour and had the personalities of blank pieces of a paper. Luckily  there is minimal interraction with them.  The Wait Staff was really on top of it.  Awesome!  The Food...excellent.  The bread selection was extensive.  I tried about 4 different types of breads and they were all really good.  I can't think of the french term for the item they bring to start off your meal...whatever it's called, really really good.  It was a a califlower puree.  We all enjoyed it, along with the raw beef appetizer which was very flavorful.  Everyone at my table had a different entree. I can't remember what everyone had right now...I know I had the duck, someone had chicken, someone had beef, someone had fish...everyone loved their food!  A couple of people had mixed drinks...can't remember what they were.  But they liked them.  I along with my parents had red wine. Very pleased.  From the very beginning, our waiter explained to us that they are knonw for their souffle and if we wanted it, we needed to order it right away because it took a long while to make.  So my dad, sister and I went ahead and ordered the souffle. My dad and I had the chocolate souffle...my sister had the banana souffle I think.  We all enjoyed it but it wasn't ALL THAT to us.  Also, the menu said it was $8 but we were actually charged $15 per souffle.  We didn't understand why and were too lazy to inquire.  The view...I think from most/all tables in the restaurant you have a direct view of Bellagio's fountains.  It was lovely being able to watch the water show while enjoying our meal.  This place is the ultimate for a romantic dinner.  I noticed there were tons of 2 seater tables right at the window.  Which is cool, especially for their special sunset dinner they have.    On the flip side of that, I did see a lot of larger groups there, like my family.  I think because it was Christmas night, there were a lot of families like us, having their Christmas dinner there.  Great choice.  We were all very pleased.  This was one of the most enjoyable meal experiences I've had while in Vegas.  I highly recommend it!

0bqtdZHbDS49gxFxHlu1_w.text: Wow, what an amazing dining experience...worth the wait to get a fountain view table.  Our server was very knowledgable and helpful but could be perceived as a bit elitist if your baseline is Bennigans enthusiasm. Appetizers of scallops and the crab salad set the tone perfectly for the evening. We had the duck breast and the "Faux gras" for entrees and I would definitely order again.  The souffle is a must to round out a wonderful evening.

F4ZJ3OHgziFZlyqK8o5qMQ.text: Hands down, this was the best restaurant experience I've ever had. When we booked, this was what we were hoping for as my partner and I were off to Las Vegas, just the two of us, to get married and this place kept popping up time and again as being one of the most romantic in town. The reviews were good too so we sent off an email to book and explained that it would be our wedding night. The maitre d' replied back very quickly to confirm our reservation and also to say that he would make sure we got a window table. He also made some really helpful suggestions regarding the menu and the best time to eat for the sunset etc. So from the off, we got lovely service. Just to say as well, don't go into this restaurant on a tight budget as that isn't what it's about and you need to realise that you are paying for a prime view, service and great food. It's, I imagine, for a lot of folks like us a very big treat and to mark some sort of special occasion, so go with it or wait til a time you can fully enjoy! I think ours cost around 300 including a couple of glasses of champagne and cocktails. On the night itself we arrived very excited and still buzzing and from our greeting at the lift entrance to the restaurant, again nothing but friendly. Getting out at the restaurant you are immediately sure that the place is something special. The surrounding windows with their views out onto the lit-up strip - just wow. The food smelt amazing too! We had a couple of drinks at the lovely circular bar just gazing at the view as we had arrived very early. Once seated - in a fabulous corner window seat no less - we just couldn't believe the view over the Bellagio Fountains. As for the food itself, it was outstanding and I'd say best I've ever had. We had a number of little starter taster-type dishes and I also had the Beef Wellington and then the pre-requisite chocolate souffle. He had the fillet mignon and a pineapple and meringue dessert, the proper name of which I can't remember. So nice. Basically, it was an unforgettable experience and just the perfect meal to mark such a special occasion that we had hoped for. Brilliant and if ever in town again, we will most certainly be back! Thanks Lyle, Tom and Eiffel Tower:)

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Little taster desserts with a view!

YoOz_jshHAoZQnzMQBJVXA.text: Hubby and I enjoyed a lovely dinner here on a recent Monday night.  I was a bit apprehensive - you know when you have a great experience at a restaurant and are afraid it can never be as good the second time?  My sister and I dined here last year and the food, service, and ambience were off the charts good -- and we had just gone up without reservations one night when we realized we were starving and managed to snag a great table.  Well my second visit was just as good.  From the moment we entered we felt welcomed.  Our lead server John Paul was everything you would hope for - efficient, helpful, friendly, there when you need him without hovering.  All the other staff were top notch, too.  Everything we had was delicious and beautifully prepared.  For example, I chose the vegetarian entree because it sounded so yummy.  It was.  Delicate crepes were filled with artichokes and walnuts and sat on a bed of the most delicious tomato coulis.  MMMM.  The view of the Bellagio fountains certainly adds to the overall experience here, but I think Eiffel Tower's food and service stands on its own even without the spectacular scenery out the window.

kSLqPy9pdvYWvUszw3QR5A.text: Absolutely incredible dining experience.  If you're coming here for a romantic dinner at a price point - this is not the place for you. But OH is it worth.  Let me start off by saying the dinner is an engagement of all of your senses. It has a stunning view of the Bellagio fountains and the rest of the strip. Being in the main part of the strip, it's expected. Atmosphere is dim, romantic, and classy.  Our appetizers were the escargot and oestra caviar. OH, MY. GOD.   I've never had either - what a first time experience, and probably all other from here will be subpar. The escargot were small in fried balls with some kind of pea reduction and greens, and something else I couldn't identify. The oestra caviar was absolutely exquisite. Served traditional Russian style with blini and small breads, some sour cream/creme fraiche, chives, and some cheese shavings. It left me wanting more. Again, I"m not going to talk about price. Because if you think about a certain price at this restaurant, you will not enjoy the experience of being here.  For entrees- the rabbit and rack of lamb. After one bite,we both fully completely understood this was one of the best dining experiences we have ever had. The lamb was perfectly cooked at medium (just over rare) It was PHENOMENAL. The right flavour, you can taste the meat exactly as it's meant to be had. No frills.   The rabbit - again for the first time experiencing this. It was served in some kind of roulade style with sauce reductions over a grain - I don't remember. All I remember was heaven in my mouth. A beautiful cut of meat, that defies the expectation of any non-occuring meat - it doesn't "taste like chicken". They make sure all the flavours are succinct, memorable, and everything served with their food complements each other instead of overpowering it. You will neither need salt or pepper. It is not oversalted or undersalted.  I must also add that the service was amazing. They knew how to talk about all of their specials. Knew all of the details about their dishes. They were prompt, organised, and checked in regularly like on schedule. Impeccable. On top of that, someone came to change our silverware and WIPE CRUMBS OFF OF OUR TABLE. I couldn't believe it.   It is definitely an experience to be had on the finer side of things in Vegas. Vegas has many amazing restaurants, but this is a must-do. Especially if you're looking to feel "the finer things". A classy, romantic, sophisticated experience that you will forever remember - that is, of course, going to actual Paris, France itself....:P

URsxvpZdPQIe_CYaZWmLEw.text: I've been here for lunch twice; the past two times I visited Vegas. All the food is delicious and the service is 5 star. The French onion soup is the best I've ever had. But seriously, everything is delicious. And the view is phenomenal. Request a window seat!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dark chocolate lava cake, but it&#39;s called something different.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger peach tea with a side of simple syrup. Perfect on a hot summer day!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table.

ToND0Du4Qi-6r2qiVDuXLQ.text: Great Service. Greater Views. The Best Food. This is one of the top 20 things to do in Vegas in my opinion.

UcshxTPGc-XXp-9Z5vzavA.text: I was not expecting this.  My girlfriend and I sort of fell into the idea of having a French  meal during this trip to Vegas when we saw a travelzoo deal for another restaurant.  That planted the bug in our taste buds, so we started looking and doing comparisons and in the end, had to decide between here and another French restaurant (I forget which).  I was worried about this one because it looked so cheesy.  French restaurant in the Paris hotel which French people probably hate America for building, at a restaurant in the Eiffel Tower, which French people probably hate America for building.  I just didn't think they would do it right.  This is the middle of the desert for pete's sake.  Stupid me.  Firstly, Vegas has some of the best chefs in America, so naturally the food would be good.  But it wasn't just good - it was spectacular.  Every bite was delicious.  And the restaurant has more to offer than just delicious food.  It has beautiful views of the Bellagio fountains.  I don't understand why anyone comes here any other time but at night.  You get the lights from Bellagio, Aria, Paris and Caesar's, and you get the fountain shows throughout your meal.  Further, our server was French (so I guess I was wrong about the French hating us for bastardizing their city).  He was gracious and helpful and couldn't have provided more perfect service.  Shame on me, but I don't remember what my girlfriend got.  I think she got the sauteed snapper without the bacon (vegetarian), but it might have been the Pacific salmon.  I got the braised short ribs.  I was on a bit of a short ribs kick this year - getting in nearly everywhere we visited, and I think I got it like 3 times in New Orleans in April.  This was, if not the best, then top 2 or 3.  It was to die for.  The sauce was incredible, the vegetables were perfect, and the meat was just right.  We ended our meal by splitting a creme brulee.  Unfortunately, still not as good as my girlfriend's creme brulee and why she doesn't market it to restaurants is beyond me.  That said, as far as non-girlfriend made creme brulee's go, then again, this was the best or at worst, second best.  This is Vegas - if you come to a restaurant like this, be prepared to leave with a second mortgage, a payday loan, and maybe even an organ or two after you sold them to pay the bill.  But, when you choose right in Vegas, its well worth the money.  This was one of those meals.

2TE1IOj_uBZyTnXWKlL_vw.text: Went there about a week ago it was my first experience with this restaurant, The food was kind of delicious not gonna say it was Awesome, Wait time was terrible, It was party of five, After we placed the order we had to wait over an hour. Portions are very tiny. I understand they located inside of the EIffel tower, But it still overpriced. We were sitting right in the middle of the restaurant and there is a piece of molding on the ceiling is about to Fall, and it was right above our table, Every five minutes I was staring on it. The view is gorgeous nothing I can say ---beautiful.

Ab3XQSgaC7P3eE_sKOqc1w.text: One of the best views in Vegas! Food was well prepared and most of the service was great. Our waiter wasn't that warm or attentative but the table next to us seemed to have an excellent one so can't say that it was bad across the board. Other than that the food was flavorful and cooked perfectly the way requested!

7ON-3_jh6hP2YJ6uGG7qcw.text: Amazing, romantic, great service, beautiful views,, and amazing food. There is a dress code. But a great place to spend an evening

GnljFl2fkg3PSMNHDKq57A.text: What a great experience and fantastic food. Went for our 15th anniversary. We live in Las Vegas and my wife has always wanted to go. Our server, Igor, was great, very attentive, but not overly, and made some nice drink recommendations. The food was on point and the serving sizes were just right. Highly recommended.

o8UUcHHKRrRYccpYvRsrcA.text: This is tourist heaven as far as it being an above average restaurant with a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains and an intimate setting (for LV). I was automatically expecting top notch service from a place like this but I was SO SHOCKED at the terrible service we got from our waiter. This guy seriously ruined the experience: didn't check on us, forgot out appetizer (but didn't charge it), we had to literally wave him down to refill our drinks, which he also forgot and then delivered with an attitude... It was terrible! Granted, we went in looking super casual (we're from LA) but it was just lunch! I've never felt more contempt from a person, I was just genuinely shocked and a little uncomfortable afterwards. This guy seriously ruined it. They should promote the bus boy! He was on top of filling our water, and removing plates when we done etc...   I think if you are lucky enough to get a good server the experience here would be lovely. But the old man that we got seriously ruined the experience.

RJRhurj1osvDJszaPZMAgw.text: View is beautiful.  See the strip in both directions and the Bellagio water show.  Service excellent. Attentive but not hovering.   Our food sub-standard for the price and the main reason I gave this restaurant only 3 stars.   I had the venison which was dry and tasteless. Only saving grace was the sauce they provided with it. Not worth a tenth of he $65 they charged for it.  The view beautiful, though.   My wife had the duck which was tough and chewy. Again, the sauce made this bearable. Did I mention the view?  Okay souffle dessert was good, so I'll give them that.   Overall, with all the quality restaurants in Vegas, this one not worth the money. View nice, however.

NgF9sjUCzLmnotfq9krltw.text: We're Las Vegas locals and didn't expect the impressive level of food quality and service that we received during our visit.  We were afraid it might be a cheesy touristy experience, but were so happy to be wrong.  We reserved a table via Open Table for our anniversary dinner.  Through the online reservation, we indicated that it was our anniversary and that we'd prefer a table by the window with a view of the Bellagio fountains.  When we arrived, we had to wait 30 minutes for our table.  We enjoyed drinks at the bar while we waited and the bartender was pleasant and fast with drinks.  After we were seated by the window with a view of the fountains, our server greeted us and wished us a happy anniversary.  She was very helpful with the menu as I have special dietary needs (gluten intolerant) and was knowledgeable beyond what was available on their gluten free menu.  They even provided gluten free toast while my husband enjoyed the bread course.  The food was delicious and the service was wonderful.  Servers and  bussers attended to us without being overly attentive, but also did not ever leave us wanting for anything.  Overall, a surprisingly lovely and romantic experience at a touristy restaurant in Las Vegas.

DeuGx5unXAC2N-KYqmp3Kg.text: I had a reservation here last night, for my anniversary. Considering that it is a much more upscale place, I thought the service would be exceptional compared to what I'm used to at restaurants.   The food and service were fairly disappointing. Understandably, its Memorial weekend and packed. Everyone around us was fairly older than us, but we had a reservation for a particularly special occasion. It felt like we weren't treated the same because of the age difference. It's easy to notice when someone is putting on airs around you and when someone is being genuine.   We had the smoked salmon to start, king tenderloin, and Alaskan cod. The smoked salmon and cod were satisfying. Whereas, the tenderloin looked like an oversized burnt lump of a meatball. It was extremely bland and difficult to chew. It costed nearly $70 and was highly disappointing. The only consistent thing was us getting water refills.

YFg5gc7jHd0B1uph-KtF9g.text: As a tourist walking around Las Vegas, I had spotted the Eiffel Tower so I thought I'd have a late lunch there.    I was greeted by the hostess who took me up to the restaurant via private elevator then to the table.  Since this was a late lunch, there were plenty of open tables, and I was lucky to be placed next to a window with a great view of  the Bellagio Hotel and the fountains.      The Server's Assistant had greeted me with incredible bread and then took a drink order.  Shortly after that the server, Mark, had introduced himself and went over the menu.  The lunch menu was limited, however, gave great options.  I had opted for the the Parmesan Crusted Chicken which included Au Gratin Potatoes and Mixture of Green Beans and Diced Tomatoes.    I was in no rush for my meal was was able to enjoy the Fountain Show at the Bellagio Hotel.    The Assistant brought the meal within ten minutes, again, I'm on vacation and I'm in no rush.  The chicken was so delicious with the Parmesan crust and the lemon wine sauce.  The green beans were crisp while the diced tomatoes were so sweet.  I wish the potatoes were little crispier, but I'm not going to complain.   Both Mark and the assistant would check in with me without being overbearing.  The decor is definitely more upper scale but relaxing enough for a late lunch. Mark had presented me with dessert options..... so I ordered the Apple Streudel.  Just like the main course, the dessert was just as good!  The restaurant has an open kitchen  - which is spotless!!  For a topnotch dinner, check this restaurant out!

Bv03tAAlqYa2GbkeN8_MSA.text: This was my second time at this restaurant. The first was to celebrate my anniversary, which is how my boyfriend fell in love with their duck fat potatoes (seriously...when we left the city and he reminisced on our trip, it was the first thing he'd bring up!) and the amazing view of the Bellagio fountains from so high up. So I took him again this year! Given that I am dairy free and pescatarian, I didn't have quite the same regard as him after our first trip, but this one left me singing a different tune! Obviously, French cuisine-- as our waiter acknowledged-- is near impossible to find without dairy, but our waiter knew off the top of his head which dishes could possibly be made to fit my diet and consistently checked in to ensure I didn't accidentally eat the little goodies they provide with the meal-- like the amuse-bouche-- and didn't even require me asking for olive oil and balsamic to accompany the bread before providing it. He was incredibly attentive and so helpful every step of the way! The best part was that when the entrees came, mine was AMAZING! I had fish that, despite not having its usual sauce on top, was so flavourful and well worth the price! Considering the view alone is worth the price of the meal, to have such delicious food (as my boyfriend enjoyed his meal again this time), a cocktail, and dessert for less than $200 on the strip and THEN have the romance and ambiance on top of that-- this place is an amazing deal for the experience. It's unparalleled, and the food was impressively tasteful considering the limitations I imposed on the chef with my diet. Overall, every second was a delight, and we'll have even more great memories from this trip to the Eiffel Tower restaurant. We might have to make this a tradition!

bbmOw2Dc85YMJh-FEYtGhA.text: Although the prices are astronomical, the decor is beautiful, romantic, and the service extremely professional.  On our last visit, we brought our son, who is 11 years old. He wanted lamb chops, plain, with a different side dish, and they happily accommodated him.  The window tables give you a terrific view of the strip, and you really feel like you're dining in the Eiffel Tower.  The kitchen absolutely knows how to prepare top-quality dishes, and continue to have pride in their work.  If you want a really fine splurge, this is your place.

4X5WWWeiUw49E8gcFEzC0Q.text: The service outstanding, the view amazing, the food not so much. It was very expensive and so not worth it. The mushrooms were COLD and too salty. The top of the spinach was singed. No hollandaise for the asparagus, instead they had scrambled eggs.

t7bXkOinNUuRoD_vZ7Ef6g.text: My boyfriend and I made reservations to this restaurant since we thought it would be the most romantic place to have dinner in Vegas.  We got all dressed up and headed out. We arrived a little early so we sat at the bar and enjoyed some drinks.  I have to say the view is amazing!!  We had reserved a window table facing the strip and we got lucky to have scored such a table. We were able to enjoy the Bellagio fountains show from our seats.  As for the service, it was just ok and I wasn't too impressed with my entree. I ordered the beef Wellington and a side of mushrooms. I enjoyed my food but I wasn't wowed. My beef Wellington was ok, I wasn't fond of the puff pastry, so I took it out of it and ate it that way. I felt the pastry took away from the taste of the beef. The wild mushrooms were delicious.  I'm glad that we got to experience this restaurant, it was romantic, spectacular views, ok food, and a nice reason to dress up.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely

iDAK4pnkJBhyI8I2l6Dk-w.text: This place needs an attitude adjustment at the front of the house.  We had a 4:30 reservation for Valentine's Day. We were told to go about 30 minutes early to get a table with a view. When we walked in the place was half empty, they tried to seat two of us by the kitchen in the way back--no view. I said, "um no, we came early to get a view" Then, they tried to put us at a table facing a huge pole, while all the window seats were opened. I said no again, then they got upset and made us wait until they then moved us to the back again with a view of the top of a stadium or something.  I wanted to leave, they made their feelings towards us known, but they gave up and said, "fine! Where do you want to sit??!!!" I said, "we came 30 minutes early to get a table with a view, we want a view." That section was empty, like one table had been seated, so there was really no issue. I was a server for 8 years and I know these things. They were beyond rude and it almost ruined our Valentine's Day.  Once we were sat someone came over and plopped roses down but didn't say anything, they were for me from my boyfriend but I had no idea. They were rude as hell in there.  He proposed that night, but luckily not in that place. We went to the top and he did it there.  This all said, the food was amazing and it better be for over $500, it was not worth $500 for two people. Honestly, they also added the tip and then tried to get us to add an additional $90 on top of that, what was that? The fee for treating us like we didn't matter? Like we were nothing? Excuse me, no. We were guests of the hotel and were staying in a suit too.  I doubt I'd ever go back there.  On one hand, it is the night he got down on one knee and proposed, on the other, they went out of their way to make us feel insignificant and horrible.

p7AZUeRPI2fpLe-0Sty0Cg.text: The manager went above and beyond to make sure we were happy.   I'd send my best friends and family here on every trip to Vegas.

CLOgHDitzJV0ts30LRmLZQ.text: Two stars for the beautiful view. My 3rd visit to Vegas and this place had been on my bucket list, and it turned out to a complete disappointment.  Made a dinner reservation for our anniversary, as we sat down the waitress greeted us with a wine and cocktail list, I've kinda noticed she was waiting for us to order drinks or bottle before giving the dinner menus, in about 5 minutes sommelier stoped to see if we had questions ( by working in this industry I know pretty much about wines and was taking my time looking at the list) just give us dinner menus already!  The whole time being in this place made me feel so obligated and uncomfortable, I know this is place is stands for the view, in NYC we have plenty of high end restaurants with the view and we know what's that all about but our waitress kept on being pushy and make us order more then of what we want,   We wanted to share the ribeye and she said unfortunately they were out of ribeye and recommended something else and pointing out that we should have one of our own each ( stop trying to up sell and just concentrate on your service and knowledge first ) and we picked a side to it (potato gratin) and she asked if we wanted some mushroom sauce with it because steak doesn't come with any and we said sure, AFTER GETTING THE BILL THERE WAS A CHARGE OF $15 for side of mushroom that we didn't even ordered and if she suggested something she has to let the guests know that there's gonna be an up charge.  Our night was ruined after of being rushed and feeling uncomfortable we did not even want to stay there no more we asked for the rest of our food to go after getting to the hotel and opening boxes we only found the potato gratin and side of mushroom and NO ANY STEAK. Here $200 went down the drain.   Stay away from this place. Or just come for the view and have the cheapest glass of wine here because they don't worth your money. Horrible experience.

GVgPFyJXEuTYj9Aa0aXFnQ.text: Very disappointing experience. When we arrived it was kind of like a cattle call-- we were herded to the reception area in the front of the restaurant by a very curt woman who "greeted"" us upon getting off of the elevator in a very unfriendly manner. We were taken to the front of the restaurant where we told to wait for our table even though we had a reservation.  We  had requested twice in 2 days that we have a window seat. Finally, we were seated and it was in a booth tucked in a corner at the bottom of stairs and metal girders overhead, so we had to duck and scoot around to get in-- probably the only seat in the house WITHOUT a view of the Bellagio fountain (one of the reasons we went was for the view). We asked our waitress if we might move to the wondow seat in front of us that had just opened up and we were given an aswer about some sort of logistical miracle that would have to take place for that to happen...uh, okay!?  Service was slow, after waiting for our main course for a while and noticing others around us eating and becoming very hungry, we asked when our food might arrive...the response was less than polite- "Why are you in a hurry?" Um, no sorry just hungry!? The food was mediocre, not as spectacular as expected. Riding back down in the elevator with another couple, they said they were also very disappointed. We all agreed we won't be back...3 stars was being kind.

aOyrLcR9bDuL2i3t_6jamA.text: Went to the restarant after getting married. Very romantic had a table by the window with a great view. Service was superb and we were given 2 free mini soup and desert choices in celebration of our wedding. I  had the filet migon and my husband had the lobster, both excellent. Great way to celebrate our occasion.

HmECa072jhkiyyYRlE0naA.text: It's not Michael's Gourmet Room. The other competitor would be Hugo's which I have not tried yet. The food is not as good as Michael's or as carefully prepared.  In fact my husband said his chateaubriand at 69.00 was dry. My filet mignon was fine.  My sister's cauliflower steak was too spicy. The view is limited from tables unless you are only two people because then you can sit at the window.  The waiter is attentive but you do not get those extras like  free quail eggs or salad or sorbet between courses.  The portions are small. The wine is prohibitively priced.  I recommend just having drinks at the bar where the view is better.

AWxhaaZLlTmBVlWqhONsnA.text: Wonderful restaurant, absolutely beautiful view, great service and delicious food.  My husband and I were lucky to get a table right at the corner of the restaurant by the window so we had front row seats to the water fountain "show". I've been recommending this restaurant to other couples who will be visiting Vegas soon.

S4xCpZX2cV9ahHDh4LnOxQ.text: This is one of our favorite spots on the strip to have lunch and see a magnificent view of the Bellagio Fountains.  Perched upon the 12th floor or so the swank restaurant and full bar offer pent house style atmosphere.  Prices are upscale with most lunch entrees ranging from $16 to $36.  We sampled the following items:  Lamb Burger: a thick 1/2 pound crazy juicy mouthful of wonderfulness! Using Moroccan spices red peppers, onions and yellow squash this burger was one to remember.  Potato chips were served on the side $18.  Eiffel Tower Burger a classic well cooked yummy burger also served with potato chips.  The burger was good but not in the same class as the lamb burger $16  Mushroom Pasta: fresh spaghetti noodles with a light sauce and mushrooms. Great flavor and just the right size portion $18  French Cream of Onion Soup; creamy onion soup, I prefer the original version $6  Lunch was also served with a Celery root puree which was a delicious bite and the some of the best baguettes ever!  Since we were there to celebrate my daughters birthday she was presented with a beautiful chocolate mousse along with milk chocolates and jelly candies.  Service was outstanding and although the prices were high it was well a great dining experience.  I highly recommend coming for lunch.  Note: The Bellagio Fountains start at 12 or 1pm on the weekends.

OKG8UY1nhRBt81yHKLDnmQ.text: For someone who loves everything French, I can't believe that I have never dined at the Eiffel Tower restaurant until 2 weeks ago!  I had a business lunch here and loved it.  We were seated at the window with a lovely view of the Strip.  The service was professional and engaging and the food was simple and so delicious.  I enjoyed the salmon paillard - unique, fresh and flavorful...something I will crave again and again.

CFdn0Y6v503SMaJWo8xvdA.text: very romantic and perfect place to celebrate special occasion. just be prepared to spend a lil but the experience is worth it.

kGhQEHs-uFB6d5vpR-DWTA.text: Food was great, desert was wonderful, Service is always top notch, and views are best In town.

VlWfO5aR_31OX2zmQDuPYw.text: First time here and in Vegas.  Very good service a d food! Awesome view of Bellagio and fountain!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Apple Strudel!  Warm and yummy!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nee York Strip! Yummy!
