z_eKVuMgxMTwHtPyqPET5g.text: A manager did contact me regarding my experience and have me a refund for the cost of the pictures. Thank you for taking the time to address my concerns.

B0CIUMfJ0RPMHeHl_A3_-A.text: Best dinner experience I've ever had! My boyfriend took me here to celebrate our anniversary and I can't wait to go back already! I ordered the filet mignon butterfly cut and it was definitely one of the best steaks I have ever had! For the sides we ordered the mushrooms which was a very different taste for me but at the end everything just went so well together. And the view is just so perfect and romantic, like I said I can't wait to go back! Oh and for dessert we had a chocolate souffle, so yummy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3VOx30AucMJEuRC939-B6g.text: I want to write and express a warm thank you to Sharon, Lyle, and the rest of the team at Eiffel Tower in Las Vegas for a spectacular and memorable dining experience. The meal was one of the best we've ever had!   Service: I called to book a special seat for a special occasion and Lyle was the consummate professional in taking care of us over the phone. He made sure to even request the manager, Sharon, to come say hi. (He also suggested rose petals on the table- so note this is possible for a special occasion but I thought it was a bit too extra when I booked).   Sharon not only chatted with us but made us feel so welcome even though it was a busy weekend! Our table had stunning views (could stare outside for hours) and our waiter, Roman, constantly checked in on us.   Food: We ordered the most delicious salmon and cod dishes. One of my guests wanted to try a sweet wine and our waiter brought over something delicious for her palette. The presentation was delightful and the meal ended with the yummiest desserts: crunchy pistachio with ice cream.   Overall:  We will definitely return here again on our next trip! I recommend this place not only for its incredible views but also it's hospitality. There are so many amazing places in Vegas but this place stands out to us the most.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our yummy appetizer!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stunning views and spectacular service!

HGlTxfoGPBidkAgrsA7KZQ.text: If you're wondering whether or not you should eat here, the answer is yes.   Book early (2 weeks +), book 7:30 pm for dinner (you get to see  Vegas at day, and then at night), have an amazing time. Located right inside the casino.   Have a great time.

xaiXDCZ2DiMMS9rINaiwMQ.text: The worst service ever! Manger Marian is completely unprofessional and rude. After our table was late 30 min, she start screaming at us after simple question when our table will be ready. I already know that food is amazing and our server John was extremely nice but to have a manager at this restaurant treating  people this way is big NO!  Just speechless!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sD2i0IPBINqa0IcqHEwImg.text: Ok. Not my typical place. EXPENSIVE. If you go here plan $200/person. No, not kidding. Now that's said, the rest of our experience was fantastic. The food is a la carte, so you need to order every individual element. (Veggies etc). The portions are actually large considering any French place I've heard of. And, yes, the food itself is the absolute gourmet experience you damn well expect in this price range. The service was beyond exceptional. For us it was almost a once in a lifetime experience due to the cost and we're glad we did it.

d3J__ZwHE89bzKn5KwS37Q.text: Absolutely wonderful!  You arrive in the Paris hotel and make your way to the restaurant elevator.  If you have a 4:30 reservation, chances are there will be a line at the elevator, so you can't miss it.  We made the reservation about two months in advance and you have to fill out a secondary reservation form and put a credit card number down in case you do not show up they charge you.  My husband and I went here for a special meal, we made a 4:30 reservation for two, because you are guaranteed at seat along the windows to look over the strip and the Bellagio fountains, and boy did we!  We got a table in a nice little corner so it was a little quieter with great views!  Overall, this place is upscale, professional, and wonderful experience!  Our waitress arrived and made the whole experience wonderful with her professionalism.  Instead of bread baskets at the table, a gentleman comes around with a box of fresh breads that you can choose from.  For entrees I ordered with vegetable and quinoa wellington, my husband ordered the dover sole, and we got sides of potatoes au gratin, and brussels sprouts with roasted chestnuts.  Everything was absolutely divine.    The dessert specials that night were souffles that were baked to order and took about 30 minutes in the oven.  We ordered the grand marnier souffle as soon as our entrees came for dessert.  It arrived about 7 minutes after we finished eating (great timing), and it was one of the best desserts we had ever had.  Overall, it is an expensive restaurant and the wine is overpriced, but the entire experience and the wonderful food you get is absolutely worth this for a special occasion.  We will return again in the future.

4ZPDZ60u6VWPt_N_Mz09qw.text: Pretty great view of the fountains at the Bellagio. I believe that is what you are paying for here.  The food is not extremely, or sufficiently, higher than the other same priced foods at other reataurants. The snails over a puff pastry was new, but a bit too garlicky.  Good meal. Decent service. A good place to TRY if you have never been.

E1QR8rcoBJ7PKBpx3DH5WA.text: Meaning to post this.  We went a month ago for a special night and everything was on the mark.  Mind you, if your on a budget this is not a place for you.  Service was 5 stars, view was amazing and the food.. well it was decadent.  Nothing about this experience was bad and we will be back again next year.  If you want romance and a better view than a dimly lit room then you want a window seat for 2.

i7Jt2oLOXCAhlaJUN5enYg.text: What a great experience. I celebrate my bday last month with the fam and we had such a great experience. Food was great, view was great and even the cocktails were on point. I got the scallops and the rabbit and let me tell you I was so happy with my choices. The sauce that came with the rabbit make it so delicious. I'll highly recommend this price.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

-g8xBdGivjBrkwthJyWTTw.text: Igor & Guillermo, 5 Stars all the way! Outstanding service from both of these gentlemen!  My boyfriend and I Dined here for my birthday and were extremely satisfied with the overall dining experience. We began at the bar with Kieth (I believe that was his name?). Excellent bar service and tasty espresso martinis.  We had a table for two on the window. Our server Igor was attentive and friendly. His assistant server Guillermo was also very friendly and quick with water refills and bread service! We shared a caesar salad, and I had the new york foie gras with a glass of sauterne! Both were exquisite! I had the seafood tower for dinner and my boyfriend enjoyed the new york strip i think. Both were super tasty!   The atmosphere is beautiful and the views of las vegas blvd and the bellagio fountain show are amazing, but what really impressed me was the overall service from the wait staff (igor & guillermo especially)!

x8tXy3M4QP4ihDQWA9m3VQ.text: Service - excellent, fast, friendly Views- superb Vibe- good for both young and old Food- average, not great, but the views make up for average food Price- a bit on pricey side, but you pay for the views Drinks- we got the Eifel affair and Painkiller, both were very good  Overall.  9/10 Recommend for couples celebrating special ocassions  Hint- they will text you n email you asking you if you their 4:30pm reservation to guarantee a window table. Don't take it. If you go in with 2 ppl chances you will get a window table.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Painkiller and Eifel Affair. Very good

2IruQANAETV214SiZd4EJw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas and through the years its been consistently good.   Vegas is a tough place to find good food. Chefs and TV personalities  lease their names to restaurant management companies but of course don't work there which is reflected in the below average food. Also, restaurants that are successful (though not necessarily good) from cities such as New York, Los Angeles and Miami have opened up in Vegas  with increasingly regularity.   Paris is one of the exceptions in Vegas. Its a chef driven restaurant that offers quality ingredients and a kitchen and management team of professionals. This is a restaurant not touting questionable talents of food TV hosts but delivering on good old fashioned culinary prowess.  We have been there for lunch and dinner and just went for brunch and it was quite good. Our service was great but a big blunder was made by our waiter but we let it slide because even good waiters can have a bad day. Plus he was a nice guy.  We had several dishes and while we liked the crepe, the chicken was a little disappointing as it was both dry and overcooked. Oh well, those things happen and everything we had compensated for a few mistakes.  A parmesan crusted chicken dish was great, soup was nice and a seafood salad was good. The burger was also good - not the best but good.  Save room for dessert because they are consistently excellent and are a nice way to end a good meal.  If in Las Vegas and you are looking for a good restaurant in a nice setting, with professional service and even a view then this is a great choice.

hU6qp4gMrrGmTY6tMrk5Qg.text: My husband I had our Anniversary dinner here recently. Staff was friendly and very accommodating! Food was great and not crazy over priced like some Vegas restaurants. The beef Wellington and souffle were to die for. We had a view of the water show at Bellagio which was so fun! We will go back and take friends!

ivFU7LyoJHnFIpSJfVE6jA.text: Can't say enough good about this place. Went for our first wedding anniversary and it was amazing. Had filet mignon which was cooked perfectly and the wife had the venison. Both amazing. For sides we had mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts. We also included a bottle of wine. While very expensive it was an amazing dinner. The view was stunning overlooking the strip. Well worth the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary desert for our anniversary.  Even this was amazing!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1ZT8CufVkmZ1VOSmFGLOwQ.text: ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE! If I could go everyday I would :)   One of the best dining experiences I've ever had.  Everything about this restaurant is exceptional: service, food, decor, view, ambience....perfection!  I ordered the roasted chicken; so moist, flavorful, fulfilling in every way possible.  THAT is how a chicken is cooked, lovely!  My mother got the filet mignon; it was exceptional!  The drinks are also fantastic!  The "Autumn in Paris" martini is a must!  I usually don't like Martini's at all, but the flavorful depth of it was too good.   Dessert is an experience in itself.  Definitely try the Pistachio Souffle! Fluffy, light, it would just melt so delicately in your mouth.  One of the best souffle I've tasted.    Our waiter was knowledgeable and friendly.  Gave great recommendations of pairings and other suggestions.  This is a MUST when you come to Vegas, you will not regret it!  It is pricey, but hey, you're in VEGAS, indulge a little bit!  Ask for seating near the window with the view of the Bellagio....at night they have a splendid water works show with lights....incredible experience!  This place is definitely as good as it gets! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner service,  try &#34;Autumn in Paris&#34; martini (right side)

_qpXzsHYSdLy1VYgTKeLOw.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and service at this restaurant. I was expecting this to be somewhat of a tacky overpriced touristy spot but it was completely not the case! To start our waitress was French which added to the experience. They also had a sommelier to help us with our wine choice.  As appetizers we had a salad and the sweet potato soup. For main dishes we had the John Dory, Loup de Mar, and Chicken. They were all delicious, well seasoned and balanced dishes. The view from the restaurant is amazing which doesn't hurt. I highly recommend and will be back!!

BUavAgsfwN7aDjmHiF5VWA.text: Ate at this restaurant with my wife and another couple. We had the Salmon for the appetizer and it was very delicious and rich with taste. My entree was the beef wellington, which was my first time experiencing this type of dish. The steak was terrific and the pastry that surrounds it tastes very similar to a vietnamese / french pastry that I enjoy, called Pate chaud. Please be warned that it will take up to 45 minutes to bake so order early! The others in my party had the Filet Mignon, Roasted Semi-boneless chicken, and the Muscovy Duck Breast. We all shared a bit of each others meals and they were all great! For desert, we split the Pistachio Souffle which was very delicious! We had a great view of the strip on vegas and saw a bit of the water show at Bellagio from our seats. Very Romantic.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Muscovy Duck Breast
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Semi bone-less Chicken
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio Souffle

aT7VOppFIFkTss7x29vlsw.text: I'm definitely a fan of this place! It's VERY pricey, so be aware. But I really loved it all.   First and foremost - the service here is top notch! The waiter is professional, helpful and folded our napkins even when we went to use the restroom.   OMG - the food here is also great! We decided to be daring and order dessert first! Yum! We shared the chocolate plate, which had like 5 different truffles on it and it was amazing. I brought 5 girls here for my bachelorette party!   I got the Queen filet mignon. It was delicous. I also got it with classic potato gratin, which was a la carte, and very traditional French.   The bread is to die for!!! And the butter too!   I also go the berry drink, and loved it!

N7P2WUiYIY7Vri8ym-_pEg.text: We got window love-seat table with excellent view (facing the Ballagio's outdoor musical fountain) and great service. The foods were 4 stars with 5$. It is good restaurant for romantic occasion with budget (around $250 per person with foods + wines).

X7bwP83CviFUzfqY7t3-AA.text: This is a long overdue review and I think this review would be the only review that I actually think I owed to Eiffel Tower Restaurant to write.  My experience with the Eiffel Tower Restaurant began long before I even stepped foot in Vegas. I was going to Vegas with my then girlfriend for a weekend in late October 2011 and I'd decided to dine at this restaurant while I was there.    So in  late September of 2011, based on a lot of comments that I had read on Eiffel Tower Restaurant's page on facebook, I chose to send an e-mail to make the reservation to  the (I'm assuming) operating/general manager of the restaurant, Lyle Tolhurst, letting him know when I was going to be dining there and the preferred time of arrival (between 7 or 7:30 pm) and the seat location (by the window overlooking the Bellagio Fountains so we could watch the dancing water). I also informed him that this would be my first time in Vegas and I'm trying to have a memorable experience.  Soon after, Lyle responded to my request suggesting that if I should move my reservation a little bit earlier to 6:30 pm. In his own words, "We are blessed with beautiful coral sky sunsets that fade into twilight and full darkness. If that appeals to you I would suggest a 6:30 reservation if you are not bowed in by other commitments."  I, of course, accepted his suggestion and made a 6:30 pm reservation for a Saturday night.  Fast forward to the day of the reservation, me and the ex arrived promptly at the restaurant and we were seated by the window with an amazing view of the Vegas strip and the Bellagio. To our surprise, our table had rose petals on it. Not the fake kind but REAL rose petals! Our waiter came to introduce himself and made small conversation and asked us if we wanted anything to drink (other than water). After we placed our drink orders and we were looking over the menu, our waiter came back with a small appetizer sampler plate with I think three appetizers on it. Before I was able to say, "I didn't order this", our waiter explained that the appetizers were given to us compliment of Lyle.  The steak that I had was great, I can't remember what my ex had but she loved it! The ambiance was nice, and the view was absolutely amazing. Lyle wasn't lying about the sunset. It was awe-some! Me and my ex had an amazing time while I was there. The only thing that I probably should have done is allow the camerawoman (there's one that offers to take your pictures with the Strip/Bellagio in the background) to take our picture.   Also, you have to try the souffle. TO DIE FOR!!!  If you're going to Vegas and you've never dined here. I absolutely recommend it. To get over the top treatment like I did, i would recommend e-mailing Lyle directly instead of making a reservation through a website like open table (which I normally use). I'm not posting his e-mail here but if you go to the restaurant's page on facebook, you'll find it pretty easily.  I really couldn't ask for a better experience while I was here. I would rate this place higher than a five, but since five is highest then I guess five it is!

Ot6R8uJq54gjJa-EJ1NvgA.text: My seven year old daughter wanted to eat there. Dad was ready to eat, mom and sis were napping, off we went.  Called ahead and understood dress code. Walked up without reservation (not suggested), but since my date wanted to dine with them, they made her feel as special as I do.  My meal was perfect, my date didn't see anything on the menu she wanted. No problem, they offered her three suggestions- all things she wanted.  Dinner was perfect, the staff as well. To top it off we had the Eiffel tower chocolate sampler. BEST CHOCOLATE EVER.   They said they would get the young lady the best seat in the house and they did, although I'm not sure there are any bad seats.   The staff really was very attentive, the meal was perfect, must of all my daughter was ecstatic. Ty!

48911s-LBjSpxpc821UbLA.text: Such a beautiful view they were really accommodating when I asked for a better table I came here with my boyfriend!!! Great food and service best steak Ive had by far!

xQ9_LsudD6xteJ-kwbzqXw.text: This star is for the service. Last night we went to have dinner there and our server was horrible! When we were sat at our table it took about 10 mins to be greeted by anyone (keep in mind I'm a server). Once our server showed up he did not introduced himself and asked us if we were ready for drinks. So I went ahead and asked him his name and without any apology he immediately turned around and walked away. Skipping him taking the order, food was great. Then he proceeded to ask us if we were ready for dessert and since we were all full we declined. He then had the audacity to make a comment under his breath. I asked him what he said and then he said never mind. I will never come back here ever again.

S3KgCayIMZetLwPV4hepxg.text: Good, not great.  The view: The view was spectacular- unfortunately, the servers were constantly interrupting the wonderful fountain shows to ask us to take pictures, or to move our plates.  The food: Good.  Forgettable.  The corn and bay scallop soup was decent.  The corn was off, but perhaps being from the midwest I just have a higher standard for corn- especially at $20 a bowl.  The escargot was bland, but not bad.  My wife's beef wellington was spot on, nearly as good as Ramsey Steak.  My rabbit was also bland, and the presentation made it hard to eat- I did eat it all, but I won't remember it next week.  The banana souffle was amazing, best part of the meal.  The service: Perhaps it was because we were one of the last tables of the night, but the servers were TOO attentive.  Always grabbing things off the table, moving our bread plates, trying to take pictures.  I am all for good customer service, but even for a high-end, high-service restaurant this was borderline intrusive.  Sometimes, less is more.

VlLPBSTkaJxM4_wvgLWuBw.text: We didn't get to choose what we ordered since we did a group menu, but it was delicious nonetheless. We all had the filet mignon which was good, not great, but the appetizers were the ones that were super delicious. I love fois gras and their appetizer with jam was astounding. Super delicious. Somewhat built up by the waiters who said this was the best they've ever had (tough bill to live up to!) but it was super good nonetheless. I don't think waiters should necessarily say that, because anything other than best ever is disappointing. I'd love to try the other items by coming back. I also expected, for some reason, for this to be at the top of the eiffel tower but it's only a few floors up. Good view of the Bellagio fountain though!

e0OSksa2v3fstOiid_F5qw.text: Like being in Paris, but you aren't. You are paying for the view...the service needs a bit of polishing, and the closeness of the tables to some of the busboy carts leaves something to be desired.  However....if you stop here a bit later for a drink with someone, you WILL enjoy the view, the wine is decent, and the restaurant can add a memorable event to an already very nice night.

uRmg44JaG1JfYStDj6mjTg.text: Not happy that they wouldn't let us into the restaurant with the excuse that they were understaffed because of a Trump rally! Come on! I find it hard to believe they can't call people in for an extra shift.

mLPdWry5O1drpuqKdMEjMw.text: The service was great! Nice view by the window and the food was great especially the pasta!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SNhILL4U_BT-sv6WWK_0HA.text: From entering on ground level to taking the elevator up it feels as though you're begging transported to  Paris, France . Right when the doors open you see the kitchen and get to smell all the wonderful aromas. This date for me was a surprise fancy date, I was told to look very fancy. I wore a very fancy dress and he wore a suit. We blended it quite well with everyone.  My boyfriend planned all of this ahead of time, which I would suggest to do, because to reserve a window table (which we did) it was $100. The view was beautiful. The fountains went off every 30min. Before our appetizer they gave us a sample of the soup of the day, it was celery something... It was so yummy! We ordered the escargot (I was expecting garlic and butter, but the escargot has more of a cream flavor, different but still good).  In between our app and our meal at 5pm (when the fountains were going off) my boyfriend became my fiance. Yes, he proposed! There was a waitress taking photos of the big moment! She captured all of the wonderful surprised reactions I had and all the love we share. I am so happy he found someone to get a photo of that moment.   My sister called ahead for a bottle of champagne for our big moment, which they poured and kept cold for us.  Our meal came after, I ordered the duck (medium rare) and he ordered the stake (rare). Both cooked to perfection and delicious!  We also ordered the  creme brulee OMG SO GOOD! If I could eat that once a week I would!  The restaurant is beautiful, the staff is quiet and polite and the view is something I'll never forget.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So happy this moment is captured.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So happy they had someone to take the photos for us.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The moment I said yes and kissed him.

1U2MrqjMy2ya4g0wU6E7iw.text: My husband and I celebrated our 48th anniversary at this beautiful restaurant.  We wanted a special place.  We were very pleased with the setting.  Our table overlooked the Bellagio Fountains.  The food was delicious and our server Igor was the best.  We had dinner at Maxim's in Paris, France many years ago, the Eiffel Tower restaurant here in Las Vegas surpassed that.  I highly recommend this place for any occasion.

8BFDLAQXioLF60tkPoOP2Q.text: Fantastic food and experience.  Try the individual beef Wellington.  Beautiful views of the bellagio fountains.  Ask for a table by the window.  Eaten there five times and each was consistently great.  Expensive but worth it.  Save room for the souffles and order them when you order your food.   Several flavors prepared to order.  A+

EoaedHIufGEshF6VxIBAnA.text: Great service and great view over looking he bellagio fountains. Caesar did a good job and the flat iron steak and eggs were great.

VeyuvOFLSyCyhfrP094F8g.text: 9environment. 9service. 9food.  We had a window seats. Nice city view!  Chief Tasting menu - $135 per person  Seafood plate - $69 per person Open red wine / corking fee $75 It was a fantastic dinner

rRNGrETU63r4J_tRWrxgVA.text: We had an excellent meal at the Eiffel. It was a business dinner at 8 on a Friday and we were escorted right away to our table. The menu was great with an extensive wine list. I opted for the sea bass and I was very happy with my choice. The view was fantastic! The service was top of the line. It's a bit pricey but definitely worth it for a special occasion. I would definitely come back.

VtUCsZJRMeakWAH_oceN3w.text: This was one of my favorite meals in Vegas.  We went for a walk on Sunday morning and I read about this on yelp.  The reviews do not do it service.  It's great!  The room is gorgeous!  The brunch was excellent.  We got a booth with a great view.  Besides the quality of the place and food, I was completely taken back by the peacefulness of this place.  All the restaurants on the main strip looked like mayhem and I just wanted a nice quiet brunch for my girl and I.    We found it!  Terrific spot!  Enjoy~

Bi4EbjXTS0_o_gWo3lDqDA.text: ok, I honestly cannot believe the ratings on this place.    Bottom-line, it is cute that it is the replica Eiffel Tower, but aside from that, this restaurant offers little.  There are simply far too many better spots in Vegas to waste time here.   Pro-  Service was solid and well attentioned. Not full French formal service, but definitely solid. View- nice view of Bellagio fountains and some of the strip, but honestly there are better spots for views (top of tower, Stratosphere, as a couple of others) Desserts- of all the food we had, the desserts seemed to have the most attention paid to them (versus simply mass pushed out commercial kitchen food).  Cons- Food- Food was average at best. Our group had a mixture of apps, salad, steak, fish, and desserts. Nothing stood out as particularly good. Each dish was just lackluster, and given the pricing, you should expect more.  We ate at Per Se the day before and this place does not remotely touch it and yet it was comparable (if not more) in price.  Wine- Honestly the wine list here is shameful.  They have bottles at 2x what you can buy at restaurants within 100 yards (again same bottle at Per Se was $75 less--crazy). I do not mind paying for good wine, but the markup here honestly put a damper on the evening. Just know going in you are being taken advantage of and deal with it. Just for reference, one example- 2 days before I had a bottle of Blackbird, arise and paid $80.  Here they had a HALF-bottle for $90.   Overall atmosphere- The volume of people run through this space shows. The white tile floors are dirty and the red carpet is worn. Again think hectic brassiere versus fine French dining.  Overall-this place seems to be lost between trying to be a high end French restaurant, a brassiere, and a tourist trap, and it owns none of its multiple identities.   Maybe I went in with wrong expectations, but for the $$$$, you should expect more than a decent view.

E6a4csoM-A4q0SawPFZlFg.text: My experience at this restaurant was lovely. Aside from just loving the company I was in while there, I also loved the ambiance, the view, the service (Roman was our server), and the cuisine. The design and decor of the restaurant is very underwhelming; accordingly, I deducted one star. However, the cuisine, service, and view of the Bellagio fountains more than make up for the lackluster decor.

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate souffle
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes gratin and asparagus

dqXLMJkMCm20FE810mpw9A.text: My girlfriend and I just so happened to be in Vegas at the one year, eight month mark in our relationship. We were originally planning to get dinner at some Cheesecake Factory-esque restaurant, but when we were walking around Paris, we decided to go with Eiffel Tower Restaurant to make it a memorable night.  We were in town because she had a singing competition at Planet Hollywood. It ran longer than we thought, and in the process I had to push back our 9:35 reservation at the last minute. The staff was very accommodating and understanding, and I really appreciated that. When we arrived ten minutes late, I showed up in a t-shirt and shorts, which, in my defense, was comfortable attire for attending a competition! But of course, not acceptable for a nice, fancy dinner. Definitely my bad! So we speed-walked back to Bally's so I could change into my collared shirt and dress pants. Ended up arriving at around 10:10. Big props goes to the staff of Eiffel Tower for dealing with my follies in such a patient, professional manner!  Now for dinner, we had a beautiful view of the Strip and Bellagio's beautiful fountain show in front of us. That alone was pretty memorable. We were treated very well by the staff, who offered us bread on a nice platter, giving us the option to choose which type of bread we wanted. Before our food was served, we were offered a nice sampling of asparagus soup, which was creamy and delicious.   For our entrees, she ordered the vegetarian option, the Baked Herbed Crepes while I ordered the Beef Wellington which came with a nice wine sauce on the side. Overall the food was good, and having never had a filet mignon baked into a pastry, it was pretty interesting -- in a good way! The wine sauce gave the dish a distinctive sweet, defined taste. My girlfriend's crepes were pretty good too, from what she let me sample... haha.  Our dessert was the Yelp-recommended pistachio souffle, which was nice and delicate. We were also given a choice of chocolates from a platter to round out the night. A nice shout-out goes to Reed, our amazing and efficient server for contributing to an wonderful and memorable dinner experience. Will definitely be back again, and will be recommending this place to family and friends. Thanks, Eiffel Tower Restaurant, for giving my girlfriend and I a great memory!

GWSylEaSAH-TeDU60goFhQ.text: I do not remember the name of our waitress and nor do I want to. We didn't know asking for a piece of bread was so difficult. She wouldn't give us a slice of a baguette until after we finished our meal...who wants bread after they are finished eating? Seemed like we had to beg after asking for the manager.   One of the "helpers" I guess you can say, Alfonso Cruz, had to be one of the absolute best. We looked forward to him actually coming to the table and asking if everything was ok even though he did not have to because he was not our waiter. Willingly, he would check on us and keep on asking if we wanted more bread (: so simple! I really would just come for his service (no lie).   Food was not bad. It was surprisingly good. No complaints.   Thank you Alfonso for the wonderful service! Made our night! He needs a promotion.

YGgewlXpL-D4jksigVdiJw.text: Absolutely spectacular!! Do not even eat here without a window table to see the view.  Every step of the service was flawless from the hostesses at the casino level who were very friendly and prompt, to the seating hostesses, the sommelier, etc.  Our captain was Alix Briand and she is a star. What a pleasure to have a dining experience executed by her.  I had the salmon appetizer and beet and goat cheese salad, and veggie sides as I don't eat meat.  Guests had halibut, steak, and leg of lamb and all were completely blown away.  Wine, dessert, sorbet and cookies at the end were a special touch. Save up your calories for this spot as it's worth it and a must eat on your Vegas vacation.

CG1-vtfZN2qYnGnuMCw9rA.text: The 1 star is a review for our lunch on Friday, June 13, 2014.   Went here for lunch with a friend! I only have one complaint-- our server, Rafael A.!   Rafael was very unprofessional, unfriendly, and boring!  We always say "Thank you" and not even a single word of "You're welcome" is mentioned! He did not even bother to ask us how our lunch/food was. He just ignored us the entire time !   Anyway, the view is breathtaking , Food is great, and other staff were nice!  Last time I went here was on my birthday dinner with my boyfriend! Everything went great! It was wonderful, especially when my boyfriend surprised me with dozen of roses and one whole cake made by their executive chef!   Oh  and our server, John was awesome---- way better than that boring, incompetent, Rafael!

pwTqlrFjJazLdSrTg7uYvA.text: Great view, good food, awesome company!  Came for the food and view and was not disappointed!  Definitely try to make reservation, or you'll be waiting for a nice long time!

BBF6um-OKCsFiEgxyxXLcw.text: Waiter was on point great recommendations. The food is superb. However the steak knife needs sharpening. I switched out for another knife and it was still full. Made the filet look cheap but I had to hack at it. Sharpen your steak knives guys.
