Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soufflés yum

_toFvKBfktRFAjoaZN2ctQ.text: Went there for a birthday dinner and had a great time. The wine list is extremely extensive and has wine priced up to 22,000 a bottle. Never in my life have I seen that selection available. We had a wonderful meal including foie grais and steak. The ride to the top is unique and the ambiance of the fountains is great. It's definitely worth the price and rather quiet up there.

V_Ydp4Imqc452mja4ayKuw.text: Stars are for service and view. Would come back. Food is above average in taste but not excellent. Food presentation is however.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate soufflé
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loupe de Mer (like a Branzino)

ATZDeHXIK6SBF4GScZPrkw.text: Ate here for the first time.  Had a great time overall and a very good dining experience.  Service was outstanding from the busboy to the waiter Michael to the wine steward.  The views were good and the atmosphere was nice.  The food was good but not 5 star or what I was hoping for based on the high prices but that doesn't surprise me when you are paying for the experience and the view.  We come from the San Francisco Bay area where we are used to many excellent restaurants so my standard are probably a little high.  We had a bottle of French wine that was good, scallops cooked perfectly but didn't wow us.  A Caeser salad that was good.  Salmon entre was good but it could have been cooked a little less.  Filet mignon was cooked perfectly and was good but again for the $80 price I was hoping to be amazed by it.  Sides of creamed spinach very tasty as well at the grotten potatoes.  Again it was all good and we enjoyed this for a one time experience but would not do it again.  Mon Abi Gabi below also with a terrific view of the Bellagio water show serves similar quality food for more reasonable prices.  I think this place is perfect to have a drink and an appetizer and enjoy the view but not for  a whole meal unless money is no object.

KaVTTgnZJpNqhVGXtRc9ZA.text: We all went here to eat on our trip to Las Vegas. We decided to try this place, because we heard good things. I am going to start by saying that the food is amazing. Amazing is an understatement. I got a salad, but everyone's food was pretty delicious. The service was good. They had 3 waiters for our table so we had excellent service. The reason why I gave the restaurant a 3 star was because, they kept  bringing us mineral water, which we did not order and charged us for it. We spent almost $50 dollars for water we did not even order. If you are eating here, expect to spend some money!!! And, the wait time to get the food is also very long.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Something very delishhhhh.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmmmm...best salad I have ever had.

1aJRaXqixWkCTofN6o8FxQ.text: Had dinner on 12/30, 6:30 pm, a day before New Years. Despite the busy time of year and day, my wife and I were seated by 6:40 pm.  Received a window seat, however, it was on the South Side (vs more desirable street side facing Bellagio.)  View was nice, but, more reserved.  Recommend requesting street side with your reservation.  Wife ordered Surf and Turf which was a tender steak and stuffed crab ravioli.  Steak was good (a bit salty), the crab ravioli better.  Loved the sauce.    I ordered the Rack of Lamb which was delicious.  Waiter commented this was New Zealand imported lamb vs the more common US lamb, so it was less gamey.  I notice the flavor difference prior to his informing me, so he was right on there.  I only miss the  minty sauce some restaurants typically include with lamb.    Accompaniment, ordered the cream spinach and mushroom. This was delicious particularly with the sourdough bread that was brought fresh periodically throughout the meal.   Our only complaint was that we were not able to use our Players card  dinning credits there, as they indicated they are not an official LV Paris Hotel restaurant.  Seemed strange as they are in the Eiffel Tower within the Hotel.

csczRk_H8pved3mel7gdhg.text: There are nice greeters by a podium near the elevators to escort you up to the restaurant. When the doors open you are dropped off in front of the kitchen. Take a right to the hostess inside to be seated. The views while eating breakfast/brunch when I was there was pretty sweet. You can always catch the Belliago water show. You are paying for the view more than the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar

EyTq2AY2FofbOEsY4Z8vLw.text: My husband and I celebrated our 25th anniversary here. Romantic atmosphere, exceptional service, delicious food. Ridge the bartender was outstanding! Wonderful cocktails, a warm welcome, and great stories.

2ywEZRIl3eqE6TyLtACFJQ.text: Definitely an experience.  I've always drive by this restaurant and wondered what it would be like to eat up there.  I finally got the chance to take my bf up here for his birthday.  Great place for an occasion or romance.  In order to make a reservation, you need to give them a credit card.  Interesting.  The view is beautiful.  You can go see the strip at sundown and the Bellagio fountains.  The tables that we were seated near the window is very tiny.  Barely have any room. I liked how they had a bread tray to choose from 4 different types of bread.  I recommend the rustic; more Frenchy.  Service was good, not excellent like what I expected from a high-end restaurant.  Wild Escargot on Sweet Garlic Souffle:  I wouldn't have known  they were snails.  Didn't look like it didn't taste like it.  For an appetizer, it was extremely tiny, smaller than my palm.   Lamb chops: Umm...that price for 3 bones of lamb? That is seriously outrageous although it was mighty delicious and it melts in your mouth. Beef Wellington: This isn't what I expected either after watching all these cooking shows.  It was technically a meat pie with a huge cube of filet in the middle. It was good and filling but not really expecting it.   Potato Gratin: Extremely creamy.  I knew it was going to be rich but this took it to the next level. Wild Mushrooms: If you're going to get a side, get this. Armaretto Souffle: You must allow 45 minutes to order any Souffle and it is well worth it.  It was a light delicious cloud of armaretto. Banana Tower Thingy: Love the white chocolate crisp with a crap ton of bananas. It was super impressive but I would got for a souffle instead.  After each meal, they give you as much petit fours your heart desire.

jGIvDZqFew4nIDj6UXcHdQ.text: Surprised my wife with this restaurant for her birthday last year and WOW was it delicious. The atmosphere of this restaurant is great! On the reservation, I noted it was her birthday and we ended up with a window seat right in front of the Bellagio fountains. That is absolutely the best view of the fountains I have ever seen. I think almost every staff member came by and wished her a happy birthday.   The meal options at this place are limited, but I do recommend the steak over the chicken. My wife was eating my steak instead of the chicken she ordered because it tasted that much better. One thing that I was a little confused about at first was before we even ordered our main course, they were asking if we wanted a souffle for dessert. I guess it is because it takes so long to prepare and is made from scratch/to order. I do recommend the souffle for dessert, it tasted delicious!  As a side note, I recommend buying the tickets for the viewing deck for after your meal. The restaurant offers a slight discount since your are dining there. Overall, will definitely be returning to this restaurant in the future (but only for special occasions, $$$$).

Zidn4ZBGnC8vCqv8Jik5LA.text: I went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant during Christmas. Pros: - Ambience was nice - The view was good - Souffle was very delicious  Cons:  - The foods are not too special

leEeDiqmZzh-eA66JshCJA.text: Took my wife here for our anniversary. The view is spectacular. We sat at a window table and watched the fountains at Bellagio. Worth the price of the meal itself. Service was impeccable. Food was good, Nancy has the chicken and I had a filet. Not something you do every day, but it was nice to play tourist for a few hours.

4hfhsbBR0gSHBvru4XHxXA.text: It was my wife's birthday, and the two of us decided to celebrate at Paris' Eiffel Tower Restaurant. The end result: near perfection. Greeting by gentlemen at first floor entrance ... perfect. Greeting by hostess in restaurant ... perfect. Table with view ... perfect, perfect. Food ... near perfect. Dessert (white chocolate banana elysee)... perfect. Overall service ... perfect. Thank you Eiffel Tower Restaurant for a memorable experience.

dJHookwsSmhUTZ0deNffzQ.text: granted the prices are expensive, but what on the strip isn't. a three course meal with a bottle of wine for two will run you $250 - $300. advice: make reservations, come early, and tip the host for the corner table.  if you'd like the souffle for dessert, order it the minute you sit down, the chocolate or grand m. are the best.

EFm94rvWc3aZ8nhuGEgQ8w.text: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday, and for a special occasion restaurant, it really can't be beat. The views are incredible, the wait staff is impeccable, and the food is top notch. I can't really remember what we both had for dinner, though, because the dessert really over-shadows it in both of our minds. The restaurant has a selection of souffles of the day, and the bff, being a nut about nuts, HAD to order the pistachio souffle. (We had a little debate over which flavor to order, as I looooove chocolate, but I was nice and let him win on his bday.) We both died and went to heaven. It was everything you'd ever want in a dessert--decadent, flavorful, wonderfully warm and rich. We both still talk about that souffle more than a year later, and we even tried to recreate it, which didn't come anywhere close to as spectacular. Yes, the prices are steep, even for Las Vegas, but the food, the ambiance, and the wait staff are all worth it. Even if you don't go for dinner, you should grab a glass of bubbly and a fantastic souffle for dessert while enjoying the Bellagio fountains.

6foQtJtq5zyvYVumSiJlJQ.text: We came to celebrate my father's birthday and I seriously do not understand how anyone could give this place more than a couple of stars if they've EVER had good food in their life.  The place is gimmicky, extremely loud, and for a restaurant that boasts sophistication/romance/fanciness as their schtick, they sure do seem like an expensive version of TGI Friday's. At over 120 dollars per person, I've had much much better quality food and better experience at much less expensive restaurants.  The quality of the beef (we ordered filet) was laughable. Both people who ordered the filet had to send it back because it was not cooked properly (both were ordered medium, and one came out well done, the other one rare).  Someone else got food poisoning from the salmon dish.  The only good dish were the lamb chops (cooked properly and had good taste).  Usually restaurants that have family style sides will give you a reasonable portion. Not here.  Each side dish will feed 2 people,  maybe.  The steaks and fish are served without any garnish.  We ordered a celebration cake for my father, and the cake was atrocious. Nobody even ate it.  We were taking a photo with my dad and some waiter came and crouched next to him to get in the photo. Really?? At a "5 star" restaurant?? All in all it was a waste of money and calories.  With so many actually good options in Vegas, please do not eat here.  It took 3 hours to leave the restaurant! The service was painfully slow, meals were cooked improperly and we got one case of food poisoning.  One of the worst meal experiences of my life.  The view of the strip is not worth that kind of pain.

AYb3oFR1PPv4Jp53ORg6gQ.text: 3 out of 5 STARS OVERALL  The SCENIC VIEW (4 out of 5 stars) appears to be the highpoint of dinning here as you overlook the Ballagio Fountains & have a magnificent panoramic view of the strip skyline.  Also, service throughout was very attentively pleasant for our party of 6.  With regards to the food we'd DISSAPPOINTINGLY say 3 of 5 stars.  Much of the main courses were underseasoned, the sauces were fair (suprisingly), 3 of our meat dishes were overdone, the fish was a bit too dry, & appetizers (except for the savory foie gras)were fair & not quite the 4 or 5 star experience we expected.  For those foodies willing to spend $$$$ for French cuisine in LV we'd recommend: Joel Robuchon @ MGM, Twist @ the Mandalay, or Guy Savory @ Ceasars for a 4/5 star dining feast!!

okc561UdXm5g5dCgnMqBrA.text: We have been coming to Vegas for MANY years and finally got around to trying this restaurant. We are sorry it took so long! We only had lunch there but we were treated just as nicely as if we'd spent a lot more on dinner! From the very start when we were warmly greeted and escorted up the private elevator, to the beautiful table we were given right by the window, and the extremely attentive and friendly service, we really felt like valued customers. We really appreciate that when eating out in Vegas. The food was good but we felt it was almost secondary to the top notch service, presentation, and ambience of the place. Our server was very helpful with describing the specials and other menu items. He seemed to know a lot about the restaurant which came across in a very fun way, his pride was definitely showing! He even shared the recipe book with us, left it on the table for us to look at, but then did not try to "upsell" it to us, which we appreciated but were almost disappointed since it was a very cool book. We went back for it later, as we decided we needed to take it home as a souvenir. But that just gave us an opportunity to go back up there at night and check out the view then! And we were treated so nicely when we went back too. Thanks for giving us such a nice memory of this Vegas trip!

gt8bA1w4UWJMa16SaOcCwg.text: This is our special occasion spot in Vegas. Spectacuar views, impeccable service and fabulous food.  Menu changes seasonally, fish is always fresh and delicious. LOVE the fois gras, desserts. Other places have good food, but the service and ambience set this apart for us

9bfnqemozlvKzbmc8gbItw.text: The best piece of meat I have ever had!!! This filet mignon melted with the plunge of the fork and then in my mouth. Asparagus al dente - perfect.  Any dessert is so good it is almost perverted. Service is good but dont expect california fakeness or ignorant drivel. Just get to the business of eating a fabulous meal.

vfSMZINIe2njspxmdAi0pw.text: My husband and I enjoy dining at fine restaurants. Having read the reviews for this place we decided to try it. We came for lunch and had such a wonderful experience. Food was not bad, but the lunch service was impeccable. I was most impress with the professionalism of the lunch staff. We had checked in with the maitre'd and shortly after, a couple with a service dog checked-in. There was a short wait, but I thought it was very courteous of the maitre'd to inform us that she was going to seat the couple with the service dog before us because of the special accommodation she had to provide. As a waiting customer, the notification was delightful. We were sat by the window and were provided an exceptional service by Jason. After experiencing this, my husband and I decided to book for dinner. Unfortunately, I cannot praise the evening staff the same. The maitre'd was rude along with the girls that surrounded her. The food and service was just mediocre. The view was impressive, but I will not fight a crowd to have dinner at this restaurant again. I recommend and will only return to have lunch at this restaurant.

fU5uVb9hw72WbbUt4Ko-dA.text: Review of lunch.  Great view and location for a tourist.  We had the seafood salad and trout, both very tasty.  When we got there, the maitre d asked if it was a special occasion, and because it was my friend's birthday, they gave a complimentary dessert.  They had forgotten to bring a drink (and we also forgot because the food was so good) but they remembered and brought it in the end on the house.

4MtzFNpdTQbKyjRVHODQtA.text: My date called ahead to ask if we could get a table near the window, and the lady on the phone said that she was unable to accommodate that and we would just have to see what we get when we get there. Now I completely understand they are busy and they cannot possibly guarantee all the requests that come in, but I am sure there is a more tactful way to say it. However, once we got there she absolutely remembered my date from the phone and we got the best table on the window overlooking the fountains. The food was beyond the best of our honeymoon. I asked if they could cook my duck medium instead of medium rare and the waiter said he would have to check with the chef. This always makes me laugh because I think, wait I am paying you, but they said they would accommodate me, and of course it came out medium rare as they said they would serve it on the menu. However, this was a learning experience for me because the duck was seriously the best duck I have ever eaten and I now order my duck as they suggest it because of this restaurant. The view, food, and service was all well worth the experience. I would love to go back again.

ovfiTXKXvj_ZkxYIz8cvbQ.text: Don't let the theme-park like location fool you, this restaurant is serious cuisine for serious foodies.  The atmosphere is elegant, yet lively, with art-deco inspired fixtures and furnishings complementing a spectacular view of the strip.  The staff is warm and attentive, without being intrusive.  And, the menu...an absolute delight.  You can choose from Chef Joho's exquisite seven course signature tasting menu or extensive a la carte selection.  I highly recommend the warm lobster salad with garlic braised artichokes.  A superb blend of flavors and textures.  The roast rack of lamb is also quite wonderful.  Cooked to perfection with a crisp herb crust drizzled with a tarragon jus.  Make sure you save room for dessert.  The souffles are not to be missed....I recommend either the pistachio or grand marnier.....and the raspberry napoleon is splendid.  Also, don't be surprised if you're visited by the Eiffel Tower's Manager, Laurent Ertle, during your dining experience.  He works to make sure that every guest is treated with exceptional care.  I've now been to the restaurant about a half-dozen times and each experience has been marvelous and memorable.  One final note, prices are what you would expect from a fine restaurant, but they are realistic, not inflated, and the value is outstanding.

ytqUWNeuDMxAJgixrtzapQ.text: Sorry, this type of restaurant really has to impress me to get more than 3 stars.  I really loved the view: from the restaurant you can see the water show at the Bellagio and lots of the Strip, it's very exciting.  Our seat was great, we sat in a red mohair banquette with a great view.  The server, my cocktail and the bread were excellent, but the food was just ok.  Sorry, Eiffel Tower, I am a snob from San Francisco.

utKo4GCWzZyUnzsTnUNAsQ.text: This restaurant did not impress me at all. My boyfriend and I had dinner here along with my cousin and her boyfriend and had a reservation next to the windows. When we got there, were were taken to the elevator and once we were taken up and into the restaurant, the first thing you see is the kitchen and the cooks. Uhh...not so romantic?? I was a little annoyed that we did not sit next to the windows like we asked, of course I didn't want to make a big fuss over it. The only view we saw was the blue Paris balloon sign and a little of Bellagio. Again, not impressive. My cousin and I ordered a chicken dish, and the BF's ordered fillet mignon. We also ordered mash potatoes on the side since the dishes did not come with anything but the meat itself. Once our dishes came out, like typical French food, the portions looked like they were meant to be eaten for birds. The fillet mignon was soooo tiny and mind you this dish cost $68 and each side dishes was $8. My chicken was "organic and grown on a special farm" so this explains why it was $38??? The only thing I enjoyed was their desserts. They were absolutely delicious! We had the White Chocolate Banana Elyse and the Raspberry Napoleon, Vanilla Blanc Manger. They had a beautiful presentation, so pretty to eat. Altogether as a group we spent $400 something including drinks and tip. Don't get me wrong, I don't mind paying a lot of money for a great dinner, but this was not a great dinner! Sorry, I will never return!

pOdftjggDSyu9XXWe1nGUQ.text: This place is my first classy/up scale restaurant so I felt somewhat out of place since the most upscale place I've been to is like... Cheesecake Factory. But my "expensive" friend wanted my bf and I to experience this place because he loved it the last time (and it is vegas after all), so I decided to come here to have an experience. And wow, what an experience. I felt like I was in a romantic show/movie. The waiter seated us ladies first and then the guys. Even pulled out the seats for us (and my bf doesn't even do that for me!) The bathroom has attendants, whom I forgot to tip because I didn't know that was standard etiquette. And the food portions were tiny but amazingly they were filling. I forgot what I ordered because I came here about a year ago, but I remember it having spinach and some hard rice cracker type thing on top. I thought it tasted way too salty but my bf seemed to love it. Overall, it was an interesting experience. I wouldn't mind coming here again for special occasions.

OISHdYqFQdQE22MC4h1MBA.text: I ate at Eiffel Tower last week for the the third time ever, and always at lunch.  If you have reservations (I make mine through OpenTable), you always get seated before the walk-ins.   They open for lunch at 11:30, and even if there were about 10 other people that had been waiting, my cousin and I were seated first.  The meal usually starts with a vegetable mousse in a tiny cup that you eat with a tiny spoon.  I've had tomato and spinach in the past and while they were delicious, this time we had mushroom.  And it was splendid.  My favorite meal is pretty standard here: Crab-stuffed avacado, pan-seared trout with butter and wild rice, and the summer berry pudding dessert.  To drink: Ginger Peach Tea.  My cousin ordered a fois gras appetizer with fig and a salmon entree with the fish hammered flat, seasoned, and fried.  We both had a bowl of the cream of celery soup.  The food is DELICIOUS!  A huge bonus is the tiny cheese and poppy seed popovers that they give you with every meal.  The service is attentive, at times a bit much, but  way better than being ignored.  Our check came out to about $200.  Eiffel Tower is always a must visit when I'm in town.

D94V5bfuKRhRLTR4KRsLRQ.text: So this is the second night of my friends quater life crisis and also the eve of his birthday.  So of course we end up at the Eiffel Tower Restauarant.  First off you take an elevator up to the restaurant and you head towards the kitchen.  Then to the dining room that over looks the strip (it's not as high as you would think).  We get a table over looing the strip (nice).    Our server comes and asks if we would like to order a bottle of wine, and I said yes of course.  A sommelier comes by and asks what are my preferences.  I don't like reds, nor do I like dry whites.  I said I like the sweeter and fruitier variety.  She comes back with this Sauvignon Blanc I forget what but it had lychee in it.  Oh my God!  The best wine I have ever had and I'm a fool for forgetting the name.    We get our choice of breads and we ordered our food.  I got the Lamb Chop with escarole and potato puree.  MMMMM the sauce that came with it...I would have drunk it till I drowned.  we also ordered Scalloped Potatoes, Mushrooms, and Asparagus with Lemon Jus to share.  All great sides with my meal.  My friend ordered the Steak Au Puoive and was delicious the peppercorn sauce was not as over powering as I would have thought.  Friend number 2 ordered the Chillean Sea Bass with Roasted Vegetables- probably my least favorite but it was still good.  Friend number 3 Pan Seared Chicken with Meyer Lemon Jus and Hari Cot Verts- really good chicken was moist, nothing spectacular though.  Friends number 4 Roasted Wild Salmon with balsamic reduction and roasted figs- interesting dish, lots of flavor, but I have to say I would have enjoyed it a lot more if it was prepared with a different type of fish.  Dessert?  My friend got a shot glass with a Cappaccino Mousse along with chocolate caligraphy saying Happy 25th Birthday!  Forever tormenting his demise of turning 25 in his quarter life crisis.  That alone made this dinner worth it.   Total= 475.46 plus we tipped the sommelier nicely on what was simply the best wine I ever had.

7TAuJYm_kR5HHu_q37lyWw.text: Took my girl here to have a romantic dinner and it definitley met our expectations.  We had a table right along side the window facing the Bellagio fountains.  The ambiance of this place is great with the dim lighting.  The staff is all very professional and the food is really good but very small portions so don't go expecting to get full.  Between me and my chick the meal was $250 with the tip, good place to eat just to say that you tried it.

idsm0rOie_cJEmiIpfLz3w.text: Been here 3 times.  The first 2 times were excellent, but the 3rd time was a little disappointing.  This was due to the consistency in the taste of the food and the service.  Probably the most expensive meal I've had in my life though.  Dinner for 2 ran me anywhere from $200 - $250 depending if alcohol was involved or not.  Was it worth it?  I think so.  This is one of those restaurants where they offer just more than good gourmet French food.  Ordered their rack of lamb all 3 times, and even though I felt that it was on the salty side, it may have been that salt that brought the flavor out.  The meat was cooked to perfection.  Their scalloped potatoes al gratin and their creamed spinach were excellent, but all a-la-cart so that's how the final bill became so pricey.  Their service was impressive to say the least and I felt we had our own personal waiter.  Very attentive.  The ambiance is very upper crust and romantic, but I didn't feel uncomfortable one bit.  The best thing about this place is the view.  Spectacular views of the Vegas strip and we literally had a front row seat of the famous Bellagio water park so we has some pretty nice entertainment to go along with dinner.  Felt like I was on top of the world!  This is a must go to restaurant if you're trying to impress a date and want to have one of those unforgettable evenings that should of course stay in Vegas.  :)

1MYUyoCAcGanRnDgkMdPPQ.text: I love this place for lunch, but wasn't a big fan of dinner. It's great for a lunch time rendezvous with that special someone, but for dinner there are other places i would recommend. Lunch offered great service, excellent bartender, fabulous bread offering, and reasonable prices for exceptional food. Dinner was crowded, our server seemed overburdened, the bread was mediocre, and the bill was twice as much. Definitely a lunch place.

Nw-9EalT2tL4DzEQ7OlSBA.text: I am tore between a 3 and half star and a 4 but I rounded up.  The view was incredible but I rather just upgrade my room for the the same view.   Food was ok and not the best steak I have had but decent.  Expensive- but you are on the strip and you are paying for the view

wAqt7YMpfOQP_iWVjrDgfA.text: First review ever, had to review the tower restaurant as i was very disappointed in the food. The view is amazing and the greeters are awesome, but our waitress was not able to explain the menu which was hard to decide since its in french.complimentary bread is good. Ordered the farm raised chicken, and was expecting the breast but was disappointed that i got the thigh. I thought it was gross. Immediately lost appetite bagged up the food and gave to street artist. Also waitress just did not seem interested in giving us an experience. Overpriced flavors that dont compliment vegas experience

qb5MlCbZNX2ZkKs9Md42kg.text: My husband made a reservation for one of our date nights. It was our second time dining at the Eiffel Tower . Everybody is very nice and kind . With a very romantic scene of the bellagio water fountain show. It's French cuisine is 5 stars . This is pure quality . Quality food , quality service and quality view !!

2i6n_k2n9xGF5alHfEHRHw.text: Fine dining at its best! They accommodated our needs as we were pressed for time. The view of the fountains added to the ambience; but their execution and delivery of each course was most memoriable. BD dinner and we were in and out within an hour but never felt rushed as we had to see a show.

C313bhz9NgifB1Msw1jOig.text: Great spot in Vegas!!! Breathtaking view, delicious food, worth the price.  Friendly staff, would recommend to anyone!!!

akn6_fMkNJCPnZSaNJ01nw.text: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant sits on the 11th floor of the Paris' Eiffel Tower replica in Las Vegas; it provides a decor, atmosphere and dining experience that is fitting with its name (which you may either enjoy or find cheesy depending on your likes/dislikes).  A private glass elevator takes guests up to the restaurant (kind of an interesting view of floors and activity on the way up and the way back down).  The elevators opens up to the kitchen where the chefs plate the food.  The restaurant utilizes an old-fashioned dining room--plush red seating and white tablecloth--but the stodginess of it is cut dramatically by the view and utilization of the Eiffel Tower's metal legs within the restaurant.  The tables are strategically placed so that many tables have a great view of The Strip (with the primary attraction being the Bellagio Fountains).  Lots of big floor-to-ceiling windows create the great view.  The metal framework cuts into the restaurant and it gives it kind of an art deco feel.  The art deco feel with the old-fashioned decor really make this place feel like a restaurant from another era.  They started us off with a cream soup amuse bouche that was okay but not great.  The complimentary bread was also okay but not memorable.  We had some appetizers.  The lobster Pain Perdu was kind of like a lobster bread souffle.  It was okay though not great.  We also had some sea scallops that were served in a wine sauce with onions.  The scallops dish was also just okay.  The scallops were tender and seasoned right.  I've had much better though in terms of scallops (both in outside sear and moistness) as well as the accompanying sauces and sides.  We also had a little bit of their cold seafood platter, which included lobster, shrimp, crab, oysters, and clams.  This is not my favorite type of starter (I would rather have hot seafood where the chefs get a little more creative in how they garnish/sauce/cook the seafood).  Everything was okay, but nothing really stood out here.  I had the venison chop as my entree.  The venison chop had a nice red color, but it was not that juicy.  The meat was tender enough and had a decent though not spectacular flavor.  The huckleberry reduction sounded good, but it did not really do much here (not a particularly prominent flavor on the plate).  The main side to the venison chop was an oatmeal cake.  This is the second time I've had oatmeal with dinner (the other time was Bistro LQ).  This would not be my favorite side--not bad (definitely tastes like oatmeal).  The plate also featured black trumpet mushrooms and these were pretty good.  They had a nice crunch to them.  I also tried one of the a la carte slides--classic potato gratin.  It was kind of lukewarm.  The potatoes were tender but a little bland (and lacked a creamy cheesy flavor).  While almost all of the food was average, the dessert was a real winner.  I had the chocolate souffle and it was probably one of the best chocolate souffles I've had.  It had a great chocolate flavor (they served it with a chocolate ganache, which was also good).  What separated the chocolate souffle was the texture.  Very nicely baked.  Great texture and great lift.  Chocolate souffles are hard to get right.  They are typically dry, spongy or liquidy.  This one though was pretty close to perfect.  I also had some vanilla ice cream, which was creamy but pretty standard stuff.  Service was good in terms of getting the food out at a good pace even though the restaurant was incredibly busy (which also caused the restaurant to be quite warm and loud).  I felt though that the waiter was not as good as some of the other waiters I've had recently.  He did a good enough job, but I felt he was a little stuffy.  I think he could have been a little more personable and relaxed.  Las Vegas restaurants are typically overpriced and Eiffel Tower Restaurant is a pretty good example of that.  The food here would be in the same price range as some of the most expensive and best restaurants in L.A.  Even when comparing Eiffel Tower Restaurant to other pricey Vegas restaurants, Eiffel Tower Restaurant still feels very overpriced.  The prices here are similar to Mesa Grill, but the flavors at Mesa Grill are much better (Mesa Grill uses better ingredients too).  Eiffel Tower Restaurant makes a great souffle and I would come back for that.  The food, however, is overpriced and average (despite having the backing of prominent chef Jean Joho, who also operates the Michelin starred Everest in Chicago).  Even though I am not a big fan of Las Vegas restaurants, I think you could do much better on The Strip than Eiffel Tower Restaurant.  I walked here, but I imagine they have complimentary valet parking or self-parking like the other big Vegas casinos.

JQ06Ll8ifp8ynIOl2_H2qQ.text: It is the cool location and the fantastic service you pay these top dollars for. The food was good but alittle too much on the plain side for my taste. Because of the unique location, to avoid disappointment you should expect a high person per square foot ratio.

zY7mXW3JLUocBepUTGipTw.text: Ou la la, tres magnifique! The view alone will swoon you.  The service is near perfect.  The food was elegant and tres delicieux!  You will walk away thoroughly satisfied.  The only complaint I could even mention is towards a patron who asked if this place served French cuisine.  Get out of here! :-P    To get to the restaurant, you must walk through the casino floor and find the Eiffel Tower elevator.  A staff member will escort you and voila.  The service was magnifique from the start to the end.  As soon as you are seated you will be asked about beverage.  They will kindly recommend you some wine followed by a buffet of freshly made breads.  Yes, buffet! We went through a few rounds of them.  You get your classic baguet and couple of other delicieux homemade breads!  As the Yelper I am, I had to take several pictures around the restaurant.  You could be seated anywhere and still have a spectacular view of the beautiful Vegas strip and surrounding.  Be sure to get a nice shot with the Paris Ballon in the background.  THE FOOD  Started off with a couple things actually.  First was this complimentary shot of something that reminded you of a bacon potato soup.  Tres bon! Second, was appetizer--a deliciously warm sweet glazed foie gras!   For the main course, I savored every single bite of my nicely medium grilled NY-cut steak with glistening bone marrow accompanied with a side of pillowy soft mashed potatoes.  *food coma mode*  Lastly, the Chocolate Souffle! They served it by pouring warm, melting chocolate into the souffle.  It was very moist and soft with a balanced sweetness from the chocolate.  One thing I really appreciated was them filling your glass of water each time it was low.  You might not be in the real Paris, but the experience here definitely made you feel like you were in the City of Lights.  Merci beaucoup Eiffel Tower Restaurant for a magical and elegant evening.

JooLwx8DpXefKAXxoWxA0w.text: Wow, an amazing experience! Sawada was our server and he was fantastic. We thoroughly enjoyed the salmon and the loup de mer with a side of creamed spinach and mushrooms. The lemon drop was also delightful. And even though we didn't offer dessert, they brought out a lovely plate of sweet bites. To top it off, we got a fabulous picture of ourselves as well as the Bellagio water show directly across the street. Definitely must visit!

FszT5wW30fQkhuYbPQB1qw.text: Food and service is second to none. You will drop some coin but the food, service and view of the bellagio fountains is worth it. Lunch is much cheaper than dinner but the fountain show at night is better

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rXkN4Ylgo8ff_NHRZ0VpUA.text: On our recent trip to Las Vegas, my wife, sister in law, and I had dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Our server, Valentino, was superb. Valentino really made us feel comfortable and spoke as though he had known us his entire life, which was quite refreshing. His knowledge and professionalism really made the entire experience worth it. The entire staff was very attentive and friendly. Our drinks were constantly topped off and we never had to wait for anything.  We all had steak, which were by far the best steak I have had in a long time and the best, by far, in Las Vegas.  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a high class, elegant meal and experience. Our reservations were on July 28 at 730pm, perfect to enjoy the sunset behind the Bellagio and enjoy the fountains after dark.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view of the Bellagio fountains from our table at The Eiffel Tower Restaurant

aLlRjhJWqVOFC1biUsSG2Q.text: Fine dining with the best view of the Bellagio Fountains and Strip. Service is outstanding and food is worth the trip down for this local. You enter the elevator from the casino floor up to through the iron girders to be welcomed into the Chef's kitchen. They start you off with the lightest creamiest cauliflower mousse that just tickles your palette. Then fresh bread and the best butter ever made on earth come around. The filet mignon melts in your mouth accompanied by a perfect wine reduction sauce. The potatoes au gratin is delicious and good to share. The timing of the service is right on, not too long and not too rushed. Mention a special occasion and you will get a special dessert. Our fave is the smooth creme brulee that you won't find anywhere else. Then finish off with a delightful mini petit fours... I happen to like the passion fruit one. A wonderful place to celebrate special romantic occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2PaSCiTFOWaZD5MFqNlI9w.text: You're paying for the view.  My suggestions: Bouchon at Venetian. Exciting food, delectable flavors, and ingredients that you would never think of pairing together having a party in your mouth. Half price over this place.  Echo&Rig(off the strip), but sooooo worth the drive. They have their own butcher shop! The meat is not meat, but butter meat. Unbelievable. I have never had a better steak in my life... MUST TRY FOR PEOPLE VISITING! 3 of us, bf and dad, still less than what we paid here.  I'm a local, so I've been to quite a few places here. This is NOT on my radar for the future.  Service was decent. Except for the bus boy who "cleared the table crumbs" by scooping over the table on to my boyfriend's lap. He saw, but didn't apologize.   I'm giving two stars for the view. We both ordered filets that were too chewy to be the quality we were paying for $70 each. The sides were bland, not exciting or creative. The only saving grace was the king crab salad as the appetizer.  We did get 6 mini little "treats" at the end of the meal!!! But, after a $300 tab for two of us, that's not the happy ending I would expect.

nKq2U0Mqtz2D8xv0yc7STg.text: ver nice and classy restaurant. food was great. just a little too pricey but other than that, great views, nice place with good food

wI287xqFTgRHdKp191_-gQ.text: Great athmosfere, service 5 star and food too. The steak tartare was awesome. Also the vegetarian plates are at the top, for the vegan. I spent my anniversary and i recommend it... And with the table in front of the Bellagio is outstanding.

9vDGT7Yi7QbZmndK25D9tg.text: This review is for the Valentine's dinner experience that me and my gf had.  1. we got to the restaurant on time at 7pm, and the Maitre d' routed us to the bar to wait for our (empty) table so that we could spend money on drinks first. 2 mimosas, with pulp, were $36 due to $14 per mimosa price tag and 18% gratuity already included.  2. At $189.99 per person I thought we'd get seated next to a window, but instead we got packed into the middle of the restaurant.  3. the 5 course meal was extremely limited. Only fish or beef (not even steak) were the main course.  4. the food felt too fancy and there was no substance to it. The first course was three 1/2 inch items on one plate, mushroom, some stuffed cracker, and something else.  The remainder of the 5 course meal was: a small salad, then 2 shrimp and shredded pear(?), and then the small beef steak, not even rib-eye, or New York, and then a piece of cake with one scoop of ice cream.  The total bill was close to $500, for 2 people. Of course 18% gratuity already included.  The best part of the whole evening was the bread, it was really good. The french bread and the multi grain bread. But I wouldn't come here just for the bread.  It was really a let down to come here. Especially for the price, this was really a shit show, and I would not come here again or recommend anyone to come here again.

sOTh3A8BZ9OadVKAUzCQJw.text: People giving this restaurant lower than a three star need to realize that a 3 star restaurant is McDonalds or any other fast food restaurant.  I've been to the restaurant several times and they continue to impress.  Food was excellent as always and service was great as well.  People need to save three star ratings for the correct restaurants.  Or better yet provide an example of a restaurant you believe is worthy of your 5 star rating because I'm interested.

kyJ17AxZPRVJCOwNrkzo2Q.text: Food was minimal. Very expensive and service was terrible. We received our meals after an hour and 20 minutes and then  checked on one more time.  I ordered a salad for my first course and two sides for my meal as I am a vegetarian and didn't want either of the two vegetarian options they had on the menu.  I had to eat my sides off a bread plate because she took 10 minutes to offer a dinner plate. Our water glasses were being filled right away at first but then when our dinner's were served we never had them refilled. After we all were finished our waitress came back and when I told her we were upset that we were never checked on she said their policy was not to talk to the customer after they received their meals.  What? Never heard of such a thing ever!  Talked with the host and he apologized and took off a couple sides.  Don't waste your time or money.

bqyqoMV5jBv4zwGDZ6d3Bg.text: This place is about location. If you sit next to a window overlooking the Bellagio fountains, it's worth it for a different perspective. The bar is great, the drinks are super yummy.  Food, however, is common. Nothing spectacular about the food.

Jeb9aYDIqM7eB51Ezar2Fg.text: Highly recommended for a romantic dinner.  Great food and good service. Prices aren't that bad for Vegas standards.  I had the shrimp cocktail and the steak salad. Both pretty solid dishes.  Kids salmon is also pretty good.  The strudel and coffee are awesome!  Cheers

nFpk8V4qzMAW1-hqK5KEjg.text: The view was spectacular and the dessert and wine was to die for! I didn't eat any entree's but I did have a cheese platter that was divine and worth every penny I spent 10/10 I would recommend this to anyone who is willing to spend money on good food!!!!!!!!!

lUgdJ4jiEAb7bzv1oHj2Aw.text: This was my second time going, and I want to say overall, the experience was pretty good.   I ordered the "queen" steak, but both the times I got it, it was pretty tender and cooked well to the degree I wanted it. My party had the lobster dish and it was pretty scrumptious. The portion was enormous. It surprised me actually. The other person in my party got the Dover sole at the recommendation of the server, and that was also amazing.   We didn't really get a good seat to see the Bellagio fountains but I guess that is to be expected since we didn't make a reservation.  Didn't have the desserts this time, but when I had the souffle and it was delicious. It's definitely worth a try... and the 40 minute wait.   This place is a great place for visitors who want a fancy dinner and with a good view, but a reservation is probably recommended.

fjTn5Z9PTdkDaCe27qvAaQ.text: the best romantic cena i can have to my hubby birthday . the food wasss ssooo tasty and soft , on POINT. i have Nothing bad to said. 100% good service and food and atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

juCBVyZF3zjhw1ESe2pefQ.text: Amazing place.  Amazing food.  Amazing service.  Bring money.  Had scallop appetizer, baked lobster dinner, grand marnier souffle.  Wife had Beef Wellington.  Party of six, everything was great.  One of our party has allergies, and they said no problem.  Name your favorite protein and they prepare it without anything on your allergy list.  Such a level of service to make a magic night.  Can't say enough about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from Eiffel Tower.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Lobster.

ABFzcPWrHiKrZPfYehG9yA.text: Many tourists or people who live around the area come here to celebrate a special occasion. This was my case too. My boyfriend took me for my birthday while we stayed in Vegas.   Since a lot of people  love to have dinner here, there's always a wait time. We had a reservation but still were asked to sit by the bar or just linger around for a little bit since our table was not ready. It's worth waiting though.   Service is great. They are really on top of their jobs. Because we were going to order a bottle of wine, they brought us a specialist to tell which which wines would pair well with their dishes. Our pick was a favorite of both of us - Chateau Montelena. I ordered Muscovy Duck Breast. It was cooked to perfection. The chef was very nice and brought us a complimentary small dessert so that they could wish me happy birthday until I would get my souffle.   The restaurant has an amazing view over the Bellagio where they do the water show every 15 minutes. It looks amazing from the top of the tower - more so when you have a seat near the window. So worth going here.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Souffle!

XRBiwEnBM5jAeZ48qMc12A.text: The Filets are astonishingly soft as if it weren't even really meat! The atmosphere is impeccable and classy. I had a delicious fruit infused vodka before my first appetizer of cooked snails. Great pair. The main course was delicious and the desert was even better. The only thing that exceeds the food is the service. Our waiter made it an actual experience. The only draw back is the price. A complete dinner for my wife and I ran me about $320. And that's before gratuity!

DGk3_8eenLlNrNHM_3wtIw.text: My husband brought me to the Resteraunt as a surprise for my 31st birthday! Ive been here before, but this time was different! We had a beautiful view if the strip, a wonderful waiter and amazing foodzl. We started off with the cheese assortment. It was delectable!! Paired with the recommended wine made it supurb! Of course I had to get the beef wellington! I asked for the demiglaze on the side because I know it's very rich! My husband had the ribeye. Both were perfect! All in all I would return! It was so wonderful to have great atmosphere, service and dining in one experience! I can't wait to return! We are local so I hope it's soon!

rHh7byyzUqBu4zSiNl3QCg.text: We have been thinking where to go at Christmas and decided to drive to Las Vegas. We have been making a plan which places we can visit and we think this restaurant worth that. The reviews are just wonderful. We have 3 months old baby and here is a slight question. Is that acceptable to take her with us?  We are going to visit Eiffel Tower restaurant around December 23. Thanks

pYdYg_RvZVyJbhw1tEBMsQ.text: Food: The food and drinks were absolutely wonderful. Rating: Five stars  Service: The servers were attentive and they were very familiar with the menu.  They explained dishes and desserts in a confident, comfortable manner. Rating: Five stars  Atmosphere: The view was great and worth the extra efforts in making advance reservations.  4:30 PM dinner reservations provide windowside tables with a view. Rating: Five stars  Location: The location at Paris Las Vegas is great.  The elevated location at the Eiffel Tower results in great views. Rating: Five stars

2porCz9TXTzR8DjVZXWEig.text: Of course, there is a beautiful view, including the Bellagio fountain show every 30 minutes. Excellent service, from the elevator girl to the hostess to the waiter to the sommelier. Seriously, everything was so seamless between the staff and so well-executed, it was very impressive. Wine list is extensive, with an emphasis on French wines, of course. The sommelier was incredibly helpful in recommending a bottle that wouldn't break the bank. And the food....loved it all. We had the escargot (be warned, it's not the traditional service - the escargot are served on top of a sunchoke flan), sea bass, veal medallions, scalloped potatoes, and mushrooms. Everything was delicious, but the standout was the veal. Every bite was great. I can't exactly call it a complaint, but I would note that although well-executed, the mushrooms seemed a bit boring compared to everything else. After tip and a bottle of wine, our bill was about $300. Obviously you won't go every day, but I think Eiffel Tower is perfect for a special occasion or a splurge.  Also note that the food mostly leans toward traditional preparations...barring vegans, I think just about anybody could be happy eating here.

Oc9HamI_DmyIDdj6lQnxOw.text: Want to have an unforgettable dinner and taste the best food in vegas? This is the place you need to make a reservation in.   Located on the actual Eiffel Tower in the Paris hotel, this restaurant is an icon in the strip. You are taken in an elevator by a hostess and brought to the bar area of the restaurant where you check in for your table.   If you call to make reservations be sure to request the fountain view. At night during the weekends the Bellagio fountains play every 15 minutes and you get to experience this great view from your table as you dine.   The service is impeccable. Once you check in you will wait a few minutes and you can enjoy one of their signature drinks at the bar.   The setting is low lighting and the noise is average. It's very cozy once you're inside. Dress code is implemented and this is a restaurant where you want to go looking your best.   When you are finally  sitting be sure to enjoy the spectacular view that the location offers.   All the waiters are very knowledgable of the menu and based on your cravings will recommend you a great plate.   After placing your order they will come with a big tray of bread and you can chose which you'll like to eat from the variety that they'll bring.   This occasion I had the beef Wellington and wow!!!! Made to perfection. The outside pastry was crunchy and the filet came medium rare inside. The flavors of the food are out of this world and you never want your plate to be emptied.   For dessert we ordered the chocolate souffle. It wasn't the best we've had but it was pretty good. It was our anniversary dinner and they surprised us with a complimentary chocolate mouse that was very good.   Our second time in Vegas and we HAD to make reservations here again. We're looking forward to going back and again having our signature plates in the best restaurant this city has!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great dinner with great view
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington

ZzK3p2JGvcdd4Weey2GnIg.text: I made reservations and requested a table with a view ahead of time. With only two people it's very easy to get a table looking over the Bellagio fountain. I thought this place was going to be breaking the bank but it's honestly reasonably price for the quality of the food. The staffs were also beyond amazing. And lastly you HAVE TO get the souffle!

Xi3aCG5nAK_TtmOGosfpEg.text: The wife and I eat here for our anniversary every year.  The service is perfect, as is the food.  One day we will come back for lunch.    As far as the negative reviews posted here; ignore them.  If you are dressed correctly and understand how the window tables work you will have a great meal here.  Take your time and enjoy the ride.

YgKJAW9nF_KDe64SpKvBrA.text: This place it probably the best place to have a date night in Las Vegas. Right above the Bellagio fountains with full view of the strip. Breathtaking spot.  The restaurant, is very well appointed with coourtoues staff welcoming guest. We were direct to corner table - best in the room.  Now the food - we started with sharing an appetizer, Hot glazed crab - it  was so well presented, on the taste it was a bit shy, for me, but I am wholesome flavor dinner.  For entree, we ordered the lamb chops, which comes with point noir infused sauce and my wife ordered the snapper - both of them were just divine. Lamb chops were hands down the best I have had in Las Vegas - well done, with perfect bland of marinade and jus. Outstanding. My wife loved the snapper too -and now the best part. the dessert - we ordered the chocolate plate - it was crazy delicious - a mix n match of best chocolate offering in the restaurant - A must have. All this was enjoyed with great French red.  Now the service, our waiter was excellent, he new his job - very attentive and made the right suggestions. Overall a strong 5 stars for the entire experience - its a awesome date night dinner spot - great service, top-quality food and million dollar views

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e7nJr1r_hlOHU2O89HafwQ.text: Terrible service from start to finish. I had requested a window seat for our 6:00 Monday night reservation. The hostess seated me in a booth furthest away from the window even though there were plenty of seats available by the window since it was rather early. I asked her if I could sit closer. She said the waitress was not there yet and it'd be another 5 minutes until she would be so I needed to wait back by the front. Why I couldn't just sit at the table for 5 minutes instead of walking all the way back to the front still boggles by mind. Fine. After about 10 minutes, she sits me one table directly in front of the table she originally seated me at. I waited 10 minutes to get 1 table closer when all the tables in front of the window are open? Wow, thanks. She said those tables were unavailable but throughout the duration I was there, only 1 table got occupied. Lies.  The waitress was very pushy. From asking what cocktail we wanted instead of "would you like a cocktail" to asking which souffle we wanted before we ordered our appetizers because she informed us it would take 40 minutes to prepare. Okay, just chill for a second. I didn't see her again until dinner was over and she placed the dessert menus in front of me and my guests without ever inquiring if we wanted to see the dessert menu. She just made assumptions about everything that night. Not once was my water glass filled. Not impressed at all with the hostesses and wait staff. Not worth it.

lH9r2rOrHYz5K2oJBhipbw.text: Really beautiful night and watching the Bellagio water fountain. We couldn't reserve a window table but after a little wait we got one for our anniversary. It's better to get a seat on the right side so u have a better view tho. Food was interesting. Especially the lobster. Cooked then baked and put back in the shell. It was good but rich! The filet was burnt on the bottom but they gladly remade it.

un12Wsmxoi201u9XgbUI0w.text: My boyfriend and I came here on Valentine's Day.  We were accompanied up the restaurant by their front guard. The kitchen view is what greets the guests once the elevator opens.    We were led to the check in counter inside. We were 15 minutes early despite the traffic that day. We waited to be seated at the bar. We both ordered Nitron beer and watched the cool bar tenders mix drinks.   At exactly 4:45pm, the usher led us to the booth near the bar where our backs would be turned away from the Strip View which we requested upon making the reservation. We understood though that the area was still occupied by guests who were there earlier and haven't finished dining. The lady brought us to an elevated portion of the restaurant that was farthest from the window that they thought had a better view. The area felt like we're outcast so we looked around and checked out the available tables.  We chose the one almost at the center of the restaurant it was a great spot. We had plenty of room around us.  Our waitress was excellent.  She had a great energy in serving and checking on us. We loved all the food except the fish dish. I wished we ordered two steaks instead for the main course. The first time I stood to use the restroom, a waiter escorted me. And when I came back, I got a new table napkin. They changed it like 3 times as many as my trips to the restroom.  It's the 2 bottles of beer and 2 glasses of water!   We took our time eating and enjoying the $480 dinner plus tip. Overall, the service was excellent and for a romantic evening like that, I would say it was worth it.   We took home with the table roses and souvenir photo.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Us at our table,  at the restaurant entrance,  at the bottom of the tower, and at the bar...
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu...
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts

4M91MuU2Quwjeo-kUuNVIw.text: The only French thing here is the snippy service. Great food, view and ambiance, but menu could use a nice reboot / refresh - a few healthy options and truly French or lighter Mediterranean options would be great. We had 2 waiters who both were a bit rude and not super helpful.   After staying at the hotel for a few days, this was the only place the service was so-so. Both the front desk, other spots inside and Mon Ami Gabi were all very helpful and friendly!

5xEyPp8Mde6ZMj_LXY-8Gg.text: We decided to celebrate the anniversary of our engagement here... Kinda fun as we got engaged here, high up on the outdoor deck:) with my wonderful guy down on one knee.  He wanted to take me to Paris France & this was the much more affordable, next best option. Maybe someday:)))  For dinner tonight, he requested a table overlooking The Bellagio fountains & they were kind enough to arrange that for us.    The hostesses were lovely, although the person who booked our reservation & took our credit card information to hold the reservation had not properly entered it in the computer... So we had No reservation. Thank goodness they were able to resolve that & our wait for a table was not terribly long. Maybe half an hour.  Accidents happen so we did not let that make our night miserable. It was weird that they did not offer to buy us a drink or even give us some sparkling water...   Michael was our waiter & he was EXCELLENT!  He has formerly been a chef on private yachts!  His French accent was charming and his service was absolutely impeccable!!! He made great suggestions & we listened to them!   My main course came out not at all as ordered... Michael, our waiter took one look at it and said. No, we will get you a new filet... I felt bad, but he had a new order re-fired immediatelyonly waited 10 minutes or so for my meal.   Foie gras was divine... Filet was perfection, Truffle sauce was delicious. My husband had the green peppercorn sauce & it was also excellent.  We ordered wild rice as a side dish to share... For me it had too much other stuff and not enough simple wild rice, but that is only my preference & it was very, very tasty.   The wine was really overpriced.  Bottles which cost $31 in the store are priced at $110.  Some bottles had bigger Mark-Ups.  The agrivating part is that there is no wine on the menu in the $40 to $50 price range.  That is crazy as there are some really nice red wines which you as a consumer can purchase for $12 to $15 per bottle, Joel Gott Cabernet, Carol Shelton Zinfandel is fabulous, Rodney Strong Merlot or Cabernet... So even with their 3 plus times mark-up, some of these wines could be offered at $40 per bottle.    Their Wine Sommelier was extremely nice & helpful. But there was not much he could do for us as their staring wine prices were so high.  I left wondering if they had a corkage fee.  Drinking a nice red should be affordable, even at the Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton.  So I was frustrated by their lack of understanding their client's needs, wants or choices which would make a dinner much better.    So here is my summary...   Both the Bread & Butter & the cleanse your palate miniature cup came very late.   3   Foie Gras was 5++++   Warm lobster salad was very delicious, but I would not consider it a salad.  Absolutely spectacular appetizer. Not sure how to grade that.  The word Salad means salad to me.   We saved room for dessert & the Salted Caramel Souffle which Michael suggested was craaaazzzy good.  The pistachio souffle was very nice.  Salted caramel is the better of the two by far IMO.  Both are a legitimate 5. Salted Caramel is a 10 if I am being integrous.   Hostesses 5 Michael our server 5 - ask for him if you want the real deal.  He is a Great Waiter!!!   Wine Sommelier 5 considering he had almost nothing to work with.   Reservations 1   Food as ordered 3 Some was & some was not.   Portion Size was Very Small 3   Wine prices 1  Bartenders were friendly, but busy so we did not get anything until we got to the table 4 View from our table 10 No music in the restaurant, so it is a bit noisy.   Both the Bread & Butter & the cleanse your palate miniature cup  came very late.    The bill was sky high... For that kind of price, I really think that everything should be Perfect!   All in all we had a great time.  I wish I could give it s 5 star, but I can't.  In fact likely it is a 3.5 considering all the ball dropping which went on.

W3fgtsb1InqVc1LRzzf-KQ.text: My family and I had an extremely disappointing experience at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. This restaurant came to my family as highly recommended. The attention to service and detail was lost at Eiffel Tower Restaurant.   We were not given our table of choice, and were told that the table was unavailable. However, throughout the course of the evening, we saw that the table was available. While we waited for an alternate table, the hostess had us awkwardly wait in the front to be moved one table up. My family and I were excited to sit near the fountains. Unfortunately, this request was not honored, despite my sister noting this request when making our reservation, and upon check-in.  We also had a negative experience with our waitress. She did not make us feel welcome, and was very forceful about ordering items off of the menu. As soon as we sat down, she was pushing us to order souffle, without even introducing the specials or asking about beverages. I understand that that souffle takes longer to make, but she asked several times. When we told her "not at this moment", she stormed off. When we had questions about the menu, she seemed exasperated and was not very helpful. Throughout the evening, she did not come check up on us. From the angle where I was sitting, I saw her talking with her co-workers while ignoring the guests. The only time when she was quick to service was giving us the bill. WOW.   When you're spending $$$$$ at a restaurant, the dining experience should be impeccable, but instead, we were left with more to be desired.

710sVsLXLXszNTBrYemWHw.text: This place is five stars  best service best food  best view over all is a must to visit when you are in Vegas food is excellent  I highly recommended this place

R6QZlIeMeGwCzW9v3HrNWA.text: Second time coming here and the food is magnificent.   Have had the steak, beef Wellington and the beef short ribs.   The potatoes gratin and green beans are delish and the pink velvet cocktail is as well.  Finished off with cream brulee.

AXITU16FNVFwTKJxn3gQpA.text: Absolutely love this place!! Staff are great and they have good service. Highly recommended

CZeNpXT7qw3UWLnD8oI7iA.text: Had an Amazing experience with my wife!   Professional and courteous staff, exceptional food!  Would go back again!

h1eUEFXrn_7I6CJVVRGG2A.text: I booked my reservation with open table and then cancelled it way before the date. The restaurant still charged me a cancellation fee. I reached out to the restaurant they asked for the information showing I canceled it. I sent them the information and never herd anything back. Beware if you make a reservation and have to cancel.

PIC1gGEvATckLhZLw8_snA.text: souffle was outstanding.  View was terrific. Service was very good.  Food passable.  For all the hype about the great french chef etc. this restaurant was disappointing. I expected to be wowed.  I was under-wowed.  no finesse and ordinary.  Too bad ... without the souffle it would have been a total no-op.

g30MJ11SxMweeTpGWvyD1w.text: The lamb was absolutely amazing and the view of our table overlooked the water garden. Service was fantastic as well

VPjeI8y-J7tE_AjXnzoxIA.text: I am upping my stars after talking to Sharon.  She invited me back to give the restaurant another try and made me feel she cares for her clients as well.
