YvjaBkQT3-3U8f0jozFwCg.text: Incredible restaurant. I went there with my wife and baby (1 year old) for our anniversary. Service was really good. They were friendly and polite at all times. Beautiful view and friendly environment. Food and drinks were amazing worth every dollar. I will recommend this place for special occasions and delicious food. It is pricy but the food and service quality is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ByLg2_i95oUKUfD2pL1iUg.text: Viva Las Vegas!!! is what I said when we walked off of the elevator half way up the Eiffel Tower to enter this restaurant. Class, style and atmosphere immediately came to mind. Dark but far from gloomy.. More like sexy but let's eat first..lol. The couples are lucky because the small tables hug the windows with the spectacular view of the strip. This is definitely the place to be is the second thought that came to mind. The third thought was, let's get to that stuffed lobster that intrigued me in the first place. Katrina G took her usual time deciding on her meal while I tapped my fingers in angst.. Lol. FINALLY she decided on the super tasty chicken dish forgoing steak two nights in a row. Again, her chicken was good, but my stuffed baked lobster tail was unchallenged! Hands down, the best meal I had in Vegas this trip and trust me, we had A LOT of meals.. Lol. The service was what you expect from a high end restaurant with an older gent dressed in a sharp tux attending to our every need.   I've been going to Vegas at least once a year for some time now. Eiffel Tower restaurant will have a standing yearly reservation after that damn lobster tail.. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner view@ Eiffel Tower!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Must have baked lobster@ Eiffel Tower!

7aquyqB05wJNnLaEq9JJaw.text: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is more flash than substance. The best thing about this place hand down is the view. Everything else is just blah.  *Reservations: They use OpenTable, so it is pretty easy to make reservations. About 2 days  prior to actual dinner, a conformation text is sent, with explicit mention of their dress code.   *Dress Code: Like others have said, what a f***** joke. Yes they did make one gentleman take off his hoodie and barrow a jacket, but other than that it was a crap shoot of what you would find. Yes, many followed it, but it was highly questionable on some  individuals that they let in during dinner service. No way in hell did their attire meet their so called dress code.  *Views- The views were stunning, there is no denying that. Many of the tables lined the windows, and depending upon your seat, you were offered a spectacular view of the Bellagio fountains and Paris Balloon.  *Gluten Free Food- They had a separate gluten free menu with a number of different options. They did also offer a tasty gluten free bread prior to dinner.   *Food - For about the amount of money per item, I'm sorry the quality didn't match up. You could go to a handful of restaurants on the strip and save half of what you spent dining here.  *Service - Attentive and friendly  For me this is really a one and done restaurant. If you promised to take someone to dinner in Paris to dine at the Eiffel Tower but didn't say that you weren't taking them to Paris, France,,,by all means, this is your way to say that you lived up to your promise.

q0Mgv5THXk7XUHibJAV1jQ.text: Wow. What a fantastic experience. Had lunch/ brunch with the girls and did it ever deliver. The champagne mimosas where a variety of flavors and well worth the price. It was yummy and strong.  Of course the view is fabulous but what I like is that the elevator opens up to the kitchen. So fun to see all the mastery taking place.

6bUhxUsm-NywS1ERMubfPg.text: Dinner with a great view!! My husband and I had dinner here and it was spectacular. We were seated right in front outlooking the water show.  Everything on the menu sounds good, we were hungry so we ordered a lot for two.  Ordered: warm main lobster /appetizer  Filet mignon  Ribeye steak Spinach mushroom /side dish Potato gratin /side dish   The rib eye was very big and could be shared. My husband did not finish it. I didn't finish my filet mignon either. I think our eyes were bigger than our stomach.  Service was great and very attentive. It was a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our dinner
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm lobster dish

O65TzJTXo5nk68ToGWf6nw.text: From the time I walked the elevator until the time me departing the service was superb. Greeted warmly by the hostess at the open kitchen and lead to our seats immediately. Of course reservations are recommended.  Greeted by our server and very well informed of the tasting menu as well as the appetizer menu.  Was provided w/ a complimentary pumpkin soup to cleanse the pallette.  For the entree I had the 22 oz ribeye w/ the bone marrow The Mrs had the rack of lamb w/ the olive oil mashed potatoes. All food was exquisite. The steak and lamb were cooked perfectly to request. The olive oil mashed potatoes were the best mashed potatoes I've ever had. Smooth, creamy, and flavorful. For dessert we finished with chocolate cake that I do not remember the name at the moment. Very rich flavor and a masterful piece of art. Petit fors were provided as a complimentary item.  Although the menu is quite pricey; if you're looking for a total elegant experience with top quality menu items; I recommend treating yourself and/or a loved one to a visit to the Eiffel Tower restaurant.  The view of the Bellagio fountain is available which is the just the cherry on top to a fine dining experience.  A wonderful experience!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu items
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocktail menu
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the fountain

a2RDTredeHDMxBZbaatq0g.text: The atmosphere, view, service and food were all amazing. The french onion soup and parmesan crusted chicken were so delicious. We will be back.

634A9FMDm6ZLMvToTDqU5A.text: I can't say enough about this place. The atmosphere, the service, the food, and the view were all top notch. I took my wife here for our anniversary, I called to reserve a table. They had the flowers and table ready to go. Our waitress was extremely nice, even took a picture for us. The food and cocktails were amazing, everything was fresh. At the end of dinner they gave us dessert and on the plate they wrote Happy Anniversary in chocolate which won me some cool points with the wife. I don't see how anyone could ever rate this place lower than 5 stars. It is pricey, but this is not a place to go if you are pinching pennies. I would highly recommend this place, especially if you are trying to set a romantic mood for something special or if you really want to let someone know that you love them. We went for dinner so the Vegas lights were an extra bonus.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our Anniversary Dinner

4u7oBQwamK4QZu4J5BIH1g.text: First visit in Mid-April for dinner! I really love the view to the strip with all the lights. We were arranged to sit in a very private corner which I really love. My boyfriend and me couldn't forget about the steak with foie gras along with the truffle sauce. We had an amazing night! Because we love it so much, we came back again for brunch the next day! We finally got a chance to sit beside the windows and looking at the Bellagio fountain. The brunch was also delicious!

5KX_l5wNV09zn1aycGOdHg.text: Went here to celebrate a birthday was sure to do the 4:30 resie to guarantee a window table. We asked if it would be possible to combine the two different tasting options because we are Pescatarians and needed substitutions for the two meat options--one of them being foie gras. Ugh! Can you imagine? Server was a tad hesitant at first, but only because he did not understand what I was asking. Once he understood, he happily agreed to ask chef. Chef, of course was eager to please with the combo tasting. It started with three different amuse bouche options, followed by a delicious scallop, and then some very tasty brussels sprouts. We ordered a Caesar salad A la carte, and they fit that into the next course. I highly recommend their Caesar salad. After that, we have the most incredible fish called char...which is a combination of salmon and trout. Yum! This was my favorite course of the tasting. After that, we had some tasty cauliflower steak and finished it all off with a cheese plate and the passionfruit souffle. We had a variety of drinks as well starting with a glass of champagne and an old-fashioned and then moved on to our favorite drink the rice as a rack, and finished the meal with their special berries-in-the-glass French version of sangria. Sorry I cannot remember the exact name. Because it was a birthday, we were super extra and got the additional photo and a rose from the bathroom.  Be aware there is a bathroom attendant. It is awesome to go somewhere that so easily could be a tourist trap, but ends up delighting you across the board. I look forward to going back and ordering the main course option of that delicious fish.

FhX5VR3zSPPiOtHDyFOokA.text: Had an amazing lunch at this place. Requested a window seat and got an amazing seat overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The food was wonderful. My kids got the chicken and waffles kids mean. It was a steal at $12. We also order the blt sandwich and it was huge! Def more than a person could eat. We also ordered the 3 course lunch. It was also delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant for lunch.

rbrVKP9wc8NSg_AkN0dFMw.text: Located inside of Paris Hotel. You take an elevator up that opens to kitchen and dinning room.  Beautiful view of Bellagio fountains. Warm foie gras was the only thing we enjoyed. The rib eye did have any seasoning. Menu was very limited. Service was good.

w20vptxdjm97ElDDx-5fHQ.text: Delicious...! Worth the $350 tab for 4 people. Okay food, good company, great awesome view of the water show at the Bellagio and just okay service. The waiter was fairly new, I can tell as he fumbled about the food and specials. But for the most part, I will *maybe* come back here. Had the beef carpaccio with capers (yum!), the grand seafood platter (oysters were really good but they also included some raw clams which were disgusting!) but the lobster and giant shrimps made up for it,  filet mignon (just okay), duck confit (okay) and smoked chicken (which was dry). Although, I must admit that those little puff parmesan little pastries they served as appetizers were delish!...

uswWOWVX6b2PHl-1bEewGA.text: By far one of the best places to go in vegas!  The views of bellagio and the strip was awesome!  The food was great, and the service was superb!      Definitely a good idea to make reservations, this place gets packed!  We started off with the cold foie geas and blue cheese souffle, both were decent but not outstanding.  The blue cheese souffle reminded me of bread pudding, it tasted okay but wasnt anything special.  The cold foie gras was a tad salty even with bread, I think the seared foie gras might have tasted better.   The bread selection was good, I liked the french baguette.  Our bread came out cold, so the waiter gladly brought us hot bread on the spot!        My friends ordered entrees of salmon, sea bass, duck breast, and lamb chops.  The seafood dishes were okay, nothing to rave about.  The grilled duck breast was excellent!  The grilled lamb chops were by far the best ive ever had!  It came out tender, juicy, and had no gamey flavor at all!  It had the texture of a filet mignon and taste of a prime rib, which was quite unique...definitely a great entree!        We ordered two souffles, a pistachio and banana nut...both were great!  The souffles came out hot, super light, perfect texture..by far the best souffles ive ever had!  The banana nut tasted excellent!  The pistachio souffle was also unique, both were very tasty!  I'd come back here just for the souffles..and they are so light that you can eat two of them by yourself!     Overall, the service here is excellent, all the waiters are super nice and constantly check up to make sure everything is satisfying.  The food was perfect, but the portions were on the small side.  The souffles are amazing, definitely a must-have!  Prices here a little high, especially for such small portions, but everything was cooked perfect and presented nicely!  This would be a perfect spot to take a date, nice cozy and dimly lit place with a romantic feel, and great views of the strip, including the bellagio water show.

9jj-07_NY9j2jQpyP_zxVw.text: I have to say the view from above was fantastic. We (my fiancee and I)  had dinner here too so we have the night view. The food and service was great, but when you think of a pricey restaurant like this the place would be a little more quiet/ peaceful, but nope it was loud. They also don't offer substitutions as well...

Ga_KuLC7-WwSbvV4u0e6XA.text: Touristy, with a great view if you get one of the two top tables at the window. Otherwise the food ( just ok ) and service (rushed) do not justify the steep prices including the mark up on the wine list. If you are going to drop $400.00 on dinner there are better places to do it in Vegas.

RRCgIohWjaeGtlbpcYJBbw.text: My husband & I had an amazing time. The view, the service and the food!!! Maravilloso!!! My husband & I love trying new restaurants and out of all of our trips to Las Vegas we have to say this has been the best. If you want romantic. This is the place.   The service was top notch. Our server made sure we understood the menu and was accommodating to all of our needs. He was very professional and nice.   The food is on the pricey side, but its all worth it!!! The souffle is a must.   The most perfect ending was when the server came out with a little dessert and in chocolate writing it said "Happy Birthday" I did not expect it, but made the night extra special.

LXrj7mTb0lGOO12wUbiKcg.text: Invited to join old friends for a birthday dinner.  The setting and view from the restaurant were excellent and got better once the sun set over the mountains.  Food was terrific and the service top rate!  All capped when dessert was served; souffles were great, but the champagne passion fruit merengue dish was SUPERB!!  A definite "recommend" for those who enjoy great food, ambiance and service...We will return!

ALiND9v5GKrdB8GsSFh8PA.text: My boyfriend and I were super late and kept pushing back our reservation 15, 30, 45 minutes later and the staff were incredibly accommodating. They didn't have to be, but it just goes to show you how immaculately professional and courteous this place is.  When we finally arrived, we waited no more than 10 minutes to be seated at a window seat with the most luscious view of the Bellagio fountains. The hostess, our server and even the random guy that came around to give us more bread rolls and cheese balls were all kind, polite and never once rushed us throughout our entire 3 hour (!!!) dinner.   If you do decide to come here I highly recommend the tasting menu. While a few of the dishes were quite forgettable, the the view and the service more than made up for it. We had:  - Trio of appetizers/les amuses bouche: The mushroom custard was incredible. - Warm lobster soup: The soup itself was lovely, but it was covered it what I can only guess was a spring roll wrapper. Curious, indeed. - Halibut: Good, but meh. - Roasted rack of lamb with tarragon jus: Highlight of the evening. The lamb was tender with a slightly crispy "crust."  - Camembert wrapped in poached pears: Seriously disgusting. I like cheese, but that combo was hard to stomach. - I had the Grand Marnier souffle and he had the pistachio souffle. Both we exquisite--both exhibited a delicate taste through the slightly eggy custard texture. The server suggested the chocolate souffle which we will definitely try the next time.

s6QQ32m9wKBj2Bbxxta9ow.text: 4.5 stars. The food was just amazing! I had some club sandwich and it was just wonderful! The view was just amazing and worth the extra cost for the food! I was hoping the water show across the street would be going on during the day, but no dice.  The staff was very friendly and had no problem getting my lady friend a shaw since she was cold. You take an elevator up too the restaurant, which is really cool. I recommend going in the day time if you want to save some cash. Probably a great place to take your lady to if you want to be romantic. Would not recommend doing this on a first date though as it would probably be a bit much. Minus half a star for SLOW food. I was thinking to myself, "Is the chef cooking the food in Paris or what?" :-)

DXcEnROg6q2a09HKOIqDLw.text: For lunch it had the best view, service, and price I've seen in Vegas thus far. i had some kind of steak sandwich and it was to die for. Can't remember the name and it's killing me.

WERjCbYYJFXUb3y9-lmbFg.text: Yesterday, my wife and I went there to celebrate one year anniversary. I made reservation and requested  table by the window with the view on Bellagio's fountain. I also asked if they can put roses on the table. When we arrived, everything was organized and roses were there. Joshua was our waiter. I have never seen anyone provide such high level of service. In Seattle, we ate at Canlis, Rover's, and some other expensive restaurants, but we have never seen anyone come close to Joshua's level of service. This guy was amazing. We took his advice and recommendation and ended up being extremely happy at the end of the night. Food was amazing. Wine was great. Their dessert is so good you may experience orgasm. This restaurant will not disappoint you. It is expensive, but it is worth every single penny. Right there and then, we decided to make it our annual tradition to come to the Eiffel Tower every year on March 8. Thank you Joshua, thank you Eiffel Tower!

zTiXbyPaxY5A2t-wOl3Cng.text: This restaurant is very upscale. As you take the elevator up to the restaurant, you can't help but feel excited. The elevator doors open up to the kitchen which was different. You'd expect the kitchen to be in the back, but here it was the first main attraction. Very clean and "white" themed. It was definitely the cleanest looking kitchen I've ever seen! The decor is simple and not overly done as it is made to make you feel like you are in the Eiffel Tower overlooking the view. Nothing fancy on the walls since it is fine dining. The booths are very comfortable and seat a part of 4 just perfect. You get the view of the water fountains of Bellagio every 15-20 mins or so. Although I would have loved to see the setting sun from there. The service was a bit off. Our water seemed like he didn't like out of towners (the again, who does?). He was very short with us and had a sarcastic tone. That's fine, but we were expecting a 4 star restaurant service. The meal itself was so-so. I expected it to be perfect as we were supposed to feel like we were in France, but the choices weren't that creative. Probably the best part of the dinner was the Raspberry Souffle with vanilla sauce. Mmmm. It was a good one time experience. The ambiance screamed out of towners, not really romantic.

a8dH7vHi04yqDJXghwMXiQ.text: The best thing about this place is it's great view...had a nice seat facing the Bellagio fountain, that made it more romantic for me and my boyfriend. Food was great and my lovey especially enjoyed their chopped lamb. The best part was the mouth-watering desert: the souffle!!! Excellent date!!!

onTqQQQVXX5D8T6HpNPY6w.text: The view and the food are among the best... second perhaps only to the miX at Mandalay. While I had eaten a very expensive and paid for by a business partner dinner here a few years ago, this time I opted for a much more reasonable (by Vegas standards) lunch with my wife. She couldn't have been happier with the view of the Bellagio fountains, and I couldn't have been happier with my lunch of foie gras with duck prosciutto and butternut squash soup.

Xqa3_Mj_fGJDDVXPgGUibA.text: pretty great for the price plus view, like everyone else has said. the menu is very detailed, which i prefer. i had a good sense of what my food would be, and the server was helpful in describing things i was less familiar with (like pheasant).  The amuse of cheese puffs (whose fancy french name escapes me right now) was perfect - light with a hint of fennel (i think it was fennel) and great.  Crispy Michigan farmstead Artisanal Camembert with Almond Apricot Petite Salad was our appetizer - would've been better wrapped in puff pastry instead of wonton skin, but it was a great bit of cheese and the accompaniments were sized and paired well.  I had braised short ribs as my main, and my goodness were they rich.  the fat hadn't quite melted down the way you'd want it to, so i found myself eating around it a lot, but the portion was big enough that i felt like i got plenty of meat, despite leaving quite a bit. the chestnut spaetzle was probably fine - i didn't care for the texture, but i think that's more me than how they cooked it.  my friend and co-worker loved her surf and turf - i tried the turf offering and it was definitely among the butterier, tastier tenderloins of my recent memory.    Chocolate souffle was a little much richness on top of everything else, but somehow, we managed to eat it all :) the coffee was also rich and fantastic, and came with those raw sugar lumps that i just want to dump out of the bowl and into my pocket for later.  the bill was not unreasonable for what we had once you take the view and service into account.  very lovely meal.

8cIVTMoXbvubNCAbhGo38w.text: Great restaurant. The staff were excellent. We appreciated the help of the Sommelier, who recommended a great wine at at reasonable price. I highly recommend going. Of note though is the noise level; we expected a lower amount of noise at this type of restaurant, but this is typical of everywhere we go in Vegas and the place was packed. A hint would be to request a window table when making reservations or a booth if in a larger group. We were stuck out in the middle and given the business that evening we were in a high activity area. I highly recommend giving this place a try especially if you love good food.

KZOwlQMbdPsur4WTB5MccA.text: A very wonderful restaurant experience can be had at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant located at the Paris Las Vegas Resort.  High quality food with beautiful views of the Bellagio Fountains in a romantic atmosphere.  If you're thinking inexpensive eats, this is not your place.  Reservations are necessary, and you are paying for good food as well as prestige.  Absolutely enjoyed the Foie Gras, Braised Bing Cherries, Alsace Spice cake appetizer as well as the Beef Wellington cooked to perfection.  A highlight of my Vegas vacation.

c_YCiPxV6OtVeQd_d2NrZg.text: Went up here just for a few drinks.  One of my friends wasnt dressed appropriately and had to put on pants and a jacket that they have at the bottom of the elevator for such situations.  It made the whole thing sooooooooo funny that it didnt even matter that a round of 4 drinks was more than $50 - the view was awesome

Lwt8AE-uHk_1P6dAUFpv2g.text: Absolutely one of the best meals I've ever had. We were there for our 4 year anniversary and the staff made it an unforgettable experience. Everything couldn't have been better. Great appetizers, dinner was perfect, and the raspberry souffle was to die for. Great views of the Bellagio water show.

3Q4EVr3sXiKW0TtXfjN5gg.text: We went to the Eiffel Tower restaurant on a whim...and my assumption was that we'd be paying for a view and not much else.  I'm glad I was wrong - The Eiffel Tower restaurant ended up being one of the top overall meals I've had in a long time. We were seated right up against the window overlooking the Bellagio Fountains.  Seating (even if you have reservations) happens on the fly when you arrive based on available tables.  So try to get there early if you want a window table.  View was everything you'd expect.  Guys - you cant go wrong taking your ladies here just for this amazing view - very romantic.  The breads they serve you were all top notch, along with a couple of appetizers we had brought out.  I ordered a filet and crabcake combo...my steak was perfect and the crabcake was flawless.  All the sides we ordered were also excellent.  We also ordered duck, which was cooked perfectly, and seasoned just right.  We couldnt fit in dessert, so I dont know what that was like here.   Service was impeccable and truly beyond ordinary.  Felt like our minds were being read the entire meal.   Bottom line:  yes it's expensive, yes it has a nice view, and yes,the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is absolutely worth it.

kCNs4O6mBgi9Id6C6uVQIg.text: I came for lunch during restaurant week. I found the menu to be very limited. However, the meal was delicious. I asked if I could get a vegetarian plate instead of the flat iron steak dinner and the chef happily obliged. Oddly, for me, the things I enjoyed the least were the complimentary mushroom flan (blah, only was to describe it) and the baked puffed dinner roll (lackluster, not a french baked treat I was looking forward to). The appetizer for the menu was a small salad and a nice size portion of spinach strussel. That was very good. My lunch entree (the one the chef made special for me) was crepes stuffed with artichokes and mushrooms and onions with a marinara sauce and basil pesto (?). It was very tasty. The dessert was also very good. I didnt think I would like basil flavored ice cream but it was refreshing and hit the spot after lunch. Overall I enjoyed my meal but I dont think it's a place I would come back to. For what they charge, there are much better places that I'd rather go to.

gtjqZJ6ixax5MlcHGiLouA.text: NY steak is a 5, best I have every had!!!!    BUT everyone's steak was overcooked a little, we sent 1 back and everything else we had was average 2-3 stars.  Appetizers, soup, salad, deserts etc.. just ok.  However, I would go back with the mindset of I am just going in to order a steak only for a quick bit to eat and not a long dinner.  I agree with some of the other reviews the dress code is lame but I called ahead and asked if they had one and came prepared.  View at night is 5 stars!!

M3RxCFmSEOYcdin-zCI8Xg.text: Very nice upscale french restaurant with an excellent view of the Bellagio fountain.  Wait staff was attentive, and food was just excellent.   APPETIZERS: I am a big fan of foie gras and couldn't help ordered their cold foie gras torchon and the warm duck foie gras as appetizers just to try them out.  Turned out both were excellent, though, this time the foie gras torchon easily won over the warm foie gras in both texture and flavor.   Spring greens salad was fresh and crisp.  Escargots was short of spectacular, not recommended.    ENTREES: Muscovy Duck Breast - haven't had such tender and well prepared duck breast for a long time.  The dish was done just right.   Aged NY Steak - Perfect at medium rare.  great taste and portion for any carnivore out there.   DESSERTS: Souffle, souffle, souffle - excellent, excellent, excellent! MUST ORDER! Had two more deserts but can't remember what they called, one was Flambe Meringue with sorbet inside, and one had two crisp almond thins sandwiched some fresh cream and raspberries.  I was surprised their desserts was light and not overly sweet that I think most guys will enjoy them as well.   High recommended if you'd like to spend a romantic evening with someone special.

tOxcFOaJ3c9gvyOmR4KIbg.text: I surprised my wife by taking her here for our 15th wedding anniversary on 6/24/2014.  What a great restaurant.  They sat us by the windows looking over the fountain.  Our server, David C., was very nice and treated us with respect.  I ordered the Seared Scallops and the Halibut.  My wife ordered the Lobster and Pinot Salmon with the Potato Gratin.  Everything was cooked to perfection.  The Caramel Souffle was phenomenon.  The supervisor, Mr. Lyle Tolhurst, came to our table to congratulate us.  Very nice guy.  Thank you for everything.  I will definitely come back and will bring my entire family.  A night that I will always remember.

4Riy91EKK_pkWoyFhoPfxg.text: Went here for lunch.  We were seated by the window and had excellent views of the strip.  I ordered a shrimp, lobster, crab salad.  It was just what I wanted.    Great dinning room Good bread Good food and spirits  The Eiffel Tower Restaurant was a nice experience.

B8TMGlZA95UwaGc0HsbiaA.text: One of the best meals we've had anywhere, even if it was a bit overpriced.  Service was also excellent.

oYIswhvJFG__D_yVeQqCcA.text: My boyfriend and I dined here on March 18 to top off our Vegas vacation and they did not disappoint.   I had read a review on Yelp about contacting Jennifer (manager) beforehand about specifics on our reservation. We requested for a table with a great view of the Bellagio Fountains, and when we got there, our table had the best view in the house. (There is a picture of it on their facebook page--it's almost the very first table in front of the fountains).  Jennifer also stopped at our table and she really knows how to make sure that a dinner becomes an experience that we will never forget. I honestly got so thrilled with the atmosphere of the restaurant that everything else that came with it made the night perfect. At first, I was a bit nervous about contacting the manager and making a request since it is a popular spot and almost everyone wants a great table, but it really doesn't hurt to ask :)   Tips: get a table around 530 to 6pm-ish because the restaurant is not packed when we got there--plus, that was right around sunset so we had a nice palette of colors to watch; the scallop/oxtail appetizer was perfect and fresh; and the chocolate souffle just melts in your mouth, it's really worth waiting 20 minutes for dessert :)   This is my very first review here on Yelp, I just thought I would shower this restaurant with compliments because they deserve it. Like I said, it wasn't just the amazing french dinner, but the whole thing was about experiencing the best customer service, a romantic ambiance, and the best view of the Strip. Thank you so much Jennifer and the rest of the staff at Eiffel Tower Restaurant!

Cvpw0TWfEMkuQq-va5-WSw.text: My girlfriend and I went here for dinner. I was worried that it would be too touristy but left quite pleased. I was nervous about small portions but that was not the case. The food was good but slightly overpriced. Standouts were the lyonnaise salad and grand mariner souffle. The service was amazing. Our waitress Michelle and the sommelier was very nice and helpful. They really helped make the meal. I am taking off half a star for the prices and another half for the dress code policy. I was really disappointed that they didn't enforce the dress code. People were there in t shirts and jean which took away from the ambiance a bit.

CHcVUedcLgum2tB6NeX1EA.text: The rack of lamb was great!  Also, the view from where we were sitting was breathtaking! The Bellagio fountains, the Bellagio sign just everything...it was my anniversary and I'm so happy that we went to this place.  The staff were attentive to every need. ;-)

E484VVs1Qu62XZJsnsC_bw.text: This place is great for a romantic dinner.  If there's just two, request a table by the windows.  We had the most amazing view of the Bellagio fountains going off during our dinner!  The food was great, too.  Nice-sized portions and great service.  Huge but expensive wine list.  Definitely a bit expensive but worth a splurge.

5N9kiek-H4YYEGoXAKrzEQ.text: My fiance treated me to a romantic dinner during our trip to Las Vegas. We stayed at the Paris Hotel so we decided to try the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. He made reservations on OpenTable.com. This restaurant requires a credit card for reservations and if canceled they will charge $50 to your cc. However, if you need to make changes you can call the restaurant directly rather than going through OpenTable. We were seated next to the floor-to-ceiling window that boasted a beautiful view of Bellagio's water show. VERY romantic. We started off with a bottle of rose champagne. Their wine list is spectacular, it's more like a book. After flipping through 10+ pages I decided to go back to the front and picked a bottle. =P We also wanted an order of fresh oysters on the half shell but the restaurant did not receive any 'good quality' oysters that day so they weren't available. HIS: Sauteed Veal Medallions with Braised Vegetables & Wild Mushrooms = 4 stars HERS: Filet Mignon with Lemon Parsley Butter Sauce = 4 stars SHARED: Potato Gratin = 2 stars Chocolate Souffle = 5 stars My filet mignon was cooked to perfection and paired well w/the lemon parsley butter sauce. It was much bigger than I expected and even though my fiance had a few bites, I still couldn't finish it. I tried his dish and the veal medallions were tender and soft. Very delectable sauce w/veggies too. The side of Potato Gratin was reasonably priced at $9 but it was below average. My version of this dish is 10x better, I'm not kidding. To end the meal, we went with a Chocolate Souffle and it was absolutely divine!! They had many versions of the Souffle, such as: Banana Souffle, Grand Marnier Souffle, Pistachio Souffle, and a couple more that escape my mind. Service was top-notch. From the moment we got on the elevator to the moment we left. 5+ STARS for great customer service & attentiveness. ON A SIDE NOTE: we returned to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant the next evening to have drinks at the bar. They have a cocktail called "Eiffel Affair" and at $20 a pop it was worth every penny! It resembled a sangria except that it was sparkling and 100x better. It is also mixed with Stoli Blueberi which gives it a nice kick. MUST TRY!

6oT6NQZcS2PngVmlmEfQOQ.text: Monday night. Service overall was 1 star. The host at the elevator was friendly. The rest of the staff was neutral to unfriendly, specially the receptionist. Water service and bread service came once, Bread was not stale but cold, (four varieties though). Waiter came twice. Appetizer came promptly but food took 50 minutes. Fish looked slightly over done. The overall experience costing well over $250 was by far bellow par.

aVE7Y43UCMaxkEzEZoHHQg.text: Best food I have ever had with the best view of Las Vegas!

dLK7k-oL_RZicexB9Oh1wg.text: We don't get the hype.  Really.  We have some experience with fine dining and it did not blow us out of the water.  Maybe our expectations were high because it was recommended.  Maybe we're getting snobby.  Who knows?!  Yeah, the service was good, the food good, the view nice, but for $400 for 2 (with tip)--- you expect that at the very least.  But to end on a positive note, my highlight was the foie gras on my filet mignon and my hubby loved his chocolate souffle.

kiadwS6qXGAu9UIPkw47LA.text: Well I just have to say that while at the height of my event's chosen venue years ago, red interior motif cozied up with the satisfactory service, tasteful cuisine and a spectacular view overlooking the famed Bellagio Fountains and the Las Vegas 'Strip' of which the view was a gratification in the elevated area for the private party. Upon initial tour of the venue by the ever gracious event hostess who showed me around the restaurant and the cuisine art room (my very own preferred reference to any "kitchen") prior to booking the date of event, I was informed of a table that just may leave you breathlessly full of romance and love...a table for two, that is for the romantic in each of us... Alas, it is mentioned in a recent February 2013 article yellowpages.com/news/foo... Be surely fall in love, your hearts a-flutter and St. Valentine would sure be elated, ooohlala. Whether or not you dine by your self, with someone special, with friends or a much bigger company to entertain, it exudes Amour!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. having a party at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant...memorable!

u4IAMTxMkw8298dtsTRREQ.text: We really enjoyed our whole experience!  From the friendly greeting all the way to the special birthday desert for my wife.    The experience: As soon as you get off the elevator you have a view of the kitchen and are greeted by hostesses.  We requested, and were seated at a window seat that overlooked the Bellagio fountain - amazing views!  The waiter and staff addressed us by our name and were very attentive and helpful.  The flavors were excellent - we enjoyed a spring salad with hints of grapefruit, cream of English pea soup, the halibut was outstanding, and the filet was cooked perfectly with a delicious red wine sauce adding to the flavor. The side of potatoes au gratin were delicious as well.  The chef sent us a beautifully presented chocolate desert (kind of something between pudding and ice cream) it was rich and delicious.  We highly recommend this place and will definitely return if we come back to Vegas

zORIuCfsvHnYykA7BYGTyg.text: There are soooo many restaurants in Vegas.... Do yourself a favor and skip Eiffel Tower. Filet should be buttery and not the texture of a top sirloin or a leather shoe. Potatoes were perfectly cold. There were so many employees and noone seemed to be organized. Try Strip Steak

BfQQ_wNcJ20bGQS-rKCHMQ.text: We live here now from SF and know better to go to such "dine with a view" places but, the reviews seemed on the contrary to this belief. Sadly, they lived up to an overpriced tourist trap. My husband booked a lovely window seat for our Anniversary. They knew it was our special day but, never acknowledged it at any point during our experience. The service and food was mediocre for the price point. I specifically told the waitress my husband did not like fish especially anchovies but, reassured me the Caesar salad was very mild with hints of anchovies (We are both well aware there are trace amounts in the dressing already). When the salad arrived, it have several large pieces of anchovies on top. We had to flag down our waitress and get a basic salad replacement. I choose the fish which was underwhelming but, I was hungry. We had to search for our waitress several times (asking other servers and bussers) to get simple things like refills and more bread. The chocolate souffle tasted like non sweetened cocoa fluffy cardboard. To top it all off, there was a crying baby near us the entire time and a gentleman on his phone next to us. On our way out, we saw several kitchen staff just standing around staring at people entering and exiting the elevator; no "hello", "goodbye" or "thank you". I've lived in Paris and this place is an embarrassment to the people and food of France.

DiMYjrDz0W2b_DHRbtUeVA.text: Exquisite! Marvelous! Magnifique!   This was truly a night on the town, a dinner du jour, a supremely satisfying and sensational dining experience, and one of the top 5 dinners of my life!  We came for my boyfriend's birthday dinner and enjoyed, strike that, SAVORED every minute of it. It was truly divine. The view. The Bellagio fountains. The ambiance. The drinks. The wine. The chocolate souffle with cascading chocolate. The cauliflower puree to cleanse the palette. The complimentary birthday chocolate mousse for my boyfriend on his special day :) The over-the-top service on all levels. The silver platter to carry our wine glasses to our dining table. The romance. The etiquette. The savory flavors melting on your tongue. This is culinary heaven folks!  From the dramatic entrance by way of the elevator, stepping out to a hostess waiting to greet you, seeing the immaculate, sparkling kitchen, to the adjustment your eye makes from the bright kitchen to the romantic dimly-lit sunken dining room with the sensational view, it was wonderful from start to finish. Not to mention THE FOOD! It was all fabulous. Utterly fabulous. While expensive (we rarely eat at these prices and totally splurged this time), it was worth every penny and I would have even paid more! We left a huge tip.  What a pleasure to dine here. We loved it so much.  As a same-sex couple, it was 100% welcoming and full of love for us. Unlike other establishments where we have felt judged or awkwardness in general, they were warm and welcoming, treating us with the respect we deserve (just like any other couple or family is want to expect).  I recommend the Eiffel Tower Restaurant extremely extremely highly. It was sensational.  A trip to Vegas isn't complete without a dinner here. Go, enjoy, and revel in its magnificence!

zw98oMzbTwmoqjhgRjfeGg.text: Holy CRAPOLA!  Ate here again on April 17, 2014.  The food was just as good if not better....but damn the service was impeccable.  I would drink some of my tea and would think to myself...."hmmm...I think I need more tea" and a guy would be there with another bottle before I even ask for it.  I would think to myself "hmmm.....it would be nice for a little taste compliments of the chef" and whamo...right in front of me.  I have no idea what it was that they gave me...some infused something or other...but it was amazing...and free....and compliments of the chef.  Then we were prepared to order dinner.  I had the snapper before so I didn't want to get that again...although it was amazing.  I wanted to expand and try something new.  I saw Arctic Char on the menu.  Strange name....Arctic = Cold and Char = Hot.  I have no idea what type of fish this will be....and once again the waiter says "you probably are not familiar with Arctic Char....it  tastes a little like a trout and salmon mixed together."  Well I be damned if it didn't taste exactly like a trout and salmon mixed together.  It was great.  The chef even seared the skin to make it crispy...which is extremely hard to do without drying out the fish.  Then dessert time.  I ordered the creme brule and my fiance ordered some banana thing.  She asked me if it would be good...and I just said "come on...stop asking stupid questions...of course it will unless you are allergic to bananas."  We inquired about the gelato briefly with the waiter and he told me the gelato is great.  I still wanted my creme brule and she wanted the banana...so gelato will have to wait I guess.  Guess what!?  They send us out this big painter's pallete dish full of one scoop gelato flavors...about 10 of them or so...as a compliment for visiting the restaurant again!  Awesome right?    I am not a high-roller by any stretch of the imagination, and the restaurant is not affiliated with Caesar's entertainment.  I imagine they rent or have purchased the space in the Eiffel Tower.  What they do is they make great food and have great service.  I will say they have the greatest service...and that is a FACTUAL statement.  I have visited other fine dining restaurants in Vegas and elsewhere and they cannot hold a candle to this place.  They treat you as though you are the only customer...but they do not treat you as a customer.  They treat you as a friend that appreciates great food and they know how to deliver.  Without a doubt this is the place I will always visit when in Vegas.

zCrOWZ_3yCvfYjbOZUIfQA.text: THIS RESTAURANT IS AMAZING!! At first I was a little worried to eat here. I knew I would be so disappointed if the food wasn't good for the prices. I was so wrong. I have been coming to vegas for years but always ate at buffets or just fast food. Being it was my 30th birthday me and my boyfriend wanted something romantic.   We called the restaurant to make a reservation for the next day. They were very polite over the phone. The next day we were running late for dinner so we called to let them know. When we got to the elevator we were greeted then getting off the elevator a girl walked us over to check in. The lady who checked us in was very nice and told me happy birthday. We were seated at the window with a view of the cosmo hotel and the water show. It was beautiful.  Our waiter came over and gave us the menu and asked if we wanted water. We also ordered a glass of wine. When we were waiting for our food they brought us bread and butter and something that was white I think he said cauliflower something lol. It was amazing. For our appetizer we got the pork belly. OMG it was so amazing! Then we got our food. I ordered the roasted farm raised chicken and my boyfriend ordered the beef wellington. They were perfect portions for us and so amazing. The staff was very very attentive without being too much. They kept filling my water which was nice being I was a little hungover from the night before. At the end of the night they gave me a chocolate mouse that had happy birthday written on the plate. Everything from the staff, the views and the food was perfect. I'm so beyond happy with my experience there and will definitely be coming back for another occasion. Our bill was $195 and worth every penny. Thank you for making my birthday perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary birthday dessert
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table

GSl0cez7oHX81OVJyBNF1A.text: The view from the restaurant is amazing. The service was pretty good, but the food was on another level. A very good restaurant for someone who wants to explore

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lydTnewGewE72h1JyjV9BA.text: Been a while since I've been to this restaurant, but I remembered that I never reviewed it.  The food was good...I mean it's a steak house so it's gotta be decent right. The reason why I gave it only 2 stars was because of my meal. I ordered the rack of lamb. It was seasoned well and very tasty. Problem was they gave TWO small lollipop ribs!! The dish cost 48$ and they give you 2! On top of that, one of the lollipops was mostly fat! I made the mistake of not complaining. It was literally a few bites of meat for fifty bucks...so not worth it! I've been to steak houses in NYC and other places and they always give 4-6 lollipops. If I didn't have that bad experience I would've given them a better rating

9y1CxCWrenoTVA4BrKvmoA.text: I have now eaten here twice and both times my experience was fantastic!!  To start: if you come here, be prepared to spend a good chunk of money... especially if you plan to have any wine.    I think the prices on the wine list is what really made me want to run out backwards, but the quality of wine is absolutely fantastic!!  Not sure if the wine we had was really worth the $120 a bottle, but it's one of those special occasion/once in a lifetime meals.  And the wine was phenomenal and didn't give me a headache the next day :)  The food is absolutely amazing!! Get anything on the menu.  It doesn't matter.  It will knock you off your feet!  I love the amuse-bouche that is included with your meal.    The service was impeccable, as was to be expected.  I liked the pace the wait staff made the dinner flow: not too fast, not too slow.  Make sure to get the chocolate souffle!! You will thank me later.  I've only had chocolate souffle a few times before and this was by far the best desert I've ever had... EVER!  They serve the souffle with a side of chocolate sauce that gets poured into the middle of the souffle.  The souffle drank up the sauce like a sponge!  Lastly, make sure you get a seat by the window.  The Bellagio fountain goes off every 15 minutes and provides a fantastic backdrop for a fantastic meal.  So, overall... make this a special occasion night (if you have any money left when you're in Vegas) and enjoy!

8MbNl4gBnDuyanhBbn5qkA.text: A beautiful dining experience! The food was perfect and the view and atmosphere are unparalleled by any other place I've been to on the strip. Very expensive! My boyfriend and I went for a special date night so we justified our spending. However if you're going with kids or just want a casual meal I wouldn't recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Date night in Paris (kind of)

qnoMgZTgIx-5cgkaD5kacA.text: Gorgeous view. While the Paris is not my favorite hotel in Vegas, the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is a must. We were in Vegas celebrating my friends 21st and she called last minute on a Saturday, and they managed to squeeze our party of five in. As a tip - the Eiffel Tower restaurant overlooks the Bellagio water show, so request a table where you can see the show (for couple's these tables must be booked months in advance). Impeccable service and my filet was top notch, when in Vegas again I will definitely return.

5jhAhSoVqADggYeyQjpMrA.text: Went for my first time last week. For the most part, it was very good. My table had the chefs tasting menu for 135.00 per person. Everything was delicious and even though the servings weren't huge, we left satisfied and full. I had the chocolate plate for dessert and it was amazing! The service was very good. We never felt like we were waiting too long, or not long enough. We had a table right along the fountains, the view was amazing. The only disappointment I had was being charged 16 dollars for tea and espresso. I guess it was my mistake for not asking if it was complementary, but I have never been to a fine dining restaurant where I am paying 300+ for two people and having to pay for tea and coffee. Oh well, will skip it next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Plate
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasting Menu

CDY8qXi67lrhv9BGfIT5pw.text: Go here for the view, but don't expect the best meal of your life.  View was SPECTACULAR, but food was just ok.  I understand everyone and their brother are trying to get a window seat when they check in, but the receptionist could be a little more friendly.  Our wait staff were very attentive, though.  Go early and hang out in the bar.

z08saDJC3t0_NnLcJd4Ohg.text: Wonderful view. I love that when you sit at the edge of the room, facing out the window, your table is faced towards the window! They are so smart. I was so excited to be able to see the Bellagio fountains go on right as we sat down and saw it twice more after that, so I guess we were there for an hour and a half. (the only bad thing about our meal... it took so long to get our food).  We came here for breakfast for our anniversary. First they give you a corn thing almost like a pudding, but it was sweet and a nice touch. We were also given small bread puffs that were delicious! I had the souffle which was really good. It was a little bit hard at the bottom, seemed like a croissant type of thing. I really loved the top though, very light and delicious. The egg popped just perfectly over it all. It doesn't look very big but it was quite filling! Boyfriend had eggs Benedict. That was pretty good too, but how can that be bad at a high class restaurant? I had a strawberry lemonade that tasted like strawberries crushed in my cup. It was very strong and not very watery so it was gone real fast. I would not order that again... not worth 7 bucks.  At the end, we had some chocolate flutes rolled in powdered sugar and they weren't too sweet with dark chocolate on the inside. They also brought out a nice chocolate pudding out for our anniversary which was really nice. This place is very nice and romantic!! The service here is great! Constantly filling waters and making sure everything is okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. anniversary dessert
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. eggs Benedict
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Souffle

SMBTEE63FT7ZHmIo6dXmsQ.text: When dining on the strip, your options are limited to, buffets, celebrity chef restaurants and large tourist traps that are ridiculously overpriced and well.... just shitty.  I honestly expected the same of Eiffel Tower after my last stint here in Vegas at Le Cirque.  I HATED that restaurant.  Ugh... The food was astonishingly bad and the service well... Let me put it this way, I was about to get all Mayweather on it's ass.  Anyway... Moving on...  The name alone screams TOURIST TRAP  but don't let that fool you.  Once you hit the elevator on the first floor, you're greeted by a young lady whom then leads you to the restaurant floor where the doors open to an impressive open kitchen.   Once you step out, you are greeted with cheerful faces that lead you to a window table, overlooking the water shows of Bellagio.  For a minute, you might forget how cheesy this all is and actually enjoy all the twinkling lights of this faux city.  Starting from the amuse bouche to the entree, I loved every morsel.   I'd highly suggest sticking with the NY Strip.  It was just divine.  This steak was my 2nd favorite of all time, after Mastro's BH.  Perfectly charred and beautifully bloody.  Just the way I like it.  Don't bother with sauces.  This beauty doesn't have anything to hide.  Also a must is the Blue Cheese Souffle.  TRUST ME, you'll want to lick the plate.  What really surprised me was the service.  In Vegas, you don't expect this kind of 5 star treatment.  Most places here treat you like cattle, even the $$$$ restaurants.  They don't give 2 shits about you because they've got a hundred other diners to take your place, but not here.  Our waiter would magically appear whenever we needed anything but was never intrusive.  The staff truly seems to appreciate their jobs.  It was never "stuffy".  From the front desk, to the bussers, to your waiter, they all serve you with a smile.  A very comfortable, beautiful setting with a sincere appreciation for fine dining.  I go to Vegas about twice a year on business and Eiffel Tower will surely be where you find me on every trip.

vP9KXR89U1mjAV4ING6Fvw.text: Great restaurant. We had a nice quiet table over looking the Bellagio pond, so the evening water shows were very scenic. We had the preset menu, so you got to sample lots of dishes and you were not over stuffed when finished. Our Captain was Sebastien...he and his crew were awesome!

QFLxt4IXMkHegzndaEBdIg.text: Beautiful location and view.  My mother in law had the cream of onion soup and the stuffed French toast. Both were amazing.  I had the foie gras appetizer and it was very creamy.  Service was top notch and the crusty bread can't be beat anywhere!

1_6o0-uifeafhEIvVLmR1g.text: My fiance took me here to celebrate my finishing grad school.  I was so excited for this place and thought we would have a quiet, romantic meal looking over the strip.    We know it was going to be expensive so the sticker shock wasn't as bad for us.  We each ordered a main dish, a side, and 1 drink.  This was about $75 each person.  We passed on sweets because we were both full.    The food was really good and my wine was delicious. The view was good.  We were sitting to the side against the window so had great views.    My biggest complaint was that the tables were small.  I felt very cramped.  When I went to stand up I felt that I was hitting everything/anybody around me.  I also felt like I was sitting on top of the person at the table next to me.  I know they do this to maximize guests who can be there at the same time but I felt it took away from the ambiance of the restaurant/experience.

I_GGeyTOEFuIPqD37Ocg_Q.text: All things considered, the Eiffel Tower Restaurant has my vote for best restaurant in Las Vegas.    Is it hands down the best food?  With so many to choose from, it's not a definitive yes... but, it's in the discussion, and we're probably splitting hairs at that point anyway.    Besides, add in the service, setting, and the spectacular view, and the Eiffel Tower Restaurant wins.

FD_NQ37asbIEauK-BoX5Iw.text: Loved this place! Of course the view goes without stating anything else but the food was marvelous. Pricey but hey it is the experience you are going for. We had a lovely bottle of bubbly - staff was on point and we left very pleased. Will return!

H4ZSt8DAKOIdLWtZGAnL2A.text: Fantastic view overlooking the Strip and Bellagio. I wasn't sure what to expect as we took the elevator up from the casino through the eiffel tower but I'm glad to say we were not disappointed. The food was very good and the service was attentive and friendly. We had the octopus and the bay scallop appetizer and for the main we had the Beef Wellington and the Dover Sole and all 4 dishes were excellent. It's a little bit pricey but I thought it was worth it. We definitely hope to return.

OTPq0oo-w8tMd8PSCeKzVw.text: We had 5-star views, attentiveness, service and great formal atmosphere. This is one of the places to dress fancy. They had a kids menu -- I'll add a star for that one: just because you have a family does not mean your days of eating at gourmet restaurants is over!  The 5-star dishes: escargot on a creamy sauce on top of a what tasted like a potato cake was heavenly. I'd order that again. Foie gras was what one would expect; melt in your mouth decadence, if you like this sort of thing. This is hard to cook -- as it might melt before your eyes if you try this at home.   4-star dishes: filet mignon was tender, juicy and simply cooked well.  I don't know what to say about the venison. It was served cold-blood rare, and had the iron-y taste of grass fed beef except 10 times more intense, almost pungent and bitter like arugula on steroids. Other reviews of the venison here on were pleasant. Was this a new recipe? Is this a different species of deer? Was it the charred spice coating? The red cabbage on the side made it worse. The sauteed apples did not redeem it. I had a few bites and did not touch the rest.

MkapzbKmgB4H-_GAYjs4Og.text: We have been coming here every time we visit Las Vegas over the last fifteen years or so.  It is our favorite restaurant in all of Las Vegas!  The food, atmosphere, view and especially the service are just unrivaled.  It's usually a special occasion when we come to town and they make the extra effort make it a special dining experience.  Of the many times we've dined here we have never been disappointed!  We will always come back.

lKg7jYmsVWdu1IusR28VtA.text: Terrific view of the fountains, a little on the loud side, great service, romantic environment and just a classy restaurant. I had the Arctic Char delicate light flavor, but came with a lemon foam, tasty other than the foam.  Had the caramel souffle. I've never really had souffle before and this one was fabulous. Light and fluffy, melt in your mouth, not too eggy, just blissful!  Little surprised at how expensive it was, more expensive than Mastro's Ocean Club. Our dinner was roughly 125pp.  Definitely was a tasty treat!

kaI2U_LF-rzxMKGmgr2o2A.text: This was our 3rd visit here.    On our first visit, my wife and I had ordered the Dinner Tasting Menu.  It was a 5 course meal in which we paired with a bottle of wine.  The view was amazing as we were sat right next to the window.  Unfortunately, the food was very forgettable and nothing impressed us.... (This was about 2 years ago  On our second visit, my wife and I dined here for lunch. I don't remember what we had... but once again nothing impressed us once again!  Third time's the charm right? Yep! The wifey and I came in for dinner on one of my days off from work.  We didn't expect much but we decided to give here another try before writing this place off for good.  The service was great and the food here was A LOT better than before.  I am not sure if they have changed the menu, but the food was definitely an improvement.  We ordered:  Appetizers - Smoked Salmon (not bad) - Butter Poach Maine Lobster (really good, get this!) - Alaskan King Crab with Melon (great as well)  Entrees Beef Wellington (yummy, the pastry was cooked to perfection) Broiled Filet Mignon with Foie Gras (this was the best part of dinner!) Crispy Potato Croquette (good stuff)  Dessert Chocolate Souffle (worth the calories)  All in all, service was great, food was actually memorable this time! Maybe it was the perfectly cooked Foie Gras that pushed me over the edge.  The view is always a plus here.

XB4BK4Rq-Yi2F94jPfETMg.text: We walked up to the Eiffel Tower restaurant just as another couple were being shown up to the restaurant. I noticed how the hostesses were so friendly and jovial with them and we were next! We step up to view the menu. The hostesses stood around and said nothing to us which wasn't too noticeable until another couple walked up behind us. The hostess sprang into action, "Hi good afternoon." She said in a friendly upbeat voice. Both of our heads darted up, as we wondered why we hadn't been greeted. The hostess continued to engage with the people behind us, even speaking in their native tongue. We were appalled and highly insulted that we hadn't received the same treatment that everyone else seemed to get. We couldn't help but to think that the service we received before we walked into the doors of this restaurant would've been indicative of the service we would've received inside so we immediately walked away and headed to Mon Ami Gabi (where I'm currently writing this review).

JZYwN_R6chWLEb_ayOXpYg.text: Atmosphere nice. The champagne delightful. The price tag a little excess. True you have the view, Vegas, lobster, beef Wellington, souffle. But I think that at that price tag, I could have got 2 comparable meals elsewhere.  The staff was nice, bread was good, great to experience it and get dressed up..,

mQTA4l9v71BhQ9t0RxC8Yw.text: I was incredibly excited to call to see if we could just stop by for Desserts on my birthday being that we have reservations i was looking for something still romantic but something different. My call got answered by Misty and she was incredibly rude, she answered immediately with an attitude and made me feel like i was being a nuisance or inconveniencing her that i had a question, when asked if i could make a reservations for just desserts she stated "no" i waited for her to maybe say we just offer it at the bar, so i asked if they offer it at the bar her response " yeah , you would be treated as a walk in, if we have space you can be seated but its only if were not busy" Which i completely understand with businesses high demand. I work in a customer service based job and it disgusted me the way Misty made me feel like i could not afford to be in the restaurant just because i was questioning about Dessert only. Its incredibly sad knowing that we most defiantly can afford to eat here and just due to other arrangements were coming to make this a birthday stop, and we did not even step foot near the restaurant to get such a rude first impression.

fHhCDsOOrrZ-vpURCR2-uw.text: The food is nothing special but not terrible either. We enjoyed our food, but it's not what will be drawing us back for a revisit.  The view from our table alone, however, was worth the visit and is plenty reason to try this restaurant again. If you'd like to see the view without eating at one of the tables, you can purchase a ticket to visit the observation deck.  However, we were hungry and wanted to try their brunch menu so why not eat while enjoying the view.  Food was moderately decent. Yes, it's pricey, but this is what is expected in Las Vegas and the nature of the restaurant, right?   Service could have been better. Our server appeared distant and seemed to never smile.  The woman who helped clear our table periodically was very nice and sweet, however.   Go at least once to try for yourself. We went for brunch, cheaper price but same view. The views are still great during the daylight hours.  Call in advance and make reservations. If you can, request a seat by the window for the best views. I think we may visit again when in town.  Next time, dinner and an evening view!

eai6WCsptF-qZxlRzxT6ww.text: xcellent food. Excellent service. Very intimate. Salmon was the best I have ever eaten. Try to get a table near the window.

YRnXofSCsAjNWISUKY1H7A.text: My friend and I were reluctant to go at first but the friendly hostess at the front convinced us to try it. Needless to say I am so happy I listened!   We got an incredible view right by the window and got to watch the Bellagio fountain dance three times!! The menu was a little pricey but the quality of the food is amazing. When you're walking to the restaurant you have to walk through the kitchen, you got to see the chefs at work and it smelled amazing in there.   My friend and I both got the French onion soup which isn't like the  typical kind you get at other places, it was very creamy and flavorful. They also give you an amuse bouche and delicious house bread with butter. By the time my entree came, I was already full. We also both got the classic eiffle tower burger and pretty sure that was the best burger I have had in a long time. The beef patty was pretty big and very well seasoned. Every bite I took melted in my mouth. The most moist burger I have ever had!!  I also mentioned to the hostess it was my friends birthday and they surprised her with a cute dessert!!  I highly recommend coming here for either a nice romantic dinner or just a fun brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Probably the best burger I have ever had in my life!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect view of the strip and enjoying a great lunch!!!

laoBZYhw0uM1c7Z0n3sRiw.text: We chose to celebrate an anniversary dinner here. We booked 2 months prior and got a window table overlooking the fountains. Our waiter was kind and helpful with interpreting the French menu. We were surprised with the little extras like break, small soup, and chocolates at the conclusion of dinner. My sea bass was exceptional. Green beans were excellent. The only thing we regretted was not ordering a starter. Portions were so small that we probably needed one. They pushed the souffles but we didn't try one. A fine dinner option for a special event. They seek to cater to guests.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special treat
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from window seat

ENdSV5JQ4MDy9Cwgn6ElRQ.text: The only this restaurant doesn't get five stars is because of the heat. It was super hot in there but everyone from the hostess to the waiter or maitre d' were great! Super friendly and great customer service, which I'm finding is very hard to find here in Vegas. But, it does come with a hearty price tag.  We went on our anniversary and we had a great time! We'll definitely come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy anniversary to us!

0SoXp3asVELDpqr7pCr_rw.text: Some places you pay for just the view and that was what I was expecting. Blown away on how great the food was. The steak was arguably the best cut I have ever had (King Filet) and the creamy spinach was amazing. I will come here every visit with my wife and family.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view is priceless

oHo3xbNan6VN0JW4QQYCPQ.text: WAY overpriced!  Great view and friendly staff but food is out of this world expensive!!  Drinks are as well!  That is why you have to take an elevator up so you don't run away screaming when you see the prices.  Food = above average.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1hv-_NaLGJoD-YAmS9DvgQ.text: If your idea of the perfect dinner is being forced to wear a cheap white shirt with a collar that looks like it was bought at the local Good Will over your $500 Armani shirt, and waiting an hour for an undercooked ribeye steak that tastes like pure salt, then this is the place for you. The service is slower than the escargot they serve as an appetizer. They take around 15 minutes to bring you butter, and then, you get to wait another 15 minutes for them to bring you a choice of bread to put the butter on, I kid you not. Then, after all of this, you get to lay down around $200-300 for the experience and that's before the 18%+ gratuity is added.  On the upside, you might get a window seat like we did and get to watch the Bellagio fountains, so at least you'll be entertained, while you slowly but surely starve to death.

SjJSpuaBYJEZ6ia6tKLmPw.text: The 1 star is for the food.    Having just had the foie at Robouchon the night before,  the contrast could not have been more stark...   The service,  staff,  and view of the belagio fountains are all great.  But I would recommend getting a dessert and wine and nothing else.     Chicken- smashed and breaded/ horrendously soaked in frying oil and yet... Almost flavorless outside of some aged parm. I could barely choke it down.    Surf and turf burger -  how you mess this up is beyond me.  The crab was tolerable,  but the Hollandaise was bland,  as was the burger.    A general theme here was under-seasoning and extremely bland flavor profiles.    With so many great restaurants in vegas like guy savoy  or Robouchon,  or Picasso.... Stay away from this place unless it's for a drink and a view.

uwu3fydjnPRIretP0BhwtQ.text: I recently ate  here for a business trip.  It was a price fixed meal and I must admit it was pretty tasty.  There were 23 of us, but the service was excellent.  The view was awesome and we never had empty glasses, maybe that was because they charged for the wine and water so empty means no money.  While the food was good, it was not close to perfect.  The lobster appetizer that I had was a bit chewy, seemed a tad undercooked.  The salad was very good and the rack of lamb was excellent.  My only take with the main course was that there was not any starch with it.  A nice mashed potato or something would have made it much better.  I had the rack of lamb and it came with a slice of tomato and egg plant.  While it was good, it just seemed to be missing something.  The Creme Brulee was very good!  I liked this place, but will probably never return, just due to the fact that there are so many other places I have yet to try, but if you have never visited I suggest you stop in.

v8BkzpFeqcbzgCMU5OxbIQ.text: Foods were amazing :) had a great time with watching a beautiful view when I enjoyed foods XD  SERVICE WAS OKAY.  I might come back but no oily, salty for me next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best food in here
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flavor was good :-)
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s Salty a little bit

ZtiUDi9d5tSg9c7Y3rYw5g.text: I'm torn. The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is not deserving of 5 stars, yet it's not bad -- thus my dilemma. At the Eiffel Tower Restaurant, the view trumps the food. But since we're talking about a restaurant, food should always trump everything else, with the view as a perk.  When calling for a reservation, I inquired about a window seat. The man said the only way to guarantee the window at 6pm was through a special birthday dinner package, including a three-course dinner for 2, bottle of wine, professional photo at dinner, and an autographed restaurant cookbook. The package was an insane price, but since we were staying at another strip hotel for free, I thought, hey, we can spend something silly for dinner.  So here are my grades: -View: A+ (of course) -Presentation of food: A -Service: C (service was no better than what I'd expect at Applebee's) -Cauliflower puree/assorted breads: A  -Mixed greens/creamy French onion soup: A -Chicken entree: A+ (I never knew chicken could be SO tender!) -Salmon entree: B- (underseasoned and did not taste super fresh) -Chocolate cake dessert: D (frozen, not sweet and didn't seem fresh; the presentation at least made up for the cake)  While some dishes we ate (as well as the presentation and the window seat) were excellent, my main entree and birthday cake were disappointing. I felt a little slighted with dessert; to charge a customer such an enormous price for a fixed menu that includes chocolate cake as the only dessert option and to provide that customer such a lackluster dessert just doesn't seem right to me.  Our server was attentive and professional but pretty mediocre. She never chatted with us and did not explain the dishes when they arrived at our table. Similarly, the hostess in the restaurant did not acknowledge us until we said hello, and she did not say goodbye or thank you as we left. (The hosts by the restaurant elevator on the casino floor were great.)  We had a great experience since the view of the Bellagio fountains was fantastic. Unfortunately, not everything we ate was fantastic, and the service was average. For what we paid, I was expecting food and service that would knock my socks off -- and we didn't get that.   In the end, because the food and service were not 5 stars for me, I don't plan on returning. I'm glad I went, though, and I enjoyed my experience.

qoRxebD_qQDLMFfjc9yaSg.text: The view was amazing, but the restaurant is very loud and the food is just okay. Our service was less than expected, glasses never filled and we felt rushed to turn over the table. They also had security walking around and staring at dinners, which made the entire experience feel very uncomfortable. If you are looking for excellent French Cuisine and dining experience then I would recommend Le Cirque, especially if you are looking for a romantic dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snow crab appetizer
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table at sunset during the Bellagio fountain show

fff3wGFwF351r6nhCw20bQ.text: I had the rack of lamb and roasted chicken with some overpriced wine. The lamb was well cooked to my standards and didn't have a strong gamey taste to it. Portion size for the rack of lamb is quite small, especially the grilled tomatoes. The chicken was well seasoned and tasted very familiar to something that I can't remember. Bread is served before the meal but it's nothing special. Dessert was too sweet as  I'm not a fan of sweets. The view isn't too great as the most I could see was the Bellagio fountain. One of my biggest complaints at this restaurant is the compactness of the booths. It was difficult to sit and get up and my chest was squeezed by the table. There were not a lot of room on the table for the many orders of food and drinks. Finding the restroom can be a hassle. Though comfort is lacking, the taste of the entrees make up for the discomforts.

NEuDkPriqtvI4-Q98hk-Lg.text: I changed my mind not go to the restaurant. I went to the restaurant for reservation. The lady who work for reservation, she is very very unfriendly and she doesn't know how to smile and how to talk nicely. She asked me my credit card number to hold my seat, I understood what she said but she doesn't know how ask nicely and just I was uncomfortable to tell my card number to the lady just cos her behave. Yes I went to other restaurant! Food is important, but if stuff isn't nice behave people won't come back again.

dqWDb5UKEVjcVQ7WNMG-9g.text: This is the ultimate classy french restaurant!  While the food is incredible, it's actually the impeccable service that pushes it up to 5-stars.  We've dined here about 3 times over the past 6 years, as well as a couple trips just to the beautiful bar. Always had a great experience and a memorable night!  Also, it's the best view on the whole strip!

2mdJ9hveYznvfwB3-GS7Ug.text: We were seated by the window overlooking the bellagio fountains , which was very nice . The service was wonderful and the food was even better. We ordered the crusted trout with mashed potato as well as the vegetarian crepes . The portions were perfect and it was all some of the best food we have enjoyed in some time . The menu is a bit pricey so be prepared but it was all really good so I didn't mind :)

Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside view of the restaurant

jxcsH3fDEHVnaYUBIxMHAA.text: Don't waste your money ~ extremely expensive and it just wasn't worth it. The Sea Bass was dry and salty, it gave me an upset stomach. The meals are ala carts and the side dishes run $12 to $18 each. The best part was the view. The wait staff had zero personality.

CLKOxmJ4P5oZvJy5lKdMOQ.text: Definitely need a reservation, go after 6pm that way you get a beautiful views. We had a window seat which was perfect. Amazing food, I had the duck with wild rice. There is a dress code so be aware of that, if you are not used to 5star restaurants.

rEFVmnWNbvZPzfFi3bz1lg.text: Fantastic in every aspect.  We live in Las Vegas, and eat on the strip often.  For some reason we had not gotten here, but we will return soon.   Fantastic service, I think the best views in Las Vegas, as looking right over Bellagio fountains, and most important stellar food.  Can't wait to go back.

tHuD8L_chwNm4RwyzTtNCA.text: One of the best restaurants I have been to! I've been here for dinner twice now and I loved both experiences. The service is great, the food is amazing, and the views are fabulous! You can see the Fountains of Bellagio from most anywhere in the restaurant. Back to the food; I really liked the halibut. I have tried the chicken and some of the red meat (I stole bites from others there with me) and everything I tasted was exquisite. The mashed potatoes and the potatoes au gratin are delicious. My favorite fondue was the pistachio but my all time favorite desert is their Banana Elysee. Bottom line, this restaurant is absolutely worth going to.

2dYn1cF38ue2-_NvmyVo_w.text: Came here for brunch and had the lobster Benedict! O M G it was delicious! Besides our 20$ mimosa I got a free dessert for being the bride  and to top it off the view was amazing!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
