JVuWrVqRHU6pnA20bB8c7Q.text: We had our pre-wedding lunch at the restaurant and there were plenty of seats remaining inside the restaurant.  The food was delicious and flavorful and the service was prompt. We were treated with respect and professionalism from the waiters and staff- no attitudes- which makes a big difference.    The view was incredible even at noon. The price was expected for a 5 star restaurant.  If you get seated by a window bring a light jacket/cardigan because it was very cold. The AC vents are next to the tables at the windows, its understandable when it's 110 outside... They offer shawls for women.   We can't wait to return, but next time in the evening to enjoy the Bellagio Fountain show at night.  (The fountain show times vary during the week and weekends).  It's well worth it, even if you sit at the bar for a cocktail.

MPZy-Yt2StPZ-pmNm-sLag.text: This is the place for high end dining in Vegas. The steaks are great but I would recommend the Individual Beef Wellington. Pick your favorite sides, and save room for a souffle for desert. Several to choose from. Ask to sit in Michael's section. He takes excellent care of you. If you have any issues, I'll assure you it will be taken care of immediately and professionally. We were celebrating a birthday and they even had a special little chocolate mousse for that! The view is spectacular! Can't say enough good!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y-bzfWSj5_OLLdNk7xZBwg.text: Went to this beautiful restaurant following a wedding. We had a large party of 20 and they were very accommodating in getting two large tables near each other. The view from the restaurant was gorgeous. You didn't have to sit right next to the window to see it either. Windows from the ceiling to the floor made for a wonderful view of the Vegas night and the Bellagio. I ordered a salad since I had eaten at the wedding reception and was not hungry enough to order an entree. As simple as the salad was, it was delicious. Same can be said about the butternut squash soup. Since I did not eat an entree I can't give it a thorough review, but if the soup/salad was that delicious I can't imagine how delicious the entrees would have been like.

qi3PWKbn7BFFP9S3eEOATw.text: the best steak I ever have, new York steak must order. duck liver is good too. seafood Salad is ok, not my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sEESLIxMbba6JJOj1s9mFw.text: We had lunch here on our most recent trip. It was my favorite restaurant that we went to. Amazing!!! Must go!  We started out with pumpkin puree compliments of the kitchen. It was definitely an interesting taste but it was good. I ordered the creamy French onion soup and it was the best French onion soup I have ever had. That is saying a lot because French onion soup is one of my favorite foods and I've had it many many times. I was scraping the side of the bowl with my bread. I got the aged Parmesan crusted chicken as my meal and it was perfect. It came with green beans and potatoes. For dessert, we shared an apple strudel. So good!!!  Price wasn't too bad. I think you're paying more for the ambience and the view. Which is amazing!   Our waiter, I think his name was Carlos, was attentive, helpful, and very nice!  Put the Eiffel Tower restaurant at the top of your to do list if you're in Vegas !!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple strudel... Must get!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan crusted chicken. Yum!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most amazing French onion soup I have ever had.

lOgx86U5VEx_iHN8VcHt3w.text: Horrible customer service. Tried ordering something specific and the lady in the background laughed at me. Never eat here. STAY AWAY

etzLmv8Hn3T8_8cCWhHeyA.text: We went for our anniversary dinner and had the Beef Wellington and King Filet mignon.   We also had sides, wine and the chocolate souffle.  The meal was delicious!  The food is like nothing I have ever had before.  We also had a beautiful window seat to view the Bellagio fountains.    This place is really expensive but really good.  Service was also excellent!

IvY0JfM3cDs8YZpOTNqtIQ.text: Eiffel Tower Restaurant is located in the Paris Hotel. The restaurant has amazing views of the Vegas strip. In fact, if you ask for a table by the window you get an unobstructed view of the Bellagio's dancing fountains.   The food is good. It is not Michelin star worthy (for that you will need to go to Joel Robuchon), but it is good. The service is attentive and friendly.  It is a great place to enjoy the views while enjoying some decent drinks and food.    We had a few cocktails. They were pretty good. For the main, I had the French Bucatini Pasta with trumpet royale mushrooms and aged parmesan. It was not bad, but I found it slightly salty.   I would recommend the Eiffel Tower Restaurant if you enjoy restaurants with a view. It is also a great place to enjoy a nice date.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bHnRQAtekjnmjY1hD9Iznw.text: Forced to come here for a birthday dinner. As a local who doesn't want to be anywhere near the strip on a Friday night, I wasn't too excited. But, thankfully the Uber driver dropped me off right in front of the entrance to the restaurant (which is through the main entrance on LV BLVD). There was no line to take the elevator up. Once arrived I was seated with my table under a candlelight type ambiance. The view IS ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL at night, it's a round two-tiered seating and my guess is reservation for the first floor with window view, even on the second floor I felt the view was spectacular with the Bellagio water show after 8pm. The restaurant was full and lively. It's not an intimate setting if that's what you're looking for. My waitress took very good care of us, she almost made us feel as if we were the only table she was servicing for the evening.  This is high-end dinning, expect the prices to be overwhelmingly high and the food is mostly seafood and pasta. The menu does not have a lot to offer, the appetizer we each purchased cost $60 a person for lobster, crab, a couple of jumbo shrimp and oysters - it was definitely all very good except for the oysters - but for $60?!  - NO, NEVER - under ordinary circumstances. I had spritzers made, that weren't very good.  I opted for a vegetarian dish and it seemed very salty to me lacking flavor or succulence. My family however, seemed to enjoy the lamb, fillet mignon and lobster bisque. Overall, for as much as we paid for the meal - it all seemed average.   My guess is, as a tourist, you will pay for the hype of having dinner in a nice restaurant with a great view. But there are certainly other restaurants in town worth exactly what you pay for.

Jp2hiklBUNulpJT8WhaLew.text: This was an incredible moment.  We had window seats to the Vegas fireworks display which is on June 30 instead of the 4th of July.  It was absolutely beautiful.  I ordered the Rabbit and Caviar for an appetizer.  The Rabbit wasn't roasted like I had hoped it was something kind of weird but it was still decent.  The caviar was amazing.  Pure luxury to be eating Caviar and watching fireworks at the best seat in Vegas.  I ordered the Bison Tenderloin and the lobster.  The Bison tasted amazing and I savored every bite of it.  The lobster was by far the best and most flavorful lobster I have ever tasted in my life!  Every bite was an incredible explosion of deliciousness!  This was my second time at the restaurant and I am a big fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caviar!!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This lobster was divine!  A thing of the gods.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IvQXNcf1iiwc4tJA6ZqVHA.text: Tonight was amazing! It started with the great table and view of the strip. It only got better once Carmen (her name is Lisa if she did something wrong) introduced herself. She helped my vegetarian wife pick out a delicious meal that I even liked. My wife was freezing so she provided her with a little shawl for warmth. The down to earth conversations were extremely pleasant. I would go back just because of Carmen.   All of the food was great. Chocolate plate was amazing.

dA--Hxj6WZctCUzQPan8QA.text: Had a great meal and even better service from Chrissy. The view of the fountains is pretty good from most tables. There is a 180 degree view of the strip. Nice place if you are celebrating a special occasion.

mskA7i5IwvaRInCvpZIftQ.text: I am not a big fan of French cuisine but this one has me curious to try more French dining. I had their chicken dish ( Forgot what it was called), it was a little on the salt side but still edible and full of flavor. We also tried the souffle which was a fail!   The views are gorgeous and very romantic offering direct views of the Bellagio fountains (And come with a price tag) - definitely a place to go with your loved one if you want a classy and sophisticated dining experience in the middle of loud Vegas.   5 stars for the Views and the service. 3 for the Food.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zlRmBMPh7f11NACFsd-0DA.text: Wonderful locale for a leisurely lunch to catch the fountain show at the Bellagio.  Wait staff was friendly and accommodating. The food was superb and quickly served. My elected courses came with explanations and wine pairings. I scored a window seat overlooking the fountains and (accidentally) timed it perfectly for the show to coincide with dessert.  I normally don't eat sweets but their creme brulee was fantastic! I couldn't pass it up. This is a great spot for solo dining or a date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vAE2yacfES7HXpHE5LI0pw.text: Beautiful ambiance, beautiful dishes, beautiful view, beautiful customer service. Loved the salmon and the banana dessert. $200+ for two people.  I was a little disappointed that I made a reservation for my birthday and requested a table with a view but they made it sound over the phone that they couldn't accommodate. We were seated at a table with a semi-view(appreciative) but it looked like plenty tables were available right by the window.

VDKF860mJIpqbsTTS9VNYg.text: The BEST restaurant in Vegas! The view is beautiful and the food is amazing!! Will definitely be back next time I'm there. Very pricey but worth it 100%. Especially the steak tartare omg it was sooo delicious!

KQjhiF30qjkArBnfpSqtyQ.text: My 200th review! Came here for drinks at the eiffel tower restaurant- I was curious to check out the eiffel tower replica. We took an elevator up to the main restaurant. Entering the restaurant- you walk-in to the chefs cooking away. We were seated at the high bar , the view was impeccable. There was a wide drink selection- cocktails starting at 20$. Our waiter offered us the special of the day "mimosas".  My friend and I had ordered two glasses of mimosas (the pear was kind of tart, the peach had a nice sweet undertone to it) - the bill came out to 43.30$!! Way too overpriced.. but the the view makes up for it!

AGj3plodkRGJr9Lun58p7A.text: This might be the first time that I wish I could leave MORE than 5 stars.  What an experience.  We made a reservation via Open Table, but I had a problem with the app when I tried to make a change, so I gave them a call and they helped me out without issue.  We arrived shortly before our reservation and were shown to our seats - a lovely booth for 4 that overlooked the Bellagio fountains.  It actually took my breath away for a second as I took it all in.    Our server was absolutely amazing.  I believe his name was Igor.  We are a curious bunch and asked him a lot of questions - like where he was from and how long he had been in Vegas.  We listened intently while he told us his story.   We also had a Somelier stop by the table to offer assistance with the wine list.  Everyone we encountered was fantastic.  Now for the food.  Oh.... the food.  What a treat!  For appetizers, we had the steak tartare and warm lobster salad.  I passed on the salad, but devoured the tartare.  It was amazing.    For our mains, we had the Queen Filet, Beef Wellington, Venison and the Rossini Style Filet Mignon.  For sides, we had the creamed spinach, the Galette of Potato Anna, and I think we also had the Brussel Sprouts.  The Queen Filet was mine and it was by far the best steak I have ever had.  Everything about it was perfect.  I also added the peppercorn sauce because it's my favourite.  The only complaint with the venison was the Chestnut Spaetzle, which I'm told was not very good.  The wellington and Rossini both received rave reviews.  We each had a cocktail before dinner, and shared a bottle of Pinot Noir with our meal.  For dessert we shared the chocolate souffle.  The only tiny complaints we had were 1) the bread is served cold, not warm.  Though delicious and 2) the spaetzle with the venison was out of place.    This was by far my favourite meal of the trip.  Made especially pleasant by the phenomenal service.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate souffle
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rossini filet
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Queen Filet

MjTMDf4MuFnE0T_R3To-7w.text: I took my wife here for her birthday.  We are locals and try all the good places.  This place is one of our favorites.  The setting is very intimate and romantic,  with panoramic views of the strip.    The food is amazing.  I love French food because the flavors are complex, I ordered the beef Wellington with the red wine sauce and to have a perfectly medium rare steak cooked inside of a puff pastry was amazing.  It was like the best pot pie crust with a steak inside.  My wife ordered the salmon which was oven baked medium rare.  To cook salmon in the oven and get it to the perfect temperature is not an easy task.  I couldn't imagine cooking a steak inside a puff pastry either and having both turn out to perfection.    Lastly the service, expect to be treated like honored guests in a home.  It was very nice and all of the staff was extremely personable and happy to engage in conversation as well as offer great service promptly.

weDaKK-RRWFoLCWcZQ3ZGQ.text: Leaving one star for my sweet waitress. I would leave zero if I could. Writing this as I leave the restaurant. I am the sister of a child with special needs. We took him for the experience because he deserves it too. They were quick to send us a link with credit card information already asking for the tip beforehand. When we sat, my brother started getting anxious. The manager was quick to come to our table even though my mom had previously mentioned to her that my brother was special needs. She asked us to "make sure he keeps the volume down" he does not speak therefore has no other way to release his frustrations. My mom was extremely upset and the manager did nothing to repair the damages. Disappointed to say the least. Before anything we are human beings and we should have more respect and compassion for one another. Would not recommend.

orvKpr6-Y9XmVeEYzOqMEw.text: My bf and I were celebrating our anniversary and decided to go to the Eiffel tower for dinner. We made reservations for a Tuesday night. Since we were coming from a show, we would be a bit late and they were accommodating of us.   We arrived at Paris and found the Eiffel tower restaurant elevators. We were taken up to the restaurant and it opened right up to the open kitchen. A host came and led us to our table right by the Bellagio fountains and the strip view.   We were greeted by our server and was handed the menu. We ordered the Escargot and Royal Osetra Caviar as appetizer. For our main dish, I got the queen filet mignon with mash potatoes and my bf got the beef wellington with snow peas.   Escargot- I love escargots! And I especially loved the sauce that it came in. It was very rich and creamy and a strong aroma of garlic. The escargots were paired with croquettes to help balance out the texture and flavors.   Royal Osetra Caviar- the whole dish was divine! The caviar dish came with a platter of assorted toast and baguettes as well as creme fraiche, eggs, and chives. I love the assortments that it came with, a traditional way of eating caviar. Definitely would order again.   The queen filet mignon- I ordered the filet mignon, cooked medium. I liked the filet but the outside was seared a little bit too much and the outside crust was a bit too hard for me. But my bf loved the filet and the crispy outside texture.   Beef wellington- My bf originally ordered the beef wellington, thinking that it would be bready but it wasn't. The outside crust was actually very flaky and light and airy. I actually enjoyed the beef wellington for that main reason, the crust. The beef on the inside was soft and moist and it tasted great with the flaky crust.   (So me and my bf actually traded our dishes because he liked my filet mignon and I liked his beef wellington. It was best of both worlds for the both of us. I also enjoyed the mashed potatoes, it was very dense and creamy. I could definitely taste the olive oil used inside)  Apple crumble souffle- After hearing about the great souffles, we decided to try it. I must say it was out of this world! It was so airy and light. I loved the crumbles at the bottom. I could taste the alcohol that was used at the bottom though. It was a bit heavier than I would have liked but the souffle overall was very good.   Our server was attentive and also gave us a nice anniversary dessert gift at the end. We were also offered petite four at the end of our meal. They refilled our waters and offered bread to our table.    Our total bill came out to be around $275 which was a lot better than I expected. For all the fancy schmancy places we have eaten at, I think this would be my favorite! The service was impeccable and the food was up to par. I really have nothing bad to say about this place. And the strip view/Bellagio fountains was a nice cherry on top.

Q5_qWQpo8T0roCEplDIn9w.text: I have been most fortunate to have enjoyed, which most locals and tourists consider, the most romantic dining venue, in all of Las Vegas. It's shown on there web page. I believe it's table # 56.  Last night was my 6th time. The view takes your breath away. I have been coming here since it opened almost 18 years ago. The service, ambiance , atmosphere, continue to be exquisite. The wine list among the best in the United States. And the food, is always delicious and prepared exactly to order. $$$$ yes, but worth every penny for the right occasion.

J6G9Z3Gsg2l8ATAPp3AoWA.text: Came here for my birthday weekend, booked the restaurant through open table. The view is top notch and the food were delicious. The only bad experience was my boyfriends drink had some kind of dirt or something in the bottom and on the side inside of the glass, we had to asked the waiter for another one. Hopefully when we come back we don't experience it again coz little dirt here and there make you loss your appetite.

sfXZAcAjip1V3j0EB6cgvA.text: So I went back hoping for more vegan dishes but nope. Only thing on the menu I could eat was pasta with zucchini and the pasta was overly drenched with lemon juice & made me pucker up like mr. trump. Not a good look for me. I ate the vegetables but it was impossible to finish pasta. Since there wasn't anything else I ate around it. As I was leaving they were cleaning asparagus stems. I should've just ordered seared asparagus. I don't know if they do special orders.

ofA9udCODKwD_C3AlohG1g.text: Top notch place! Seasonal menu is fantastic! I had the seasonal rabbit dish with a side of asparagus in brown butter with a perfectly cooked chocolate souffle and espresso for desert. The service from my server Heather was nothing short of amazing! I even got a special taster from the chef!

QUv7lGDeys80yCP3KRURVQ.text: ***Brunch Review***  I've been wanting to try this place out for awhile so I decided to treat myself to brunch on a Saturday. As suggested here, I made a reservation online. For brunch I don't think the reservation was necessary for brunch but perhaps for dinner. Oh and you should definitely request a window sit when you reserve. Anyway after checking in at the podium, you take an elevator to the restaurant. Elevator opens to the kitchen so you get a view of what's going on in there. The food was GREAT! The mimosas are great too. The meal came with the standard bread but also a small shot glass size soup. Amazing food + great service = highly recommend!

EoS7CsTYgjo2axl_YHpoKA.text: Beautiful! It's quite fancy here and very classy. Everyone is dressed up formal. The view is spectacular! The vibrance is warm & romantic. Spend your anniversary, birthday or special occasion here because it is worth it. The prices are very expensive but the experience is immeasurable and makes everything worth it. The service is amazing. Food portion is great, and the taste of every bite is delicious & satisfying. I have been to many special fancy restaurants but this one is my favorite one thus far. It's so romantic, and elegant, you can feel as if you're from another country like France (because the restaurant is Eiffel Tower itself )  I recommend this to all couples celebrating birthdays and anniversaries or any special occasions. I think this place is also good for proposals! It is quite marvelous! Steak was a wow-factor, it was delicious! My favorite was also this cute birthday dessert they gave me. I think it was chocolate mousse. It was soooooo yummy! I wanted some more! Haha. We had an amazing and priceless experience here. This place marks my favorite fancy special restaurant! We are planning to come here once or twice a year for any given special event/day.

YQnTQBae3FWU-Lp0Lj7r5A.text: Once again, the boyfie of the year surprised me to another grand meal while in Vegas. Shockingly had an amazing meal at this "tourist" spot. Super underrated. Pricey? Of course. But this if Vegas, people. Don't expect to take an elevator up the "Eiffel Tower" with epic views at TGI Friday's prices. You are paying for the food, service, and views :)  Ordered: x Warm Maine Lobster Salad - Beautiful presentation and huge chunks of lobster! Really enjoyed this salad. Portion was perfect for an appetizer. Don't order this thinking you'll get an entree salad.  x Slow Cooked Seared Octopus - LOVE! I order octopus everywhere I go and this one did NOT disappoint. On the saltier side, but bearable. I'm very sensitive to salt.   x Trio of American Caviar (Golden Whitefish, American Sturgeon, Salmon Roe) - served traditional style. This was just "ok". We didn't have a favorite out of the three.  x Wild Alaskan Halibut - Delicious cooked halibut. I must admit, it was a little overcooked, but the flavors of everything else really made up for it. Really, really enjoyed this dish. x Galette of Potato Anna - Obviously had to order this because it has my name in it... Think Au Gratin protest without the pounds of dairy. Super delicious. I think I found my new favorite way to cook potatoes ;)  The food was more like 4 stars, but what really stood out was the service we got. Our server was so knowledgable with the menu AND all the wines. So great when the staff knows every single thing about the restaurant they work in :)  The views are spectacular here. Right in the middle of the strip. Almost better than the Mandarin Oriental bar ;) Highly recommend for a romantic date night. Loved our experience here. Just don't expect Michelin level food...

ORrWkc0-FFZIEaS0blp4dg.text: I had lunch with a friend today and this was definitely an exceptional dining experience.  It has all of the key ingredients - ambience with a great view, knowledgeable and articulate staff, and sumptuous food with great presentation.  While I had a light meal with entree and dessert, it was definitely worth reviewing.  Server was attentive and helpful with dietary restrictions, offering an incredible vegan entree from their dinner menu - the Cauliflower steak.  It was accented with an olive tapenade on top, paired with the sauces, and kale chips - simply wonderful!  I was happy to be able to enjoy the baguette and the server offered oil and vinegar instead of butter.  Berries with micro mint was also a perfect finish to the meal.  For the carnivorous and seafood indulgent, they had some nice options, too!  My friend's seafood salad was a healthy portion and nicely presented.  It's great to go to a restaurant with freshly prepared and perfectly seasoned food and service staff that fully understands their role in making a memorable experience.

jaus_A0bZeOR0BiD2yrxHQ.text: Always want to go here for years but everytime when I looked at the menu and just walked away...lol...this time finally me and my fiance made it True cause life is once and we work hard so just try once whatever u wanna do or try in ur life. Glad that we had a good experience which r all good for services,staffs r so nice.The foods r so delicious,for myself I had lamb chop which is hard to make cause of the smell of itself but here it's the best.Had mai tai for drink and thanks the bartender made it rite mai tai which is nice mixing colors and still feel the taste of the drink. And we got so lucky to have a beautiful view which made us so happy cause we had a try this time at this place ;)

q5wOGUoCc9qKoF-AJFSsoA.text: We took our family here for our 23rd anniversary.  The view was great.  The food and wait staff were excellent.  I like the fact I can order half bottles of wines so I can have different ones with each course.

AioS-6M4lIVL0q1e96czuw.text: This place is no joke when they say it is the most romantic restaurant in Las Vegas.  Me and my GF decided to go to this place to check this place out for the July 4th weekend and had an amazing experience.    First the service is amazing.  We arrived and the person at the escalator showed us the way to the restaurant.  The servers were very courteous and knowledgeable about the food being served.  I asked for a recommendation and our server suggested the sea bass and it did not disappoint.  Our server name was George and he did everything he could to make our visit an enjoyable one.  Thanks George!  The food was overall spot on for me.  The sea bass was lightly crispy on the outside and very flavorful on the inside.  I also go to try fore groie.  It's supposed to be duck liver and it was fused with some cherries.  I am glad I tried it, but I will definitely not order it again in the future.  Just not my kind of dish.  We ended our meal with pistachio and gran broule souffles.  First time I ever had souffle and now I understand what the fuss is all about.  I am now a souffle fan!  Lastly the ambiance of the place is very nice and with a great view.  Make sure to request for a window view.  It is well worth the extra 15 minute wait.  I was lucky enough to sit at a window table and go to see the Bellagio water show every 15 minutes.  Then we enjoyed the firework show that was being displayed at Cesar's Palace.  It was quite a memorable night for us.  All this does come at a price.  Total bill for me n my GF was $200, but the experience was priceless.  I am glad I had the chance to dine at such an exquisite restaurant.    TIP: I showed up in a t-shirt and jeans.  Make sure to wear a collar shirt or else they will provide you with a jacket.  Also do not wear shorts because I saw some guy having to put on loaner slacks.    Bon Appetit!!!

FxOt8Exq5CA5izlDPFPoUg.text: Horrible experience! First off the menu is extremely limited, so if you like options ... Not your place to go. Everything is really unorganized. Waiters are frantically walking back and forth you can't even enjoy the view. Our experience was terrible because our soup was cold, main course ordered came 1 hour later and the waiter was probably the worst part. When I was going to order I asked the waiter what he recommended and he was really rude and short about it. Some loser French guy who hates his life. After our food took too long we asked what's taking so long he first said "want to cancel" then said 3 minutes which turned into 15. Of course we canceled and left. But the point is it was like he enjoyed it. As we left I saw the manger standing around I told him what had taken place. His reaction was a half ass apology. Don't waste your time and money in a restaurant that is going to give you horrible service. vegas is full of amazing places ... I'm surprised this place remains open. We were at stk night before ... Fabulous. Don't go here .. View is half ass. Service is terrible and food is limited.

X1o8iZU4Hwg8fuNfLZcYVA.text: Been here twice. The dinner service was formal and elegant. Lunch was more relaxed, but very nice. I was expecting more of a tourist attraction type of dining, but it really is fine dining. My lamb was cooked perfectly and my martini was perfect.

p3ZwjhkdpwS-urLnS7yRcg.text: This is only my 2nd review on Yelp but I think it's the least I can do.  I read the reviews for this restaurant and decided that this was the place for my wife and I to celebrate our 6th wedding anniversary, and I was not disappointed!  First of all, I have to thank Laurent, one of the managers, for the fabulous accommodations that he made for us which made it a little more special.  The view was amazing!  We had an awesome view of the Bellagio fountains.  The food was delicious!  I had the halibut and my wife had the filet, both were very good.  The amuse bouche and chocolate mousse were very tasty.  We topped it off with the chocolate souffle that was amazing!  The setting, service, and the view were top notch.  I definitely recommend this place for romantic or special occasion dining.  We had a great experience and will likely go again.

lf_CpooqmesDe_Q9HH7F8w.text: Really nice view. The waiter was really sweet, flirted a couple of times :) I had a tomato Salad which melted right on my mouth. For main I had Aged Parmesan crusted chicken w/ potato gratin, vegetables, it was delicious. Romantic place.

ZRbX0LkeqkDxcLgNdHU2wQ.text: Thank you Ridge and Lloyd you guys are awesome. I had made reservations for dinner initially and unfortunately were not able to make it for dinner and when I called in they said to come in for dessert and drinks would be just fine. Well we got to the restaurant and a very rude and passive lady tall with blonde hair helped us and was refusing to give us a seat that we wanted claiming that it was taken by reserved dinner guest which was an absolute lie. Right than we were about had it with her nonsense and were heading out when Ridge one of the waiters stopped us and apologized for the misunderstanding and that we were able to sit there afterwards. Just after that Lloyd the manager approached us heard our complaint and was very apologetic for it and assured he would take care of the situation. I would definitely come back again for dinner I'll make my reservations with Ridge next time and make sure to completely avoid that girl as should all f you. Thanks for the dessert Lloyd you guys made my wife's  birthday absolutely wonderful

DOKqC2J5kMaT2l7R9NhQuw.text: Was recently in Vegas for my brother's wedding and my parents, husband and I came here for a late night dinner. My favorite part of the experience is when the elevator doors open, they open into the actual restaurant kitchen! A great photo opportunity.   When we were escorted to our table we were so excited to discover we were by the window over-looking the Bellaggio Fountains! They were truly a sight to behold while sipping on my Sauvignon Blanc!  The amuse bousche was a cold cauliflower soup and was a nice way to start the dinner, as well as their gorgeous selections of homemade breads.  I ordered the cod done 'en papillote' with trumpet mushrooms and lemon. It is a fabulous presentation but I do have to say the lemon completely over-powered the mushrooms. My mom and husband had the salmon with a Pinot Noir reduction and they both said it was one of the best pieces of salmon they'd ever had. My dad ordered the surf and turf and loved the steak but said the crab was just 'meh'. I had a side of Brussels sprouts that were divine and we all loved the side of asparagus with Gorgonzola.    My favorite part of the meal? You guessed it... the Chocolate Souffle'. The souffle' was eggy, rich and decadent.   Notes:  Eiffel Tower is a fun excursion for the hopeless romantics when in Vegas. Watch the wine list, though, it's crazy pricey (I know, I work for a winery and the bottle prices are pretty outrageous). Stay with wine by the glass.

9ONAq3FJsjs4UNrn7TrHPw.text: Get the souffle and the steak. Incredible and a beautiful restaurant.

z7rWFVWiKiUBHih9-2OhtQ.text: Called on Tuesday for a special occasion on Friday. Briefly explained to reservation-taker that I was surprising my husband for lunch on his 50th birthday and would like a table with an excellent view.   When we arrived, we were greeted by name (?) even though we'd never been there before, and since we were a few minutes early were asked to wait. Other couples came in, each celebrating something: birthdays and engagements. I was concerned that my husband's birthday would be just another ho hum event and that we'd be left in the dust. But no.  Service was stellar. Lunch menu was varied and food was tasty. Portion sizes were perfect: not the usual Vegas-strip-enormous sized plates but servings we could actually finish.   We ordered two desserts to share which I completely recommend: creme brulee and apple streudel with cinnamon ice cream, (both ridiculously delish) and afterwards, the waiter brought out a lovely chocolate mousse on a white plate which had written in chocolate "Happy Birthday."  Couldn't have asked for a lovelier lunch in all of Las Vegas.  One thing you need to know if you're going at lunch time is that the Bellaggio Fountains don't start until 3 pm on weekdays so you won't see that. Totally not the restaurant's fault! But you might want to know so you can reserve at dinnertime if you'd prefer.

1yU_6gZlaLP1Xxez_003cA.text: January 18th we had reservations for our party of 8. It all started out good but ended with a Hugh disappointment. First when we told the waitress we wanted separate checks for every 2 people she looked at us perplexed. We literally pointed and said those two, these two, us two and them two making it very easy for her, but again she looked perplexed. She was a blonde. Trust me I am a blonde and could have done her job with my eyes closed. Ok so let's move on. Next was the ordering. The food was very expensive, you could order let's say the venison but you then had to order a vegetable or potato dish to go with it.  Once we all placed our order we thought we were good to go. One of our group accidentally spilled her water and the water went across the table, leaked through the table to where I was sitting and drip by drip went on the floor it also got spilled on her friends piece of bread, to which the bread soaked it up completely. When the friends guest (mind you it was my brother and his wife, myself and my boyfriend and the others minus one lady we all went to school together. So getting back to this breakdown, the one lady asked for another piece of bread. IT took the waitress over an hour to bring a simple piece of bread to the lady. So after sitting for 1.5 hours our food finally arrived. Grant it the food was delicious but the wait time was horrendous. My brother asked for a glass of wine with dinner and had to ask for it again as it never came. I guess they went to the other side of the world to get it. After dinner came the checks. Can you feel the tension growing now? They had the guts to add 18% gratuity to all the checks and again mind you they can only do this on a party of 8. There were 4 separate checks.  My sister in law and I both got up, and went to see the manager. We told them the service was horrible, the food was good but should not have taken 1.5 hours for it to be delivered, we tried several times to flag a waiter or waitress but to no avail. We asked the manager how he was going to compensate us for our meal? He told us that he would take the 18% gratuity off and let us put our own tip amount in. We said fine. I told my boyfriend not to sign the check as the 18% was coming off and the waitress was redoing our bill. I guess the others didn't realize what was going on and one of them signed it regardless. We all agreed that the food was delicious and well done but we would not go back again as the service was horrible, the time waiting for our meal was inexcusable, and the waitress was indescribable.  I am being generous in giving 2 stars. The company was awesome as we the food and the wine we had paired with our meal.

zjfgANYvIRIdB8fGOtFS-A.text: What an experience! It's comparable to having dinner @ Pier 39 in San Francisco watching the sea lions lay there motionless. Yes. It's that epic.  The ambiance, decor, and 360 panoramic view is breathtaking. They should make their patrons pay just entering this place. But of course, those breathtaking feature do make an appearance on your bill listed next to your food items.   Service:  This is where the very annoying, yet True saying applies, "You get what you pay for." There were at least 3 servers waiting on our table of 12, which felt really nice. The servers were very pleasant and willing to do whatever it takes to satisfy our visit. I was really appreciative of each and everyone of them.   Bread was served to each person individually while you choose you dinner items and enjoy your cocktails. I was surprised at how long it took before our server took our order, but once we placed our orders, the wine arrived and 15 minutes later all the appetizers, then 20+ minutes later the first course, 30+ minutes later the main course, and 1 hour+ after the desert. It was relatively nice to have that cushion to digest and tipsy chat.  I was definitely not use to the time and the leisure of having the time cushion, but considering the view, it was well worth it!  Food:  Quality wise, everything was amazingly fresh. From the oysters, clams, lobsters, shrimp and quality cut meats, it was well worth the $$$$. Our party ordered about 5 appetizers, all of which tasted good.   I ordered the surf and turf entree which is a new york aged steak with a crab cake. I was surprised at how simple it tasted. Don't get me wrong, the food was good, but it just wasn't fantastic or outstanding. If I were to grade it, the food tasted B average while the quality was an outstanding A.  After sobering up, I would really wished the chef  got creative with flavors and tastes. Using crazy herbs and spices to blend the perfect $$$$ taste, which is what we paid. Over 1800. The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is still remarkable experience I recommend.

jXb_rJt-SjrCbSivX6HvOw.text: Celebrated our anniversary here, made reservations and asked for a table with the bellagio fountain views. Hostesses were nice informed us it would be a few more minutes so we got a drink at the bar, very pricey drinks but they did have my favorite bleu cheese stuffed olives. Finally seated and they did honor my request for the fountain view, such a romantic spot. Our server greeted us an older gentleman but right away we could tell he was snobby and looked down at us since we were a young couple. Just brushed him off, for a starter we had the scallops, so delicious served with baby carrots and a  puree that I can't remember but oh man so good! For dinner I had the filet while my husband had the ny strip with bone marrow, to share we also ordered asparagus, mushroom & spinach along with pommes rissolees, these fried potatoes. Everything except the potatoes was delicious!  Just melt in your mouth delicious. Steaks were cooked perfectly, we were so stuffed. i dont know why my husband ordered a warm apple strudel because our server brought us an anniversary dessert which I noted in our reservations and we were in a food coma after that. I highly recommend this spot for a romantic dinner. Be prepared to spend some money but its worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. anniversary dessert

o0rN9PU6JeiZyS3U_Cgn1Q.text: Went here for Lunch during one of our random trip to Vegas. I seriously did not expect the food to be as good. You'd think that its a trap and that your only going to be paying for the SPECTACULAR view of the Bellagio fountains but we unfortunately were seated farther away from the fountains. :(   despite my disappointment the food and the service more than made up for it. The chocolate souffle was to die for! Our waiter was prompt, polite and friendly and the wine pairings were on the spot delicious!  All in all the place is beautiful and my fiance and I  definitely going back for dinner this June for our 8th anniversary. Its the PERFECT SPOT to celebrate and no other Restaurant will do. Hopefully we get window seats this time though, otherwise i think im just gonna cry. lol

0YB2IsYObNI5KCJyTb2I2w.text: Location, food, service, view...simply amazing...  Location..could this be any better? Inside the Eiffel Tower looking toward Bellagio water fountain show as sunset...Man...Perfect place to take my girl.   Food...We ordered the Sauteed Sea Scallops, English Peas, Alsatian Pinot Gris Jus for starter. I ordered the Roasted Rack of Lamb, Tarragon Jus, Tomato Tart and Slow Roasted Filet of Atlantic Salmon, Pinot Noir Sauce. The scallops was so tender and soft and has a very great sauce. mMM..The lamb was out of this world. The sauce was mM and the juice when you bite on it omg it's so delicious. It was perfect, they cooked it very raw so if you don't wanna eat something raw ask for medium cook. I said medium rare and it came out like that and I saw other people lamb was the same. The Salmon my girl said it was amazing as well.   Service..Can't say enough about their quality in service. Our server made us feel at home and very good at what he does. We ordered a bottle of wine and he opened, pour and did everything with such grace. A handkerchief over his arms, pour it gently. He came by very often to refill our wine glasses. He really make you feel like you're at a 5 star restaurant.   The View...Wow I can't say enough. The reason I picked this place was the view. The food and everything just came as bonuses. Watching the Bellagio water fountain show was nice. The view of the strip was amazing. It was the most romantic dinner me and my girl ever had. If I am In Vegas I will definitely come back to this place. There are so many other great dishes that I would love to try. I recommend this place. 5 stars!!

5J4tnjogmIIQM4E6mxZL5Q.text: My first experience here with my family was awesome. It was a nice surprise for us to see the kitchen when we got out of the elevator. We got to see that they were diligently preparing the food. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful. He answered all our questions and gave us good recommendations.   We ordered shrimp spaghetti veggies salad, slow-roasted filet atlantic salmon with pinot noir sauce, roasted semi-boneless chicken with butternut squash, and char broiled filet mignon with red wine sauce. We ended up trying each other dishes since all the food looked so yummy. The salad came with 6-7 jumbo shrimps! The salad tasted light and healthy. My salmon dish came out to be perfect. It smelled great and tasted soft and amazing with the pinot noir sauce. The chicken came out to be the biggest portion out of all our dishes. It tasted differently from the typical marinated chicken we usually ate. Although it was smallest portion, the steak turned out to be excellent. It was medium-rare cooked. It tasted tender and juicy with the red wine sauce. For dessert, we had the banana souffle. It's the best I've tasted!!! Highly recommended!!! Our bill came out to be almost $400...it was because we also ordered wine and cocktails.  Overall the atmosphere was very cozy and romantic. They have a gorgeous view, and the restaurant itself is nicely decorated. Great service throughout the dinner. Two reasons I didn't give it 5 stars: 1) food and drinks a bit overpriced 2) small food portion.  MY TIPS:  1) MAKE A RESERVATION, SO YOU DON'T HAVE TO WAIT. (YOU CAN'T REQUEST SITTING ARRANGEMENT, I TRIED)  2) THOUGH YOU DON'T HAVE TO DRESS-UP NICELY, I RECOMMEND IT SO YOU CAN TAKE PICS. PLUS IT'S FUN DRESSING UP. :D (THOSE WHO WORRY ABOUT DRESS CODE, YES YOU CAN WEAR JEANS, BUT WEAR IT WITH A NICE TOP AND YOU SHOULD BE GOOD.)  3) BRING A CAMERA, SO YOU CAN TAKE LOTS OF PICS!! (LADIES- WHEN YOU VISIT THE RESTROOM, TAKE YOUR CAMERA WITH YOU. IT HAS A NICE ARRANGEMENT. ;P)  4) FOR THOSE WHO WORRY ABOUT $$$ AND NOT BEING FULL ENOUGH, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU TO EAT A BIG LUNCH FIRST. IF YOU'RE GOING WITH A PARTNER, YOU CAN ALWAYS ORDER ONE MEAL AND SHARE. ANOTHER OPTION IS YOU CAN ALWAYS EAT DINNER SOMEWHERE ELSE FIRST, AND THEN STOP BY THIS RESTAURANT TO ENJOY SOME DESSERTS INSTEAD. YOU CAN NEVER GO WRONG WITH DESSERTS. (KIDS NOT RECOMMENDED BECAUSE THEY MIGHT NOT ENJOY/LIKE THE FANCY FOOD. PLUS I DON'T REMEMBER SEEING A KID'S MENU)  5) I RECOMMEND GOING WITH A DATE SINCE THE SETTING IS VERY ROMANTIC AT NIGHT, AND YOU WOULD HAVE A BETTER CHANCE OF SITTING BY THE WINDOW WHERE YOU CAN SEE THE GORGEOUS VIEW AND THE BELLAGIO'S WATER SHOW RATHER THAN WITH A BIG GROUP.  Enjoy your food!
