W2v-UvcikojTQyV2D5G1Yg.text: To me it was real expensive for not that amazing of a quality.  May be because the hotel itself is so old and falling apart compared to The city center.

xahCv9y7wNh0eqJyLN4GoA.text: Extremely expensive, but it's really all about the location and the view. You ride up an elevator from the casino and it opens right up with a view into the kitchen. The views of the Bellagio fountain are perfect. We sat down around 7pm and watched as sunset faded into evening and the fountains lit up at least four or five times while we were eating.  (Don't cheat yourself and get what you've paid for -- definitely get a table by the window with a view. Don't let them seat you in the back of the restaurant with a side view. Wait for a table in the front, make reservations for earlier in the evening, whatever it takes.)  The food was very good, but not like the best I've ever had. Get a souffle for dessert -- that was amazing. The service was good, but on par with what I would expect for a fancy French place.

faMBxH9LklsScqeafc1-Ew.text: The best part of this restaurant is the view.   The food is ok, nothing incredible and definitely over-priced, but the view!!! THE VIEW!! It's incredible.  They give you a complimentary little white fish appetizer (which I didn't care for at all). I ordered the lamb chops which were very good, but a little overcooked.   My colleagues enjoyed their food, but the restaurant was largely great because of the view and the ambiance.

JgkMoFOmDxn3BIpxm5lDAQ.text: I was a little disappointed. The food was overpriced and I made reservations to sit by the windows with a view. We arrived early and there was only 2 couples by the window, which left about 15+ tables open. They did not sit us by the window and told us those tables were taken?!?

i7pVG-LBJ_2qEi6YjMpmQw.text: In terms of food. atmosphere, taste and service....this place is excellent.  Been here several times and never disappointed.  Also, you get a great view of the Strip on top of that.  Great place for dinner and very romantic if you are on a date or special occasion.  A bit pricey...but if you want good food, service and IF YOU HAVE TO SPEND BIG BUCKS ONE NIGHT FOR DINNER...you won't lose on this bet like you would at the slot machines!

DCjJMBeLmhDngOpfP0zHfA.text: View of Bellagio water show is outstanding. Food was delicious! I may or may not have had their amazing banana souffle. (Yes, I did and would do again!)  The service was efficient. I dined alone and had made a 515 pm reservation to ensure a window seat. The efficiency is the reason for four vs five starts: the waiterade me feel it was more of a production than an experience. A bit more personalization would have got me to give five stars. It was def worth the money and time to eat here!

_H9AnQkr5VtOiykNnxcQlQ.text: Great food, great service, great view. The ravioli, the only vegetarian option, was amazing! The steaks were also very good. Of course, this place has the best creme brulee in town!

iwqifBY3k1VMa35mw3HObg.text: My wife and I made the trek to Vegas for Memorial Day to celebrate an early anniversary.  Initially we had reserved at Picasso across at the Bellagio, but with the heavy traffic we were forced to find other options.  We've been to Vegas countless times so we finally decided to try the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.  I have to say, it exceeded my expectations.  The dining room was a great rendition of those Parisian brasseries.  Although there were a few open seats that faced the window, the hostess could not accommodate us due to prior reservations.  We were pretty hungry so at that point, it wasn't worth the wait.    As it turns out, this was a bit of a serendipitous turn as we were waited on by one of the best waiters I've experienced in quite a while in Rodney.  From listening to our tastes, he was able to recommend us two delicious red wines that paired perfectly with the dinner selection that we chose.   Before we even started, we were served a nice amuse bouche of chilled avocado puree.  It was a nice palate cleanser and a welcome bite after such a long drive in.  Wanting to maintain that French theme, we chose the Fricassee of Wild Escargot, Potato, Sweet Garlic Souffle and the Roasted Foie Gras, Rhubarb Compote, Alsace Spice Croutons for appetizers.  Both were quite tasty with a nice balance of flavors.  The Foie Gras had a great compote that offset the richness of the foie gras itself.  Escargot is definitely an acquired taste, but that said, the fricassee was equally delicious over the bed of potato.  In between, Rodney continually checked on us and talked with us like old friends that haven't seen each other for a long time.    The main course itself, we chose the Muscovy Duck Breast, Camargue Rice, Pistachio, Sauce Foie Gras and the Boneless Farm Raised Rabbit, Braised Carrots Confits, Mustard Jus.  Just delicious.  I looked for both of these entrees in Paris last fall and to my surprise, I just had to come to Vegas for some real French food.  The duck was perfectly cooked and the rice had a very pleasant hint of orange folded with it.  The rabbit itself was slightly crispy on the outside and the meat itself was quite tender.  (Those who have never had rabbit before, it tastes like chicken mostly but it does have another unique flavor to it)  In addition we decided to supplement with the potato croquettes and the gratinee creamed spinach and mushroom.  (We also learned from one of the French staff that croquettes are not French).  Amazing.  Slightly crispy on the outside and the middle is similar to a mashed potato texture, its something I haven't had before.  The only minus points were the creamed spinach was a little too oily for my liking.  Save room for the souffle.  Its a can't miss.  We chose the pistachio (btw, i love all things pistachio - macaroons, froyo, etc.) but I can imagine the other flavors being just as good.  The dessert itself is quite light and the souffle itself has a texture similar to sponge cake.  Afterwards, Rodney surprised us with a plate commemorating our 2nd anniversary with a chocolate mousse in the center.  At that point, I was quite full, but i did manage to get a small taste of it.  As with the rest of the meal, delicious.  In closing, as someone who visits Vegas on a consistent basis, I look forward to celebrating our future events at the Eiffel Tower restaurant and would recommend others as well to experience the authentic French food and delicious desserts.

wnljEywILgEHGlN7Zr5Hug.text: WOW!  This is one of the best restaurants in the world that I have been to in my 45 years!  From the moment you step off the elevator you know that you are in the right place.  The ambience and views are amazing.  The food is absolutely equisitie.  The staff is top-notch and very attentive.  This is on our must list from now on every time we are in Las Vegas.

A7HIuYiVfNaqeUZJIZY5og.text: So begins the most expensive meal in my entire life. $89/person, 5 course tasting menu at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in Paris Hotel, Las Vegas. Was it spectacular? Yes it was. It was SO good. I've paid almost as much at other restaurants, but never quite as much which is why this is the most expensive meal ever. It was also the most filling and best meal!  My friend wanted to go somewhere with a view (not necessarily to go someplace to EAT with a view) and I figured HEY when in Vegas why not go eat at a nice place with a view. So we decided to go up the mini eiffel tower to have a late dinner (9:30pm). We had a late lunch at the Wynn Buffet.  Most of the entrees were close to $40. The appetizers were about $15-$20. So I figured why not go for the 5 courses for $89? It seems like an awesome deal. Triple the amount of food for double the price, essentially. The catch was everyone at the table had to do the tasting menu.  Course #1: Warm Maine Lobster Salad, Cauliflower and Romanesco It was simply delectable. For a salad there wasn't enough green for me but there was tons of lobster. The lobster was juicy and I'm glad they took the meat out of the shell for me already, lOl. I think what really made the dish was the sauce. It was creamy but not overpowering. I'm not a fan of creamy sauces usually because it's soo creamy and it makes me feel thirsty after eating it but this was just the right amount of creaminess. It went really well with the lobster.  Course #2: Cream of French Green Lentils, Braised Ham Okay when they first brought out the plate/bowl it just had this tiny chopped up braised ham in the middle and I was thinking... that's it? This tiny tiny piece of ham. And then the server said "wait, the soup is coming now" and this other person poured the soup into the bowl. The look of relief on my face? Yes, yes there was. However it was brown and that put me off cause I've never had brown soup, so I thought it was mushroom soup. (Yeah.. we didn't really remember what our courses were suppose to be because they take the menu away from you!). Boy was I surprised when it actually tasted good! That's all I remembered how it tasted, just good. I don't even remember the flavors. Just that I wasn't disappointed.  Course #3: Filet of Red Snapper, Salsify, Blue Kale, Marjolaien and Pine Nuts My FAVORITE dish of the meal & my life! It was SO freaking good. The red snapper was perfectly cooked. It was so juicy. I've had so many overcooked fish before and well mostly we like to deep fry the fish too. But this was just so good. Ughs, I don't know what those crispy things are called on top of the red snapper but they were SO GOOD. The best texture I've ever tasted. It was a great combination of crispy with the soft fish. The blue kale was great too! It wasn't overly salty like seaweed. This was a perfect dish.  Course #4: Venison Chop, Chestnut and Brussels Sprouts, Sweet Potato, Huckleberries Venison is deer meat! I did not know that. In fact when we were eating this we thought it was lamb. Wow. Nonetheless it was still a delicious piece of meat. I'm not a huge fan of lamb (mostly because I don't really eat it) but since it wasn't, I'm all confused. Because I thought the meat was gamey and a bit tougher than regular beef, so I knew it wasn't from a cow. Is lamb tough? However, reading about venison it seems that is the right texture for the meat. It's leaner meat than beef and has a tougher texture and tastes gamey. But I thought it was nicely seasoned. It really covered up the gamey taste. I only tasted a little so if it was suppose to be gamey without the seasoning and sauce I wonder how it would've tasted? Hms, I ponder. The sweet potato was a nice surprise. I thought it was mashed sweet potato when I first saw it but it's actually thinly sliced sweet potato. It was awesome! =) I'm also not a fan of Brussels sprouts but I don't know, I cleaned this plate and the other ones too. I ate EVERYTHING.  Course #5: Eiffel Tower Dessert - I chose Raspberry Napoleon, Vanilla Blanc, Manager Okay first off when they brought my dessert that little mound of vanilla JIGGLED. It was the most fascinating thing. I kept shaking my plate to watch the vanilla blanc jiggle, jiggle, jiggle. It was so hilarious. Yes, I am easily amused. Back to the dessert. Raspberries were sweet. There were tons of them. I love the cream filling. The coconut crisps were crispy and it was sweet and didn't taste much like coconut because I do not like coconuts. The vanilla blanc, although fun to watch, I felt wasn't sweet enough. It didn't have a strong vanilla presence so I felt like I was eating something pretty bland compared to it's partner the raspberry napoleon. Hms, maybe I should've eaten the vanilla blanc before the raspberry then it would've been tasty. Oh wells, I didn't eat it in that order.  Overall it was FANTASTIC. I would definitely recommend coming here but only if you decide you want to spend the money.

SwwmbARJbeYZtuaorzIzww.text: We would have given this a much higher rating, had we not had a problem with one dish, but more on that later.  The restaurant had a beautiful view of the strip, and a wonderful waitstaff.  The food was very good, although pricey and we did feel that for those prices we've had better food in other restaurants.  But what really put a damper on an otherwise lovely evening was when my son bit down on a bone in what was supposed to be a boneless dish of rabbit.  The waitstaff was quick to send over a manager to check on him and take his information should he have needed to have anything done, but the damage was already done.  He had such pain in his tooth and jaw that he left the restaurant early to go back up to the room, which just ruined the meal for the rest of us.

UVjR0b79B3KaXt56d6lgLA.text: Service is great but the food is just "meh."  I wouldn't go back here-- I went with friends for the view and the atmosphere.  It's definitely overpriced for what you get, and with hundreds of choices for delicious eateries in Vegas there's no reason that I'd ever eat here again.  Note: I was here for brunch, not dinner.

uaL7BW0vQUm65NSQFoRwTw.text: Food poisoning enough said.  Had to leave our show "O" early because of this food poisoning.  The maitre de was rude, cold and snobbish not even bothering to take our names when we arrived.  Service was wonderful as well as the chocolate souffle, but neither make up for being sick for the next 24 hours

b0ElreyCI-xESdmqUiakeQ.text: I'll admit, I was dubious about eating dinner at a replica of the Eiffel Tower and dining with a view of the Bellagio fountains instead of the Seine. But reviews for the Eiffel Tower restaurant were positive so I decided to give it a chance. I had an early reservation in order to see a Cirque show so was seated right at the window facing the strip. Great view, although in order to maximize the number of tables by the window there isn't much space between tables. Expect to be listening to the conversation at the next table, and vice versa.  Service was attentive and food was faithful to True French cooking. Monkfish was excellently cooked, although the portion was small. The chef did serve an amuse bouche of a pistachio soup. Souffle for dessert was good, but not great. Petit fours are served with the check. A loud group at the bar marred the romantic feel of the dinner somewhat. Overall a cool experience but don't expect to feel like you're in France.

69xcb1vS34NBS8dYXKtRdQ.text: Absolutely my favorite restaurant in Vegas!  The food is as good as it gets and the service is beyond impeccable.  If you're not in the mood for a full meal, sit at the bar and have a couple of appetizers and drinks.  The lobster salad is my current favorite!

WNOUQxWDLSmQta_LmLqoOQ.text: All the hype about this restaurant is True.  The views leave you speechless.  The waiter and all staff very pleasant and on their toes.  Food was excellent at lunch.  Take someone there for lunch and they will be very impressed.  Only negative is that there were some guests that were truly dressed inappropriately in way too short jean shorts.  Looked tacky in such a nice setting.

gudDZ0ppSJjkFk5O4nuojg.text: Over priced, I've had MUCH better French food elsewhere.  You are basically paying for the fantastic service and the view.  I go to restaurants for food, not the service or the view so unfortunetly I have to stop at 2 stars.

zAYs03Ki3cUSVKuUPLeKSw.text: Yes! Yes and yes! Beautiful view, delicious food, attentive service, intimate settings. This is the place to be to wow anyone. With spending in the air, be prepared to splurge, it don't fret, it is worth it all.

rupKNifHcY4LPGyssmKx-A.text: I took my husband and some of his family here for a reunion meal, and everyone loved the experience.  Laurent, the restaurant manager whom I contacted by email before our visit, ensured that we had a fabulous window table with an awesome view of the Bellagio Fountains.  Our wait staff gave us attentive, patient service.  And the chefs provided delicious meals.  My husband deemed his salmon with pinot noir sauce "the best salmon ever."  I was a huge fan of the Grand Marnier souffle and the expensive ($18) specialty cocktails.  Our four guests ordered versions of the filet mignon, and all seemed pleased except for the one who ordered her filet medium well (it was more well done, and therefore tougher, than she had expected it to be).  All of the sides (potato gratin, green beans, brussels sprouts, and mushroom spaetzle) were tasty.  The Maine Lobster salad was very good, though it's worth noting that it contained far less kale than I had expected, just a little taste rather than salad-like greens.  The meal was, of course, seriously expensive ($717 for the six of us, including tax and the mandatory 18% gratuity (the gratuity was, I assume, mandatory because we were a larger group)).  We knew that going in (the menu, with prices, is available on the restaurant's website), however, so we were not unpleasantly surprised.  If you can afford to ignore the cost, eating at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at Paris Las Vegas is a fun, tasty, memorable experience (the views truly are unforgettable).

VvyKNW-Yl4RMZzNh9Vw09g.text: This was my first high class, formal, classy dinner in Las Vegas and the Eiffel deserves 5 stars. From the matradee to the hostess to the server to the water guy we were treated with outstanding service.   While you can be more casually dressed here I do recommend dressing top the 9's to compliment the atmosphere, music, views and overall ambiance.  We were seated with the perfect view of the Bellagio Water Show and it was the best complement to our meal .  The only con I have has absolutely nothing to do with the Eiffel but one table of their customers. If you're turning 21, you are already drunk, looking for dinner, and you're in a group with 12 other 21 year olds please don't go here. Otherwise, if you're looking for one of the best places on the strip this is the place to go.  I'm not a wine drinker but if you are this is the place to be. There wine list is easily 20 pages with wines from all over the world. I had a few Bacardi Mojitos and they were perfectly done.   If you go here and order a steak medium, you'll get medium rare, your order medium well, you'll get medium. Just a heads up...  Here's what we ordered...with ratings...  Bacardi Mojitos (10 ea.) - perfect... Sweetbread appetizer (20)- small portion but incredible... Pea Soup w/ smoked trout (15)- perfect combonation and the smoked trout was to die for... NY Steak (49) - huge portion and perfectly done... Filet Mignon (47) - smaller cut but filling and perfectly done... Potato Gratin (18) - perfect size and best I've ever had... Chocolate Hazelnut Cake Desert (12) - perfect portion and the hazelnut makes this a great simple dessert.  Eiffel Chocolate Plate (12) - Sampler of 5 different chocolate desserts and each was better than the last. Incredible...  Food Quality: 5 star Spend-o-meter: It's up there...we spent 235 before tip (45)...for what we got, service we received, atmosphere, and view however I was expecting it to be much more. Value: I walked out feeling like I got the best end of the deal. Best meal and dining experience I've had in a long time.

3w_DkWkSJGTOn_XLRRK3Ug.text: Blech.  This place is an almost total rip-off.  Absurdly expensive.  The only obvious reason for people to book a dinner here is to watch the fountains across the street at Bellagio.  Seriously, the folks at Bellagio should charge some kind of royalty for the amount of business that the view generates.  Our waiter was in on the scam - he admitted that he wouldn't eat some of the items on the menu when we sent back the escargot app that one of us ordered.  My food ranged from poor to solidly average.  The atmosphere, despite the view, was so bustling that it was unplesant: waiters rushing all over and a too-warm temperature.  Certainly not what I would expect in a fine-dining restaurant.  The biggest insult was on the wine list where bottles ranged from 3-4 times the retail price.  When we left, we couldn't help feeling ripped off.

5owdIYWSFYNCBsI5M7-rjw.text: Nice place with a great view of the Bellagio Fountains.  Came here while we were waiting for our reservations at Mon Ami Gabi to have a couple of drinks.  Both of the drinks we had were very good. I forgot the name of them but mine had some fresh berries and champagne and my gf's was a fruity one with a strawberry type froth on top.

h79uHVbK6MvlHdy7jBdeGg.text: Wow!  We have been coming to Las Vegas for years and never even walked into this Casino or knew there was a restaurant.  We came with friends and decided to try it for Sunday Brunch.  OMG - the food was amazing and the views have to be the best kept secret in Las Vegas - it is walls and walls of floor to ceiling windows that overlook the Bellagio fountains and the fountains go off every 15 minutes on Sundays.  Did I mention that the food was GREAT and service was AWESOME.

vWQKHe9tYDq6Zm2jwQQIEA.text: We have had Thanksgiving dinner at the Eiffel Tower four times over the last six years, including this one.  All of our prior visits had been superb in every category.  This was an exercise in how can we make the most money serving the least quantity and quality food to an unsuspecting crowd.  There were only two choices for an appetizer:  one soup or one salad.  My salad might has well have been dumped straight out of a bag from the local supermarket.  The turkey was so, so with a tiny amount of boring gravy.  The pecan pie was good.  I had been a huge fan of this restaurant and all the prior visits were worthy of 5++ stars.  The whole family was looking forward to this wonderful experience together enjoying excellent food, great service and unbelievable views.  What we got was one of the most boring Thanksgiving meals ever, great service and unbelievable views.  Prices were astronomical, but we were expecting that.  But wait it gets better, then they had the audacity to charge $6 extra for the souffle after charging $79 for the meal.  Unreal!!!  The souffle was ok at best (no one finished theirs at our table which had never happened before).  We were all so let down and we will never visit for Thanksgiving again. This is what a restaurant does just before it dies.  Don't bother.  I should have known when I booked reservations the day before Thanksgiving with no problem that something was wrong!!!  I chalked it up to the horrible economy, not so Vegas was packed yesterday.  Oh well live and learn.

cxCCvq3V8VeDc0qTrgIVjQ.text: My fiance and I tried to go to the Eiffel tower for champagne and dessert.  We had one of our first dates at this restaurant and were feeling festive and in the mood to celebrate.  It was a Tuesday night so we didn't think they would be booked up but just in case I called ahead to see how busy they were and if we should make a reservation.  The lady on the phone assured us that they weren't that busy and that they should be able to find us a table but we didn't need to put our name in.  When we arrived, sure enough there were plenty of tables.  However, when my fiance asked to be seated, the hostess was very rude to him.  She spoke to him in a very condescending way as if he was not important enough to be seated and that we should have had a reservation.  It really ruined our love for this restaurant.  We decided to celebrate at Twist at the mandarian oriental instead and were treated with the hospitality one would expect.  We are locals and we will not be going back to Eiffel Tower.  We also will dissuade anyone who visits from eating there.  I'm really disappointed.

OJSO6PnyxcBbvwCAz1fWgg.text: Had dinner elsewhere but enjoyed the last part of dinner here. Desert and the view watching fountain show was perfect.

CzLiWDwF4LM3vtHRfbL-HQ.text: My brother told me to try out this restaurant but I was a little apprehensive.  It sounded a bit cheesy.  I was totally wrong.  The service was outstanding, the view was spectacular and the food was wonderful.  I loved my Sea Bass dish and there was some kind of apple dessert that was delicious. It made for a very memorable evening.

4BeWAQYEz74xuwv-LNV3bA.text: My first review on Yelp, but after this trip I decided it was time to give some major kudos!  The staff at the restaraunt were exceptional in making our 19th wedding anniversary a special one.  Thank you Jennifer for the best seat in the house and for the Happy Anniversary written in chocolate on the desert plate!  We were going to thank you on our way out but didnt see you.  So we decided we would do it here.  Our food and service were both great. If anyone has a special occasion to celebrate I would highly recommend this place.    Thanks again to Jennifer and her staff. James

y2iPjeqJ7JfRe2oMfTtWBw.text: Great dinner experience! Romantic views of the Strip and Fountain. Had the corner table at the windows and dinner entertainment was provided by an amorous couple in the Paris hot tubs directly below. Great fun! The Arctic Char was light and delicate, however, there was an over abundance of smoked beets and foam. The potato croquettes were delicious, and the NY Strip steak was cooked sufficiently. Service was excellent. The souffle to end the meal was to die for....especially with a black coffee. Off to see the Jubilee show shortly.

xjqR_JxLGbzRguDAISF_dg.text: A very romanic place to have dinner. Food was small but taste great. Great view, a little crowed for dinner but overall had a great time.

ijao1R9_WM3TMc1F9XXGBQ.text: Very nice atmosphere.  The server is not very attentive but i think that it is good in a way since, I would like to apend time enjoying the atmosphere and the nice view of the Bellagio's fountain.  I ordered a cream of corn soup, which is really good.  Got the duck breast as the main entry and that didn't disappoint me either.  Overall, great atmosphere and great food for fine dining.

aG0tE5igHFmk704RMRPh4w.text: Wow what a View! I had flowers delivered, so the Fiance was knocked out. I probably could have proposed to any girl in the world at the seats we had and gotten a yes! The cocktails we had were expensive but good, and the bartenders were very nice. We had the lamb and the beef wellington. I loved the steak inside the wellington and the accompanying sauce was great, but the crust was weird to me. The lamb was tender and awesome. The highlight was the oxtail, and scallops. So Beefy it was crazy, and it made me want to make it at home! The service was great as well. The souffle was good, i am not a souffle person I guess. Worth going to for a romantic meal, or a proposal dinner.

xxtGDlh_XOq4G1ONNx311g.text: I was invited to dinner at this restaurant with some business associates.  I was told that the view was incredible... color me impressed!  The view of the Bellagio water fountains (at night) was amazing!    This is a class establishment with a focus on service and it starts before you ever get on the elevator to the restaurant.  There is a gentleman on the first floor who helps you into the elevator and a gentleman that greets you as you exit the elevator to take you to the hostess.  The elevator opens into the kitchen so you get to see the staff working diligently to bring the food to the patrons' tables.  I was fortunate that one of the people I dined with was French and a wine aficionado; everyone agreed that the French wine he chose was an excellent selection.  As a starter, I had the butternut squash soup with double smoked bacon.  I played it safe with the entree; I chose the pheasant and wild berry risotto and green beans almondine.    Everything was outstanding including the wonderful breads that we were provided while waiting for our meal.  I topped off dinner with a caramel souffle... it was heaven in a cup.   The portions were appropriately sized for a French restaurant.  I left the restaurant very satisfied and very happy that I was invited.  It was truly a nice experience.  This restaurant would be a very nice place to bring a date for a romantic dinner.  I also believe that the prices were appropriate for the level of service and quality of food.  I look forward to eating here again next time I'm in Vegas.

QOakZ5jJQbw8dnqFvjRb5Q.text: Went with the girlfriends to take at look at the view. It was fine but nothing to write home about. Snapped a picture and surveyed the place. At the lowest priced drink being $16 it's not at all inexpensive but the cocktail was at least strong and tasted good. The collared shirt review is hilarious since one of my tomboyish girlfriends was left to dress herself and came up to meet us in a t-shirt and sweatpants with no problems!

HTwc4yoWOhxn66SngACKUw.text: Food was good, wasn't sure about the mushroom foam they gave to me and my date before we ate, but it was good. Very elegant, the view of the fountains is always a favorite I feel. It's romantic in a non cheesy way.

kQNffZO4jdY1kIa4itBxqQ.text: Celebrated a bachelorette/bachelor party dinner here with a group of 12. We didn't have to wait long to get seated.  The space between the seats were kind of tight-it is like that all around.  Service was great--fast and efficient. We had wine with dinner and the sommerlier was nice. Our wine glasses were never empty--we had a total of 4 bottles.  They had a good selection of bread, server comes around to ask which one you want. Tried the foie gras---delicious.  They are known for their chocolate souffle but I am not a dessert person-didn't get it but others did and said they were good...you be the judge.  Really enjoyed it here and would come again.  The views were good from our table which was in the middle--suggest getting a table along the windows.  We had a good view of the Eiffel Tower.  My dish was yummy-makes me want to come back to try other dishes.  We had a great time here and would come back.

tbOxes6Jfuu8SzlGDG72Fw.text: The view is magnificent from here and the servers are really friendly and helpful. The food wasn't particularly great but it wasn't too bad.

j6Ok-td3PWBjR28vOX_afg.text: This place was recommended to me by a friend the first time I went to Vegas and was not able to go. On my recent trip to Vegas I definitely had to go. We made our reservations for dinner early while we strolled through the casino. The woman made it very clear that there was a dress code. We arrived for dinner 30 minutes before our reservation but were seated anyways. I couldn't believe the view its breath taking. Between all the Vegas lights and the Bellagio fountain show about every half hour I was mesmerized. When the menu came I was very intimidated and surprised at how small it was. The prices were very up there. This is the most expensive restaurant I have ever been to in my whole entire life I'm not much of a food critic. I ordered the filet mignon in the bearnaise sauce with the spinach and mushroom, the waiter did an excellent job answering my questions and helping me choose a wine. My boyfriend ordered the flatiron steak. We received an asparagus mousse compliments of the chef which I thought was very sweet I'm not sure if they do this for everyone. The food is a decent amount and all of it was delicious nothing out of this world though. I recommend it for a romantic intimate dinner a man even proposed to his wife while we were there (she said yes) it really was one of the most amazing views. The check came out to about $200 including tip. For the money I feel like we could've gone to another swanky Vegas restaurant and gotten a better dinner but it's just one of those things you have to experience. I was scared of a snotty establishment but the staff were all sweet and helpful.

cRV67d7ZftxvgdPc2VJQ6w.text: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant has excellent dinners, but is very expensive. Probably the best, most expensive meal I have ever had. I wanted to see the inside and go up to the top, mostly because I haven't made it to Paris yet. The restaurant is very elegant and offers a great view of the Strip and the Bellagio Fountain Show.   I suggest making reservations and get a window table. Neither of which we did by the way :-( It was a last minute deal and it was on a Monday night, so we thought we would wing it. We didn't have reservations so we decided to wait at the bar and have a drink.   We ordered 2 glasses of wine, a Shiraz and a Riesling, whoaaaa $46!!! I made no reaction, which my girlfriend liked because the couple next to us that ordered 2 drinks, yeah his eyes almost came out of their sockets...lol. Anyway, we waited almost an hour and the bartender, JR, said we could eat at the bar, which we did. He was very nice and helpful giving us Vegas tips on restaurants and clubs. Also, there was much entertainment between the three bartenders as two of them kept making fun of the "new guy".   Once dinner finally came, it was excellent. I had the salmon which was cooked perfectly. Also has the asparagus which was great. In the end the total was $260 for food and wine. I would probably go again if I had a little extra $$ to spend.   Just a tip, it is a little upscale as I said. As we were going in, there were other people who had come back from their hotel because the guys were not allowed in with sandals or any open towed shoes. Ladies of course were allowed. I was wearing Dockers and a collared shirt. Most people were pretty dressed up.

n_rNddoFBY8862kn53husQ.text: We celebrated my mom's 80th b-day. Oh my God I like their food, the best food ever. Just enough servings and the taste is excellent.

OUhtG13hWAyfZCdSl5fmAw.text: Went here for drinks & dessert. Loved everything we tried & the view was awesome. However it is crazy expensive. But worth it for a special occasion.

Z3qQinOM46aJS0qiJM_hIA.text: I love this restaurant and I can't wait to return in the future! Not only is this restaurant beautiful but it has amazing views of the water show and the food is fantastic! The fish, lamb, and chocolate souffle were to die for!  This is one of my favorite restaurants!!!

U09bLq16dEHKUtLv3lEjdA.text: My fiance and I love good food. We dine in some of the finest restaurants all over the world. We are fortunate enough to be from New York so we know good food. I have walked by this restaurant many times and I always wanted to try it because it has a great view. We decided to stop in for lunch one day and just loved their food so much that we went back every night that we were there. I really enjoyed their food very much, and I also thought the service was great and the prices were reasonable. Very nice place to have lunch or dinner and the view is just amazing. This is one restaurant I can't wait to revisit when we go back to Las Vegas.

eJD45P14M1a36d6Bwc3yXg.text: Classic.  Beautiful.  Opulent.  If you want to celebrate a joyous occasion or impress a lady in Las Vegas, take her to the Eiffel Tower restaurant.  It may not be similar to Altitude 95, the actual restaurant on the first floor of the Eiffel Tower in Paris, but the food, not the views, come quite close.

kWFUx0-yRc-OTscpNkwMEg.text: The birthday boy wanted to come to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for dinner,. the birthday boy gets what he wants,..  After a long day of walking the strip and checking out different restaurants and their menus,.. we finally made a decision to eat at the Eiffel Tower,. despite the fact that,.. I know the boys REALLY wanted to eat here, cause they were gambling on some basketball games downstairs and wanted to stay close so they can pick up their winnings?! :)  Anywho,..  We were around the Eiffel Tower about 4pm and the security was nice enough to escort us up the tower and showed us around the restaurant.  Dress Code is enforced,.. so the boys had to go back to the hotel room and change :)   I would suggest in making reservations before coming to the restaurant.  I noticed quite a few people were waiting infront to get seated.   The view was breathtaking,. and I couldn't stop staring out the window during dinner.  We were seated slightly close to the window and was able to catch the water show at Bellagio.  We ordered the steak, rack of lamb, black cod prepared in a bag?,. a side of asparagus and cream spinach/ mushrooms.  The entrees didn't stand out to me, but the side order of the "cream spinach/mushrooms" was yummmy!  We wanted to order the creme brulee, but our waiter said they were sold out! x__X ,. we ended up skipping dessert =(* maybe next time!  Our waiter did bring out a special treat for the BIRTHDAY BOY!  As we were walking out to the elevator, I kindly asked a man to take a picture for my friends and I,. the man hesitated for a good minute and stated he was the photographer,. BLAHBLAHBLAH and took the photo for us.  He didn't seem to friendly and was a bit awkward,. it seemed like he was butthurt that I wanted to take a photo with my digital camera and not his,..   MINUS ONE STAR, thanks to the RUDE and DISRESPECTFUL camera man!  Other than that,.. everything was A OK!

9GEy_z5i3uPtDU3__iIiSQ.text: I ate here awhile ago and for starters, the food was really amazing. This place is the go-to place in Vegas for a tasteful and rich night out. However, I did not like how most of that nights service was. I went with my best friend and our mothers. We are underage and are not legally to drink but allowed but our mothers wanted to order us a drink to have with our dinner. Our mothers told the waiter that they wished to do so and he did not allow it because it would cost him his job. TOTALLY UNDERSTAND! BUTTTT after he left our table he informed the whole restaurant crew and security and they watched us like HAWKS while we had our dinner. Very unprofessional and low-class for such a great restaurant. Props to the chef! but bad service.

Z5S5gn0ObOetlJWRdzcEQA.text: Went here for lunch today to with friends to celebrate our anniversary and my birthday. Could not have been happier!!! We were a table of junior senior citizens :) and our server TODD could not have been more attentive or friendlier...he just played the game with the ladies(..that we started) perfectly! 2 of us had the Parmesan crusted chicken which was outstanding and  2 had the steak sandwich that they loved and one had the trout and he said it was perfect. The cream  onion soup was a hit. We ordered all the deserts and made a buffet..ha the Creme broulette was my favorite but all were exceptional ' The specialty drinks were great. We got special deserts for our celebrations. Saying happy birthday and happy anniversary in chocolate on the plate. The star of the show was the service!!!  Todd could not have handled these crazy old ladies better!! He was handsome and quick with his wit!! My best birthday ever!!! Thank you Eiffel Tower restaurant!!!!

dm0Xic8t_xamKk8iOF15ug.text: Best meal of my life and worth every penny!! Fabulous wine recommendations by the sommelier. The blue cheese souffle is a must for an appetizer. I then had the duck breast for dinner which was everything I expected. What really stole the show was the pistachio souffle for dessert! Delicious!! Made my graduation dinner one I'll never forget.

aK50P9Vhh_Dxi7y3DPtsMg.text: Great view, food, and service. My GF and I went here to celebrate my return home from deployment. Wonderful experience!

R4zN9onPSbLqsXtcEySpeg.text: Last time I ate here was seven years ago for my first wedding anniversary. Eiffel Tower was my first high dollar meal. It was so good that I'm returning to give it the five stars it deserves. Here's why:  1. Very best view of the strip 2. Outstanding service 3. Amazing food at a (fairly) reasonable, fine-dining price.  4. Perfect atmosphere (great lighting, comfortable chairs, lovely windows, well-placed tables, unobtrusive music).  Compared to Renoir at the Mirage (which closed the year after we tried it), the prix fixe menu was half the price and twice as good.   The most memorable part of dinner was the Foie gras. It was love at first taste and I have not had better versions of the same dish since.  If you're just looking for a great view and place to chill, without dropping hundreds, hang out at the bar.   FYI, I think flip flops are sexy on men, but this place disagrees. Dress shoes are required for the boys.

rL2228oxpe9spw7ky6m0eg.text: Extremely rude and headstrong receptionist at the elevator. Looked at us as if we didn't belong there..didn't even bother to answer our queries..was very dismissive. It was very insulting and we returned without going to the restaurant. And also will never go back.

G_L5K-xjSwpA-9rbLlwo8Q.text: Just tried Eiffel Tower Restaurant for an early Anniversary dinner. LOVED IT! Great place for a special celebration. The tables on either side of us were also celebrating anniversaries. My partner and I both had the tasting menu for $89 per head, and then ordered a half bottle of wine, and a couple of upgrades...like the Baked Camembert (could have skipped it), and the Chocolate Souffle (worth it!). Overall worked out to about $125+ per person. Somewhat pricey, but for the great Bellagio Fountain views, excellent service, creative and tasty dishes, and reasonably sized portions...it's definitely worth it for the special occasion. Tasting menu had: - Crab corn chowder - Pretty good, Nice presentation - Mediterranean Sea Bass over Quinoa - Very tasty, very inventive quinoa prep with chicken stock, champagne butter reduction and crispy shallots. - Veal with mushrooms - Only OK - Choice of dessert, upgrade charge for souffle - definitely worth the upgrade. For best views and ambiance (for couples, anyway), get the table right by the windows, and get there by 6:30pm (during summer) to get the full range of time-of-day views...sunset through night time...it's breathtaking. Definitely coming back.

jRwzVT02pZWXmuWy0K0fig.text: Was there a couple of weeks ago to celebrate her 21st bday!!! She surprised me by saying we were heading here for dinner.    The atmosphere and food was awesome.   The souffle was awesome. They did help celebrate her BDAY with an extra dessert surprise. The ambience and view made the price worthwhile...and the food was the kicker.  The only thing that we had issue was with a/c that was blowing right over us...so at the end of the dinner..we were pretty cold.

74Mn_FBqNwor3G_LVCoimg.text: I came here with my girlfriend we knew up front that this was going to be expensive but we put it in the back of our minds and enjoyed it for it was. The place is an awesome restaurant the views are spectacular and the vibe is very romantic. The food was delicious. I ordered the beef Wellington which I've never had before it was really good. My girl ordered the steak and said it was the best steak shes ever had which means alot because we've had some really good steak in Chicago. The breads they came passing around were really good too. Bill was around $250 with tip which was pretty good cause we also tried like 3 sides. Afterwards we took the elevator to the top of the Eiffel tower which ended up being a catastrophe cause my girl is terrified of heights which I didnt know lol. She ended up gripping the wall for dear life she literally had tears in her eyes so we didnt stay long. Overall very nice memory though.

R18sotk19vydmawJ716Khw.text: Spendy but the views are stunning, especially if you're lucky enough to get a table facing the Bellagio and it's spectacular fountain show.  The food was good but not worth the money by itself.  We loved the chocolate souffle and the creme broulee. Oh, men need to wear long pants.  We didn't know that and they let us borrow a pair.

RFXx5F815Yg4dbc3smKXdw.text: To ensure that my dinner plans would go smoothly I spoke to a manager and made reservations with Paris hotel and the restaurant for about 2 months in advance, as well as having placed down a large deposit.  However, when I arrived on that day, I was met with terrible service as my dinner did not go as originally planned.  I spent close to $1000 for this event for two people, and should have been given better service for a small piece of steak, some veggies, and soup.  I would not recommend eating here, as I went to MGM's Joel Robuchon the very next day, and received exceptionally better food and service for about the same price.  So for if you want great French food and service go to Joel Robuchon, as the Eiffel Tower was a terrible experience for me and I would not come back to eat here ever again.

KnhQ_X7HHzDR2ROUe3Lfig.text: All I can say is get the Beef Wellington! It is amazing! This is the second time I have been here. Both times the service was outstanding and the food was as good as it gets. I wanted to try something new this time but I just couldn't pass up such a difficult to find and tasty dish!

pq0LXoMvRR-rLUvUdu2Tmg.text: We love this restaurant.  The food is delicious and tasty, and the view is gorgeous.  Service was great too.  We'll be back on our next trip to Las Vegas.

i2oq6J_NeDuPiN7S22DWmQ.text: If you get the right table, you do get a lovely view. But it is SO crowded that I can't believe the Las Vegas Fire Marshalls allow the number of people they squeeze in.  Scary crowded. Food is WAY overpriced.....and not very good. kind of blah. The food is "French Wannabe", not really French, not really anything to tell the truth expect too expensive and dull. Go up, see the view and LEAVE.

u1TFVSrz7mH4g_2ho8YZwQ.text: This is a "do not miss" spot. Having eaten in Paris on the "tower", we were excited to experience this Vegas style. We had a great meal , a great table , a great picture , and a top waiter (John Anthony) who artfully wound us through a terrific dining experience. Truly one of the best meals we had in Vegas, add in the view and this was magic. Thanks Eiffel Tower.

HKnHnrzClAZBNoNoScnhrg.text: This restaurant always reminds me of the Rainbow Room in NYC, one can always grab a seat at the bar and dine if you don't have reservations.... It's part of the "Lettuce Entertain You" Group, and is also on "Open Table." The Bartenders are a really great group... and the food is marvelous. Plus the view... Bellagio Fountains the Paris Balloon, and City Center... one could not ask for more... (tip: very pricey)

y2uMC3QIBxH776r2Hq2TXA.text: My fiance booked a table at the Eiffel Tower restaurant last Sunday for a very important occasion--he was proposing! If you want to snag on of the fabulous window tables with the gorgeous view of the strip, they will only guarantee those table for reservations before 6pm. Otherwise it's fist come, first served.  Our reservation was at 6:30, and they were able to seat us by the window on a Sunday night. We started the meal with a strawberry basil mojito. It was pretty delicious except it was served with a metal straw, which gave it a slightly metallic taste. We opted to try the tasting menu at $98 per person to try a little bit of everything.  Honestly, I will agree with some of the other reviewers that the best part of this experience is not the food. However, my favorite part of the meal was the oyster in the amuse-bouche with caviar on it. Also, their baguette bread was actually excellent and probably the best I've had outside of Paris. Have some! The Maine lobster salad and the rack of lamb were tasty, but the corn soup and the halibut were sub-par.   For dessert we ordered the caramel souffle and the passion fruit meringue with champagne sauce. My fiance proposed right before dessert came out and he was able to pull it off discretely without causing a big scene luckily. Although all the tables by the window are very close to each other, facing out onto the Bellagio fountains made the experience more private and intimate. I was too overwhelmed to eat much of the dessert, but the little bit I had didn't blow me away at all.  The only people to really noticed we got engaged were the couple next to us who generously sent over two glasses of champagne for us since they were on honeymoon. The restaurant did absolutely nothing for us to congratulate us, which was a bit of a disappointment for me. I heard a statistic that 300 couples get married in Vegas every day, but these are still very special moments for people that should be treated as such.  Overall, this is a nice place to go to for a special occasion but I would not recommend splurging on the tasting menu. Go for the view and the bread!

ZvaYyOrd2BD80O_vCPy7gQ.text: This was my first time to Vegas "doing it right." On a whim, I decided to get a table at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant as it did have a great view of the Fountains. We were a bit early about 6 or 6:30, so the restaurant was not filled yet. We entered from the elevator right into the kitchen viewing area. Not sure of the reason for this, but it's nice that you can view the kitchen at work if you want to. But I don't think entering the restaurant to this area is the best idea. Anyway, we rounded the corner to a beautiful restaurant and bar area. The hostess greeted us and we were seated in just a few minutes. I think this was so we could take the place in for a moment (which we did.) We were seated near the far corner, about center of the Bellagio. I was excited as this was my GF's first trip to Vegas and this was the place to see the fountains. Unfortunately they didn't start until 7, but that was ok, because we got to meet our waitress, Alix. She was one of the most pleasant and professional wait staff I've ever encountered. She was on it from the moment she arrived. The Champagne was wonderful, as were the Filet and the Salmon. Finally during the meal, the fountains started. It was a great vantage spot and the GF loved it! Dessert was a small cake and ice cream. A great restaurant is measured by many things and The Eiffel Tower hit them all for me.

TLBQ7ELoC8ufJ9mfgbFpvw.text: Just the best! Our waiter,Roman, was superb and the food and view were worth every penny spent. Amazing from the moment you walk in to the elevator trip down and Lyle and his staff make sure every detail is perfect. The lamb was the best I have ever had and the black cod dish had flavors we had not experienced before in a fish dish. The timing was perfect with each course and this will remain a very special place in our dining experiences for a very long time.

-XjJl3NltI3KO-CM0mZPvQ.text: I had an amazing brunch at Eiffel Tower with my mom. The entire experience was worth while. We had a great view of the Belagio water fountain show. Both my mom and I ordered their lobster eggs Benedict- SOOOO GOOD! It was my mom's birthday and they brought out a nice sweet treat. She was born in Paris so this was the perfect birthday brunch. Can't wait to return for more lobster Benedict.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My mom&#39;s birthday treat.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now i really can&#39;t wait to go back for this
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster eggs Benedict was so good!

h4fW2UHtnA3FMlOphROnYw.text: Came here for dinner on Sunday night to celebrate my mom's birthday. The service was excellent, and we had a really nice view of the strip/the water show at Bellagio across the street.   We had the Slow Roasted Filet of Pacific Salmon, which was good but nothing crazy. It had a nice crust on top. We also had the muscovy duck breast which was delicious- cooked perfectly so it stayed moist, on top of a bed of cooked fennel and some broccolini on the side. For dessert, they brought her a little chocolate mousse with a candle in it, and we also ordered their version of an apple pie as well which was divine. Overall, good place, nothing crazy.

VpxNxR_HdruLRB5ufyPZNQ.text: My friend made reservations here for her birthday dinner. Eiffel Tower Restaurant did not disappoint at all. We had a table for 4 right by the window and had a prime view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. The bar also has some nice views as well, we went a little earlier than our reservation so we could have a pre-dinner cocktail.   Chris, our server, was fantastic. He was super attentive, funny, and patient since we couldn't decide what we wanted to order. He also helped us pick out a fantastic bottle of wine that would compliment our entrees.   I ordered the "Not your ordinary" caesar salad as a starter and oh my it was so good. They make their own caesar vinaigrette and toss the salad right in front of you. The dressing was so good my friends were dipping the fresh French bread into it. For an entree I ordered the queen filet with the Bordelaise sauce. My steak was cooked to perfection (medium rare) and the sauce, oh the sauce was so so delicious especially with the side of assorted mushrooms I ordered.   We also ordered dessert and after dinner drinks. Everything was fantastic overall, and I would definitely go back again on my next trip to Vegas.

sWXBOl9s9l14f5lJxvyhUA.text: View and ambiance: The view of the Bellagio fountains from this place is probably the best, it even beats the views of the fountains from the Bellagio itself. Make sure you ask for a window seat facing the fountains. We're there for our anniversary dinner and got a window seating, just what we had asked for. The interior is dimly lit and that makes the ambiance very romantic.   Wine: They have a great wine selection. Our server was warm and courteous and knowledgeable on wine. We took his recommendation and odered a half(small) bottle champagne. We liked it so much that we ended up ordering another full bottle.   Food: The food was great. The lobster and salmon we ordered were well presented and tasted great. It could be better though, since its vegas and there's a world renowned restaurant at every corner of the strip, food is at par but not better than others. But hey, we're there to have a good time with a good view. No complaints with food.   Overall: If you are looking to have a good view of the strip/fountains while sipping a fine wine or a romantic dinner then this place gets my vote.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent champagne. Highly recommended. Suggested by our server.

tMt0nMdRrrdBjolItSOHLQ.text: In fairness the first time we were there two and a half years ago was absolutely amazing which is why this time in Vegas we saved an entire evening for dinner here instead of seeing a show. I made the reservation months in advance and we had to wait 15 mins but that really wasn't the issue. I have no problem spending good money on a meal but the meal has to deliver. My wife's salad wasn't any better than you'd find at an Applebee's like chain restaurant and her cauliflower steak just tasted like regular cauliflower for 30 some bucks. My meal was very tasty and the desert was good. Props to the sommelier for the good wine selection. I thought this would be a Vegas staple for us but I think there are better ways to spend our money while here. Very disheartening. Additionally, the dress code which they boast on their website was clearly not enforced as there were gym clothes everywhere.

_EFTW6Rk1VQBGNsdg_qtnQ.text: What a fun experience. Before being seated there's a bar to get your drink on while waiting. I highly recommend getting a table next to the windows so you can see the fountain show at the Bellagio. The tables are a bit small by the windows but it's worth the view.   As for the food everything was beautifully presented, and tasted like heaven.  I think the pictures will speak for themselves!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. When you step out of the elevator you get to see the chefs at work!
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Supreme, Alsace Knefla, Crimini Mushroom, Shallot, Sauce Madeira
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

40wsXYf0g7IYU0u7LB6MEg.text: Great restaurant for dinning with a view of the Vegas strip. Breakfast was great and at a reasonable price bearing in mind you are paying for the overhead. French toast was good but not great like the one at the Aria in Bardot's. I recommend the steak and eggs and getting there at 9:45 am for the weekend only breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet

qCLHFQ9nTAAqcWP8deGX4Q.text: Loved the experience here. It was my partner and I first time here and we loved it. We both ordered two different appetizers and two different entree's. He was more of the seafood and I opposite.  I loved the view from here but unfortunately did not get to sit at the outer parts of the restaurant.  Overall great experience!

Pn7nlttNk2BkfiheNDRhVg.text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!  It was my first day in Vegas and my friend had planned a surprise meal for me, I had never heard of this restaurant and I didn't know the name of it until shortly after we arrived.  From the get go, everyone was so wonderful! The woman at the podium of the elevator, the hostess at the top of the elevator (who took our coats), the bartenders, and the restaurant hostesses were all amazing! Not to mention the service from Egor (one of the waiters). Everyone here makes you feel at home. Despite the amazing atmosphere and the great food I never felt out of place here. Thank you so much for your hospitality and amazing service!  The view we had of the city from our table was unlike anything else. We could see the fountain outside of Bellagio, and down the street to the Cosmopolitan. It was getting darker while we ate and it was amazing to see the lights come on in Vegas, for the first time, at this amazing view.  My friend ordered the tasting menu and the chef was kind enough to let her do it despite me not wanting to! I myself ordered the salmon.  My friend's first tasting platter arrived, but I also received one! That was so awesome of the chef and the waiter for making that happen! I was thrilled to have the extra food and to try the unique cuisine. My favorite thing on the testing menu was the scallop.  Soon my smoked salmon arrived and it was spectacular! There was SO much flavor. Some of the best food I've ever had. Nothing at this restaurant tastes similar.  For dessert we got the souffle and it was so so amazing! Everything here exceeded expectations and it was such a wonderful experience for me.  Thank you so much for making my early birthday celebration a memorable one. I would 100% love to come back here.  Atmosphere: 5/5 Service: 5/5 Food: 5/5 Cost: 4/5 (Actually less than I thought it would be, my salmon was only 49) Total: 5/5

XJzCn2aXGOy4JW0VipyKQw.text: We went here with a group of friends we know in the Las Vegas area, and best of all, we didn't had to pay! So for the dinner, I went with a Alaskan Halibut, I felt the Halibut was perfect, one of the members went with the Octopus, No thanks! lol, but my wife went with the Pacific Salmon, I had a bit and it was also delicious!  The group also went with a Trilogy of Imported Osetra Caviar which had Golden, Russian and Siberian- I never had Caviar before, my favorite was the Golden Caviar. For drinks, of course went with beer lol With the Caviar was a pretty hefty bill! But since I didn't had to pay for it, was worth the experience!

3Zu4O729CFGZZH1XvWfKWQ.text: Lovely restaurant to visit for a special occasion. You need a reservation and there is a dress code.  If you want a window table you need an early reservation. We were seated in the row right behind the window tables and it was perfect. Comfy booth, dim lighting, great view. The service is excellent- this place hustles!  The menu has great options, of course it is pricey.  We had the auld fashioned signature drinks and omg they were delicious. We had an issue with our food not coming out but they rectified it quickly and offered us dessert which was a nice gesture.  Our steaks were a little under for our taste but they were tender. The chicken was also really good. If you're looking for a special dining experience and don't mind spending a lot this is the place to go to.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vow1KKgK-LK71IjGpVyHlg.text: The food menu was mildly interesting. The appetizers were so fancy that between the price and the description, I wasn't enticed to order one. The taste of the food was great, and the service was wonderful. The view was spectacular. I feel like what you get for your money here, the price is a bit inflated. Without appetizers or desert my wife and I spent over $250.00 on our meal. A nice experience, but get ready to spend some money.

_43FWwHMq_BjLQH3Fam_WA.text: As soon as you enter you are greeted with such hospitality from all of the staff.  We made a 4:30 reservation to receive a window seat. We got to see the Bellagio water show during our dinner.  Food was amazing! I ordered the roasted chicken breast which was full of flavor.  Ordered a pink velvet cocktail. Fruity drink, the water flavor shines through.  Hotel offered us a complimentary anniversary dessert: chocolate mousse in a shot glass.   Or table was a little wobbly. Husband leaned on it to move around in his seat and it shifted the entire table and he spilled our drinks. Luckily hotel staff was very sweet and brought me another.  They have a photographer come around and take your photo. $25 for digital copies.  Food is pretty pricey, but so worth it.

B2Hrq4fGAX1K_frPID8tLw.text: I had so eating here for lunch! From the appetizer & pallet cleanser to the main course..twas bomb. Most importantly, you could tell the staff was well trained for fine dining. In short, well run and well staffed. Next time you go, get a drink from Daniel the beard model and request John S. I'm not super polished with my fine dining skills and they made me feel welcomed and were funny. Thank you for the experience

mIO6nUI-D1n9oIh9QVD_Aw.text: Fantastic views, great service, in a very romantic setting on the strip.  We had an amazing wedding reception in the restaurant 5 years back and wanted to stop in again to celebrate our anniversary. They were able to order a mini version of our wedding cake and had it waiting for us post meal. They really do a great job of making you feel special. Can't wait to come back.

geAzKboSRcMDZUcmYc7Gew.text: The Eiffel Tower restaurant is located in the Paris Hotel right on the Las Vegas strip. While Las Vegas is now known as a foodie city with celebrity chef restaurants earning Michelin stars, the Eiffel Tower is not one of them. It does however boast a great view of the strip, including the Bellagio fountains. If you plan your dinner appropriately, you can watch that spectacular show. That might make up for the hit and miss entrees.   We stopped into the restaurant for lunch one day and had no trouble getting in. We were seated by the windows to enjoy the view and provided water and menus promptly. I had a glass of red wine that was so-so but my friend enjoyed her eggnog cocktail. She also liked her appetizer of avocado, lobster, shrimp, and crab. I on the other hand had the New York Strip steak and was quite disappointed. The first thing that annoyed me is that my steak arrived drowning in some sort of red-brown sauce. There was no sauce mentioned on the menu and I am not a steak-sauce type of gal. I took a bite and quickly realized that the steak quality could be compared to Applebee's. Seriously. The texture was off and the flavor lacking, which I'm guessing is why they chose to try to hide it with steak sauce. It didn't work.   In short, the Eiffel Tower restaurant seems like a very touristy dining venue and I can't recommend a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Strip Steak with Cabernet Butter, Green Beans, Potatoes, &amp; some sort of sauce that wasn&#39;t in the menu description

7kjD-3JLtJLbqGdWjHY-mQ.text: I made reservations for dinner at the Eiffel Tower for my moms birthday on Wednesday 1/3/2018 at 745. It was such a great experience and the food was better than I had expected! A lot of the times at touristy places such as this one, the food isn't always up to par, but throw that out the window because it's hand down delicious!   For starters we ordered the spring salad and butternut squash soup with duck confit. The soup was absolutely fantastic! The sweetness from the squash with the Crispiness of the duck was the perfect mix! For our entrees we got the chicken and filet mignon with a side of Brussels sprouts, potatoes au gratin and mashed potatoes. My mom said the mashed potatoes we beyond creamy and the best she's ever had. The Brussel sprouts were fantastic and the bacon mixed it was the perfect addition. The potatoes au gratin had the perfect amount of cheesiness to them! My filet was over cooked and burned/charred in some areas, but it was ok.For dessert we got the grand marnier and the apple crisp souffles. Very delicious and light. Not heavy leaving you overly full.   So why the 4 stars? Well because our waiter was not friendly and good at all! All of the tables around us, he went into detail about all of the dishes and their service was fantastic. He dropped off menus, helped other tables around us who sat down 15 minutes after we did, then came got our order. Asked if we wanted to put souffle orders in because it would take 30 minutes and we never saw him again until the check came. We had no idea their were other desserts! Really wish he would have given us more time and attention.   Overall, it was worth it! The food was great and the views of the city and bellagio foundations were pretty fantastic.

IIaG_sPAr6a1KvwBI7Kx2w.text: My wife and I enjoyed the food here, we both really believed they served better food than the 58 Tour Eiffel Restaurant in Paris, and the price was quite reasonable, we got a seat overlooking the fountains of Bellagio which was incredible... highly recommend you go check this place out.!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room

HMAYha4FTLPSAzJVFK7Cag.text: Can't begin to explain the Excellent experience we had at this establishment but this is a definite attempt.  My fiance and I came here to vegas for the McGregor/Khabib fight. We had been wanting to go to this restaurant together for quite some time now as we're vegas regulars.   We made reservations a couple hours before our actual seating time. They were surprisingly very accommodating even though it was an extremely busy weekend in lieu of the fight. We had a great view and were sat in a section with a gentleman named "Guillermo" who was our waiter and an absolute legend. We kindly asked Guillermo to send the Sommelier over, we discussed what we were having and we chose a perfect bottle of wine to complement our food.   The Food was absolutely Decadent. Steak with Foie Gras, crab oscar, etc, makes my mouth water thinking about it.  All In All this place is 2 thumbs up. But more importantly the service was superior to a lot of other places i've eaten right off the strip.  Guillermo told us that he worked his way up from being a busser and had been working at the Paris Hotel for 15+ years. His Candor, manners, and all around attentiveness is what really impressed us outside of the food. He's patient, kind, and willing to help you with everything.  Thanks for such a great dining experience Paris Hotel. can't wait to make it back.

e9OcDKhazSMcdBysaxAYnQ.text: You're coming to the Eiffel Tower restaurant with an amazing view of the Bellagio Fountains, of course your tab will be rather expensive, but that is to be expected.  Reserve your table at 4:30pm, and you will be guaranteed a table by the window. It is a bit early compared to the conventional dinner, but it is TOTALLY worth it. The fountain view is amazing!  The food - We tried the lobster salad and the octopus leg for the appetizers. They were both tasty! My husband and I both thoroughly enjoyed the lobster salad and felt that it was a generous portion. We ordered Chicken and salmon for our entree with a side of wild mushrooms. The mushrooms were a bit too oily, but nonetheless tasted amazing.   For dessert, we had the nutella souffle, which wasn't too heavy.   As we were celebrating our anniversary, our server brought us a special Chocolate mouse dessert after our meal that said "Happy Anniversary" which was incredibly thoughtful of them. There is also a photographer walking around to take pictures and you can get 2 pictures (softcopy) for $10 which is worth it as the picture comes out pretty nice compared to a phone picture.  My husband and I had an amazing time here and we hope to be back for our next anniversary!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anniversary Gift from the restaurant! How nice:)

pg75v9oPgNjOnk-X27oylw.text: The BEST STEAK I've ever tasted! My boyfriend and I stopped by for a celebration. We made reservations and we were seated with the best view of the Bellagio Fountain. We also ended up mentioning to the woman that was helping us that we were celebrating our anniversary & my birthday. By the end of dinner, she surprised us with chocolate mousse with the writing of happy birthday & happy anniversary on the plate. I can't express how grateful I was (I definitely teared up). Great drinks, food, and views. This place is the best spot with the best staff! You won't regret it!

vuJ6VROLeNiKJpkpYKZKLg.text: This food was fantastic we had lamb and rib-eye all were cooked perfectly, I tried the pork belly and I was not disappointed. Our server David was great he explained the menu and was excellent.

kRdvrHt07ciPTP-EUFvIkA.text: I had the pleasure of dining at the Eiffel Tower restaurant over the weekend. I LOVE Wellingtons and they an awesome individual portion wellington which melts in your mouth!  My date had the New York which she thoroughly enjoyed as well. We both split the au gratin potatoes along with brussel sprouts.  For dessert, we had a chocolate and a nutella souffle which were both awesome!   For drinks, we had 2 of their top 3 recommendations from our server. Mine had blueberries in it and hers had champagne. Both were awesome!   We made a 715 reservation and got there early. They were able to seat us immediately and we got one of the many table for twos that ran along the long glass window that had a great view of the bellagio watershow.  Don't come here if you're on a budget. The two of us spent just under 400 but was well worth the experience!

geh2yawUOxEgF9V69X1z3g.text: When I first called to get info for this place and they side there was a dress code, I was worried because I had my 4 kids with me. And when I walked in and then saw the menu I was like "oh no!" Because I didn't thinks my kids would even know what would be served to them.   I was sooo wrong, my entire family loved this place. Food was so with the price and service was above and beyond!!!  But next time I'm only inviting my wife to go solo with me.

xn2mupFlcS72hDKpH38_aA.text: This was a great experience while on vacation.  We started with high expectations and they were met.  We explained our situation and they sat us at a nice table with a great view.  The waiter was professional and the food was exceptional.   If you are going here you already know it's pricey.  I'm no stranger to a pricey dining experience but this one totally delivered.

MIlglQRzHqd75N6AojjTew.text: Great service and view. Get the pistachio souffle... my table got pistachio and chocolate.... both great but don't skip on the pistachio.

LxBmzloP0Qp1WppJNOtFIg.text: We Came Here Friday Night the staff were very helpful and friendly the restaurant itself is in the Eiffel Tower above the Paris Hotel on the strip you have an amazing view of the Bellagio Fountains and the Paris Sign! Anywhere you are seated in this restaurant you have a great view it was built with that in mind! For appetizers we got the Steak Tartare with truffle oil and the Warm Lobster Salad Both tasted amazing. For entrees we got the 16oz Ribeye with Bone Marrow, the Duck, Salmon, and Chicken. All of which were cooked perfectly and delicious. For desert we had the Chocolate Souffle you have to order this desert at the beginning because it takes about 40mins to make and it was delicious and worth it! I will be back here next time I am in Vegas for sure Thank You For The Great Experience.

QEOqexC7FlaI19wXX2bGow.text: Our 10 year old son had the king crab appetizer as his meal and loved the taste and presentation. Husband had bison steak, which was best he's ever had. I  ordered sea bass and wasn't disappointed. Fresh bread was delicious. Wish the butter had been room temperature so it would spread better. Views outstanding, of course. The wait staff very attentive and patient explaining the menu to our son. Most expensive meal our family has ever had but for a special occasion was worth it.

LuH7XieXB3MjCLlx7ivfZQ.text: We went here for a late breakfast and WOW. The service, the food, the atmosphere, everything here was True perfection. I had a espresso martini that was out of this world. I will go back every time I'm in town!

YaDrgLhj0VHvyNOl2s0mWA.text: The view, the waiters, the company... the company... the food! Everything perfect... the flavored mimosas... the salad wrapped with a thin slice of cucumber... the mimosas... did I say the company? It does not get any better to share this with a human you really care about.

oESWpWx5601QIgB7mP-9lw.text: Wow!  What a night!    We started by sitting in one of the lounges in the casino where a knock off of the Platter sang through their list of greatest hits.  Gotta love Motown and their love songs.  Headed to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant without reservations on a Saturday night.  Nothing like doing things on the spur of the moment.  Waited at the bar for about 30 minutes and were taken to our seats.  Wonderful views and ambiance!  Started with the Trilogy of Cavair.  Ordered the lobster and rib eye and shared both.  Would have liked a better selection of classic French dishes but the food was all very good.  Great place to go with that special person.  Not a budget outing but was well worth it.

kXhiXBmsBZgu-si2-R_Y6Q.text: The food is wonderful and the views are spectacular, when seated by the windows. We have been spoiled by this view in our hotel rooms for the last 3 1/2 years, but it still it is impressive. The service is also perfect.   The first location that we were awarded by the window had a beautiful view, but the air conditioning vent blew straight down on us. I ended up getting a headache instantly. When the couple next to us we moved we moved to their table, and everything was perfect. The only thing I would ask is that management look at where the vents are located.

7TDUbEohps6-DBbo08gANw.text: View is nice! We got seated at a table with a view of Bellagio fountains, even though we made a last minute reservation. We were sort of in a rush as we had tickets to a show so we had two glasses of wine and shared two appetizers, the octopus and the steak tartare. Both appetizers were good but not good enough to reflect the price. You are paying for the ambience for sure. They were very generous with the bread and the French baguette is my idea of carb perfection.   Of note, we did make a hilarious memory... we didn't know that there was a dress code (although we should've assumed...) and my boyfriend did not have on a collared shirt. They handed him this terrible, black oversized button down to put on. He looked horribly sloppy and we found it ironic that this was more acceptable than the uncollared shirt he had on. It was worth the laugh.

yrulH8fWv4AAV-xHwPHivg.text: Such a wonderful experience.  We had a wonderful table at the window The view is absolutely amazing.  The service was impeccable.  My hubby had the beef wellington and it was delicious.  It takes a bit longer though so if you're pressed for time, dont order that.  We had the steak tartare appetizer and it was seriously the most amazing thing I've ever eaten.  Much better than any steak tartare I've had in the past.  Its expensive but worth every single penny.

1deoneTS0fIdLA4Ef21TJg.text: BIG disappointment!!!!!!!!! Had great expectations and couldn't wait for french food.  We rarely get to have.  I don't think of a lamb burger or BLT or sausage/eggs and mashed potatoes being French.  They had no crepes???? We went for Christmas day brunch and were excited about french bread because a French meal wasn't there.  The view was nice.  The Bellagio fountain went off at 12 for Christmas day.  It was very expensive?????  Especially for what was available to eat.  NEVER AGAIN !!!!!!!  The positive was the service was excellent.....

472_0npjlAAiYFnw83KGaA.text: Stopped in for a souffle late one evening. They require a collared shirt for men, but fortunately my husband had on a golf shirt. No dress code for ladies...lucky me as I had in yoga pants!! The souffle was as delicious as it was beautiful!! Will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate soufflé

2NFLLlG83JBN0LF84OrQFg.text: What a lovely experience. We had our dinner here after getting married at little church of the west and it was perfect. We were running ahead of schedule, so we called to see if we could be early and they accommodated us very well. They moved our reservation up by 45 minutes and they still sat us at the window! The views were gorgeous and the food was delicious. It's rather loud inside, which I was surprised by, but otherwise it was a perfect experience.
