XFlTAbbjINvebSsuK_2aNQ.text: We wanted to go out to a nice dinner the last time we were in Vegas, but did not have reservations.  I was convinced we wouldn't be able to get in to the Eiffel Tower, but was surprised when they said just wait in the bar a few minutes.    We ended up ordering drinks and a cheese plate in the lounge part of the bar and we were surprised when they came to get us only 15 minutes later!  Overall, I was very impressed with the Eiffel Tower restaurant.  I expected to find very over-priced menus with food unworthy of the hype.  I am happy to say that this is not the case.    All of our food was wonderful.  We had the Filet Mignon, the Beef Wellington, and the chocolate souffle.  Yum!  The service was excellent, the view was amazing, and we had a wonderful meal.

mVB_5AATqroacTeNGzAgTg.text: Went back Saturday night. Was excellent all the way around again.. Only thing for me was the Caesar salad had a horrible dressing. It was VILE !!!! Everything else was outstanding.

UJgL4sCDti_W6_fvqsgE-g.text: One of my top ten restaurant experiences of all time.  Really spectacular service.  Outstanding food.  An amazing view.  Expensive (although not the most expensive meal I've ever eaten) and worth every damn penny.    Your experience starts off on the casino floor where you take a special elevator up to the restaurant.  The doors open and you are greeted by an adorable majordomo standing in front of the gleaming glass and chrome kitchen which is a positive beehive of activity. You round the corner into a cozy dark reception area with seating and a small bar area.  The couple next to us was eating at the bar so I supposed if you are too spontaneous to make a reservation you can still enjoy the restaurant.  Our table was ready after about 10 minutes (we had a drink at the bar, which seems to be stocked with at least one bottle of every liqueur known to man, meticulously organized and labeled)  We had a window table with a great view of the fountains and strip.  Service was flawless.   They select and train staff very well.  And the food....  Starters Me:   Cold Foie Gras Boyfriend:  Warm Foie Gras Set the standard for the dinner to come.  Phenomenal.    Main Me:  Venison Chop Boyfriend:  Rack of Lamb Side Dish:  Brussels Sprouts As tender and amazing as the meat was on my chop, the star of the plate was the little oatmeal cake it was served with.  For many restaurants the starch is kind of an afterthought ("Umm, yeah let's throw some potatoes on here to take up space").  I am still thinking about that sublime little round of deliciousness a month later.    To my absolute surprise we learned from the it is a Lettuce Entertain You restaurant from the lovely manager who visited our table and chatted with it.  I wholeheartedly recommend this as a great special event restaurant.    And please fellow Yelpers, DRESS APPROPRIATELY.  Yes, it is Vegas where you can wear a tee shirt and jeans 99% of the time, but this is the 1% of the time you shouldn't.  I know you'll argue that you are paying good money so why should you dress up for others but go ahead and wear those heels and dress shoes.  Enjoy it.  Savor the fanciness.   It is a special meal, so relax and enjoy it for what it is.  You deserve it, right?

cJFAjJBNf4ULN6EYY3irDA.text: Can't beat the view. However, though they have offer many various High end foods. The quality doesn't seem match the price. The service is great, the food is beautiful. But if the price matches the taste? I had better. Will not come back unless there is a special occasion and requested by anyone. Otherwise, it is not a must list.

2XxXS5PCKJF4w7eQzhRU_g.text: BEST customer service in the world! So it's Valentine's Day, traffic is terrible and I have 8:15 reservations here.  After fighting traffic and waiting in a loooong valet line, we go up to the restaurant and realized it wasalmost 9 o'clock.  Would you believe it?  On one of the busiest nights, they still held our reservations and it only takes them 15 minutes to get our table ready.  After being seated, our waiter serves us our choices on their V-day menu.  Everything tasted great, the second we finished something they took our plate, the restaurant was pretty, the view of the fountain was nice, and my wine glass never was empty until the end.  I already was thinking in my head to give it four stars (only because I thought it was just a bit over priced).  However, I ended up giving them five because of this...  My waiter came back saying what NO ONE ever wants to hear, "I'm so sorry, but your card was declined".  The room went black and I died (at least that's what I wanted to happen in that moment).  Immediately, I called my bank.  After having the worst experience on the phone with my bank again (review of Chase customer service coming soon, and it won't b,pretty) and not having any way to pay, I expected the worst.  With no questions asked, the waiter and the manager informed me in the kindest manner that they'll just do a copy of the card and my ID and to not worry whatsoever, to come back tomorrow was just fine and don't let this ruin my Valentine's Day.  Eiffel Tower, I loved your decor, food presentation as well as taste, the live singer and nice views.  But what I loved most was the superb customer service and understanding.  Thank you for not making me feel like such a cheap skate.  Will you always be my Valentine?

570Vvz30XQRYwG9Cp34_bQ.text: Went there on Valentine's day, and they have a special menu for that day. Food n drinks were really good except the desert. Great customer service. Reasonable price.

pptKXundcoxoXL7wWoWDKQ.text: Bad service not a pleasant experience food was cold steak was dry no flavor . expected lot better than what I got for a $79 steak.  was told it was $6 for a Rose was charge $18 . Went there for my girlfriend's birthday she was not happy with the service.  There's lot better places to go in Vegas only good thing was the window view to the strip .

QLnKnoa1f38p3XHj7XwXrw.text: My mother and I had the prefix dinner menu before the Jersey Boys. For our first course my mother had the kale salad and I had the french onion soup. The kale salad had just the right amount of dressing and was delicious. However the onion soup had a hair in it and I pointed it out to the waiter as soon as he dropped it off he apoligized and brought me another soup which was ok but hard to enjoy after there was a hair... For our second course I had the flank steak which was just ok and my mother had the salmon which she really enjoyed. We both loved our desserts. We both had a few cocktails and they were all very good.   all the choices on the strip I dont think I will come back due to having a hair in my soup and not having anything taken off the final bill....  I worked in the restaurant industry and if there is a hair in your food a manager comes to the table!

piJ3piA7UIl9oAJA6pAeFA.text: Went here for our wedding anniversary. Everything was superb! Service was excellent. They treated us with the best treatment possible and made sure we had everything we needed.very attentive, and helpful. The quality of the food was five star quality. I had the filet mignon crusted with lemon garlic herb butter. Hubby had the lamb. Succulent melt in ur mouth flavor. Be warned, this place is very $$$$ but well worth it.and the view! The view the view the view!!! Excellent!

6Rn-JvimqasHf-KmR-esVw.text: You take an elevator from the casino floor up to the mid-section of the Eiffel Tower. We got one of the best tables in the entire restaurant! We sat by the window and was dead center for the Bellagio Fountain shows. I think we saw the show about nine or ten times. The only thing missing was the Bellagio music. The food was excellent - I got the Beef Wellington with ratatouille.  The souffles were PERFECT! OMG the souffles were so freaking yummy I was scraping the bottom of the dishes. You must get it! I had Gran Marnier and pistachio. I'm drooling.  Make reservations. Dress up. A lot of the men were with suit jackets and women in cocktail dresses.

0WL4uvSm51eitVKjIshQ5g.text: Choose this restaurant for the Bellagio fountain view at night.  Visited week of Thanksgiving, November 2011.  Found out that we could get guaranteed night time view of the fountain if reservations were made for 5 pm or 5: 15 pm, for a maximum of two people.  We were not disappointed - saw 3 fountain shows (every 1/2 hour).  We had a not so friendly waiter (thus, the 4 stars) and a slight problem with luke warm soup - but management quickly stepped in to rectify to our satisfaction with the soup.  Would have given 5 stars but the waiter was stiff and unfriendly and a tad edgy....  Food was pretty good, and the dessert was DELICIOUS!

OC-JgBw4Tj_mRMqjfjN8CQ.text: thanks boyfriend for an amazing early valentine's day dinner!  out of all the award winning restaurants and famous chefs here on the las vegas trip, i choose to dine at the eiffel tower restaurant because the view looked beautiful from pictures i've seen and for now, this will be the closet thing i'll get to the real eiffel tower in paris.  the eiffel tower restaurant has its own private elevator that takes you up 11 stories. i had requested a window seat when i made my reservations through opentable and fortunately enough, we got window seats directly facing the bellagio fountains  while we waited for our table to be ready, the boyfriend and i each started off with a cocktail. i dont remember the names, but i know the one i got was the eiffel tower's signature drink - a sangria type drink with a mixture of berries and bubbly like champagne. the other one was a type of pear infused drink.  for appetizers, the two of us shared the grand seafood platter which could have been an entree by itself. it is a little pricey ($98) but i think its well worth it. we got a whole lobster split in half, a giant king crab leg with a good amount of meat in it, several oysters and clams, and jumbo shrimp with three different cocktail sauces. i loved the crab, oysters, and shrimp  for my entree i got the roasted rack of lamb with tarragon jus and glazed turnips. the lamb was extremely tender and really flavorful with the sauce. i tried a little bit of the boyfriend's cured duck. we asked what it meant by cured and we were told that it was soaked in coffee the night before. coffee duck sounded a little strange but you cant really taste the coffee and the duck was pretty tender as well. it's not the usual chinese bbq duck im used to. the duck tasted more like some sort of red meat, but still good nonetheless.  for dessert i went with majority of people's suggestion on yelp and ordered the chocolate souffle. it was delicious! im not a big fan of chocolate but i loved this dessert! the warm chocolate sauce poured into the soft yet slighty crunchy souffle. a must try! and remember to put in the order when you first order your other things because it takes awhile to make.  price wise, it was on the more expensive side, but it is las vegas. the service here was excellent, the view of the fountains were beautiful, the portions weren't disappointing for a fine dinning restaurant, and i was very happy with everything we got. the only thing i regret not doing is riding up the eiffel tower after dinner. oh well, next time! i would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to treat themselves and/or other people to a great dining experience

OMMvgQPHbjScdykma-3nzQ.text: I haven't been here recently but the last two times that my husband and I went have been great. We've had the filet mignon, scalloped potatoes, mushroom soup, chocolate souffle, crime brulee and asparagus. All the items mentioned were great with the exception of the asparagus which was bland. Both times we were seated by the windows and the view was awesome at evening/night time. The service was good. It is kind of tight squeeze in there but the food and view make up for that. It's pricey but I don't mind paying for great food and service.

20v_atLJywOV7nhBJRuCFA.text: I have only had lunch here. Let's start with the view...amazing, we lucked out and got a window table with a perfect view of the Bellagio fountains and a nice sightline up and down the strip, I can only imagine the views to be even more breathtaking at night. As a whole the food was just slightly above average (but still above average and I have higher expectations than most) but there was a few hints of awesomeness tossed in. They bring out a bread basket and one of the little flatbread things in the basket was simply amazing, we sent the waiter back for thirds LOL and the potatoes crouqet were delish and I don't even normally like potatoes. Service was great as well.. Summary, you can definetly find a better meal in Vegas but probably not a better view/meal combo. I enjoyed it enough for lunch to go back and give it a try for dinner in the future.

-AX3ihz3ACZz1xV6UMGoVA.text: First let me say the view is beautiful. It over looks the Bellagio fountains. The food is very good, but very expensive. The service was just ok. We had to ask every time to get our drinks refilled. We had an appetizer of one half of a crab leg, one salad, one entree of duck and another entree of tenderloin fillet (it was big) along with two sides, and one Diet Pepsi. Unless you get the fixed menu ($150) EVERYTHING is a la carte. The sides are $10-20, and any sauce is $5. Our bill came to $205 before tips for the two of us.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VCCmlFFqi09_JKFjw5FM5A.text: I would give this place 5 stars if it weren't for our snooty server. Eiffel Tower is the perfect special occasion restaurant for a romantic evening with your S.O., girls night, bach party, etc. I came here with my best gfs for a bachelorette dinner and enjoyed it for the most part.  My only gripe about the restaurant was our pretentious server. As we were seated we were only given the drink menu. Which is completely fine, but we were also hungry and didn't have time to take a 3 hour dinner as we had to book it to Omnia to see Afrojak! So we asked for the food menu and she kept making us feel bad bc not everyone wanted to order $20 cocktail when we could drink for free at the club!   There is a bread guy that goes around to all the tables. Wheat and multi grain is my favorite. I did try to lay off the carbs on this trip, but the bread here I just couldn't resist! Also, their butter is some bougey butter bc it was good AF!  Lobster, steak, cod and beef wellington were all very well executed to our liking.  If you have time for dessert, definitely get the Pistachio souffle. Trust me you won't regret it! Just FYI - let your server know in advance bc it takes ~20min to prepare.  Put in a request with the hostess to be seated in front of the Bellagio fountains. If you go for dinner around 8pm, you'll get a perfect view of the fountain show with your dinner.  Take into consideration, this place is not cheap. We spent at least ~$100/person.  The restaurant is located far from the self parking deck (Free parking at Paris btw).

n9BelB7WFsSIE-ffjRY_RA.text: Best steak of my life. And great view and ambiance. Had to sell my first born to pay for dinner, but worth it.

MFy-B31oSPMOWXmXBc3FqQ.text: Amazing views of Las Vegas. Special feeling. Very romantic. Great to woe your love. I feel place was pricey. Expect to spend $150 or more for a good meal. I had a cocktail $18. Meal prices as high as $60 a plate?? This place is great if you want something really special and different. After our cocktail, we went downstairs to a French restaurant which was delicious and paid $50 for memorable meal for 2. Well worth it if it's a bday anniversary etc. worth to have a drink at the bar to see the amazing views and feel the ambiance.

lr_Uqx14h3ic9Y1f7JCrQw.text: Wow!! French cuisine and amazing views right across from the Bellagio fountains!  My guy & I went here for Easter dinner and we really enjoyed our French food! The service was exceptional and the food was fantastic!  It was a very romantic night!

GQ3isTzpPlGpaTq-_Zn7cw.text: Service was great and personal on par similar steakhouses . Location was awesome , second floor of Paris . I thought it was going to be higher but the view was still great . Entire strip can be seen . Wine selection was massive

Rj95tpDE6nxrGT-LPOJwog.text: Yes, It's $$$$ ~ but worth every nickel!     The food is out of this world, every bite as good as the next and presentations are spectacular. Remember you eat with your eyes FIRST!!!!!!     Our cocktails all superb, mine a whiskey Sour and my girlfriend ordered a speciality gin cocktail with a rose petal that they raved about the other drink were more typical martinis & scotch & water, no complaints anywhere.      My starter was a Alaskan King  crab & Avocado layered upon layer and a VERY generous portion too! They do not skimp at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant ~    My main was the Queen Steak, cooked perfectly and melted like butter in my mouth  ~    I did order the chocolate souffle for dessert  and well worth the antisapation.       This is a special occasion restaurant for sure as the view in unbelievable, the service impeccable!!!! Our maitre 'd was Constantin~ and set the pace for our dinner as we did have Show tix later, offered a quicker route how to walk there all without being stuffy! I will request his station upon our next visit, Just perfection in his over 6ft frame a True professional~

QTBPIfQ4cP5CXmLUVMn6CA.text: The Eiffel Tower is now my wife and I new favorite place in Las Vegas to eat. From the view to the service is five stars and the food was even better. I had the New York strip and that was one of the best strips I've ever eaten. My wife had the duck she loved it. Even the bread and butter that came first was excellent. All and all couldn't have anything bad to say about the Eiffel Tower it has become our new tradition to eat when we come to Vegas. All and all best $200 I've spent on a dinner!

6GJFdfWHl0Kcp2-og1hgqQ.text: My gf and I took my mother here for a belated Mother's Day dinner and she loved it! We had already dined here twice and decided it was worth to go a third time.   We always make reservations especially on weekends since it does get busy here! We are always seated right away. I love the ambience of this place because of the old school fine dining seating and at night they leave it dim so that your attention is more focused on the beautiful view outside! Every time we've been seated we always got the window in front of the Bellagio Fountain View. It is absolutely amazing to see the water show from a higher view.   As for the food, we ordered the steak tartare and foie gras as our appetizers. The steak tartare was buttery and the garlic with aoli gave it such a yummy umami flavor. The foie gras was smooth and had a clean salty taste which paired very well with the sweet fig compote.  For our main course we ordered the Lobster with spinach florentine, the veal, and lamb chop dish. All were cooked perfectly and had distinct/tasty flavors. I love that the menu is simple yet still has a lot of options for appetizers, main courses, and sides!   We also ordered the souffles for dessert! If you are a dessert person and love something perfectly sweet, light, and a bit creamy; their souffle is perfect for you! I recommended to anyone that decides to dine here to ORDER THEIR SOUFFLE!!  My mom ordered the orange flavor, I got Nutella, and my gf ordered chocolate. They had the right amount of each flavor, they were puffed out perfectly with a thin crust on top, and pairs with a creamy melted sauce to pour into the middle of it.   Overall, this restaurant has the perfect ambience for an intimate dining experience with a beautiful view of the Bellagio Fountain! Their food definitely lives up to French Standard and service was spot on. There was always someone who checked up on us, refilled out waters, and were very friendly. We will probably be back for our 4th time haha

g4WD3O0OoojWq1rFevvn3A.text: FANTASTIQUE! the entire experience is uncompromising in its excellence. The service is masterful, the staff truly immerse you with the classic French dinning feel.  The view is to die for, with a perfect view of the Bellagio's fountain show, and the bustling strip below. The cuisine is elegant, and the staff are fantastique in their description of each dish. We enjoyed a variety of starters, entrees, and desserts, those that stood out were the olive oil mashed potatoes, and the creamed spinach and mushrooms, for starters. For entrees, you can't miss the Muscovy duck breast, tender, mouthwatering...heaven. For dessert, the decadent classic chocolate souffle is light, fluffy, creamy, and sinfully rich. When in Vegas, the Eiffel Tower restaurant is a must.

CyDJbu_-Q9iOzQxLX8rJxg.text: Great time, service was awesome couldn't ask for better. The view was of the fountain show and it was awesome.

RyMSJgPR0tyhMfvyMc8sDw.text: Went here for an mid week early dinner, reservations were for 6:15P, arrived early and sat at the bar for drinks.  No pina colada due to no blender, so I ordered another tropical drink which was tasty.  We were given a window seat and it was a fabulous view of the Strip, loved the floor to ceiling windows!  The servers were very attentive and our waiter was very elegant looking with a European accent.  I had beef wellington which was nice and for dessert the chocolate souffle which was just ok. The green beans were buttery and delicious.  The view was the best part of this experience, so glad we got a window seat.  Even got to see the Bellagio dancing fountains!

V4OTRO98zCPbAQ82luLWUg.text: I'll keep this review very brief because I'm sure that everything I want to say has been said already somewhere in the 1500 Yelp reviews.    This restaurant was simply amazing!!! I ordered the Beef Wellington and it was perfection in every way.   Service was top notch and our server was attentive but not overly attentive to where it can annoying.   We had the view right next to the window with a floor to ceiling view of the strip. Beautiful!   I will definitely be returning on my next trip to Vegas!

zhuwpCTpIy9JKGEUJFulnQ.text: Attended the gala NYE dinner and live music ... Beautiful venue with amazing views  Great professional waiters   An absolute ripoff price of $500 per person for 5 course meal .  Every single meal was just hmmm tasteless or bad   This is not my personal opinion only all of our friends and other guests complained   Now the way they serve the meals was really unheard off non stop misplaced the right dish , many times they deliver out meal then apologized and took it to different table .  But pretty much the worse experience was checking in desk with poor hard working girls that was placed in front of loud music band . People pushing on each other backs and can't hear nothing .  I would like to send warm regards to the management that setup this event and I pray for you poor people that god will bless you soon with more brains then money since at this point you have it seriously backwards   Literally we have recommended to all friends to never go there

XhsMiWlOwCDdKOxbkYIpUA.text: This was absolutely breathtaking!! The food was great, the view was amazing! Highly recommend you do the 4:30pm reservation special they have. The dinner was perfect and there is something on the menu for everyone. I wouldn't recommend this place for kids. Definitely dress for the occasion if you are doing dinner. It's a great experience. Only complaint which isn't really a complaint was that the waiter asked if we were celebrating anything we said my birthday. He was like oh great! And that was the end of it, tables next to us also celebrating birthdays and anniversary's got a lot more enthusiasm and a cute dessert from the chief. We didn't get any of that but we were so stuffed by the time we were done it didn't really matter, just a aww factor.

Uqd1x6lgOKjbuhlfqlsHDg.text: The Eiffel Tower should not be missed Great restaurant with wonderful view David the waiter was superb and very friendly. I had the foie gras which was out of this world. Frankie had Caesar salad as well as Paulie. Doc had the steak tartare he said really good. I had the Dover sole and it was excellent. Frankie and doc had salmon and bear had the chicken which he described as the best he's had. For desert we had a raspberry souffle and the special apple desert. Would love to come back with Kathy as the ambiance is great for couples. Sure winner. It is a bit pricey but for special occasions well worth it

zWsMvxErxxVP-mgLspfyYA.text: Ok, let's start off with I am a Chef here in Las Vegas. The service here is immaculate and the view is breathtaking. Usually I cook dinner for me and my GF every night that I'm not working, but sometimes we like to eat out to enjoy the LV Chefs and support them. Honestly I know it's french food and the plates are small but when you offer small plates you better make sure every bite makes your heart skip a beat. The food here is like a 6/10 and for us paying $400 for the meal the food is a 2/10. Probably one of the worst Beef Wellingtons I've ever tried. The lobster salad was very bland too. Deft not worth $400 for a meal. Probably won't come back unless forced to.

2Khaol8VY0fH2jDyt1-hQA.text: This restaurant was exceptional! Had a great experience and everyone was very professional and friendly. Server was super helpful with helping decide on what to drink & describing what's on the menu. The food was delicious as well! Great place to bring anyone for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

66d_YIvReVPDTz0yeCENdQ.text: The place, the views, the food and the staff are just WOW. The steak tartare was one of the best I have ever had. There duck was so amazing, and this shocked me because I am not a fan of duck. Especially eating duck out a lot of people do not know how to do it! But I definitely recommended the duck and put in an order for the souffle. Our waiter told us prior to dinner being served if we wanted a souffle we would need to put the order in prior Bc it can take 30 to 40 mins to prepare. And boy oh boy we're we glad to do so. The souffle was so light and airy, I got passion fruit and it was the perfect tart. Can not wait to return to Vegas to go back!

vErRAJzQDuzp_EviIyBkgw.text: This was an excelent meal, albeit much overpriced. The service was great, the server spoke French, English, and German (and God knows what else) so I spoke to her in German, just to match the cost of the food.  My partner and I ordered the tasting menu with the wine paring. Both were almost flawless until the main meat course, which sucked my donkey's ass (some chef experiments aren't meant to be charged for).   We began with an amuse bush of three small items including lobster, sausage, and cured vegies. Our first course was a raw scallop appitizer. This was my favorite course of the evening. After that we had a delicious seared fish followed by the main meat couse which was a tenderloin of venison with a spice rub. The venison was totally overpowered by the rub, which tasted so strong it was almost like powdered pine needles (I am thinking, pepper, star anise, cloves, allspice, and maybe thyme). We packed that in a box to eat later, which I tried to do but gagged every time until I threw it away.  The desert course was lovely, I recall it being a chocolate mouse which my partner gobbled up as her favorite course of the night.  The wine pairing flowed nicely and in fact so nicely that I gave my partner my last three glasses, and she got sexily buzzed.  The best thing about the evening besides the service was the view. We sat sat right at the window in the middle of the fake Eiffel Tower, overlooking the Bellagio wather show, which we got to see multiple times.   It was a lovely dinner (except for the venision which was like a poop in the punchbowl) and then proceeded to our hotel room for some after-the-culinary-orgy exercise.  A very nice night - at the cost of $450 for two of us.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great view from the two-tops

qMOaywNyExv-mVqTl_XfMg.text: I was totally surprised at how good the food was!  So much better than I was expecting.  My friend and I were staying at Paris and made reservations to eat dinner here because we thought it would be fun and that we would have a nice time.  I figured the food would be ok but probably not great, just overpriced due to the gimmickyness of everything.  So we got all dressed up and took the fun elevator ride up the tower to the restaurant.   We took a peek at the cool open kitchen and then took a seat at the bar since our table wasn't ready.  The drinks, like everything else were overpriced but really delicious and well made.  After a few sips our table was ready and we were seated right in the front by the window.  The views are totally worth the expensive food.  You can see the strip lights, watch all the happenings from above and see the fountain show across the street.  The service was really good and our waiter stayed on top of everything the entire time.  The beef wellington I had was amazing!!!  I love, love, loved it and I am not really much of a beef eater.  My friend and I also shared a pistachio souffle and it was also delicious.  Made correctly, one of the best souffles I have had in a while.  If you are looking for a romantic dinner spot, or just a nice place with a great view and good food this is a good choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3Uam-STZNum-geJKVpNrYA.text: I had the veal medallions with morel fricassee. The veal was tender and lean, and well-flavored with the morel saute. My boyfriend ordered the rabbit dish. It was my first time tasting rabbit, and am now turned on to it.   The cost is heavy on the wallet, but most places are in Vegas. But here you receive a meal with a view. And meanwhile, you can play pretend that you're dining in France ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal medallions with morel fricassee at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant, overlooking the Bellagio fountains. A meal with a view!

nobYOVjMbcysoI-TFWaK9Q.text: Mimosas and French toast at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Wow! So delicious! Such a wonderful job with the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast with pecan and banana

TuVplaCLANVYMSENhf44xQ.text: Service here is great - our waitress was attentive and friendly. The food is fairly poor. The lobster was not actually a whole baked lobster - it was pieces of lobster mixed with mostly spinach and cream. It was salty and underwhelming. When asked about the preparation method, we were told it was "French with a twist" which apparently means very little lobster with lots of cream and salt. The lamb chops were okay, and not particularly fresh. The beef wellington had a very thin almost non-existent crust, and the cut of steak was chewy. Salads were the best part of the meal. If you're looking for a good view of the fountains, there are much better food options at the Bellagio.

bGEGKJEl-6-x63tVt30T3w.text: Came here for lunch and it was not crowded, so we didn't need a reservation. Lunch time prices are lower than dinner prices, and we had a nice daytime view of the strip. The service is great and the Lamb Burger I had is good, but I think we had higher expectations based on everyone else's glowing reviews. Come here for the view and the novelty of the place!

eTOifIiKI3YdYKFHZsLH9g.text: Looking at the menu, I was a little skeptical. Nothing jumped out as the thing I should order. But it seemed like the most romantic place for dinner. They absolutely took excellent care of us and gave us a great view and above and beyond service all night. I almost ordered the steak but instead opted for the individual beef wellington. Very glad I did as it was unforgettable.   It has a built-in advantage with the location and view, but the service and food matched the atmosphere.

x-n59mw5lTeLcu-6OOW-zA.text: The food is absolutely amazing!!!  Highly recommend the tasting menu.  The desserts are to die for. The chocolate mousse tastes like heaven. The restaurant overlooks the strip with a great view of the Bellagio fountains. The watermelon mimosa is the perfect drink

ukNw8XpKQeQ3Nj3Sa188mw.text: Service was excellent, the food was great.   I took my wife there for our Anniversary, I reserved a table a head of time along with a dozen of red roses for the table. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave honest opinions about the dishes that we had questions about. Love the fact that I wasn't rushed to do anything. That's from looking over the menu to paying for the bill. The Sommelier was very knowledgeable and a great help. Although we ended up going with a cocktail she was truly a help.   We had Tartar Salmon, followed by Creamy Onion Soup,  then for our main course my wife had "the Queen" (filet mignon), while I had the neapolitan of rabbit. For sides dishes we shard a chessey potato dish and a mushroom spinach dish. Then finished the night off with a Grand Marnier Souffle. And because it was our Anniversary they gave us a chocolate mousse desert, with a special writing in chocolate drizzle.   I would definitely recommend this place to a friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The roses that I had for the table the next morning, still looking beautiful.
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our wonderful view
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Anniversary Dessert

5rUjZrSS4-OzCtxU0BuFCg.text: This was planned as the Highlight of a Romantic Vegas Getaway... Turned out to be the one blemish on an otherwise fantastic Weekend.  Things that might be interesting to a Yelper.  1.  They require a CC at booking.  There is a Dress Code.  Don't show or cancel within adequate time and they charge your card.  Fair Enough.  2.  The View-  They have a view of the Fountains but without the music from the Fountains the effect is not as high as you might expect.  Plenty of their tables lack a fountain view.  Ours was overlooking a Hot Tub at the Paris where two individuals were engaging in the kind of PDA that was rather unfortunate for all involved.  3.  The Staff-  Uppity was brought to a new level here.  Our Waiter could have been the Maitre D from Ferris Bueller's Day Off.   4.  Problem 1-  The Order-  I ordered the Lobster.  We both had drinks as we sat and we were certainly having dessert and likely another drink (or two).  This was not going to be a small bill.  (You don't book this restaurant looking for a cheap date people).  My Wife ordered the Asparagus Soup and Crab Cake as her entree.  It was listed as an appetizer.  Response-  You MUST order an entree per seat in our restaurant Madame.  In retrospect... This was a WALK situation if I have ever experienced one.  Just a get up.  So Sorry.  Walk.  It was all downhill from here.  Wife was taken aback-  And pivoted into a $32 Vegetarian entree.  I think that was maybe a $8 jump in price? Offended for essentially being called cheap.  Mood changed.  Suddenly on the defensive for no reason.  Did not want the Vegetarian Dish.  Wanted the Asparagus Soup and Crab Cake.  Solution on the odd chance management reads this and cares=  Propose to Serve the Appetizer as an Entree.  So Simple.  Just throw an additional Crab Cake on there and bump the cost up to that of an entree.  Or-  Simply advise that you must charge a minimum of the lowest entree.  Anything.  But "You must order an entree" forces a patron into a dish they never desired.  Success never follows here.  5.  Problem 2-  The Lobster was Cold.  Ice Cold.  No idea how you botch that.  Seafood in the middle of the desert is not to be trifled with.  This was the first meal I have ever sent back to the Kitchen in my life.  The Chef came out to apologize... Agreed that it was ice cold and seemed baffled as to how that happened.  Replaced or Reheated (Wasn't really sure) and we waited while my wife stared at her disappointing entree selection.   End of day they brought us a complementary dessert as a "So Sorry" for botching the Lobster.  At that point for me I just wanted out of the restaurant.  With all of the spectacular options throughout Las Vegas-  Its a shame this one skates by solely on location.

ZXzjplvSWgD_mbGtr6EiKw.text: This place is nicely located at the eiffel tower of the Paris Hotel. The place has a nice setting and beautiful views of the Bellagio fountains... You must Reserve and try to get a table overlooking the fountains... Very nice. The bar area is also quite nice and the entrance once you get off the elevator is spectacular... One of those movie kitchens.... Service is above average and the somelier Jennifer was very nice, she tried to pick a wine that suites our budget and did fine. Wine Is extremely overpriced, so be prepared for that! Remeber to bring a collar shirt, they do have a dress code. Now the food, this is where this place stands out period! The steak tartare is above average with hints of dill that made it unique... Well balanced, good texture and elegant. The main course was way above average... Sinply reaching those levels of perfection... The chef did just what needed to be done, cooked to perfection and giving the plate the correct balance even though I would have substituted the "fried brioche" under the steak ( that was there for texture and crunchy balance) and done something different..... The meat, well, see the pictures... Tender, flavourfull, thick, juicy and the foie gras on top, well I'm just getting the texture in my mouth again and is making me drule... Don't forget to ask for the souffle ahead of time as it will take time to prepare... Again, try thinking outside of the usual chocolate and do yourself a favor... Grand marnier... Simply soectacular... Perfect consistency, temperature, size, texture.....  Loved this place, my 1 star off, sinply absurd procing for the wine... They should let people have several wines that could be recommended by the somm at decent prices... As for the chefs, Congrats!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grand Marnier souffle
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boeuf with Foie Gras
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine over looking the Bellagio fountains

da8_Ty7fTckU0ozutooi8w.text: We wanted to eat at Mon Ami Gabi for lunch but it's over an hr wait so we decided to give this place a try even I knew this place used to get only 3 stars.   There's no wait at all around 12pm during Valentine's/President's weekend and been seated at the window seat right away..wondering why?? hmmm....Our waiter is very friendly, service is GOOD and the view is GREAT  We ordered the following plus 2 drinks 1) Cold Foie Gras Torchon      It was okay, nothing special 2) Lamb burger      It looks very delicious when the waitress bring out the dish, but the bun is very soggy due to all the sauces and juices 3) Beef tartare -- this is where it went wrong      When I first look at it, my first impression is.....the color of the raw meat looks a little funny. But I ate it anyways since the raw beef was over powered by all the spices they put in it, I couldn't really tell if the meat is bad at this point and I don't like wasting food. I started having upset stomach after we left the place. I have very strong stomach so if I get sick, that means the food is reallllly not good   Anyways, the bill come out to be $100 before tips. The food quality does not match their price point. For great view I would still go back to Mon Ami Gabi, for great food, there are alot more restaurants to choose from at the same price point or even pricier I would still think it's worth paying than coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tartare that got me sick :(

Z4u2SfkdQ-Nd2CesbSgFnA.text: There is no doubt that you go here for the view.  You can overlook the Bellagio's water fountain show.  I went there around 6:30 to see the view before and after the sunset.  The food is 3.5 stars. But the service 5 stars.  I had a filet with Foie Gras and truffle sauce.  It was pretty good.  Napoleon for the dessert was two thumbs up.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Napoleon
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet with Foie Gras and truffle sauce.

8pV2PeEPZ7db6ABGRG1q6g.text: Perfect New Year's Eve special menu- not to mention we had an amazing view of the fountains at Bellagio. The foie gras was perfect, and the filet topped with short ribs was incredibly tender. Everyone else ordered the creme brulee for dessert, but I ordered a champagne fruit dessert, and we liked it the most! The service was second to none. As a Vegas regular, I'm not sure why this was my first time to visit here- it certainly won't be my last!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the best views in Vegas
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the best views in Vegas

EBhuPlGhvZ5U0da7ZHToRg.text: Our one year anniversary dinner! Made reservation at 8, changed to 9:30, still requested a window seat with Bellagio fountain and strip views, host girl was so nice, gave us a window seat before 9:30, great job! I had a specialty cocktail at the bar, red velvet, it was so yummy! Sweet but strong, liked it a lot.   I can't even describe how amazing the views were.... I had photos of that, please check them out! Our waiter greeted us very friendly, gave us wine list first, expensive bottles of wine, red, white, sparkling, I didn't see one bottle less than $70, we ordered bottle of champagne around $100, it was so good! We took time to look through the menu while sipping on our champagne.   Their complimentary bread was a big tray, server carry it around for dining people to choose what kind of bread we want, they gave us a creamy soup as dipping sauce,  butter too. I didn't like the cold bread and soup, but it was a great dipping sauce, bread tasted so delicious with it.  Our amazing food: Trio of American Caviar, Golden Whitefish, American Sturgeon, Salmon Roe, 28 grams each, with Creme Fraiche, Chives, Blinis and Toast: they were heavenly delicious! Beautiful presentation! We enjoyed every single bit of it very much  Cream of mushrooms soup, wild rice galette, crispy shallots: so delicious, soup was very flavorful  Maine lobster salad, roasted butter squash, wilted kale, old cider vinaigrette: the kale was so yummy! The lobster was very tender and flavorful, loved loved it!   Fricasse of escargot, sweetbreads, fennel, farm raised poached egg, Pinot noir jus: the escargot was so tender, but not very flavorful, the poached egg was perfect, I still loved it cause I wanted something light as entree for that night.   Char broiled filet Mignon, red wine sauce: hubby asked for extra red wine sauce, he said the filet was one of the best he has ever had for a very very long time! He absolutely loved the red wine sauce!  Gratinee creamed spinach and mushroom: too creamy to our liking, but still yummy  We didn't order desert, the portions were really big for French cuisine! But the restaurant gave us chocolate mousse for our anniversary! They even put chocolate "happy anniversary" on the plate.... Aww... It was just too sweet and beautiful!   I was so happy for our memorable anniversary dinner, with beautiful views from our seat, over the top service, tasty champagne, delicious food, what more could I ask?.... It was just amazing! $350 dinner was very well worth it....  A perfect restaurant for romantic dinner date or special occasions!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yk5fpMVmphyk2iCrBMB2vg.text: Have been here a few times for lunch or brunch when guests were in town, and they've always been pretty impressed. The view is great, and the ambiance is kinda fancy but not over the top. We really enjoyed the complimentary bread and butter, and they come around offering more bread which is hard to say no to.  I've enjoyed a brunch menu which was $39, and came with a shrimp appetizer (2 pieces), salmon omelette (really good), and a yummy strawberry champagne ice cream that was a pretty decent size.  They also sometimes give complimentary candies or "amuse bouche" which i never heard of before until one time i went lol... like a little tiny appetizer before a meal.  I would recommend the BLT sandwich.  I don't know that I would order anything too fancy or expensive, but to order a fun meal under $20 (like the BLT, or soup and salad),  I think the view is worth it.  The coffee is good but it's like $8!  So you can get a decent meal for not too expensive as long as you don't over order....   I've never had a problem with the service, they've always been friendly and attentive.

AQcBD2kelEytOxu71RpFPQ.text: Where do I start??  This experience was one of the best that I have had in Vegas!  It was my birthday dinner and we had an absolutely fantastic time.  The meal was so delicious and unique.  Our server, Jorge, was so attentive and knowledgeable.  He really made the experience so much better.  My husband called ahead for flowers and a photographer, so it was just a gorgeous table.  The only drawback is that we could see the fountains from where we were seated, but the sunset and skyline were beautiful.  We will definitely come back again and again!

keNGoTU9w8vh0M1O7ND9TA.text: It was our first visit. We got lost, it was so hard to find this place but it was worth it. Very pricey but delicious French dish. The restaurant is up towards the building, we had to take the elevator by the receptionist. The bathrooms had employees serving us with paper towels, offering perfumes and waiting for tips. The service was really good and friendly.   We had the Beef Wellington and roasted Chicken and Potato Gratin. They were all good. But I didn't like the potato Croquette. The desert souffle was good also. Prepare to have a fat bill even for a couple. I spent more than $300. Half a dozen roses cost $30 and a small photo cost $25. I would still comeback coz I liked the food.

EPsx-cmpcq3TIoVQQozhgg.text: My husband and I went here for our 1 year anniversary dinner without a reservation and they took great care of us. We went on a Sunday night around 830 and we're suprisingly sat up against the glass with a great view of the strip. The pork chop was delcious as well as the roasted chicken. Definitely get the chickpea frites side-amazing! One of the best meals I've had in my life.

Y_wULUn_n4L6RhmR9bYvHQ.text: You pay for the ambience.  Amazing views of the strip can't be beat. The food is solid if not spectacular.  Had the market greens,  smoked salmon,  grilled shrimp,  and wild escargot appetizers.  The highlights were the salmon and the escargot,  which was brilliantly prepared.  The main dishes were large portions of the snapper, salmon,  and pork chop.  The potatoes au gratin were a hit at the table.  Excellent service and  good food in a nice upscale atmosphere.  If not a bit overpriced it would be five stars

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YF6m52-ICwYX4TVlG7Ioug.text: Got a reservation on the same evening for an amazing table with a grand view of the Bellagio fountain. The sun was setting and it made even more magical! Warning the price is high but you pay for the view, too;-)  We ordered seafood entrees.  I ordered the Crab Salad. The portion was small for an appy and cost $18 but it was good. As for the entree we ordered, Salmon, Halibut, and Snapper.  They were seasoned well. Unfortunately, the snapper had a couple of small bones and scale. We shared the chocolate souffle for dessert. It was yummmmy!  The service was excellent. There were three servers that took care of us. We felt special!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BIvDmTkCs0dN83bcYNehkQ.text: Sharon and her team couldn't have done better and we loved our anniversary dinner. A year ago we tried to go for our anniversary dinner and when we got to the restaurant, they had a broken water pipe and had to close. It was a sat night and everywhere we liked was booked. Sharon walked us over to Gordon Ramsey Steak, spoke with the manager and in moments we had a great table. We didn't forget the gesture and returned a year later. I phoned ahead and when we arrived she had the best table you could ask for waiting for us. We had a seat directly across from the Bellagio fountains and saw the show 4 times during our meal. We ordered a la carte with a bottle of wine after a couple cocktails and were happy with everything. The Escargot and the steak tartare were both excellent and the filet Rossini was beautifully prepared, plenty of fois gras and excellent sauce. The meal began with a couple amuse bouche and a few complimentary deserts came along afterwards then we had the souffles, one grand mariner and one carmel, both perfect. It was a perfect meal and I can't wait to go back. Thanks again to Sharon , our waitress Carmen, a very helpful sommelier and the whole staff.

QTMFVBV4vSMOfSNBKBgZUg.text: The food was good... if you have the appetite of a newborn. It is very bougie and underwhelming, if thats the vibe you're going for. I got the lamb and a side of salt with potato. If you're coming for the view, it might be a better idea to come for drinks or dessert then head to in n out. Also, I ordered Brussel sprouts and was incredibly disappointed. I think thy bought the microwaveable pack from Trade Joe's. They also have a "proposal package" If any girl is into this type of thing

iVv-OS-vre9ItlEUvAR04w.text: I went to the eiffel tower restaurant for my birthday celebration.  we had window seating and had a great view of the strip and the bellagio show.  the staff is very friendly and helpful.the first course i had was the pea soup...never had it before...it was very good!  it was creamy, buttery and filled with awesomeness...from my entree i ordered the sea bass...it was ok....the fish was room temperature which makes me think it was left out a little before being served...the flavor was good, but had no wow factor that you would expect for the price you pay...my wife had the ny steak and i had a few bites...again good, but not anything to write home about...probably the same quality you would get at a cheesecake factory....for desert we had the chocolate and grand marnier souffles...these were very good...not as good as the one i had at paleo on the disney cruise, but very good...all in all, the ambiance was great, service was excellent and the food was good...  for the price, i probably would not go back...a lot better places in Vegas to go to for fine dining

G-nUch03-JeyDPUqtTykDQ.text: My brother got married in Las Vegas this past weekend and him and his fiance did their grooms dinner at Eiffel Tower. I must first say that the service was absolutely top notch. The atmosphere is fantastic, from the moment you step off the elevator and see the production in the kitchen to the spectacular views of Las Vegas BLVD. My steak was fabulous, but my favorite part of the meal was the French onion soup. I will be back. Another job well done by the Lettuce Entertain You group.

fuT7jG6zIOEhOxlM9ogVcw.text: This is definitely one of the more romantic restaurants on the Strip.  I took my GF to dinner here shortly after we first met and asked for one of the tables by the window, which offered us stunning 180-degree views of the Bellagio fountains that made us both swoon.  The restaurant is located in the Paris Hotel's scaled down Eiffel Tower of course and is serviced by a single elevator, which sort of adds some fun and a sense of exclusivity to your evening.  The dining room is intimate, with both booths and floating tables scattered around.  Everything is about the views here, so almost every table has a least a peek of the fountains.  However, there is this odd waiter's station in one corner that I was seated by when I treated my family to dinner on another visit that completely blocked our table's view, which was a bit of a let down.  Steer away from that area if possible.  The cuisine here is French of course, and while it is certainly well prepared, nothing really ever stands out for me.  This is usually the case with themed or view restaurants;  They live in their own niche and therefore don't really have to compete with others in their category.  Thus, in terms of food there are certainly more impressive restaurants in the area, but they don't have these views.  Note that I'm not knocking the food here;  Just don't expect it to be an epic Michelin 3 diamond experience and you'll be fine.  The service has been top notch each and every time I've eaten here, although the kitchen is a little less accommodating.  Last visit my old-school father wanted a baked potato with his entree, but the chef flatly refused the request (even though there were obviously potatoes in the house).  My parental unit was about to do the diner scene from Five Easy Pieces on them, but the waiter was very professional and calmed him down, talking him into another one of the sides on the menu, thank God.  Reservations are an absolute must and sometimes they'll ask for a credit card and bill you a non-refundable fee ($50, if memory serves, which is applied to your check) to place it.  I've noticed a few other places do this as well;   I guess it stops people from scatter bombing reservations at a bunch of places for the same evening and then cancelling last minute once they make their choice.  If you just want to come up and take a peek, they do have a bar, but it's been totally packed every time I've been here.  I don't know if they do the velvet rope thing or not to limit the crowds, but expect to wait for a bar seat if you decide to make the trip.  Long and short:  A four star French restaurant with five star views. Definitely one of those places you must try at least once.  Perfect for a special night out, a proposal, or an anniversary.  Highly recommended.    Bon Appetit!

EpLst1ZC9eN25AzaFXd65Q.text: This place is a must when visiting Vegas. It's a very romantic resturant and all the tables have views of the Vegas skyline.  I do recommend going at night. The food was very good. It is a bit pricey, but worth the experience.

3js50GD-cUqcEZLXeSC0Sw.text: In a word... Souffle. Their weightless, fluffy, and perfectly prepared chocolate souffle is utterly exquisite. Complemented by a stellar view of the Vegas strip and a front row view of the Bellagio's dancing water show, this delicious dessert is well worth the the 25 minute preparation time. It was an exceptional way to finish off a delicious meal that began with a warm lobster and fennel appetizer followed with a moist and tender filet of salmon in a pinot noir sauce. The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is not likely to disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aXByAyC4HCod5hR_3QGJRg.text: I've been to Vegas a thousand times and I'm always tempted to try this place and I finally gave in. There is nothing special about it. It is overpriced, the food is nothing special. I got the chicken parmesan dish and it really just tasted like a Lean Cuisine meal. Not much flavor and nothing special about the presentation. The only redeeming qualities I can think of would be the amazing view- it overlooks the Bellagio water fountain and you ca see most of the strip and the creme Brule is to die for.

Sx2LuoVUlJEvQYHxicSmHg.text: We had the most amazing meal... service was off the hook! We renamed our waitress #1 (it was really Alix) we will be back and never have a server besides our #1

ffMHVqKPkdH6owceEpB8KQ.text: Never have I ever tasted such exquisite entrees before. The butternut squash veal was so tender that it melts in your mouth like butter. The view of the Bellagio fountain shows was breathtaking. Service was amazing, as well, as the waiters make you feel comfortable and make sure you have everything you need. Highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sKcMz8YyjO2rntAadEw4pQ.text: We went to Vegas for my wife's birthday past weekend. We decided to go here for the brunch since we weren't staying in Vegas for the entire weekend. Yes it was still expensive, especially we decided to order Appetizer and desert, but with impeccable service and food, I thought it was worth of every penny especially if you add the view looking over Bellagio and Vegas Strip. My wife thought that creamy french onion soup was one of the best soup she ever had, and my Eggs Benedict was excellent! I will try dinner next time!

vkl19X-PCL1TQEhvAl3E7g.text: Food HEAVEN. We celebrated a late Valentine's Day dinner here and it was well worth the wait and the 3,000 miles traveled!   We had a fantastic view of the Bellagio Fountains, great service and extremely delectable entrees. Maine Lobster Salad, Aged New York Steak, Beef Wellington and various side dishes. Their Caramel Souffle is must have.   To address the reviews that said portions were small - our portions were more than sufficient and perhaps you attended one too many buffets.   We will definitely be back again when we return to Vegas!

B3lnAPOEUpPaxLwuMRaw6w.text: I have two sets of comments here, one for the general public, and the other for the truly discriminating foodie.  First, if you're looking for a lovely dining experience, you won't be disappointed.  Everything that came out of the kitchen was presented beautifully, the pacing was good, the ambiance, lovely.  Probably 'nuff said here, but if you're a foodie, read on.  I have to lead with the wired, Secret Service earpieces the waitstaff sported.  As you exit the elevator, you're facing the state of the art kitchen, and beehive efficient staff.  If you have lead time on your reservation, do request a table overlooking the Bellagio's fountains.  It's a mesmerizing view.  Casual diners, stop here.  Foodies, read on.  Now for the prix fixe.  98 pp for the meal, an additional 69 pp for the wine pairings, and if you're dining as a couple, you will both need to opt in.   The amuse bouche was the prelude, and consisted of an onion vichyssoise with a white fish top that was divine.  After this there were three petits of smoked salmon, foie gras, and mushroom streudel.  The foie gras was served atop an almost meringue-light crouton, but it was still too much bread to balance the foie gras.   From there off to the first course - a lobster salad over cucumber papaya relish, paired with a Feuillatte blush champagne.  This is, of course, where my palate first deviates from the sommelier's, as I didn't find the blush, well, necessary.  I would have been perhaps happier with a light champagne or chardonnay/chablis sparkling.  Lobster, in my opinion, should always be the star of the show.   The next course was the butternut squash bisque, and that pairing was literally too close for comfort.  No, really, the Pinot Gris was astoundingly similar to the soup.  In this case, I would have looked for a little more contrast.  The soup was quite wonderful.  Sea bass was served next, over a bed of smoky tomato quinoa that was nothing short of brilliant (the quinoa; not the bass, which I actually found a little leathery and over-done.)  A quintessentially Russian River chardonnay was served; I would have gone for something un-oaked and less buttery.  I love it when a restaurant *knows* how the beef should be cooked; just a few degrees shy of medium rare.  Paired with the perfect Ferrari-Carano blend, these tiny prime beef roulades were absolutely top-notch.  Prime beef roulade, horseradish mousseline and a nod to brussels sprouts  I can't comment on the dessert wine, as they are not to my taste, and beyond my scope. Clos Uroulat.  What I can tell you is to scratch the apple streudel with cinnamon ice cream right off your list of considerations - the pastry was tough enough to need a knife, and the filling, totally forgettable.  Way too heavy-handed on the raw sugar as well.   By contrast, however, the White Chocolate Banana Elysium (I believe they called it), was a work of art (photo attached).  If you got to the end of this whole review, without thinking I'm  certifiable, you better link to me.  I want to read your reviews, too.  Overall, the restaurant experience was excellent, and someplace I could recommend without hesitation.  Bon Appetit!

photos.caption: Photo of Eiffel Tower - Las Vegas, NV, United States. WChoc-Banana-Elysium

cCvKn3nEq3VAhUjM3kCXsQ.text: I went there last night for my birthday and Valentine's dinner. I have to say the view was absolutely amazing, the ambiance was great but the food was nothing to brag about. It was pricey and I don't have a problem paying for great food but this was something I could even finish it was so bad. They had a preset menu for Valentine's I had the fish and my husband had the filet mignon. I had a taste of the steak and it was dry. The fish had no flavor and the dessert was a chocolate  cake that was also dry, and I love chocolate ... I was so disappointed I wish we could have gone somewhere else.

CE6qMRxBgcW7krm6CtPb1A.text: First and foremost, the food was absolutely amazing. My husband and I have had many meals in many restaurants each time we come to Vegas and this is one of, if not THE best places we have been. We couldn't have asked for better service or a more gorgeous view.  I had the warm lobster salad and it was insanely delicious. We ended our meal with a perfectly prepared pistachio souffle paired with a tawny port wine. I wanted to put our waiter in my will for recommending the port wine pairing for the souffle. Yes! It was that good! I am already looking forward to our next visit.

PlZGBp3ZNoU092DGuRKlkg.text: LUNCH  What a surprise to find the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in Las Vegas to be such a great restaurant.  With a group of 8, we came here for lunch.   The view from the restaurant is very nice.  Our lunch, of hamburgers and lamb hamburgers was quite good and tasty, and the presentation was quite good also.  The service associated with lunch was very good. I see other YELPER mentioned this also.

mlzM83h-dKLwiSmllLv3Gg.text: At first I was a little worried the place would be tacky and not bear much in common with the place that has the real Eiffel Tower.  Wrong again.  Good food, good service and good setting.  Forget the water show put on for free by the Bellagio.  Go for the food.

RICM2SReuY3FmCJIVORMGw.text: Ill start off by saying that the best thing about this evening was the view.  As for the food.......the bread was average at best nothing special at all.  Our stater the Blue cheese Souffle was excellent.  On to the main course. First off was the Beef Wellington everything about this dish was perfect except for the star the beef.   A very average piece of beef cooked perfectly  but not worth the price. Way to tough!!!!!   My wife had the Veal which was good but not great and a small portion.   Desert was the creme brulee once again average.  It was a bit to runny .  Overall better bang for the buck in Vegas!!!

577ZO4HWR9BaEN2G8Zk9sg.text: maybe not my very favorite meal, but was excellent in every way.  my hubby and me went here as our last meal.  our last day we were leaving the paris and walked by and randomly made a reservation.  we figured it was an over priced old lady restaurant!   our favorite part of vegas are the fountains, so we figured lets watch them while eating dinner.  our midnight flight meant that we could not change all day so we were both dressed in sneakers.  no joke- from the menu downstairs we had no idea how lavish a restaurant it was upstairs.  so imagine a friday night arriving and being surrounded by evening attire!  many people were celebrating, many women in long gowns.  but the treatment we were given was ultra professional.  i felt well taken care of. and the food!  we enjoyed their lentil soup and the salad with tulle.  the tulle was so delicious!  parmasan and poppy seeds i think. in fact it may have been my favorite part of the meal.  also, the french bread was crusty and tasty.   the salad was crispy and delicious, the soup hearty and classic.  i had fish and the hubby had pork.  both delicious.  the greens served with both seemed a bit heavy- too much butter?  but the whole experience- food, views, service was classy and very well crafted.

-N4_99kOsms0U-X8hghi3A.text: I was so looking forward to this restaurant experience, because it's one of those not too often in a lifetime, spendthrift extravaganzas. I was quite disappointed because the expense did not match the food quality or service. Whatever you do, don't order Roberto Cavalli vodka. It was $23.00 for that brand martini. I almost fell of the chair. Utterly ridiculous! Moving to our scenic table, we found the service to be lacking. We weren't greeted by waiter, busboy, anyone for several minutes. Ordering the escargot got us what seemed to be one escargot cut in half swimming  around in a filo dough, saucy conglomeration. However the manager did apologize and remove it from the tab. The rest of the meal was nothing we couldn't get anywhere else for a lot less. In fact every other restaurant I passed wherever I went made me mad that I didn't go to it instead. For half the price!  We paid $320.00 for 2 drinks, 3 wines, 2 entrees, green beans and dessert. That was 4 days ago and I'm still not over it! Way too much competition in Vegas to get away with nothing but the finest,  when that is what you're portraying.

UgTxPlwnXvaV1dGbSXjXMw.text: If you are looking for a romantic night then the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is where to go at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. I just went there this past weekend with my boyfriend. We made reservations at 9:30 but got there at 9 and they still sat us right away. We sat at a table near the window which had a perfect view of the Bellagio fountains. Every ten minutes we watched the water show. Our server was very nice and knowledgeable. He picked out the perfect white wine for our meals. I got the skirt steak which was amazing. My boyfriend got the filet mignon also delicious. We shared the asparagus and gratin potatoes as our sides since the menu is a la carte. Of course we had to try the chocolate souffle that everyone talked about on Yelp (which is the reason we even came to this spot). And man oh man....it was soooo good. The ambiance of this fine dining restaurant is surprisingly casual. I figured since it was fine dining then it'd be full of stuck up rich folks...but that wasn't the case at all. Everyone was laughing and having a good time. It made our experience that much better. The night was magical and a perfect date! oh btw - the bill came out to $193...not including tip but worth every single penny!
